44_11ecbplus.0: Hewlett - Packard makes another acquisition, chases IBM
44_11ecbplus.2: Hewlett - Packard Corp. ( NYSE: HPQ ) has opened up its checkbook once again.
44_11ecbplus.3: This time, the world's largest tech company by sales announced that it will be buying EYP Mission Critical Facilities Inc.
44_11ecbplus.4: That company, which provides data center consulting services, will become a division of HP for an undisclosed sum, according to sources.
44_11ecbplus.5: Is this a move to compete more headily with tech giant IBM Corp. ( NYSE: IBM )?
44_11ecbplus.6: It could certainly be seen that way.
44_11ecbplus.7: HP's growing presence in providing data center services and contract consulting is the core of IBM's business model these days, now that the latter is out of the hardware business.
44_11ecbplus.8: EYP provides design, technology planning and support for large data centers - - the kind that runs a large U. S. bank, credit card operation or manufacturing business.
44_11ecbplus.9: This is right in IBM's territory, and the move should put HP in a more competitive position to challenge IBM as a premier provider of computing services consulting.
44_11ecbplus.10: Does HP's Mark Hurd want to grow the company he leads into the biggest computing hardware and services manufacturing company the world has ever seen?

19_11ecbplus.0: Large Riot Breaks Out In Brooklyn During Vigil For Teen Shot 11 Times By Police
19_11ecbplus.2: Police intervened when more than a hundred people joined in a candlelit vigil in the East Flatbush neighborhood in Brooklyn, New York, where 16 - year - old Kimani Gray was shot 11 times by police on Saturday, according to RussiaToday
19_11ecbplus.3: Brooklynites on Twitter reported that police followed the march and searched apartment buildings in the neighborhood without warrants, looking for children who had been seen throwing bottles at police from neighborhood rooftops.
19_11ecbplus.4: March participants chanted “ NYPD KKK how many kids will you kill today, ” people report from the scene.
19_11ecbplus.5: “ I ’ m in the middle of the riot action at Church and Snyder in my district.
19_11ecbplus.6: Right now, things are tense, ” New York City Councilman Jumaane D. Williams, who represents the area, said on Twitter.
19_11ecbplus.7: Sixteen - year - old Kimani Gray was shot and killed on Saturday night after, police say, pointing a gun at approaching cops.
19_11ecbplus.8: According to the officers involved in the shooting, the teenager adjusted his belt “ suspiciously, ” and after they exited their vehicle to investigate, he pointed a. 357 caliber revolver at them.
19_11ecbplus.9: Both officers fired at the suspect, hitting Gray eleven times in his torso and legs.
19_11ecbplus.10: Witnesses say Gray, who was running for his life when he was shot, did not have a gun.
19_11ecbplus.11: “ Stay down, or we ’ ll shoot you again, ” police said once Gray had been hit, according to The New York Times.
19_11ecbplus.12: After the shooting Gray was rushed to a hospital but was declared dead on arrival.

34_2ecbplus.0: Dr. Regina Benjamin: Nominee for Surgeon General
34_2ecbplus.2: The President announced his nominee for the U. S. Surgeon General, Dr. Regina Benjamin, today at the White House.
34_2ecbplus.3: Dr. Benjamin has an extensive and distinguished career in medicine.
34_2ecbplus.4: She is the Founder and CEO of the Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic in Alabama, which aims to provide primary care to people of any age regardless of their financial situation.
34_2ecbplus.5: She previously served as Chair of the Federation of State Medical Boards of the United States, and as the Associate Dean for Rural Health at the University of South Alabama College of Medicine.
34_2ecbplus.6: Additionally, she was chosen as President of the Medical Association of Alabama in 2002, becoming the first African - American woman to be president of a state medical society.
34_2ecbplus.7: She was also the first African - American woman and physician under 40 to be elected to the American Medical Association Board of Trustees.
34_2ecbplus.8: She received the Nelson Mandela Award for Health and Human Rights in 1998, among other honors.
34_2ecbplus.9: The President emphasized this experience in his remarks, chronicling her dedication to providing health care for her rural community in the face of adversity:
34_2ecbplus.10: And that's why, even though she could have left the state to make more money as a specialist or as a doctor in a wealthier community, Regina Benjamin returned to Alabama and opened a small clinic in Bayou La Batre.
34_2ecbplus.11: When people couldn't pay, she didn't charge them.
34_2ecbplus.12: When the clinic wasn't making money, she didn't take a salary for herself.
34_2ecbplus.13: When Hurricane George destroyed the clinic in 1998, she made house calls to all her patients while it was rebuilt.
34_2ecbplus.14: When Hurricane Katrina destroyed it again and left most of her town homeless, she mortgaged her house and maxed out her credit cards to rebuild that clinic for a second time.
34_2ecbplus.15: She tended to those who had been wounded in the storm, and when folks needed medicine, she asked the pharmacist to send the bill her way.
34_2ecbplus.16: And when Regina's clinic was about to open for the third time, and a fire burned it to the ground before it could serve the first patient, well, you can guess what Dr. Benjamin did.
34_2ecbplus.17: With help from her community, she is rebuilding it again.
34_2ecbplus.18: One disabled patient brought her an envelope with $20 inside.
34_2ecbplus.19: Another elderly man said simply, "Maybe I can help.
34_2ecbplus.21: For nearly two decades, Dr. Regina Benjamin has seen in a very personal way what is broken about our health care system.
34_2ecbplus.22: She's seen an increasing number of patients who've had health insurance their entire lives suddenly lose it because they lost their jobs or because it's simply become too expensive.
34_2ecbplus.23: She's been a relentless promoter of prevention and wellness programs, having treated too many costly and - - diseases and complications that didn't have to happen.
34_2ecbplus.24: And she's witnessed the shortage of primary care physicians in the rural and underserved areas where she works.
34_2ecbplus.25: But for all that she's seen and all the tremendous obstacles that she has overcome, Regina Benjamin also represents what's best about health care in America - - doctors and nurses who give and care and sacrifice for the sake of their patients; those Americans who would do anything to heal a fellow citizen.
34_2ecbplus.26: As the President explained, through this personal experience working with the poor and uninsured, Dr. Benjamin understands firsthand the urgent need for health care reform.
34_2ecbplus.27: As Surgeon General, she will be the people's health advocate, and will play a key role in health care reform.
34_2ecbplus.28: In her remarks, Dr. Benjamin explained how she sees her role:
34_2ecbplus.29: My hope, if confirmed as Surgeon General, is to be America's doctor, America's family physician.
34_2ecbplus.30: As we work toward a solution to this health care crisis, I promise to communicate directly with the American people to help guide them through whatever changes may come with health care reform.

38_7ecbplus.1: A 4. 6 - magnitude earthquake rattled Northern California overnight Thursday, shaking residents from San Francisco to north of Sacramento.
38_7ecbplus.2: The temblor struck at 2: 09 a. m. and was centered in Geyserville, about 20 miles north of Santa Rosa, according to the U. S. Geological Survey.
38_7ecbplus.3: USGS measurements indicated at least 20 smaller earthquakes followed throughout the morning.
38_7ecbplus.4: The Santa Rosa Press Democrat reported the quake began only one mile below ground level, which is why it was felt across the region.
38_7ecbplus.5: There were no immediate reports of damage, the newspaper said.
38_7ecbplus.7: More than 60 people reported to USGS's "Did you feel it? " site, with reports ranging from San Francisco and Oakland to Lake and Yuba counties.
38_7ecbplus.8: Others reported the shaking on Twitter.
38_7ecbplus.10: The Maacama Fault is mostly a right - lateral strike - slip fault that lies north of Santa Rosa and the immediate San Francisco Bay Area and extends as far north as Ukiah.
38_7ecbplus.11: It connects to the Rodgers Creek Fault through a complex set of faults between Santa Rosa and Healdsburg, and is thought to be the northward continuation of the Hayward - Rodgers Creek Fault System.
38_7ecbplus.12: The 2007 Working Group for California Earthquake Probability assigned a total slip rate on the Maacama Fault of approximately 9 mm / yr ( 1 / 3 inches / yr ), based on the assumption that it continues the slip on the Hayward - Rodgers Creek Fault northward.
38_7ecbplus.13: The central and northern sections of the fault have been observed to accommodate approximately 7 mm / yr ( 1 / 4 inch / year ) of creep along it.
38_7ecbplus.14: The Maacama Fault parallels and overlaps the Rodgers Creek Fault, in a geometry that is causing the ground between the faults to subside.
38_7ecbplus.15: In Sonoma County north of Healdsburg, the Maacama Fault is largely obscured by massive landslides where it passes east of Alexander Valley.
38_7ecbplus.16: The 2007 Working Group for California Earthquake Probability combined the Maacama and the Garberville Faults into single a 181 - km ( 110 mile ) long fault and determined M7. 5 as the maximum magnitude for this combined fault system.
38_7ecbplus.17: There is very little known about the seismic history or earthquake cycle of the Maacama Fault, and as such recurrence intervals are uncertain.

23_8ecbplus.0: Second man dies in Mt Cook National Park
23_8ecbplus.2: A second man has fallen to his death in Aoraki Mount Cook National Park.
23_8ecbplus.3: The man aged in his early 30s fell about 600m while climbing near the Mount Sefton Bivvy on Saturday afternoon.
23_8ecbplus.4: Rescue personnel were not able to reach him or his three companions, who were all from overseas, due to low light levels on Saturday, Mid - South Canterbury Area Commander Inspector Dave Gaskin said.
23_8ecbplus.5: "They managed to have a look at him and it was pretty clear that there was no signs of life and they've flown in today to retrieve the body, " he told NZ Newswire on Sunday.
23_8ecbplus.6: The other three men were rescued by about 10am on Sunday morning.
23_8ecbplus.7: "We haven't been in a position to speak to the survivors at this stage, but it appears as if their equipment and preparation was limited, " Insp Gaskin said.
23_8ecbplus.8: It was the second death in the park in two days.
23_8ecbplus.9: A 36 - year - old man died about 11am on Friday after he slipped and fell about 200m down a steep icy gully.
23_8ecbplus.10: The man, a New Zealander living in Melbourne, was planning to go ski touring.
23_8ecbplus.11: Two deaths so close together was unusual for the time of year, Insp Gaskin said.
23_8ecbplus.12: "We don't normally get too many climbing accidents at this time of year, it's still basically winter conditions here, so there's very little climbing done. "
23_8ecbplus.13: The climbing season generally starts about late October / early November.
23_8ecbplus.14: Mr Gaskin urged people not to go into situations unprepared.
23_8ecbplus.15: "This is an extremely dangerous area and if you're going to climb or come into this area and go up high in the mountains, you've got to make sure that you know what you're doing and you've got all the appropriate equipment. "

9_12ecbplus.0: Obama White House reverses Bush rule on protection of endangered species
9_12ecbplus.2: • Government wildlife experts to be consulted on development
9_12ecbplus.4: The Obama administration overturned one of the most controversial environmental measures of the George Bush era today, striking down a rule that had weakened protection for endangered species.
9_12ecbplus.5: Officials at the interior and commerce ministries said they had returned to a requirement that government wildlife experts sign off on any new development - mining, logging or road construction - that could hurt animals, fish or plants that are at risk of going extinct.
9_12ecbplus.6: Today's move was the latest in a series of declarations by Obama officials meant to chip away at the Bush environmental legacy.
9_12ecbplus.7: A number of those measures were put in place in the final hours of the Bush administration, in what became known as "midnight regulations".
9_12ecbplus.8: Until last December, developers had been required for more than two decades to get approval from government wildlife experts before embarking on new projects.
9_12ecbplus.9: But the Bush administration in its final days brought in a rule leaving it up to businesses to consult with government biologists on the impact of new development.
9_12ecbplus.10: Environmentalists had accused Bush of effectively gutting protections for threatened or endangered species, and activists had sent more than 70, 000 petitions to officials in the Obama administration urging them to cancel the "midnight regulation".
9_12ecbplus.11: In a statement, the commerce secretary, Gary Locke, and the interior secretary, Ken Salazar, agreed.
9_12ecbplus.12: After a scientific reviewed ordered by Obama last month, they said they had reached the conclusion that such protections were indeed necessary.
9_12ecbplus.13: "By rolling back this 11th hour regulation we are ensuring that threatened and endangered species continue to receive the full protection of the law, the two men said in a statement.
9_12ecbplus.14: "Federal agencies proposing to take actions that might affect threatened and endangered species will once again have to consult with biologists. "
9_12ecbplus.15: There was no word on another so - called midnight regulation that undermined protection for polar bear, an omission criticised by some activists today.
9_12ecbplus.16: The move, which had been anticipated, comes just 24 hours after Salazar took steps against another midnight regulation.
9_12ecbplus.17: The interior secretary said he would ask the courts to overturn a last - minute rule that made it easier for coal mining operations engaged in mountaintop removal to dump dirt near streams.

40_8ecbplus.0: Apple intros new MacBook Pro, blurs line between tablet, computer
40_8ecbplus.2: Apple has unveiled the next generation of MacBook Pro at the WWDC Keynote in San Francisco.
40_8ecbplus.3: The 15. 4″ MacBook Pro refresh will be remarkably thin, at 0. 71″ and at 4. 46 pounds, it will be the thinnest and lightest MacBook Pro ever.
40_8ecbplus.4: The display is where the MacBook Pro refresh truly shines, with a Retina display at a whopping 2, 880 by 1, 800 pixels.
40_8ecbplus.5: That amounts to 5, 184, 000 pixels and 220 ppi, 4 times the current pixel count in the existing MacBook Pros.
40_8ecbplus.6: Apple touts it as the world's highest - resolution notebook display.
40_8ecbplus.7: All stock Mac applications have been updated to support the Retina display on the new MacBook Pro, as well as several other popular applications including Aperture, Final Cut Pro, and Diablo III.
40_8ecbplus.8: Updates for Adobe's suite of programs and AutoCAD should be coming soon as well.
40_8ecbplus.9: The new MacBook Pro will feature Intel's 3rd - Generation Core ( Ivy Bridge ) processor up to an i7 2. 7 GHz quad - core, up to 768GB of internal flash storage, and up to 16GB of RAM.
40_8ecbplus.10: Kepler GT 650M graphics will also be included on all models of the new MacBook Pro, which should offer a superb gaming experience.
40_8ecbplus.11: The new MacBook Pro will feature 7 hours of battery life, with up to 30 days of standby time.
40_8ecbplus.12: Completing the feature set are an SD reader, HDMI and USB 3. 0, MagSafe 2, Thunderbolt, USB 3. 0, headphone jack, Black Magik 5K Camera, FireWire 800, and GigaPort Ethernet Thunderbolt adapters.
40_8ecbplus.13: The new MacBook Pro will start at $2, 199 for the 2. 3 GHz quad - core i7 model with 256GB flash storage, and go up from there.
40_8ecbplus.15: The new MacBook Pro starts shipping TODAY.
40_8ecbplus.16: Go ahead and start throwing your credit cards at the screen, folks.

27_3ecbplus.0: Hackers exploit critical IE bug; Microsoft promises patch
27_3ecbplus.1: IE6 through IE11 harbor vulnerability, but in - the - wild attacks limited to IE8 and IE9
27_3ecbplus.3: Computerworld - Microsoft today said that hackers are exploiting a critical, but unpatched, vulnerability in Internet Explorer 8 ( IE8 ) and Internet Explorer 9 ( IE9 ), and that its engineers are working on an update to plug the hole.
27_3ecbplus.4: As it often does, the company downplayed the threat.
27_3ecbplus.5: "There are only reports of a limited number of targeted attacks specifically directed at Internet Explorer 8 and 9, although the issue could potentially affect all supported versions, " Dustin Childs, a manager in the Trustworthy Computing group and its usual spokesman, said in a blog post Tuesday morning.
27_3ecbplus.6: "We are actively working to develop a security update to address this issue, " Childs added.
27_3ecbplus.7: According to Childs and the security advisory Microsoft also published today, the vulnerability affects all supported versions of IE, from the 12 - year - old IE6 to the not - yet - officially - released IE11, the browser that will accompany Windows 8. 1 when it ships Oct. 18.
27_3ecbplus.8: "There is no escaping this one, " said Andrew Storms, director of DevOps at cloud security vendor CloudPassage, referring to the bug affecting all versions of Microsoft's browser.
27_3ecbplus.9: "IE zero - days are never a good thing, especially when they affect every version, " Storms added.
27_3ecbplus.10: Although Microsoft's advisory did not put it in these terms, the vulnerability can be exploited using classic "drive - by" attack tactics.
27_3ecbplus.11: That means hackers need only lure victims running IE to malicious sites - - or legitimate websites that have previously been compromised and loaded with attack code - - to hijack their browser and plant malware on their Windows PCs.
27_3ecbplus.12: Until Microsoft produces a patch, the company offered customers several options to protect themselves, including advice on configuring EMET 4. 0 and running one of its "Fixit" automated tools to "shim" the DLL that contains the IE rendering engine.
27_3ecbplus.13: EMET ( Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit ) is a tool designed for advanced users, primarily enterprise IT professionals, that manually enables anti - exploit technologies such as ASLR ( address space layout randomization ) and DEP ( data execution prevention ) for specific applications.
27_3ecbplus.14: But the Fixit route will be easiest for individual users: Microsoft's posted a link to the Fixit tool on its support site, and customers need only click the icon marked "Enable. "
27_3ecbplus.15: Microsoft has used the shim approach before when faced with unexpected attacks against IE.
27_3ecbplus.16: Based on past practice, Microsoft's Fixit workaround probably uses the Application Compatibility Toolkit to modify the core library of IE - - a DLL ( dynamic link library ) named "Mshtml. dll" that contains the browser's rendering engine - - in memory each time IE runs.
27_3ecbplus.17: The shim does not quash the bug, but instead makes the browser immune to the attacks Microsoft's seen in the wild thus far.
27_3ecbplus.18: Users can also temporarily ditch IE for an alternate browser, such as Google's Chrome or Mozilla's Firefox, to stay safe until Microsoft comes up with a permanent fix.
27_3ecbplus.19: Microsoft today declined say when it plans to patch the IE vulnerability.
27_3ecbplus.20: But because the next regularly - scheduled Patch Tuesday is three weeks away, it's possible the Redmond, Wash. company's security team will deliver a so - called "out - of - band" update before Oct. 9.
27_3ecbplus.21: Out - of - band updates from Microsoft are rare: The last one it shipped was MS13 - 008, an the emergency patch issued Jan. 14 that plugged a hole in IE6, IE7 and IE8 that had been exploited since early December 2012.

45_9ecbplus.0: An Oklahoma man has pleaded not guilty to two first - degree murder charges for the deaths of an Arkansas woman and her fetus.
45_9ecbplus.1: Trial is set for June 17 for 26 - year - old Christopher Kenyon Simpson of Fort Coffee, who is accused of fatally shooting Ka'Loni Marie Flynn of Fort Smith, Ark.
45_9ecbplus.2: The Southwest Times Record reports Simpson has been held without bond at the LeFlore County Jail since his arrest on June 21.
45_9ecbplus.3: Flynn's body was found in a car near Spiro on April 9.
45_9ecbplus.4: Prosecutors allege Simpson shot Flynn after she told him she was pregnant.
45_9ecbplus.5: Lawyers for Simpson don't want prosecutors to be able to use phone records that allegedly place Simpson in the area of the slaying on grounds that authorities obtained them without a warrant.

14_11ecbplus.2: A FIRE has badly damaged the Waitrose supermarket in Wellington's High Street.
14_11ecbplus.3: Eight crews fought the blaze which broke out in the early hours of Sunday morning.
14_11ecbplus.4: It is not known how long the store will be closed.

14_1ecbplus.1: Waitrose fire in Wellington town centre tackled
14_1ecbplus.2: Crews from Devon and Somerset Fire and Rescue have tackled a blaze at a supermarket in a Somerset town.
14_1ecbplus.3: The fire service was called at 06: 00 BST to the Waitrose store in High Street, Wellington, on Sunday.
14_1ecbplus.4: Half the roof at the entrance of the building has collapsed but the main building is in intact with only smoke damage, fire crews said.
14_1ecbplus.5: Matt Goodman, from the fire service, said: "It would appear the fire started on the outside of the building. "
14_1ecbplus.6: "It then quickly spread to the roof so there is a significant amount of damage to the roof, but thankfully due to the early actions of the Wellington crew we could get a large weight of response to the scene.
14_1ecbplus.7: "We've been able to prevent it spreading to other areas of the building, so the main store on the inside has got a reasonably small amount of smoke damage. "
14_1ecbplus.8: Engineers were called to switch off the electricity supply to the building.
14_1ecbplus.9: A spokesman for Waitrose said: "Luckily no - one has been hurt and we are very grateful to the fire service and police for their prompt and professional help. "
14_1ecbplus.10: An investigation into the cause of the fire has begun.

19_10ecbplus.0: Dozens "Riot" Over NYPD's Fatal Shooting Of Brooklyn Teen
19_10ecbplus.1: Yesterday, the police explained that officers shot and killed a 16 - year - old Kimani Gray in Brooklyn because he allegedly pointed a gun at the cops.
19_10ecbplus.2: However, his relatives are skeptical of the police account—his sister Mahnefah Gray said, "He has common sense. ..
19_10ecbplus.3: They killed my little brother for no reason. "
19_10ecbplus.4: Tonight, a crowd gathered to mourn his death—and protest police treatment.
19_10ecbplus.5: Police said two Brooklyn South Anti Crime plainclothes officers had been on patrol when they noticed young males near 473 East 52nd Street.
19_10ecbplus.6: According to the NYPD's statement, the cops noticed one "break away from the group upon noticing the police.
19_10ecbplus.7: The male. .. adjusted his waistband and continued to act in a suspicious manner.
19_10ecbplus.8: The officers exited their unmarked auto and attempted to engage the suspect, who turned on them, and pointed a. 38 caliber revolver at the officers.
19_10ecbplus.9: Both officers fired at the suspect, striking him about the body. "
19_10ecbplus.10: A witness told the Daily News "The cops, they just jumped out of the car so fast, .
19_10ecbplus.11: They started shooting him and he went down, he was bleeding, holding his side, screaming, 'stop, stop. '"
19_10ecbplus.12: Another witness described the scene to PIX11, "He was running for his life, telling the cops, 'Stop. '
19_10ecbplus.13: They really are, seriously, walking around, shooting little kids. ”
19_10ecbplus.14: Tonight, a large crowd gathered to remember Gray, and it apparently became unruly as the crowd walked between the shooting location and the 67th Precinct at Snyder Avenue near Nostrand—there were reports that bottles were thrown at police officers.
19_10ecbplus.15: NBC New York estimated the crowd at 70, and the Post says a crowd looted a Rite Aid.
19_10ecbplus.16: The manager said, "They poured in here like 40 or 50 of them.
19_10ecbplus.17: They pulled the registers off the counters, they flipped over everything.
19_10ecbplus.18: They punched me in the face.
19_10ecbplus.19: Several of them did, not just one [ person. ]
19_10ecbplus.21: City Council Member Jumaane Williams lamented that a "peaceful vigil that devolved into a riot.
19_10ecbplus.22: The youth in this community have no outlets for their anger, no community center. "
19_10ecbplus.23: NYPD spokesman Paul Browne had said yesterday, "After the anti - crime sergeant and police officer told the suspect to show his hands, which was heard by witnesses, Gray produced a revolver and pointed it at the officers, who fired a total of 11 rounds, striking Gray several times. "
19_10ecbplus.24: Police sources also told the News that "Gray has four prior arrests, including charges of grand larceny, possession of stolen property and inciting a riot. "
19_10ecbplus.25: Still, Gray's sister Mahnefah Gray said that a witness told her that Kimani was adjusting for his belt and that even if he had a gun, he wouldn't point it at the police.
19_10ecbplus.26: At this point ( 10: 30 p. m. ), the police said that the crowd has dispersed and that there was one arrest, with no injuries to police or civilians ( the Post says three people were injured ).

12_8ecbplus.0: A five - boat pirate attack on merchant vessels transiting the Gulf of Aden was foiled by an Indian warship that was on escort duty, capturing 26 Somani brigands on three of the skiffs and confiscating their weapons, a naval officer said here Friday.
12_8ecbplus.1: Patrol vessel INS Sukanya was escorting the five merchant vessels through the Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor in the Gulf of Aden Thursday morning when the warship's crew noticed the five - boat pirate formation approaching the cargo ship group.
12_8ecbplus.2: "The warship immediately altered towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them, " the officer said, adding the pirate skiffs then reversed course and tried to flee the area.
12_8ecbplus.3: "While two of the skiffs and its crew managed to get away, Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three skiffs and carried out well - practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action.
12_8ecbplus.4: "The three boats had a total of 26 Somali crew on board.
12_8ecbplus.5: During the operation, six AK - 47 rifles, 12 magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition were found and confiscated, " the officer said.
12_8ecbplus.6: In addition, the naval boarding party also found a host of other equipment such as grapnels, ladders and rope - handling gloves, all of which confirmed their intent to attack and hijack the merchant vessels, he said.
12_8ecbplus.7: This anti - piracy action by INS Sukanya was the fifth successful operation by its crew during its current patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden since September this year.
12_8ecbplus.8: INS Sukanya has seized a total of 14 AK - 47 rifles, 31 magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition during the five operations it carried out there, the officer said.

20_5ecbplus.2: A 5. 9 magnitude earthquake has leveled seven villages in Iran's southern area, killing 10 persons and wounding other 70, Iranian officials were quoted by AP as saying.
20_5ecbplus.3: According to Iran's seismologic center, the epicenter of the earthquake was in the waters of the Persian Gulf, between the port city of Bandar Abbas and Qeshm Island.
20_5ecbplus.4: Qeshm's governor, Heidar Alishvandi, told the state television that rescue teams have been deployed to the affected areas and that the population from the villages is now safe.
20_5ecbplus.5: A reporter of the Iranian news agency, IRNA, said that the only hospital in Qeshm was full of people and that there was a shortage of medical facilities.
20_5ecbplus.6: According to the same agency, the Deyrestan village saw serious destruction, while Tonban and Goursin were all but destroyed.
20_5ecbplus.7: The main temblor was followed by at least four major aftershocks, with magnitudes ranging from 3. 6 to 4. 3, which increased the panic among villagers.
20_5ecbplus.8: Qeshm, a 1, 500 - square - kilometer island off the coast southwest of Bandar Abbas and 1, 500 kilometers south of Tehran, has a population of more than 100, 000.

25_15ecbplus.0: Pierre Thomas out for playoffs after Saints place him on IR
25_15ecbplus.3: The Saints placed running back Pierre Thomas on IR Wednesday, the second time in as many days the team has placed one of its primary running backs on the list.
25_15ecbplus.4: New Orleans picked up DeShawn Wynn on Monday after putting Chris Ivory on Injured Reserve and on Wednesday, signed Joique Bell to replace Thomas
25_15ecbplus.5: “ With Pierre, last week during practice he had a setback, ” head coach Sean Payton said.
25_15ecbplus.6: “ We got to that point in discussing it with him where it was at.
25_15ecbplus.7: He came back and was very effective for a couple of games, particular the ATL game.
25_15ecbplus.9: “ We ’ re at the time of year where you want to do what ’ s best.
25_15ecbplus.10: The doctors, trainers and ourselves, we thought it was the best move. ”
25_15ecbplus.11: New Orleans plays at Seattle on Saturday at 3: 30 p. m. in the Wild Card round of the NFC playoffs.
25_15ecbplus.12: While Thomas went on IR, four others did not practice.
25_15ecbplus.13: Defensive tackle Anthony Hargrove ( knee ), tight end Jimmy Graham ( ankle ), linebacker Danny Clark ( hamstring ) and defensive back Malcolm Jenkins ( knee ) all sat out.
25_15ecbplus.14: Tight ends Jeremy Shockey ( groin ) and David Thomas ( knee ) both were limited while receiver Marques Colston ( knee ) and defensive end Alex Brown ( shoulder ) both were full.
25_15ecbplus.15: Thomas came into 2010 as the team ’ s leading returning rusher from the Saints ’ Super Bowl winning season.
25_15ecbplus.16: He had 793 yards and six touchdowns on 147 carries and caught 39 passes for 302 yards and another two touchdowns.
25_15ecbplus.17: But he missed 10 total games this season and had only 269 yards and two touchdowns on 83 carries and another 201 yards on 29 catches.
25_15ecbplus.18: The Saints have had a season - long struggle with the running back corps, dating back to training camp when Lynell Hamilton was lost for the season when he tore up his knee in practices with New England.
25_15ecbplus.19: Less than three weeks later, P. J. Hill was placed on IR with a torn triceps that he injured in a preseason game against Houston.
25_15ecbplus.20: Reggie Bush was lost for half the season after breaking his right fibula in New Orleans ’ Sept. 20 win over San Francisco.
25_15ecbplus.21: A week later, Pierre Thomas went out for nearly nine weeks when he severely sprained his ankle late in New Orleans ’ loss to Atlanta.
25_15ecbplus.22: But while Bush has returned and played in the past six games, Thomas was back for only three games before being listed on the inactive list for the regular season ender against Tampa Bay.
25_15ecbplus.23: He tweaked the same left ankle that bothered him originally the Friday before the game against the Bucs.
25_15ecbplus.24: Bell ( 5 - foot - 11, 220 pounds ) has spent time with the Indianapolis Colts, Philadelphia and Buffalo this season, but has no carries.
25_15ecbplus.25: He played at Wayne State, where he finished with 6, 728 yards rushing with 96 touchdowns in addition to 918 yards and four scores receiving.

34_10ecbplus.0: Obama nominates new surgeon general: MacArthur "genius grant" fellow Regina Benjamin
34_10ecbplus.2: As the country's politicos have their sights set on the U. S. Supreme Court confirmation hearings for Sonia Sotomayor today, President Barack Obama nominated Regina Benjamin, 52, as the country's new surgeon general, the "leading spokesperson on issues of public health, " Obama said.
34_10ecbplus.3: Benjamin, a rural family doctor in Alabama, was a 2008 MacArthur Foundation Fellow, and in 1995 she was elected to the American Medical Association's board of trustees, making her both the first black woman on the board and the first AMA trustee to be elected before the age of 40.
34_10ecbplus.4: In 1990 she founded the Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic, which cares for a largely uninsured working - class community that was hit by both Hurricanes Katrina and George.
34_10ecbplus.5: In addition to providing for her ill patients - whether or not they can foot the bill - "she's been a relentless promoter of prevention and wellness programs, " Obama said about Benjamin, who has had many relatives have die of preventable diseases.
34_10ecbplus.6: In her acceptance speech, Benjamin thanked two of her mentors: former Surgeon General David Satcher and former Secretary of Health and Human Services, Louis Sullivan.
34_10ecbplus.7: If confirmed by the Senate, she will replace Rear Admiral Steven K. Galson, who has been acting surgeon general since October 2007.
34_10ecbplus.8: The surgeon general "communicates the best science, evidence, and data to the American people for them to make healthy choices, " according to the Office of the Surgeon General's Web site.
34_10ecbplus.9: CNN correspondent Sanjay Gupta had been the front - runner for the spot earlier this year until he pulled himself out of consideration.

45_6ecbplus.0: Jury Convicts Spiro Man In Shooting Death Of Pregnant Girlfriend
45_6ecbplus.2: A jury in eastern Oklahoma has convicted a Spiro man of two counts of first - degree murder in the 2012 shooting death of his pregnant girlfriend.
45_6ecbplus.3: The jury deliberated almost seven hours Thursday before convicting 27 - year - old Christopher Kenyon Simpson in the death of 20 - year - old Ka'loni Flynn of Fort Smith, Ark.
45_6ecbplus.4: The Southwest Times Record reports that the jury recommended the maximum sentence of life in prison without parole.
45_6ecbplus.5: Formal sentencing is set for 11 a. m. on Nov. 8.
45_6ecbplus.6: Prosecutors allege that Simpson shot Flynn twice in the head because he did not want another child to support.
45_6ecbplus.7: A DNA expert testified that Simpson fathered the fetus.
45_6ecbplus.8: Simpson's attorney, Warren Gotcher, argued that no witnesses could place Simpson at the shooting scene and that his client was innocent.

24_1ecbplus.0: Paris hit by 2 mn - euro jewelry heist
24_1ecbplus.1: Four men rammed their car into an upmarket jewelry store in central Paris on Monday, smashing the shop window and making off with a two - million - euro ( $2. 6 - million ) booty, a police source said.
24_1ecbplus.2: The heist near the upscale Place Vendome is the latest to hit France after a spate of high - profile robberies in the southern resort of Cannes.
24_1ecbplus.3: The police source, who wished to remain anonymous, said the men drove a large four - by - four car into the store in the early hours of the morning and grabbed jewelry and luxury watches worth an estimated two million euros.
24_1ecbplus.4: They then set fire to the vehicle and escaped in another car.
24_1ecbplus.5: Forensic policemen are currently going through the site of the robbery at the Casty store on Rue de Castiglione in the central first district of Paris, which is home to numerous jewelry shops.
24_1ecbplus.6: At the end of July, an armed man carried out a brazen robbery in broad daylight at a diamond exhibition at the Carlton hotel in Cannes, making off with jewelry worth 103 million euros in one of the world's biggest ever heists.
24_1ecbplus.7: Paris has also been the scene of high - profile robberies.
24_1ecbplus.8: In December 2008, three men emptied almost all of the stock of gems from the Harry Winston jewelry store.
24_1ecbplus.9: In 2009, police said they had recovered 80 percent of the haul.

13_13ecbplus.0: Historic dairy building destroyed by fire
13_13ecbplus.2: A fire on Tuesday destroyed Palmer's historic Matanuska Maid Dairy warehouse building, which was built in the 1930s when colonists arrived from the Midwest to try their hand at farming in Alaska.
13_13ecbplus.3: Jon Owen, the city's public safety director, said a call came in from the Valley Hotel at 3: 33 a. m. from someone who saw the vacant building across town on fire.
13_13ecbplus.4: By the time fire crews arrived, flames could be seen coming out from under the eaves all the way around the building.
13_13ecbplus.5: In the next minute or two, the entire roof was in flames, Owen said.
13_13ecbplus.6: Firefighters worked quickly to contain the blaze.
13_13ecbplus.7: More than two dozen pieces of firefighting equipment were brought to the scene, including some that were placed between the warehouse building and a petroleum distribution company next door, Owen said.
13_13ecbplus.8: About 5, 000 gallons of water a minute was poured on the fire.
13_13ecbplus.9: It took about three hours to knock the fire down, but the building was destroyed, he said.
13_13ecbplus.10: The warehouse building, one of the oldest in Palmer, had been vacant for years and was boarded up, Palmer City Clerk Janette Bower told The Associated Press.
13_13ecbplus.11: "It is very, very sad, " Bower said.
13_13ecbplus.12: The building was constructed in 1935, predating statehood by more than 20 years.
13_13ecbplus.13: "That is really old for Alaska standards, " Bower said.
13_13ecbplus.14: The city was negotiating to purchase the property, along with at least a half - dozen others that once were part of the Matanuska Maid Dairy operation.
13_13ecbplus.15: Voters in 2009 approved a $3 million bond to buy the properties, Bower said.
13_13ecbplus.17: Palmer does not own the properties, Bower said.
13_13ecbplus.18: While the city hadn't settled on a plan for the Mat Maid properties, some ideas had been bounced around, she said, including turning the properties into a new city hall complex, or using them for a museum or theater arts building.
13_13ecbplus.19: Bower said the colonists settled in the Palmer area under the New Deal to spur economic development during the Great Depression.
13_13ecbplus.20: The idea was to see if there were agricultural opportunities to be had in Alaska, Bower said.
13_13ecbplus.21: More than 200 families, mostly from Wisconsin and Minnesota, were brought to Alaska under the Matanuska Colony project.
13_13ecbplus.22: Bower said the warehouse building was one of the first structures to be built.
13_13ecbplus.23: The Mat Maid dairy started at that time as a dairy cooperative.
13_13ecbplus.24: It was taken over by the state in the mid - 1980s after its private owner went bankrupt.
13_13ecbplus.25: The money - losing operation was subsidized by the state and shut down for good in December 2007.
13_13ecbplus.26: It appeared for a time that the valley's tradition of dairy farming also would be lost but it was revived in 2008 under a private operation called the Matanuska Creamery, which is successfully filling a niche market for fresh milk and cheese produced entirely by Alaska farmers.

44_13ecbplus.0: HP's Mark Hurd: Thoughts on consolidation
44_13ecbplus.1: Summary: During his keynote at Oracle OpenWorld, HP CEO Mark Hurd gave his views on market consolidation.
44_13ecbplus.2: It's an appropriate setting given Oracle has made 41 acquisitions in 45 months totalling.
44_13ecbplus.4: During his keynote at Oracle OpenWorld, HP CEO Mark Hurd gave his views on market consolidation.
44_13ecbplus.5: It's an appropriate setting given Oracle has made 41 acquisitions in 45 months totalling.
44_13ecbplus.6: HP is no slouch at acquisitions in its post - Compaq era, with more than 20 in the last few years, including Mercury for $4. 5 billion for and most recently Opsware for $1. 6 billion.
44_13ecbplus.7: Today, HP announced a small acquisition, EYP Mission Critical Facilities, a datacenter consulting service with 350 employees, while Oracle took a day off from its pursuits, which recently included BEA.
44_13ecbplus.8: Hurd sees continuing industry consolidation and vertical integration going forward, which is no surprise.
44_13ecbplus.9: Lately, some mid - size companies being bought out by private equity firms, and the larger companies are still on the hunt.
44_13ecbplus.10: Today, IBM took out Cognos for $5 billion.
44_13ecbplus.11: But he seems to suggest that the market is shaping up for some very large scale transactions in the next few years.
44_13ecbplus.13: A handful of players have in excess of $100 billion in cash revenue.
44_13ecbplus.14: We'll see more consolidation, not less.
44_13ecbplus.15: At the same time, we are all getting a push from an IT perspective to do more standardization and to have fewer suppliers, " Hurd said.
44_13ecbplus.16: Over time, fewer suppliers means moving from the large buying the small - and medium - sized to the large munching on the large, more mergers of near equals, carving up the market into fewer fiefdoms within the complex bounds of global regulatory approval.
44_13ecbplus.17: "It could happen in two or three years if the right alignment of players occurs, " he added.
44_13ecbplus.18: Hurd didn't elaborate on the "right alignment of players, " and made a point of saying that he wasn't making a prediction.
44_13ecbplus.19: He explained that companies with lots of cash can pay dividends to shareholders, buy back stock or make acquisitions.
44_13ecbplus.20: "You have to measure the value of the three choices, and in many cases potential M&A activities will rise to the top. "
44_13ecbplus.21: "You can figure it out as well as I can, " Hurd told the rapt OpenWorld crowd.
44_13ecbplus.23: Hurd is well known for his acumen with the numbers, but gave no further insights.
44_13ecbplus.24: Following the trajectory of the numbers for a moment, it's not that far fetched to see HP and Oracle in a consolidation supernova if the planets align in a certain way.
44_13ecbplus.25: Or, how about SAP and IBM, or some other combination.
44_13ecbplus.29: It's just ungoverned speculation, but consolidation in maturing market tends toward singularity.
44_13ecbplus.30: Of course, that could be the beginning of the end for those long established brands, as Google or a company no one had heard of rears its head and completely changes the rules of the game.

3_5ecbplus.0: Texas convict Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr. , riding in wheelchair, pulls gun on guards, escapes on foot
3_5ecbplus.2: Rewards totaling $30, 000 are offered for information leading to Texas prison escapee Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr.
3_5ecbplus.3: Department of Corrections spokeswoman Michelle Lyons said Thursday that the convicted sex offender was still on the run.
3_5ecbplus.4: Comeaux was in a wheelchair Monday when he pulled a gun on two guards during a transfer from a unit in Huntsville to one in Beaumont.
3_5ecbplus.5: Both guards were released after being forced to drive to the Baytown area, where Comeaux ran way.
3_5ecbplus.6: Comeaux was serving life in prison for aggravated sexual assault out of Brazos County.

39_8ecbplus.0: Peter Capaldi favourite to take over from Matt Smith as Doctor Who
39_8ecbplus.2: Peter Capaldi is the bookies' favourite to become the next Doctor Who.
39_8ecbplus.3: There has been a surge in bets on Capaldi, who plays sweary spin doctor Malcom Tucker in The Thick of It, replacing Matt Smith, according to William Hill.
39_8ecbplus.4: Joe Crilly, a spokesperson for William Hill, said: 'Peter Capaldi was not even in our list a few days ago but he has been the subject of a lot of betting interest recently and this gamble would suggest that if he does not have the part already, he is almost certainly on the shortlist. '
39_8ecbplus.5: He now has odds of 2 / 1 to become the 12th Time Lord above Ben Daniels and Rory Kinnear.
39_8ecbplus.6: Previous favourite Kinnear has slipped down the list after he ruled himself out of the running, claiming he's never seen an episode of Doctor Who.
39_8ecbplus.7: Capaldi's name may have been linked to the role after Doctor Who creator Steven Moffat said he would not rule out casting an older Doctor.

39_8ecbplus.9: It is completely on all the lists we make - there are absolutely older Doctors. '

7_1ecbplus.2: Wladimir Klitschko stopped Tony Thompson in the sixth round to keep a comfortable hold on his WBA, IBF and WBO heavyweight titles Saturday night.
7_1ecbplus.3: The 36 - year - old champion Klitschko, 58 - 3 with 51 knockouts, floored Thompson with a big right hand near the end of the fifth round at Stade de Suisse, and the 40 - year - old American never recovered.
7_1ecbplus.4: The Ukrainian champion dropped Thompson again in the sixth, and referee Sam Williams gave the challenger a standing count before stopping the fight at 2: 56.
7_1ecbplus.5: "Thompson was not so easy to box.
7_1ecbplus.7: In 2008, Klitschko stopped Thompson in the 11th round.
7_1ecbplus.8: Thompson, the mandatory challenger nominated by the IBF, fell to 36 - 3 ( 24 KOs ).
7_1ecbplus.9: After the fight, Klitschko led the crowd of 22, 000 in signing "Happy Birthday" to trainer Emanuel Steward, who turned 68 on Saturday.
7_1ecbplus.10: "Tony Thompson is very hard to hit, " Steward said.
7_1ecbplus.11: "Tony was watching Wladimir's right hand all night. "
7_1ecbplus.12: A cagey opening round was followed by a scrappy second, as Klitschko twice wrestled Thompson to the floor.
7_1ecbplus.13: Thompson briefly stepped up his cautious tactics when landing a left to Klitschko's face in the third.
7_1ecbplus.14: Klitschko finally landed a long, straight right in the fifth, and the round ended with Thompson struggling on the ropes.
7_1ecbplus.15: The champion cornered Thompson toward the end of the sixth, and landed punches to the head though no single blow appeared to cause serious damage.
7_1ecbplus.16: "I got caught but I'm OK, " Thompson said in the ring.
7_1ecbplus.17: "He's strong and he's world heavyweight champion for a reason. "
7_1ecbplus.18: Klitschko extended the domination of the heavyweight ranks he shares with his older brother, Vitali.
7_1ecbplus.19: Vitali was in his brother's corner as usual, and acted as cheerleader in the third round, urging on fans in the soccer stadium when the first chants of "Klitschko! Klistchko! stirred.
7_1ecbplus.20: The elder Klitschko will defend his WBC title against Manuel Charr of Germany in Moscow on Sept. 8.

12_10ecbplus.0: INS Sukanya intercepts pirate ships, arms seized
