3_8ecbplus.0: Escape renews calls for prison agency shake - up
3_8ecbplus.2: After facing serious questions about how 900 prohibited cell phones were smuggled into Texas prisons this year, along with drugs and weapons, the Texas Department of Criminal Justice found itself on the defensive again Tuesday while trying to find an inmate who escaped despite being shackled to a wheelchair.
3_8ecbplus.3: TDCJ officials could answer few questions about how convicted rapist Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr. , 49, escaped Monday from a prison van in Baytown after pulling a gun and handcuffing two transport officers, stealing their three guns and walking away.
3_8ecbplus.4: He remains on the loose today.
3_8ecbplus.5: Comeaux escaped Monday morning as transport officers tried to move him in a TDCJ van from the Estelle prison unit in Huntsville to the Stiles Unit in Beaumont.
3_8ecbplus.6: He put on one officer's gray uniform and black boots, then stole a 12 - gauge shotgun and two semi - automatic pistols before fleeing on foot, leaving his pistol behind.

41_7ecbplus.2: A refugee camp in South Sudan's Unity state was bombed on Thursday, South Sudan officials and witnesses said, threatening to raise tensions with Sudan.
41_7ecbplus.3: Sudan's armed forces denied they carried out the strike.
41_7ecbplus.4: South Sudan's president Salva Kiir talked of Sudan's "pending invasion" of its neighbour.
41_7ecbplus.5: Violence along the poorly defined border since South Sudan's independence in July has strained ties between the two nations.
41_7ecbplus.6: They have accused one another of backing rebel groups on their sides of the border.
41_7ecbplus.7: A reporter heard a large explosion in the Yida refugee camp, then saw a crater about two metres wide, an unexploded bomb wedged in the side of a school building and a white aircraft flying north.
41_7ecbplus.8: Witnesses said there were three further explosions at 3 p. m.
41_7ecbplus.9: Yida is a camp of about 20, 000 refugees from the Nuba Mountains region of South Kordofan, a state north of the border where rebels have been fighting Sudan's army since June.
41_7ecbplus.10: The camp is less than 25 kilometres from the border with Sudan.
41_7ecbplus.11: There were no immediate reports of any casualties.
41_7ecbplus.13: Taban Deng, the governor of Unity state, accused Khartoum of carrying out the attack.
41_7ecbplus.14: "These people ( Khartoum ) should be taken to book.
41_7ecbplus.15: They should adhere to international laws and regulations, " Deng told reporters in Bentiu.
41_7ecbplus.16: "The refugees need to be safe and need to be protected.
41_7ecbplus.18: They should not be pursued inside the territory of South Sudan, " he said.
41_7ecbplus.19: Al - Sawarmi Khalid, spokesman for Sudan's armed forces, said Sudan had not bombed anywhere in South Sudan's territory.
41_7ecbplus.20: "South Sudan is a state in the United Nations.
41_7ecbplus.21: We respect international law, and it's impossible that we would do that, " he said.
41_7ecbplus.22: South Sudan split off into a separate country in July after voting overwhelmingly for secession in a January referendum, the culmination of a 2005 peace deal that ended decades of war between north and south.
41_7ecbplus.24: Fire crackled in the dry grass around the crater about 100 metres away from an aid agency compound in Yida camp.
41_7ecbplus.25: "They ( Khartoum ) don't want any life in the Nuba Mountains, and now they are expanding the war to the South Sudan republic, " said Yousif Ismail, a refugee from the Nuba mountains.
41_7ecbplus.26: Fighting has broken out in Sudan's Blue Nile state this year.
41_7ecbplus.27: Blue Nile and South Kordofan are home to tens of thousands of fighters who sided with the south during the war but were left in Sudan when South Sudan seceded, analysts say.
41_7ecbplus.29: Last week, Khartoum submitted its second complaint to the UN Security Council, accusing South Sudan of supplying anti - aircraft and anti - tank missiles, ammunition, landmines and mortars to the insurgents.
41_7ecbplus.30: Kiir denied those claims in a statement on Thursday, calling them "smoke screens to mask Khartoum's own activities in support of the armed dissident groups that are fighting its proxy war against the Republic of South Sudan".
41_7ecbplus.31: The accusations were being used to justify Sudan's "pending invasion of the South, " Kiir said.
41_7ecbplus.32: The two countries have yet to agree on how much the new nation will pay to use Sudan's oil pipelines and other facilities, which South Sudan depends on to export crude.
41_7ecbplus.33: They also dispute control of the Abyei region.
41_7ecbplus.34: Some 2 million people died in the north - south civil war, waged for all but a few years since 1955 over religion, ideology, ethnicity and oil.

12_9ecbplus.1: Anti Piracy Ops by INS Sukanya
12_9ecbplus.2: Indian Naval Ship Sukanya, presently deployed on anti - piracy patrols in the Gulf of Aden under the operational control of the Western Naval Command, found herself once again in the thick of things, thwarting a multiple - boat piracy attack on 10 Nov 11.
12_9ecbplus.3: The ship was escorting a group of five merchant vessels through the IRTC ( Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor ) when, at about 9: 25 in the morning of 10th Nov, she detected a group of five suspicious boats, speedily approaching the merchant vessels of her group.
12_9ecbplus.4: The warship immediately altered towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them.
12_9ecbplus.5: On seeing the resolve evident in the warship's action and probably mindful of the reputation for resolute action that the Indian Navy justly enjoys in such deployments, the pirate skiffs reversed course and tried to flee the area.
12_9ecbplus.6: While two of them managed to get away, the Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three and carried out well practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action.
12_9ecbplus.7: The three boats had a total of 26 Somali crew onboard.
12_9ecbplus.8: During the operation, six AK 47 rifles, 12 Magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition were found and confiscated.
12_9ecbplus.9: In addition, the boarding party also found a host of other equipment such as grapnels, ladders and rope - handling gloves all of which confirmed their piratical intent.
12_9ecbplus.10: The timely operation by Sukanya resulted, once again, in foiling the pirates' intention of attacking merchant vessels transiting this busy sea lane through which over a hundred Billion Dollars of India's external trade passes each year.
12_9ecbplus.11: This is the fifth successful anti - piracy operation conducted by Sukanya, in the course of her ongoing patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden, which commenced in September.
12_9ecbplus.12: The ship has, thus far, confiscated a total of 14 AK 47 Rifles, 31 Magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition, thereby ensuring that the Indian Navy retains its standing as a force not to be trifled with, and remains at the forefront of anti - piracy operations, as a critical component of the international effort to curb piracy and ensure the safety and freedom of seaborne trade, even in this highly risk - prone area.

28_1ecbplus.0: Deep Throat suspect found dead in hotel
28_1ecbplus.2: One of the longest - running mysteries of American politics may soon be resolved after it was announced yesterday that the man many suspect of being Deep Throat in the Watergate scandal had died.
28_1ecbplus.3: Fred LaRue, known as the "bagman" because he delivered payments to ensure the silence of participants in the Watergate break - in, was found dead in a hotel room in Biloxi, Mississippi.
28_1ecbplus.5: The two Washington Post reporters who broke the Watergate story, Carl Bernstein and Bob Woodward, have maintained that they would only reveal the identity of Deep Throat once he was dead.
28_1ecbplus.6: Although there have been several names advanced as Deep Throat, LaRue is one of the more likely candidates.
28_1ecbplus.7: He was a special assistant to John Mitchell, the former attorney general who headed Creep, the Campaign to Re - elect the President, in 1972.
28_1ecbplus.8: LaRue was at a meeting at Nixon's Florida holiday home at which the scheme to break into the Democratic headquarters in the Watergate building in Washington was first mooted.
28_1ecbplus.9: Although LaRue insisted he was not Deep Throat, and that the source was a combination of several people, Woodward and Bernstein have insisted Deep Throat was one person.
28_1ecbplus.10: LaRue said last year that President Nixon had not been told of the plan to break into the building.
28_1ecbplus.11: He cited his close relationship with Mr Mitchell to back up his claim that the president was ignorant of the plan.
28_1ecbplus.12: LaRue served four and a half months in prison for his role in the Watergate conspiracy, after being charged with obstructing justice.

26_1ecbplus.0: Vincent Gigante, Mafia Leader Who Feigned Insanity, Dies at 77
26_1ecbplus.2: Vincent Gigante, who feigned mental illness for decades to camouflage his position as one of the nation's most influential and dangerous Mafia leaders, died today in federal prison in Springfield, Mo. , officials told The Associated Press.
26_1ecbplus.4: Mr. Gigante died while serving a 12 - year sentence imposed in 1997 after he was convicted of racketeering and conspiring to kill other mobsters.
26_1ecbplus.5: Officials at the prison medical center where he died did not provide the cause of death but noted that he suffered from heart disease.
26_1ecbplus.6: Mr. Gigante, whose nickname was "Chin, " painstakingly maintained the fiction that he was incompetent until April 2003, when he appeared before Judge I. Leo Glasser in Federal District Court in Brooklyn and pleaded guilty to obstruction of justice.
26_1ecbplus.7: Specifically, he acknowledged running a con on the legal system that delayed his racketeering trial from 1990 to 1997 while his sanity was being examined.
26_1ecbplus.8: As part of the plea, three more years were added to his prison term, but he avoided a lengthy trial on the other charges, which amounted to an accusation - long denied or sidestepped by Mr. Gigante - that he headed the Genovese organized crime family.
26_1ecbplus.9: His lawyer, Benjamin Brafman, offered the explanation that "I think you get to a point in life - I think everyone does - where you become too old and too sick and too tired to fight. "
26_1ecbplus.10: For Mr. Gigante, the guise that he adopted in the mid - 1960's - behavior that won him the nickname Oddfather - took considerable effort to maintain.
26_1ecbplus.11: He could often be seen shuffling around his Greenwich Village neighborhood in pajamas, bathrobe and slippers, mumbling to himself and appearing to be a disturbed but harmless person.
26_1ecbplus.12: Law - enforcement agents, prosecutors and Mafia defectors described his behavior as a staged performance calculated to evade prosecution for his activities as head of a crime family that under his leadership became the wealthiest and most powerful in the nation.
26_1ecbplus.13: Based on information from informers and electronic eavesdropping on gangsters, F. B. I. and New York City law - enforcement officials ranked Mr. Gigante as the pre - eminent Mafia leader in the early and mid - 1990's, and prosecutors identified him as the dominant force in the early 1990's inside the Commission, the Mafia's ruling body, which resolves significant disputes among the five major families in the New York region.
26_1ecbplus.14: His reach, law - enforcement officials said, extended as well to Philadelphia and New England, where he exercised veto power over the appointments of mob bosses in those areas.
26_1ecbplus.15: Salvatore Gravano, the No. 2 figure in the Gambino crime family before he defected in 1991, testified that even Mr. Gigante's archrival, John Gotti, grudgingly acknowledged Mr. Gigante's craftiness.
26_1ecbplus.16: "He's crazy like a fox, " Mr. Gravano quoted Mr. Gotti as saying of Mr. Gigante after a summit meeting of New York City mob leaders in 1988.
26_1ecbplus.17: Mr. Gotti was the boss of the Gambino family until his own imprisonment forced him to relinquish undisputed control in the late 1990's.
26_1ecbplus.18: He, too, died in a prison hospital, of cancer in June 2002.
26_1ecbplus.19: Federal Bureau of Investigation agents and federal and state prosecutors regarded Mr. Gigante as the most elusive Mafia leader of his era and the most difficult to bring to trial.
26_1ecbplus.20: "He was probably the most clever organized - crime figure I have ever seen, " said John S. Pritchard 3rd, a former F. B. I. supervisor, who led a squad that investigated the Genovese family in the 1980's.
26_1ecbplus.21: Disputing the government's contentions, Mr. Gigante's lawyers and relatives maintained that he had been mentally disabled since the late 1960's, with a below - normal I. Q. of 69 to 72.
26_1ecbplus.22: His defenders steadfastly denied that he was associated with the Mafia, asserting that it was ludicrous to believe that someone so mentally subpar was capable of heading a major crime organization.
26_1ecbplus.23: The Rev. Louis Gigante, a Roman Catholic priest, former New York city councilman and a builder of low - income housing in the Bronx, characterized the relentless investigations of his older brother as persecution by agents and prosecutors who were biased against Italian - Americans.
26_1ecbplus.24: Organized - crime experts and mob turncoats said that Mr. Gigante was apparently willing to humiliate himself publicly as the price for escaping the long prison sentences that were being meted out to other Mafia leaders.
26_1ecbplus.25: According to federal and state investigators, each of the family's 200 "made" or inducted soldiers and about 1, 000 associates - the name for others who voluntarily cooperate in illegal activities but who are not sworn members - were obligated to funnel part of their loot to Mr. Gigante, as much as $100 million a year in the early 1990's.
26_1ecbplus.26: The family's fortune, the experts said, flowed largely from a vast network of bookmaking and loansharking rings and from extortions of construction companies in the New York City area seeking labor peace or sweetheart contracts from carpenters, teamsters and laborers' unions that were dominated by Mr. Gigante's lieutenants.
26_1ecbplus.27: Mob deserters in the mid - 1990's testified in criminal and civil cases that the Genovese gang's other lucrative enterprises included the control of cartels that rigged bids and inflated prices in the private garbage - hauling industries of New York City and Westchester County; kickbacks from shipping and trucking companies on the New Jersey waterfront in exchange for labor peace; protection payoffs from merchants at the Fulton Fish Market; and the control of many union jobs at the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center in Manhattan.
26_1ecbplus.28: Mr. Gigante's influence even extended over the San Gennaro Street Festival in Little Italy until a 1995 crackdown by New York City officials and federal prosecutors resulted in allegations that the Genovese family operated gambling games at the festival, extorted payoffs from venders and pocketed thousands of dollars donated to a neighborhood church.
26_1ecbplus.29: In the 1980's, after the authorities said Mr. Gigante had assumed undisputed command of the Genovese family, he conducted his activities in a starkly unorthodox fashion for a Mafia leader.
26_1ecbplus.30: Most days, in the early evening, Mr. Gigante, a hulking man who was about six feet tall and weighed 200 pounds, would emerge from his mother's walkup apartment building on Sullivan Street in Greenwich Village.
26_1ecbplus.31: Sometimes dressed in a bathrobe and pajamas and sometimes wearing a windbreaker and shabby trousers and always accompanied by one or two bodyguards, he gingerly crossed the street to the Triangle Civic Improvement Association, a dingy storefront club that served as his headquarters.
26_1ecbplus.32: Inside, he played pinochle and held whispered conversations with men who agents said were his trusted confederates.
26_1ecbplus.33: After midnight, according to F. B. I. surveillance reports, he would be driven to a townhouse near Park Avenue at East 77th Street, that was owned by Olympia Esposito, who was characterized by Mr. Gigante's lawyers as his common - law wife and the mother of three of his eight children, Vincent, Lucia and Carmella Esposito.
26_1ecbplus.34: F. B. I. agents, who in 1986 observed the townhouse from a nearby rooftop post, said that soon after arriving, Mr. Gigante would change into more elegant clothes, carry on conversations with associates, and read or watch television before retiring.
26_1ecbplus.35: About 9 or 10 the next morning, he would reappear in his shabby downtown clothes and be driven back to Sullivan Street or a nearby apartment occupied by his relatives at 505 LaGuardia Place.
26_1ecbplus.36: "It was hard to understand what enjoyment he got out of being a mob boss, " said Ronald Goldstock, the former director of the New York State Organized Crime Task Force.
26_1ecbplus.37: "His only pleasure appeared to be the pure power he exercised. "
26_1ecbplus.38: Vincent Gigante ( pronounced ji - GANT - tee ) was born on March 29, 1928, in New York City and grew up on the same streets in Greenwich Village where he would spend most of his adult life.
26_1ecbplus.39: He was one of five sons of Salvatore Gigante, a watchmaker, and Yolanda Gigante, a seamstress, both of whom had immigrated from Naples.
26_1ecbplus.40: His mother usually addressed him as "Cincenzo, " a diminutive of Vincente, and his boyhood friends shortened that into his lifelong nickname, "Chin. "
26_1ecbplus.41: A lackadaisical student, Mr. Gigante graduated from P. S. 3, an elementary school in Greenwich Village and dropped out of Textile High School in Manhattan in the ninth grade.
26_1ecbplus.42: Police detectives said that as a teen - ager, he became a prot�g� of Vito Genovese, who was a potent Mafia leader in the United States and in Italy from the 1930's to the 1960's and whose name still describes the organized - crime group he headed until his death in 1969.
26_1ecbplus.43: The gang was founded in the 1930's by one of the nation's most notorious criminals, Charles ( Lucky ) Luciano, who was deported to Italy and who died in 1962.
26_1ecbplus.44: Mr. Genovese is believed to have endeared himself to the Gigantes when Vincent was a boy with a loan to pay for surgery needed by Mrs. Gigante.
26_1ecbplus.45: Between age 17 and 25, Mr. Gigante was arrested seven times on an array of charges: receiving stolen goods, possession of an unlicensed handgun, auto theft, arson and bookmaking.
26_1ecbplus.46: Most were dismissed or resolved by fines.
26_1ecbplus.47: His only jail sentence in that period was 60 days for a gambling conviction.
26_1ecbplus.48: When arrested in his early 20's, he listed his occupation as a tailor.
26_1ecbplus.49: But as a strapping youth with quick fists, he was better known as a prize fighter.
26_1ecbplus.50: Mr. Gigante, from age 16 to 19, fought as a light heavyweight in clubs around town, winning 21 of 25 light - heavyweight bouts, according to Nat Fleischer's Ring Record Book.
26_1ecbplus.51: Club boxers in those days fought four - and six - round contests in neighborhood arenas, usually getting a percentage of the tickets they themselves sold.
26_1ecbplus.52: One of Mr. Gigante's managers was a Greenwich Village neighbor, Thomas ( Tommy Ryan ) Eboli, who later became the boss of the Genovese family.
26_1ecbplus.53: Former New York City detectives who were assigned to organized - crime intelligence units said that Mr. Gigante earned his Mafia spurs as an enforcer in the 1950's.
26_1ecbplus.54: But his prominence in the underworld surged in 1957, when Mr. Genovese wrested control of a mob family from Frank Costello, who had been a close friend of Lucky Luciano and Meyer Lansky and was one of the best - known underworld figures in America.
26_1ecbplus.55: Mr. Costello retired abruptly as a boss after a gunman grazed his scalp with a bullet in the vestibule of his apartment building on Central Park West.
26_1ecbplus.56: A doorman identified the 29 - year - old Mr. Gigante as the shooter, but Mr. Costello testified that he was unable to recognize his assailant and Mr. Gigante was acquitted in 1958 on charges of attempted murder.
26_1ecbplus.57: A year later, he was convicted with Mr. Genovese in Manhattan on federal charges of heroin trafficking.
26_1ecbplus.58: Mr. Gigante, who listed his profession as the superintendent of a tenement on Bleecker Street, was sentenced to seven years in prison.
26_1ecbplus.59: The sentencing judge said he would have imposed a longer sentence but was swayed by a flood of letters from residents of Greenwich Village and Little Italy attesting to Mr. Gigante's good character and his work on behalf of juveniles.
26_1ecbplus.60: He was paroled after five years and detectives said that soon afterward he was promoted from soldier to the rank of capo, or captain, overseeing a group of Mafia gangsters known as a crew, in Greenwich Village.
26_1ecbplus.61: Although his headquarters was in Lower Manhattan and he spent his nights farther uptown, Mr. Gigante had a home in Old Tappan, N. J. , where he lived with his wife, the former Olympia Grippa, and their three daughters and two sons.
26_1ecbplus.62: They are Yolanda Fyfe, Roseanne D'Cola and Rita Gigante, and Salvatore and Andrew.
26_1ecbplus.63: In 1969, he was indicted in New Jersey on a charge of conspiracy to bribe the entire five - member Old Tappan police force to alert him to surveillance operations by law enforcement agencies.
26_1ecbplus.64: The accusation was dropped after Mr. Gigante's lawyers presented reports from psychiatrists that he was mentally unfit to stand trial.
26_1ecbplus.65: Mafia informers and defectors said that Mr. Gigante gained control of the Genovese family in a peaceful transition in the early 1980's when the group's acting boss, Philip Lombardo, stepped down because of ill health, and Mr. Gigante's main rival, Anthony Salerno, was imprisoned for life on racketeering charges.
26_1ecbplus.66: Mr. Salerno died in federal prison in 1992.
26_1ecbplus.67: As a new godfather, Mr. Gigante quickly imposed extraordinary security measures.
26_1ecbplus.68: Genovese soldiers and associates were forbidden to utter his name or nickname in conversations or telephone calls.
26_1ecbplus.69: When references to him had to be made, capos and soldiers would silently point to their chins or form the letter "C" with their fingers.
26_1ecbplus.70: Mr. Gigante was indicted in 1990 with 14 others on federal charges in Brooklyn that they had conspired to rig bids and extort payoffs from contractors on multimillion - dollar contracts with the New York City Housing Authority to install windows.
26_1ecbplus.71: At his arraignment, he appeared in court in his familiar pajamas and bathrobe and a peaked cap.
26_1ecbplus.72: Because of defense contentions that he was mentally and physically impaired, his case was severed from the other defendants and legal battles ensued for seven years over his competence to stand trial.
26_1ecbplus.73: A superseding indictment in 1993 brought more serious accusations against him.
26_1ecbplus.74: Mr. Gigante was charged with being the head of the Genovese family and sanctioning the murders of six mobsters and conspiring to kill three others, including John Gotti, the boss of the Gambino family.
26_1ecbplus.75: Mr. Gigante, the indictment asserted, wanted Mr. Gotti eliminated because he had violated Mafia protocol by arranging the assassination of the previous Gambino boss, Paul Castellano, without seeking Mr. Gigante's approval.
26_1ecbplus.76: The evidence in both indictments stemmed mainly from deserters from the Genovese and other mob families who entered the Government's Witness Protection Program.
26_1ecbplus.77: At sanity hearings in March 1996, Mr. Gravano of the Gambino family, and Alphonse D'Arco, the former acting boss of another New York Mafia organization, the Lucchese crime family, testified that Mr. Gigante was lucid during top - level Mafia meetings and that he had acknowledged to other gangsters that his eccentric behavior was a pretense.
26_1ecbplus.78: Mr. Gigante's lawyers elicited testimony and reports from psychiatrists and psychologists that from 1969 to 1995, he had been confined 28 times in hospitals for treatment of hallucinations and that he suffered from "dementia rooted in organic brain damage. "
26_1ecbplus.79: In August 1996, Judge Eugene H. Nickerson of Federal District Court in Brooklyn ruled that Mr. Gigante was mentally competent to stand trial on murder and racketeering charges.
26_1ecbplus.80: The judge found that at least until 1991, Mr. Gigante had engaged in an "elaborate deception" with the help of his relatives to deceive psychiatrists about his condition.
26_1ecbplus.81: Before the trial began, Mr. Gigante, who had open - heart surgery in 1988, had another cardiac operation in December 1996, putting his fitness to stand trial in doubt once again.
26_1ecbplus.82: Mr. Gigante had pleaded not guilty and had been free for years on $1 million bond.
26_1ecbplus.83: During the monthlong trial in 1997, a gaunt - looking Mr. Gigante sat in a wheelchair, looking blankly into space as witnesses testified and lawyers argued.
26_1ecbplus.85: After three days of deliberations, the jury on July 25, 1997, convicted him on charges of running multimillion - dollar rackets as the Genovese family chief and of conspiring unsuccessfully in the late 1980's to murder Mr. Gotti and a Genovese family defector.
26_1ecbplus.86: But he was acquitted of ordering three other gangland slayings and the jury was deadlocked on accusations that he ordered four other murders.
26_1ecbplus.87: Imposing a sentence of 12 years - instead of a possible maximum of 27 years - and a $1. 25 million fine, Judge Jack B. Weinstein of Federal District Court in Brooklyn reflected in December 1997 on Mr. Gigante's career.
26_1ecbplus.88: "He is a shadow of his former self, " the judge said, "an old man finally brought to bay in his declining years after decades of vicious criminal tyranny. "

20_11ecbplus.1: Ten people are killed and about 50 hurt.

20_11ecbplus.4: Ten people were killed and at least 50 injured when an earthquake razed mud - brick villages on the Persian Gulf island of Qeshm off Iran's southern coast Sunday, officials and state media said.

20_11ecbplus.7: The temblor was felt across the gulf in Oman and the United Arab Emirates.
20_11ecbplus.8: State - run TV reported that the island's airport sustained minor damage, and part of a hospital collapsed.

20_11ecbplus.11: "The earthquake was really strong, and people poured into the streets in panic.

20_11ecbplus.14: Qeshm Gov. Heidar Alishvandi said 50 were injured.

26_3ecbplus.0: Ex - Mafia boss Vincent Gigante dies in prison
26_3ecbplus.1: He was known as the 'Oddfather' for faking mental illness to beat raps
26_3ecbplus.3: Mob boss Vincent "The Chin" Gigante, the powerful Mafioso who avoided jail for decades by wandering the streets in a ratty bathrobe and slippers, feigning mental illness, died Monday in prison, officials said.
26_3ecbplus.5: Gigante, who had suffered from heart disease, died at the federal prison in Springfield, Mo. , said prison spokesman Al Quintero.
26_3ecbplus.6: Gigante, head of the Genovese crime family, had scored a lengthy string of victories over prosecutors, but it ended with a July 1997 racketeering conviction.
26_3ecbplus.7: After nearly a quarter - century of public craziness, he finally admitted his insanity ruse at an April 2003 federal hearing in which the man dubbed the "Oddfather" by tabloid newspapers calmly pleaded guilty to obstruction of justice.
26_3ecbplus.8: At the height of his power, Gigante's empire stretched from Little Italy to the docks of Miami.
26_3ecbplus.9: Denying he was a gangster, Gigante would wander the streets of the Greenwich Village neighborhood in nightclothes, muttering incoherently.
26_3ecbplus.10: Relatives, including a brother was who a Roman Catholic priest, insisted Gigante suffered from paranoid schizophrenia, dementia and Alzheimer's disease.
26_3ecbplus.11: Authorities charged it was a brazen act to avoid the law - although it wasn't until 1997 that a jury agreed, and it took another six years for Gigante to concede his subterfuge.
26_3ecbplus.12: Born in the Bronx in 1928, one of five sons of Italian immigrant parents, Gigante became a small - time boxer and drifted into the crime family founded in 1931 by legendary gangster Charles "Lucky" Luciano.
26_3ecbplus.13: In 1957, Gigante was the hitman in a botched attempt to assassinate then - boss Frank Costello.
26_3ecbplus.14: After refusing to name his attacker in court, the shaken Costello retired, making Gigante's patron, Vito Genovese, kingpin of the family that still bears his name.
26_3ecbplus.15: Over time, Gigante proved better at beating the law than John Gotti, the so - called "Teflon Don" who won two acquittals before tapes and turncoats sent him to prison for life.
26_3ecbplus.17: Before 1997, Gigante had served only a five - year heroin rap in 1959.

29_13ecbplus.0: Chiefs lose 20 - 13 to a fourth quarter Indianapolis Colt stampede

29_13ecbplus.16: But are usually thwarted by the goofups; some must come off that field shaking their heads and fondering in frustration.

29_13ecbplus.18: Oh well, next week they journey to Denver to take on the Broncos in their mile high city with their rarified air.
29_13ecbplus.19: Denver is not going to be a pushover.

26_8ecbplus.2: Mob boss Vincent "The Chin" Gigante, the powerful Mafioso who avoided jail for decades by wandering the streets in a ratty bathrobe and slippers, feigning mental illness, died Monday in prison.

26_8ecbplus.6: Gigante's death also was confirmed by Christine Monaco, a spokeswoman for the FBI, the organization that worked for years to put him behind bars.
26_8ecbplus.7: Dubbed the "Oddfather" for his bizarre behavior, Gigante had scored a lengthy string of victories over prosecutors, but it ended with a July 1997 racketeering conviction.
26_8ecbplus.8: He was sentenced to 12 years in prison.
26_8ecbplus.9: After a quarter - century of public craziness, he finally admitted his insanity ruse at an April 2003 federal hearing in which he calmly pleaded guilty to obstruction of justice.

38_4ecbplus.7: The UGSG Website says the largest quake ever to be recorded there was 4. 5.

23_5ecbplus.1: Briton dies in New Zealand's Aoraki Mount Cook National Park
23_5ecbplus.2: A British climber has fallen 2, 000ft to his death on a mountain in New Zealand, police there have said.
23_5ecbplus.3: Robert Buckley, 32, died while climbing to a hut on Mount Sefton in the Aoraki Mount Cook National Park on Saturday.
23_5ecbplus.4: Police inspector Dave Gaskin said Mr Buckley was well equipped at the time but was an inexperienced climber.
23_5ecbplus.5: A Foreign Office spokeswoman said: "We are aware of the death of a British man in New Zealand.
23_5ecbplus.6: We are providing consular assistance at this time. "
23_5ecbplus.8: Mr Buckley, originally from Essex in the UK, lived in New Zealand, says the Press Association news agency.
23_5ecbplus.9: His body was recovered by a team of rescuers on Sunday afternoon after attempts on Saturday were unsuccessful, according to local media reports.
23_5ecbplus.10: Three climbers with Mr Buckley were said to have been rescued after spending the night on the mountain.
23_5ecbplus.11: They were were released after a medical examination.
23_5ecbplus.12: Mr Buckley's death came a day after 36 - year - old Duncan Rait was killed after slipping and falling 200ft from a ridge in the same national park.
23_5ecbplus.13: The New Zealander, who lived in Australia, had been been dropped off by helicopter and was walking to a hut when he fell in the Tasman Glacier area.
23_5ecbplus.14: Inspector Gaskin said the deaths were a reminder that climbers needed to use extreme caution.
23_5ecbplus.15: "I can't speak for the first death but in this case it looks like to be a lack of experience, " he told the Timaru Herald.

39_1ecbplus.1: Doctor Who: Peter Capaldi revealed as 12th Doctor
39_1ecbplus.2: Actor Peter Capaldi has been announced as the new star of BBC sci - fi series Doctor Who.
39_1ecbplus.3: The 55 - year - old Glasgow - born star will be the 12th actor to play the Doctor, replacing out - going lead Matt Smith.
39_1ecbplus.4: Capaldi is best known for his role as foul - mouthed spin - doctor Malcolm Tucker in the BBC series The Thick of It.
39_1ecbplus.5: "It's so wonderful not to keep this secret any longer, but it's been so fantastic, " he said after the news was revealed on a live BBC One show.
39_1ecbplus.6: The actor had been the bookmakers' favourite to take on the role, with betting on him becoming the next Doctor suspended on Friday.
39_1ecbplus.7: It is not the first time Capaldi has appeared on the show - he played Roman merchant Caecilius in 2008 Doctor Who adventure The Fires of Pompeii.
39_1ecbplus.8: At 55, he is the same age as William Hartnell when he was cast in the role as the first Doctor in 1963.
39_1ecbplus.9: "Being asked to play the Doctor is an amazing privilege.
39_1ecbplus.10: Like the Doctor himself I find myself in a state of utter terror and delight.
39_1ecbplus.11: I can't wait to get started, " he said.
39_1ecbplus.13: Steven Moffat, the show's lead writer and executive producer, said casting Capaldi as the Doctor was an "incendiary combination".
39_1ecbplus.14: "One of the most talented actors of his generation is about to play the best part on television. "
39_1ecbplus.15: Moffat said Capaldi had been cast after a secret audition at his house.
39_1ecbplus.16: "We made a home video of [ Capaldi ] being the doctor and I showed it around and everyone said 'yes, that's the Doctor'.
39_1ecbplus.17: Moffat added the actor had "briefly flicked through my mind" the last time he was casting the role, but he did not think he was right for the part, however "now that moment has arrived".
39_1ecbplus.18: Capaldi said he downloaded old Doctor Who scripts from the internet and practised the lines in front of a mirror to prepare for the audition.
39_1ecbplus.19: He revealed he was filming a BBC adaptation of The Three Musketeers in Prague when he found out he got the part.
39_1ecbplus.20: "I had my phone on silent so I missed the call, " he said.
39_1ecbplus.21: "It was my agent and I rang her up and she said 'hello Doctor' - I haven't stopped laughing since. "
39_1ecbplus.23: Out - going Doctor Matt Smith welcomed Capaldi's casting, and pre - recorded a message for the new Time Lord.
39_1ecbplus.24: "I wish my successor all the best and say good luck and good on you for getting it, because I know he's both a huge fan of the show and a really nice guy, " he said.
39_1ecbplus.25: "The casting made me ready excited and as a fan I think it's a canny choice.
39_1ecbplus.26: If I had to pick someone, I'd pick him because I think he's great.
39_1ecbplus.27: I'm excited because I know what's coming and he's going to have a blast. "
39_1ecbplus.28: Jenna Coleman, who stars as current Doctor Who companion Clara, said: "I'm so excited Peter Capaldi is the man taking on the challenge of becoming the 12th Doctor.
39_1ecbplus.29: "With Steven's writing and his talent I know we'll be making an amazing show with an incredible incarnation of number 12.
39_1ecbplus.30: I can't wait to start this new adventure. "
39_1ecbplus.31: Ben Stephenson, controller of BBC Drama Commissioning said Capaldi was "an extraordinarily talented actor who can seemingly turn his hand to anything".
39_1ecbplus.32: "We can't wait to premiere his unique take on the Doctor on Christmas Day and we are sure he's going to become one of the all - time classic Doctors. "
39_1ecbplus.33: Following the announcement, The Thick of It writer Armando Ianucci tweeted: "There can't be a funnier, wiser, more exciting Time Lord than Peter Capaldi.
39_1ecbplus.34: The universe is in great hands. "
39_1ecbplus.35: Capaldi will film his first scenes on the series this autumn.

14_9ecbplus.0: Breaking: man charged with arson after fire at Waitrose in Wellington
14_9ecbplus.2: A man has been charged on suspicion of arson following a fire that devastated a Somerset supermarket.
14_9ecbplus.3: Robert Pitman, aged 24 and from Wellington, was charged with arson following the fire at the Waitrose supermarket in the Somerset town at the weekend.
14_9ecbplus.4: He has been denied bail and will appear at Taunton Deane Magistrates Court tomorrow morning.
14_9ecbplus.5: Dozens of firefighters tackled the blaze at the supermarket after the alarm was raised at about 6am on Sunday morning.

39_11ecbplus.0: Peter Capaldi announced as the new Doctor Who
39_11ecbplus.2: PETER Capaldi has been announced as the new Doctor Who, the 12th actor to take up the coveted TV role.
39_11ecbplus.3: Fans eagerly awaited the news, which was broadcast during a special live show on ABC this morning.
39_11ecbplus.4: The 55 - year - old Scottish actor will replace Matt Smith, who announced in June that he was leaving the sci - fi show later this year.
39_11ecbplus.5: Scroll down to see the first XI Doctors and tell us who your favourite has been
39_11ecbplus.6: Capaldi is best known in Britain for his starring role as a sharp - tongued spin doctor Malcolm Tucker in the critically - acclaimed UK political comedy The Thick of It.
39_11ecbplus.7: He has a long list of movie, television and stage credits, from the 1983 film Local Hero to a role alongside Brad Pitt in the recent zombie horror World War Z.
39_11ecbplus.8: He's also an Oscar winner - he directed Franz Kafka's It's a Wonderful Life, which won the Academy Award for best short film in 1994.
39_11ecbplus.9: In a live interview with the BBC Capaldi admitted he had been a long - time fan of the show.
39_11ecbplus.10: He said he used to pretend to be the Doctor as a child growing up in Glasgow.
39_11ecbplus.11: "Being asked to play the Doctor is an amazing privilege.
39_11ecbplus.12: Like the Doctor himself I find myself in a state of utter terror and delight.
39_11ecbplus.13: I can't wait to get started, " he said.
39_11ecbplus.14: "I haven't played it since I was nine.
39_11ecbplus.15: As an adult actor I've never worked on it.
39_11ecbplus.16: " ( For the audition ) I downloaded some old scripts from the internet and pracitised that in front of the mirror. "
39_11ecbplus.17: The role will be a dramatic change from Capaldi's turn as Tucker, a political manipulator known for his ceaseless and creative use of expletives.
39_11ecbplus.18: Doctor Who is a firmly child - friendly program.
39_11ecbplus.19: "I think Malcolm has been banished from the mirror by this Doctor Who, who certainly would not put up with any of Malcolm's language or attitude, " Capaldi said.
39_11ecbplus.20: Capaldi attributed the longevity of the show to the creative team behind it as well as to its millions of fans around the world.
39_11ecbplus.21: The show is a television institution, making its debut in 1963.
39_11ecbplus.22: In the show the galaxy - hopping Time Lord travels in the Tardis, a time machine shaped like an old - fashioned British police telephone booth.
39_11ecbplus.23: Its longevity is due partly to the flexibility of the premise.
39_11ecbplus.24: The Doctor can regenerate into new bodies, and can travel to any point in space or time.
39_11ecbplus.25: The show went off air in 1989 and was revived in 2005 when Christopher Eccleston took on the role.
39_11ecbplus.26: David Tennant then starred for three seasons before Smith took over in 2010.
39_11ecbplus.27: Talking about his time in the show, Smith told the BBC live show: 'I'll miss playing a character who can bounce from A - Z and be the smartest in the room and the silliest in the room. ..

14_10ecbplus.0: Major fire at Waitrose in Wellington
14_10ecbplus.2: A LARGE fire broke out at the Waitrose supermarket in Wellington town centre this morning ( July 21 ).

30_5ecbplus.0: Submarine cable problem disrupts telecom services in Alexandria
30_5ecbplus.2: Services on Egypt's three telecom operators were disrupted in parts of Alexandria on Tuesday afternoon, and some users in Cairo experienced slower internet connections due to "downtime" in a submarine cable.
30_5ecbplus.3: Vodafone Egypt said some users are continuing to face slight problems due to damage in Telecom Egypt's cables which began in central Cairo.
30_5ecbplus.4: "Vodafone, along with the country's three telecom providers has been affected by a damage in one of Telecom Egypt's fiber cables in a wire going from the Ramsis Communications Center all the way to Sadat City, " said Khaled Hegazy, Vodafone's external affairs director.
30_5ecbplus.5: "This has affected and continues to affect communications especially in parts of Alexandria and Suez governorates, " he said.
30_5ecbplus.6: "We have not been told when it will be fixed yet, it is in the hands of Telecom Egypt.
30_5ecbplus.7: Right now it is still slightly affecting some connections, " he added.
30_5ecbplus.8: On its Twitter account, Etisalat Misr said, "Customers on all three Egyptian mobile operators may currently face connection issues with voice, mobile internet, and / or BlackBerry services as a result of a damaged fiber cable from TE Data.
30_5ecbplus.9: "The issue is currently under investigation and services will be restored as soon as possible. "
30_5ecbplus.10: According to MyBroadband, the largest IT website in South Africa, the problem was attributed to downtime experienced by the pan - African ICT enabler SEACOM.
30_5ecbplus.11: The company which is a privately funded venture that owns and operates a submarine fiber - optic cable connecting communication carriers in south and east Africa, affected Mobinil, Vodafone, and Etisalat networks across parts of Alexandria and Suez.
30_5ecbplus.12: "We are seeing some problems in our telecom towers which are affecting only certain parts like Abu Qir district or Maamoura, for example, " a Mobinil customer service representative told Daily News Egypt.
30_5ecbplus.13: "Other than that, our clients have been calling us as usual. "
30_5ecbplus.14: A Vodafone customer representative also confirmed that some of their users were experiencing downtime in parts of Alexandria due to "minor technical difficulties. "
30_5ecbplus.15: According to SEACOM, the problems began at around 08: 30 am on Tuesday, and were resolved at approximately 09: 40.
30_5ecbplus.16: "SEACOM's partner network experienced a terrestrial fiber cut between Alexandria and the Suez this morning 16th August from 06: 31GMT.
30_5ecbplus.17: All links are back up as of 07: 35GMT.
30_5ecbplus.18: Total downtime was 1hr 4 mins, " the company was quoted as saying in an official statement.

25_5ecbplus.0: Pierre Thomas Placed on Injured Reserve by New Orleans Saints
25_5ecbplus.2: Pierre Thomas was placed on injured reserve by the New Orleans Saints on Wednesday, meaning he won't play in the 2011 NFL playoffs.
25_5ecbplus.3: Losing Thomas is bad enough, but it is compiled with the fact that they just lost Chris Ivory on Tuesday.
25_5ecbplus.4: This means they will be missing two of their best players in the rushing game, and it could weaken the attack that the Saints have on offense even further.
25_5ecbplus.5: Coach Sean Payton announced it himself on Wednesday, revealing through the New Orleans Saints Twitter account that Thomas had been placed on IR.
25_5ecbplus.6: It was a very shocking revelation in the roster moves the Saints have been making and any Saints fan that came into the postseason extremely confident about their team should be a tad worried about what the Saints can do now.
25_5ecbplus.7: They still have Reggie Bush and Julius Jones to head the running game, so at least the Saints weren't left empty handed.
25_5ecbplus.8: Last season it was Thomas that led the Saints in rushing, posting 793 total yards in 14 games.
25_5ecbplus.9: He had been hobbled this year, and that was the main reason that Ivory ended up seeing so much playing time.
25_5ecbplus.10: Ivory rushed for 716 yards this year, leading the Saints in rushing, and giving them a great option as they tried to survive without Thomas and Bush behind quarterback Drew Brees on offense.
25_5ecbplus.11: We reported Tuesday how Ivory is done for the year, and it raises the chances of Seattle pulling off an upset on Saturday.
25_5ecbplus.12: The Seattle vs. New Orleans game will be the first one on wild card weekend, with kickoff scheduled for 1: 30 p. m. PST.
25_5ecbplus.13: Seattle is the big underdog in this game, even though it is the team hosting the game.
25_5ecbplus.14: Getting to play in front of the home crowd and going up against a banged - up Saints team could be exactly what the Seahawks need to pull an upset, but they will need quarterback Matt Hasselbeck to come up huge as well.
25_5ecbplus.15: Hasselbeck had more than 300 passing yards against the Saints back in Week 11, so maybe Seattle has a chance after all.
25_5ecbplus.16: As for the Saints on offense, they still have Super Bowl MVP Drew Brees taking the snaps.
25_5ecbplus.17: He is having a bit of a down year by his standards, especially in the category of interceptions, but this is still a guy who could throw for 400 yards on any given night.
25_5ecbplus.18: A lot will be asked of him on Saturday, but he has been in pressure - packed games quite a few times at this point in his career.

8_10ecbplus.0: BREAKING NEWS - 3 DEAD due to Molotov cocktail at Bank
8_10ecbplus.1: According to international media and Greek Sky TV
8_10ecbplus.2: THREE PEOPLE HAVE DIED IN A BLAZE that broke out at MARFIN EGNATIA BANK, on Stadiou Street, downtown Athens.
8_10ecbplus.3: The fire started when demonstrators hurled Molotov cocktail fire bombs at the Bank.
8_10ecbplus.4: SKY - TV reports that the 3 bank employees were burnt to death.
8_10ecbplus.5: They were trapped in the stairwell of the 3rd floors while trying to flee the fire broken out two floors below.
8_10ecbplus.6: Four people - one with broken bones, 3 with inspiratory problems - are treated in nearby hospitals.
8_10ecbplus.7: Reports have it that angry demonstrators threw stones to the fire brigade coming in.
8_10ecbplus.8: There are reports about fire at Finance Ministry - depts, burnt cars & shops, smashed windows.
8_10ecbplus.9: The van of turkish NTV private channel was also set on fire.
8_10ecbplus.10: Clashes between demonstrators and plice are continueing.
8_10ecbplus.11: So far no information about injured peple or arrests.
8_10ecbplus.12: Information flow is hindered today since Greek Media are also taking part to the general strike.
8_10ecbplus.13: Tens of thousands angry Greeks demonstrate in Athens protesting the harsh austerity measures and severe cuts on salaries and pensions as well price increases in electricity and extra taxes.
8_10ecbplus.14: The slogans are against the politicians, the police and the journalists.
8_10ecbplus.15: People demand "Give the Stolen Money Back".
8_10ecbplus.16: People demand property confiscation of corrupt politicians and that those respomsible for the economic crisis should go to jail.
8_10ecbplus.17: The Greek government announced Sunday drastic public spending cuts in order to get bailout loans of 110 b. Euro from EU & IMF.

2_2ecbplus.2: Ellen DeGeneres was so nice as an Oscars host the first time, the Academy has asked her to do it twice.
2_2ecbplus.3: "It's official: I'm hosting the #Oscars! " DeGeneres tweeted Friday.
2_2ecbplus.4: "I'd like to thank @TheAcademy, my wife Portia and, oh dear, there goes the orchestra. "
2_2ecbplus.5: We'll get to hear more of her quips when she leads the Oscars ceremony next March.
2_2ecbplus.6: DeGeneres previously hosted the 79th Oscars in 2007, and snagged an Emmy nod for her work.
2_2ecbplus.7: The daytime talk show host follows Seth MacFarlane, whose hosting of the 2013 Academy Awards was divisive.
2_2ecbplus.8: "I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time, " DeGeneres said in the Academy's announcement.

31_1ecbplus.0: PUBLISHED FRIDAY, MARCH 8, 2013 AT 12: 46 PM / UPDATED AT 12: 48 PM
31_1ecbplus.1: McDermott becomes CU ’ s all - time scoring leader
31_1ecbplus.2: With a first - half free throw, junior forward Doug McDermott scored his 11th point of the Bluejays ’ Valley tournament opener and passed Rodney Buford to become the school ’ s all - time scoring leader with 2, 117 points.
31_1ecbplus.3: McDermott ended the game with 2, 129 points.
31_1ecbplus.4: With his first five points of the game, McDermott passed Bob Harstad ( 2, 110 ) and the next six helped him overtake Buford ( 2, 116 ), the last two players ahead of him on the Bluejays ’ career scoring chart.
31_1ecbplus.5: It took Buford and Harstad four seasons to amass their point totals.
31_1ecbplus.6: McDermott has notched his in 105 games over three seasons.

2_3ecbplus.0: Ellen DeGeneres to host the Oscars
2_3ecbplus.2: Ellen DeGeneres will host the Oscars for a second time next year, the Academy announced Friday.
2_3ecbplus.3: "We are thrilled to have Ellen DeGeneres host the Oscars, " producers Craig Zadan and Neil Meron said in a statement.
2_3ecbplus.4: DeGeneres announced the news in a tweet: "It's official: I'm hosting the #Oscars!
2_3ecbplus.5: I'd like to thank @TheAcademy, my wife Portia and, oh dear, there goes the orchestra. "
2_3ecbplus.6: "I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time.
2_3ecbplus.7: You know what they say - the third time's the charm, " she added in a statement.
2_3ecbplus.8: The television personality hosted the 79th Academy Awards in 2007, becoming only the second woman to host the ceremony solo, following Whoopi Goldberg's four stints in 1994, 1996, 1999 and 2002.

21_14ecbplus.0: Schenectady man charged in fatal Queens crash
21_14ecbplus.2: A Schenectady man has been charged in a fatal hit - and - run crash that killed a woman in Queens Friday night, New York Police said.
21_14ecbplus.3: Vishwanand Subryan, 23, was charged with vehicular manslaughter, criminally negligent homicide, leaving the scene of an accident and driving while intoxicated, police said.
21_14ecbplus.4: Subryan allegedly struck Raj Chohan, a 59 - year - old grandmother, as she walked along parked cars on 117th Street in Queens when the car struck her and fled the scene.
21_14ecbplus.5: Chohan was unconscious and unresponsive when officers and EMS arrived, police said.
21_14ecbplus.6: She was taken to Jamaica Hospital, where she was pronounced dead, police said.
21_14ecbplus.7: Subryan was arrested without incident shortly after the crash, police said.

8_9ecbplus.0: Greek Prime Minister Calls Bank Workers' Riot Deaths 'Murder'
8_9ecbplus.2: The Greek prime minister has denounced what he called the "murder" of three bank workers killed when the building they were in was torched during protests in Athens against harsh new austerity measures.
8_9ecbplus.3: Prime Minister George Papandreou vowed Wednesday that those responsible for the deaths would be found and brought to justice.
8_9ecbplus.4: He told Parliament that "a demonstration is one thing and murder is quite another. "
8_9ecbplus.5: The two women and a man were killed during demonstrations by tens of thousands who marched through Athens.
8_9ecbplus.6: The national strike was held to protest the austerity measures announced last weekend so that Greece can get a $144 billion bailout from the International Monetary fund and other European nations.
8_9ecbplus.7: Three people died when an Athens bank went up in flames Wednesday as tens of thousands of Greeks took to the streets to protest harsh spending cuts aimed at saving the country from bankruptcy.
8_9ecbplus.8: The fire brigade said the bodies were found in the wreckage of a Marfin Bank branch, on the route of the march in the city center.
8_9ecbplus.9: Demonstrators chanting "thieves, thieves" attempted to break through a riot police cordon guarding Parliament and chased the ceremonial guards away from the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in front of the building.
8_9ecbplus.10: An estimated 100, 000 people took to the streets as part of nationwide strikes to protest austerity measures imposed as a condition of bailout loans from the International Monetary Fund and other eurozone governments.
8_9ecbplus.11: The bailout is needed to keep heavily indebted Greece from defaulting on its debts.
8_9ecbplus.12: The loans are aimed at preventing Athens' debt troubles from becoming a wider crisis for the Euro by engulfing other financially troubled countries such as Spain and Portugal.
8_9ecbplus.13: But the rioting underlined skepticism that the Greek government could keep up its end of the bargain, helping drive the Euro below $1. 29 for the first time in over a year.
8_9ecbplus.14: Union reaction until now had been relatively muted by Greece's volatile standards, although the country has been hit by a series of strikes.
8_9ecbplus.15: But anger has mounted after the announcement of new austerity measures, which were essential to unlock the loans.
8_9ecbplus.16: Papandreou on Sunday announced cuts in salaries and pensions for civil servants, and another round of consumer tax increases, as a condition of the bailout.
8_9ecbplus.17: In Germany, Chancellor Angela Merkel urged parliament to quickly pass the country's share of the bailout - - 22 billion Euros over three years.
8_9ecbplus.18: The goal is passage by Friday; Greece faces a May 19 due date on debt it says it can't repay without the bailout.
8_9ecbplus.19: "Nothing less than the future of Europe, and with that the future of Germany in Europe, is at stake, " Merkel told lawmakers.
8_9ecbplus.20: "We are at a fork in the road. "
8_9ecbplus.21: Extensive clashes took place a broad swathe of central Athens, with hundreds of people battering store fronts and smashing paving stones to throw at the police, who responded with stun grenades and volleys of tear gas that left clouds of smoke hovering over the streets.
8_9ecbplus.22: Violence also broke out in the northern city of Thessaloniki, where another 20, 000 people marched through the city center, with youths smashing windows of stores and fast food restaurants.
8_9ecbplus.23: The outpouring of anger appeared much more spontaneous than the frequent set piece battles between police and anarchist youths who often spark violence during Greek demonstrations.
8_9ecbplus.24: The marches came amid a 24 - hour nationwide general strike that grounded all flights to and from Greece, shut down ports, schools and government services and left hospitals working with emergency medical staff.
8_9ecbplus.25: The Acropolis and all other ancient sites were closed, while journalists also walked off the job, suspending television and radio news broadcasts.
8_9ecbplus.26: Some media - - including state television and the Ta Nea newspaper Web site - - broke the strike to report on the deaths.
8_9ecbplus.27: Greek unions concede that the cash - strapped government was forced to increase consumer taxes and slash spending, including cutting salaries and pensions for civil servants.
8_9ecbplus.28: But they say low - income Greeks will suffer disproportionately from the measures, which aim to save $40 billion - - the country's current budget deficit - - through 2012.
8_9ecbplus.29: "These people are losing their rights, they are losing their future, " said Yiannis Panagopoulos, head of GSEE, one of the two largest union organizations.
8_9ecbplus.30: "The country cannot surrender without a fight. "
8_9ecbplus.31: IMF head Dominique Strauss - Kahn warned that the crisis could spread to other countries despite the rescue package's efforts to contain it.
8_9ecbplus.32: "Everyone must remain extremely vigilant, " to this risk, Strauss - Kahn said in an interview published in French newspaper Le Parisien Wednesday.
8_9ecbplus.33: "I completely understand the Greek populations' anger, its incomprehension at the size of the economic catastrophe, " Strauss - Kahn said.
8_9ecbplus.34: But Greeks must also understand that without these measures, "the situation would be infinitely more serious, " he said.
8_9ecbplus.35: Those who are feeling the crunch are outraged that they have to pay for what they see as politicians' mismanagement of their country's economy.
8_9ecbplus.36: "We'll be on the streets every day, every day!
8_9ecbplus.37: You never win unless you fight, " said 76 - year - old Constantinos Doganis, who gets euro345 a month from his farming pension fund.
8_9ecbplus.38: "It's our fault too, all the mistakes made by politicians over 30 years, all the people who cheat on their taxes, " he said.
8_9ecbplus.39: "But they are behaving like buzzards - - the Germans borrow money at 3 percent and then lend it to us for 5.
8_9ecbplus.41: Despite the strike, the draft bill of the new austerity measures is to be voted on Thursday.
8_9ecbplus.42: Prime Minister George Papandreou's Socialists hold a comfortable majority of 160 in the 300 - seat Parliament, and with a simple majority of 151 votes needed, the bill is expected to be passed easily.

28_4ecbplus.2: Fred LaRue, a Watergate figure and high - ranking Nixon administration official who once was rumored to be Deep Throat, has died of natural causes.
28_4ecbplus.4: His body was discovered Tuesday by a maid who entered his hotel room in Biloxi, Coroner Gary Hargrove said.
28_4ecbplus.5: The coroner said he believes Mr. LaRue died Saturday ( July 24, 2004 ).
28_4ecbplus.6: Mr. LaRue was known as the "bagman" who delivered payoffs to keep participants in the Watergate breakin quiet, and served 41 / 2 months in federal prison for conspiracy to obstruct justice.
28_4ecbplus.7: Mr. LaRue served as special assistant to John Mitchell, the former attorney general who later headed President Richard Nixon's re - election committee.
28_4ecbplus.8: Mr. LaRue was at a 1972 meeting with Mitchell and Nixon aide Jeb Stuart Magruder in Key Biscayne, where the plan to break into the Watergate complex allegedly was hatched.
28_4ecbplus.9: After his political career ended in scandal, Mr. LaRue returned to his home state of Mississippi to work in his family's business.
28_4ecbplus.10: Mr. LaRue discounted rumors that he was Deep Throat, saying the mysterious source for Washington Post reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein was not one person, but probably a combination of people.

40_9ecbplus.0: Apple Unveils New Flagship Macbook Pro
40_9ecbplus.2: Apple has unveiled its new flagship Next Generation Macbook Pro.
40_9ecbplus.3: Apple has unveiled its new flagship laptop: The Next Generation Macbook Pro.
40_9ecbplus.4: This new Macbook Pro boasts several upgrades of note, including a slimmer profile: at 0. 71 inches thick, it is the same thickness as a Macbook Air.
40_9ecbplus.5: Apple CEO Tim Cook claimed that "It's thinner than my finger" and will weigh just 4. 5 pounds.
40_9ecbplus.6: The aesthetics of the Next Generation Macbook Pro will remain the same: It will still have the same aluminum unibody case and backlit keyboard.
40_9ecbplus.7: The main differences of note are the internal components and the display.
40_9ecbplus.8: Either an i5 or i7 quad core Intel processor powers the Next Generation Macbook Pro.
40_9ecbplus.9: Coupled with Turbo Boost, the i7 will be able to reach speeds of up to 3. 7 GHz.
40_9ecbplus.10: This flagship model with run off 16GB of RAM, and will also have up to 768 GB of flash storage.
40_9ecbplus.11: For a graphics processor, the Next Generation Macbook Pro will have a 1GB Geforce GT 650M graphics card.
40_9ecbplus.12: All this hardware will be necessary to help support the shiny new display specs.
40_9ecbplus.13: Tim Cook announced that Apple's new laptop will have retina display, meaning that you won't be able to distinguish individual pixels from a typical viewing distance.
40_9ecbplus.14: In hard numbers, that means the screen with have a 2880x1800 resolution with 220 pixels per inch.
40_9ecbplus.15: The Next Generation Macbook Pro will also carry some standard ports, and a number upgraded ports.
40_9ecbplus.16: It will have two USB ports which will support both 3. 0 and 2. 0.
40_9ecbplus.17: It will also have two thunderbolt, an HDMI, an SD card reader, and a headphone jack.
40_9ecbplus.18: The new Pro does not include an Ethernet jack or Firewire 800 port, but Apple has introduced two adapters that offer thunderbolt to gigabit Ethernet and thunderbolt to Firewire 800 connections.
40_9ecbplus.19: So, the standard model will have a 15. 4" retina display, 2. 3 GHz i7, 8GB of RAM, 256 GB of flash storage, and a Geforce GT 650M.
40_9ecbplus.20: The final price tag for the Next Generation Macbook Pro?
40_9ecbplus.23: Apple is also upgrading the current Macbook Pro and Air models.
40_9ecbplus.24: Both laptops will receive new Ivy Bridge CPUs, but the price will not increase.
40_9ecbplus.25: The 11 - inch Air will cost from $999 up to $1099.
40_9ecbplus.26: The 13" Macbook Air will get a 1. 8 GHz i5 dual core processor and Intel HD graphics 4000, a nd the price remains at $1099 to $1499.
40_9ecbplus.27: The Macbook Pros are getting more upgrades.
40_9ecbplus.28: The 13" model will have the option for a 2. 9 GHz i7, 750 GB HDD, and up to 8 GB of RAM, priced at $1799.
40_9ecbplus.29: Lower - specced models will cost from $1199.
40_9ecbplus.30: Also of note, is that the the new Macbook Pros will support two USB 3. 0 ports.
40_9ecbplus.31: The 15" models with have either 2. 3 or 2. 6 GHz i7 quad cores.
40_9ecbplus.32: They will also have upgraded GPUs, a choice between either 516MB or 1GB GeForce GT 650M.
40_9ecbplus.33: These large models will be priced between $1799 and $2199, but for that price might as well hold out for the Next Generation Macbook Pro with the retina display.
40_9ecbplus.34: All of these new models are available immediately.

38_1ecbplus.0: 4. 6 magnitude quake recorded in Sonoma County
38_1ecbplus.2: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 4. 6 was recorded in the North Bay this morning, according to the U. S. Geological Survey.
38_1ecbplus.3: The quake occurred at 2: 09 a. m. about 14 miles north - northeast of Healdsburg and had a depth of 1. 2 miles.
38_1ecbplus.4: It was followed by a 2. 9 aftershock at 2: 12 a. m. and a 2. 2 at 2: 15 a. m. .
38_1ecbplus.5: There are no reports of injuries or major damage.

27_9ecbplus.0: Microsoft rushes urgent fix for Internet Explorer
27_9ecbplus.1: It ’ s not Patch Tuesday, but Microsoft has released a crucial update for Internet Explorer that you should apply immediately.
27_9ecbplus.2: Microsoft included a cumulative update for Internet Explorer in the 13 security bulletins that made up Patch Tuesday last week, and that update was considered Critical as well.
27_9ecbplus.3: Since then, though, a new flaw has been targeted by attacks in the wild, so Microsoft has responded with an out - of - band update.
27_9ecbplus.4: Apply the urgent Fix - It solution from Microsoft to protect Internet Explorer from exploits.
27_9ecbplus.5: The update from Microsoft is a Fix - It tool, which is more of a stop - gap bandage than an actual patch.
27_9ecbplus.6: Applying the Fix - It will protect Internet Explorer and prevent the currently circulating exploit from working on your systems.
27_9ecbplus.7: Paul Henry, security and forensic analyst with Lumension, says that there are number of mitigating factors that limit the potential scope of this threat, but those factors may offer little consolation for many users.
27_9ecbplus.8: “ The bad news is that this is a very wide - reaching patch, affecting all versions of IE across all operating systems, from XP to RT, " he says.
27_9ecbplus.9: "And more bad news: the average user is very susceptible to being hit with this. ”
27_9ecbplus.10: Microsoft claims that running Internet Explorer in Enhanced Security Configuration mode prevents this attack.
27_9ecbplus.11: Internet Explorer runs in this restricted mode by default on Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server 2012, and Windows Server 2012 R2.
27_9ecbplus.12: Microsoft states that all supported versions of Outlook, Outlook Express, and Windows Mail include protection by default as well.
27_9ecbplus.13: HTML email messages are opened by default in the Restricted Sites security zone, which disables scripts and ActiveX controls necessary for the exploit to execute.
27_9ecbplus.14: However, Microsoft cautions that the protection in Outlook only applies to the HTML message within Outlook itself.
27_9ecbplus.15: If a user receives an email with a link and clicks on it, they ’ re still potentially vulnerable because the threat is now Web - based and functioning outside of Outlook.
27_9ecbplus.16: “ The average user does not run the restricted sites mode, are not using the Enhanced Security Configuration and are all - too - willing to click on phishing emails, " Henry explains, "I recommend employing the mitigating factors, as well as advising users about this so they will be less likely to click malicious links until you can apply the patch.
27_9ecbplus.17: It ’ s been a while since we ’ ve seen an out - of - band patch for IE from Microsoft, but it ’ s still important to apply it as soon as possible. ”
27_9ecbplus.18: “ It's important to reiterate that ALL versions of IE are affected including the Internet Explorer 11 preview, Tyler Reguly, technical manager of security research and development for Tripwire, says.
27_9ecbplus.19: "Since attacks are occurring now, this is a situation where it's in everyone's best interest for Microsoft to release a patch as soon as possible.
27_9ecbplus.20: In the meantime, install the shim that they've released. ”
27_9ecbplus.21: He adds, “ For less technical users that aren't comfortable with Microsoft Fix it solutions, using another browser until a patch is available is the best option, ”
27_9ecbplus.22: A couple additional notes: The Fix - It solution only works with 32 - bit versions of Internet Explorer, and you must first apply the cumulative update for Internet Explorer from last week ’ s Patch Tuesday ( MS13 - 069 ).

24_10ecbplus.0: Paris thieves nab $2. 5 million worth of jewellery
24_10ecbplus.1: Robbers crash 4x4 into store, grabbing jewelry and watches, before setting car ablaze
24_10ecbplus.2: Four men rammed their car into an upmarket jewellery store in central Paris on Monday, smashing the shop window and making off with a two - million - euro ( $2. 6 - million ) booty, a police source said.
24_10ecbplus.3: The heist near the upscale Place Vendome is the latest to hit France after a spate of high - profile robberies in the southern resort of Cannes.
24_10ecbplus.4: The police source, who wished to remain anonymous, said the men drove a large four - by - four car into the store in the early hours of the morning and grabbed jewellery and luxury watches worth an estimated two million euros.
24_10ecbplus.5: They then set fire to the vehicle and escaped in another car.
24_10ecbplus.6: Forensic investigators are currently going through the site of the robbery at the Casty store on Rue de Castiglione in the central first district of Paris, which is home to numerous jewellery shops.
24_10ecbplus.7: At the end of July, an armed man carried out a brazen robbery in broad daylight at a diamond exhibition at the Carlton hotel in Cannes, making off with jewellery worth 103 million euros in one of the world's biggest ever heists.
24_10ecbplus.8: Paris has also been the scene of high - profile robberies.
24_10ecbplus.9: In December 2008, three men emptied almost all of the stock of gems from the Harry Winston jewellery store.
24_10ecbplus.10: In 2009, police said they had recovered 80 percent of the haul.

10_2ecbplus.0: Boston Red Sox majority owner John W. Henry, CEO Larry Lucchino and general manager Theo Epstein flew to Texas on Thursday night to meet with free agent Mark Teixeira and his agent, Scott Boras, in an effort to convince the switch - hitting first baseman to sign with Boston.
10_2ecbplus.1: The Red Sox have made an eight - year offer to Teixeira in excess of $160 million, but sources close to the negotiations say it is less than the $184 million reported by Boston WCVB sportscaster Mike Lynch, who first reported that the meeting would take place.
10_2ecbplus.2: The meeting will not result in a “ take it or leave it ” scenario by the Red Sox, a source said.
10_2ecbplus.3: However, Henry said earlier this week that the Red Sox will not satisfy Boras ’ request for a 10 - year deal, and it appears highly unlikely that Boston will go beyond eight years.
10_2ecbplus.4: The parties are meeting at an undisclosed location in Texas, the Red Sox having requested the face - to - face meeting with the player so he can hear directly from them why they believe he should spend the next eight years in Boston.
10_2ecbplus.5: The Los Angeles Angels, Baltimore Orioles and Washington Nationals also have made offers to Teixeira, but to date none of those offers are believed to be for more than eight years.
10_2ecbplus.6: Yankees general manager Brian Cashman also met with Teixeira earlier this month, but that was before the Yankees committed more than $240 million to sign pitchers CC Sabathia and A. J. Burnett, so it appears unlikely they would make a grab for Teixeira as well.
10_2ecbplus.7: Boras also represents free - agent catcher Jason Varitek, the Red Sox captain who declined an offer of salary arbitration from the team.
10_2ecbplus.8: Boston has not made another offer to Varitek since, though the sides continue to talk.
10_2ecbplus.9: A third Boras client, free - agent pitcher Derek Lowe, also is of interest to the Red Sox, but they have not made him an offer and are expected to do so only if he drops his price.
10_2ecbplus.10: Lowe is believed to be seeking a five - year deal in the $75 million range.
10_2ecbplus.11: Teixeira, who turns 29 on April 11, has averaged more than 30 home runs and 100 RBIs in his six big - league seasons, while posting a. 919 OPS and playing Gold Glove - caliber defense.
10_2ecbplus.12: The Red Sox envision him as a middle - of - the - lineup presence to offset last July ’ s departure of Manny Ramirez to the Dodgers.
10_2ecbplus.13: If Teixeira signs with the Red Sox, they would move All - Star Kevin Youkilis from first to third base while looking to trade third baseman Mike Lowell, the 2007 World Series MVP.

34_1ecbplus.3: President Obama Announces Nominee for Surgeon General
34_1ecbplus.4: Today, President Barack Obama announced his intent to nominate Regina M. Benjamin as Surgeon General, Department of Health and Human Services.
34_1ecbplus.5: President Obama said, "Health care reform is about every family's health and the health of our economy.
34_1ecbplus.6: And if there's anyone who understands the urgency of meeting this challenge in a personal and powerful way, it's the woman who will become our nation's next Surgeon General, Doctor Regina Benjamin.
34_1ecbplus.7: I look forward working with her in the months and years ahead. "
34_1ecbplus.8: President Obama announced his intent to nominate the following individual today:
34_1ecbplus.9: Regina M. Benjamin, Nominee for Surgeon General, Department of Health and Human Services
34_1ecbplus.10: Regina M. Benjamin, MD, MBA, is Founder and CEO of the Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic in Bayou La Batre, Alabama.
34_1ecbplus.11: She is the Immediate Past - Chair of the Federation of State Medical Boards of the United States, and previously served as Associate Dean for Rural Health at the University of South Alabama College of Medicine.
34_1ecbplus.12: In 2002, she became President of the Medical Association of the State of Alabama, making her the first African American woman to be president of a State Medical Society in the United States.
34_1ecbplus.13: Dr. Benjamin holds a BS in Chemistry from Xavier University, New Orleans.
34_1ecbplus.14: She was in the 2nd class at Morehouse School of Medicine and received her MD degree from the University of Alabama, Birmingham, as well as an MBA from Tulane University.
34_1ecbplus.15: She completed her residency in family medicine at the Medical Center of Central Georgia.
34_1ecbplus.16: Dr. Benjamin received the Nelson Mandela Award for Health and Human Rights in 1998, and was elected to the American Medical Association Board of Trustees in 1995, making her the first physician under age 40 and the first African - American woman to be elected.
34_1ecbplus.17: Dr. Benjamin was previously named by Time Magazine as one of the "Nation's 50 Future Leaders Age 40 and Under. "
34_1ecbplus.18: She was also featured in a New York Times article, "Angel in a White Coat", as "Person of the Week" on ABC's World News Tonight with Peter Jennings, and as "Woman of the Year" by CBS This Morning.
34_1ecbplus.19: She received the 2000 National Caring Award which was inspired by Mother Teresa, as well as the papal honor Pro Ecclesia et Pontifice from Pope Benedict XVI.
34_1ecbplus.20: She is also a recent recipient of the MacArthur Genius Award.

29_6ecbplus.0: COLTS BEAT CHIEFS 20 - 13 TO CLINCH PLAYOFF BERTH
29_6ecbplus.2: Andrew Luck couldn't help but smile thinking about the joyous celebration taking place just down the hall, through the big metal doors marking the entrance to the Colts' locker room.
29_6ecbplus.3: Even interim coach Bruce Arians had been dancing.
29_6ecbplus.4: "It's a fun locker room, a great locker room, " Luck said after leading Indianapolis to a 20 - 13 victory over Kansas City.
29_6ecbplus.5: "You know guys are going to play hard no matter what the score, no matter what the situation, and I am very proud to be a part of a team like that. "
29_6ecbplus.6: A team that's headed back to the playoffs, too.
29_6ecbplus.7: Luck threw for 205 yards on Sunday, breaking Cam Newton's single - season mark for yards by a first - year quarterback.
29_6ecbplus.8: He also engineered the go - ahead drive late in the fourth quarter, hitting Reggie Wayne on third - and - goal from the Kansas City 7 with just over 4 minutes remaining.
29_6ecbplus.9: The touchdown pass finished off Luck's seventh four - quarter comeback this season, and allowed the Colts ( 10 - 5 ) to join the Miami Dolphins of 2008 as the only teams in NFL history to win at least 10 games one year after losing 14 or more.
29_6ecbplus.10: "Would we have done it without him? " Arians asked.
29_6ecbplus.12: Luck broke Newton's record of 4, 051 yards passing in the second quarter, and then became the fifth rookie quarterback in the Super Bowl era to win at least 10 games in a season.
29_6ecbplus.13: "Obviously it's nicer to be in the playoffs, " Luck said, "but it's nice to have a couple records — which I'm sure will be broken in the next year. "
29_6ecbplus.15: Luck still has next Sunday's game against Houston to pile up numbers, and then comes a trip to the playoffs, where the Colts became a mainstay under his predecessor, Peyton Manning.
29_6ecbplus.16: "We didn't want to slide in the backdoor and put the extra stress on a man having to win the next game, " Luck said.
29_6ecbplus.17: "So we are very glad to be going to the postseason. "
29_6ecbplus.18: Arians will also get a reprieve from shouldering so much of the burden.
29_6ecbplus.19: Colts coach Chuck Pagano, who has undergoing treatment for leukemia, plans to rejoin the team this week.
29_6ecbplus.20: Jamaal Charles ran for 226 yards for the Chiefs, including an 84 - yard scamper on the first play of the second half as his team rallied to forge a 13 - all tie entering the fourth quarter.
29_6ecbplus.21: It was Charles' second 200 - yard game of the season, and the third of his career, and came one week after he managed 10 yards on nine carries against Oakland.
29_6ecbplus.22: "It was fun today, competing out there and doing it while we were trying to come back, " Charles said.
29_6ecbplus.23: "It was fun going out there and putting out a performance like that. "
29_6ecbplus.24: Charles joined the Titans' Chris Johnson and former Lions great Barry Sanders as the only players with three runs of 80 or more yards in a season.
29_6ecbplus.25: Peyton Hillis added 101 yards on the ground for the Chiefs ( 2 - 13 ), who finished with 352 yards rushing in a losing effort.
29_6ecbplus.26: A big reason why was Brady Quinn, who was just 10 of 22 for 162 yards with two interceptions through the air.
29_6ecbplus.27: "This game was without a doubt, 100 percent on my shoulders, " Quinn said.
29_6ecbplus.28: "You can't play the way I played today and win a football game. "
29_6ecbplus.29: His trouble began with the Chiefs' fifth offensive play, when he threw woefully behind Dexter McCluster — who wasn't even looking for the ball.
29_6ecbplus.30: Darius Butler picked off the pass in stride, and took it untouched 32 yards to give the Colts a 7 - 0 lead.
29_6ecbplus.31: Kansas City managed a field goal by Ryan Succop, but he missed his next try and the Colts went the other direction to set up the first of Adam Vinatieri's two field goals.
29_6ecbplus.32: Charles fumbled in the red zone later in the second quarter, and the Colts moved into Vinatieri's range for a 36 - yard field goal and a 13 - 3 halftime lead.
29_6ecbplus.33: Charles electrified a sparse crowd on the first play of the second half.
29_6ecbplus.34: He angled to the left and then found room down the sideline, cutting back toward the middle of the field and winning a foot - race with the Indianapolis defense for an 86 - yard touchdown run.
29_6ecbplus.35: The Chiefs were in position to take the lead later in the third quarter, but Quinn was picked off by Vontae Davis in the end zone.
29_6ecbplus.36: The defense forced a three - and - out and Kansas City was driving again before settling for Succop's tying 47 - yard field goal.
29_6ecbplus.37: The Chiefs got the ball back again late in the fourth quarter, but Quinn was stuffed on a quarterback sneak on fourth - and - inches from the Indianapolis 27.
29_6ecbplus.38: That turned the ball over to Luck, who completed an 11 - yard pass to T. Y. Hilton to convert a third down before he and Wayne won it.
29_6ecbplus.39: "At times it looked a little bleak, " Arians said.
29_6ecbplus.40: "Guys hung in there, made plays when they had to make them.
29_6ecbplus.41: Offensively we struggled, and then put together a drive, like we have all year. "
29_6ecbplus.42: NOTES: Chiefs WR Terrance Copper ( left knee ) and DT Tyson Jackson ( left foot ) left with injuries. .. .
29_6ecbplus.43: Wayne had five catches to become the fifth player in NFL history with four 100 - catch seasons.
29_6ecbplus.44: He also became the 14th player to reach 13, 000 yards receiving.

2_9ecbplus.0: Ellen DeGeneres to host Oscars in 2014
2_9ecbplus.1: This will be second time hosting for the daytime talkshow star who will follow on from Seth MacFarlane's savaged 2013 stint
2_9ecbplus.2: The comedian Ellen DeGeneres announced on Friday that she is to return as host of the Academy Awards, the second time she has been tasked with saving the Oscars a year after a poorly received performer.
2_9ecbplus.3: For the 2014 show, she follows a heavily criticised performance this year by the Family Guy creator Seth MacFarlane.
2_9ecbplus.4: In 2007, she put the Oscars back on an even keel after poor reviews for the satirist Jon Stewart in 2006.
2_9ecbplus.5: "I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time.
2_9ecbplus.6: You know what they say – the third time's the charm, " DeGeneres said in a statement.
