2_9ecbplus.7: She is a safe bet for the Academy, following an outraged reaction to the misogynistic jokes that peppered MacFarlane's script.
2_9ecbplus.8: While MacFarlane's performance generated high ratings for the broadcast – 40. 3 million people watched, 2% higher than the year before – he said he would not host the Oscars again because of the negative response.
2_9ecbplus.9: DeGeneres however, has a history of well - received hosting gigs.
2_9ecbplus.10: She was nominated for a Primetime Emmy for her performance as Oscars host in 2007.
2_9ecbplus.11: She also garnered positive responses as a two - time Emmy Awards host, carrying the ceremony shortly after 9 / 11 and then after Hurricane Katrina.
2_9ecbplus.12: Her previous Oscar gig, in which Martin Scorsese's The Departed took home the top prize, was watched by 39. 9 million people.
2_9ecbplus.13: DeGeneres made the announcement on Twitter on Friday and said: "It's official: I'm hosting the #Oscars!
2_9ecbplus.14: I'd like to thank @TheAcademy, my wife Portia and, oh dear, there goes the orchestra. "
2_9ecbplus.15: Academy Award producers Craig Zadan and Neil Meron said in a statement: "We are thrilled to have Ellen DeGeneres host the Oscars. "

14_6ecbplus.1: Fire at Waitrose supermarket may have been arson
14_6ecbplus.2: Police are continuing to investigate a fire at a Waitrose supermarket in Wellington.
14_6ecbplus.3: Staff are today turning away customers.
14_6ecbplus.4: Shoppers have been arriving at the supermarket unaware of the fire at the weekend.
14_6ecbplus.5: Police say it may have been arson.

28_11ecbplus.0: Fred LaRue, top Nixon aide, dies at 75
28_11ecbplus.2: Fred LaRue, a Richard Nixon White House aide and key player in the Watergate scandal, was found dead in his room at a Biloxi, Miss. , motel, it was reported Wednesday.
28_11ecbplus.3: LaRue was 75, the Biloxi Sun Herald reported Wednesday.
28_11ecbplus.4: He was found dead, reportedly of natural causes, in his room at the Sun Tan Motel Tuesday morning, officials said.
28_11ecbplus.5: LaRue returned to Mississippi to tend his family's real estate and oil interests after serving more than four years for his role in the Watergate scandal.
28_11ecbplus.6: Known as the "bagman, " he was arguably Nixon's most vital defender.
28_11ecbplus.7: Watching the PBS documentary looking back at Watergate last summer, LaRue called Magruder a "congenital liar" and insisted Nixon had no knowledge of the plans.
28_11ecbplus.8: LaRue was occasionally identified as "Deep Throat, " the shadowy character believed to have helped two Washington Post reporters crack a bevy of Nixon - era secrets, including the Watergate break - in.
28_11ecbplus.9: But he denied he or any one individual could have been such a figure.

36_3ecbplus.0: Warren Jeffs, Polygamist Leader, Convicted In Child Sexual Assault Case
36_3ecbplus.1: First Posted: 08 / 04 / 11 06: 44 PM ET Updated: 10 / 04 / 11 06: 12 AM ET
36_3ecbplus.2: A Texas jury convicted polygamist sect leader Warren Jeffs of child sexual assault Thursday in a case stemming from two young followers he took as brides in what his church calls "spiritual marriages. "
36_3ecbplus.3: The 55 - year - old head of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints stood stone - faced as the verdict was read.
36_3ecbplus.4: Jeffs, who acted as his own attorney, faces up to life in prison.
36_3ecbplus.5: The jury went immediately into sentencing proceedings.
36_3ecbplus.6: They had deliberated on a verdict for more than three hours.
36_3ecbplus.7: Prosecutors used DNA evidence to show Jeffs fathered a child with a 15 - year - old girl and played an audio recording of what they said was him sexually assaulting a 12 - year - old girl.
36_3ecbplus.8: They also played audio recordings in which Jeffs was heard instructing young women on how to please him sexually.
36_3ecbplus.9: Jeffs has claimed he was the victim of religious persecution.
36_3ecbplus.10: The FLDS, which has at least 10, 000 members nationwide, is a radical offshoot of mainstream Mormonism.
36_3ecbplus.11: The church believes polygamy brings exaltation in heaven and that Jeffs is God's spokesman on earth.
36_3ecbplus.12: Police had raided the group's remote West Texas ranch in April 2008, finding women dressed in frontier - style dresses and hairdos from the 19th century as well as seeing underage girls who were clearly pregnant.
36_3ecbplus.13: The call to an abuse hotline that spurred the raid turned out to be a hoax, and more than 400 children who had been placed in protective custody were eventually returned to their families.
36_3ecbplus.14: But authorities brought charges against several men from the group, with Jeffs by far the highest - profile defendant.
36_3ecbplus.15: Jeffs stood mute and expressionless, staring at the floor, for all but a few seconds of the half hour he was allotted for a closing argument on Thursday.
36_3ecbplus.16: At one point he mumbled, "I am peace, " and said no more.
36_3ecbplus.17: The only noise in the courtroom was the creaking of wooden benches brimming with spectators.
36_3ecbplus.18: Prosecutors said the case had nothing to do with his church or his beliefs.
36_3ecbplus.19: "You have heard the defendant make repeated arguments about religious freedoms, " said lead prosecutor Eric Nichols.
36_3ecbplus.20: "Make no mistake, this case is not about any people, this case is not about any religion.
36_3ecbplus.21: It is about one individual, Warren Steed Jeffs, and his actions. "
36_3ecbplus.22: Prosecutors relied heavily on information found during the raid on the compound and after a traffic stop in Nevada in 2006, when Jeffs was arrested.
36_3ecbplus.23: Much of the material was discovered in a vault at the end of a secret passageway in the temple and another vault in an annex building.
36_3ecbplus.24: "You might have asked yourselves, " Nichols said, "a lot of people may ask, why would someone record sex? .. .
36_3ecbplus.25: This individual considers himself to be the prophet.
36_3ecbplus.26: Everything he did, hour after hour, he was required to keep a record of that. "
36_3ecbplus.27: On one of the tapes played at the trial, Jeffs made a reference to "drawing close" or "being close, " which authorities testified is how church members refer to sex.
36_3ecbplus.29: "A good wife is trained for her husband and follows the spirit of peace, " Jeffs was heard saying.
36_3ecbplus.30: Another audio tape included Jeffs and the younger girl from a recording made in August 2006 at the Texas compound, according to testimony from Nick Hanna, a Texas Ranger involved in the 2008 raid.
36_3ecbplus.31: Played in court, it was difficult to decipher, but Jeffs' and a female voice are heard.
36_3ecbplus.32: He says, "I perform this service in the name of Jesus Christ, Amen, " then mentions the alleged victim by name.
36_3ecbplus.33: When she says something, he responds, "don't talk while praying. "
36_3ecbplus.34: Several minutes of heavy breathing followed.
36_3ecbplus.35: The jury wore headphones to better hear the recording and also followed a transcript.
36_3ecbplus.36: One female juror covered her face with her hand as she listened.
36_3ecbplus.37: Jeffs represented himself after firing seven attorneys in the six months leading to the trial.
36_3ecbplus.38: He broke his courtroom silence with an objection marked by a nearly hourlong speech defending polygamy, and twice threatened the judge and the court with warnings of punishment from God.
36_3ecbplus.39: He refused to cross - examine the state's witnesses, and delayed giving an opening statement until he began presenting his own defense.
36_3ecbplus.40: In that statement, he evoked images of the civil rights movement and mentioned former Mormon leader Joseph Smith Jr.
36_3ecbplus.41: He also asked the jury to remember constitutional guarantees of religious freedom.
36_3ecbplus.42: The lone defense witness Jeffs called, church elder JD Roundy, spent about 10 minutes on the stand Thursday discussing FLDS history after 4. 5 hours of testimony Wednesday evening.
36_3ecbplus.43: Jeffs failed three times to remove state District Judge Barbara Walther from the case, the last rejection coming even without a hearing.
36_3ecbplus.44: He claimed Walther was biased because she issued the warrant for the original raid and was frequently updated as it progressed.
36_3ecbplus.45: Eleven other FLDS men were charged with crimes including sexual assault and bigamy.
36_3ecbplus.46: All seven of those who have been prosecuted were convicted, receiving prison sentences of between six and 75 years.

43_5ecbplus.0: AMD Buys SeaMicro, Enters Server Hardware Business
43_5ecbplus.2: Advanced Micro Devices announced Wednesday it is buying low - power server vendor SeaMicro, a surprise move that puts AMD in the systems business and disrupts Intel by acquiring one of its close partners.
43_5ecbplus.3: AMD will pay US$334 million in cash and stock for SeaMicro, an 80 - employee Silicon Valley startup that has gained attention for building highly dense and power - efficient servers for use in large - scale cloud computing environments.
43_5ecbplus.4: SeaMicro CEO Andrew Feldman will become general manager of a new division at AMD, the Data Center Server Solutions group.
43_5ecbplus.5: AMD plans to sell SeaMicro - branded servers directly to customers, but it bought the company primarily for its technology, which it hopes to license to other server vendors to build their own low - power systems, AMD officials said.
43_5ecbplus.6: "SeaMicro has a proven technology that has been benchmarked in key customer sites to show improvements in power consumption and total cost of ownership.
43_5ecbplus.7: That [ intellectual property ] was very attractive to us, " said Lisa Su, senior vice president and general manager for AMD's products division.
43_5ecbplus.8: The move will be seen as a setback to Intel, which had built a tight partnership with SeaMicro.
43_5ecbplus.9: All the servers SeaMicro currently sells are based on low - power Intel Atom processors, and just a few weeks ago the companies held a joint press conference where Intel sang SeaMicro's praises.
43_5ecbplus.10: An Intel spokesman declined to comment on the acquisition Wednesday before it was officially announced.
43_5ecbplus.11: AMD will continue to sell SeaMicro servers based on Intel processors "for the foreseeable future, " Lu said.
43_5ecbplus.12: By the end of this year, she said, it will release the first SeaMicro servers based on AMD Opteron processors.
43_5ecbplus.13: Feldman wouldn't say when SeaMicro and AMD began talks but said the deal came about "unbelievably quickly. "
43_5ecbplus.14: He said there were other suitors for the company, including non - chip vendors.
43_5ecbplus.15: SeaMicro developed an interconnect technology that allows it to eliminate all but three of the chips on a standard server motherboard.
43_5ecbplus.16: That allowed it to develop servers that it claims consume one quarter the power and one sixth the space of standard x86 servers.
43_5ecbplus.17: Its products are geared primarily towards high volume, Web - based transaction workloads that don't require the computing muscle of a traditional Xeon or Opteron server processor.
43_5ecbplus.18: Mozilla uses SeaMicro servers, for instance, to deliver software updates to users.
43_5ecbplus.19: It's not clear which AMD processor SeaMicro will use as an alternative to Intel's Atom chip, though AMD has several low - power offerings and plans to release a new, low - power chip for tablets, code named Hondo, later this year.
43_5ecbplus.20: However, SeaMicro has said its technology can also benefit servers based on more powerful processors.
43_5ecbplus.21: A server based on an Opteron chip would be efficient for running MySQL and MondoDB database workloads, Feldman said, as well as PHP applications used by many online services.
43_5ecbplus.22: It could also be used to build efficient supercomputers, he said.
43_5ecbplus.23: It's a new direction for AMD, one it hopes will allow it to expand its server business and capitalize on the fast - growing cloud computing market.
43_5ecbplus.24: Spending on servers for such "scale out data centers" is expected to grow 33 percent a year on average for the next several years, AMD said, faster than the server market as a whole.
43_5ecbplus.25: The move puts AMD in the difficult position of competing with some of its customers, though Lu insisted that will not be a problem.
43_5ecbplus.26: The scale of SeaMicro's business today is much smaller than that of a Hewlett - Packard or a Dell, she said, and AMD thinks the value of SeaMicro's technology to server vendors will outweigh their competitive concerns.
43_5ecbplus.27: AMD's server business could use a lift, noted Dean McCarron, principal analyst at Mercury Research.
43_5ecbplus.28: "They are obviously experiencing a decline and this would be a way to expand the market for their processors, " he said.
43_5ecbplus.29: AMD is paying $281 million in cash for SeaMicro and the remainder in stock, Lu said.
43_5ecbplus.30: It expects to close the deal in March.

25_11ecbplus.0: Saints' Pierre Thomas placed on IR
25_11ecbplus.2: The defending champion Saints will have try to repeat without their top two power running backs.
25_11ecbplus.3: Pierre Thomas, one of the stars of last season's Super Bowl run, was placed on injured reserve on Wednesday because of his injured ankle.
25_11ecbplus.4: The Saints made that move only one day after placing leading rusher Chris Ivory on injured reserve because of a left foot injury that occurred during Sunday's regular season finale.
25_11ecbplus.5: "That's tough, " quarterback Drew Brees said of the loss of both running backs this week.
25_11ecbplus.6: "You can't deny that just because of the physical presence they bring and obviously their productivity. "
25_11ecbplus.7: When the Saints ( 11 - 5 ) open the playoffs in Seattle ( 7 - 9 ) on Saturday, the only remaining healthy running backs from their regular season roster will be Reggie Bush and Julius Jones.
25_11ecbplus.8: "Naturally, I'm going to have to step up, " Bush said.
25_11ecbplus.9: Bush missed eight games with a fracture in his lower right leg.
25_11ecbplus.10: He has rushed for only 150 yards and has not scored a rushing touchdown this season, but started to look stronger on Sunday against Tampa Bay, when he had 70 yards rushing on just nine carries and had 55 yards receiving on five catches.
25_11ecbplus.11: Jones has 193 yards and no touchdowns on the ground.
25_11ecbplus.12: The only other running backs on the roster are fourth - year pro DeShawn Wynn, who was signed on Tuesday but also was with the Saints during the preseason, and rookie Joique Bell, who was signed Wednesday from the Philadelphia Eagles' practice squad.
25_11ecbplus.13: Brees said he remained optimistic that the versatility of the Saints' offense and the way they spread the ball among so many players will allow them to weather such injuries perhaps better than most teams.
25_11ecbplus.14: "In the end, you just work to the strengths of the guys that you have.
25_11ecbplus.15: You don't worry about what you don't have, just what you have, " Brees said.
25_11ecbplus.16: "While you would love to have all of the guys and all of the elements that they bring, I feel like Reggie Bush can do some pretty special stuff and Julius Jones can do some pretty special stuff.
25_11ecbplus.17: Deshawn Wynn, when called upon, can do the job.
25_11ecbplus.18: You realize that the passing game may have to pick up some slack at times depending on how the game plan changes by having those guys in. "
25_11ecbplus.19: Bush, who returned from his broken right fibula on Thanksgiving, said he has been feeling stronger lately and is looking forward to the chance to be the primary running back.
25_11ecbplus.20: However, he stressed that the success of the offense would hinge on many more factors than him.
25_11ecbplus.22: It's not just about one person, " Bush said.
25_11ecbplus.23: "We have some mistakes that we made as a team throughout the season on offense, defense and special teams that we've got to clean up.
25_11ecbplus.24: The running back position is just one small piece of the puzzle. "
25_11ecbplus.25: Yet as the playoffs approached, the Saints had been optimistic their offense would be better with Thomas, who scored memorable touchdowns in both the NFC title game and Super Bowl last season.
25_11ecbplus.26: Plagued by a left ankle injury that limited him to only six games this season, Thomas started to look effective again in a 17 - 14 victory at Atlanta in Week 16, when he had 102 yards from scrimmage and a touchdown.
25_11ecbplus.27: However, he aggravated the injury in practice last week and sat out the regular season finale.
25_11ecbplus.28: "The setback he had was substantial and we're at that point in the season where you want to do what's best, and yet you want to be mindful of the injury the player has, " Saints coach Sean Payton said.
25_11ecbplus.29: "So I think on all fronts - - doctors, trainers, the player and ourselves - - we felt that this was the best move. "
25_11ecbplus.30: Thomas initially was hurt in an overtime loss to Atlanta in Week 3, then missed nine games before coming back for three late - season games.
25_11ecbplus.31: He finished with 269 yards and two touchdown rushing and caught 29 passes for 201 yards.
25_11ecbplus.32: Late this season, Thomas also had handled kickoff returns after Courtney Roby was placed on injured reserve with a head injury.
25_11ecbplus.33: Payton said receivers Devery Henderson and Robert Meachem are getting most of the practice time in that area this week.
25_11ecbplus.34: Ivory's injury is a Lisfranc, which is a fracture and dislocation in the mid - foot, and will require surgery, Payton said.
25_11ecbplus.35: After joining the Saints as an undrafted rookie out of Division II Tiffin, he rushed for 716 yards in 12 games and had a team - leading five rushing TDs.

37_11ecbplus.0: 6. 1 - magnitude quake strikes Indonesia's Aceh: USGS
37_11ecbplus.1: A powerful 6. 1 - magnitude earthquake struck the Indonesian province of Aceh with no tsunami warning issued
37_11ecbplus.3: A strong 6. 1 - magnitude earthquake struck the northwestern Indonesian province of Aceh on Tuesday, the US Geological Survey said, sending people running into the streets in panic.
37_11ecbplus.4: There were no immediate reports of damage after the quake struck inland at a depth of just 10 kilometres ( 6. 2 miles ), 55 kilometres south of Bireun and 72 kilometres southeast of Reuleuet, said the USGS.
37_11ecbplus.5: People ran out of buildings in panic in the provincial capital Banda Aceh as the quake shook houses for around one minute, an AFP journalist at the scene said.
37_11ecbplus.6: But the USGS estimated there was a low likelihood of casualties or damage.
37_11ecbplus.7: A massive quake struck off Aceh in 2004, sparking a tsunami that killed 170, 000 people in the province on Sumatra and tens of thousands more in countries around the Indian Ocean.
37_11ecbplus.8: Indonesia sits on the Pacific "Ring of Fire" where continental plates collide, causing frequent seismic and volcanic activity.

18_3ecbplus.0: Troy, Michigan Office Shooting Follow - Up - 1 Dead, 2 Injured, and Suspect Caught
18_3ecbplus.2: "A man suspected of shooting three people, killing one, at an accounting firm where was fired last week was arrested after a high - speed chase a few hours after the Monday morning attack, authorities said.
18_3ecbplus.3: Police said they had located Anthony LaCalamita, 38, on Interstate 75, north of the suburban Detroit office building where the shootings took place.
18_3ecbplus.4: Sheriff's deputies and state police chased him for 30 miles, including through a construction zone, at speeds up to 120 mph before he finally pulled over after about 15 minutes, Genesee County Sheriff Robert J. Pickell said.
18_3ecbplus.5: 'He probably realized if he didn't, he was going to be shot, ' Undersheriff James Gage said.
18_3ecbplus.6: LaCalamita said nothing after officers surrounded him, Pickell said, describing the suspect as 'subdued.
18_3ecbplus.8: Officers found a 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three live shells in the vehicle, Pickell said.
18_3ecbplus.9: Witnesses said the shooter used a shotgun or a rifle, Troy police Lt. Gerry Scherlinck said. " ( Fox News article )
18_3ecbplus.10: The suspect was finally apprehended after a high - speed chase on Interstate 75.
18_3ecbplus.11: He was finally stopped near the Saginaw County and Bay County border.
18_3ecbplus.12: Evidence found in the vehicle points to having apprehended the correct suspect.
18_3ecbplus.13: "Officers found a gun in the vehicle matching the description of the one used in the shootings, Troy police Lt. Gerry Scherlinck said.
18_3ecbplus.14: Some witnesses told police that when the shooter walked into the office on the building's second floor around 10 a. m. Monday, he looked as if he was trying to hide something, Troy Police Chief Charles Craft said.
18_3ecbplus.15: Police couldn't say how many shots were fired.
18_3ecbplus.16: 'I'm not positive all three of the people were targeted, but there appeared to be some purpose, ' Craft said.
18_3ecbplus.17: The families of the two wounded men requested 'total privacy, ' and the hospital would not release any details about their conditions, Beaumont Hospital spokeswoman Ilene Wolfe said.
18_3ecbplus.18: She said the third victim died on the way to the hospital.
18_3ecbplus.19: LaCalamita was listed among the professional staff on the website of Gordon Advisors, a public accounting and business consulting firm in the building.
18_3ecbplus.20: Calls to Gordon Advisors were not answered Monday afternoon, and a recording said the offices were closed. " ( USA Today article )
18_3ecbplus.21: Local evening news in Michigan originally reported that two of the three victims died.
18_3ecbplus.22: The subsequent car chase tied up traffic on the I - 75 corridor in Flint, Saginaw, and Bay City, Michigan for quite some time.

32_9ecbplus.0: TRIAL DATE SET FOR MAN ACCUSED OF DOUBLE MURDER IN MILLOM
32_9ecbplus.2: A trial date's been set for a Millom man accused of murdering his mother and sister.
32_9ecbplus.3: John Jenkin was due to appear via video link at Preston Crown Court today but didn't because he's currently considered too much of a danger to himself and others.
32_9ecbplus.4: The case continued in his absence and a three day trial hearing was penciled in for October - the 23 - year old's due to enter his plea in September.
32_9ecbplus.5: The bodies of Alice McMeekin and Katie Jenkin were found at their Newton Street home in Millom on Saturday morning.
32_9ecbplus.7: John Jenkin also faces an animal cruelty charge after the family's dog was also found beaten to death.

19_2ecbplus.1: Riots Erupt Following Death of Brooklyn Teen Killed By Police
19_2ecbplus.2: In the week following the fatal shooting of 16 - year - old Kimani Gray, several protests and riots have erupted in the teen's Brooklyn neighborhood as the cops involved have come under scrutiny for previous reported civil rights violations.
19_2ecbplus.3: Gray was killed on March 9 by police who claim he pointed a gun at Sgt. Mourad Mourad and Officer Jovaniel Cordova before they opened fire.
19_2ecbplus.4: An autopsy shows that Gray was hit in the back by three of the seven bullets fired by the officers.
19_2ecbplus.5: A loaded. 38 - caliber revolver was found at the scene.
19_2ecbplus.6: Since the shooting, over 50 arrests have been made over four nights of protesting where community members are expressing outrage and demanding justice.
19_2ecbplus.7: Gray's school principal, Matthew Willoughby of the Urban Assembly School of Design and Construction, wrote a heartfelt letter describing the teen as a hard - working student who was committed to his academics.
19_2ecbplus.8: "Kimani made great strides this year academically, ” the letter read.
19_2ecbplus.9: “ He was taking an extra English class after school; he was writing a dramatic dialogue in another English class; his group in design class was working on a project to design a school.
19_2ecbplus.10: Now they are working to complete the project without him. "
19_2ecbplus.11: "Kimani should be remembered for all of who he was—an energetic, kind, playful, independent young man who was trying to learn and grow one day at a time, " Willoughby's letter continued.
19_2ecbplus.12: In the days following Gray's death, it's been revealed that both Mourad and Cordova have reportedly been named in five federal lawsuits with plaintiffs alleging civil rights violations.
19_2ecbplus.13: As a result, the two men have reportedly cost the city about $215, 000 in court settlements.
19_2ecbplus.14: In 2009 and 2010, Mourad was sued three times with allegations including a stop - and - frisk in which Mourad and fellow cops pulled down a suspect's underwear, and an illegal arrest in which the plaintiff says he was slammed into a car.
19_2ecbplus.15: Cordova was sued in 2011 and 2012, with one plaintiff claiming the cop punched him in the eye.

32_4ecbplus.1: John Jenkin accused of Millom mother and sister murder
32_4ecbplus.2: A man has been remanded in custody after being charged with the murder of his mother and sister in Cumbria.
32_4ecbplus.3: The bodies of Alice McMeekin, 58, and Kathryn Jenkin, 20, were found at a terraced house in Newton Street, Millom, on Saturday.
32_4ecbplus.5: The family dog had also been killed.
32_4ecbplus.6: John Jenkin, 23, was remanded in his absence by Barrow magistrates, after the court heard he was deemed a risk to himself and potentially to others.
32_4ecbplus.7: No pleas were entered and a bail hearing was scheduled for Wednesday at Preston Crown Court.
32_4ecbplus.9: Mr Jenkin, of Newton Street, Millom, who arrested an hour after the bodies were discovered in a distressed state, has also been charged with animal cruelty.
32_4ecbplus.10: Friends of Kathryn Jenkin, known as Katie, have described her as a "bright and much - liked student. "
32_4ecbplus.11: Miss Jenkin was a student at the University of South Wales in Cardiff.
32_4ecbplus.12: Gill Sandford, dean of the Faculty of Creative and Cultural Industries, said: "The university's staff and students are extremely sad to hear of the untimely death of Katie Jenkin.
32_4ecbplus.13: "She was a bright, much - liked and promising student and our thoughts are with her family.
32_4ecbplus.14: "As a close community we will come together to support our colleagues and students at this difficult time. "

27_10ecbplus.1: Microsoft Launches Emergency Patch for Internet Explorer
27_10ecbplus.2: Microsoft has just released a new security update for Internet Explorer in order to patch a flaw affecting all versions of the company ’ s in - house browser, including IE11 on Windows 8. 1 RTM.
27_10ecbplus.3: While Microsoft claims that it has received reports of attacks aimed at Internet Explorer 8 and 9, it appears that the security flaw affects all the other versions of the browser.
27_10ecbplus.4: According to the company, the issue would allow remote code execution, which means that an attacker could get access to an unpatched system by directing users to a compromised website.
27_10ecbplus.5: “ This issue could allow remote code execution if an affected system browses to a website containing malicious content directed towards the specific browser type.
27_10ecbplus.6: This would typically occur when an attacker compromises the security of trusted websites regularly frequented, or convinces someone to click on a link in an email or instant message, ” the company explained.
27_10ecbplus.7: The Fix It tool released by Microsoft can be used for IE6, 7, 8, 9, 10, and 11 on Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8, and 8. 1, both Preview and RTM. 32 - and 64 - bit versions of the operating systems are all included in the security advisory.
27_10ecbplus.8: In addition, the tech giant recommends users to set Internet and local intranet security zone settings to “ High ” in order to block ActiveX Controls and Active Scripting in these zones.
27_10ecbplus.9: “ This will help prevent exploitation but may affect usability; therefore, trusted sites should be added to the Internet Explorer Trusted Sites zone to minimize disruption, ” Microsoft said.
27_10ecbplus.10: At the same time, the Softies suggest that it would be a good idea to configure Internet Explorer to prompt before running Active Scripting or to disable Active Scripting completely in the Internet and local intranet security zones, just to be sure that everyone is on the safe side and no successful attacks are possible.

13_7ecbplus.0: Overnight Fire Destroys Historic Matanuska Maid Building
13_7ecbplus.2: Story Created: Aug 7, 2012 at 9: 56 AM AKDT
13_7ecbplus.3: ALASKA - Shortly after 3: 30 Tuesday morning someone called 911 to and reported a fire at the Matanuska Maid building in downtown Palmer.
13_7ecbplus.4: Palmer Fire & Rescue, along with the Mat - Su Central Fire Department, responded.
13_7ecbplus.5: Palmer Fire & Rescue Chief John McNutt saw flames emerging from under the building's eaves when he arrived, and soon the entire roof was engulfed in flames.
13_7ecbplus.6: A total of 31 fire apparatus arrived to fight the fire, and it was extinguished by 6: 40 a. m. The building is a total loss according to the City of Palmer.
13_7ecbplus.7: The state's Fire Marshal's office is assisting in the investigation of the cause of the fire, and anyone with knowledge of the fire is asked to call Palmer Police Sergeant Shayne La Croix at 907 - 745 - 4811.

3_1ecbplus.0: Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr, Prison Inmate, Pulls Gun On And Handcuffs Guards, Runs Away
3_1ecbplus.2: A convicted sex offender sentenced to life in prison pulled a gun on two guards during a prison transfer Monday and held them hostage temporarily before fleeing on foot in one of the guard's uniforms, authorities said.
3_1ecbplus.3: At the time of the escape, the inmate was in a wheelchair, which he claimed he needed to help move him around, officials said.
3_1ecbplus.4: Comeaux, 49, took the officers' weapons and handcuffed them together in the back of the vehicle before fleeing on foot at around 9 a. m. , Lyons said.
3_1ecbplus.5: He was serving a life sentence after being convicted in June 1998 of aggravated sexual assault out of Brazos County, located northwest of Houston.
3_1ecbplus.6: Comeaux was given two extra life sentences after being convicted for stabbing his wife and another person in 1999 while she visited him in prison.
3_1ecbplus.8: Comeaux also injured a man who was visiting another inmate at the time and tried to stop the attack.
3_1ecbplus.9: The escape triggered a lockdown at Lee College and three campuses in the Goose Creek school district, in and around Baytown.

45_11ecbplus.0: Jury Convicts Spiro Man In Shooting Death Of Pregnant Girlfriend
45_11ecbplus.3: A jury in eastern Oklahoma has convicted a Spiro man of two counts of first - degree murder in the 2012 shooting death of his pregnant girlfriend.
45_11ecbplus.4: The jury deliberated almost seven hours Thursday before convicting 27 - year - old Christopher Kenyon Simpson in the death of 20 - year - old Ka'loni Flynn of Fort Smith, Ark.
45_11ecbplus.5: The Southwest Times Record reports that the jury recommended the maximum sentence of life in prison without parole.
45_11ecbplus.6: Formal sentencing is set for 11 a. m. on Nov. 8.
45_11ecbplus.7: Prosecutors allege that Simpson shot Flynn twice in the head because he did not want another child to support.
45_11ecbplus.8: A DNA expert testified that Simpson fathered the fetus.
45_11ecbplus.9: Simpson's attorney, Warren Gotcher, argued that no witnesses could place Simpson at the shooting scene and that his client was innocent.

22_12ecbplus.0: Kraft Shooting: Yvonne Hiller Charged With Two Counts Of Murder
22_12ecbplus.2: A Kraft Foods plant worker who had been suspended for feuding with colleagues, then escorted from the building, returned minutes later with a handgun, found her foes in a break room and executed two of them with a single bullet each and critically wounded a third, police said Friday.
22_12ecbplus.3: Yvonne Hiller, 43, had gotten into an argument Thursday evening with her co - workers at the northeast Philadelphia plant, police said.
22_12ecbplus.4: After she was disciplined, she went to her vehicle, made several phone calls, and then grabbed a. 357 Magnum and used it to force her way past security guards at the front gate.
22_12ecbplus.5: About 100 people were at work at the plant, which makes Nabisco cookies and crackers.
22_12ecbplus.6: Hiller walked to the third - floor mixing area and found four people in the break room.
22_12ecbplus.7: She had no quarrels with one woman and told her to leave.
22_12ecbplus.8: She then opened fire on the others, Philadelphia Homicide Capt. James Clark said.
22_12ecbplus.9: "She believed they were spraying chemicals at her, saying things behind her back, " Clark said.
22_12ecbplus.10: After leaving the break room, Hiller went down a hallway and fired shots at the supervisor who had suspended her and at a mechanic who was using a walkie - talkie to alert police and co - workers to her whereabouts, police said.
22_12ecbplus.12: Hiller finally went to a second - floor office and called police to tell them what she had done, authorities said.
22_12ecbplus.13: Seven other workers were hiding in a closet nearby.
22_12ecbplus.14: Cpl. Janice Leader, a 911 dispatcher, told reporters Friday that Hiller called 911, saying "I'm the one you're looking for" and reporting that she had been harassed at work.
22_12ecbplus.15: Keeping her on the line, Leader said she told Hiller to put the gun down and place her hands on her head so officers wouldn't take any aggressive action against her.
22_12ecbplus.16: When tactical police who had entered the plant found her, Hiller was in a fetal position on the floor, the gun beside her.
22_12ecbplus.17: Police called the mechanic a hero who "did a phenomenal job" in alerting employees to evacuate the building and directing officers to where Hiller was.
22_12ecbplus.18: "By following the suspect at great peril to himself – and we can see that by the fact that he was shot at and almost hit – he reduced our tactical problem quite dramatically, " Chief Inspector Joe Sullivan said.
22_12ecbplus.19: Police identified the victims as Tanya Renee Wilson, 47; LaTonya Sharon Brown, 36; and Bryant A. Dalton, 39, all of Philadelphia.
22_12ecbplus.20: Wilson and Brown died at the plant.
22_12ecbplus.21: Dalton, shot in the neck, remained in intensive care Friday at Jefferson University Hospital, police said.
22_12ecbplus.22: The plant will remain closed indefinitely, Kraft said.
22_12ecbplus.23: "We suspended the employee when she became agitated and used profanity.
22_12ecbplus.24: We wanted the opportunity to investigate the situation, " Kraft said in a statement Friday.
22_12ecbplus.25: Hiller was charged with two counts of murder, one count of attempted murder, aggravated assault and other charges.
22_12ecbplus.26: She had a permit to carry the gun, authorities said.
22_12ecbplus.27: Hiller has worked for Kraft for about 15 years, and had been in repeated arguments there in the past several years, a few of them physical, Clark said.
22_12ecbplus.28: Yet a next - door neighbor described Hiller as a quiet woman who kept to herself but said she was polite and exchanged pleasantries when they saw each other.
22_12ecbplus.29: Catherine Hillgen, who has lived on the tidy middle - class city block for about 45 years, said Hiller moved in several years ago with her son but recently has been living alone.
22_12ecbplus.30: She initially dismissed a neighbor's report Thursday that Hiller might be involved in a fatal workplace shooting, but then heard her named on the news Friday.
22_12ecbplus.31: "It was a complete shock, " Hillgen said.
22_12ecbplus.33: Kraft, based in Northfield, Ill. , also makes Oreo cookies, Philadelphia cream cheese, Oscar Mayer bacon and other products.
22_12ecbplus.34: Mass shootings are rarely carried out by women, said Dr. Park Dietz, president of Threat Assessment Group Inc. , a Newport Beach, Calif. - based violence prevention firm.
22_12ecbplus.35: Earlier this year, Amy Bishop, a former instructor and researcher at the University of Alabama's Huntsville campus, was charged with murder in a campus shooting spree that left three biology professors dead and three other employees wounded.
22_12ecbplus.37: Thursday's shooting came just weeks after a driver who had been accused of stealing from a Manchester, Conn. , beer distributorship fatally shot eight people, then himself.
22_12ecbplus.38: The driver, who was black, had seethed with a sense of racial injustice in his job, said his girlfriend.
22_12ecbplus.39: But the beer distributor's president said there was no record to support claims of "racial insensitivity. "

39_4ecbplus.0: Peter Capaldi exclusively revealed to the nation as the Twelfth Doctor
39_4ecbplus.2: Amid much hype and speculation, Peter Capaldi was unveiled as the next Doctor during a special live television event on BBC ONE tonight.
39_4ecbplus.3: Widely regarded as one of the biggest roles in British television, Capaldi will be the Twelfth Doctor and takes over from Matt Smith who leaves the show at Christmas.
39_4ecbplus.4: Peter Capaldi says: "Being asked to play the Doctor is an amazing privilege.
39_4ecbplus.5: Like the Doctor himself I find myself in a state of utter terror and delight.
39_4ecbplus.6: I can't wait to get started. "
39_4ecbplus.7: Steven Moffat, lead writer and executive producer says: "It's an incendiary combination: one of the most talented actors of his generation is about to play the best part on television.
39_4ecbplus.8: Peter Capaldi is in the TARDIS! "
39_4ecbplus.9: Doctor Who companion, Jenna Coleman says: "I'm so excited Peter Capaldi is the man taking on the challenge of becoming the Twelfth Doctor.
39_4ecbplus.10: With Steven's writing and his talent I know we'll be making an amazing show with an incredible incarnation of number 12.
39_4ecbplus.11: I can't wait to start this new adventure! "
39_4ecbplus.12: Charlotte Moore, Controller BBC One says: "Peter Capaldi has all the genius and versatility needed to take on the mantel of the great Time Lord and make the role his own.
39_4ecbplus.13: He'll bring his own particular wisdom, charisma and wit to the Twelfth Doctor and take the show into an exciting new era. "
39_4ecbplus.14: Ben Stephenson, Controller, BBC Drama Commissioning says: "We started thinking Peter Capaldi might be the right person to take on this iconic part a few months ago.
39_4ecbplus.15: But it was only when he did a secret audition at Steven's house under the cover of darkness that we knew we had our man.
39_4ecbplus.16: He's an extraordinarily talented actor who can seemingly turn his hand to anything.
39_4ecbplus.17: We can't wait to premiere his unique take on the Doctor on Christmas Day and we are sure he's going to become one of the all - time classic Doctors. "
39_4ecbplus.18: Doctor Who is produced by BBC Cymru Wales.

43_2ecbplus.0: AMD to Acquire SeaMicro: Accelerates Disruptive Server Strategy
43_2ecbplus.1: SeaMicro Low - Power, High - Bandwidth Microserver Solutions Set the Stage for AMD ’ s Disruptive Approach To Lead Fast - Growing Cloud Data Center Market
43_2ecbplus.3: AMD ( NYSE: AMD ) today announced it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire SeaMicro, a pioneer in energy - efficient, high - bandwidth microservers, for approximately $334 million, of which approximately $281 million will be paid in cash.
43_2ecbplus.4: Through the acquisition of SeaMicro, AMD will be accelerating its strategy to deliver disruptive server technology to its OEM customers serving cloud - centric data centers.
43_2ecbplus.5: With SeaMicro ’ s fabric technology and system - level design capabilities, AMD will be uniquely positioned to offer industry - leading server building blocks tuned for the fastest - growing workloads such as dynamic web content, social networking, search and video.
43_2ecbplus.6: AMD ’ s server technology combined with SeaMicro technology provides customers with a range of processor choices and platforms that can help significantly reduce data center complexity, cost and energy consumption while improving performance.
43_2ecbplus.7: AMD plans to offer the first AMD Opteron™ processor - based solutions that combine AMD and SeaMicro technology in the second half of 2012.
43_2ecbplus.8: The company remains firmly committed to its traditional server business, and will continue to focus and invest in this area.
43_2ecbplus.9: “ By acquiring SeaMicro, we are accelerating AMD ’ s transformation into an agile, disruptive innovator capable of staking a data center leadership position, ” said Rory Read, president and CEO, AMD.
43_2ecbplus.10: “ SeaMicro is a pioneer in low - power server technology.
43_2ecbplus.11: The unmatched combination of AMD ’ s processing capabilities, SeaMicro ’ s system and fabric technology, and our ambidextrous technology approach uniquely positions AMD with a compelling, differentiated position to attack the fastest growing segment of the server market. ”
43_2ecbplus.12: SeaMicro technologies offer substantial advantages in large data center and cloud environments.
43_2ecbplus.13: Cloud data centers are projected to be the fastest growing segment of the server market through 2015, according to IDC1.
43_2ecbplus.14: Current systems featuring SeaMicro technology typically use one quarter the power and take one sixth the space of traditional servers with the same compute performance, yet deliver up to 12 times the bandwidth per core2.
43_2ecbplus.15: Foremost among SeaMicro ’ s innovations is their supercompute fabric, which connects thousands of processor cores, memory, storage and input / output traffic.
43_2ecbplus.16: SeaMicro ’ s fabric supports multiple processor instruction sets.
43_2ecbplus.17: SeaMicro solutions are currently deployed in multiple sites across the world.
43_2ecbplus.18: AMD will continue to support all current SeaMicro customers while accelerating plans to deliver new platforms that combine AMD and SeaMicro technology and enable AMD ’ s OEM partners to bring differentiated solutions to market.
43_2ecbplus.19: “ Cloud computing has brought a sea change to the data center - - dramatically altering the economics of compute by changing the workload and optimal characteristics of a server, ” said Andrew Feldman, SeaMicro CEO, who will become general manager of AMD ’ s newly created Data Center Server Solutions business.
43_2ecbplus.20: “ SeaMicro was founded to dramatically reduce the power consumed by servers, while increasing compute density and bandwidth.
43_2ecbplus.21: By becoming a part of AMD, we will have access to new markets, resources, technology, and scale that will provide us with the opportunity to work tightly with our OEM partners as we fundamentally change the server market. ”
43_2ecbplus.22: The acquisition does not change AMD ’ s 2012 financial guidance and the transaction is expected to be accretive to earnings after 2012.
43_2ecbplus.23: AMD will fund the cash portion of the acquisition with existing cash reserves.
43_2ecbplus.25: AMD will hold a conference call for the financial community at 4: 45 p. m. EST today to discuss today ’ s announcement.
43_2ecbplus.26: AMD will provide a real - time audio broadcast of the teleconference on the Investor Relations page of its Web site at www. AMD. com.
43_2ecbplus.27: The webcast will be available for 10 days after the conference call.

43_13ecbplus.0: AMD acquires SeaMicro to grab share of microserver market
43_13ecbplus.1: AMD's $334 million deal with SeaMicro is a strong move to improve within the …
43_13ecbplus.3: AMD has made a $334 million bet on the energy - efficient "microserver" market.
43_13ecbplus.4: On Wednesday afternoon, the company announced that they have reached a $334 million agreement, to purchase SeaMicro, a successful microserver manufacturer.
43_13ecbplus.5: Launched in 2007, SeaMicro quickly gained attention for their ability to combine cheap, low - end processors that could handle Web - centric server workloads.
43_13ecbplus.6: The company worked closely, if not exclusively, with Intel processors in recent years.
43_13ecbplus.7: SeaMicro's current SM server line uses Intel's Atom and "Sandy Bridge" processors.
43_13ecbplus.8: “ By acquiring SeaMicro, we are accelerating AMD ’ s transformation into an agile, disruptive innovator capable of staking a data center leadership position, ” said Rory Read, AMD's president and CEO, in today's news release.
43_13ecbplus.9: For now, AMD will continue to sell SeaMicro servers based on Intel Atom processors according to PC World.
43_13ecbplus.10: However, AMD expects to release the first SeaMicro servers based on AMD Opteron processors within the year.

1_19ecbplus.0: Lindsay Lohan Checks Into Betty Ford Clinic, Rehires Attorney Shawn Holley
1_19ecbplus.2: The 26 - year troubled starlet narrowly avoided jail time by checking into a second rehab center following her quick exit from Morningside Recovery in Newport Beach, Calif. on Thursday, May 2.
1_19ecbplus.3: Santa Monica Chief Deputy City Attorney Terry White confirmed to the The Associated Press that Lohan has checked into an approved rehab facility.
1_19ecbplus.4: A source tells The Associated Press that the Liz & Dick star is now receiving treatment at the Betty Ford Center in Rancho Mirage, Calif. where she has spent time before.
1_19ecbplus.5: Lohan caused a stir on Thursday after she checked out of Morningside Recovery after only a few minutes, risking jail time with a probation violation.
1_19ecbplus.6: Now that Lohan is back at Betty Ford Center, she has also decided to rehire her former attorney Shawn Holley, who had been at her side during many of her courtroom appearances.
1_19ecbplus.7: During Lohan's stay at the famed Betty Ford Center in 2010, Lohan was accused of attacking a female staffer, but she was not charged.

44_15ecbplus.0: Hewlett - Packard to buy consulting firm EYP Mission Critical Facilities news
44_15ecbplus.2: Technology products and services company Hewlett - Packard said on Monday 12 November that it has agreed to buy data centre consulting company EYP Mission Critical Facilities for an undisclosed sum.
44_15ecbplus.3: The New York - based EYP specialises in technology planning, design and operations support for large data centres.
44_15ecbplus.4: It has about 350 employees with offices in the US and the UK.
44_15ecbplus.5: Its customers are in the financial services, telecommunications, technology, broadcast, manufacturing and health care sectors, as well as the government.
44_15ecbplus.6: HP said the acquisition will boost its ability to help clients improve their data centres and build new computing environments.
44_15ecbplus.7: The deal is expected to close in January 2008.

18_8ecbplus.0: Fired Accountant Goes on Shooting Spree
18_8ecbplus.2: A fired accountant bought a shotgun the day after he lost his job, then returned to the office the following week and opened fire on his bosses, wounding both and killing a receptionist, the Associated Press reported.
18_8ecbplus.3: Troy, Mich. police said Anthony LaCalamita III, 38, targeted two managers and also may have intended to shoot another one.
18_8ecbplus.4: "There is a suspicion that there might have been a third upper management official he was seeking, " said Troy police Lt. Gerry Scherlinck.
18_8ecbplus.5: The man, whom police did not identify, was not in the office at the time of the attack.
18_8ecbplus.6: LaCalamita had been fired last Thursday as a general accountant at the firm and bought a shotgun and shells on Friday, Scherlinck said.
18_8ecbplus.7: He said police found a box consistent with one that would hold a shotgun, as well as empty shell boxes, in a Dumpster outside LaCalamita's apartment Monday evening.
18_8ecbplus.8: When LaCalamita was arrested, police said they found a 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three shells in his vehicle.
18_8ecbplus.9: Scherlinck said LaCalamita had been denied a handgun permit in March but it wasn't clear why.
18_8ecbplus.10: Anthony LaCalamita III, 38, had been arrested following a high - speed chase shortly after the Monday morning shootings at Gordon Advisors in suburban Detroit.
18_8ecbplus.11: During LaCalamita's arraignment, authorities described what witnesses saw inside the accounting firm's offices that morning.
18_8ecbplus.12: LaCalamita walked in around 10 a. m. , stopped briefly at the reception desk, then entered Alan Steinberg's office with the shotgun, Troy police Sgt. Barry Whiteside testified.
18_8ecbplus.13: Steinberg, a partner in the firm, later told police LaCalamita loaded a shell into the shotgun's chamber and fired at him, hitting him in the hip area.
18_8ecbplus.14: He then walked toward the office of Paul Riva, another partner.
18_8ecbplus.15: Receptionist Madeline Kafoury was standing in the doorway of Riva's office, and the gunman fatally shot her in the midsection, Whiteside said.
18_8ecbplus.16: LaCalamita shot Riva in the upper chest, then left the building, Whiteside said.
18_8ecbplus.17: He was gone when officers swarmed the office building and began evacuating other workers, then was arrested a few hours later after a chase on a nearby interstate.
18_8ecbplus.18: Riva had yet to regain consciousness Wednesday and was on a ventilator, police said.
18_8ecbplus.19: LaCalamita is charged with first - degree murder in the death of Kafoury, 63, and intent to murder in the shootings of Riva, 47, and Steinberg, 48.
18_8ecbplus.20: He also is charged with possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony and fleeing and eluding police.
18_8ecbplus.21: A not guilty plea was entered on LaCalamita's behalf during the hearing.
18_8ecbplus.22: Asked by the judge if he understood the charges against him and if he was aware that he could be sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole if convicted of first - degree murder, he responded "Yes. "
18_8ecbplus.23: The judge ordered him held without bail pending his next court hearing April 19.
18_8ecbplus.24: The judge said he would appoint a lawyer for LaCalamita.
18_8ecbplus.25: He did not have a representative in court Wednesday.
18_8ecbplus.26: LaCalamita is married, but his wife, Michele, released a statement saying they had been separated for about three weeks.
18_8ecbplus.27: According to real estate records obtained by The Associated Press, the couple during the past year actively bought and sold suburban homes.
18_8ecbplus.28: Records list Michele LaCalamita as the owner of all four.
18_8ecbplus.29: Riva and Steinberg were being treated at Beaumont Hospital, where spokeswoman Ilene Wolff said the families of the wounded men asked that their conditions and other information not be released.

5_10ecbplus.0: Sixers Hire Maurice Cheeks as Head Coach
5_10ecbplus.1: Maurice Cheeks was officially introduced as the 21st head coach of the 76ers.
5_10ecbplus.2: Cheeks, who played for the Sixers for 11 seasons and served as an assistant coach for seven, was named coach after Jim O'Brien was relieved of his coaching duties.

22_4ecbplus.0: ‘ Very Spiritual ’ Muslim Woman Shoots Co - workers
22_4ecbplus.2: According to reports, a Muslim woman named Yvonne Hiller shot and killed two co - workers at a Kraft plant in Philadelphia.

12_3ecbplus.0: Indian Navy foils attack in Gulf of Aden, nabs 26 pirates
12_3ecbplus.2: Indian Navy patrolling the Gulf of Aden yesterday thwarted a multi - boat attack by sea brigands on merchant vessels, apprehending 26 Somali pirates and confiscating arms and ammunition, in the fifth successful anti - piracy operation since September.
12_3ecbplus.3: At about 9: 25 Thursday morning, navy personnel aboard warship INS Sukanya spotted a group of five suspicious boats speedily approaching the merchant vessels of her group.
12_3ecbplus.4: "The warship immediately altered ( its direction ) towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them.
12_3ecbplus.5: On seeing the resolve evident in the warship's action and probably mindful of the reputation for resolute action that the Indian Navy justly enjoys in such deployments, the pirate skiffs reversed course and tried to flee the area, " Captain Manohar Nambiar, Chief Public Relations Officer, Defence, said.
12_3ecbplus.6: While two of them managed to escape, INS Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three boats and, in a well - practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action, nabbed 26 Somali pirates with six AK 47 rifles, 12 magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition.
12_3ecbplus.7: This is the fifth successful anti - piracy operation conducted by INS Sukanya in the course of her ongoing patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden that commenced in September, the navy said.
12_3ecbplus.8: Warship Sukanya, currently deployed on anti - piracy patrols in the Gulf of Aden under the operational control of the Western Naval Command, was escorting a group of five merchant vessels through the Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor when the incident happened.
12_3ecbplus.9: The timely operation by INS Sukanya resulted, once again, in foiling the pirates' attempt to attack merchant vessels transiting the busy sea lane through which over nearly 100 billion USD worth India's external trade passes each year, Nambiar said.
12_3ecbplus.10: In their five operations so far, the personnel on board the warship have confiscated 14 AK - 47 Rifles, 31 magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition, he said.
12_3ecbplus.11: Indian Navy is part of the international effort to ensure the safety and freedom of seaborne trade in this high - risk stronghold of modern - day piracy.

35_8ecbplus.0: Chargers Jamal Williams arrested for DUI
35_8ecbplus.1: In the steeped NFL tradition of drinking and driving, Chargers NT Jamal Williams is doing his part to uphold the tradition.
35_8ecbplus.2: Of course, football is the ultimate team game and fellow Charger Vincent Jackson was arrested last month for DUI as well.
35_8ecbplus.3: Although results are pending for the blood - alcohol test that Williams took, he has been booked and later released on bail.
35_8ecbplus.4: While I make fun of a topic that definitely isn't funny, I still don't understand how these players with their multi - million dollar salaries don't hire drivers or car services.

31_3ecbplus.0: Creighton's Doug McDermott returns for senior season
31_3ecbplus.1: Doug McDermott ’ s teammates figured it was just another day in the gym Wednesday afternoon.
31_3ecbplus.2: They were playing pick - up games with a guy they didn ’ t know for sure would be around next season.
31_3ecbplus.4: Shortly before hitting the court, McDermott had told his father, Creighton coach Greg McDermott, that he intended to return for his senior season rather than declare for the NBA draft.
31_3ecbplus.5: Father and son then informed Creighton Athletic Director Bruce Rasmussen.
31_3ecbplus.6: Doug called his mom to break the news to her, then stepped into the gym to play a little ball.
31_3ecbplus.7: “ He wasn ’ t acting any different, ” Grant Gibbs said.
31_3ecbplus.9: Later that night, McDermott let the news slip to a couple of them.
31_3ecbplus.10: “ I had to go to class today, knowing that he was going to announce it, and try to be super low - key, ” Jahenns Manigat said.
31_3ecbplus.11: “ But I couldn ’ t stop smiling. ”
31_3ecbplus.12: It ’ s safe to assume Bluejay Nation had much the same reaction when, shortly before 2 p. m. , McDermott sent out the following message on Twitter:
31_3ecbplus.13: “ I will be returning to Creighton for my senior year and can ’ t wait to put on that uniform for one more season. ”
31_3ecbplus.14: McDermott ’ s return for his senior season will allow a fan base that has come to marvel at his on - court accomplishments the past three seasons one more chance to watch him.
31_3ecbplus.15: College basketball insiders see his return possibly giving Creighton more of a fighting chance as it moves into the new Big East.
31_3ecbplus.16: For McDermott, it will give him a chance to make more of an orderly transition from college basketball to professional basketball.
31_3ecbplus.17: He knows he ’ s taking a risk from a financial standpoint.
31_3ecbplus.18: “ That ’ s definitely a lot of money I ’ m passing down, but that money could be there next year, ” McDermott told reporters Thursday.
31_3ecbplus.19: “ It might not be quite as much, but you really can ’ t put a price tag on a senior year. ”
31_3ecbplus.20: That was the same theme that McDermott touched on repeatedly Wednesday night in an exclusive interview with The World - Herald.
31_3ecbplus.21: In the final analysis, McDermott ’ s heart won out over the cash.
31_3ecbplus.22: “ My heart has been telling me all along to stay, but my mind tried to take over a couple of times, ” McDermott said.
31_3ecbplus.23: “ I just ended up trusting myself that I was making the right decision. ”
31_3ecbplus.24: His mind, of course, focused on the financial benefits that might be his had he decided to turn professional.
31_3ecbplus.25: Based on evaluations he received from the NBA Draft Advisory Committee, McDermott said, “ There was no doubt in my mind that I would have been a first - round pick. ”
31_3ecbplus.26: That would have meant a two - year, guaranteed contract that could have been worth between a minimum of $888, 600 to $1. 4 million if he had been selected with one of the last 15 picks in the lower half of the first round.
31_3ecbplus.27: That initially had his father recommending that his son turn pro.
31_3ecbplus.28: “ He knew my dream is to play in the NBA, and he just felt that this was too good of an opportunity to pass up, ” Doug said.
31_3ecbplus.29: “ But the way I look at it, if I can play in the NBA, I can play there the next year just as well as I can next year.
31_3ecbplus.30: “ I feel there are things I can work on.
31_3ecbplus.31: I feel I can still improve my draft stock by playing in the Big East.
31_3ecbplus.32: There are a lot of areas that I can get better at, and I just felt I ’ d be more comfortable doing it here in Omaha. ”
31_3ecbplus.33: McDermott had heard more than once from outsiders that he should turn pro because he had nothing left to prove as a collegian.
31_3ecbplus.34: The 6 - foot - 8, 225 - pound forward has been a consensus first - team All - American in each of the past two seasons.
31_3ecbplus.35: He broke Creighton ’ s career scoring record near the end of the last season.
31_3ecbplus.36: That argument might have swayed some players, but if there is anything McDermott has shown the past three seasons it ’ s that he ’ s an unconventional superstar.
31_3ecbplus.37: He remains as unassuming as the day he stepped on campus in June 2010.
31_3ecbplus.38: He embraces the attention from an adoring fan base that some players might find stifling.
31_3ecbplus.39: It ’ s that fan base, McDermott said, that figured prominently into his decision.
31_3ecbplus.40: “ I care so much about Creighton, ” he said.
31_3ecbplus.41: “ There are a lot of people around here that believed in me.
31_3ecbplus.42: This whole fan base has been with me from the start.
31_3ecbplus.43: I felt like I owed them one more year. ”
31_3ecbplus.44: McDermott said the opportunity to play in the new conference became more of a factor as he got deeper into the decision - making process.
31_3ecbplus.45: He admitted had Creighton remained in the Missouri Valley it might have made it easier to turn pro.
31_3ecbplus.46: But the opportunity to play in the Big East, and perhaps prove a few people wrong, was too much to pass up.
31_3ecbplus.47: “ I feel there are a lot of people that don ’ t believe we can be successful in the Big East, ” McDermott said.
31_3ecbplus.48: “ If you ask anyone on our team, we feel that we ’ re going to be capable of doing some damage there.
31_3ecbplus.49: “ That played into my decision a lot.
31_3ecbplus.50: I care for the guys in this program and I care for the coaches.
31_3ecbplus.51: I wanted to do what I could to help make this transition a successful one. ”
31_3ecbplus.52: What didn ’ t factor into his decision, he said, was the fear that he would be leaving his dad in a tight spot had he bolted for the NBA.
31_3ecbplus.53: As Greg McDermott said Thursday, his son ’ s 23 points and eight rebounds a game will come in handy next season.
31_3ecbplus.54: But Doug said his father and Creighton would have been fine had he decided to leave.
31_3ecbplus.55: “ He never pushed for me to stay, ” Doug said.
31_3ecbplus.56: In an interview with The World - Herald on Tuesday, McDermott indicated he might remain undecided until Sunday ’ s deadline to declare for the draft.
31_3ecbplus.57: The agony of the decision - making process was apparent as he spoke.
31_3ecbplus.59: In discussing his decision Wednesday night, McDermott said he never intended to take so long in making up his mind.
31_3ecbplus.60: “ I apologize for putting people through that, ” he said.
31_3ecbplus.61: In trying to make up his mind, McDermott said, he put his emotions to a test.
31_3ecbplus.62: He would go through one day with the idea in mind that he was headed for the NBA.
31_3ecbplus.63: The next day, he would approach things as if he would be returning to Creighton.
31_3ecbplus.64: “ I wanted to see how I felt, ” McDermott said.
31_3ecbplus.65: “ I found myself waking up the next day feeling a whole lot better when I was thinking about coming back.
31_3ecbplus.66: But I went back and forth more times than you can imagine. ”
31_3ecbplus.67: He said Tuesday that he had talked with former Creighton All - American Kyle Korver, now in his 10th season in the NBA.
31_3ecbplus.68: McDermott also sought the counsel of Harrison Barnes, his former teammate at Ames High School who now is wrapping up his rookie season with the Golden State Warriors.
31_3ecbplus.69: “ He and I talked before the NCAA tournament, and he told me I should go to the NBA if I felt I was 100 percent ready, ” McDermott said.
31_3ecbplus.71: “ Harrison told me that playing in the NBA is a completely different world.
31_3ecbplus.72: The money is nice, but you ’ re out there fighting for your job every night.
31_3ecbplus.73: It ’ s not like college, where you ’ re playing for the love of the game and for the fans. ”
31_3ecbplus.74: In the end, those factors appealed more to McDermott than money.
31_3ecbplus.75: “ I believe I ’ m going to play in the NBA, but I have to do it when I feel I ’ m 100 percent ready, ” he said.
31_3ecbplus.76: “ I feel like I have some unfinished business here at Creighton.
31_3ecbplus.77: I feel like I can be a lot better, and why not do it here where I can have fun for another year.
31_3ecbplus.79: I feel like a ton of weight has been lifted off my shoulders.
31_3ecbplus.80: I can ’ t put into words how happy I am this is behind me and how excited I am to be coming back.

36_6ecbplus.0: Warren Jeffs convicted of child sexual assault charges
36_6ecbplus.2: A Texas jury convicted polygamist sect leader Warren Jeffs of child sexual assault Thursday in a case stemming from two young followers he took as brides in what his church calls "spiritual marriages. "
36_6ecbplus.3: The 55 - year - old head of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints stood stone - faced as the verdict was read.
36_6ecbplus.4: Jeffs, who acted as his own attorney, faces up to life in prison.
36_6ecbplus.5: The jury went immediately into sentencing proceedings.
36_6ecbplus.6: They had deliberated on a verdict for more than three hours.
36_6ecbplus.7: Police had raided the group's remote West Texas ranch in April 2008, finding women dressed in frontier - style dresses and hairdos from the 19th century as well as seeing underage girls who were clearly pregnant.
36_6ecbplus.8: The call to an abuse hotline that spurred the raid turned out to be a hoax, and more than 400 children who had been placed in protective custody were eventually returned to their families.
36_6ecbplus.9: But authorities brought charges against several men from the group, with Jeffs by far the highest - profile defendant.
36_6ecbplus.10: Prosecutors used DNA evidence to show Jeffs fathered a child with a 15 - year - old girl and played an audio recording of what they said was him sexually assaulting a 12 - year - old girl.
36_6ecbplus.11: They also played audio recordings in which Jeffs was heard instructing young women on how to please him sexually.
36_6ecbplus.12: Jeffs has claimed he was the victim of religious persecution.
36_6ecbplus.13: The FLDS, which has at least 10, 000 members nationwide, is a radical offshoot of mainstream Mormonism.
36_6ecbplus.14: The church believes polygamy brings exaltation in heaven and that Jeffs is God's spokesman on earth.
36_6ecbplus.15: Jeffs stood mute and expressionless, staring at the floor, for all but a few seconds of the half hour he was allotted for a closing argument on Thursday.
36_6ecbplus.16: At one point he mumbled, "I am peace, " and said no more.
36_6ecbplus.17: The only noise in the courtroom was the creaking of wooden benches brimming with spectators.
36_6ecbplus.18: Prosecutors said the case had nothing to do with his church or his beliefs.
36_6ecbplus.19: "You have heard the defendant make repeated arguments about religious freedoms, " said lead prosecutor Eric Nichols.
36_6ecbplus.20: "Make no mistake, this case is not about any people, this case is not about any religion.
36_6ecbplus.21: It is about one individual, Warren Steed Jeffs, and his actions. "
36_6ecbplus.22: Prosecutors relied heavily on information found during the raid on the compound and after a traffic stop in Nevada in 2006, when Jeffs was arrested.
36_6ecbplus.23: Much of the material was discovered in a vault at the end of a secret passageway in the temple and another vault in an annex building.
36_6ecbplus.24: "You might have asked yourselves, " Nichols said, "a lot of people may ask, why would someone record sex? .. .
36_6ecbplus.25: This individual considers himself to be the prophet.
36_6ecbplus.26: Everything he did, hour after hour, he was required to keep a record of that. "
36_6ecbplus.27: On one of the tapes played at the trial, Jeffs made a reference to "drawing close" or "being close, " which authorities testified is how church members refer to sex.
36_6ecbplus.29: "A good wife is trained for her husband and follows the spirit of peace, " Jeffs was heard saying.
36_6ecbplus.30: Another audio tape included Jeffs and the younger girl from a recording made in August 2006 at the Texas compound, according to testimony from Nick Hanna, a Texas Ranger involved in the 2008 raid.
36_6ecbplus.31: Played in court, it was difficult to decipher, but Jeffs' and a female voice are heard.
36_6ecbplus.32: He says, "I perform this service in the name of Jesus Christ, Amen, " then mentions the alleged victim by name.
36_6ecbplus.33: When she says something, he responds, "don't talk while praying. "
36_6ecbplus.34: Several minutes of heavy breathing followed.
36_6ecbplus.35: The jury wore headphones to better hear the recording and also followed a transcript.
36_6ecbplus.36: One female juror covered her face with her hand as she listened.
36_6ecbplus.37: Jeffs represented himself after firing seven attorneys in the six months leading to the trial.
36_6ecbplus.38: He broke his courtroom silence with an objection marked by a nearly hourlong speech defending polygamy, and twice threatened the judge and the court with warnings of punishment from God.
36_6ecbplus.39: He refused to cross - examine the state's witnesses, and delayed giving an opening statement until he began presenting his own defence.
36_6ecbplus.40: In that statement, he evoked images of the civil rights movement and mentioned former Mormon leader Joseph Smith Jr.
36_6ecbplus.41: He also asked the jury to remember constitutional guarantees of religious freedom.
36_6ecbplus.42: The lone defence witness Jeffs called, church elder JD Roundy, spent about 10 minutes on the stand Thursday discussing FLDS history after 4 1 / 2 hours of testimony Wednesday evening.
36_6ecbplus.43: Jeffs failed three times to remove state District Judge Barbara Walther from the case, the last rejection coming even without a hearing.
36_6ecbplus.44: He claimed Walther was biased because she issued the warrant for the original raid and was frequently updated as it progressed.
36_6ecbplus.45: Eleven other FLDS men were charged with crimes including sexual assault and bigamy.
36_6ecbplus.46: All seven of those who have been prosecuted were convicted, receiving prison sentences of between six and 75 years.

39_10ecbplus.0: Peter Capaldi to replace Matt Smith on 'Doctor Who'
39_10ecbplus.2: Peter Capaldi is to be the new star of Doctor Who.
39_10ecbplus.3: The Thick of It actor will play the 12th Doctor, replacing Matt Smith on BBC One's hit sci - fi drama.
39_10ecbplus.4: Capaldi was unveiled on tonight's ( August 4 ) special show Doctor Who Live: The Next Doctor on BBC One and gave his first interview since taking the role with host Zoe Ball.
39_10ecbplus.5: He had been widely tipped to take the role for days, with bookmakers suspending betting yesterday after making him the odds - on favourite.
39_10ecbplus.6: He will take over from Smith in this year's Christmas special ahead of his first full series as the Time Lord in 2014.
39_10ecbplus.7: Jenna Coleman, who plays current companion Clara, will join Capaldi for the show's eighth series since returning to screens in 2005.
39_10ecbplus.8: Capaldi - a long - time fan of the show - revealed that he discovered that he had been cast as the 12th Doctor while filming in Prague for the BBC's upcoming adaptation of The Three Musketeers.
39_10ecbplus.9: In a statement, the 55 - year - old said: "Being asked to play The Doctor is an amazing privilege.
39_10ecbplus.10: Like the Doctor himself I find myself in a state of utter terror and delight.
39_10ecbplus.11: I can't wait to get started. "
39_10ecbplus.12: Executive producer Steven Moffat added: "It's an incendiary combination: one of the most talented actors of his generation is about to play the best part on television.
39_10ecbplus.13: Peter Capaldi is in the TARDIS! "
39_10ecbplus.14: Jenna Coleman revealed that she is "so excited" to welcome Peter Capaldi as the 12th incarnation of the Doctor, adding: "With Steven's writing and his talent I know we'll be making an amazing show with an incredible incarnation of number 12.
39_10ecbplus.15: "I can't wait to start this new adventure! "
39_10ecbplus.16: Ben Stephenson, controller of BBC Drama commissioning, said: "We started thinking Peter Capaldi might be the right person to take on this iconic part a few months ago.
39_10ecbplus.17: "But it was only when he did a secret audition at Steven's house under the cover of darkness that we knew we had our man.
39_10ecbplus.18: He's an extraordinarily talented actor who can seemingly turn his hand to anything.
39_10ecbplus.19: "We can't wait to premiere his unique take on the Doctor on Christmas Day and we are sure he's going to become one of the all - time classic Doctors. "
39_10ecbplus.20: Doctor Who returns to screens on November 23 for its 50th anniversary special starring Matt Smith, David Tennant and John Hurt.

30_4ecbplus.2: Reports on Tuesday morning indicated that a fiber optic cable in the northern part of Egypt had been damaged, resulting in the loss of all telecommunications in Egypt's second largest city of Alexandria and parts of the Nile Delta region.
30_4ecbplus.3: ITNewsAfrica that "a Telecom Egypt fiber line near Alexandria has been damaged resulting in loss of telecommunications for all three mobile operators. "
30_4ecbplus.4: The official, however, did not give details as to why the cable was damaged and it remains unclear whether it was an attack or a miscue on the operator's part.
30_4ecbplus.5: Telecom Egypt, the country's state - owned fixed line monopoly is responsible for all ADSL Internet connections and the three mobile operators in Egypt their infrastructure for connectivity.
30_4ecbplus.6: Egypt is not unfamiliar to telecom cuts.
30_4ecbplus.7: In recent years, the country has lost Internet service after Mediterranean cables were cut, leaving the country largely blacked out for days.
30_4ecbplus.8: The official, who was not authorized to speak to the media, did say that they were attempting to rectify the problem "as soon as we understand exactly what happened. "
30_4ecbplus.9: Users across the country reported immediate drops in speed and connectivity.
30_4ecbplus.10: At local cafes in Cairo, users immediately saw a difference in connection speed.
30_4ecbplus.11: "I hope they get this sorted out quickly, because I have to upload things daily and this cut is affecting how I work, " said an Egyptian blogger and journalist, who added that the "Internet is my life.
30_4ecbplus.12: If it goes down, it really hurts my ability to work. "

16_1ecbplus.1: Charged with Murdering Sheriff ’ s Deputy
16_1ecbplus.3: District Attorney Steve Cooley announced today that capital murder charges were filed against a Hawaiian Gardens gang member accused of gunning down Deputy Luis Gerardo ( Jerry ) Ortiz a month ago.
16_1ecbplus.4: Cooley said Jose Luis Orozco was charged with murdering the 35 - year - old deputy on June 24 outside a Hawaiian Gardens apartment.
16_1ecbplus.5: The complaint alleged three special circumstances that would make Orozco eligible for the death penalty: murder of a peace officer during performance of his duties, lying in wait and murder to avoid arrest.
16_1ecbplus.6: “ Deputy Ortiz was killed while investigating a shooting in which the defendant was a suspect, ” Cooley said at a news conference at the Bellflower courthouse.
16_1ecbplus.7: “ He was shot in the head and left dying on the ground while his killer ran away and tried to hide.
16_1ecbplus.8: “ Law enforcement officers like Deputy Ortiz are the last line of defense between criminals and the law - abiding citizens they protect.
16_1ecbplus.9: When one is killed, all of us lose.
16_1ecbplus.10: We will not let their killers go unpunished, ” the District Attorney said.
16_1ecbplus.11: Orozco, 27, was found hiding in a house a few doors away from the shooting some hours after Deputy Ortiz was slain.
16_1ecbplus.12: He was arrested and remained in custody on a parole hold.
16_1ecbplus.13: “ The defendant ’ s custody status gave Sheriff ’ s detectives and our prosecutors in the Crimes Against Police Officers Section ( CAPOS ) additional time to fully investigate this murder and the case on which Deputy Ortiz was working when he was killed, ” Cooley said.
16_1ecbplus.14: “ Having time to do the fullest investigation possible results in a stronger criminal case. ”
16_1ecbplus.15: Orozco is scheduled to appear in Bellflower Superior Court ’ s Division 3 at 1: 45 p. m. today for arraignment.
16_1ecbplus.16: The defendant, who lives in Hawaiian Gardens and also is known by the street moniker of Sepe, is charged in case No. VA089897 filed this morning by Deputy District Attorney Lowell Anger of CAPOS.
16_1ecbplus.17: Although filed as a capital case, the District Attorney ’ s office will decide closer to trial whether to seek the death penalty or life in prison without the possibility of parole.
16_1ecbplus.18: Orozco is charged with one count of murder of a peace officer with the special circumstances of murder of a peace officer during performance of his duties, lying in wait and murder to avoid arrest.
16_1ecbplus.19: It was alleged the defendant personally used a handgun to commit the crime.
16_1ecbplus.20: The complaint also alleged two counts of possession of a firearm by a felon for the June 24 murder of Ortiz and on June 20, when a man was shot and wounded in Hawaiian Gardens.
16_1ecbplus.21: It was that shooting that Deputy Ortiz was investigating when he was killed.
16_1ecbplus.22: Deputy Ortiz was shot to death outside an apartment in the 12000 block of East 223rd Street.
16_1ecbplus.23: The deputy was with the Sheriff ’ s gang enforcement unit and was investigating the June 20 shooting.
16_1ecbplus.24: Authorities said he spotted Orozco shortly after 3 p. m. and chased him to the apartment.
16_1ecbplus.25: The killer was hiding behind the apartment ’ s front door.
16_1ecbplus.26: The defendant was arrested five buildings away on 223rd Street shortly before midnight.
16_1ecbplus.27: A. 38 - caliber revolver believed to be the murder weapon was recovered.
16_1ecbplus.28: Orozco also was charged with one count of attempted willful, deliberate, premeditated murder in connection with the June 20 shooting.
16_1ecbplus.29: The victim was shot while doing yard work at a home in the 22000 block of Joliet Avenue.
16_1ecbplus.30: He was hit in the back, but survived.
16_1ecbplus.31: The complaint charged that the June 20 shooting was for furtherance of a street gang.
16_1ecbplus.32: The complaint also alleged prior convictions including auto burglary, possession of a firearm by a felon and resisting and executive officer.
16_1ecbplus.33: Orozco will be held without bail.
16_1ecbplus.34: Joining Cooley at the news conference was Assistant Sheriff Doyle Campbell.

13_6ecbplus.0: Matanuska Maid Dairy Building Burns Down
13_6ecbplus.2: The old Matanuska Maid dairy building in Palmer was nearly destroyed by a fire early Tuesday morning, according to Palmer officials.
13_6ecbplus.3: John Owen, the city's public safety director, says dispatchers got a call shortly after 3: 30 a. m. Tuesday that the vacated building was on fire.
13_6ecbplus.4: Crews arrived to find flames completely engulfing the structure.
13_6ecbplus.5: Crews from both Palmer Fire and the Mat - Su Central Fire Department responded to the blaze, using at least two ladder trucks as well as "a number" of other apparatus.
13_6ecbplus.6: The fire was extinguished by 7 a. m. , after fire crews attacked it from all sides.
13_6ecbplus.7: Owen says the building will likely be a total loss.
13_6ecbplus.8: No one was believed to be inside the building, and the fire marshal had been called to investigate.

20_1ecbplus.1: Ten dead in southern Iran quake
20_1ecbplus.2: A powerful earthquake has hit southern Iran, killing at least 10 people, injuring dozens more and damaging several villages, officials say.
20_1ecbplus.3: The 6. 1 - magnitude quake struck Qeshm island, home to 120, 000 people, and the city of Bandar Abbas, state media said.
20_1ecbplus.4: On Qeshm island, between half and two - thirds of homes in five villages had been damaged, officials said.
20_1ecbplus.5: The quake, which struck at 1353 ( 1023 GMT ), was felt in the neighbouring Gulf states of Oman and the UAE.
20_1ecbplus.6: Iran sits in a volatile earthquake region and is regularly struck by damaging quakes.
20_1ecbplus.7: A 6. 7 - strength quake killed more than 26, 000 people in the ancient city of Bam in December 2003.
20_1ecbplus.9: The US Geological Survey put the epicentre of Sunday's quake at about 58km ( 36 miles ) south - west of Bandar Abbas.
20_1ecbplus.10: Heydar Alishbandi, Governor of Qeshm island, said five villages had been badly hit, but the worst - affected areas appeared to be in the less - populated west.
20_1ecbplus.11: Helicopters ferried the injured to hospital but the authorities say the rescue effort is now winding down.
20_1ecbplus.12: Mr Alishbandi told the AFP news agency he was not expecting the death toll to rise.
