20_1ecbplus.13: The BBC's Frances Harrison in Tehran says in one incident a number of children suffered broken legs as they rushed to evacuate their school.
20_1ecbplus.14: The initial tremor lasted just over 10 seconds, she says, and there have been at least four aftershocks of around 4. 0.
20_1ecbplus.15: Qeshm is a popular tourist destination in the mouth of the Persian gulf.
20_1ecbplus.16: It has a free trade zone and a commercial and fishing port as well as a sanctuary for the conservation of turtles
20_1ecbplus.17: The main town on Qeshm still has power, water and electricity connections and officials say they are sending relief goods such as tents to those who have lost their homes
20_1ecbplus.19: I saw an injured person with blood on their clothes being taken to a local hospital, " one woman in Qeshm told AFP.
20_1ecbplus.20: There were reports of people fleeing buildings in the larger city of Bandar Abbas, a major port, but no indications of serious damage.
20_1ecbplus.21: The surrounding area has not been hit by a quake in more than 25 years.
20_1ecbplus.22: A 6. 4 - magnitude quake hit the town of Zarand in Iran's Kerman province in February, killing hundreds of people.

40_2ecbplus.0: New MacBook Air models officially unveiled with Ivy Bridge upgrade
40_2ecbplus.1: As rumored, new 11 - inch and 13 - inch MacBook Air models have just been officially announced by Apple at WWDC 2012.
40_2ecbplus.2: Unsurprisingly, Apple is keeping pace with competitors with the addition of Ivy Bridge to its slimmest line of laptops.
40_2ecbplus.3: The 11 - inch models will start at $999 with a 1. 7GHz dual - core Intel Core i5 processor, 4GB RAM, integrated Intel HD 4000 graphics, 64GB flash storage, and 5 hours of battery life, with a higher - tier model for $1099 that contains 128GB of flash storage.
40_2ecbplus.4: The 13 - inch models start at $1, 199 and include the same 1440 x 900 display as the previous models, along with a 1. 8GHz dual - core i5 processor, 4GB of RAM, the same graphics as the 11 - inch model, and 128GB of storage.
40_2ecbplus.5: $1499 will get you an extra 256GB of storage; specs are the same otherwise.
40_2ecbplus.6: Apple has also opted to include a pair of USB 3. 0 ports in its new Air lineup.
40_2ecbplus.7: Apple says the new 11 - inch and 13 - inch Macbook Air models are available now.

39_3ecbplus.0: Peter Capaldi: from spin doctor to the new Doctor Who
39_3ecbplus.1: Scottish actor best known for his role as Malcolm Tucker in The Thick of It revealed as 12th actor to play the Doctor
39_3ecbplus.3: Peter Capaldi, best known for playing foul - mouthed spin doctor Malcolm Tucker in political satire The Thick of It, has been named as the 12th actor to play the Doctor in the TV series Doctor Who.
39_3ecbplus.4: The 55 - year old Glasgow - born actor, a self - confessed lifelong Doctor Who fan, is the oldest actor to play the Time Lord since the first Doctor, William Hartnell, in 1963.
39_3ecbplus.5: He will replace Matt Smith, the youngest ever Doctor at 26 when he was introduced in 2009.
39_3ecbplus.6: The new Doctor was announced in a special live broadcast on BBC1 on Sunday night.
39_3ecbplus.7: Capaldi had been firmly installed as the bookies' favourite ahead of contenders including Luther's Idris Elba, Ben Whishaw and Daniel Rigby, despite a cloak of secrecy surrounding the identity of the new Doctor.
39_3ecbplus.8: Internally the BBC referred to the selection process as project Houdini, with reportedly only 10 people knowing Capaldi had been chosen.
39_3ecbplus.9: "It is so wonderful not to keep this secret any more, " he said.
39_3ecbplus.10: "For a while I couldn't even tell my daughter.
39_3ecbplus.11: Being asked to play the Doctor is an amazing privilege.
39_3ecbplus.12: Like the Doctor himself I find myself in a state of utter terror and delight.
39_3ecbplus.13: I can't wait to get started. "
39_3ecbplus.14: Capaldi admitted that it would be tricky to throw off the spectre of his most famous on screen persona, the wily and unscrupulous spin doctor Malcolm Tucker for the hit BBC show.
39_3ecbplus.15: "I think Malcolm has been banished from the mirror by the new Doctor who wouldn't put up with Malcolm's attitude to the world, " said Capaldi in an interview with Zoe Ball.
39_3ecbplus.16: Capaldi, who described himself as a "full anorak" Doctor Who fan who once wrote a letter aged 15 about Doctor Who to the Radio Times, admitted he was yet to get his head around being named as one of British TV's most enduring and best loved characters.
39_3ecbplus.18: "But he is reaching out and hopefully we will get it together.
39_3ecbplus.19: Even though I am a lifelong Doctor Who fan I've not played him since I was nine.
39_3ecbplus.20: I downloaded old scripts and practised those in front of the mirror. "
39_3ecbplus.21: Capaldi is not completely new to Doctor Who, having appeared in the programme playing Caecilius in the episode "The Fires of Pompeii" in 2008 with David Tennant.
39_3ecbplus.22: Steven Moffat, lead writer and executive producer of Doctor Who, said: "It's an incendiary combination: one of the most talented actors of his generation is about to play the best part on television. " he said.
39_3ecbplus.23: " Peter Capaldi is in the Tardis. "
39_3ecbplus.24: Capaldi said he had his phone on silent when he received the call that he had got the role - he was in Prague shooting a BBC remake of the Three Musketeers, where he plays Cardinal Richelieu.
39_3ecbplus.25: An assistant delivered the good news by saying: "Hello Doctor".
39_3ecbplus.26: Moffat said Capaldi had been thought of before but that the timing had not been right.
39_3ecbplus.27: "We all had an idea, we all had the same idea, it was quite a different idea, " he said.
39_3ecbplus.28: "We got the notional 12th Doctor around to my house and made a home video.
39_3ecbplus.30: There comes a right time for the right person to play it.
39_3ecbplus.32: The live announcement was broadcast simultaneously on BBC America, highlighting the increasing popularity of the franchise internationally and growing importance of the world's biggest TV market for the BBC franchise.
39_3ecbplus.33: In Doctor Who lore Capaldi is the 12th Doctor, leaving just one left and raising the long - held question of how the script writers will overcome the problem to keep the franchise going.
39_3ecbplus.34: "We're getting towards the end of the incarnation cycle and everyone always remembers that bit of the overall plot, " said Tom Spilsbury, editor of the official Doctor Who magazine.
39_3ecbplus.35: "The question is probably a few years away now for Doctor Who fans, I don't think they will be worried about it just yet.
39_3ecbplus.36: Doctor Who is popular so [ the BBC ] will invent away to get around it when the time comes, won't they? "
39_3ecbplus.37: The hope of a first female Doctor has once again been dashed, though Moffat tantalisingly hinted that the prospect remained for the future.
39_3ecbplus.38: "Time Lords can change gender, so it is not against the rules, " he said.
39_3ecbplus.39: Jenna Coleman, who will remain as the Doctor's companion when Capaldi takes over the role next year, said: "With Steven's writing and his talent I know we'll be making an amazing show with an incredible incarnation of number 12.
39_3ecbplus.40: I can't wait to start this new adventure. "
39_3ecbplus.41: The decision was welcomed by Smith who pre - recorded a message to Capaldi, saying: "I just want to wish my successor all the best and just say good luck and good on you for getting it, because I know he is both a huge fan of the show and a really nice guy.
39_3ecbplus.42: "The casting of it made me really excited genuinely, and as a fan I think it's a really canny choice, so good luck mate, it's going to be a thrill. "
39_3ecbplus.43: Smith added: "If I had to pick someone, I'd pick him, because I think he's great.
39_3ecbplus.44: And weirdly enough, after the 11th hour, he came up to me in the street and said, 'Ah mate, well done.
39_3ecbplus.45: I watched your episode last night, it was brilliant, I think you're really good'.
39_3ecbplus.46: And I really needed that, I needed a sort of boost and I never forgot it. "
39_3ecbplus.47: Capaldi has appeared in more than 40 films and TV shows, including Dangerous Liaisons, Shooting Fish, Minder, The Vicar of Dibley, Peep Show and Waking the Dead, since being cast as Danny Oldsen in the 1983 film Local Hero.
39_3ecbplus.48: He is also playing Guardian editor Alan Rusbridger in the forthcoming film about the WikiLeaks affair.

19_6ecbplus.0: Brooklyn neighborhood on police lockdown following protest
19_6ecbplus.3: Police intervened after more than 100 people joined together for a candlelit vigil in the East Flatbush neighborhood in Brooklyn, New York, where 16 - year - old Kimani Gray was shot multiple times by police on Saturday.
19_6ecbplus.4: Brooklynites on Twitter reported that police followed the march and searched apartment buildings in the neighborhood without warrants, looking for children who had been seen throwing bottles at police from neighborhood rooftops.
19_6ecbplus.5: Officers clad in riot gear were seen along the block, and barricades were placed on the streets.
19_6ecbplus.6: March participants chanted, "NYPD / KKK / how many kids will you kill today, " witnesses reported.
19_6ecbplus.7: Police said the crowd fell the 67th Precinct station in East Flatbush, where teenagers who were not apparently a part of any organized group threw garbage and empty bottles at the windows.
19_6ecbplus.8: "I'm in the middle of the riot action at Church and Snyder in my district.
19_6ecbplus.9: Right now, things are tense, " New York City Councilman Jumaane D. Williams, who represents the area, said on Twitter.
19_6ecbplus.10: Williams said people smashed out windows and overturned garbage cans during the disorder, and that one person had been attacked outside of a local Rite Aid.
19_6ecbplus.11: “ Tonight was a peaceful vigil that devolved into a riot, ” Williams wrote.
19_6ecbplus.12: “ The youth in this community have no outlets for their anger, no community. ”
19_6ecbplus.13: One person is believed to have been arrested, and no injuries were reported.
19_6ecbplus.14: Sixteen - year - old Kimani Gray was shot and killed on Saturday night after pointing a gun at two plainclothes officers who approached him, police said.
19_6ecbplus.15: According to the officers involved in the shooting, the teenager adjusted his belt "suspiciously, " and after they exited their vehicle to investigate, he pointed a. 357 caliber revolver at them.
19_6ecbplus.16: Both officers fired a total of 11 shots at the suspect, hitting Gray multiple times in his torso and legs.
19_6ecbplus.17: His sister, Mahnefah Gray, told NY1 she doubted her brother was carrying a gun, but was rather grabbing his belt “ to squeeze it ” because he had a “ skinny waist. ”
19_6ecbplus.18: "They thought he was grabbing back to get a gun, ” she said.
19_6ecbplus.20: What is he pointing a gun at over six police, knowing that they would kill him?
19_6ecbplus.22: Witnesses said that Gray, who was running for his life when he was shot, did not have a gun.
19_6ecbplus.23: "Stay down, or we ’ ll shoot you again, ” police said once Gray had been hit, according to the New York Times.
19_6ecbplus.24: "The cops, they just jumped out of the car so fast, " the New York Daily News quoted witness Devonte Brown as saying.
19_6ecbplus.25: "They started shooting him and he went down, he was bleeding, holding his side, screaming, 'stop, stop. "
19_6ecbplus.26: But one woman, who identified herself as the slain teen ’ s cousin, told NY1 that Kimani was in fact holding the gun for a friend.
19_6ecbplus.27: She also believed that Kimani was attempting to alert the police that he had the weapon rather than use it.
19_6ecbplus.28: After the shooting, Gray was rushed to a hospital but was declared dead on arrival.
19_6ecbplus.29: The officers involved in the shooting were also treated for trauma and tinnitus.
19_6ecbplus.30: Police said there is no evidence the unidentified officers acted inappropriately, though they were put on administrative leave.
19_6ecbplus.31: The also said that Gray had previously been arrested four times on charges of grand larceny, possession of stolen property and inciting a riot.

29_9ecbplus.0: Colts beat Chiefs 20 - 13 to clinch playoff berth
29_9ecbplus.1: The expectations placed upon Andrew Luck almost seemed unfair.
29_9ecbplus.2: Being the heir to Peyton Manning in Indianapolis is heady stuff for a rookie taking the reins of a franchise that won two games last season.
29_9ecbplus.3: Now, after guiding the Colts back to the playoffs - and breaking Cam Newton 's single - season passing record for a first - year player - it's safe to say Luck exceeded just about all of them.
29_9ecbplus.4: Luck threw for 205 yards Sunday, and his 7 - yard touchdown pass to Reggie Wayne on third - and - goal late in the fourth quarter gave the Colts a 20 - 13 victory over the Kansas City Chiefs.
29_9ecbplus.5: That put them into the playoffs without worrying about anybody else.
29_9ecbplus.6: "Would we have done it without him? " Colts interim coach Bruce Arians asked.
29_9ecbplus.8: Luck broke Newton's record of 4, 051 yards passing in the second quarter.
29_9ecbplus.9: But it was extending his own rookie record for fourth - quarter comebacks to seven was more important.
29_9ecbplus.10: The Chiefs had rallied behind Jamaal Charles ' 226 yards rushing to tie the game 13 - 13 heading into the fourth quarter.
29_9ecbplus.11: The Colts' defense stuffed quarterback Brady Quinn on fourth - and - inches to give Luck a chance.
29_9ecbplus.13: After a miserable stretch in which he connected on 1 of 13 passes, the fabulous freshman calmly led Indianapolis ( 10 - 5 ) downfield.
29_9ecbplus.14: He completed a key pass to T. Y. Hilton on third down and made two nice throws to Wayne before hitting the veteran in the back of the end zone.
29_9ecbplus.15: "We had so many opportunities all game, especially on third down, that we squandered, " Wayne said.
29_9ecbplus.17: That was the opportune time to do it. "
29_9ecbplus.18: Darius Butler returned an interception 32 yards for the Colts' other touchdown, helping them join the 2008 Miami Dolphins as the only teams to win at least 10 games after losing 14 or more the previous season.
29_9ecbplus.19: Most of those wins have come under Arians, who has filled in admirably while Chuck Pagano underwent treatment for leukemia.
29_9ecbplus.20: Pagano is expected to rejoin the Colts this week.
29_9ecbplus.22: That's all I can say, " Arians said.
29_9ecbplus.23: "Without getting emotional again, knowing that ( Pagano ) is going to be back Monday, the work week shouldn't be as stressful. "
29_9ecbplus.24: Charles' big day included an 86 - yard touchdown run on the first play of the second half.
29_9ecbplus.25: It was his second 200 - yard game of the season, and came one week after he managed 10 yards on nine carries against Oakland.
29_9ecbplus.26: "It was fun today, competing out there and doing it while we were trying to come back, " Charles said.
29_9ecbplus.27: "It was fun going out there and putting out a performance like that. "
29_9ecbplus.28: Charles joined the Titans' Chris Johnson and former Lions great Barry Sanders as the only players with three runs of 80 or more yards in a season.
29_9ecbplus.29: His third career 200 - yard game also set a franchise record, which he had shared with Larry Johnson.
29_9ecbplus.30: Peyton Hillis added 101 yards on the ground for the Chiefs ( 2 - 13 ), who had 352 yards rushing in a losing effort - the first time that's happened in NFL history.
29_9ecbplus.31: A big reason why was Quinn, who was just 10 of 22 for 162 yards with two interceptions.
29_9ecbplus.32: "This game was without a doubt, 100 percent on my shoulders, " he said.
29_9ecbplus.33: "You can't play the way I played today and win a football game. "
29_9ecbplus.34: His trouble began with the Chiefs' fifth offensive play, when he threw woefully behind Dexter McCluster - who wasn't even looking for the ball.
29_9ecbplus.35: Butler picked off the pass in stride, taking it untouched to the end zone for a 7 - 0 lead.
29_9ecbplus.36: Kansas City managed a field goal by Ryan Succop, but he missed his next try and the Colts went the other direction to set up the first of Adam Vinatieri 's two field goals.
29_9ecbplus.37: Charles fumbled in the red zone later in the second quarter, and the Colts moved into Vinatieri's range for a 36 - yard field goal and a 13 - 3 halftime lead.
29_9ecbplus.38: Charles electrified a sparse crowd on the first play of the second half.
29_9ecbplus.39: He angled to the left and then found room down the sideline, cutting back toward the middle of the field and winning a foot - race with the Indianapolis defense for an 86 - yard touchdown run.
29_9ecbplus.40: The Chiefs were in position to take the lead later in the third quarter, but Quinn was picked off by Vontae Davis in the end zone.
29_9ecbplus.41: The defense forced a three - and - out and Kansas City was driving again before settling for Succop's tying 47 - yard field goal.
29_9ecbplus.42: The Chiefs got the ball back again late in the fourth quarter, but Quinn was stuffed on a quarterback sneak on fourth - and - inches from the Indianapolis 27.
29_9ecbplus.43: That turned the ball over to Luck, who completed an 11 - yard pass to T. Y. Hilton to convert a third down before he and Wayne won it.
29_9ecbplus.44: "At times it looked a little bleak, " Arians said.
29_9ecbplus.45: "Guys hung in there, made plays when they had to make them.
29_9ecbplus.46: Offensively we struggled, and then put together a drive, like we have all year. "
29_9ecbplus.47: Notes: Chiefs WR Terrance Copper ( left knee ) and DT Tyson Jackson ( left foot ) left with injuries. .. .
29_9ecbplus.48: Wayne had five catches to become the fifth player in NFL history with four 100 - catch seasons.
29_9ecbplus.49: He also became the 14th player to reach 13, 000 yards receiving.

25_8ecbplus.1: New Orleans Saints place Pierre Thomas on injured reserve list
25_8ecbplus.2: The New Orleans Saints have placed running back Pierre Thomas on the injured reserve list a day after their leading rusher, Chris Ivory, was shut down for the season.
25_8ecbplus.3: With a playoff game looming Saturday on what probably will be a wet field in a tough stadium in Seattle, Reggie Bush and Julius Jones will step up to replace the Saints' top two running backs.
25_8ecbplus.4: "I don't know that this is a rallying cry, " Coach Sean Payton said of the injuries ( via Jeff Duncan of the Times - Picayune ).
25_8ecbplus.8: Thomas had a setback with an ankle injury in practice last week and, Payton said, everyone "felt this was the best move. "
25_8ecbplus.9: The Saints signed DeShawn Wynn on Tuesday and Joique Bell today off the Philadelphia Eagles' practice squad.

42_1ecbplus.0: T - Mobile Adds BlackBerry Q10 to its 4G LTE Smartphone Portfolio

7_8ecbplus.0: Wladimir Klitschko defeats Tony Thompson in six rounds
7_8ecbplus.3: Wladimir Klitschko retained his WBA, IBF and WBO heavyweight title belts by stopping American challenger Tony Thompson in the sixth round.
7_8ecbplus.4: The Ukrainian world champion extended his unbeaten run to eight years by overcoming 40 - year - old Thompson in Berne, Switzerland on Saturday.

35_10ecbplus.0: San Diego lineman arrested on suspicion of DUI
35_10ecbplus.2: San Diego Chargers defensive tackle Jamal Williams was arrested on suspicion of drunken driving, the team ’ s second such arrest in less than a month.
35_10ecbplus.3: Williams was pulled over for speeding early Sunday on a freeway outside downtown San Diego, the California Highway Patrol said.

4_9ecbplus.0: Esther Williams, Swimming Champion, Actress, Pin - Up Icon Dies; Fans And Family Mourn

37_10ecbplus.0: 6. 1 - magnitude quake strikes Indonesia's Aceh province in region hit by 2004 tsunami
37_10ecbplus.2: AN EARTHQUAKE killed six children and left 14 others trapped when a mosque collapsed during a Koran reading session in Indonesia's Aceh province, bringing the confirmed death toll from the disaster to 11.
37_10ecbplus.3: The strong 6. 1 - magnitude quake left hundreds more injured as it rocked a region that was devastated by the quake - triggered tsunami of 2004.
37_10ecbplus.4: The earthquake reduced houses in parts of Aceh to rubble, set off several landslides and badly damaged roads.
37_10ecbplus.5: Rescuers were struggling to find the children still trapped after the mosque collapse in Blang Mancung village, Central Aceh district.
37_10ecbplus.6: "Our search and rescue teams are struggling to evacuate an estimated 14 children still trapped under the rubble, '' said Subhan Sahara, the head of the local disaster management agency.
37_10ecbplus.7: "I hope they can be found alive but the chances are very slim, '' he added, explaining they were reading the Koran together when the quake struck.
37_10ecbplus.8: The quake, which hit at a shallow depth of just 10 kilometres, injured more than 200 people and damaged more than 300 houses in Aceh, said national disaster agency spokesman Sutopo Purwo Nugroho.
37_10ecbplus.9: As police and military personnel struggled to reach affected areas late Tuesday, there were two aftershocks of more than 5. 0 magnitude.
37_10ecbplus.10: In a village in Bener Meriah district, one man was killed when a landslide engulfed a coffee plantation, said disaster agency official Fauzi.
37_10ecbplus.11: "A man was working at a coffee plantation with his wife when a landslide caused by the quake struck.
37_10ecbplus.12: His body was found under a pile of earth soon afterwards, '' he said, adding that his wife and another woman were missing at the site.
37_10ecbplus.13: Another four people died in hospitals in the district from injuries sustained in the quake, he said.
37_10ecbplus.14: One of the fatalities was a child who died when a wall collapsed, said Ema Suryani, a doctor at a health clinic in Lampahan city in the district.
37_10ecbplus.15: "We have received around 50 people with injuries sustained when the walls of their houses collapsed, '' added the doctor.
37_10ecbplus.16: "There are around 30 people seriously injured, some with head injuries.
37_10ecbplus.17: The rest have only light injuries like minor cuts and grazes. ''
37_10ecbplus.18: Injured people had been transported from several affected villages in two trucks, she said.
37_10ecbplus.19: People ran outside in Banda Aceh as the quake shook houses, and in Medan city to the south of the province on Sumatra island.
37_10ecbplus.20: "The quake was felt strongly for around 15 seconds, from Bener Meriah to Banda Aceh.
37_10ecbplus.21: People panicked and rushed out of their homes, '' said national disaster agency spokesman Nugroho.
37_10ecbplus.22: Aceh, on the northern tip of Sumatra, is regularly hit by quakes.
37_10ecbplus.23: In 2004 a massive tremor sparked a tsunami that killed 170, 000 people in the province and tens of thousands more in countries around the Indian Ocean.
37_10ecbplus.24: In April last year an 8. 6 - magnitude quake struck 431 kilometres off Banda Aceh, prompting an Indian Ocean - wide tsunami alert.
37_10ecbplus.25: Five people died and seven were injured in Aceh in the quake and following aftershocks.
37_10ecbplus.26: In September 2009 a major earthquake near Padang city on Sumatra killed more than 1000 people.
37_10ecbplus.27: Indonesia sits on the Pacific "Ring of Fire'' where tectonic plates collide, causing frequent seismic and volcanic activity.

36_10ecbplus.0: Polygamist prophet Warren Jeffs charged againJuly 23, 2008. 4: 49 pm
36_10ecbplus.1: Seven indictments, nine charges and six leaders of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints now face trial in Texas.
36_10ecbplus.2: Among them is FLDS prophet Warren Jeffs, who has already been convicted in Utah on two counts of being an accomplice to the rape of a 14 - year - old girl and is now awaiting trial on similar charges in Arizona.
36_10ecbplus.3: The FLDS also has followers living in Bountiful, B. C. Bountiful has been the object of scrutiny by the RCMP and the B. C. attorney general since 2004.
36_10ecbplus.4: A special prosecutor, Terry Robertson, was appointed in June to determine whether charges should be laid.
36_10ecbplus.5: The Texas grand jury heard evidence collected during the April raid on the Eldorado compound that resulted in more than 400 women and children being taken into protective custody.
36_10ecbplus.6: They were later allowed to return to the compound after a Texas appeal court ruled that the child protection officials had overstepped their legal boundaries.
36_10ecbplus.7: The grand jury also heard testimony from at least four FLDS women including prophet Warren Jeffs's 16 - year - old daughter who her father placed into a religious marriage to an older man when she was just 15.
36_10ecbplus.8: The Texas charge against Jeffs is a first - degree felony count of sexually assaulting an under - aged girl.
36_10ecbplus.9: The other men - none of whom have yet been named - face charges related to sexual assault of under - aged girls and bigamy.
36_10ecbplus.10: Jeffs will not be tried in Texas until he goes to court in Arizona.
36_10ecbplus.11: Matt Smith, the county attorney in Mohave County, Az. said in a press release Wednesday that he had heard about the charges, but "the indictments in Texas do not affect the Arizona case at all. "
36_10ecbplus.12: The Americans have taken a very different approach to the FLDS.
36_10ecbplus.13: In Utah, Arizona and Texas, the main thrust of the investigation has been the sexual abuse of under - aged girls.
36_10ecbplus.14: In British Columbia, Attorney - General Wally Oppal has focused his attention mainly on the Criminal Code offence of polygamy.

9_7ecbplus.0: Obama administration overturns rule that weakened Endangered Species Act
9_7ecbplus.2: Interior Secretary Ken Salazar announced today that the Obama administration will reverse an Endangered Species Act ( ESA ) regulation that allowed federal agencies to go ahead with actions that may impact endangered species without consulting with experts, essentially circumventing the role of conservation scientists in such decisions.
9_7ecbplus.3: "By rolling back this eleventh - hour regulation, we are ensuring that threatened and endangered species continue to receive the full protection of the law" said Salazar.
9_7ecbplus.4: The change to the ESA was made last December by the Bush administration and drew heavy criticism from environmental and conservation groups.
9_7ecbplus.5: At the time, during heavy campaigning, Obama stated that he opposed the last minute rule changes with a spokesman stating: “ As president, Senator Obama will fight to maintain the strong protections of the Endangered Species Act and undo this proposal from President Bush. ”
9_7ecbplus.6: Darin Schroeder, Vice President for Conservation Advocacy at the environmental organization, American Bird Conservancy, agreed with Salazar ’ s decision.
9_7ecbplus.7: “ We are gratified Secretary Salazar and Secretary Locke acted to restore the Endangered Species Act to its intended strength.
9_7ecbplus.8: The consultation process is one of the cornerstones of the ESA, and one of the key checks and balances that ensures protection for the 90 birds and 1, 263 other animals and plants it covers. ”
9_7ecbplus.9: Another anticipated ruling regarding polar bears has not been announced yet.
9_7ecbplus.10: While the Bush administration found that melting ice in the Arctic due to climate change was endangering polar bears, they ruled that the ESA could not used to regulate carbon emissions in order to protect the polar bear.
9_7ecbplus.11: Salazar must make a judgment on this rule by May 9th.
9_7ecbplus.12: “ Secretary Salazar took an important step today toward restoring needed protections for endangered species, ” said Noah Greenwald, biodiversity program director for the Center for Biological Diversity.
9_7ecbplus.13: “ But he still needs to rescind the special rule for the polar bear, which amounts to a death sentence for the majestic bear because it exempts greenhouse gas emissions from regulation. ”

25_13ecbplus.0: Pierre Thomas is headed to injured reserve

13_5ecbplus.0: Arson suspected in fire that destroyed Alaska's Mat - Maid dairy
13_5ecbplus.2: Only about a week after Alaska officials formally moved to dissolve the last entity to run the historic Matanuska Maid Creamery, the historic structure which once housed part of that historic business burned to the ground in Palmer.
13_5ecbplus.4: "You can't call it arson yet, " Palmer public safety director Jon Owen said, but the fact that the 86 - year - old structure was without electrical or gas connections makes the 3: 30 a. m. fire highly suspicious.
13_5ecbplus.5: "There was no lightning strike, " Owen said.
13_5ecbplus.6: It was a pretty morning in Palmer when a visitor to the Valley Hotel walked out at 3: 33 a. m. and spied the deserted building nearby in flames.
13_5ecbplus.7: By the time local police arrived to investigate, Owen said, there was no hope of saving the structure, and the firemen who arrived soon thereafter focused their efforts on keeping flames from spreading to a nearby fuel storage facility.
13_5ecbplus.8: A good portion of the fire - fighting equipment in the Matanuska Valley was called to help, more than two dozen units.
13_5ecbplus.9: At one time, Owen said, firefighters were pouring 5, 000 gallons of water per minute onto the blaze as history burned.
13_5ecbplus.10: Designated as national historic landmarks, the Mat Maid buildings dated back to the mid 1930's during President Franklin D. Roosevelt's "New Deal" efforts to wrench the country out of The Great Depression.
13_5ecbplus.11: They were built shortly after the Matanuska Colony was established by the Roosevelt administration to relocate struggling Americans and give them a new start in the Last Frontier.
13_5ecbplus.12: A farmer's cooperative at first, Mat Maid became a state - run business that eventually died despite the best efforts of former Gov. Sarah Palin to keep it alive.
13_5ecbplus.13: Now a conservative icon, Palin was anything but in 2007 when "The Creamery Corporation, " an arm of the Alaska Board of Agriculture and Conservation, voted to close down a financially struggling Mat Maid.
13_5ecbplus.14: Palin responded by firing the board.
13_5ecbplus.15: She then replaced board members with her cronies.
13_5ecbplus.16: They pumped another $600, 000 in state money into Mat Maid, but it didn't help.
13_5ecbplus.17: "In July alone, they lost $300, 000, " said Anchorage businessman and blogger Andrew Halcro, a sometimes critic of Palin.
13_5ecbplus.18: By the end of 2007, it was obvious even to the Palin administration that Mat Maid couldn't survive, and the state was forced to shut it down although "The Creamery Corporation" survived.
13_5ecbplus.19: It is only now going out of business.
13_5ecbplus.20: "Dissolution of the corporation has taken four years, " Robert McFarlane, an assistant state attorney general said Tuesday.
13_5ecbplus.21: In the interim, a new creamery grew up in the Matanuska - Susitna Valley to take the place of Mat Maid.
13_5ecbplus.22: However, Valley Dairy Inc. , seems to have many of the same problems that beset its predecessor.
13_5ecbplus.24: At the start of the month, Valley Dairy Inc. , which does business as the Matanuska Creamery, told the Agriculture Board it was going to stop making payments on its hundreds of thousands of dollars in debt to the state's Agriculture Revolving Loan Fund ( ARLF ).
13_5ecbplus.25: "We will be making no further payment on our ARLF notes until we have been able to move to a suitable location and secure a minimum raw milk supply, " Karen Olson, president and CEO of Valley Dairy, notified the panel on Aug. 1.
13_5ecbplus.26: "All our attempts to deal with our ARLF loans have only resulted in a moment's reprieve following by further threats. "
13_5ecbplus.27: A copy of the letter has been obtained by Dispatch.
13_5ecbplus.28: In it, Olson blames the state for Alaska's dairy problems.
13_5ecbplus.29: "There are some who would say that Matanuska Creamery has been a victim of its own idealism and commitment to keeping the dairy industry alive, " she wrote, "and they would be correct.
13_5ecbplus.30: But had we ignored our commitment back in 2007 and since, there would be no dairy industry. "
13_5ecbplus.31: The problems specific to the Matanuska Creamery date to the two - year reign of Sarah Palin, but the problems for the dairy industry in Alaska go back way before her administration.
13_5ecbplus.32: They are rooted in state - sponsored efforts to create an industry instead of letting markets work.
13_5ecbplus.34: Mat Maid did fine "for 23 years without one single dime from the state, " Halcro said.
13_5ecbplus.35: That changed at the start of the 1980s when the state tried to supercharge farming across Cook Inlet from Anchorage by creating the Point MacKenzie dairy project.
13_5ecbplus.36: Mat Maid, a farmer's cooperative begun in 1936, tried to help.
13_5ecbplus.37: It borrowed $2 million dollars from the Agriculture Fund to expand its facilities to handle all the milk that was supposed to come from the farms.
13_5ecbplus.38: When the farmers faltered, Mat Maid was left short of milk.
13_5ecbplus.39: Without enough milk to sell - - either as milk or cream or yogurt or cheese - - Mat Maid couldn't generate enough profit to service its debt.
13_5ecbplus.40: In 1983, it was forced to file for bankruptcy.
13_5ecbplus.41: The state stepped in to run the company to protect its debt.
13_5ecbplus.42: Two years later, the cooperative signed over to the Loan Fund its property and assets to settle a $5. 3 million debt.
13_5ecbplus.43: Three years after that, the state established The Creamery Corporation as an arm of the Loan Fund to run Mat Maid.
13_5ecbplus.44: It struggled along for almost a decade.
13_5ecbplus.45: "The Creamery Corporation has operated without financial assistance from the ARLF since 1988 and continue to provide a return on investment thorough increased equity value, " argued a "White Paper" produced for the Alaska Department of Natural Resources in 2006.
13_5ecbplus.46: Mat Maid was then valued at $5 million, down from a peak value of $5. 3 million but above the 2002 value of $4. 9 million.
13_5ecbplus.47: The white paper noted efforts to privatize the operation in 1986 and again in 1990 had failed.
13_5ecbplus.49: The state was more successful in getting rid of the historic creamery buildings in Palmer although that, too, was a struggle.
13_5ecbplus.50: They were leased with an option to buy in 1996, but that deal fell through.
13_5ecbplus.51: A restoration company called Heritage Properties picked the buildings up in 1997, and in 2001 announced plans to convert them into offices and stores, or apartments, while maintaining their historic façades.
13_5ecbplus.52: That idea, too, fell through, and the property was finally sold at bid.
13_5ecbplus.53: It was purchased by Anchorage attorney Bill Ingaldson.
13_5ecbplus.54: He was not returning calls on Tuesday.
13_5ecbplus.55: Ingaldson, as well as the state Division of Agriculture and other property owners, have been in negotiations with the city of Palmer on the sale of what is called the old "Matanuska Maid block. "
13_5ecbplus.56: It is an area of about 8. 7 acres near downtown Palmer that included, until Tuesday, the old creamery, an historic hatchery, a cinderblock power house, a residency, a building housing the offices of the Palmer Arts Council, and Crowley Petroleum Distributors, which maintains the fuel storage facility.
13_5ecbplus.57: Palmer voters in 2010 approved a $3 million bond to pay for purchase of the property.
13_5ecbplus.58: There were hopes of restoring the buildings as a tourist attraction.
13_5ecbplus.59: It could have detailed the successes and failures of those sorts of collective efforts sometimes attacked by Palin.
13_5ecbplus.60: Mat Maid the co - op was a profitable business that once produced and sold about half the milk in Alaska.
13_5ecbplus.61: Mat Maid the state - owned corporation was a company that struggled from the start and sold a lot of milk produced in the Lower 48.
13_5ecbplus.62: "In 2004, 39 percent of the milk produced at Mat Maid was from Alaska producers, " the white paper said.
13_5ecbplus.63: The other 61 percent was shipped in from Outside to be packaged and sold as Alaska milk in an effort by Mat Maid to maintain market share in hopes the cows on the state - sponsored farms at Point MacKenzie would one day start producing.
13_5ecbplus.65: Over time the MacKenzie properties began to shift into the hands of land speculators anticipating some far - future wealth if a bridge were ever built across Knik Arm to allow for creation of a new Anchorage bedroom community.
13_5ecbplus.67: "It's all kind of a long and complicated story going way back, " said Ed Fogels, the deputy commissioner of Natural Resources in charge of the Agriculture Division.
13_5ecbplus.68: He couldn't hazard a guess on how much money the state has lost on Mat Maid and associated agriculture projects over the years.
13_5ecbplus.69: "That's kind of a good question, " he said.
13_5ecbplus.70: Darcy Davies, an agriculture student at the University of Alaska Fairbanks, in 2007 authored a senior thesis calculating money spent on agriculture projects in the state.
13_5ecbplus.71: Davies wrote that "over $76 million ( in 2006 dollars ) was spent on the projects.
13_5ecbplus.72: Even more millions of dollars were spent on the ARLF loans to farmers. "
13_5ecbplus.73: "It is debatable, " she wrote, "whether those funds expended were worth the benefits created. "
13_5ecbplus.74: Davies examined not only Point MacKenzie and Mat Maid, but the Delta barley project and an effort to produce red meat in the Nenana area of the Interior.
13_5ecbplus.75: Her report notes that the Point Mac agriculture project got almost $10 million in direct appropriations.
13_5ecbplus.76: It is unclear how many millions more exactly were spent propping up Mat Maid.
13_5ecbplus.77: After the fire, and the pending dissolution of The Creamery Corporation, about all that will remain is the Mat Maid trademark, an ice - skating princess in a fur hat.
13_5ecbplus.79: As the most durable legacy of Mat Maid, the trademark could prove valuable, though Fogels wasn't sure how the state could use it.
13_5ecbplus.80: Maybe it could festoon the 100, 000 pounds of Matanuska Creamery cheese the Valley Dairy put up to back one of its state loans.

40_6ecbplus.0: Apple Unveils New MacBook Air, Next - Generation MacBook Pro
40_6ecbplus.2: Apple's MacBook line, particularly certain portions of it, have been overdue for a refresh.
40_6ecbplus.4: During the opening keynote of Apple's WWDC event Monday morning, Apple's Phil Schiller unveiled updates to both the MacBook Air and the MacBook Pro, as well as an entirely new next - generation MacBook Pro with a Retina Display.
40_6ecbplus.5: The new MacBook Air features third - generation 1. 7GHz Intel Core processors, a new 512 gigabyte flash - storage option, 60 percent faster graphics, and USB 3 support via a dual USB 2 / USB 3 port.
40_6ecbplus.6: It also has a new price point that's $100 cheaper than its predecessor.
40_6ecbplus.7: The new MacBook Pro features Intel Ivy Bridge chips, running at up to a 2. 7GHz, with faster graphics.
40_6ecbplus.8: It, too, has been given a USB 2 / USB 3 port.
40_6ecbplus.9: The 13 - inch model comes in $1, 199 and $1, 499 versions; the 15 - inch model is offered in $1, 799 and $2, 199 versions.
40_6ecbplus.10: Also debuted this morning, Apple's new "next - generation MacBook Pro. "
40_6ecbplus.11: "It's the most beautiful computer we've ever made, " Schiller said, before listing the device's impressive specs.
40_6ecbplus.12: The machine is 0. 71 inches thin, a quarter - inch thinner than the current MacBook Pro; it weighs under 4. 5 pounds.
40_6ecbplus.13: And yes, it boasts that rumored Retina Display.
40_6ecbplus.14: The screen is 2880 pixels by 1800; that's four times that of the prior MacBook Pro, and more than five million pixels total.
40_6ecbplus.15: The next - generation MacBook Pro's innards are equally impressive: An Intel quad - core i7 processor, up to 2. 7GHz; up to 16GB of memory; Nvidia GeForce GT 650M graphics; up to 768GB of internal flash storage; up to seven hours of battery life; SD card slot, HDMI, USB 3, a new MagSafe 2 connector and, finally, two Thunderbolt ports.
40_6ecbplus.16: Legacy connectors like Ethernet and FireWire have been abandoned, but can run over Thunderbolt via an adapter.
40_6ecbplus.19: The entire notebook lineup is available for purchase today.

10_6ecbplus.3: Yet it ’ s coming from up top.

43_12ecbplus.0: AMD to Acquire Server Innovator SeaMicro
43_12ecbplus.2: In a bold move to boost its position in next - generation servers, AMD will acquire low - power server specialist SeaMicro for $334 million, the companies said today.
43_12ecbplus.3: The acquisition is a disruptive one for the low - power server landscape, as SeaMicro has been using Intel chips in its next - generation servers, which offer dramatic reductions in power and space usage.
43_12ecbplus.4: The crown jewel in the acquisition is SeaMicro ’ s networking fabric, which allows hundreds of low - power processors to work together.
43_12ecbplus.5: The SeaMicro architecture is processor - neutral, meaning it can be quickly adapted to work with AMD ’ s technology.
43_12ecbplus.6: “ By acquiring SeaMicro, we are accelerating AMD ’ s transformation into an agile, disruptive innovator capable of staking a data center leadership position, ” said Rory Read, president and CEO, AMD.
43_12ecbplus.7: “ SeaMicro is a pioneer in low - power server technology.
43_12ecbplus.8: “ We are clearly skating to where the puck is going, ” Read added.
43_12ecbplus.9: “ This is a great company with innovative IP and great talent. ”
43_12ecbplus.11: AMD plans to offer the first AMD Opteron processor - based solutions that combine AMD and SeaMicro technology in the second half of 2012.
43_12ecbplus.12: The company said it remains firmly committed to its traditional server business, and will continue to invest in research and development.
43_12ecbplus.13: But AMD executives said the acquisition of SeaMicro will boost the company ’ s offerings for cloud computing providers, who are keenly focused on reducing the energy used by their armadas of servers.
43_12ecbplus.14: “ Cloud data centers are the fastest growing segment of the server market, ” said Lisa Su, Senior Vice President and General Manager, Global Business Units.
43_12ecbplus.15: “ The cloud has changed the dynamics of the data center and how people think about servers. ”
43_12ecbplus.16: Su said AMD will offer SeaMicro servers with AMD chips to provide continuity for existing customers.
43_12ecbplus.17: But the primary focus will be on integrating SeaMicro ’ s fabric technology with AMD processors in “ building blocks ” for its OEM customers.
43_12ecbplus.19: The basic building block of the SeaMicro system is a credit card - sized compute block, comprised of a CPU and its chipset, DRAM, and a custom SeaMicro ASIC ( application specific integrated circuit ).
43_12ecbplus.20: SeaMicro ’ s patented I / O virtualization allows companies to save money by using fewer cables and network interface cards ( NICs ) to connect to networks and storage.
43_12ecbplus.21: SeaMicro ’ s early systems featured up to 768 Intel Atom cores in a 10U server.
43_12ecbplus.22: It recently introduced a server powered by 64 Intel Xeon processors, providing a “ brawny ” offering to supplement the “ wimpy ” Atom nodes.
43_12ecbplus.23: One of the benefits of the AMD acquisition is the ability to adapt SeaMicro ’ s technology to a broader range of workloads and applications, according the SeaMicro CEO Andrew Feldman.
43_12ecbplus.24: “ SeaMicro was founded to dramatically reduce the power consumed by servers, while increasing compute density and bandwidth, ” said Feldman, who will become general manager of AMD ’ s newly created Data Center Server Solutions business.
43_12ecbplus.25: “ By becoming a part of AMD, we will have access to new markets, resources, technology, and scale that will provide us with the opportunity to work tightly with our OEM partners as we fundamentally change the server market. ”

39_7ecbplus.0: 'Doctor Who': Peter Capaldi announced as the new Doctor
39_7ecbplus.2: After lots of speculation, Peter Capaldi has been named the new Doctor for Series 8 of "Doctor Who. "
39_7ecbplus.3: He will take over for Matt Smith, the 12th Doctor, who is leaving during the 2013 Christmas Special.
39_7ecbplus.4: The announcement was made Sunday ( August 4 ), during "Doctor Who Live: The Next Doctor, " which aired on BBC and BBC America.
39_7ecbplus.5: Capaldi, a Scottish actor, is best known for starring in the BBC series "Thick of It, " though he has a few movie credits to his name, as well.
39_7ecbplus.6: He appeared in "World War Z" ( ironically, in the role of W. H. O. Doctor ) and has a part in the upcoming "Maleficent, " starring Angelina Jolie.
39_7ecbplus.7: Capaldi has also appeared on "Doctor Who" before, guest starring in the Series 4 episode "The Fires of Pompeii. "
39_7ecbplus.8: The live special, hosted by Zoe Ball, featured celebrity guests sharing their love for "Doctor Who, " including Peter Davison ( 5th Doctor ).
39_7ecbplus.9: The show also featured an interview with Smith, who endorsed the new Doctor.
39_7ecbplus.10: "If I had to pick someone, it would be [ Capaldi ].
39_7ecbplus.11: I think he's great, " he says.
39_7ecbplus.12: "I just want to wish my successor all the best. "
39_7ecbplus.13: It was first announced Smith would be leaving the show in June.
39_7ecbplus.14: He joined the series, becoming the 11th Doctor, in 2010.
39_7ecbplus.15: He was the third to take on the role since the series was relaunched in 2005, following in the footsteps of Christopher Eccleston ( 9th Doctor ) and David Tennant ( 10th Doctor ).
39_7ecbplus.16: The new Doctor will be introduced as Smith leaves the role, regenerating in the 2013 Christmas special ( airing December 25 ).
39_7ecbplus.17: It will also serve as the show's 800th episode.
39_7ecbplus.18: Smith was first introduced in the 2009 Christmas special, "The End of Time. "

27_1ecbplus.1: Microsoft releases fix for 'zero - day' IE browser bug
27_1ecbplus.2: Microsoft has released a temporary patch to fix a "zero - day", or previously unknown, vulnerability in its Internet Explorer ( IE ) web browser.
27_1ecbplus.3: The software giant said the bug, which relates to the browser's memory, could affect all versions of IE6 to 10.
27_1ecbplus.4: Attackers could set up websites specifically designed to exploit the vulnerability, Microsoft said, and then run malicious code on users' computers.
27_1ecbplus.5: Targeted attacks directed at IE8 and 9 had already been reported, it said.
27_1ecbplus.6: "This is a serious vulnerability potentially affecting millions of Windows computers, " Dana Tamir, director at security company Trusteer, told the BBC.
27_1ecbplus.7: "Hackers are already exploiting this so I hope Microsoft produces a full patch within a few days, " she said.
27_1ecbplus.8: In a blog post, Microsoft's Dustin Childs advised concerned users to set internet and local security zone settings to "high" to block ActiveX controls and active scripting.
27_1ecbplus.9: He also recommended changing IE settings to prompt users before running active scripting.
27_1ecbplus.10: But doing this "may affect usability", he said, so users should add sites they trust, and visit often, to the IE trusted sites zone.
27_1ecbplus.11: Microsoft's Fix It patch applies only to 32 - bit versions of IE.
27_1ecbplus.12: It is not being rolled out automatically and is not intended to be a replacement for scheduled security updates, the company said.
27_1ecbplus.13: "This temporary workaround is like applying a Band - Aid to a wound, " said Ms Tamir.
27_1ecbplus.14: Last week, Microsoft admitted that it had been forced to rewrite four of its security updates just three days after they had been issued.
27_1ecbplus.15: Customers had reported receiving repeated demands to install the updates even after they had already done so.

27_2ecbplus.0: Microsoft releases out - of - cycle patch for IE flaw
27_2ecbplus.2: Microsoft's bad September continues to grow worse, with the company being forced to issue an out - of - cycle patch for a zero - day vulnerability in its Internet Explorer web browser.
27_2ecbplus.3: Microsoft's September got off to a bad start when the company issued a raft of faulty updates as part of its monthly Patch Tuesday release cycle.
27_2ecbplus.4: While the issues have now been resolved, the company was forced to remove and re - release a total of ten patches - making it the worst Patch Tuesday in a six - month run that has seen only a single month go by without a show - stopping fault resulting in patches being reissued following customer complaints.
27_2ecbplus.5: Today's admission from the company isn't going to do much to salve its public image, either: Microsoft has confirmed that a flaw in its Internet Explorer web browser is being actively exploited in targeted attacks, and considers the issue serious enough to release an out - of - cycle fix ahead of next month's Patch Tuesday.
27_2ecbplus.6: The update, which is only available for manual installation and will not be published through Windows Update, is a work - around rather than a true fix for a pretty serious flaw in Microsoft's MSHTML Shim component - which had already been targeted in prior attacks at the start of the year.
27_2ecbplus.7: 'This issue could allow remote code execution if an affected system browses to a website containing malicious content directed towards the specific browser type, ' explained Microsoft's Dustin Childs in an alert to the security community.
27_2ecbplus.8: 'This would typically occur when an attacker compromises the security of trusted websites regularly frequented, or convinces someone to click on a link in an email or instant message.
27_2ecbplus.9: Running modern versions of Internet Explorer ensures that customers receive the benefit of additional security features that can help prevent successful attacks, ' he added - but while the current targeted attacks are only being pointed at the outdated Internet Explorer 8 and Internet Explorer 9 releases, it is thought the flaw could exist across all versions of IE.
27_2ecbplus.10: For those who use Internet Explorer, Microsoft's advice is to install the out - of - cycle Fix - It patch to work around the issue until a proper solution can be found.
27_2ecbplus.11: The patch applies to all version of Internet Explorer from IE 6 through to the latest IE 11, although is only designed to resolve the issue with the 32 - bit version - the 64 - bit version, it would seem, being better protected against the vulnerability.
27_2ecbplus.12: With Microsoft's recent track record for patches causing problems worse than they solve, however, users would be well advised to test the patch on a virtual machine or similar throw - away system before rolling it out on a wider scale.

23_2ecbplus.0: Two climbers killed in Mt Cook falls
23_2ecbplus.2: The Aoraki Mt Cook Alpine Rescue Team have recovered the body of the second climber to fall to his death at Mount Cook National Park over the weekend.
23_2ecbplus.3: Inspector Dave Gaskin said the man fell around 2000ft ( 609 metres ) near the Mount Sefton Bivvy, above the Mueller Glacier.
23_2ecbplus.4: ''The fall was unsurvivable, '' Inspector Gaskin said.
23_2ecbplus.5: There were four in the climbing party.
23_2ecbplus.6: The friends of the deceased had to stay in position overnight until the weather was suitable to carry them out by rescue helicopter this morning.
23_2ecbplus.7: The body was recovered in the afternoon, and taken to Mt Cook Village initially, then on to Timaru.
23_2ecbplus.8: Inspector Gaskin confirmed the climbing party are foreigners, but would not specify any other details until the family of the deceased had been informed.
23_2ecbplus.9: With two deaths at Mt Cook National Park this weekend, Inspector Gaskin said police and rescures were pushed to their limits
23_2ecbplus.10: ''Resources are tight, there's no doubt about that.
23_2ecbplus.11: It's been very difficult but the guys have done a wonderful job. ''
23_2ecbplus.12: He said the two deaths were not related to weather conditions.
23_2ecbplus.13: ''I can't speak for the first death, but in this case it looks like to be a lack of experience, '' Inspector Gaskin said.
23_2ecbplus.14: Yesterday, a 36 - year - old Australian climber died after falling about 150 metres at Mt Cook.
23_2ecbplus.15: The man, from Hampton East, fell in the Tasman Glacier area.
23_2ecbplus.16: A Westpac Rescue Helicopter from Christchurch was called about 3pm to assist with search and rescue co - ordination at the Mt Cook base.
23_2ecbplus.17: When it got there, the man had been transported to Mt Cook Village by a local helicopter service and pronounced dead by paramedics.
23_2ecbplus.18: The man is thought to have fallen much earlier in the day.

37_7ecbplus.1: Powerful earthquake injures dozens in Indonesia's Aceh province
37_7ecbplus.2: At least 50 reported injured and buildings destroyed after a 6. 1 magnitude earthquake strikes Sumatra's Aceh province.
37_7ecbplus.3: A powerful 6. 1 magnitude earthquake hit Indonesia's northwestern Aceh province on the island of Sumatra early Tuesday.
37_7ecbplus.5: The epicenter of the quake was roughly 55 kilometers from the town of Bireuen, a regency of the larger Aceh province, according to data from the US Geological Survey.
37_7ecbplus.6: It took place at 7: 37 AM local time.
37_7ecbplus.7: Although it's unknown how many were injured, Sky News estimates"at least 50 people, " and numerous buildings have collapsed as an effect of the powerful tremor.
37_7ecbplus.8: The quake appears to have shaken the provincial capital of Banda Aceh, which is located at the northern tip of the Sumatran land mass.
37_7ecbplus.9: More from GlobalPost: Aceh's bloodstained elections
37_7ecbplus.10: "I see many houses were damaged and their roofs fell onto some people, " central Aceh district resident Bensu Elianita told the Associated Press.
37_7ecbplus.11: "Many people were injured but it is difficult to evacuate them due to traffic jams. "
37_7ecbplus.12: "We have received around 50 people with injuries suffered when the walls of their houses collapsed, " said doctor Ema Suryani to AFP, speaking from Lampahan city in Aceh's Bener Meriah district.
37_7ecbplus.13: Aceh was hit extremely hard by the massive Boxing Day earthquake and tsunami in 2004, killing 170, 000 people in Sumatra alone - with 35, 000 bodies never recovered.
37_7ecbplus.14: The rebuilding process continues to this day from the enormous natural disaster.
37_7ecbplus.15: Here's a slideshow of images of the northern Sumatra quake on Tuesday.

2_10ecbplus.2: Talkshow host returns for second Oscar tour
2_10ecbplus.3: And the next host of the Academy Awards is … Ellen DeGeneres.
2_10ecbplus.4: It will be DeGeneres ’ second tour of duty as Oscar host, having previously emceed the 79th annual Academy Awards in 2007 and earning an Emmy nomination.
2_10ecbplus.5: The popular syndicated talkshow host also fronted the Emmys in 2001 and 2005 ( co - hosting them in 2003 ).
2_10ecbplus.6: “ I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time, ” DeGeneres said, joking that “ you know what they say – the third time ’ s the charm. ”
2_10ecbplus.7: “ We are thrilled to have Ellen DeGeneres host the Oscars, ” said Zadan and Meron jointly.
2_10ecbplus.8: “ It is an honor to welcome back Ellen DeGeneres as the host of the biggest entertainment celebration of the year, ” said ABC Entertainment Group prexy Paul Lee.
2_10ecbplus.9: Over the last eight years, the 2007 Oscars hosted by DeGeneres stands as the top rated in both adults 18 - 49 ( 14. 1 rating / 33 share ) and women 25 - 54 ( 19. 2 / 40 ).

22_10ecbplus.0: Trial Begins for Kraft Shooting Suspect
22_10ecbplus.1: The murder trial of a suspended female employee who allegedly shot and killed two co - workers two years ago starts Monday.
22_10ecbplus.3: The murder trial for the suspended Kraft foods employee accused of shooting three co - workers, killing two of them, starts Monday.
22_10ecbplus.4: Yvonne Hiller, 43, is charged with murder for the shooting deaths of two female co - workers in September 2010.
22_10ecbplus.5: Hiller is also charged with attempted murder for allegedly shooting and injuring a third co - worker.
22_10ecbplus.6: Police say that the shootings happened minutes after Hiller was suspended from her job at the Kraft Plant following an altercation with the three victims.
22_10ecbplus.7: They say she forced her way through security at gunpoint, walked into the employee lounge where the three victims were and shot them.

38_2ecbplus.0: 4. 6 quake rattles Sonoma County early Thursday
38_2ecbplus.3: An earthquake measuring 4. 6 rattled Sonoma and Lake counties early Thursday, according to the U. S. Geological Survey.
38_2ecbplus.4: The quake occurred at 2: 09 a. m. , about 14 miles northeast of Healdsburg, on the Maacama Fault with a depth of 12 miles.
38_2ecbplus.5: A Sonoma County Sheriff's dispatcher said around 7 a. m. that there had been no reports of damage or injuries.

10_3ecbplus.0: Nationals' Eight - Year Offer to Teixeira Reportedly Bumped as High as $184M
10_3ecbplus.2: For weeks now, Mark Teixeira has contemplated his next home - - a waiting game that has slowly shortened the list of teams in pursuit of his services.
10_3ecbplus.3: But evidently, the waiting hasn't caused Teixeira's price tag to drop even the slightest.
10_3ecbplus.4: One report posted online last night by MASN Sports' Roch Kubatko suggested that the Washington Nationals have upgraded their initial offer to Teixeira - - eight years, $160 million - - to somewhere between $178 million and $184 million over the same timeframe.
10_3ecbplus.5: No member of the team's front office would add comment yesterday on the current offer or indicate whether the team had sweetened the deal.
10_3ecbplus.6: By way of declining to offer the numbers of Washington's proposal to Teixeira, team president Stan Kasten said, "There are bargains, but luxury goods are still not being discounted. "
10_3ecbplus.7: Regardless of the money, the team's front office still knows it would take a mild upset for the 28 - year - old to settle on a deal with Washington.
10_3ecbplus.8: On Sunday night, the Los Angeles Angels withdrew their contract offer to Teixeira, believing he had no sincere interest in playing for the organization with which he ended the 2008 season.
10_3ecbplus.9: The Boston Red Sox and Baltimore Orioles have offers on the table, and though they have yet to make a concrete offer the New York Yankees might also contemplate a last - minute bid.
10_3ecbplus.10: Various news reports late last week pegged the Boston offer to be as high as $184 million over eight years, though subsequent rumors suggested that the numbers are a little lower - - perhaps between $165 million and $180 million.
10_3ecbplus.11: The Orioles have the weakest offer of the bunch - - a proposal reportedly worth between $140 million and $150 million over seven years.
10_3ecbplus.12: So far, no team involved has offered a contract longer than eight years.
10_3ecbplus.13: Teixeira's agent, Scott Boras, entered the free agency process hoping his client could attract a 10 - year deal.
10_3ecbplus.14: Either way, Teixeira will end up with one of the biggest paydays in baseball history, almost certainly exceeding the $161 million ( over seven years ) that fellow free agent CC Sabathia received from the Yankees earlier this offseason.

45_12ecbplus.0: The murder trial of a Spiro man charged in the deaths of a pregnant Arkansas woman and her fetus is underway in Poteau.
45_12ecbplus.1: Prosecutors have charged 27 - year - old Christopher Kenyon Simpson with two counts of first - degree murder in the April 2012 shooting death of 20 - year - old Ka'Loni Flynn of Fort Smith and the resulting death of the fetus.
45_12ecbplus.2: The Times Record reported Friday that trial is expected to last several days.
45_12ecbplus.3: Prosecutors say Simpson called Flynn several times and arranged to meet her on a rural road, then shot her in the head.
45_12ecbplus.4: Defense attorney Warren Gotcher said Simpson did not call Flynn and never owned a phone like the one that called her the night she was killed.
45_12ecbplus.5: Gotcher also denied that Simpson was the father of Flynn's baby.

8_6ecbplus.0: War - Zone Athens: three people dead, many buildings burning as general strike march turns into a battle
8_6ecbplus.2: Three people have suffocated to death as a result of a fire in Marfin Bank during ongoing battles between anti - measure protesters and police in Athens.
8_6ecbplus.3: The Athens protest march marking the zenith of the general strike called for the 5th of May was attended by an approximate 200, 000 ( 20, 000 which is the foreign broadcast number referring to the PAME march alone ), although because of lack of media coverage due to the media participation in the general strike no concrete estimates can be made.
8_6ecbplus.4: After the PAME ( Communist Party union ) protesters left Syntagma square, the first lines of the main march started arriving before the Parliament with the first clashes erupting at the end of Stadiou street.
8_6ecbplus.5: The march then walked on the Unknown Soldier grounds leading the Presidential Guard to retreat, and attempted to storm the Parliament but was pushed back by riot police forces which today demonstrated a particularly staunch attitude and resolve against the demonstrators.
8_6ecbplus.6: Soon battles erupted around the Parliament with protesters throwing Molotov cocktails and rocks, with one riot police armored van torched, and the police responding by extended use of tear gas that soon made Athens' atmosphere unbearably acrid.
8_6ecbplus.7: As more blocks reached Syntagma square, the battles spread across the city center and lasted for more than five hours.
8_6ecbplus.8: During the clashes several state buildings were set ablaze including the County Headquarters of Attika.
8_6ecbplus.9: At the time of writing the Ministry of Finance is reported to be on fire, and vital tax documents as destroyed by the raging fire.
8_6ecbplus.10: However the strange thing is that it is the fourth floor of the building that is burning, at a height inapproachable to petrol bombs.
8_6ecbplus.11: The building is in danger of total collapse.
8_6ecbplus.12: According to news reports that began at 14: 00 Greek time after, under pressure by the events, most radio and TV stations decided to break their strike, claim that the fire at Marfin Bank's Stadiou street branch that has led to the death of three workers ( one a pregnant woman ) was started by protesters.
8_6ecbplus.13: However this remains an unsubstantiated claim.
8_6ecbplus.14: A similar case three decades ago had originally put the blame for the fire at Kappa - Marousi building on Panepistimiou street, leading to the death of several people inside, to anarchists, while its was later proved the fire was caused by tear gas fired by the police.
8_6ecbplus.15: After the tragic death of the three workers made the round of Athens, new clashes started to spread in the Greek capital, with a large crowd gathered outside the burned bank when Marfin's boss tried to visit the site.
8_6ecbplus.16: Clashes broke out between the crowd and police when the former attacked the bank magnate accusing him of forcing the dead workers to scab on a general strike and locking them in the building despite them demanding to evacuate it since 12: 00.
8_6ecbplus.17: In Parliament the Communist Party of Greece has accused the government for the deaths, claiming it was a result of agents provocateur fascist groups.
8_6ecbplus.18: The claims of the Communist Party are based on the fact that 50 fascists tried to enter the PAME demo bearing the flags of the union earlier in the morning.
8_6ecbplus.19: The fascists were spotted, chased and sought refuge behind riot police lines.
8_6ecbplus.20: Accusing the extreme - right as being behind the deaths, the Coalition of Radical Left has declared in Parliament that the government cannot pretend to be in grief for the loss of life, as it has been attacking human life by all means possible.
8_6ecbplus.21: Meanwhile, extended clashes broke out in Salonika where approximately 50, 000 people marched destroying dozens of banks and corporate shops in Greece's second largest city.
8_6ecbplus.22: Clashes with the police continued for several hours.
8_6ecbplus.23: According to news broadcasts anarchist have occupied the Labour Center of the city.
8_6ecbplus.24: In Patras, around 20, 000 protesters were joined by tractor drivers and garbage truck drivers on their vehicles, as flaming barricades were erected along central streets of the city and clashes developed between protestors and the police.
8_6ecbplus.25: In Ioannina the protesters attacked banks and corporate shops leading to extended use of chemicals by the police.
8_6ecbplus.26: In Heraklion, 10, 000 people are reported as marching against the measures.
8_6ecbplus.27: In Corfu, protesters taking part in the anti - measures march occupied the County Headquarters.
8_6ecbplus.28: Protesters have occupied the Administrative Headquarters of Naxos and the City Hall of Naoussa.
8_6ecbplus.29: As a result of the Athens riots, the police have cordoned off the entire center of the city, erecting check points of entry and exit, while all police work permits have been recalled.
8_6ecbplus.30: At the time of writing battles continue to rage in the inner city, while news broadcasts claim the police is mobilising its forces to storm an anarchist squat in Exarcheia.

1_1ecbplus.0: Lindsay Lohan Leaves Betty Ford, Checks Into Malibu Rehab
1_1ecbplus.2: Lindsay Lohan has left the Betty Ford Center and is moving to a rehab facility in Malibu, Calif. , Access Hollywood has confirmed.
1_1ecbplus.3: A spokesperson for The Los Angeles Superior Court confirmed to Access that a judge signed an order yesterday allowing the transfer to Cliffside, where she will continue with her 90 - day court - mandated rehab.
1_1ecbplus.4: Lohan ’ s attorney, Shawn Holley, spoke out about the move.
1_1ecbplus.5: “ Lindsay is grateful for the treatment she received at the Betty Ford Center.
1_1ecbplus.6: She has completed her course of treatment there and looks forward to continuing her treatment and building on the foundation established at Betty Ford, ” Holley said in a statement to Access.
1_1ecbplus.7: The actress checked into the Betty Ford Center in May as part of a plea deal stemming from her June 2012 car accident case.

6_4ecbplus.0: Gary Ross back in talks to direct 'The Hunger Games' sequel 'Catching Fire'
6_4ecbplus.2: Despite reports last week that said Gary Ross would definitely not be returning to direct The Hunger Games sequel, Catching Fire, it seems he will be back at the negotiating table with Lionsgate this week.
6_4ecbplus.3: The Hollywood Reporter says Ross is set to meet with Lionsgate officials on Monday to resume negotiations.
6_4ecbplus.4: According to THR, two major sticking points are salary ( Ross apparently wants a raise ) and schedule, with The Hunger Games set to begin filming in August.
6_4ecbplus.5: That's in part to accomodate Jennifer Lawrence's January start date for filming the X - Men: First Class sequel, a project that legally and contractually holds priority for the actress over Catching Fire.
6_4ecbplus.6: Lionsgate is also under pressure to meet a previously announced November 2013 release date for Catching Fire.
6_4ecbplus.7: The majority of fans were outspoken last week in their disappointment that Ross would not return for Catching Fire.
6_4ecbplus.8: Some launched the "Gary Ross Is Boss" campaign to show support, a petition has been circulating Twitter, and it will be the top discussion subject on Monday night's episode of the HG Fireside Chat podcast.
6_4ecbplus.9: What do you think about Ross returning ( or possibly not ) for Catching Fire?
6_4ecbplus.10: Sound off in the comments below!

12_4ecbplus.0: Indian Navy captures 26 Somali pirates in Gulf of Aden
12_4ecbplus.1: Published on: Fri, 11 Nov 2011 at 09: 56 IST
12_4ecbplus.2: New Delhi / Mumbai: An Indian warship foiled a five - boat pirate attack on merchant vessels transiting the Gulf of Aden on Friday capturing 26 Somani brigands on three of the skiffs and confiscating their weapons.
12_4ecbplus.3: Patrol vessel INS Sukanya was escorting the five merchant vessels through the Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor in the Gulf of Aden on Thursday morning when the warship's crew noticed the five - boat pirate formation approaching the cargo ship group.
12_4ecbplus.4: "The warship immediately altered towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them, " the officer said, adding the pirate skiffs then reversed course and tried to flee the area.
12_4ecbplus.5: "While two of the skiffs and its crew managed to get away, Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three skiffs and carried out well - practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action.
12_4ecbplus.6: "The three boats had a total of 26 Somali crew on board.
12_4ecbplus.7: During the operation, six AK - 47 rifles, 12 magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition were found and confiscated, " the officer said.
12_4ecbplus.8: He said that in addition, the naval boarding party also found a host of other equipment such as grapnels, ladders and rope - handling gloves, all of which confirmed their intent to attack and hijack the merchant vessels.
12_4ecbplus.9: This anti - piracy action by INS Sukanya was the fifth successful operation by its crew during its current patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden since September this year.
12_4ecbplus.10: The officer said that INS Sukanya has seized a total of 14 AK - 47 rifles, 31 magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition during the five operations it carried out there.

41_1ecbplus.0: Breaking News: Sudan Bombs Yida Refugee Camp in South Sudan
41_1ecbplus.2: The Sudan Armed Forces, or SAF, attacked a refugee camp in South Sudan at 2: 53 p. m. local time today.
41_1ecbplus.3: Enough Project sources indicated that no one was killed or injured in the attack, contrary to initial estimates from the Unity state government.
41_1ecbplus.5: A SAF spokesman denied the attack occurred.
41_1ecbplus.6: At least four bombs were reportedly dropped.
41_1ecbplus.7: Sources on the ground told Enough that one bomb, which did not explode, fell directly within the camp, in a primary school yard, with several more falling in the close vicinity.
41_1ecbplus.8: A Reuters correspondent reported hearing a large explosion, then saw "a crater about two metres ( 6. 6 feet ) wide, an unexploded bomb wedged in the side of a school building and a white aircraft flying north.
41_1ecbplus.9: Observers believe the attacks were carried out by the SAF's signature Antonov bombers.
41_1ecbplus.10: One of the bombs landed inside a primary school yard in the camp, according to citizen journalist Ryan Boyette, who was on the phone with sources in the camp when the raid began.
41_1ecbplus.11: Boyette reported school was in session but no children or staff were injured, since the bomb did not explode.
41_1ecbplus.12: Three other bombs allegedly exploded outside the camp: two landed and exploded on the outskirts, near the airfield where two U. N. aircraft had landed today to deliver food.
41_1ecbplus.13: The first aircraft departed without incident, but the bombings reportedly began shortly after the second aircraft arrived.
41_1ecbplus.15: Yida is home to more than 22, 000 refugees, many of whom walked at least seven days across the border to flee indiscriminate bombing and approaching famine conditions in Sudan's South Kordofan state.
41_1ecbplus.16: Since fighting between the SAF and the Sudanese Peoples' Liberation Army - North, or SPLA - N, began in July, hundreds of thousands of civilians have fled South Kordofan, many into the border areas of newly independent South Sudan.
41_1ecbplus.17: The attack on Yida camp comes shortly after reports of aerial bombardments in South Sudan's Upper Nile state, making it Sudan's second unprovoked military attack on the sovereign state of South Sudan in the last three days.
41_1ecbplus.18: In a November 9 press conference, South Sudan President Salva Kiir stated his country would not retaliate for the reported bombing of Guffa in Upper Nile state on Tuesday, which he said killed seven.
41_1ecbplus.19: It remains to be seen how the Government of South Sudan will respond to this second attack within its borders; President Kiir held a press conference today on relations with Sudan just hours before the alleged attack on Yida camp.
41_1ecbplus.20: "The regime in Khartoum is attempting to provoke South Sudan into restarting a war, " said Enough Project Co - Founder John Prendergast, quoted by the Associated Press.
41_1ecbplus.21: "The regime's endgame is to either capture South Sudan's oilfields along their common border, or achieve a stronger negotiating position on shared oil revenues and border demarcation. 33_6ecbplus.0: Guilty verdict for murderer of Brooklyn mother of 12
33_6ecbplus.1: A Brooklyn jury has returned a guilty verdict for Andrew Lopez for the murder of Zurana Horton and the injury of two others.
33_6ecbplus.2: Convicted of second - degree murder and assault in the first degree, Lopez, 20, faces a potential sentence of life in prison when he is sentenced by Justice Vincent Del Giudice.
33_6ecbplus.3: In October 2011, Lopez and his co - defendant and half - brother Jonathan Carrasquillo, 24, were arrested in connection with a shooting in Brownsville's Howard housing projects.
33_6ecbplus.4: Surveillance footage, provided as evidence to the jurors, captures the horrific event as it unfolded.
33_6ecbplus.5: The video shows Horton, a mother of 12, on the street near a school immediately prior to the shooting.
33_6ecbplus.6: It shows her attempting to shield herself from the spray of bullets, and ultimately her fatally wounded body on the sidewalk.
33_6ecbplus.7: "Zurana Horton became a victim of the senseless gang violence that plagues Brooklyn, " prosecutor Seth Goldman said during the murder trial of Lopez and Carrasquillo.
33_6ecbplus.8: It was said throughout the investigation and trial that Lopez and Carrasquillo were targeting members of a rival gang when Horton and the two other victims killed and injured in the crossfire.
33_6ecbplus.9: Carrasquillo allegedly ordered Lopez to shoot.
33_6ecbplus.10: The jury is still deliberating on Carrasquillo's verdict.

29_3ecbplus.0: Colts Beat Chiefs 20 - 13, Clinch 5th Seed In AFC Playoffs
29_3ecbplus.2: Andrew Luck wielded his fourth quarter magic wand yet again, willing Colts to victory over hapless Chiefs and into the 2012 playoffs!
29_3ecbplus.4: Too bad the game that put the 2012 Indianapolis Colts into the playoffs was such a dud.
29_3ecbplus.5: But, a win is a win, and prior to the start of the 2012 regular season, very few ( if any! ) people had the Colts winning ten games and earning a post - season birth.
29_3ecbplus.6: On Sunday, in their Week 16 match - up with a Kansas City team some thought would be a playoff contender in 2012, the Colts took care of business and dispatched the Chiefs 20 - 13.
29_3ecbplus.7: The key to the game was ( drrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrums rolling. .. ) turnovers!
29_3ecbplus.10: Two Brady Quinn interceptions and a boneheaded fumbled by Jamaal Charles were what won this game for the Colts.
29_3ecbplus.11: That, and some fourth quarter heroics by the offense, but mostly it was KC just being really, really bad.
29_3ecbplus.12: For the second time this season, Darius Butler picked off a pass and returned it for a TD.
29_3ecbplus.13: In this game, he did it on KC's opening driving, scooping the ball off the turf and scampering in from 32 yards out to give the Colts a 7 - 0 lead.
29_3ecbplus.14: Unfortunately, the Colts offense simply could not sustain drives.
29_3ecbplus.15: Dropped passes ( I counted three ) were the bane of Indy's offense early on.
29_3ecbplus.16: Because drives could not be sustained, the Chiefs began to gash the Colts in the running game.
29_3ecbplus.17: KC blasted Indy with 352 net rushing yards.
29_3ecbplus.20: Still, to further illustrate to you, our well - informed readers, how running the football is nearly meaningless in this league, the Chiefs never led in this game despite running all over an extremely porous and injured Colts defense.
29_3ecbplus.21: Part of the reason KC ran so effectively was the awful play of Pat Angerer, how should so obviously be on IR right now it's not even funny.
29_3ecbplus.22: He redeemed himself a bit by forcing a critical fumble late in the second quarter, but that play was mostly the fumble - prone Jamaal Charles ( 3 on the season ) being careless with the ball.
29_3ecbplus.23: Still, despite three turnovers, KC managed to tie the game going itno the fourth.
29_3ecbplus.24: Then, as he has done so many times this year, Andrew Luck wielded his magic wand and willed the Colts to victory.
29_3ecbplus.25: The Colts offense went on a 13 - play drive starting at their own 27, ate up 6: 05 of the clock, and capped it off with a 7 - yard touchdown pass from Luck to ( who else ) Reggie Wayne.
29_3ecbplus.29: The Colts are the second team in NFL history to make the post - season the year after posting a 2 - 14 ( or worse ) record the year prior.
29_3ecbplus.30: Andrew Luck set an NFL record, throwing for 205 yards in the game, swelling his season yardage to 4, 183.
29_3ecbplus.31: Cam Newton in 2011 had the previous record with 4, 051 yards.
29_3ecbplus.32: The guy who had it before Cam?
29_3ecbplus.34: Luck's fourth quarter drive was his 7th game - winning drive this season.
29_3ecbplus.35: That's both a rookie record and an NFL record.
29_3ecbplus.36: No QB has ever had seven game - winning drives in one year.
29_3ecbplus.38: Dwayne Allen also got into the record books.
29_3ecbplus.39: He eclipsed Ken Dilger's franchise record for catches by a rookie tight end in one season.
29_3ecbplus.40: Allen had three catches on Sunday, bringing his season total to 43.
29_3ecbplus.43: Jim Harbaugh, the man who would go on to recruit Andrew Luck at Stanford before going to to coach the San Francisco 49ers.
29_3ecbplus.44: with the win in KC, coupled with the Steelers losing to the Bengals 13 - 10, all the teams in the AFC playoffs are set.
29_3ecbplus.45: Also locked up is the No. 5 seed for the Colts.
29_3ecbplus.46: They will face the No. 4 seed, which could mean a trip to Baltimore to face the Ravens, the team Chuck Pagano used to coach for.
29_3ecbplus.47: Speaking of Pagano, he is scheduled to return to work full - time tomorrow as the head coach after taking a leave of absence to battle leukemia.
29_3ecbplus.48: His cancer is now in remission, and he returns to a team that is bound for the post - season.
