36_9ecbplus.0: Warren Jeffs arraigned in Texas on sex charges
36_9ecbplus.2: Polygamist sect leader Warren Jeffs was quietly extradited from Utah to Texas, where he was arraigned Wednesday to face trial on bigamy and sexual assault charges.
36_9ecbplus.3: Jeffs, who was indicted more than two years ago, appeared during a brief hearing in San Angelo wearing glasses, orange jail pants and a gray sweat shirt, Texas Attorney General's Office spokesman Jerry Strickland said.
36_9ecbplus.4: The 54 - year - old Jeffs was not asked to enter a plea and spoke only to tell he judge that he needed more time to find a lawyer, Strickland said.
36_9ecbplus.5: Texas authorities have charged the ecclesiastical head of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints with felony bigamy, aggravated sexual assault and assault.
36_9ecbplus.6: Prosecutors plan to try the charges separately, with the first trial scheduled to begin Jan. 24.
36_9ecbplus.7: The charges stem from the 2008 raid of the Yearning For Zion Ranch in Eldorado, where authorities seized more than 400 children and placed them in state custody on suspicion that the girls were being sexually abused and the boys were being raised to be sexual predators.
36_9ecbplus.8: Most of the children were eventually returned to their families, but several men in the sect who see Jeffs as their spiritual leader were charged with child sexual assault and abuse.
36_9ecbplus.9: On Wednesday, Jeffs was in the same courtroom where several members of his church were convicted.
36_9ecbplus.10: He was brought to Texas a day earlier from Utah, where he was convicted in a case stemming from the marriage of an underage girl to her cousin.
36_9ecbplus.12: A phone message left with Jeffs' attorneys in Utah was not returned Wednesday.
36_9ecbplus.13: Willie Jessop, a spokesman for the church, declined immediate comment.
36_9ecbplus.14: Jeffs is being held without bond at a jail outside San Angelo in West Texas.
36_9ecbplus.15: During the hearing, District Judge Barbara Walther read Jeffs the indictment and asked if he understood the charges.
36_9ecbplus.16: He declined to sign a scheduling order that laid out the dates of his court appearances, Strickland said.
36_9ecbplus.17: Strickland called the jail choice an issue of "security. "
36_9ecbplus.18: He did not elaborate, but noted that prosecutors were not approaching the case differently because of Jeffs' high profile.
36_9ecbplus.19: "When you have sexual assault of a child, it doesn't matter who you are, " Strickland said.
36_9ecbplus.20: Utah Department of Corrections spokesman Steve Gehrke said Wednesday that prison officials transported Jeffs to the Salt Lake City airport Tuesday and turned him over to Texas law enforcement.
36_9ecbplus.21: A Texas Ranger and an officer from the Attorney General's Office went to Utah to pick up Jeffs and flew with him back to Texas, Strickland said.
36_9ecbplus.22: Jeffs' defense attorneys in Utah had opposed the extradition, arguing that sending Jeffs to Texas before a long - running criminal case in Utah was resolved would deny him the right to a speedy trial.
36_9ecbplus.23: But the Utah Supreme Court ruled Nov. 23 that it would not block the transfer.
36_9ecbplus.24: Jeffs had been held at the Utah State Prison since his arrest, and eventual conviction, on two charges of rape as an accomplice for his role in the 2001 marriage of an underage follower - then 14 - to her 19 - year - old cousin.
36_9ecbplus.25: In July, the Utah Supreme overturned the 2007 convictions.
36_9ecbplus.26: Prosecutors there have yet to decide whether they'll retry Jeffs.

26_5ecbplus.0: Vincent 'The Chin' Gigante died while in prison custody on December 19, 2005.

44_9ecbplus.2: HP has been moving fast and strong into services and have continued the trend with today's acquisition of EYP Mission Critical Facilities, a consulting firm specializing in large data center design and operations support.
44_9ecbplus.3: Coming on the heels of last month's expansion of their SaaS offerings, one imagines that before long you will simply be able to turn your keys over to HP and take off on a long vacation while they provision, support, and run your business.
44_9ecbplus.4: In fact, this may not be far from the vision that CEO Mark Hurd has for the company, as revealed today also during his keynote speech at Oracle's OpenWorld conference.
44_9ecbplus.5: Consolidation has clearly been on his mind, and the recent acquisitions presage more in the future, driven as he states by " … a push from an IT perspective to do more standardization and to have fewer suppliers, " as well as a number of players with an excess of cash on hand.
44_9ecbplus.6: While I am certainly one of those pushing from the IT perspective to have fewer suppliers and more standardization, you have to be careful how you go about it, and although I am sure acquisition such as EYP MCF are brilliant for HP's business, I am skeptical about their value to customers.
44_9ecbplus.7: I think the conflation of purveyors of advice with purveyors of service and equipment is dangerous and if anyone was expecting to get unbiased opinion out of EYP MCF about the gear to build out their data center with, that's probably gone by the wayside.
44_9ecbplus.8: Consolidation can be a boon when it results in better alignment and firmer standards; the danger is when the alignment locks you in to a vendor and the standards turn out to be proprietary.

36_11ecbplus.0: Warren Jeffs Trial: Defends 'Spiritual' Marriage, Polygamy
36_11ecbplus.2: Warren Jeffs, leader of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints, who has been silent since his trial began last Thursday, spoke for the first time with the jury present Friday.
36_11ecbplus.3: Jeffs is charged with two counts of sexual assault for raping two under - aged girls and fathering a child with one of the girls.
36_11ecbplus.4: Objecting to the testimony from an FBI agent about documents seized from his church's compound in 2008, Jeffs delivered a 55 - minute speech arguing that the raid on the church was illegal and that charges brought upon him and other members of the FLDS were unwarranted.
36_11ecbplus.5: "You are now touching that which is sacred.
36_11ecbplus.6: Thus on these grounds we call upon this court to render justice before sacred trust is trampled upon, " Jeffs said during his objection.
36_11ecbplus.7: During the raid of the Yearning for Zion Ranch, executed after a tip that turned out to be a hoax, police witnessed several underage girls who were heavily pregnant.
36_11ecbplus.8: This led to the arrest of Jeffs as well as 11 other men of the FLSD.
36_11ecbplus.9: Thus far, seven men have been tried and convicted of sexual assault and bigamy, among other crimes, and have received sentences of between six and 75 years.
36_11ecbplus.10: Jeffs himself may receive up to 119 - years in prison if convicted.
36_11ecbplus.11: In his testimony on Friday, Jeffs said there was no crime, explaining that he and both girls had a "spiritual" marriage bond.
36_11ecbplus.12: He went on to say that the FLDS must "follow the law set out for it by God. "
36_11ecbplus.13: "If we do not live these laws we are damned here and hereafter.
36_11ecbplus.14: We believe in a marriage system of eternity called celestial marriage, wherein celestial means heavenly authorized, not to be intervened by government intervention, " Jeffs said.
36_11ecbplus.15: Jeffs ended his speech by saying, "Amen. "
36_11ecbplus.16: Jeffs remained completely silent during the first four days of the trial, during which he dismissed his defense team in order to serve as his own defense, and refused to give an opening statement after the judge declined his request for more time to prepare.
36_11ecbplus.17: "Mr. Jeffs, the court is not going to recess these proceeding to let you go to law school, " said U. S. District Judge Barbara Walther.
36_11ecbplus.18: In the meanwhile, special prosecutor for the Texas attorney general's office, Eric Nichols, delivered his opening statement, detailing that he will submit as evidence an audio recording of Jeffs having sex with a 12 - year - old as well as a DNA report confirming Jeffs as the father of a 15 - year - old FLSD member's child.
36_11ecbplus.19: Jeffs remained silent throughout the prosecution's opening statement but interjected repeatedly during Nichol's response to his speech.
36_11ecbplus.20: Judge Walther recessed the court and directed that Jeffs speak with his counsel, who remains available in case they are needed, about proper court decorum.
36_11ecbplus.21: Director of criminal clinics for the Texas Tech School of Law, Patrick Metze, commented on the case, saying Jeffs won't be able to continue the trial without lawyers.
36_11ecbplus.22: "At some point, the judge will have had enough, so it's not going to be a pleasnt experience and she's not just going to let him prophesize, " Metze told the San Angelo Standard Times.

44_8ecbplus.1: HP lands green datacenter consultant EYP
44_8ecbplus.2: Extending its reach into the ripening green - consulting space, HP today announced the acquisition of EYP Mission Critical Facilities, a consulting company specializing in strategic technology planning, design and operations support for large - scale datacenters.
44_8ecbplus.3: Extending its reach into the ripening green - consulting space, HP today announced the acquisition of EYP Mission Critical Facilities, a consulting company specializing in strategic technology planning, design and operations support for large - scale datacenters.
44_8ecbplus.4: The financial details of the acquisition were not disclosed.
44_8ecbplus.5: HP's aim, however, is clear: to tap into the growing demand for more energy - efficient datacenters by bolstering its existing Data Center Services, and no doubt hawking more HP gear along the way.
44_8ecbplus.6: "The datacenter is the foundation of IT for enterprises, an essential building block for driving business growth and adapting to changing business objectives, " said John McCain, senior vice president and general manager of HP Services in a written statement.
44_8ecbplus.7: "Acquiring EYP Mission Critical Facilities boosts HP's ability to help customers transform their datacenters and build dynamic computing environments from the ground up. "
44_8ecbplus.8: EYP has developed a green reputation since its establishment in 2001 as a split - off from A / E giant Einhorn Yaffee Prescott.
44_8ecbplus.9: Headquartered in New York with 13 offices worldwide and technical staff of more than 350, the company's arsenal of tools includes a homegrown software package called EnerOpt, designed to assess and optimize energy consumption in the datacenter.
44_8ecbplus.10: Among its clients, the company claims 25 percent of the Fortune magazine's list of top EPA Green Partners.
44_8ecbplus.11: Moreover, the company designed the first LEED - rated datacenter for Fannie Mae in Urbana, Maryland, and is currently designing a datacenter for the Lawrence Berkeley National Labs.
44_8ecbplus.12: Like other big - name hardware companies, including IBM, Dell, and Sun, HP has been playing up the green credentials of its wares, such as its Smart Dynamic Cooling offering, power capping features in its Systems Insight Manager software, and its recently announced line of more energy - efficient ProLiant BL460c blades.
44_8ecbplus.13: Moreover, the big boys of technology have also started adding more green - hued services to their portfolios.
44_8ecbplus.14: In August, IBM added http: / / blogs. business2. com / greenwombat / 2007 / 08 / ibm - moves - into -. html ">carbon consulting to business consulting operation.
44_8ecbplus.15: Also in August, Sun unveiled an Eco Services Suite.
44_8ecbplus.16: BT is also on the list.
44_8ecbplus.17: HP's acquisition of EYP is subject to certain closing conditions and is expected to be completed within HP's first fiscal quarter.

7_10ecbplus.0: Wladimir Klitschko stops Tony Thompson in 6th round to retain world heavyweight titles
7_10ecbplus.1: Wladimir Klitschko stopped Tony Thompson in the sixth round to retain his WBA, IBF and WBO heavyweight title belts Saturday night.
7_10ecbplus.2: The 36 - year - old champion Klitschko, 58 - 3 with 51 knockouts, floored Thompson with a big right hand near the end of the fifth round at Stade de Suisse, and the 40 - year - old American never recovered.
7_10ecbplus.3: The Ukrainian champion dropped Thompson again in the sixth, and referee Sam Williams gave the challenger a standing count before stopping the fight.

7_10ecbplus.5: Thompson, who was the mandatory challenger nominated by the IBF, dropped to 36 - 3.

8_4ecbplus.0: Three dead after fire - bomb hits bank during Greek riots
8_4ecbplus.1: A FIRE - BOMB attack on a bank in Athens left at least three people dead as police fought pitched battles with striking protesters furious at brutal spending cuts designed to avoid national bankruptcy.
8_4ecbplus.2: Hooded youths hurled petrol bombs at stores and businesses in the Greek capital, setting the bank and two government buildings ablaze.
8_4ecbplus.3: Protesters also tried to storm the Greek Parliament and the rioting spread to Greece's second city, Thessaloniki.
8_4ecbplus.4: Police said at least three people, a man and two women, were killed in the fire - bomb attack.
8_4ecbplus.5: Firefighters said as many as 20 people had been inside the bank.
8_4ecbplus.6: It was unclear if the dead were customers or bank employees.
8_4ecbplus.7: Two buildings, one used by tax officials and another by regional authorities, also caught fire.
8_4ecbplus.8: Greek President Carolos Papoulias condemned the violence, saying the debt - hit country had "reached the edge of the abyss".
8_4ecbplus.9: "Our country has reached the edge of the abyss.
8_4ecbplus.10: It is the responsibility of us all to not take the step into the void.
8_4ecbplus.11: "What is at stake in coming days is to keep social cohesion and social peace. "
8_4ecbplus.12: Greek Prime Minister George Papandreou said the firebombing was a "raw murderous act".
8_4ecbplus.13: Athens underground stations were shuttered and the international airport deserted as tens of thousands of union members rallied on the eve of a vote in parliament on the planned cuts and tax hikes.
8_4ecbplus.14: The general strike was the first major test of the Socialist government's resolve to push through unprecedented measures since agreeing a ����110 billion ( $158 billion ) EU and IMF debt bailout over the weekend.
8_4ecbplus.15: Prime Minister George Papandreou's insistence that the measures are vital for the nation's survival failed to dissuade unions from paralysing public transport, grounding air traffic and preventing ferries from leaving docks.
8_4ecbplus.16: After rallying in two separate demonstrations in central Athens, members of the main unions began converging on parliament, where the Government was preparing for the measures to be voted on Thursday.

14_8ecbplus.2: A Waitrose supermarket in a Somerset town caught fire yesterday ( July 21st ), causing substantial damage to the building ’ s roof.
14_8ecbplus.3: The fire service was called at approximately 06: 00 BST to the store, which is on Wellington ’ s high street.
14_8ecbplus.4: Upon arrival they found that the roof fire was quite significant.
14_8ecbplus.5: Fire crews from Devon and Somerset Fire and Rescue attended the scene and then called a further four appliances to help, a report from ITV revealed.
14_8ecbplus.6: They contained the fire to one corner of the roof but could not be extinguished before a part of the entrance building collapsed.
14_8ecbplus.7: However, the main area of the one - storey supermarket was left largely intact with only smoke damage.
14_8ecbplus.8: By about 09: 30 BST the fire was largely out, with crews checking for hotspots.
14_8ecbplus.9: The fire service ’ s Matt Goodman explained that the fire began on the outside of the building.
14_8ecbplus.10: "It then quickly spread to the roof so there is a significant amount of damage to the roof, but thankfully due to the early actions of the Wellington crew we could get a large weight of response to the scene, ” he said.
14_8ecbplus.11: "We've been able to prevent it spreading to other areas of the building, so the main store on the inside has got a reasonably small amount of smoke damage. "
14_8ecbplus.12: A spokesperson from Waitrose explained that no one was hurt in the incident and was grateful to the emergency services for their quick response and effective help.
14_8ecbplus.13: Investigations into what caused the fire are ongoing.
14_8ecbplus.14: In a bid to remove potential fire hazards, commercial buildings and non - domestic premises in England and Wales are already forced to undertake a 'suitable and sufficient' fire risk assessment carried out under the Regulatory Reform ( Fire Safety ) Order 2005.
14_8ecbplus.15: While the overwhelming majority of premises do this, if the assessment is thought to have been carried out to an insufficient extent, the Responsible Person can face an unlimited fine or up to two years in prison.

45_3ecbplus.0: Oklahoma man pleads not guilty in deaths of Arkansas woman and her fetus

16_3ecbplus.2: Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department, California
16_3ecbplus.4: Deputy Jerry Ortiz was shot and killed after knocking on a door during an investigation.
16_3ecbplus.5: Deputy Ortiz had gone to an apartment complex in the city of Hawaiian Gardens to question a woman about a shooting that had taken place the previous day.

16_3ecbplus.9: The suspect, who was on parole and had prior arrests for convictions for assault with a deadly weapon, resisting arrest, burglary, as well as for gun and drug crimes, was charged with first degree murder and faces the death penalty.
16_3ecbplus.10: In April 2007 the suspect was found guilty of capital murder and sentenced to death.
16_3ecbplus.11: Six months prior to this incident, Deputy Ortiz's brother - in - law, Corrections Officer Manuel A. Gonzalez, of the California Department of Corrections, was stabbed to death by a gang member inmate at California Institution for Men in Chino.

3_2ecbplus.0: Convicted Child Molestor Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr. On The Lam in Texas
3_2ecbplus.2: A convicted child molester who was supposedly confined to a wheelchair overpowered two prison guards today, handcuffed them, stole their weapons and walked off wearing one of their uniforms.
3_2ecbplus.3: Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr. , 49, is serving a life sentence for several charges – including indecency with a child – and was en route from the Estelle Unit in Huntsville, Texas, to the Stiles Unit in Beaumont, Texas, when he escaped just after 9 a. m.
3_2ecbplus.4: Lyons said that Comeaux used a wheelchair in prison – he "claimed it was necessary for his mobility" – and added, "Since he fled on foot, that's obviously in question. "
3_2ecbplus.5: Described as a 6 - feet tall and weighing approximately 200 pounds, Lyons warned that Comeaux knows the area where he escaped well and could have family nearby.
3_2ecbplus.6: He initially was imprisoned on February 1979 on three 10 - year sentences for rape of a child, aggravated rape of a child, and burglary of a building with the intent to commit theft.
3_2ecbplus.7: His supervision was revoked and he returned to prison in May 1984 with a new charge of indecency with a child, given a new 20 year sentence.
3_2ecbplus.8: Between 1991 and 1998, Comeaux was in and out of prison on parole violations until he finally returned to prison in June 1999 to serve a life sentence for aggravated sexual assault.
3_2ecbplus.9: In 1999, Comeaux stabbed his wife during a visit, using his wheelchair to pin her against a wall while he stabbed her.
3_2ecbplus.10: His wife survived, but another inmate who tried to break up the attack also suffered stab wounds, and Comeaux was convicted of additional assault charges and received two additional life sentences.

14_7ecbplus.2: FIRE crews from Tiverton and Cullompton were this morning called in to help fight a major blaze at the Waitrose supermarket in Wellington.
14_7ecbplus.3: The fire has destroyed a large section of the store and fire crews and investigators are still on the scene.
14_7ecbplus.4: Two engines were sent to the store after several members of the public called emergency services at 6am.
14_7ecbplus.5: When they arrived they called in an additional six engines, an aerial platform and an incident command vehicle.
14_7ecbplus.6: A corner of the building measuring 50m by 50m containing food was well alight.
14_7ecbplus.7: By 6. 30am the fire had been contained using water and foam and police had been called.
14_7ecbplus.8: Half an hour later a second aerial platform was called in. and hydrants were being used for extra water.
14_7ecbplus.9: Police advised local residents to shut all doors and windows.
14_7ecbplus.10: Just before 8am crews requested the attendance of an incident support unit from Yeovil for additional drinking water, firefighter welfare and salvage equipment.
14_7ecbplus.11: By 8. 30am crews were using thermal imaging cameras to identify hotspots and an investigation into the cause of the fire was under way.

43_4ecbplus.0: AMD buys Sea Micro for $334M to get into energy - efficient “ microservers ”
43_4ecbplus.2: There ’ s a sea change happening in a segment of the server market dubbed microservers.
43_4ecbplus.3: And Sea Micro has been at the center of it, disrupting the market with energy efficient servers that use lightweight processors from Intel.
43_4ecbplus.4: Advanced Micro Devices is acquiring Sea Micro today for $334 million, including $281 million in cash.
43_4ecbplus.5: Sea Micro has been disruptive because it can pack a lot of computing power in a server rack that is about a sixth of the usual size.
43_4ecbplus.6: Its servers use a quarter of the usual electricity and cost a lot less.
43_4ecbplus.7: The servers use Intel ’ s Atom microprocessors, which are targeted at energy efficient devices such as tablet computers.
43_4ecbplus.8: But AMD ’ s move could shake things up for Intel, which presumably will lose some of its business.
43_4ecbplus.9: The advantage of Sunnyvale, Calif. - based SeaMicro ’ s small and power - efficient computers is that enterprises can now shove a lot more computing power into a given amount of space and use a lot less electrical power, thereby cutting electricity bills dramatically.
43_4ecbplus.10: That matters because electricity costs are the biggest part of the budget for operating data centers.
43_4ecbplus.11: Andrew Feldman, chief executive of Sea Micro has said in past interviews that SeaMicro had become the fastest - growing system company in Silicon Valley history.
43_4ecbplus.12: SeaMicro ’ s customers include France Telecom, Skype, Rogers Wireless, Mozilla, eHarmony, and China Netcom BB.
43_4ecbplus.13: Hundreds of millions of internet users traverse SeaMicro ’ s hardware daily.
43_4ecbplus.14: As we ’ ve described in earlier stories, Intel has been improving its server microprocessors by making them more power efficient.
43_4ecbplus.15: But the microprocessor only accounts for a third of the power consumption in a server.
43_4ecbplus.16: SeaMicro ’ s innovation lies in how it attacks the remaining two - thirds of the power consumption problem.
43_4ecbplus.17: It does so by combining a lot of the extraneous chips into a single, more - efficient custom chip, Feldman said.
43_4ecbplus.18: In its earliest system, SeaMicro put 384 Intel Atom dual - core processors ( for a total of 64 - bit 768 cores ) in a 10 - rack system, which is just 17. 5 inches high.
43_4ecbplus.19: The newer SM10000 - 64HD was a 20 percent improvement over SeaMicro ’ s previous server line and a 150 percent improvement on its compute density record, or the amount of computing power in a given space.
43_4ecbplus.20: That single machine could replace rival systems with a bunch of equipment: 60 traditional servers, four rack switches, four terminal servers, and a load balancing server.
43_4ecbplus.21: It uses a quarter of the power and a sixth of the space.
43_4ecbplus.22: SeaMicro can put an entire server on a motherboard that is 5 inches by 11 inches.
43_4ecbplus.23: Since the hardware is Intel - based, customers don ’ t have to change their software at all.
43_4ecbplus.24: SeaMicro was founded in 2007 and is backed with $60 million in funding by Khosla Ventures, Draper Fisher Jurvetson, Crosslink Capital, and a number of strategic investors.
43_4ecbplus.25: It also won grants from the U. S. Departement of Energy ( $9. 3 million ) and the state of California ( $250, 000 ).
43_4ecbplus.28: SeaMicro also attacked the power consumption problem with a very clever trick known as virtualization.
43_4ecbplus.29: Today, virtualization is frequently used with servers.
43_4ecbplus.30: It is a layer of software that rests between an application and the servers that it runs on.
43_4ecbplus.31: If an application needs only two servers, the virtualization software finds two available servers to run the application.
43_4ecbplus.32: If the application gets busy and needs 10 servers, the virtualization software finds 10 available servers to do the job.
43_4ecbplus.33: The application is no longer tied to specific servers; the virtualization software frees up the overall system and gets more use out of the available servers.
43_4ecbplus.34: SeaMicro did the same thing, but it applied the concept of virtualization to the inside of a server.
43_4ecbplus.35: Feldman designed custom chips that could take the tasks that were handled by everything beyond the Intel microprocessor and its chip set.
43_4ecbplus.36: The custom chips virtualize all of those other components so that it finds the resource when it ’ s needed.
43_4ecbplus.37: It essentially tricks the microprocessor into thinking that the rest of the system is there when it needs it.
43_4ecbplus.38: SeaMicro virtualized a lot of functions that took up a lot of space inside each server in a rack.
43_4ecbplus.39: It also did the same with functions such as storage, networking, server management, and load balancing.
43_4ecbplus.40: Full told, SeaMicro eliminates 90 percent of the components from a system board.
43_4ecbplus.41: SeaMicro calls this CPU / IO virtualization.
43_4ecbplus.42: With it, SeaMicro shrinks the size of the system board from a pizza box to the size of a credit card.
43_4ecbplus.43: By boiling down the rest of the system into a couple of chips, SeaMicro can get rid of a lot of the components in a system, thereby getting rid of space, cost, and power consumption.

2_5ecbplus.0: Ellen DeGeneres Set As Oscars Host For 2014 Academy Awards
2_5ecbplus.2: Ellen DeGeneres will host the Oscars.
2_5ecbplus.3: The comedian and talk show host made the announcement via her Twitter feed on Friday.
2_5ecbplus.4: DeGeneres has experience hosting the Academy Awards: She previously served as emcee during the 2007 ceremony.
2_5ecbplus.5: "I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time, " DeGeneres said in a press release announcing the big news.

4_1ecbplus.1: Hollywood ’ s mermaid Esther Williams dies
4_1ecbplus.2: Champion swimmer turned top box - office draw in 40s and 50s
4_1ecbplus.3: Esther Williams, the swimming champion turned actress who starred in glittering and aquatic Technicolour musicals of the 1940s and 1950s, has died.
4_1ecbplus.5: Williams, whose experiences as a young swimming champion led to a career of Hollywood “ aqua - musicals ” designed just for her, died yesterday in Beverly Hills, California, at the age of 91, her spokesman said.
4_1ecbplus.6: She died peacefully in her sleep and had been in declining health due to old age, spokesman Harlan Boll said.
4_1ecbplus.7: It was the pool — and wartime pinup pictures of her in bathing suits — that made her popular.
4_1ecbplus.8: Williams in a bathing suit became a favourite pinup of US people in World War II, and her popularity continued afterward.

16_2ecbplus.0: Hawaiian Gardens Gangmember Convicted Of Murdering Lakewood Stn. Sheriff's Deputy Jerry Ortiz
16_2ecbplus.2: Add'l Horrific Charges; D. A. Will Now Seek Death Penalty
16_2ecbplus.4: A Superior Court jurty in Norwalk today convicted a Hawaiian Gardens gang member of murdering L. A. County Sheriff's Deputy Jerry Ortiz in June, 2005.
16_2ecbplus.5: The District Attorney's office says in a release that the jury found Jose Luis Orozco, 29, guilty of 1st degree murder, attempted murder and posession of a firearm by a felon.
16_2ecbplus.6: It also found true special circumstances of murder of a police officer intentionally killed while performing his duties, murder to avoid arrest, street gang murder, lying in wait. .. and that Orozco personally used a handgun to commit the murder and the attempted murder, the D. A. 's release says.
16_2ecbplus.7: Sheriff Deputy Ortiz, 35, with LASD's Gang Enforcement Unit, was killed June 24, 2005 outside an apartment in the 12000 block of East 223rd Street in Hawaiian Gardens while investigating a June 20 shooting in which Orozco was a suspect.
16_2ecbplus.8: The D. A. 's release says Deputy Ortiz "spotted Orozco shortly after 3 p. m. the day of the shooting and chased him to the apartment.
16_2ecbplus.9: Orozco was hiding behind the apartment ’ s front door.
16_2ecbplus.10: He fired at the deputy and ran.
16_2ecbplus.11: Orozco was arrested five buildings away on 223rd Street shortly before midnight.
16_2ecbplus.13: Orozco was also convicted of the June 20, 2005 attempted murder of a man shot in the back while doing yard work at a home in the 22000 block of Joliet Avenue in Hawaiian Gardens, a shooting that the jury also determined to be a street crime.
16_2ecbplus.14: Next week, the same jury will begin hearing evidence in the trial's penalty phase in which Deputy D. A. Lowell Anger of the Crimes Against Police Officers Section ( CAPOS ) will seek the death penalty.
16_2ecbplus.15: Deputy Ortiz was a Lakewood Award of Valor winner in 2004 for having faced down an armed carjacker who drew a gun on him and his partner, ending with the death of the carjacker and the arrest of two suspected gang members.
16_2ecbplus.16: The murder of Deputy Ortiz prompted an outpouring of emotion from the community, where he was respected and admired coworkers and members of the community.
16_2ecbplus.17: This was the scene outside the Lakewood Sheriff's station 24 hours after his death.
16_2ecbplus.18: Dep. Ortiz is the fifth Lakewood Sheriff Deputy slain while on duty. .. and his name is now inscribed on the Memorial Wall outside the LASD station on Clark Ave.

44_10ecbplus.0: HP to Acquire Data Center Consultants
44_10ecbplus.2: Electronics manufacturer Hewlett - Packard ( hp. com ) announced on Tuesday that it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire EYP Mission Critical Facilities ( eypmcf. com ), a consulting company that specializes in strategic technology planning, design and operations support for large - scale data centers.
44_10ecbplus.3: Although no financial terms of the transaction were disclosed, it is expected to be completed within HP ’ s first fiscal quarter.
44_10ecbplus.4: By acquiring EYP MCF, HP will be able to help customers to better transform their data centers, optimize energy efficiency and position them for future business growth, says the company.
44_10ecbplus.5: Headquartered in New York, EYP MCF has approximately 350 employees with 13 offices in the US and the UK.
44_10ecbplus.6: The firm provides mission - critical services to enterprises around the world in business sectors including financial services, telecommunications, technology, broadcast, manufacturing and healthcare, as well as numerous federal, state and county government agencies.
44_10ecbplus.7: HP says that EYP MCF ’ s capabilities, particularly its expertise in energy - efficient operations, complement HP ’ s extensive data center services and cost - saving power and cooling solutions, such as Dynamic Smart Cooling.
44_10ecbplus.8: “ The data center is the foundation of IT for enterprises, an essential building block for driving business growth and adapting to changing business objectives, ” says John McCain, senior vice president and general manager, HP Services.
44_10ecbplus.9: “ Acquiring EYP Mission Critical Facilities boosts HP ’ s ability to help customers transform their data centers and build dynamic computing environments from the ground up. ”

18_10ecbplus.0: Detroit Office Shooter Charged With Murder, Attempted Murder
18_10ecbplus.2: A man fired four days earlier from his job as an accountant walked into his old office, passed by the receptionist and made his way to a manager's office with the purpose of killing him with a shotgun, a police sergeant said Wednesday during the man's arraignment.
18_10ecbplus.3: When Monday's violence had concluded, the receptionist - - Madeline Kafoury - - was shot dead and two managers, Paul Riva and Alan Steinberg, were wounded.
18_10ecbplus.4: Steinberg was shot in the hip and has spoken to police about the attack, while Riva had not yet regained consciousness and was on a ventilator.
18_10ecbplus.5: The man accused of shooting his three former co - workers is Anthony LaCalamita III, a 38 - year - old Troy resident who was fired from Gordon Advisors on Thursday.
18_10ecbplus.6: A not guilty plea was entered on LaCalamita's behalf during Wednesday's hearing.
18_10ecbplus.7: LaCalamita is charged with first - degree murder in the death of Kafoury, 63, of Warren.
18_10ecbplus.8: He also is charged with two counts of intent to murder in the shootings of Riva, 47, of Sterling Heights, and Steinberg, 48, of Macomb County's Bruce Township - - as well as three counts of possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony and one count of fleeing and eluding police.
18_10ecbplus.9: LaCalamita was asked by Judge Michael A. Martone if he understood the charges against him and if he was aware that he could be sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole if convicted of first - degree murder.
18_10ecbplus.10: He responded, "Yes, " to the series of questions posed by Martone.
18_10ecbplus.11: The judge ordered him held without bond pending his next court hearing April 19.
18_10ecbplus.12: Kafoury's loved ones attended Wednesday's arraignment, and her daughter, Charlene - - holding a picture of Kafoury - - sobbed loudly during the proceedings.
18_10ecbplus.14: She didn't fire him, " Charlene Kafoury said.
18_10ecbplus.15: LaCalamita sat nearby and did not react to the comments from the victim's daughter.
18_10ecbplus.16: After the hearing, Charlene Kafoury and other loved ones gathered for a news conference.
18_10ecbplus.18: She was our mom and the grandmother of our children, " said Charlie Kafoury, Charlene's brother.
18_10ecbplus.19: "She was an essential point of our lives, " said a tearful Charlie Kafoury, who had difficulty getting out his words.
18_10ecbplus.20: A number of loved ones stood behind him and cried audibly.
18_10ecbplus.21: They engaged in a group hug after the news conference.
18_10ecbplus.22: Troy police Sgt. Barry Whiteside said LaCalamita first stopped at the reception area after 10 a. m. on Monday and talked to Kafoury, then entered Steinberg's office and asked him twice if he wanted to be shot.
18_10ecbplus.23: Steinberg told police he thought LaCalamita was holding a toy gun.
18_10ecbplus.24: "He didn't think it was real until he saw the shotgun was being racked, " Whiteside said.
18_10ecbplus.25: After shooting Steinberg, Whiteside said LaCalamita walked down the hall and into Riva's office.
18_10ecbplus.26: Kafoury, who was standing in the doorway of Riva's office, was struck in her midsection, Whiteside said.
18_10ecbplus.27: She fell to the floor and died from her wounds, he said.
18_10ecbplus.28: LaCalamita then fired one round at Riva, who was struck in the upper chest area.
18_10ecbplus.29: Riva tried to step over Kafoury and collapsed in the hall, Whiteside said.
18_10ecbplus.30: Police said LaCalamita targeted the two managers and also may have intended to shoot another one.
18_10ecbplus.31: "There is a suspicion that there might have been a third upper management official he was seeking, " said Troy police Lt. Gerry Scherlinck.
18_10ecbplus.32: The man, whom police did not identify, was not in the office suite at the time of the attack.
18_10ecbplus.33: Police said the shotgun was armed with buckshot that contained nine pellets in each shot.
18_10ecbplus.34: Some of the pellets hit the victims and some did not, police said.
18_10ecbplus.35: LaCalamita was fired from his position as a general accountant last Thursday because of poor performance, police said.
18_10ecbplus.36: According to receipts police recovered from his apartment, LaCalamita purchased the shotgun around 3: 45 p. m. on Friday.
18_10ecbplus.37: LaCalamita was denied a handgun permit in March, said Scherlinck, who would not say why the permit was denied.
18_10ecbplus.38: LaCalamita was arrested Monday afternoon after leading police on a chase north along Interstate 75 in Genesee County in which speeds reached 120 mph.
18_10ecbplus.39: A 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three live shells were found in the silver Ford Fusion LaCalamita was driving.
18_10ecbplus.40: Police said they found a long, cardboard box consistent to one that would hold a shotgun, as well as empty shell boxes, in a Dumpster outside LaCalamita's apartment during a search Monday evening.

44_4ecbplus.0: HP acquires EYP Mission Critical Facilities
44_4ecbplus.1: HP today announced that it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire EYP Mission Critical Facilities Inc. , a consulting company specializing in strategic technology planning, design, and operations support for large - scale data centers.
44_4ecbplus.3: HP today announced that it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire EYP Mission Critical Facilities Inc. ( EYP MCF ), a consulting company specializing in strategic technology planning, design, and operations support for large - scale data centers.
44_4ecbplus.4: By acquiring EYP MCF, HP will be better able to help customers to transform their data centers, optimize energy efficiency, and position them for future business growth.
44_4ecbplus.5: Headquartered in New York, EYP MCF has approximately 350 employees with 13 offices in the United States and the UK.
44_4ecbplus.6: The firm provides mission - critical services to enterprises around the world in business sectors including financial services, telecommunications, technology, broadcast, manufacturing, and healthcare, as well as numerous federal, state, and county government agencies.
44_4ecbplus.7: From data centers and command and control centers, to trading floors and supercomputing sites, EYP MCF has designed hundreds of technology - intensive, high - performance facilities where monitoring, operational, and energy efficiencies are top - priority business requirements.
44_4ecbplus.8: EYP MCF ’ s capabilities %%MDASSML%% particularly its expertise in energy - efficient operations %%MDASSML%% complement HP ’ s extensive Data Center Services and cost - saving power and cooling solutions, such as Dynamic Smart Cooling.
44_4ecbplus.9: “ The data center is the foundation of IT for enterprises, an essential building block for driving business growth and adapting to changing business objectives, ” said John McCain, senior vice president and general manager, HP Services.
44_4ecbplus.10: “ Acquiring EYP Mission Critical Facilities boosts HP ’ s ability to help customers transform their data centers and build dynamic computing environments from the ground up. ”
44_4ecbplus.11: Peter Gross, chief executive officer of EYP MCF, said, “ Worldwide data center requirements are rapidly growing, with significant year - over - year increases in power consumption, which is fueling demand for energy - efficient power and cooling strategies.
44_4ecbplus.12: HP and EYP Mission Critical Facilities will drive innovation by integrating IT infrastructure into the planning and design of the data center, enabling the customer ’ s whole organization to be more energy efficient and adaptive. ”
44_4ecbplus.13: The transaction is subject to certain closing conditions and is expected to be completed within HP ’ s first fiscal quarter.

43_11ecbplus.1: AMD to Acquire Server Start - Up
43_11ecbplus.2: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. , AMD +0. 26% vowing to change the game in its longtime competition with Intel Corp. , INTC +0. 93% has forged a deal to buy a Silicon Valley start - up that takes the chip maker into the server business.
43_11ecbplus.3: The Sunnyvale, Calif. , company said it will pay $334 million for SeaMicro Inc. , a company known for products called micro servers that pack together many chips in ways that save space and energy.
43_11ecbplus.4: Such products are particularly popular among companies that buy servers in huge volumes to run popular consumer websites.
43_11ecbplus.5: AMD has long battled Intel in making chips for servers, as well as PCs, but it has struggled lately in the larger systems because of late products and other issues.
43_11ecbplus.6: Both companies, meanwhile, face increasing competition from companies making lower - power chips that are based on architecture developed by ARM Holdings PLC.
43_11ecbplus.7: Last year, Hewlett - Packard Co. announced a partnership with Calxeda Inc. , a start - up making ARM - based micro servers.
43_11ecbplus.8: Most chip makers avoid selling systems that use their chips, because such moves can put them in competition with their customers.
43_11ecbplus.9: But Rory Read, a former Lenovo Group Ltd. executive who became AMD chief executive in August, has stressed the need for unconventional tactics against its much - larger rival.
43_11ecbplus.10: In a briefing Wednesday, AMD executives stressed that the main motivation of buying SeaMicro was not to sell servers but to offer communications technology and other elements developed by SeaMicro to allow other server makers to make similar products.
43_11ecbplus.11: "We are not intending to compete with our customers, " said Lisa Su, who recently joined AMD to serve as senior vice president and general manager for global business units.
43_11ecbplus.12: On the other hand, AMD plans to keep supporting SeaMicro's existing customers by selling servers "for the foreseeable future, " Ms. Su said.
43_11ecbplus.13: Those systems now use Intel chips.
43_11ecbplus.14: But AMD plans to also offer systems that use AMD's Opteron chips for servers in the second half of the year, the company said.
43_11ecbplus.15: Mr. Read had already indicated that AMD in the future might offer customers the choice of products that include ARM technology.
43_11ecbplus.16: SeaMicro, meanwhile, had indicated its technology was also designed to support ARM as well as the x86 chips sold by AMD and Intel.
43_11ecbplus.17: SeaMicro Chief Executive Andrew Feldman, who will become general manager of AMD's newly created data - center server solutions business, said the company had more than one interested bidder.
43_11ecbplus.18: But he said it was attracted by AMD management's open attitude toward issues such as supporting other chip designs, as well as a desire to propagate its technology faster than a start - up can.
43_11ecbplus.19: "We came to believe the way to grab this opportunity was the drive of a much larger company, " Mr. Feldman said.
43_11ecbplus.20: The start - up, also based in Sunnyvale, originally passed up Intel's mainstream offering for servers, a chip called Xeon that is a workhorse for companies around the around the world.
43_11ecbplus.21: SeaMicro took Intel's tiny, relatively low - powered Atom chip—best known for use in inexpensive laptop computers called netbooks and now in smartphones—and packaged it for use in data centers.
43_11ecbplus.22: SeaMicro last month held an event with Intel and Samsung Electronics Co. to detail plans to use Xeon chips in its new machines.
43_11ecbplus.23: That shift, the company said at the time, allows customers to use its machines for an array of new tasks that couldn't be addressed before, such as running Web databases rather than simply serving up Web pages.
43_11ecbplus.24: Mr. Feldman said Wednesday that AMD's Opteron chip would further expand the kinds of applications that would fit its technology.
43_11ecbplus.25: Jason Waxman, Intel's general manager for cloud computing, said it has enjoyed its relationship with SeaMicro and expects to keep supplying chips to the company as part of AMD, while working with other makers of micro servers.
43_11ecbplus.26: He noted that Intel has also been acquiring communications - related technology so AMD's motivations were understandable.
43_11ecbplus.27: "You need a broader technology portfolio to service the needs of customers in this market, " Mr. Waxman said.
43_11ecbplus.28: Evercore analyst Patrick Wang said the acquisition was surprising but likely indicates AMD's commitment to the data center and cloud computing.
43_11ecbplus.29: "This is the next step in that direction, " Mr. Wang said.
43_11ecbplus.31: Mr. Wang said AMD likely is using the purchase to acquire server intellectual property, particularly for the high - performance technology, known as a fabric, that connects all the different processors and disk drives to each other.
43_11ecbplus.32: The approach allows data to pass more quickly and efficiently.
43_11ecbplus.33: "SuperMicro is very successful right now, " he said.
43_11ecbplus.34: AMD said $281 million of the purchase price for SeaMicro will be in cash.
43_11ecbplus.35: The company said the acquisition doesn't change its 2012 financial guidance and the transaction is expected to be add to earnings after 2012.

35_11ecbplus.0: San Diego Chargers Defensive Tackle Faces DUI Charges
35_11ecbplus.1: Jamal Williams, the defensive tackle for the San Diego Chargers was arrested on suspicion of drunk driving early morning on Sunday, February 1, 2009.
35_11ecbplus.2: He is the second Chargers ’ player within the last month to be arrested for DUI.
35_11ecbplus.3: Williams was initially pulled over for speeding on a freeway outside downtown.
35_11ecbplus.4: He submitted to a blood - alcohol test, but it will take a few weeks for the results to be completed.
35_11ecbplus.5: Williams was taken to a county jail where he later was released on bail.
35_11ecbplus.6: Williams is an 11 - year veteran and recipient of the Chargers ’ Most Valuable Player Award this season.
35_11ecbplus.7: According to the City Attorney ’ s office, Williams ’ case had not been submitted as of Tuesday, February 3, 2009.
35_11ecbplus.8: The team ’ s general manager, A. J. Smith said that “ we ’ ll continue to monitor the situation and let the legal process run its course. ”
35_11ecbplus.9: He went on to say, “ the Chargers have always been leaders and positive contributors to our community.
35_11ecbplus.10: We take our stature in the community very seriously.
35_11ecbplus.11: Through the Chargers and the NFL, our players receive one of the most comprehensive education and support programs in sports to help them deal with issues that affect all segments of society. ”
35_11ecbplus.12: Vincent Jackson, the Chargers receiver, was also recently arrested on allegations of DUI.
35_11ecbplus.13: His DUI arrest occurred five days before San Diego ’ s playoff loss at Pittsburgh.
35_11ecbplus.14: Jackson ’ s court date is set for February 17, 2009.
35_11ecbplus.15: When he was arrested, he was on probation for a previous DUI arrest, according to the California Highway Patrol.

44_6ecbplus.0: HP Snaps Up Data Center Consulting Firm
44_6ecbplus.2: The acquisition of EYP Mission Critical Facilities will help the OEM expand its services division.
44_6ecbplus.3: In a move that will expand its services division, Hewlett - Packard will acquire EYP Mission Critical Facilities, a New York company that offers data center consulting services.
44_6ecbplus.4: Financial details of the acquisition, announced Nov. 12, were not disclosed.
44_6ecbplus.5: HP announced that the deal would close during its first financial quarter.
44_6ecbplus.6: EYP Mission, which has 350 employees and 13 offices in the United States and the United Kingdom, helps plan, design, build and support large - scale data centers.
44_6ecbplus.7: In a statement, HP executives said EYP Missions emphasis on designing energy - efficient facilities will complement its own data center technology, such as HP Dynamic Smart Cooling.
44_6ecbplus.8: At the HP Technology Forum & Expo in June, CEO Mark Hurd said the company needs to move away from its traditional roots as a hardware company that sells PCs and servers and toward a business that focuses on delivering software and services to customers.
44_6ecbplus.9: Part of the change is to offer more services for businesses that are looking to revamp or build new data centers, with an emphasis on offering better power efficiency by cutting down on power and cooling costs.
44_6ecbplus.10: In addition to HP, the other top - tier OEMs—IBM Sun Microsystems and Dell—have looked to expand their services divisions as a way to add to the bottom line, while offering customers a new set of choices to support data centers by lending their own level of expertise to the problems of maintaining these types of facilities.
44_6ecbplus.11: "The data center is the foundation of IT for enterprises, an essential building block for driving business growth and adapting to changing business objectives, " John McCain, senior vice president and general manager of HP Services, said in a statement.
44_6ecbplus.12: EYP Mission has experience in a number of fields that require data center services, including financial services, telecommunications, technology, broadcast, manufacturing and healthcare, as well as numerous federal, state and county government agencies.

28_6ecbplus.2: Fred LaRue, a high - ranking Nixon administration official who served a 4 - 1 / 2 - month prison term for his role in Watergate and was among those rumored to be Deep Throat, has died.
28_6ecbplus.4: His body was discovered Tuesday, July 27, 2004, by a maid who entered his hotel room in Biloxi, Miss.
28_6ecbplus.5: The coroner believes LaRue died Saturday, July 24, 2004, of natural causes.
28_6ecbplus.6: LaRue was known as the ``bagman'' who delivered payoffs to keep participants in the Watergate break - in quiet.
28_6ecbplus.7: He was a special assistant to John Mitchell, the former attorney general who later headed President Nixon's Committee to Re - elect the President.
28_6ecbplus.8: LaRue was present at a 1972 meeting with Mitchell and Nixon aide Jeb Stuart Magruder at Nixon's vacation home in Key Biscayne where the plan to break in Democratic headquarters at the Watergate complex allegedly was hatched.

19_1ecbplus.0: Brooklyn Neighborhood Is 'A Powder Keg' After Teen Killed By Police
19_1ecbplus.2: Hostility has been mounting this week in East Flatbush, Brooklyn, after two plainclothes police officers fatally shot 16 - year - old Kimani Gray after he allegedly pointed a revolver at them on Saturday night.
19_1ecbplus.3: On Monday a group of about 130 people were marching toward the 67th Police Precinct station when about two dozen young protesters splintered off — drawing riot police — and trashed a Rite Aid.
19_1ecbplus.4: Tuesday the crowd was mostly calm, but on Wednesday — the same day Gray's autopsy showed he had been shot seven times — part of the 200 person crowd became unruly.
19_1ecbplus.5: The night began with hope that Gray's mother would speak at a vigil alongside mothers of local shooting victims, but the night turned when about 30 young men showed up in the shadows across the street.
19_1ecbplus.6: "They were staying in the dark area of the street, " a witness told CNN.
19_1ecbplus.7: "You just knew it was going to turn into the cops trying to contain those kids who were obviously gonna go for it.
19_1ecbplus.8: That just stopped the original intention of the night. "
19_1ecbplus.9: The witness said the teenagers suddenly took off, fanning through streets and side streets, followed by the sound of glass breaking and metal store - front gates being pulled down.
19_1ecbplus.10: Protesters began throwing bricks and bottles while cops began pepper - spraying and arresting.
19_1ecbplus.11: By the end an officer's face and the window of a police van had been hit with bricks, and 46 people had been arrested.
19_1ecbplus.12: The string of incidents has amplified the distrustful friction between the neighborhood's informal crews of armed teenagers and its aggressive police, whom residents say make prejudiced decisions based on race.
19_1ecbplus.13: Kenneth J. Montgomery, an attorney for the Gray family, told the LA Times that the police "patrol these neighborhoods like they ’ re paramilitary. ”
19_1ecbplus.14: “ [ The police ] have a hard time because there ’ s a lot of crime in the neighborhood, ” a local barber told The New York Times.
19_1ecbplus.15: “ But when they play hardball, they end up going after innocent people, too. ”
19_1ecbplus.16: Police say that on Saturday around 11: 30 p. m. Kimani Gray was standing outside his home with five other young men before splitting off when he noticed two plainclothes officers in an unmarked car.
19_1ecbplus.17: After he "adjusted his waistband and continued to act in a suspicious manner, ” officials say the cops got out of their car and approached Gray — who allegedly turned toward them with a loaded. 38 - caliber revolver in hand.
19_1ecbplus.18: The 30 - year - old sergeant and 26 - year - old fired 11 shots — the autopsy showed that seven bullets entered Gray's body, three of them from the rear.
19_1ecbplus.19: A revolver loaded with four bullets was reportedly recovered from the scene.
19_1ecbplus.20: Police commissioner Raymond Kelly told the New York Times there was “ nothing to indicate that this shooting was outside the guidelines ” while John C. Cerar, the former commander for firearms training at the Police Department, said "it appears to be a good shooting ” under the reported circumstances.
19_1ecbplus.21: That statement doesn't pacify neighborhood residents, who question the official story — some in the community don't believe Gray had a gun — and perceive the officers' behavior as part of a larger trend of NYPD antagonism.
19_1ecbplus.22: “ We ’ re talking about a powder keg out here.
19_1ecbplus.23: Any incident could trigger it, ” City Councilman Charles Barron told the LA Times.
19_1ecbplus.24: On Wednesday tensions "seemed to be decreasing until Mahnefah Gray, sister of the teen killed by police, was arrested while crossing the street, " according to Danny Gold of Metropolis.

44_5ecbplus.0: HP To Acquire Data Center Cooling, Energy Specialist EYP
44_5ecbplus.2: Hewlett - Packard on Monday said it has agreed to buy EYP Mission Critical Facilities, a consulting company that specializes in data center cooling and energy efficiency.
44_5ecbplus.4: The acquisition, expected to close by the end of January, would provide HP with proprietary services and technology related to one of the hottest issues today in data center planning and design.
44_5ecbplus.5: Because EYP services start at the ground level of data - center design, the company would give HP an early entry with its cooling technology and energy - efficient storage products.
44_5ecbplus.6: EYP, based in New York, has 350 employees spread through 13 offices in the United States and the United Kingdom.
44_5ecbplus.7: Most of its operations, employees, and management team would be folded into HP.
44_5ecbplus.8: EYP is led by chairman Steven Einhorn and chief executive Peter Gross.
44_5ecbplus.9: The need for more storage is growing as companies expand their businesses and strive to meet legal and regulatory requirements for handling electronic documents.
44_5ecbplus.10: Additional storage, however, also can increase energy consumption to run and cool more powerful servers.
44_5ecbplus.11: EYP's proprietary products and services include EnerOpt, a software - based process to assess and benchmark energy efficiency; a cooling design concept called Cool Design; and a direct current powered facility design called DC2.
44_5ecbplus.12: "Acquiring EYP Mission Critical Facilities boosts HP's ability to help customers transform their data centers and build dynamic computing environments from the ground up, " John McCain, senior VP and general manager for HP Services, said in a statement.
44_5ecbplus.13: Industries in which EYP has customers include financial services, technology, telecommunications, broadcast, manufacturing, and health care.
44_5ecbplus.14: The company also serves federal, state and local government agencies.
44_5ecbplus.15: Besides the EYP deal, HP has made other data center - related acquisitions this year.
44_5ecbplus.16: The largest was the $1. 6 billion purchase of Opsware, a maker of data center automation software; and the $214 million buy of Neoware, a maker of hardware and software for thin - client desktop systems.

40_5ecbplus.0: Apple unveils cheaper Ivy Bridge - powered MacBook Air
40_5ecbplus.2: Apple has chosen WWDC week to announce an update to its MacBook Air line.
40_5ecbplus.3: It may lack the Retina display of its newly upgraded, headline - grabbing cousin, the MacBook Pro, but the 2012 Air sees significant advances too.
40_5ecbplus.4: An upgrade from Sandy Bridge to Ivy Bridge processors with improved integrated graphics is chief among the upgrades, and onboard memory has also received a boost.
40_5ecbplus.5: What hasn't changed is the ultra - thin form factor and ( with the thick end of the wedge maxing out at 0. 68 in or 17 mm ), weighing in at 2. 38 pounds ( 1. 08 kg ) for the 11 - inch model and 2. 96 pounds ( 1. 35 kg ) for the 13 - inch.
40_5ecbplus.6: Battery performance remains as is ( which is no bad thing ), with a touted 5 and 7 hours for the smaller and larger models respectively while wirelessly browsing the web.
40_5ecbplus.7: What's new is an upgrade from Sandy Bridge to the faster Ivy Bridge processor, which brings with it a switch up from Intel HD Graphics 3000 to Intel HD Graphics 4000.
40_5ecbplus.8: This should bring with it a noticeable performance boost, though its doubtful that hardcore gamers will be rushing to buy the new Airs as portable gaming rigs this year.
40_5ecbplus.9: The included random access memory allowance has doubled from 2 to 4 GB ( configurable to 8 GB ), and has been upgraded to lower voltage 1600 - MHz DDR3L SDRAM.
40_5ecbplus.10: Flash storage remains at 64 GB and 128 GB in the entry - level 11 - and 13 - inch models respectively, though this is now configurable up to 512 GB.
40_5ecbplus.11: Connectivity sees a significant boost with the inclusion of two USB 3. 0 ports in addition to the Thunderbolt port.
40_5ecbplus.12: The USB 3. 0 standard allows data transfer more than ten times the speed of USB 2. 0.
40_5ecbplus.13: The power connection has been upgraded to Apple's MagSafe 2, which is simply an even smaller version of the MagSafe port that lets the power cable disconnected safely in the event of jarring cable snag, preventing unwelcome MacBook / floor interface scenarios.
40_5ecbplus.14: Though the 11 - inch Air still starts at US$999, the 13 - inch has dropped $100 to $1199, making it all the more compelling to laptop - hunters on the prowl for an ultrabook.

9_8ecbplus.0: President Obama Overturns Endangered Species Rule Bush Instated
9_8ecbplus.1: Former President Bush Had Enacted Legislation that Could Have Put More Animals in Danger
9_8ecbplus.3: In a move that could anger some people on the other side of the aisle, President Obama overturned an administration regulation that could have possibly weakened the stability of the Endangered Species Act.
9_8ecbplus.4: Before former President George W. Bush left office, he passed legislation that would have allowed federal agencies to skip consultations before launching projects that could affect endangered wildlife.
9_8ecbplus.5: This could have put more animals at risk, and while it would have eliminated a lot of red tape in the process, it could have been more risky to endangered animals than necessary.
9_8ecbplus.6: The problem with the legislation by Bush was that it was taking scientists out of the equation, and basically removing the most knowledgeable people from the equation.
9_8ecbplus.7: It would have given a lot of additional power to federal agencies, but stripped a lot of the rights that the Endangered Species Act gives to the animals which it seeks to protect.
9_8ecbplus.8: While the act is not perfect in its implementation or enforcement, undermining by removing any "teeth" that it might have was a big step in the wrong direction.
9_8ecbplus.9: President Obama has already received immense support from environmentalists for this move, and by overturning something the Bush administration put in place, he showed that he is also willing to step up to the plate on issues such as these.
9_8ecbplus.10: By flat out declaring that it is necessary to ensure that no harm will come to endangered species as the result of new projects, it gives the Endangered Species Act more strength, and does a lot to further the cause of environmentalists looking to protect these animals.
9_8ecbplus.11: With scientists being put back into the equation, it gives a lot of hope that the threatened wildlife will stand a better chance at surviving over the long term.
9_8ecbplus.12: It was a questionable move when Bush made the move to approve the last - minute legislation during his second term, and while there were a lot of objections, nothing could really be done at the time.
9_8ecbplus.13: With an eye toward the future, President Obama made a really smart decision by bringing scientists back into the endangered species fold, and surely helped to save a number of animals that could have otherwise been put at risk.

41_4ecbplus.0: Bombing At Yida Refugee Camp, South Sudan
41_4ecbplus.1: On Thursday, November 10th at approximately 3: 00 pm, the Yida Refugee Camp in South Sudan was bombed.
41_4ecbplus.2: Nonviolent Peaceforce's Yida protection team lives and works in the camp, providing protection monitoring and support to nearly 23, 000 Nuban refugees who have fled to South Sudan to escape the escalating violent conflict across the border in Sudan's South Kordofan.
41_4ecbplus.3: Four bombs were dropped within just a few moments - two landed inside the camp itself, while the other two bombs were dropped near the airstrip where a UN helicopter was delivering much needed food aid.
41_4ecbplus.4: Of the bombs that landed inside the camp, one detonated about a quarter mile from the NP compound.
41_4ecbplus.5: The other landed next to the school building where 300 students were attending class, but it did not explode.
41_4ecbplus.6: Tiffany Ornelas, NP's Yida Team Leader, reported that "people were terrified; they were running and screaming in all directions".
41_4ecbplus.7: However, there have been no casualties or fatalities confirmed as a result of this bombing.
41_4ecbplus.8: In the days following the bombing, NP's team has been working with the refugee and host communities to verify the damage to the camp, account for children who fled during the bombing, set up a safety perimeter around the unexploded bomb to prevent curious children from approaching it, and explore options to further improve the safety and security of the refugees living at the camp.
41_4ecbplus.9: NP's protection team arrived in Yida one month ago to respond to the direct protection needs of the camp and host populations.
41_4ecbplus.10: NP's team of 3 international and 3 local protection officers are working to facilitate secure relations between both communities and to provide specialized support for the most vulnerable civilians, including more than 1200 unaccompanied children.

21_3ecbplus.0: Queens grandmother killed by a drunk hit - and - run driver

21_12ecbplus.0: GRANDMOTHER KILLED BY DRUNK DRIVER IN HIT - AND - RUN ACCIDENT IN RICHMOND HILL, QUEENS DA SAYSSEPTEMBER 19, 2013
21_12ecbplus.1: A 59 - year - old grandmother on her way to a religious service in Richmond Hill last Friday was hit and killed by an allegedly drunk driver who fled the scene of the accident that left her family and friends devastated, Queens District Attorney Richard Brown said.
21_12ecbplus.2: Raj Chohan, who lived in South Ozone Park, was walking towards a Sikh temple for a Friday evening service when Vishwanand Subryan, 23, of Schenectady, N. Y. , allegedly mowed into the older woman with his gray 2013 Toyota Camry around 7 p. m. , police said.
21_12ecbplus.3: Emergency workers rushed to her side and brought her to Jamaica Hospital Medical Center, where Chohan – an immigrant from India who leaves behind a husband, son and two grandchildren – died later that night, police said.
21_12ecbplus.4: Subryan has been charged with vehicular manslaughter, criminally negligent homicide, driving while under the influence of alcohol, and leaving the scene of an accident without reporting it, the DA said.
21_12ecbplus.5: “ Drinking and driving is a deadly combination – one that has the potential of turning a vehicle into a lethal weapon, ” Brown said in a prepared statement.
21_12ecbplus.6: “ In this case, the defendant is accused of getting behind the wheel while under the influence of alcohol, being unable to maintain proper control of his vehicle, and striking a pedestrian before speeding away without checking to see if she needed medical assistance. ”
21_12ecbplus.7: Arraigned on Sept. 15, Subryan was ordered held on $200, 000 bail and is expected to return to Queens Supreme Court in Kew Gardens on Oct. 2.
21_12ecbplus.8: According to the criminal charges, two police officers from the 102nd Precinct were stationed on 117th Street at approximately 7 p. m. on Friday night, when they heard a loud bang behind them and one of the officers saw fluorescent garments fly in the air.
21_12ecbplus.9: When the officers turned around, they allegedly saw Subryan speed past them.
21_12ecbplus.10: He then allegedly ran a stop sign and red light when police began to pursue him, the DA said.
21_12ecbplus.11: When cops stopped the car, police allegedly observed Subryan to have bloodshot watery eyes and slurred speech and smelled of alcohol, according to Brown.
21_12ecbplus.12: Additionally, he was allegedly swaying and unsteady on his feet when he got out of his car – which police wrote had a dented hood, a cracked bumper and front headlight, and scuff marks on the hood, the NYPD said.
21_12ecbplus.13: The driver was taken to the 112th Precinct, where police documented that he allegedly had a blood alcohol content of. 09 percent – above New York ’ s legal limit of. 08 percent.
21_12ecbplus.14: A civilian witness at the scene also told police that they saw a car speed by and then saw Chohan, who was wearing bright yellow clothing and went into cardiac arrest, laying in the street, the DA said.
21_12ecbplus.15: Video surveillance from the area showed the vehicle striking Chohan, causing her to become airborne, according to Brown.
21_12ecbplus.16: The tragic event was one of three accidents involving pedestrians in the city last weekend.

28_3ecbplus.0: Fred LaRue, Watergate Figure, Dies at 75
28_3ecbplus.2: Frederick C. LaRue, a top Nixon campaign official who passed money from a secret White House fund to buy the silence of the Watergate burglars, died Saturday at a hotel in Biloxi, Miss.
28_3ecbplus.4: His heart failed while he was reading a book, his son, Ike LaRue III, said.
28_3ecbplus.5: He lived in Biloxi and Jackson, Miss.
28_3ecbplus.6: Fred LaRue's career was intertwined with that of Richard M. Nixon from the time he transferred his considerable financial support to Nixon from the defeated presidential candidate Barry Goldwater in 1964.
28_3ecbplus.7: He was an architect of Nixon's successful strategy for capturing Southern votes and then a significant participant in the Watergate scandal.
28_3ecbplus.8: Mr. LaRue pleaded guilty to obstruction of justice in July 1973.
28_3ecbplus.9: He served a reduced sentence of four and a half months in federal prison in return for cooperating with prosecutors investigating the break - in at the Watergate complex, which housed the headquarters of the Democratic National Committee, on June 17, 1972.
28_3ecbplus.10: He was at the meeting in Key Biscayne, Fla. , on March 30, 1972, where John N. Mitchell, the former attorney general who became head of Nixon's re - election campaign committee, and Jeb Stuart Magruder, Mr. Mitchell's deputy, approved a "dirty tricks" campaign, including the Watergate break - in.
28_3ecbplus.11: Mr. LaRue was also at the meeting after the break - in at which some of the same officials scurried to come up with money for the burglars.
28_3ecbplus.13: Nixon acknowledged his own involvement in the cover - up, but always denied advance knowledge of the break - in.
28_3ecbplus.14: In a heated exchange with Mr. Magruder in 2003, Mr. LaRue supported Nixon's claim of ignorance of the initial burglary.
28_3ecbplus.15: Mr. LaRue's main argument was that he had been in charge of the phone at a Florida meeting of the top campaign staff where the break - in was planned and was monitoring all calls.
28_3ecbplus.16: Nixon never called, he said in an interview with The Sun Herald, a Biloxi newspaper.
28_3ecbplus.17: Also, he said his personal relationship with Mitchell was so close that Mitchell would certainly have told him.
28_3ecbplus.18: Mr. LaRue denied suggestions that he was "Deep Throat, " the secret Watergate source used by Bob Woodward in his joint coverage of the scandal with Carl Bernstein for The Washington Post.
28_3ecbplus.19: Mr. LaRue said he believed the secret informer was an amalgam of several people, but Mr. Woodward has said that it is one person and that he will reveal that person's identity after his death.
28_3ecbplus.20: Mr. LaRue, whose family amassed a fortune in the oil business, played an important role with Nixon many years before Watergate.
28_3ecbplus.21: After contributing heavily to Goldwater's losing presidential campaign in 1964, he became a leading supporter of Nixon.
28_3ecbplus.22: In particular, he helped develop a "Southern strategy" for the Republicans to recapture Southern states from the Democrats.
28_3ecbplus.23: After Nixon's election in 1968, Mr. LaRue worked in the White House without title or salary.
28_3ecbplus.24: Partly through his friendship with Senator James O. Eastland, the Mississippi Democrat who was chairman of the Judiciary Committee, Mr. LaRue helped to win confirmation for Nixon's nominees to the federal bench.
28_3ecbplus.25: "He was an elusive, anonymous, secret operator at the highest levels of the shattered Nixon power structure, " The New York Times reported in 1973.
28_3ecbplus.26: "He is a man of personal mystery, too - a latter - day character, it sometimes seemed, out of a Southern gothic novel. "
28_3ecbplus.27: Frederick Cheney LaRue was born Oct. 11, 1928, in Athens, Tex.
28_3ecbplus.28: His father, Ike Parsons LaRue Sr. , whom Fred LaRue shot and killed in a Canadian duck - hunting accident in 1957, was a first cousin of Sid Richardson, the Texas oil and ranching tycoon.
28_3ecbplus.29: The elder Mr. LaRue had gone to jail for banking violations and moved to Mississippi to look for oil.
28_3ecbplus.30: His company discovered the giant Bolton field, which Fred's generation sold for $30 million in 1967.
28_3ecbplus.31: Fred LaRue spread money to local and national politicians, and, despite his shyness, acquired the nickname Bubba.
28_3ecbplus.32: He became a Republican national committeeman.
28_3ecbplus.33: In the end, Mr. LaRue was one of the first top Nixon aides to cooperate with prosecutors.
28_3ecbplus.34: "LaRue had stressed that it was time for both of us to think about protecting ourselves and our families instead of continuing to worry about protecting Mitchell and the president, " Mr. Magruder wrote in his 1974 book, "An American Life: One Man's Road to Watergate. "
28_3ecbplus.35: Mr. LaRue is survived by his wife, Joyce Burleson LaRue; his sons Ike III, of Jackson, and Fred Jr. , of Brandon, Miss. ; his daughters Patricia LaRue of Arlington, Tex. , Leslie LaRue of Manhattan, Grace Burleson LaRue of Crystal Springs, Miss. ; his brother, Ike Jr. ; his sister, Ruthie LaRue Owen of Jackson; and nine grandchildren.
28_3ecbplus.36: In the interview with The Sun Herald, Mr. LaRue guessed that the healthy regimen of his months in prison added 10 years to his life.
28_3ecbplus.37: "The warden let me make a badminton court out of the volleyball court, " he said.
28_3ecbplus.38: "We had some of the best badminton players in the country. "

10_17ecbplus.1: Herald: Sox Make Offer To Teixeira ( 8 Years? )
10_17ecbplus.2: Michael Silverman reports that the Red Sox
10_17ecbplus.3: have made an offer [ for Mark Teixeira ], the biggest and longest yet for this current ownership group.
