4_8ecbplus.0: Esther Williams Dead: Technicolor Star Dies At Age 91
4_8ecbplus.2: The self - described "Million Dollar Mermaid, " whose wholesome beauty, shapely figure and aquatic skills launched an entire genre of movies – the Technicolor "aqua musicals" – died Thursday at 91.
4_8ecbplus.3: She also was a favorite swimsuit pinup for GI's in World War II, and a refreshing presence among MGM's stellar gallery – warm, breezy, with a frankness and self - deprecating humor that delighted interviewers.
4_8ecbplus.4: As news of her death spread Thursday, pinup shots of her circulated on Twitter.
4_8ecbplus.5: Lamas' son, actor Lorenzo Lamas, tweeted Thursday: "My stepmom Esther Williams passed peacefully this morning.

16_5ecbplus.0: Gunman Kills L. A. Deputy on Gang Duty
16_5ecbplus.2: A Los Angeles County sheriff's deputy interviewing a woman and a man outside a Hawaiian Gardens apartment was fatally shot Friday when a gunman burst out of the residence, put a handgun to the officer's face and fired, authorities said.
16_5ecbplus.3: Sheriff's deputies fanned out across Hawaiian Gardens late Friday in search of the gunman, who apparently surprised Deputy Jerry Ortiz, 35, as he spoke to the woman in the doorway of her apartment.
16_5ecbplus.4: Authorities said Ortiz probably died instantly.
16_5ecbplus.5: "This was an assassination of a deputy, " Sheriff Lee Baca said.
16_5ecbplus.6: "It was a sudden attack that gave the deputy no chance. "
16_5ecbplus.7: Deputies identified the suspect as Jose Luis Orozco, 27, a parolee wanted on suspicion of attempted murder in another case.
16_5ecbplus.8: "He should be considered armed and very dangerous, " said sheriff's spokesman Steve Whitmore.
16_5ecbplus.9: Deputies said that Orozco is 5 - foot - 8, 135 pounds, with tattoos of "devil's horns" on his forehead and other tattoos over his upper body.
16_5ecbplus.10: They said he is a gang member known by the nickname "Sepy. "
16_5ecbplus.11: Ortiz, who had hoped to become a detective soon, had worked for the Sheriff's Department for 15 years and was known as an extremely hard worker whose job was to penetrate the inner workings of local gangs.
16_5ecbplus.12: The Diamond Bar resident was married two weeks ago to his second wife, Chela.
16_5ecbplus.13: He is also survived by two sons, ages 6 and 16.
16_5ecbplus.14: Last year, Ortiz won the department's Medal of Honor after he fatally shot a carjacker who drew a gun on him and his partner, Det. Colin Orpe.
16_5ecbplus.15: "He was an outstanding person, who would go out of his way to help people, " said Orpe, a longtime friend.
16_5ecbplus.16: "We're all mourning, " he said, choking back tears.
16_5ecbplus.17: The shooting occurred about 3: 10 p. m. in the 12200 block of 223rd Street in Hawaiian Gardens, a working - class city at the northeastern border of Long Beach that has long been plagued by gang violence.
16_5ecbplus.18: The town of 14, 000 has struggled economically in recent years, luring a casino to help balance its shaky finances.
16_5ecbplus.19: Ortiz's body was discovered by residents who heard the gunfire.
16_5ecbplus.20: They tried to aid the deputy and dialed 911, authorities said.
16_5ecbplus.21: Ortiz was working without his longtime partner at the time of the attack.
16_5ecbplus.22: Undersheriff Larry Waldie said Ortiz had arrived for work early, as he often did, and was so eager to begin his day that he struck out on his own.
16_5ecbplus.23: "He didn't want to wait, " Waldie said.
16_5ecbplus.24: Asked if Ortiz might have lived had his partner been with him, Waldie said there was no way to know.
16_5ecbplus.25: "There might have been two people killed, " he said.
16_5ecbplus.26: The shooting was followed by confusion as scores of deputies descended on the area with dogs and rifles but little knowledge of what had occurred.
16_5ecbplus.27: A sheriff's SWAT team encircled the apartment complex where it was believed that the gunman could be hiding.
16_5ecbplus.28: Patrol deputies detained as many as nine potential witnesses and others in an effort to learn details of the shooting.
16_5ecbplus.29: Nearly all of them were rounded up in a liquor store next to the apartment complex.
16_5ecbplus.30: Television news footage showed the men and women sitting on the curb in handcuffs as deputies interviewed them and swabbed their hands for possible gunshot residue.

19_4ecbplus.0: Brooklyn riot over teen's death: 16 - year - old shot by cops did not have a gun, says witness
19_4ecbplus.1: Tishana King says she saw the whole incident from a bird's eye view in her Brooklyn apartment.
19_4ecbplus.2: She says she's 'certain' slain Kimani ( Kiki ) Gray 'didn't having anything in his hands. '
19_4ecbplus.5: A Brooklyn woman who claims she had a “ bird ’ s - eye view ” of the fatal police shooting of 16 - year - old Kimani ( Kiki ) Gray says the youth did not have a gun in his hand.
19_4ecbplus.6: Tishana King is the only civilian eyewitness to come forward, and her account sharply differs from Police Commissioner Raymond Kelly ’ s assertion that Gray had pointed a. 38 - caliber revolver at the cops before they opened fire.
19_4ecbplus.7: “ I ’ m certain he didn ’ t have anything in his hands, ” King told the Daily News.
19_4ecbplus.8: Moments after the Saturday shooting, one cop put both hands on his head and said, “ ‘ Oh, God! ’ ” King recalled.
19_4ecbplus.9: “ His partner went over to him and put his hand on his shoulder and said, ‘ Are you okay, buddy? ’ ”
19_4ecbplus.10: King, 39, a medical records clerk at Kings County Hospital, said she gave a tape - recorded interview to detectives several hours after the shooting.
19_4ecbplus.11: The detectives were aware her 14 - year - old son dialed 911 from their apartment after the gunfire.
19_4ecbplus.12: But King, in her nearly eight - minute interview with NYPD investigators at 3 a. m. on Sunday, never said a word about whether Gray was carrying a gun.
19_4ecbplus.13: King emphatically told The News that Gray didn ’ t have a weapon in his hands.
19_4ecbplus.14: But the newspaper ’ s review of her nearly eight - minute interview with NYPD investigators hours after the shooting shows she never mentioned whether the teen was carrying a gun.
19_4ecbplus.15: “ I couldn ’ t see what the kids were doing, ” she said during the session.
19_4ecbplus.16: The News reviewed the tape of the Q&A conducted in her apartment after the fatal shooting.
19_4ecbplus.17: Detectives and Internal Affairs Bureau investigators never asked directly if King saw Gray with a gun, and a police source said NYPD policy precludes asking such leading questions.
19_4ecbplus.18: “ They ’ re just asked to say what happened in as much detail as they can remember, ” the source said.
19_4ecbplus.19: A police spokesman said that when King was asked what she saw by detectives, she told them she couldn't see what the boys were doing "from the angle I was at. "
19_4ecbplus.20: But King told The News that, at first, the boys were under her window and that they moved into view when police got out of their car and approached them.
19_4ecbplus.21: The NYPD has not released the names of the sergeant and cop who fired 11 shots.
19_4ecbplus.22: A police source said the pair initially reported to supervisors that the teen had pulled a gun — and a loaded weapon was recovered at the scene.
19_4ecbplus.23: King told The News she was drawn to her third - floor East Flatbush window late Saturday night by the sound of loud laughing and talking outside on E. 52nd St.
19_4ecbplus.24: She said she watched as a burgundy - colored sedan pulled up and a man jumped out of the passenger side, followed by the driver.
19_4ecbplus.25: King initially thought the duo intended to fight with the youths.
19_4ecbplus.26: When the driver yelled, “ Don ’ t move! ” it clicked that they were cops, she said.
19_4ecbplus.27: “ Kimani started backing up, ” King said.
19_4ecbplus.28: “ The cop took out his gun and started firing at Kimani. ”
19_4ecbplus.29: King said the area was illuminated by a streetlight and Gray appeared to be cornered by the cops.
19_4ecbplus.30: “ His ( Gray ’ s ) hands were down, ” she said.
19_4ecbplus.31: “ I couldn ’ t believe he let off ( fired ) his gun.
19_4ecbplus.34: A police source said King never told detectives that Gray was backing up with his hands down.
19_4ecbplus.35: Kelly said an “ earwitness ” heard a cop yell, “ What do you have in your hands? ” but a source said the man was too far away to see the confrontation.
19_4ecbplus.36: The shooting appeared to be within NYPD guidelines, he added.

2_7ecbplus.0: Ellen DeGeneres Returns to Host the Oscars
2_7ecbplus.2: Television icon Ellen DeGeneres will return to host the Oscars® for a second time, producers Craig Zadan and Neil Meron announced today.

6_2ecbplus.0: Director Gary Ross Still in Negotiations for HUNGER GAMES Sequel, CATCHING FIRE; Release Date May Be in Jeopardy
6_2ecbplus.1: Posted 1 year, 160 days ago [ downloaded on 2 October 2013 ]
6_2ecbplus.2: As I said many times in my review, Gary Ross ‘ direction was the strongest element of The Hunger Games.
6_2ecbplus.3: But for Lionsgate, the movie ’ s ability to make a crazy amount of money was the strongest element of The Hunger Games.
6_2ecbplus.4: Now, THR is reporting that Ross and the studio are locked in tense negotiations over his return to direct the sequel, Catching Fire.
6_2ecbplus.5: Lead actors Jennifer Lawrence, Josh Hutcherson, and Liam Hemsworth are already signed for Catching Fire ( and I imaging they ’ re also signed for the third installment, Mockingjay ), but Ross doesn ’ t have a deal in place.
6_2ecbplus.6: He was paid $3 million for co - writing and directing the film plus 5 percent on the back - end.
6_2ecbplus.7: Unsurprisingly, he would like a raise on the sequel.
6_2ecbplus.8: Hit the jump for more including why Catching Fire might not make its November 22, 2013 release date.
6_2ecbplus.9: According to THR, negotiations on the first film were tough because Ross already had a successful, Oscar - nominated movie to his name ( Seabiscuit ), but Lionsgate had never paid a hefty filmmaker salary before ( Hunger Games was the highest - budgeted project in the studio ’ s history ).
6_2ecbplus.10: Now that Hunger Games will undoubtedly be one of the highest - grossing films of the year, Ross has some leverage, but current franchise trends aren ’ t moving in his favor.
6_2ecbplus.11: Other major franchises have shown no hesitation in constantly switching out directors.
6_2ecbplus.12: After all, it ’ s the title that draws people into the theaters, not the filmmaker.
6_2ecbplus.13: Harry Potter went through four directors as did Twilight, and Marvel has basically made it a policy never to rehire any of their directors.
6_2ecbplus.14: The studio ’ s highest priority is making sure to keep the franchise flowing without delay, and prolonged negotiations with Ross may cause a delay.
6_2ecbplus.15: There ’ s also the added problem of Ross taking time to revise Simon Beaufoy ‘ s script for Catching Fire.
6_2ecbplus.16: Lionsgate is also facing an issue with the sequel ’ s scheduled November 22, 2013 release date.
6_2ecbplus.17: Fox could stymie Lionsgate ’ s plans by exercising Lawrence ’ s option to do the sequel for X - Men: First Class.
6_2ecbplus.18: Sources tell THR that Fox ’ s option would take priority over Lionsgate ’ s.
6_2ecbplus.19: Lionsgate is aiming to get Catching Fire into production by the fall, but Fox already has their director ready to go ( Matthew Vaughn is signed to return for First Class 2 ).
6_2ecbplus.20: However, First Class 2 doesn ’ t have a release date.
6_2ecbplus.21: Ross ’ does have a few counters against Lionsgate.
6_2ecbplus.22: First, he ’ s a known quantity and has established a relationship with the cast and crew.
6_2ecbplus.23: He also delivered a critically well - received movie.
6_2ecbplus.24: Granted, The Hunger Games would have crushed at the box office no matter what, but the positive response indicates that he ’ s now in higher demand for other properties.
6_2ecbplus.25: It ’ s an impressive boost for a director who hadn ’ t helmed a project since Seabiscuit in 2003.
6_2ecbplus.26: Despite the acrimony, a source tells THR that the two sides will eventually make a deal:
6_2ecbplus.27: Ultimately, it will be difficult, and yet everybody will do the sane thing, which is to work it out, ” says one.
6_2ecbplus.28: “ Everybody will end up unhappy in their own way.
6_2ecbplus.29: It ’ s just the nature of the beast. ”
6_2ecbplus.30: The alternative is to throw 24 directors into an arena and have them fight to the death.
6_2ecbplus.31: And if you ’ re having trouble imagining other directors taking over the franchise, take a look at these fake posters for The Hunger Games.

32_5ecbplus.0: PROVISIONAL TRIAL DATE SET FOR MILLOM DOUBLE MURDER ACCUSED
32_5ecbplus.2: A PROVISIONAL trial date has been set in the case of a son accused of killing his mother, sister and pet dog in Millom.
32_5ecbplus.3: A preliminary hearing for John Jenkin, 23, charged with the murders of his mother Alice McMeekin, 58, and sister Katie Jenkin, 20, was heard in Preston Crown Court this morning.
32_5ecbplus.4: Jenkin was due to appear via videolink from HMP Preston, but did not do so as he was considered a risk to his own safety and that of other people, according to crown prosecutor Susan Carter.
32_5ecbplus.5: The case was heard in his absence, and a provisional trial date was set for October 28 with a duration of three days.
32_5ecbplus.6: The bodies of Ms McMeekin and Miss Jenkin, were found in their house in Newton Street, Millom, on Saturday about 8. 40am.
32_5ecbplus.7: An earlier hearing at Furness Magistrates' Court, in Barrow, heard they had "severe head injuries".
32_5ecbplus.8: The family's border collie, named Fenn, was also found beaten to death in the backyard of the house.
32_5ecbplus.9: Jenkin was arrested at Millom Pier around 9. 35am.
32_5ecbplus.10: He faces one charge of causing unnecessary suffering to an animal in relation to the dog's death.
32_5ecbplus.11: No application for bail was made at yesterday's hearing and no plea was entered.
32_5ecbplus.12: A plea and case management hearing will be held on September 6.
32_5ecbplus.13: Judge Anthony Russell QC asked for psychiatric reports to be completed on Jenkin before the next hearing.
32_5ecbplus.14: At the earlier hearing on Monday he was deemed too much of a risk to appear in the dock at Furness Magistrates' Court.
32_5ecbplus.15: Jenkin was brought to the magistrates' court building by a secure van on Monday, but did not appear in the dock and no pleas were entered.
32_5ecbplus.16: Miss Rachel Bates, court clerk, said: "He is at risk of causing harm to himself and causing harm to others as well.
32_5ecbplus.17: " ( Custody ) are having difficulties restraining him and they can't move him from the cell.
32_5ecbplus.18: "There are extreme difficulties and for the safety of everybody, including the defendant, the best approach is ( to hold the hearing ) in the defendant's absence. "
32_5ecbplus.19: The court heard police were called after hearing an argument at the family's home at 8. 39am on Saturday.
32_5ecbplus.20: Seven of Jenkin's friends attended court as a show of support.
32_5ecbplus.21: Jenkin had been living in South Wales with his mum for the past three years and they had moved back to Millom around six weeks ago.

26_7ecbplus.0: NY mob don Vincent 'Chin' Gigante dies in prison
26_7ecbplus.2: Convicted mobster Vincent "Chin" Gigante, famed for wandering the streets of New York in a tattered bathrobe in a show of insanity, died on Monday in federal prison, officials said.
26_7ecbplus.3: Considered one of the last of New York's old - time Mafia dons, the reputed head of the Genovese family was serving a 12 - year sentence at the U. S. Medical Center for Federal Prisoners in Springfield, Missouri.
26_7ecbplus.5: Gigante was also nicknamed "The Oddfather" and "The Pajama King" - references to his habit of shuffling along the sidewalk in Manhattan's Greenwich Village muttering to himself, looking disheveled and unshaven in a robe and slippers.
26_7ecbplus.6: His attorneys argued that Gigante was mentally ill and incapable of running a crime family; prosecutors argued he was feigning illness to avoid prosecution.
26_7ecbplus.7: Eventually, a jury found Gigante guilty in 1997 of conspiracy to murder other organized crime figures, racketeering, extortion and other charges.
26_7ecbplus.8: The case relied heavily on the testimony of six former mobsters who became government informants, including Salvatore "Sammy the Bull" Gravano, whose testimony was critical in the 1992 conviction of the late mobster John Gotti.
26_7ecbplus.9: Following Gigante's conviction, prosecutors said he continued to run the crime family from prison.
26_7ecbplus.10: In 2003, he pleaded guilty to obstructing justice by misleading doctors about his mental state.
26_7ecbplus.11: The cause of death was unknown, but Gigante had been suffering from heart disease, said prison spokesman Al Quintero.

45_5ecbplus.0: Christopher Simpson shoots pregnant girlfriend dead cause he didn't want another child to support.
45_5ecbplus.1: An Oklahoma jury has found 27 year old Christopher Simpson guilty of first degree murder of his then pregnant 20 year old girlfriend Ka'loni Flynn and their 12 week unborn child.
45_5ecbplus.2: The murder came after Flynn resisted Simpson's demands to have an abortion and his reluctance with having to 'deal with another child to support. '
45_5ecbplus.3: In finding Christopher Simpson guilty the jury recommended that he be sent to maximum life in prison without parole.
45_5ecbplus.4: His sentencing is scheduled for November 8.
45_5ecbplus.5: Prosecutors allege that Simpson, who has at least one child from a past relationship, shot Flynn twice in the head because he did not want another baby to support.
45_5ecbplus.6: A DNA expert testified that the 27 - year - old fathered the 12 - week - old fetus.
45_5ecbplus.7: The murder is said to have taken place on April 9 at 3 am in Flynn's car which was parked at the time.
45_5ecbplus.8: It wasn't until in late June that authorities arrested Christopher Simpson believing that he was the chief instigator of her death.
45_5ecbplus.9: Told the deceased's father, Herbert Flynn Jr: 'I'm glad it's over.
45_5ecbplus.10: I'm glad we got the verdict we got.
45_5ecbplus.12: During closing arguments, Crawford County Deputy Prosecuting Attorney Jacob Howell showed a photograph of Flynn's body in the driver's seat of car, with bullet wounds to her temple and forehead.
45_5ecbplus.13: Prosecutors went on to acknowledge that the case against Simpson was complicated and mostly circumstantial.
45_5ecbplus.14: Told Howell: 'I hope we showed you this was investigated thoroughly, and that every possible suspect was investigated and excluded except one. '
45_5ecbplus.15: Simpson's attorney, Warren Gotcher, argued that no witnesses could place Simpson at the crime scene and that his client was innocent.
45_5ecbplus.16: Prosecutor Anthony Evans countered by telling that Simpson was trying to deflect blame because 'the defendant has the spotlight on him, and it's hot, and he needs to get it off him.
45_5ecbplus.20: According to a police affidavit, the couple had been dating for about three months when the 20 - year - old found out she was pregnant.
45_5ecbplus.21: Purportedly Simpson became angry and expressed that he did not want to be a father again.
45_5ecbplus.22: Pushed to get an abortion, Flynn declined telling Christopher Simpson that she did not believe in abortion.
45_5ecbplus.23: Of course the better question may have been if either one of the couple believed in using contraceptives and if not why?
45_5ecbplus.24: Herbert Flynn Jr told 5News after Simpson's arrest that on the night of his daughter's murder, she was planning to meet with her boyfriend to ask for help in applying for government assistance.
45_5ecbplus.25: Around the time of the shooting, Simpson was late on child support payments for his 7 - year - old daughter, and according to a local sheriff, he had made statements to his friends that he did not want another child.
45_5ecbplus.26: After Flynn's death, a witness told police that Simpson bragged to him that his girlfriend's killing will never be solved because it was 'too clean' and 'the perfect murder. '
45_5ecbplus.27: The 20 - year - old woman, who aspired to be a nurse, allegedly told a friend a short time before the slaying that Simpson had threatened to end the pregnancy for her if she refused to abort the baby.

31_4ecbplus.0: McDermott Sets Scoring Record as Men's Basketball Tops Drake
31_4ecbplus.2: Doug McDermott became the leading scorer in Creighton history and had five points during a pivotal 15 - 2 run as top - seeded Creighton defeated Drake, 65 - 53, on Friday afternoon in the first quarterfinal of the Missouri Valley Conference Tournament.
31_4ecbplus.3: Creighton improved to 25 - 7 on the season and advances to play Saturday in a 1: 35 pm semifinal against Indiana State.
31_4ecbplus.4: Drake, which defeated Bradley in the play - in round just 18 hours earlier, fell to 15 - 17.
31_4ecbplus.5: Creighton broke open a 12 - all game with some strong play by Will Artino to key a 7 - 0 run.
31_4ecbplus.6: The sophomore center from Iowa came off the bench and dunked to start a traditional three - point play.
31_4ecbplus.7: McDermott would follow with a jumper to tie the scoring record, and Artino answered with another bucket to make it 19 - 12 with 11: 43 left in the first half.
31_4ecbplus.8: McDermott's history - making point came at the foul line, when he sank a free throw with 4: 43 left in the first half.
31_4ecbplus.9: It gave him 2, 117 career points, passing Rodney Buford's career mark that had stood since 1999 and moving him into 10th in MVC history.
31_4ecbplus.10: The Jays led 33 - 26 at the half, paced by 13 points from McDermott.
31_4ecbplus.11: CU dominated the glass 22 - 13, the paint ( 16 - 10 ) and the second chance points ( 9 - 0 ) in the first 20 minutes, while also outscoring DU 12 - 3 off the bench.
31_4ecbplus.12: Creighton would take its first double - digit lead of the day at 45 - 35 on a pair of Artino free throws with 13: 41 to go.
31_4ecbplus.13: Drake countered with a 9 - 2 run and missed a tying trey by Richard Carter with about 10: 00 to play.
31_4ecbplus.14: The Jays answered, as Echenique threw down a powerful alley - oop during a three - point play and the lead returned to 54 - 46 a short time later on Austin Chatman's first score of the second half and a McDermott hoop in transition to move ahead by eight with 7: 54 to go.
31_4ecbplus.15: After a timeout, McDermott hit his third trifecta of the day, and Echenique's third three - point play of the day made it 60 - 46 with 6: 11 to go.
31_4ecbplus.16: Gibbs ended the run with two charity shots, and the Jays would keep Drake off the scoreboard for nearly seven minutes to pull away.
31_4ecbplus.17: McDermott led all players with 23 points while also grabbing seven rebounds.
31_4ecbplus.18: He made 3 - of - 4 three attempts from 3 - point range.
31_4ecbplus.19: Echenique generated a double - double with 11 points, 11 rebounds and six swats, with most of that production after half.
31_4ecbplus.20: Artino complemented Echenique inside by scoring a career - high 14 points and adding six rebounds.
31_4ecbplus.21: The Jays shot 46. 8 percent for the game ( 22 - 47 ) and owned the glass by a 44 - 26 margin.
31_4ecbplus.22: Drake was paced by 13 points from Seth VanDeest, while Richard Carter had 12 points and four assists.
31_4ecbplus.23: Drake shot 35. 0 percent overall and just 11 - of - 36 after intermission.
31_4ecbplus.24: The win improved Creighton to 41 - 20 all - time in MVC Tournament play, easily the most victories by any team in event history.
31_4ecbplus.25: The Jays are 19 - 12 all - time in the quarterfinal round, and 5 - 2 all - time vs. Drake in the event.

20_3ecbplus.2: Strong earthquake jolts southern Iran, felt in Oman
20_3ecbplus.3: An earthquake measuring at least magnitude - 5. 9 shook a sparsely populated area of southern Iran on Sunday, flattening seven villages and killing 10 people, officials said.
20_3ecbplus.4: The temblor was felt as far away as Oman and the United Arab Emirates.
20_3ecbplus.5: Heidar Alishvandi, the governor of Qeshm, was quoted by state - run television as saying rescue teams were deployed to the affected area and people in the wrecked villages moved quickly to safely.
20_3ecbplus.6: Another provincial official, Ghasem Karami, told The Associated Press that high casualties were not expected because the area was not heavily developed.
20_3ecbplus.7: Tehran's seismologic center said the quake measured magnitude - 5. 9, but the U. S. Geological Survey in Golden, Colo. , said it was a magnitude - 6. 1 temblor.
20_3ecbplus.8: A magnitude - 6. 0 quake can cause severe damage.
20_3ecbplus.9: Iran's seismologic center said the epicenter was in the waters of the Persian Gulf between the port city of Bandar Abbas and Qeshm Island.
20_3ecbplus.10: The USGS said the quake was 35 miles southwest of Bandar Abbas.
20_3ecbplus.11: Masoud Dalman, head of Hormozgan province's emergency affairs, said several buildings on Qeshm Island were damaged.
20_3ecbplus.12: The island, which has about 200, 000 residents, is about 940 miles south of Tehran, the capital.
20_3ecbplus.13: Shahram Alamdari, head of the rescue unit for the Iranian Red Crescent, said two helicopters were evacuating injured from Qeshm to Bandar Abbas, a city of 500, 000 people that also was jolted by the quake.
20_3ecbplus.14: Iranian television ran video from Qeshm showing minor damages to some buildings and a few injured being taken to hospitals.
20_3ecbplus.15: The report said the villages of Karavan and Kousheh were worst hit, but no footage was shown from those sites.
20_3ecbplus.16: The quake cut telephone links between Qeshm Island and the mainland, the report said.
20_3ecbplus.17: In Oman and the United Arab Emirates, buildings were evacuated and people fled into the streets.
20_3ecbplus.18: "Power and water supplies were not affected, " said Alireza Khorshidzadeh, a local journalist.
20_3ecbplus.19: "People poured into the streets, fearing aftershocks. "
20_3ecbplus.20: In Dubai, one of the seven emirates of the UAE, several buildings in the skyscraper - lined central business district were evacuated.
20_3ecbplus.21: They included the twin Emirates Towers, the highest buildings on the main street, where many international corporations and Dubai government institutions have offices.
20_3ecbplus.22: "It lasted around 30 seconds or so — you could feel the building moving and the coffee cups shaking, " said public relations executive Bina Mathews.
20_3ecbplus.23: Iran is located on a number of seismic fault lines and, on average, experiences at least one slight quake every day.
20_3ecbplus.24: The last major quake to hit southern Iran was in February, when a magnitude - 6. 4 temblor rocked Zarand, a town of about 15, 000 people in Kerman province 602 miles southeast of Tehran.
20_3ecbplus.25: It killed 612 people and injured more than 1, 400, leveling several villages and leaving thousands of people homeless.

30_7ecbplus.0: BRIEF UNPLANNED SEACOM CABLE INTERNET OUTAGE
30_7ecbplus.2: ( Tue, 16 Aug 2011 ) This morning one of the Wits Internet Service providers, SEACOM, experienced an outage affecting International Internet browsing.
30_7ecbplus.3: The service is now back online.
30_7ecbplus.4: TENET will continue to monitor and ensure that it is stable however, but from the looks of things traffic should now be flowing normally again.
30_7ecbplus.5: According to information from SEACOM the outage was caused by a terrestrial break in the fibre in Egypt on the SMW4 cable system.
30_7ecbplus.6: Once we have official confirmation / an incident report we will send more information.

25_7ecbplus.0: Saints Pierre Thomas to injured reserve and the rest of injury report
25_7ecbplus.2: Not a mere day ago, the New Orleans Saints placed their rookie running back sensation Chris Ivory on injured reserve ( IR ) thus ending his season as the team heads intpo the playoffs.
25_7ecbplus.3: Now the black and gold will have to go without yet another running back.
25_7ecbplus.4: Pierre Thomas was officially placed on IR Wednesday with an ankle injury meaning that the team will be without both of their leading backs for the duration of the season.
25_7ecbplus.5: Remaning on the team are Reggie Bush and Julius Jones.
25_7ecbplus.6: On Tuesday, the Saints re - signed running back DeShawn Wynn who played a few games on special teams earlier in the season.
25_7ecbplus.7: Wednesday afternoon, the Saints signed rookie Joique Bell from the Philadelphia Eagles practice squad.
25_7ecbplus.8: Before the season even began, the Saints had lost running backs Lynell Hamilton and PJ Hill to injuries for the entire year.
25_7ecbplus.9: Some good news is that wide receiver Marques Colston returned to practice fully.
25_7ecbplus.10: The rest of the injury report for Wednesday is as follows:

40_1ecbplus.0: Apple unveils new MacBook Pro with Ivy Bridge at WWDC
40_1ecbplus.2: Apple is certainly making WWDC a hardware conference this year - - it just unveiled a refresh of the existing MacBook Pro running Intel's newer Ivy Bridge processors on the San Francisco gathering's opening day.
40_1ecbplus.3: The 13 - and 15 - inch portables run up to 2. 7GHz quad Core i7s ( turbo up to 3. 7GHz ), carry up to 8GB of RAM and have GeForce GT 650M - based graphics 60 percent faster than the previous generation.
40_1ecbplus.4: Like the new MacBook Air, they tout USB 3. 0 ports.
40_1ecbplus.5: If you're more comfortable with Apple's conventional MacBook Pro design than the new variety, Apple will ask $1, 099 for the base 13 - inch version and $1, 799 for a 15 - inch version, with an upgraded 15 - inch model going for $2, 199.
40_1ecbplus.6: All of them are shipping today - - we're not seeing any mention of an updated 17 - inch version, so it may have been cast aside.

43_15ecbplus.0: AMD snaps up server upstart SeaMicro
43_15ecbplus.1: Jumpstarting a cloudy server biz with an interconnect
43_15ecbplus.3: AMD's new CEO Rory Read was fired up about executing better in the server racket at the company's analyst day earlier this month and has wasted little time in stirring things up with the acquisition of low - power server start - up SeaMicro for $334m.
43_15ecbplus.4: SeaMicro is the server upstart founded four and a half years ago that came out of stealth in June 2010 with an Atom bomb: a 10U chassis crammed with 512 single - core Atom servers in a 10U chassis, all linked by a 1. 28Tb / sec 3D torus interconnect implemented on an ASIC that also virtualized all I / O in the cluster of server nodes and provided load balancing across those nodes.
43_15ecbplus.5: Over time, SeaMicro has added 64 - bit Atoms, boosted the number of Atom processors and main memory in the system, and only a month ago announced a variant that used single - socket Xeon E3 - 1260L processors to give the SM10000 system some "brawny cores" to do heavier computational tasks.
43_15ecbplus.6: The acquisition of SeaMicro will no doubt irk Intel, which has used SeaMicro as a poster child for its microserver and cloud computing efforts in the past two years.
43_15ecbplus.7: So there's some public relations fun in that.
43_15ecbplus.8: But there isn't much Intel can do about SeaMicro being in AMD's hands.
43_15ecbplus.9: In a conference call with Wall Street analysts announcing the deal after the market closed, Andrew Feldman, SeaMicro's CEO and co - founder, said that his company had been buying Atom processors and chipsets from the distribution channel, not from Intel.
43_15ecbplus.10: SeaMicro does not anticipate any changes in getting its supply of Atom and Xeon processors or building systems for current and future customers.
43_15ecbplus.11: In the call, Read reiterated that AMD was "seizing the inflection point" in the server business.
43_15ecbplus.12: The acquisition of SeaMicro, which along with Cisco Systems is one of the first new entrants in the server racket in years to actually look like it has a chance of making it, would "accelerate out transformation into an agile and disruptive innovator. "
43_15ecbplus.13: As we can now see, looking at the past month in hindsight, is that AMD figured out that is needed to hunker down on its Opteron processor roadmaps and not force server makers to absorb a socket change in 2012, as was the original plan, but rather to get an improved "Piledriver" core for Opteron processors into the field this year and do lots of performance tuning to show what "Bulldozer" class of chip can really do.
43_15ecbplus.14: The company then looked around and decided that it didn't need a new chip or chipset so much as a whole different set of technologies to sell to its server OEM partners.
43_15ecbplus.16: Much will be made of AMD entering the server business with the acquisition of SeaMicro.
43_15ecbplus.17: But that's not the point, even if it will be technically true over the next months.
43_15ecbplus.18: Lisa Su, senior vice president and general manager of the new Global Business Units at AMD, who is tasked with making sure the company has the components from which server makers want to build systems, put the kibosh on that idea.
43_15ecbplus.19: "This is a technology play for us, " Su explained, calling the interconnect used at the heart of the SeaMicro system a "unique technology" that would be a "building block" that AMD integrates with its processors and chipsets and then in turn sells to server makers.
43_15ecbplus.20: The company will work now to get AMD's Opteron server processors embedded in the SeaMicro machines, which it expected to have accomplished by the second half of this year.
43_15ecbplus.21: The company will not divulge what Opteron chips it will weld onto the SeaMicro server boards, but it stands to reason that it would be a low - voltage Opteron 3200 or 4200 part.
43_15ecbplus.22: In an interview with El Reg, Mark Papermaster, AMD's CTO, deflected all of the interesting questions about how the SeaMicro 3D torus interconnect might be used, such as extending it beyond one chassis to span multiple chassis under a single management and cluster domain, or maybe adding cache coherence and shared main memory across all or a portion of a SeaMicro server's nodes.
43_15ecbplus.23: The acquisition, said Papermaster, "allows us to redefine the server building block, " and he noted that AMD was keen on becoming "an agile SoC company, " referring to system - on - chip designs that put processors and other system elements into a single piece of glass.
43_15ecbplus.24: And he confirmed El Reg's sense that AMD was not getting into the server business.
43_15ecbplus.25: "You have that exactly right, " said Papermaster.
43_15ecbplus.26: When asked about when AMD and SeaMicro started talking, Papermaster would not be specific, except to say that AMD "moved very, very rapidly. "
43_15ecbplus.27: This was quite possibly to keep someone else from buying SeaMicro and very certainly in part as a reaction to Intel's purchase of the InfiniBand networking business from QLogic back in January for $125m.
43_15ecbplus.28: Papermaster would not comment on rumors that AMD has been taking a look at ARM server chip maker Calxeda, but it could very well turn out that if AMD had tried to do that deal, it might be grateful that it fell through.
43_15ecbplus.29: The SeaMicro deal is a much better option if it wants to sell server interconnects and help OEM customers build cloudy servers and maybe even clustered supercomputers based on the SeaMicro "Freedom" fabric, as the latest generation is called.
43_15ecbplus.30: That fabric is processor and instruction set agnostic, as Feldman has said many times, and SeaMicro only started out on Atom processors because they gave the best bang for the watt.
43_15ecbplus.31: And it could turn out that Calxeda and AMD partner to make ARM servers somewhere down the road.
43_15ecbplus.33: Read wanted to make sure that everyone understood that the SeaMicro acquisition would have no effect on the company's 2012 and 2013 Opteron processor roadmaps and system plans, and that AMD was not leaving the traditional x86 server business.
43_15ecbplus.34: "We're in that business to stay, and we're going to grow it and invest in it, " Read said.
43_15ecbplus.35: AMD is paying $281m in cash and $53m in stock to acquire privately held SeaMicro, which raised $35m in two rounds of funding and also got $9. 3m in funding from the US government as part of the $787bn American Recovery and Reinvestment Act ( ARRA ) of 2009.
43_15ecbplus.36: Feldman is staying on at AMD after the acquisition closes and will be general manager of a new Data Center Server Solutions business unit, reporting to Su.

28_10ecbplus.0: Fred LaRue, Nixon administration aide, dies
28_10ecbplus.2: Fred LaRue, a Watergate figure and high - ranking Nixon administration official who once was rumored to be Deep Throat, has died of natural causes.
28_10ecbplus.4: His body was discovered Tuesday by a maid who entered his hotel room in Biloxi, Coroner Gary Hargrove said.
28_10ecbplus.5: LaRue was known as the "bagman" who delivered payoffs to keep participants in the Watergate break - in quiet, and served 41 / 2 months in federal prison for conspiracy to obstruct justice.
28_10ecbplus.6: LaRue served as special assistant to John Mitchell, the former attorney general who later headed President Nixon's re - election committee.
28_10ecbplus.7: LaRue was present at a 1972 meeting with Mitchell and Nixon aide Jeb Stuart Magruder at Nixon's vacation home in Key Biscayne, Fla. , where the plan to break into the Watergate complex in Washington allegedly was hatched.
28_10ecbplus.8: LaRue said he advised against the burglarization of the building, which housed Democratic Party headquarters.
28_10ecbplus.9: After his political career ended in scandal, LaRue returned to his home state of Mississippi to work in his family's oil company and with its real estate holdings.
28_10ecbplus.10: LaRue discounted rumors that he was Deep Throat, saying the mysterious source for Washington Post reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein on the Watergate story was not one person, but probably a combination of several people.

36_7ecbplus.0: The Polygamist Prophet: One Step Closer to a Texas Court
36_7ecbplus.2: The appearance was brief, perhaps two or three minutes, but the presence of Warren Jeffs in a Salt Lake City area courtroom this week revealed a man who has changed in the four years since his arrest.
36_7ecbplus.3: The man who was once on the FBI's Most Wanted List looked thinner, his hair, now close - cropped, dusted with gray, and he wore a pair of frameless glasses that seemed to emphasize his most distinctive feature, his wide, compelling eyes.
36_7ecbplus.4: Jeffs has reportedly suffered from illness brought on by extended periods of prayer and fasting.
36_7ecbplus.5: But the brief courtroom hearing with its mundane talk of calendars and hearings also brought the sometime "prophet" of a Utah - based polygamist sect one step closer to a Texas courtroom to face allegations of sexual assault and bigamy - perhaps law enforcement's best avenue to keep him behind bars.
36_7ecbplus.6: Jeffs and 11 members of his Fundamentalist Church of the Latter Day Saints ( FLDS ) were charged in 2008 by Texas authorities with a variety of felony charges, from bigamy to child abuse, following a raid on the group's Yearning for Zion Ranch in tiny Eldorado, Texas.
36_7ecbplus.7: Seven of the men have been convicted and have received sentences ranging from 7 to 75 years; another goes on trial this month.
36_7ecbplus.8: Jerry Strickland, a spokesman for Texas Attorney General Greg Abbott told TIME: "Whenever Warren Jeffs is brought to Texas, we stand ready to try him on felony charges returned by a Schleicher County grand jury. "
36_7ecbplus.9: ( Will Texas have better luck with Warren Jeffs? )
36_7ecbplus.10: Jeffs' defense team's efforts to fight extradition are a "big long shot, " according to Clifford Rosky, a criminal law professor at the University of Utah.
36_7ecbplus.11: "He is going to be extradited - it's a matter of weeks, not months, " Rosky says.
36_7ecbplus.12: On Tuesday, Jeffs refused to sign the waiver of extradition - a move his legal team had hinted would happen after Utah's Gov. Gary Herbert accepted the extradition request by Texas Gov. Rick Perry last month.
36_7ecbplus.13: The wrangling over his extradition will continue at a Nov. 15 hearing when it is likely Jeffs' legal team will argue he should remain in Utah until charges against him in that state are either dropped or reinstated.
36_7ecbplus.14: ( See a multi - media look at families excommunicated by Warren Jeffs. )
36_7ecbplus.15: In August, the Utah Supreme Court tossed out a 2008 conviction in state court that found Jeffs was an accomplice to rape after he performed a marriage between Elissa Wall, 14, and her then 19 - year - old first cousin, Allen G. Steed.
36_7ecbplus.16: Jeffs remains in Utah prison so far, while state government is asking its high court to reconsider its ruling.
36_7ecbplus.17: Prosecutors, however, have been mum on whether they will retry Jeffs.
36_7ecbplus.18: "We don't need him here right now, " Utah Assistant Attorney General Craig Barlow said, urging the court to move forward on the Texas extradition.
36_7ecbplus.19: Texas prosecutors need only prove the target of their arrest warrant is the real Warren Jeffs and that their charges are based on some reasonable belief that a crime occurred.
36_7ecbplus.20: During the raid on the FLDS ranch, Texas Rangers removed numerous boxes of records and computers.
36_7ecbplus.21: Later, the state assembled a detailed DNA map of the 401 children removed by child protective services from the ranch, plus samples from some of their parents who agreed to testing to reclaim their children.
36_7ecbplus.22: Among the evidence was a 2006 photograph marked "anniversary" that shows Jeffs kissing a 12 - year - old girl.
36_7ecbplus.23: The photo, according to FLDS detractors depicts an abusive underage marriage, while supporters claim it is just a record of a symbolic kiss marking a spiritual marriage aimed at strengthening bonds between families.
36_7ecbplus.24: But the photo is likely to be evidence in Jeffs' Texas trial, the sort of evidence that eluded Utah prosecutors.
36_7ecbplus.25: Meanwhile, Schleicher County Sheriff David Doran says his 15 - bed jail is ready for Jeffs whenever he arrives in the small West Texas town of Eldorado.
36_7ecbplus.26: The man who spent three months eluding the FBI in 2006 also could be housed in nearby San Angelo, a city of some 88, 000 residents compared to El Dorado's 1, 800.
36_7ecbplus.27: Law enforcement continues to view him as flight risk.
36_7ecbplus.28: Tuesday's hearing was delayed as attorneys and prosecutors argued.
36_7ecbplus.29: Prosecutors wanted him in prison clothes and handcuffed, defense attorneys argued he should appear unshackled in civilian clothes.
36_7ecbplus.30: The judge split the baby and Jeffs appeared in a suit, a white shirt that looked a little large in the collar, and his hands cuffed as if in prayer.
36_7ecbplus.31: As he appeared a dozen male members of the FLDS community in the courtroom audience stood and smiled at their former leader.
36_7ecbplus.34: He is very appreciative of the Utah Supreme Court's decision.
36_7ecbplus.35: He is a prayerful man and he feels, and the people who support Mr. Jeffs believe, that their prayers were answered, " Jeffs' attorney Walter F. Bugden told the Salt Lake Tribune.
36_7ecbplus.36: "He is a little thin, he is a little thin.
36_7ecbplus.37: He could use some fattening up. "

37_6ecbplus.1: Indonesia Aceh rescue operation after deadly earthquake
37_6ecbplus.2: Rescue operations are under way after a 6. 1 magnitude earthquake hit Indonesia's Aceh province, flattening houses and causing landslides.
37_6ecbplus.3: Officials say at least 24 people were killed and more than 200 injured by the quake, which struck the western tip of Sumatra island on Tuesday.
37_6ecbplus.4: One report said six children were killed and 14 trapped under debris when a mosque collapsed in Central Aceh.
37_6ecbplus.5: Indonesia is located on one of the most seismically active regions on earth.
37_6ecbplus.6: "We have recorded 24 people dead and 249 people injured, " disaster agency spokesman Sutopo Purwo Nugroho told Agence - France Presse ( AFP ) news agency.
37_6ecbplus.7: He added that more than 300 buildings have been damaged in the quake.
37_6ecbplus.9: Soldiers and police have been deployed in rescue operations, but have struggled to access some areas where roads were blocked by landslides, officials said.
37_6ecbplus.10: The Indonesian air force deployed a helicopter and a plane as part of the rescue efforts.
37_6ecbplus.11: Officials say that the quake was felt for around 15 seconds, from Banda Aceh, the regional capital, to Bener Meriah, one of the worst - hit areas.
37_6ecbplus.12: In Bener Meriah, about 300 people slept outdoors on Tuesday night as the area was hit by strong aftershocks and people were afraid to return to their homes, a local official told AFP.
37_6ecbplus.13: "We have a power outage now and communications are unreliable, " he added.
37_6ecbplus.14: In 2004, a magnitude 9. 1 quake off Indonesia triggered a tsunami that killed some 230, 000 people around the Indian Ocean.
37_6ecbplus.15: Indonesia is prone to earthquakes due to its location on the Pacific Ring of Fire, an arc of volcanoes and fault lines encircling the Pacific Basin.

10_4ecbplus.0: Sources: Sox May Not Be Out Of Teixeira Chase
10_4ecbplus.1: Team Execs Meet With Player's Agent
10_4ecbplus.3: Despite saying they have been outbid for free agent first baseman Mark Teixeira, the Red Sox do not believe they are completely out of the chase, SportsCenter 5 has learned.
10_4ecbplus.4: Sources have also told SportsCenter 5's Mike Lynch more about the negotiations that took place Thursday at Teixeira's Texas home.
10_4ecbplus.5: Lynch reported the Red Sox team of owner John Henry, COO Larry Lucchino and General Manager Theo Epstein offered Teixeira, 28, an eight - year deal worth $184 million or $23 million per season.
10_4ecbplus.6: It was then that agent Scott Boras countered by asking for an eight - year contract worth $200 million, sources said.
10_4ecbplus.7: Lynch reported that Henry became infuriated at that point, balking at the massive sum.
10_4ecbplus.8: In an e - mail to media members Thursday night, Henry said, "We met with Mr. Teixeira and were very much impressed with him.
10_4ecbplus.9: After hearing about his other offers, however, it seems clear that we are not going to be a factor. "
10_4ecbplus.10: Henry's reference to the "other offers" leaves open the possibility that he is calling Boras' bluff, who has been known to inflate the value of offers and the number of suitors pursuing his client, Lynch reported.
10_4ecbplus.11: Boras represented former Red Sox center fielder Johnny Damon, who signed with the New York Yankees in 2005 after the Boston brass apparently refused to believe that the offer from their archrivals was real.
10_4ecbplus.12: Lynch also learned that one of Teixeira's hometown teams, the Washington Nationals, has made a huge offer.
10_4ecbplus.14: Teixeira was traded from Atlanta to Los Angeles in July.
10_4ecbplus.15: He hit. 308 with 33 homers and 121 RBIs last season, including. 358 with 13 homers and 43 RBIs in 54 games with the Angels.
10_4ecbplus.16: The Angeles said last week they made an eight - year offer.
10_4ecbplus.17: Henry had expressed concern about a contract of eight years or more.
10_4ecbplus.18: "We all have limits, " he wrote the AP on Wednesday.
10_4ecbplus.19: "Eight years is a very long time in baseball and everywhere else. "
10_4ecbplus.20: He also said the amount the team is willing to spend on a free agent "depends on both" the economy and the player being sought.

7_3ecbplus.0: Wladimir Klitschko stops Tony Thompson to retain world heavyweight titles
7_3ecbplus.3: Wladimir Klitschko stopped Tony Thompson in the sixth round to keep a comfortable hold on his WBA, IBF and WBO heavyweight title belts on Saturday in Bern, Switzerland.
7_3ecbplus.4: Klitschko put Thompson on the canvas with a big right hand near the end of the fifth round at Stade de Suisse, and the 40 - year - old American southpaw never recovered.
7_3ecbplus.5: The Ukrainian champion dropped Thompson again in the sixth, and referee Sam Williams gave the challenger a standing count before stopping the fight at 2: 56.
7_3ecbplus.6: "Thompson was not so easy to box.
7_3ecbplus.7: I'm satisfied, " said the 36 - year - old Klitschko, who improved his record to 58 - 3 ( 51 KO ).
7_3ecbplus.8: Klitschko finished the fight five rounds sooner than when knocking out Thompson in the 11th of their first title fight in 2008.
7_3ecbplus.9: Thompson, who was the mandatory challenger nominated by the IBF, fell to 36 - 3 ( 24 KO ).
7_3ecbplus.10: After the fight, Klitschko led the 22, 000 crowd in signing "Happy Birthday" to his trainer Emanuel Steward, whose was 68 on Saturday.
7_3ecbplus.11: "Tony Thompson is very hard to hit, " Steward said.
7_3ecbplus.12: "Tony was watching Wladimir's right hand all night. "
7_3ecbplus.13: A cagey opening round was followed by a scrappy second, as Klitschko twice wrestled Thompson to the floor.
7_3ecbplus.14: Thompson briefly stepped up his cautious tactics when landing a left to Klitschko's face in the third.
7_3ecbplus.15: Klitschko finally landed a long, straight right in the fifth and the round ended with Thompson struggling on the ropes.
7_3ecbplus.16: The champion cornered Thompson toward the end of the sixth, and landed punches to the head though no single blow appeared to cause serious damage.
7_3ecbplus.17: "I got caught but I'm OK, " Thompson said in the ring.
7_3ecbplus.18: "He's strong and he's world heavyweight champion for a reason. "
7_3ecbplus.19: Klitschko extended the domination of the heavyweight ranks he shares with his elder brother Vitali.
7_3ecbplus.20: Vitali was in his brother's corner as usual, and acted as cheerleader in the third round, urging on fans in the football stadium when the first chants of "Klitschko, Klistchko" stirred.
7_3ecbplus.21: The elder Klitschko will defend his WBC title against Manuel Charr of Germany in Moscow on Sept. 8.

43_1ecbplus.0: AMD Announces Strategic Investment to Accelerate Cloud Server Strategy
43_1ecbplus.1: On February 29, 2012, AMD announced a definitive agreement to acquire SeaMicro, a pioneer in energy - efficient, high - bandwidth microservers.
43_1ecbplus.2: By acquiring SeaMicro, AMD is accelerating our disruptive server strategy, taking advantage of an inflection point in the industry driving opportunities in low power, client mobility, emerging markets and the cloud / megadata centers.
43_1ecbplus.3: This disruptive move positions AMD to expand our current server offerings and provide our customers with low - power, low - cost, high - bandwidth platforms.
43_1ecbplus.4: With SeaMicro, AMD builds upon our processor design and compute expertise with system - level advances in energy efficiency, total cost of ownership and density for customers.
43_1ecbplus.5: We are excited to have SeaMicro join AMD.
43_1ecbplus.6: The combination of SeaMicro IP with AMD Opteron™ technologies and our focus on execution provide AMD differentiated capabilities to address the evolving needs of the server market.

34_5ecbplus.0: AMA Celebrates Nomination of Regina Benjamin, MD, Surgeon General
34_5ecbplus.3: The American Medical Association is delighted that Dr. Regina Benjamin, MD, has been nominated to serve as our nation's next U. S. Surgeon General.
34_5ecbplus.4: Her many impressive accomplishments, including receiving a 2008 MacArthur Fellowship, commonly known as the "genius grant", leave no doubt as to her qualifications.
34_5ecbplus.5: "Dr. Benjamin's most important qualification for surgeon general is her deep commitment to her patients.
34_5ecbplus.6: We are particularly gratified to see her recognized for her work caring for patients in rural Alabama, and for her commitment to rebuilding her rural health clinic in the wake of Hurricane Katrina.
34_5ecbplus.7: She is a true professional who puts her patients first.
34_5ecbplus.8: The AMA is immensely proud of Dr. Benjamin's accomplishments, and we are extremely fortunate that she has just served a term as chair of the AMA's Council on Ethical and Judicial Affairs.
34_5ecbplus.9: She served as a member of the AMA's Board of Trustees with the dual distinctions of being the AMA's first young physician trustee, as well as the first African - American woman board member.
34_5ecbplus.10: We look forward to seeing Dr. Benjamin serve as an advocate for all the nation's patients, as our country works toward health reform that provides high quality, affordable health coverage for all. "

24_3ecbplus.0: Thieves in $2. 6 million smash - and - grab raid on Paris jewelry store
24_3ecbplus.1: A smash - and - grab on a high end Paris store saw four robbers make off with jewelry and watches valued at over $2. 6 million early Monday.
24_3ecbplus.2: At around 4: 30 a. m. local time ( 11. 30 p. m. ET ) the thieves rammed an SUV into the front of the Casty store, near the prestigious Place Vendome, a well - known square in the center of the French capital that is home to a number of jewelers and high - end stores.
24_3ecbplus.3: After scooping up jewelry and watches estimated to be worth 2 million euros ( $2. 6 million ) the thieves reversed their car out of the store and set fire to it before making off in another vehicle, Le Monde reported.
24_3ecbplus.4: The raid comes little over a month after a masked bandit made off with an $136M worth of diamonds and jewels from the Carlton Intercontinental Hotel in Cannes on the glamorous French Riviera, in possibly the world ’ s biggest heist.
24_3ecbplus.5: A lone robber entered through a French door at the side of the building on the famed La Croisette seafront, scooped up the loot and then jumped out of another window.
24_3ecbplus.6: Despite a huge police investigation, the audacious culprit remains at large.
24_3ecbplus.7: Thieves also targeted the annual Cannes film festival, stealing almost $2 million of jewelry from the safe in the hotel room of an American jeweler working for Chopard, one of Switzerland ’ s most famous diamond merchants.
24_3ecbplus.8: Days later a $2. 5 million necklace was lifted by a crook at a movie industry party at the even more exclusive resort of Cap d ’ Antibes, near the Italian border.

4_10ecbplus.0: Esther Williams, Olympic swimmer turned actress and pinup girl, dies at 91
4_10ecbplus.1: Esther Williams, the swimming champion turned actress who starred in glittering and aquatic Technicolor musicals of the 1940s and 1950s, has died.
4_10ecbplus.3: Williams died early Thursday in her sleep, according to her longtime publicist Harlan Boll.
4_10ecbplus.4: Williams in a bathing suit became a favorite pinup of GI's in World War II, and her popularity continued afterward.

28_2ecbplus.2: Frederick Cheney LaRue, 75, the shadowy Nixon White House aide and "bagman" who delivered more than $300, 000 in payoffs to Watergate conspirators, died of coronary artery disease in a Biloxi, Miss. , motel room, where he lived.
28_2ecbplus.3: His body was found by a motel maid July 27, but Harrison County, Miss. , coroner Gary Hargrove said he believed the death occurred July 24.
28_2ecbplus.4: Mr. LaRue had a history of heart problems, Hargrove said.
28_2ecbplus.5: Considered one of the most mysterious men in the Nixon administration, Mr. LaRue served as a presidential aide without title, salary or mention in the White House directory.
28_2ecbplus.6: Yet he was so close to the center of power that he was one of the few present at a March 30, 1972, meeting at Nixon's vacation home on Key Biscayne, Fla. , at which former attorney general John Mitchell discussed the planned break - in and bugging of the Democratic National Committee headquarters office in the Watergate building.
28_2ecbplus.7: The money for the operation came from Nixon's reelection campaign funds, as did "hush money" paid to the Watergate burglars and their attorneys, Mr. LaRue later testified to the Senate Watergate investigative committee.
28_2ecbplus.8: He was the first administration official to plead guilty to charges in the Watergate coverup and was the last to be sentenced.
28_2ecbplus.9: He pleaded guilty to one count of conspiracy to obstruct justice and was sentenced to one to three years, with all but six months suspended.
28_2ecbplus.11: Mr. LaRue came to Washington in 1969 as an experienced political hand and was described in a 1972 Washington Post profile as a squinting, mumbling "Faulknerian character, an insignificant - looking man who. .. passionately sought anonymity throughout his wheeler - dealer days. "
28_2ecbplus.12: He was considered the liaison between Mitchell and Mississippi Sen. James O. Eastland ( D ), who was chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee and who supported Nixon's judicial appointments.
28_2ecbplus.13: Mr. LaRue's role during Nixon's 1968 election campaign was to woo Southern voters.
28_2ecbplus.14: Born in Athens, Tex. , Mr. LaRue was nicknamed "Bubba" in his family and graduated from the University of Oklahoma with a bachelor's degree in geology in 1951.
28_2ecbplus.15: His father, Ike Parsons LaRue, went to jail on crimes involving banking law, and upon his release, struck it rich in the oil and gas business.
28_2ecbplus.16: The son sold one of their Mississippi oil fields for a reported $30 million in 1957, using his family's newfound wealth to become a political financier.
28_2ecbplus.17: Later that year, Mr. LaRue shot and killed his father in a duck - hunting accident in Canada.
28_2ecbplus.18: Mr. LaRue became active in state Republican politics and served on the Republican National Committee from 1963 to 1968.
28_2ecbplus.19: He donated to Barry Goldwater's 1964 presidential campaign and was an early donor to Nixon's 1968 campaign.
28_2ecbplus.20: He was very close to Mitchell, and after the attorney general resigned in 1972 to become campaign director of the Committee to Re - Elect the President ( CREEP ), Mr. LaRue went with him.
28_2ecbplus.21: After the Watergate break - in, Mr. LaRue and another aide, Robert C. Mardian, were put in charge of the coverup, supervising the shredding of documents and destruction of financial records.
28_2ecbplus.22: Hugh W. Sloan Jr. , former treasurer of the CREEP Finance Committee, said under oath that Mr. LaRue and deputy campaign manager Jeb Stuart Magruder told him he might have to commit perjury to protect the Watergate conspiracy.
28_2ecbplus.23: They tried to get him to agree to testify that he gave Watergate burglar G. Gordon Liddy much less than the campaign's financial records showed.
28_2ecbplus.24: After Mr. LaRue pleaded guilty and served his sentence in 1973, he returned to Mississippi, where he worked in the family oil and real estate development business, his nephew William T. LaRue said.
28_2ecbplus.25: The family money had dwindled by the early 1970s, after the LaRues lost money in the Castaways, a Las Vegas gambling casino they bought in 1963.
28_2ecbplus.26: Mr. LaRue said in 1971, "I'm no millionaire. "
28_2ecbplus.27: He was one of many Nixon - era figures rumored over the years to be "Deep Throat, " the undercover source of Washington Post reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein.
28_2ecbplus.28: Mr. LaRue denied that he was Deep Throat, and Woodward said he will not reveal the source's name until after Deep Throat dies.
28_2ecbplus.29: Survivors include his wife, Joyce LaRue of Jackson, Miss. ; five children; and several grandchildren.

7_9ecbplus.0: WLADIMIR KLITSCHKO RETAINS WORLD HEAVYWEIGHT BELTS
7_9ecbplus.2: Wladimir Klitschko stopped Tony Thompson in the sixth round to retain his WBA, IBF and WBO heavyweight title belts Saturday night.
7_9ecbplus.3: The 36 - year - old champion Klitschko, 58 - 3 with 51 knockouts, floored Thompson with a big right hand near the end of the fifth round at Stade de Suisse, and the 40 - year - old American never recovered.

27_6ecbplus.0: Microsoft: IE Zero Day Flaw Affects All Versions
27_6ecbplus.1: Microsoft said today that attackers are exploiting a previously unknown, unpatched vulnerability in all supported versions of its Internet Explorer Web browser.
27_6ecbplus.2: The company said it is working on an official patch to plug the security hole, but in the meantime it has released a stopgap fix to help protect affected customers.
27_6ecbplus.3: Microsoft said it is aware of targeted attacks that attempt to exploit the vulnerability ( CVE - 2013 - 3893 ) in IE 8 and IE 9 versions of the default Windows browser.
27_6ecbplus.4: According to an advisory issued today, the flaw is a remote code bug, which means malware or miscreants could use it install malware just by coaxing IE users to browse a hacked or malicious Web site.
27_6ecbplus.5: The Fix It solution is available from this link.
27_6ecbplus.6: To apply it, click the Fix It icon above the Fix This Problem link.
27_6ecbplus.7: Applying this solution may limit some functionalities of IE, so if you run into problems after applying this interim patch, you can click the Fix It icon to the right of that “ enable ” button to reverse the update.
27_6ecbplus.8: Update: As several readers have already noted in the comments, this Fix It solution is for 32 - bit versions of IE only.
27_6ecbplus.9: In 64 - bit Windows, you can tell whether the browser you ’ re using is a 32 - bit or 64 - bit version by opening the Windows Task Manager ( Ctrl+Shift+Esc ) and clicking the Processes tab.
27_6ecbplus.10: The number that appears after the process name ( in this case, iexplore. exe ) indicates the version in use.

10_19ecbplus.1: Prediction: Red Sox Will Nab Teixeira
10_19ecbplus.2: ESPN is reporting that the Nationals have offered Mark Teixeira an 8 - year, $160 million contract.
10_19ecbplus.3: At the same time, SI. com is reporting that, “ The Red Sox are one of the most aggressive pursuers of Teixeira, with several executives predicting he may wind up there. ”
10_19ecbplus.4: The Nationals ’ offer sets the bar for Teixeira ’ s services.
10_19ecbplus.5: Will the Sox have to offer more money and / or years, or does playing in Boston, for a winning team, with very a passionate fan base mean more than playing near his hometown in Maryland?
10_19ecbplus.6: Naturally Scott Boras will try to draw this out as long as he can.
10_19ecbplus.7: However, Teixeira has said he would like a resolution by Christmas.
10_19ecbplus.8: The question is, now that the Angels have lost out on CC Sabathia, will they be all the more motivated to retain Teixeira?
10_19ecbplus.9: Could they swoop in with an overwhelming offer?
10_19ecbplus.10: The LA Times says the Angels are reluctant to go past seven years for Teixeira.
10_19ecbplus.11: And though they still need more pitching, the Yankees can never be discounted.
10_19ecbplus.12: However, unfortunately for the Angels, Ken Rosenthal of Fox Sports reports that two major - league sources said Teixeira would prefer to be on the East Coast for family reasons.
10_19ecbplus.13: With that in mind, the Nationals and Orioles are pushing hard to bring Teixeira back to the Maryland area.
10_19ecbplus.14: Last night, Rosenthal reported that, according to a major - league source, the Red Sox are making progress in their quest to sign Teixeira.
10_19ecbplus.15: “ Headway was being made earlier today, ” the source said.
10_19ecbplus.16: And a rival general manager whose plans could be affected by the Red Sox ’ s addition of Teixeira also indicated that a deal was getting closer.
10_19ecbplus.17: Teixeira is seeking a 10 - year contract for at least $20 million per season.
10_19ecbplus.18: The Red Sox preference would be to sign him to a deal between six and eight years.
10_19ecbplus.19: The free - agent first baseman will be 29 on April 11, coinciding with the opening week of the 2009 season.
10_19ecbplus.20: By all indications, he ’ s a solid long - term investment.
10_19ecbplus.21: Eight years seems like a reasonable contract - length for a player of Teixeira ’ s age and ability.
10_19ecbplus.22: But if the Sox are pushed to 10 years, they would likely deem it acceptable.
10_19ecbplus.23: They will do whatever it takes to get it done.
10_19ecbplus.24: Teixeira is the big fish they ’ re determined not to let slip away.
10_19ecbplus.25: Having never hit fewer than 26 homers in his six major - league seasons, Teixeira certainly seems like a better long - term investment than Sabathia.
10_19ecbplus.26: Paying astronomical money to a guy who plays every day makes more sense than guaranteeing it to one who plays every five days, and who has weight issues.
10_19ecbplus.27: Questions about his long term durability will continue to dog Sabathia for at least the next couple of years.
10_19ecbplus.28: Teixeira remains the hottest commodity on the free agent market because he ’ s been durable, injury - free, and highly productive.
10_19ecbplus.29: Over six full seasons, his career stat line looks like this: . 290 average, . 919 OPS, 203 HR, 676 RBI
10_19ecbplus.30: Last season, split between the Braves and Angels, Teixeira hit. 308, with 33 home runs and 121 RBI.
10_19ecbplus.31: He ’ s proven himself in both leagues.
10_19ecbplus.32: He is an All Star, a two - time Gold Glove winner, and a two - time Silver Slugger winner.
10_19ecbplus.33: Without question, Teixeira is a very solid hitter and a bona fide slugger; he is one of just five players in Major League history to hit at least 100 home runs in his first three seasons.
10_19ecbplus.34: For these reasons, he has been described as the “ apple of Theo Epstein ’ s eye. ”
10_19ecbplus.35: This is why the Red Sox will not fail in their effort to bring home their single highest priority this offseason.

33_1ecbplus.0: Footage Of Brooklyn Mother's Fatal Shooting Released During Trial
33_1ecbplus.2: Video of Brooklyn Mother of 13 Zurana Horton shot and killed in a gang shooting was revealed Thursday, according to the N. Y. Daily News.
33_1ecbplus.3: The footage shows 34 - year - old Horton ( pictured ) picking up her daughter from school on October 21, 2011, in Brooklyn's Brownsville section.
33_1ecbplus.4: Around 2: 18 p. m. , Horton and two other Moms are seen waiting at an intersection as a yellow bus pulls up to the curb.
33_1ecbplus.5: The shooting then breaks out, with Horton pushing a child out of the way to take a bullet.
33_1ecbplus.6: She then grips her chest and collapses to the ground.
33_1ecbplus.7: Prosecutors showed the tragic footage at the trial of the two youths charged with murdering Horton.
33_1ecbplus.8: Twenty - year - old Andrew Lopez has been accused of carelessly firing at rival gang members from a rooftop.
33_1ecbplus.9: Half - brother Jonathan Carrasquillo is suspected of having directed Lopez to kill their enemies.
33_1ecbplus.10: Both are charged with murder, with Lopez standing accused of letting off 13 shots in Horton's death.
33_1ecbplus.11: One of the two Mothers with Horton that day testified at the trial.
33_1ecbplus.13: I saw blood coming from her, " said Unique Armstead, who is seen in the video covering her son with her body as the shooting began.
33_1ecbplus.14: Armstead sustained a gunshot wound to her left arm.
33_1ecbplus.15: Armstead said she heard someone say, "He has a gun, " prompting her to take her son inside a nearby corner bodega for safety.
33_1ecbplus.16: When the coast seemed clear, they reportedly went back out, which is when the shots began.
33_1ecbplus.17: "I thought it was a brick but it was a bullet, " Armstead said.
33_1ecbplus.18: "I told my son, I think I'm shot. "
33_1ecbplus.19: The trial is scheduled to resume Monday, with testimony from a man who claims Lopez's brother threatened to kill him; he is reportedly scared to take the stand.
33_1ecbplus.20: "The man is petrified, " Judge Vincent DelGiudice said.

25_3ecbplus.1: Saints place RB Pierre Thomas on injured reserve
25_3ecbplus.2: One day after placing leading rusher Chris Ivory on injured reserve, the Saints have lost another RB for the season.

25_3ecbplus.4: Thomas suffered through an injury - plagued 2010 season, missing 10 of the Saints' 16 games with a troublesome left ankle sprain.
25_3ecbplus.5: He returned to play in Weeks 14 - 16, but missed New Orleans' season - finale after tweaking the injury.
25_3ecbplus.6: Ivory made the most of his opportunities with Thomas and Reggie Bush ( broken tibia ) missing time with injuries.
25_3ecbplus.7: The undrafted rookie averaged 5. 2 yards a carry and finished with a team - high 716 yards rushing and five touchdowns.
25_3ecbplus.8: The Saints re - signed RB DeShawn Wynn to take Ivory's place on the roster on Tuesday.
25_3ecbplus.9: After putting Thomas on IR Wednesday, New Orleans replaced him by signing RB Joique Bell off the Eagles' practice squad.
25_3ecbplus.10: Thomas joins a growing tally of shelved Saints RBs.
25_3ecbplus.11: Ladell Betts went on IR in early December and the team lost Lynell Hamilton and P. J. Hill to season - ending injuries during the preseason.
25_3ecbplus.12: Bush, veteran Julius Jones and Wynn are expected to carry the load as the Saints try to defend their title.
25_3ecbplus.13: New Orleans begins its postseason Saturday at 4: 30 p. m. ET with a wild - card round game in Seattle against the NFC West champion Seahawks.

18_1ecbplus.0: Sheriff: Michigan office shooting kills 1, injures 2
18_1ecbplus.2: A Michigan man shot to death one person and injured two others Monday at the suburban Detroit accounting firm from which he was fired last week, police said.
18_1ecbplus.3: The suspect, 38 - year - old Anthony LaCalamita, was "deliberately seeking out these individuals, " according to Troy police Lt. Gerry Scherlinck.
18_1ecbplus.4: A female receptionist died and two men, believed to be "management level employees, " underwent surgery for gunshot wounds at Royal Oak Beaumont Hospital, Scherlinck said.
18_1ecbplus.5: A 50 - year - old man from Dexter, Michigan, tipped off authorities to LaCalamita's location after hearing a description of the suspect's vehicle - - a 2007 silver Ford Fusion - - on the radio.
18_1ecbplus.6: The man, who did not want to be identified, called 911 when he realized the vehicle directly next to him matched the description on the radio, according to Genesee County Sheriff Robert Pickell.
18_1ecbplus.7: Police attempted to stop the vehicle as it entered Vienna township, but LaCalamita would not pull over, Pickell said.
18_1ecbplus.8: LaCalamita drove across several counties, at speeds up to 120 miles per hour, surrendering only after authorities boxed in his car on Interstate 75 in Saginaw, Michigan.
18_1ecbplus.9: He surrendered "peacefully and without incident, " Pickell said.
18_1ecbplus.10: Upon arrest, police seized a shotgun and several shells, he said.
18_1ecbplus.11: LaCalamita is being held in the Genesee County jail and is expected to be handed over to the Detroit police.
18_1ecbplus.12: A Web site for the public accounting firm Gordon Advisors in the building lists LaCalamita as an employee.
18_1ecbplus.14: We're on the third floor, barricaded in, " Bill Adgate, who works for LPL Financial in the office building, told CNN affiliate WDIV - TV as the search went on for the gunman.
18_1ecbplus.15: "We put a conference table in front of the front door with a bunch of chairs, " Adgate told WDIV, a Detroit station.
18_1ecbplus.16: "We have four entrances - - three entrances to our offices.
18_1ecbplus.17: We put file cabinets and things of that nature in front of it. "
18_1ecbplus.18: Monday's shooting follows two last week in public places in Atlanta, Georgia, and Seattle, Washington.
18_1ecbplus.19: In Atlanta's CNN Center on Tuesday, police say a man shot to death his former girlfriend just downstairs from the center's Omni Hotel and outside the CNN. com newsroom.
18_1ecbplus.20: On Monday on the Seattle campus of the University of Washington, a gunman killed his former girlfriend and then himself.
18_1ecbplus.21: In early March, a gunman shot and wounded three people at a printing facility near Los Angeles, California, before killing himself.
18_1ecbplus.22: Police said he was a disgruntled employee of the facility in Signal Hill, California.
18_1ecbplus.23: In February, a gunman killed five people and injured several others at a shopping mall in Salt Lake City, Utah, before an off - duty policeman killed the shooter.
