9_10ecbplus.0: President Barack Obama overturns Bush administration ruling on Endangered Species Act
9_10ecbplus.2: President Barack Obama announced plans Tuesday to resume full scientific reviews of projects that might harm endangered wildlife and plants.
9_10ecbplus.3: The president signed a memorandum putting on hold a Bush administration regulation allowing agencies to avoid scientific reviews in endangered species decisions.
9_10ecbplus.4: During a visit to the Interior Department, Obama said the review process had been undermined by past administrations.
9_10ecbplus.5: "For more than three decades, the Endangered Species Act has successfully protected our nation's most threatened wildlife.
9_10ecbplus.6: We should be looking for ways to improve it, not weaken it, " Obama said.
9_10ecbplus.7: Obama's action puts the Bush regulation on hold until the Interior and Commerce departments complete a review.
9_10ecbplus.8: While on the campaign trail, Obama said he would fight to maintain the protections of the Endangered Species Act and work to undo what was then a proposal by the Bush administration.
9_10ecbplus.9: The rule, finalized in December, made optional the mandatory, independent consultations federal scientists have performed for 35 years on projects.
9_10ecbplus.10: The reviews have been blamed by developers and federal agencies for delays and cost increases.
9_10ecbplus.11: Instead, the Bush rule allowed federal agencies to decide for themselves whether projects such as dams and power plants posed risks to endangered species or the places they live.
9_10ecbplus.12: These changes, which were completed in a relatively short time, were described at the time by the Bush administration as minor.
9_10ecbplus.13: But Democrats and environmentalists have argued that the regulations overhauled long - standing policy.
9_10ecbplus.14: Democratic leaders in Congress who have been attempting to reverse the rule applauded the president's decision.
9_10ecbplus.15: "I wholeheartedly support the president's proposal to restore the protections for endangered species that the Bush administration spent so many years trying to undermine, " said Rep. Nick Rahall, D - W. Va. , who chairs the House Natural Resources Committee.
9_10ecbplus.16: Rahall is pushing to overturn the rule through a congressional resolution.
9_10ecbplus.17: There is also a provision tucked into the $410 billion spending bill the House passed last week that would allow the Interior and Commerce secretaries to withdraw regulations.
9_10ecbplus.18: Since the rule took effect before Obama was sworn in, overturning it through regulation would require a lengthy review process.
9_10ecbplus.19: Industry and business representatives said restoring scientific input would only delay projects, including those that will be funded by the recently passed stimulus package.
9_10ecbplus.20: But Obama, in announcing his decision, said that economic recovery and protecting the environment are not at odds with one another.
9_10ecbplus.21: "We can grow our economy today, " Obama said, "and preserve the environment for ourselves and our children and our grandchildren. "

6_7ecbplus.0: GARY ROSS REMAINS IN NEGOTIATIONS TO DIRECT 'THE HUNGER GAMES' SEQUEL
6_7ecbplus.2: After opening to the third - biggest domestic debut weekend of all time, legitimate pop culture phenomenon The Hunger Games has grossed $368. 0 million globally.
6_7ecbplus.3: It's done so in under two weeks of theatrical release.
6_7ecbplus.4: So with by far the biggest hit in its history, Lionsgate is naturally keen to continue the series with Catching Fire, the already announced adaptation of Suzanne Collins's novel.
6_7ecbplus.5: But apparently it's not a guarantee that Gary Ross, who co - wrote and directed The Hunger Games, will be back for another round.
6_7ecbplus.6: Lionsgate has long been open about its intent to turn Collins's bestselling young adult novels into a franchise, one that would spin four movies out of the literary trilogy.
6_7ecbplus.7: Last year, the studio staked out a November 22, 2013 release date for Catching Fire and pursued Oscar winning Slumdog Millionaire screenwriter Simon Beaufoy to pen the script.
6_7ecbplus.8: In January, word emerged that Beaufoy was indeed at work on Catching Fire, and at the time, word was that he was doing so under Ross's supervision, with the director set to return.
6_7ecbplus.9: Since then, it's been generally accepted that Ross would take another trip to Panem, particularly once The Hunger Games received an overwhelmingly positive critical response and, you know, made dump trucks of money.
6_7ecbplus.10: Ross has by no means been set to direct, however.
6_7ecbplus.11: According to The Hollywood Reporter, he has yet to formally sign on, and negotiations might just be proceeding with some difficulty, if the process on The Hunger Games is any indicator.
6_7ecbplus.12: The reports cites an anonymous source familiar with Ross's negotiations last time, who cites it as, "a terrible experience. "
6_7ecbplus.13: Lionsgate, unaccustomed to dealing with directors as established as the four time Oscar nominee and Pleasantville and Seabiscuit director, reportedly played some hardball with Ross, who ended up being paid $3 million.
6_7ecbplus.14: That relatively low figure was no doubt helped by the 5% of the film's backend profits.
6_7ecbplus.15: Having delivered a critically acclaimed, zeitgeist - tapping event movie, Ross is doubtless expecting a bigger figure for Catching Fire, but will Lionsgate pay it?
6_7ecbplus.18: Lionsgate recently bought Summit Entertainment, the distributor behind the Twilight franchise, meaning that the Lionsgate film division is now under the auspices of Summit's Patrick Wachsberger and Rob Friedman.
6_7ecbplus.19: The revolving door of directors on the Twilight series has some fans worried that a similar policy might be carried out with The Hunger Games sequels.
6_7ecbplus.20: Negotiations with Ross didn't actually begin until roughly three weeks before the first film's release, at which point it was obvious that the film would be successful, giving no small amount of leverage to the director, who co - wrote the screenplay with Collins and Billy Ray.
6_7ecbplus.21: While Ross wasn't signed on to multiple films, stars Jennifer Lawrence, Josh Hutcherson, and Liam Hemsworth are all on board for the duration of the series.
6_7ecbplus.22: But that's not say there's no potential issues there either.
6_7ecbplus.23: The unanimously - praised Lawrence is also contractually obligated to reprise her role as Mystique in a sequel to last year's X - Men: First Class.
6_7ecbplus.24: Her commitment there apparently supersedes her Hunger Games contract, meaning that if Fox goes ahead with another X - Men at an inconvenient moment, it could complicate the Catching Fire schedule.
6_7ecbplus.25: Of course, all of this could be conjecture or, at the very least, over - analysis.
6_7ecbplus.26: Let's not get hysterical just yet, folks.

40_11ecbplus.0: Apple unveils latest MacBook Pros, iOS 6 for iPhone and iPad
40_11ecbplus.2: After a witty intro by Siri herself, Apple CEO Tim Cook took the stage in San Francisco to welcome developers and announce new stuff.
40_11ecbplus.3: Cook had a lot to say about the success of the app program, with 30 billion downloads of 650, 000 distinct apps worldwide.
40_11ecbplus.4: Once Cook rattled off the specs, they played a video about the success of apps, from one that a blind man built to help seeing - impaired people get around, to the successful Airbnb, a place for couch surfers to find homes away from home, to a speech therapy tool for iPad that's helping a little girl learn how to communicate.
40_11ecbplus.5: It may be marketing, but parts are truly touching.
40_11ecbplus.6: Needless to say, the developers applauded profusely.
40_11ecbplus.7: "We would like to thank everyone in the developer community for the incredible apps that you've done for us, " says Cook.
40_11ecbplus.9: Next, global marketing VP Phil Schiller announced updates to the MacBook line.
40_11ecbplus.10: The MacBook Air gets 3rd - gen Core chips, up to 2GHz dual - core i7.
40_11ecbplus.11: It also gets storage up to 512 GB Flash storage, with 2x read speed.
40_11ecbplus.12: And it gets USB 3. 0 and a 720p camera.
40_11ecbplus.13: The new models start shipping today.
40_11ecbplus.14: The 13 - inch and 15 - inch MacBook Pros get Ivy Bridge processors, a new - generation GeForce graphics card and USB 3. 0, while the prices stay the same.
40_11ecbplus.15: But the big news is the "next generation" MacBook Pro, which is about as thin as a MacBook Air, with a 15 - inch "retina display" of 2880 x 1800 pixels.
40_11ecbplus.17: But it's not just about the display and thinness.
40_11ecbplus.18: There's a quad - core i7 chip up to 2. 7GHz; up to 16GB of RAM; the new GeForce Kepler graphics and 768GB of internal flash storage.
40_11ecbplus.20: Battery life sounds right: 7 hours on a charge, with 30 days of standby.
40_11ecbplus.21: And as for ports: SD, HDMI, USB 3, a new MagSafe 2 and two Thunderbolts ports.
40_11ecbplus.23: Read into that what you will, but clearly Apple will not be supporting Blu - ray anytime soon ( or ever ).
40_11ecbplus.24: Adobe, Autodesk and others are developing apps to work with the new retina display.
40_11ecbplus.25: ( Aside to the creative people: Hooray for Photoshop being in sync with Mac development! )
40_11ecbplus.27: After the pulse - racing MacBook unveiling, Apple execs took things down a notch to discuss features of OS X 10. 8, Mountain Lion, including drill - down on stuff that has already been revealed.
40_11ecbplus.28: For a quick look at those features, have a look here.
40_11ecbplus.29: Some awesome ones include Messages, dictation, sharing and AirPlay mirroring, which lets you send up to 1080p video from Mac to Apple TV.
40_11ecbplus.30: The new Safari is great: You can click a cloud icon to see tabs open on other devices such as iPads and iPhones, and if you zoom out, each tab becomes a thumbnail, so you can easily get to the tab you want.
40_11ecbplus.31: Mountain Lion will launch next month, and will cost $19. 99.
40_11ecbplus.32: We've got more details on Mountain Lion's upcoming release here.
40_11ecbplus.34: Following Mountain Lion, SVP of iOS software Scott Forstall took the stage to unveil iOS 6, something that had been somewhat confirmed, but without any details.
40_11ecbplus.35: First on his agenda was Siri: "In eight months, Siri has been studying up and learning a lot, " says Forstall.
40_11ecbplus.36: Now, in iOS 6, you can ask score of last Giants game, even batting average of a given player, team standings.
40_11ecbplus.37: Impressive ( if it works in my house ).
40_11ecbplus.38: Forstall: "Who is taller, Lebron or Kobe? "
40_11ecbplus.39: Siri: "Lebron James appears to be slightly taller. "
40_11ecbplus.40: In addition to sports, Siri does more with restaurant details, and is partnered with Yelp for reviews and OpenTable for reservations.
40_11ecbplus.41: Yes, you can make dinner reservations with Siri.
40_11ecbplus.42: Good news for a food person like myself.
40_11ecbplus.43: For movies, Rotten Tomatoes reviews are integrated, and you can tap inside Siri to watch trailers.
40_11ecbplus.44: Best of all, Siri can now launch apps.
40_11ecbplus.45: New driving mode for Siri: "Eyes free, " says Forstall.
40_11ecbplus.46: Button on steering wheel of some car manufacturers including GM, Toyota, Honda, Land Rover, Audi, Mercedes Benz and BMW.
40_11ecbplus.47: Siri will also speak 15 languages including Korean, Italian, Mandarin and Cantonese.
40_11ecbplus.49: Integrated within iOS 6 ( photos, calendars, contacts, etc. ) and even the App Store and iTunes, where you can like stuff, instead of Pinging it like nobody does now.
40_11ecbplus.50: Forstall says Facebook is coming to Mac OS, too, though it wasn't mentioned earlier.
40_11ecbplus.51: Apple is building its own mapping service, complete with fresh maps of the whole globe, plus built - in turn - by - turn navigation, so you don't need a third - party app anymore.
40_11ecbplus.52: There's also crowd - sourced traffic data ( anonymously gathered, says Apple ) tied into the service, so you have realistic ETAs and smart routing.
40_11ecbplus.53: There's also a beautiful new photo mapping feature called "Flyover" which lets you view major landmarks in 3 - D.
40_11ecbplus.54: Not sure if they've got your house in there, but it's gorgeous to look upon.
40_11ecbplus.55: More iOS 6 stuff, in rapid succession:
40_11ecbplus.56: "Reply with message" - gives you the option to send canned messages to callers.
40_11ecbplus.57: Also a "Remind me later" feature with time and geo - tagged reminders for ignored calls.
40_11ecbplus.58: "Do Not Disturb" - Phone won't bother you with calls and alerts, includes plenty of control ( no calls at all or just calls from favorites, etc ).
40_11ecbplus.59: FaceTime enabled over cellular with iOS 6.
40_11ecbplus.60: Apple is unifying phone numbers and Apple IDs - - you can now answer calls on iPad or Mac - - it's huge news but apt to depress the mobile carriers.
40_11ecbplus.61: In mobile Safari, there's now photo updating, and there's now more cross - talk between apps and browser.
40_11ecbplus.62: Shared Photo Stream - - think Instagramm style comments and integration with Mac, iPhone, Apple TV etc.
40_11ecbplus.63: VIP contacts and a "flagged" mailbox for the most important people in your life.
40_11ecbplus.64: Insert photos and video into mail more easily.
40_11ecbplus.65: Single App Mode and Guided Access let you lock people into one app, for parental control, education, testing, museum tours, etc.
40_11ecbplus.66: Forstall introduced a whole new app, too, called Passbook.
40_11ecbplus.67: Codes for boarding passes ( United, Amtrak ), store cards ( Starbucks, Target ), tickets ( Fandango, SF Giants ), reservations ( W Hotels ), etc. are all collected in one app.
40_11ecbplus.68: When you visit the store or venue, the app automatically pulls up the right card.
40_11ecbplus.69: And when you're done with a given card, there's a cute shredding animation.

18_7ecbplus.0: Mich. accountant charged with murder in office shootings
18_7ecbplus.2: A fired accountant accused of wounding two former bosses in a shotgun attack and killing a receptionist who tried to stop him was arraigned Wednesday on murder and other charges.
18_7ecbplus.3: Anthony LaCalamita III, 38, had been arrested following a high - speed chase a few hours after the Monday morning shootings at Gordon Advisors in suburban Detroit.
18_7ecbplus.4: During his arraignment Wednesday, authorities described what witnesses saw inside the offices that morning.
18_7ecbplus.5: LaCalamita was hiding the gun when he walked into accounting firm offices, stopped briefly at the reception desk and then entered Alan Steinberg's office, Troy police Sgt. Barry Whiteside testified.
18_7ecbplus.6: Steinberg, a partner in the firm, told police LaCalamita loaded a shell into the shotgun's chamber and shot him in the hip, then walked toward the office of Paul Riva, another partner.
18_7ecbplus.7: When receptionist Madeline Kafoury tried to stop him at Riva's door, the gunman fatally shot her in the midsection, Whiteside said.
18_7ecbplus.8: LaCalamita then fired at Riva, hitting him in the upper chest, and left the building, Whiteside said.
18_7ecbplus.9: Riva had yet to regain consciousness Wednesday and was on a ventilator, police said.
18_7ecbplus.10: As Whiteside talked in court, Kafoury's adult daughter sobbed uncontrollably.
18_7ecbplus.12: She was our mom and the grandmother of our children, " Kafoury's son, Charlie, said after the hearing.
18_7ecbplus.13: "She was an essential point of our lives. "
18_7ecbplus.14: Not guilty pleas were entered on LaCalamita's behalf to charges of first - degree murder, intent to murder, possession of a firearm in the commission of a felony and fleeing and eluding police.
18_7ecbplus.15: Asked by the judge if he understood the charges against him and if he was aware that he could be sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole if convicted of first - degree murder, he responded "Yes. "
18_7ecbplus.16: The judge ordered him held without bail pending his next court hearing April 19.
18_7ecbplus.17: Troy police Lt. Gerry Scherlinck said Riva and Steinberg appeared to have been the targets in the shootings.
18_7ecbplus.18: LaCalamita had been fired last Thursday as a general accountant at the firm and bought a shotgun and shells on Friday, Scherlinck said.
18_7ecbplus.19: He said police found a box consistent with one that would hold a shotgun, as well as empty shell boxes, in a Dumpster outside LaCalamita's apartment Monday evening.
18_7ecbplus.20: When LaCalamita was arrested, police said they found a 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three shells in his vehicle.
18_7ecbplus.21: Matthew Roth, executive staff attorney for the prosecutor's office, said his office had not been told if LaCalamita or his family had retained a lawyer.
18_7ecbplus.22: LaCalamita is married, but his wife, Michele, released a statement saying they had been separated for about three weeks.
18_7ecbplus.23: According to real estate records obtained by The Associated Press, the couple during the past year actively bought and sold suburban homes.
18_7ecbplus.24: Records list Michele LaCalamita as the owner of all four.
18_7ecbplus.25: Riva, 47, of Sterling Heights and Steinberg, 48, of Macomb County's Bruce Township, were being treated at Beaumont Hospital, where spokeswoman Ilene Wolff said the families of the wounded men asked that their conditions and other information not be released.
18_7ecbplus.26: Gordon Advisors issued a statement Tuesday expressing condolences to the families of the victims.
18_7ecbplus.27: "We are especially devastated by the death of Madeline Kafoury and our hearts go out to her family.
18_7ecbplus.28: Maddie was revered by clients, employees and owners alike, " the statement said.
18_7ecbplus.29: "We express our gratitude to our employees for their bravery on Monday and for their support in the days to come. "

31_7ecbplus.0: McDermott fuels Creighton past Drake in MVC Tournament opener
31_7ecbplus.2: Doug McDermott scored 23 points Friday and became Creighton ’ s all - time leading scorer in helping the Bluejays to a 65 - 53 victory over Drake at the quarterfinals of the Missouri Valley tournament.
31_7ecbplus.3: McDermott broke Rodney Buford ’ s school scoring record of 2, 116 points with a free throw with 4: 43 to play in the first half.
31_7ecbplus.4: McDermott now has 2, 129 points heading into Saturday ’ s semifinals against the winner of Friday ’ s second quarterfinal between Evansville and Indiana State.
31_7ecbplus.5: Creighton also got 14 points from backup center Will Artino, while starting center Gregory Echenique scored 11 points, all in the second half, to help the top - seeded Bluejays shake the stubborn Bulldogs.
31_7ecbplus.6: Drake, which had defeated Bradley in Thursday ’ s play - in round, hung with Creighton for about 30 minutes before running out of gas and ending its season 15 - 17.
31_7ecbplus.7: Creighton, with more than 6, 000 fans cheering it on at the Scottrade Center, improved to 25 - 7.
31_7ecbplus.8: Seth VanDeest led Drake with 13 points, while Richard Carter added 12 for the Bulldogs.
31_7ecbplus.9: Creighton got five points from Echenique in the first 3½ minutes of the second half as the Bluejays added a point to their 33 - 26 halftime lead when the center converted a three - point play to make it 41 - 33.
31_7ecbplus.10: Artino picked up the slack in the first half as he scored seven points.
31_7ecbplus.11: Five came in a 7 - 0 run that allowed the Bluejays to go from being tied with the Bulldogs at 12 - 12 to a 19 - 12 lead.
31_7ecbplus.12: Artino struck again in the second half, scoring four straight points on a dunk and two free throws that allowed Creighton to open a 45 - 36 lead with 13: 41 to play.
31_7ecbplus.13: Drake got baskets from Carter and Ben Simons to close within six again, then made it a 45 - 42 game when Simons buried a 3 - pointer from the corner with 11 minutes to play.
31_7ecbplus.14: Artino ’ s putback on the next possession put Creighton up 47 - 42 but VanDeest ’ s basket pulled Drake back within three.
31_7ecbplus.15: After a Creighton turnover, Drake had a chance to tie but Richard Carter couldn ’ t convert an open look, 3 - point shot.
31_7ecbplus.16: Echenique ’ s three - point play stretched the Creighton lead to 50 - 44, and the Bluejays got baskets from Austin Chatman and McDermott on their next two possessions to make it 54 - 46 with 7: 54 to play.
31_7ecbplus.17: McDermott then buried a 3 - point shot coming off a screen to make it 57 - 46 with 7: 02 remaining.
31_7ecbplus.18: After Echenique blocked a shot on Drake ” s end, he turned a rebound into a three - point play to make it 60 - 46.
31_7ecbplus.19: Two Grant Gibbs free throws hiked the run to 12 - 0, making it 62 - 46 before Drake snapped its scoreless string with two free throws with 1: 41 to play.

12_11ecbplus.0: INS Sukanya foils piracy attempt in Gulf of Eden
12_11ecbplus.2: Warship INS Sukanya on Thursday foiled a piracy attempt in the Gulf of Aden between Somalia and Yemen.
12_11ecbplus.3: The ship was escorting a group of five merchant vessels through the Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor ( IRTC ) when the bid occurred.
12_11ecbplus.4: This is the fifth anti - piracy operation carried out by the warship after it was sent for patrol missions to the Gulf of Aden in September.
12_11ecbplus.5: The course of INS Sukanya was altered to intercept boats targeting the merchant vessels.
12_11ecbplus.6: "The incident occurred around 9. 25 am when five boats were seen approaching the vessels. ..
12_11ecbplus.7: Seeing the warship headed in their direction, the skiffs tried to escape.
12_11ecbplus.8: While two of them managed to flee, boarding - and - search operations were carried out on the other three, " a defence spokesperson said.
12_11ecbplus.9: Six AK 47 rifles, 12 magazines and 300 rounds of ammunition were seized from the boats.
12_11ecbplus.10: They had 26 crewmen aboard, all Somalian nationals.
12_11ecbplus.11: "We also managed to find grapnels, ladders and rope - handling gloves, which are proof that those caught were pirates. "

44_7ecbplus.0: HP to acquire green consultancy EYP
44_7ecbplus.1: HP signs agreement to acquire EYP Mission Critical Facilities and incorporate energy - efficient - facilities expertise into HP's data center services
44_7ecbplus.3: As part of its efforts to support energy - efficient computing, HP Monday announced it has signed an agreement to acquire facilities consulting firm EYP Mission Critical Facilities for an undisclosed sum.
44_7ecbplus.4: HP says the deal, which will bring EYP MCF's 350 employees into a new division under HP Services, will help HP better address customers' needs for more efficient data centers.
44_7ecbplus.5: The combined EYP and HP Services will let large, enterprise companies couple efficient facilities design with an optimized IT infrastructure.
44_7ecbplus.6: Until recently, HP officials say, IT executives handled facilities and data - center design efforts separately.
44_7ecbplus.7: With this acquisition, HP aims to bring the two more closely together and help build dynamic computing environments from the start.
44_7ecbplus.8: "Data center transformation is a key focal point for the HP Services team, " says John McCain, senior vice president and general manager of HP Services.
44_7ecbplus.9: "Power consumption is becoming one of the largest components in terms of the bill in data centers today. "
44_7ecbplus.10: To combat the increase in energy spending, HP Labs has developed technology to conserve energy and delivers it via such products as HP Dynamic Smart Cooling and HP Thermal Zone Mapping.
44_7ecbplus.11: The deal, according to EYP MCF representatives, will let consultants expand beyond facilities planning and offer expertise in large - scale data - center design.
44_7ecbplus.12: "IT infrastructure is ready for a major paradigm shift in the way that mission - critical facilities are delivered to the marketplace, " says Steve Einhorn, chairman of EYP MCF.
44_7ecbplus.13: "The data center and its facility are ready for a major change. "
44_7ecbplus.14: HP says it expects the deal to close by its first fiscal 2008 quarter, which ends January 31.

2_4ecbplus.2: She will make her second appearance as the show's emcee on the March 2 broadcast.
2_4ecbplus.3: Ellen DeGeneres will host this year's Oscars.
2_4ecbplus.4: DeGeneres herself announced the news Friday morning on Twitter, writing, "It's official: I'm hosting the #Oscars!
2_4ecbplus.5: I'd like to thank @TheAcademy, my wife Portia and, oh dear, there goes the orchestra. "
2_4ecbplus.6: Choosing DeGeneres, known for her kindler, gentler humor, signals that the Academy's next awards show will have a decidedly different tone than the 85th Academy Awards, hosted by Seth MacFarlane, who drew criticism for routines like his song about actresses' nudity on film.
2_4ecbplus.7: DeGeneres previously hosted the show in 2007 and earned a Primetime Emmy nomination for her work.
2_4ecbplus.8: "I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time.
2_4ecbplus.9: You know what they say - - the third time's the charm, " DeGeneres said in a statement.
2_4ecbplus.10: Zadan and Meron added: "We are thrilled to have Ellen DeGeneres host the Oscars. "
2_4ecbplus.11: Newly elected Academy President Boone Isaacs said, "I agreed with Craig and Neil immediately that Ellen is the ideal host for this year's show. "
2_4ecbplus.12: Meanwhile, ABC Entertainment Group president Paul Lee said, "It is an honor to welcome back Ellen DeGeneres as the host of the biggest entertainment celebration of the year. "

29_2ecbplus.0: Colts clinch playoff berth with 20 - 13 win in K. C.
29_2ecbplus.2: The connection between quarterback Andrew Luck and wide receiver Reggie Wayne has been vital to the Colts ’ success this season.
29_2ecbplus.3: It paid off one more time for the game - winning play in Week 16.
29_2ecbplus.4: Luck hit Wayne for a seven - yard touchdown with just over four minutes to play to break a 13 - 13 tie and put the Colts on the verge of a playoff berth.
29_2ecbplus.5: The defense forced a three - and - out and rookie running back Vick Ballard ran for a first down to ice the game on the next Colts possession.
29_2ecbplus.6: Give the Colts defense a lot of credit for this one.
29_2ecbplus.7: Darius Butler ’ s interception return opened the scoring for them and they stuffed Chiefs quarterback Brady Quinn short on a fourth - and - inches play early in the fourth quarter.
29_2ecbplus.8: The Colts took the ball and went 73 yards in 13 plays to set up Wayne ’ s game - winning score.
29_2ecbplus.9: It had not been a great day for the Colts offense to that point, but they were able to come up with the drive they needed to punch their postseason ticket.
29_2ecbplus.10: While you ’ re giving the defense credit, though, make sure that you ’ re careful to note all the chances the defense gave Kansas City as well.
29_2ecbplus.11: Jamaal Charles had 226 yards on 22 carries, including an 86 - yard touchdown run, and Peyton Hillis ran for 101 yards.
29_2ecbplus.12: Given the lack of threat posed by Quinn, it ’ s pretty damning that the Colts couldn ’ t keep Kansas City from running the ball.
29_2ecbplus.13: That will likely be something for Chuck Pagano to worry about.
29_2ecbplus.14: The head coach is expected to return to work on Monday after months away from the team battling leukemia.
29_2ecbplus.15: Fixing the run defense before the playoffs will be hard, but it ’ s a good problem to have after drafting first overall last April.

35_3ecbplus.0: Williams' DUI arrest just the latest for Chargers
35_3ecbplus.1: Team has program to address problem
35_3ecbplus.3: Two years ago, the Chargers won an NFL special award for helping start a San Diego program by which players who've been imbibing can call a private number for a ride home, an alternative to driving under the influence.
35_3ecbplus.4: A former Chargers fullback, Lorenzo Neal, was among the co - founders of the “ Safe Ride Solutions ” program that since has been expanded to other NFL cities.
35_3ecbplus.5: Evidently, though, the drinking and driving problem hasn't been eradicated in San Diego.
35_3ecbplus.6: Sunday, for the second time in less than four weeks, a Chargers player was pulled over in the early - morning hours and arrested on suspicion of DUI.
35_3ecbplus.7: “ It's disappointing to hear about the issue involving Jamal Williams, ” said General Manager A. J. Smith in a news release issued by the team yesterday.
35_3ecbplus.8: “ We'll continue to monitor the situation and let the legal process run its course. ”
35_3ecbplus.9: Smith's statement served as the only comment from the Chargers.
35_3ecbplus.10: A request to interview club President Dean Spanos was declined by a spokesman.
35_3ecbplus.11: As it is, the Chargers are still awaiting the disposition of a similar case involving wide receiver Vincent Jackson, arrested Jan. 6 in Clairemont on suspicion of driving under the influence.
35_3ecbplus.12: Jackson, also facing charges of driving while on probation for a prior DUI, has an arraignment set for Feb. 17 in San Diego Superior Court.
35_3ecbplus.13: Williams, a three - time Pro Bowl nose tackle, was stopped for speeding westbound on state route 94 at approximately 1: 30 a. m Sunday.
35_3ecbplus.14: Arrested by the CHP on suspicion of drunken driving, he was booked into county jail and later released on bond.
35_3ecbplus.15: Results of Williams' blood - alcohol test have not been released.
35_3ecbplus.16: “ These are just two more arrests that we've had, ” said Pat Hodgkin, local executive director of Mothers Against Drunk Driving ( MADD ), noting that roughly 13, 000 DUI convictions are issued every year in San Diego County.
35_3ecbplus.17: “ However, these are media - worthy professionals.
35_3ecbplus.18: These are individuals that not only youth looks up to, but adults look up to as well.
35_3ecbplus.19: They need to understand that they have an effect on people and a responsibility. ”
35_3ecbplus.20: The Chargers were involved in one of the most publicized and bizarre instances of a DUI stop in 2006.
35_3ecbplus.21: Linebacker Steve Foley was shot three times by an off - duty Coronado police officer who followed Foley from downtown to the player's home in Poway.
35_3ecbplus.22: Foley, his career ended by the bullet wounds, later pleaded guilty to misdemeanor DUI.
35_3ecbplus.23: It was that case that prompted Gary Lawrence, a detective with the Northern Division of the San Diego Police Department, to ally with the Chargers in a program in which players who've been drinking would call “ Safe Ride Solutions ” and be driven home by an off - duty member of law enforcement.
35_3ecbplus.24: “ Anytime anybody's arrested for DUI, I get very disappointed, and not just when athletes are involved, ” said Lawrence yesterday.
35_3ecbplus.25: “ We're talking about a crime where people are killed or injured, a crime where people go to jail, and it's 100 percent preventable. ”
35_3ecbplus.26: Citing his company's confidentiality agreement with clients, Lawrence declined to discuss anything specific pertaining to the Chargers and their players.
35_3ecbplus.27: From its start with the team, though, the business has grown to include clients from other high - profile realms and put to work by other NFL franchises.
35_3ecbplus.28: In recognition of the program, the league gave the Chargers its Winston - Shell Award in 2007 for “ demonstrating commitment and dedication to developing unique and innovative ideas and solutions. ”

21_8ecbplus.0: Woman Killed In Queens Hit - And - Run Accident, Driver Charged
21_8ecbplus.1: A woman has died after being hit by a car that fled the scene in Queens Friday, and now, the driver is facing manslaughter charges.

6_1ecbplus.0: The Hunger Games Director Gary Ross Still In Negotiations For The Sequel
6_1ecbplus.2: During the promotional period for The Hunger Games everyone involved made sure to note how different the franchise was from Twilight.
6_1ecbplus.3: While it may have seemed like a silly thing to do given Twilight's success, but the truth is that comparisons were making male audiences a bit shaky about the film, as that demographic didn't want to spend two and a half hours watching a tween romance ( and Hunger Games is definitely not that ).
6_1ecbplus.4: The film obviously wasn't hurt by this strategy, as it went on to shatter records and become the third highest grossing opening weekend title of all time.
6_1ecbplus.5: But while the story of The Hunger Games may have no comparison to Twilight, it turns out that action behind the scenes may duplicate it.
6_1ecbplus.6: While the first movie was a huge success, THR is saying that director Gary Ross is still in negotiations to direct the sequel, Catching Fire.
6_1ecbplus.7: The stars of the film - the ones that survived, anyway - are already contractually obligated to appear in the second movie, but things haven't been going to great on the filmmaker side.
6_1ecbplus.8: The trade says that Ross' negotiations with LionsGate the first time around weren't so hot either, an inside source calling it "a terrible experience, " as the studio doesn't usually pay "seasoned - filmmaker fees" to even seasoned filmmakers like Ross. ?
6_1ecbplus.9: Because of The Hunger Games' big box office numbers, Ross is expecting a raise for his work on the movie ( he was given $3 million upfront and 5% on the backend with his first deal ) but it's unclear if the studio will give it to him.
6_1ecbplus.10: Much like the Twilight franchise, or even Harry Potter, it's entirely possible that LionsGate will choose not to pay Ross and instead go with another filmmaker who is demanding less money.
6_1ecbplus.11: A script has already been written for Catching Fire, from Simon Beaufoy, but Ross has not yet had the chance to revise it.
6_1ecbplus.12: The one big card that Ross has in his back pocket is that The Hunger Games was better received than any of the Twilight films, which could convince the brass to try and keep some consistency.
6_1ecbplus.13: Whether it will play in his favor is still an unknown at this point.
6_1ecbplus.15: Should Ross be brought back for the next movie or should they go with someone else's vision?
6_1ecbplus.16: Leave your thoughts, ideas and desires in the comments section below.

5_1ecbplus.0: Cheeks returns as Sixers' fixer Jim O'Brien was shown the door after a single tumultuous season.
5_1ecbplus.2: Billy King spun the 76ers' head coach revolving door again yesterday, pushing out Jim O'Brien after just one season and bringing in Maurice Cheeks, the popular former Sixers player and assistant coach, as O'Brien's replacement.
5_1ecbplus.3: Nearly three weeks after the Sixers ended their season, King decided to fire O'Brien, who still has two years and $8 million left on the contract he signed when he was hired by the Sixers on April 21, 2004.
5_1ecbplus.4: Cheeks, who was fired March 2 as head coach of the Portland Trail Blazers, is the fourth head coach since King took over as the team's president and general manager on May 26, 2003.
5_1ecbplus.5: That is the same date that Larry Brown resigned from the Sixers after six seasons, the last time coaching stability existed with the team.
5_1ecbplus.6: Cheeks was a second - round draft choice of the 76ers in 1978 and played for 11 seasons with the team.
5_1ecbplus.7: He was the point guard and floor leader of the Sixers' 1983 NBA title team.
5_1ecbplus.8: At a news conference last night at the Philadelphia College of Osteopathic Medicine, King said he had the support of Ed Snider, the chairman of Comcast - Spectacor, the team's owner, for his latest moves even though the Sixers will be paying ex - coaches Randy Ayers ( $2 million ) and O'Brien along with Cheeks next season.
5_1ecbplus.9: "In talking with Ed, we felt the main focus was that we want to make the right decisions and not let money be the factor, " King said.
5_1ecbplus.10: "We think we owe it to our fans and the city of Philadelphia to do that. "
5_1ecbplus.11: Cheeks, 48, a four - time NBA all - star while with the Sixers, was fired from the Blazers, his first head coaching job, in the middle of his fourth season.
5_1ecbplus.12: He led the team to a 162 - 139 record.
5_1ecbplus.13: Two years ago, after Brown resigned, King looked to Cheeks to take over as Brown's successor.
5_1ecbplus.14: But the Trail Blazers rebuffed him three times, because Cheeks was still under contract to them.
5_1ecbplus.15: The Sixers then hired Ayers, who lasted 52 games before being replaced by Chris Ford.
5_1ecbplus.16: King said he decided on Saturday to fire O'Brien, and then checked with Cheeks to see if he'd be interested in the job.
5_1ecbplus.17: Cheeks said he would be, and King called him again yesterday and reached a deal after notifying O'Brien of his decision.
5_1ecbplus.18: Terms of the deal were not disclosed.
5_1ecbplus.19: When King hired O'Brien, he had called him a "perfect fit" for the job.
5_1ecbplus.20: O'Brien did lead the Sixers to a 43 - 39 record - a 10 - win improvement over the previous season - and a playoff berth and coached Allen Iverson to his fourth NBA scoring title.
5_1ecbplus.21: But in evaluating the season, King said he didn't think the Sixers were heading in the right direction.
5_1ecbplus.22: He had a problem with the team's style of play, which included reliance on the three - point basket and a defense that protected the paint but had trouble getting out on perimeter shooters.
5_1ecbplus.23: There was also talk that O'Brien was aloof and not communicative with his players.
5_1ecbplus.24: He did not start Samuel Dalembert, a developing young center, until the season's 19th game, and he did not play Willie Green with Iverson for much of the season's final four months because he felt that was a bad matchup defensively.
5_1ecbplus.25: King said that in his postseason meetings with players, "not one of them said they wouldn't play for Jim. ..
5_1ecbplus.26: that they'd all come back ready to go and try to go further in the playoffs. "
5_1ecbplus.28: King said he didn't want to make a snap decision when the season ended on May 3, the day that the Detroit Pistons eliminated the Sixers from the playoffs.
5_1ecbplus.29: He talked to his management team, went on vacation for a week, then made his decision on Saturday.
5_1ecbplus.30: "In the interview process with Jim, there were a lot of things that we talked about, " King said.
5_1ecbplus.31: "But in watching the season, evaluating our young players' development and evaluating our style of play, it wasn't something I was comfortable with. "
5_1ecbplus.32: Reached by telephone yesterday, O'Brien declined to comment.
5_1ecbplus.33: "I'm not going to have any discussion about this, " he said.
5_1ecbplus.34: King said that when he broke the news yesterday to O'Brien, "He asked why, and I told him that I just felt there were some things that took place that I don't think will change and we're going to make a change.
5_1ecbplus.36: Snider, who attended King's news conference, said he backed King.
5_1ecbplus.37: "I really don't question Billy at all, " he said.
5_1ecbplus.38: "I know what went on in the process when he made this decision, as well as the decision to hire Jim O'Brien.
5_1ecbplus.39: I've supported his moves, and I still do. "
5_1ecbplus.40: O'Brien was excited to come back to Philadelphia because of his roots in the city.
5_1ecbplus.41: Cheeks, who is expected to speak at a press conference today, is excited to be coming back to Philadelphia because of all the success he enjoyed here as a player, followed by seven seasons as an assistant coach.
5_1ecbplus.45: He is still the franchise's all - time leader in assists and steals.
5_1ecbplus.46: Cheeks also played with San Antonio, New York, Atlanta and New Jersey before retiring in 1993.
5_1ecbplus.47: Cheeks returned to the Sixers in 1994 as an assistant coach and stayed for seven seasons until the Trail Blazers hired him as head coach on June 27, 2001.
5_1ecbplus.48: Under Cheeks' guidance, the Blazers made the playoffs in 2002 and 2003, but did not get out of the first round.
5_1ecbplus.49: They missed the postseason in 2004, breaking a streak of 21 consecutive years in the playoffs, and were wracked by dissension.
5_1ecbplus.50: "I look at Mo Cheeks and I know Mo Cheeks, " King said.
5_1ecbplus.51: "If players have problems with Mo Cheeks, then there's got to be something wrong with those players. "
5_1ecbplus.52: Under O'Brien, the former head coach of the Boston Celtics, Iverson moved from shooting guard to point guard and responded with an MVP - caliber season, winning his fourth NBA scoring title.
5_1ecbplus.55: And King knows he's being held accountable.
5_1ecbplus.56: "I look in the mirror every day, " King said.
5_1ecbplus.57: "I'm not somebody that's above scrutiny, but I think I try to do the best I can and make the best decisions. "

20_6ecbplus.2: A powerful earthquake has hit southern Iran, destroying several villages and killing at least three people and injuring others, according to reports.
20_6ecbplus.3: The 5. 9 - magnitude quake struck Qeshm island, home to 120, 000 people, and the city of Bandar Abbas, state media said.
20_6ecbplus.4: The governor of Qeshm island told the AFP news agency four villages had been destroyed and three people killed.
20_6ecbplus.5: The quake, which struck at 1353 ( 1023 GMT ), was felt in the neighbouring Gulf states of Oman and the UAE.

9_3ecbplus.1: Biologists Call on Obama Administration to Overturn Bush Rules that Cut Science Out of Endangered Species Legislation
9_3ecbplus.2: Interior and Commerce Secretaries Must Act by May 9
9_3ecbplus.3: More than 1, 300 federal and independent scientists with biological expertise and three leading scientific societies today called on the Interior and Commerce departments to overturn rule changes made in January that weaken the scientific foundation of the Endangered Species Act.
9_3ecbplus.4: In a letter, the scientists urged the department secretaries to rescind changes to Endangered Species Act regulations that allow federal agencies to decide for themselves if their own projects—such as roads, dams and mines—would threaten imperiled species.
9_3ecbplus.5: Previously, federal agencies were required to consult with biologists at the U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service or National Marine Fisheries Service before undertaking or permitting projects.
9_3ecbplus.6: "Many federal agencies do not have the scientific expertise to determine the consequences of federal projects on endangered species and may have vested interests in the implementation of a project, " said Stuart Pimm, Doris Duke Professor of Conservation Ecology at Duke University, who helped organize the scientists' letter.
9_3ecbplus.7: "The new rules exclude expert scientists—who for decades have provided impartial review and critical analysis—from the process. "
9_3ecbplus.8: The Ornithological Council, Society for Conservation Biology and the Wildlife Society, which collectively represent more than 20, 000 scientists, also sent a letter today asking the Interior and Commerce secretaries to rescind the changes and make other improvements to the scientific base of the Endangered Species Act.
9_3ecbplus.9: "As the threats we face continue to evolve, federal scientists must be able to evaluate their consequences for imperiled species.
9_3ecbplus.10: Putting boundaries on the science that informs the Endangered Species Act fundamentally undermines the ability of science and scientists to protect our nation's biodiversity, " said Alan Thornhill, an ecologist and executive director of the Society for Conservation Biology.
9_3ecbplus.11: "Politics plays a huge role in such decisions, " said Michael Hutchins, executive director and CEO of The Wildlife Society.
9_3ecbplus.13: The rules generated concern when they were hastily pushed through at the end of the last administration with little discussion or debate.
9_3ecbplus.14: The Obama administration has addressed the rule change, but has not formally overturned it.
9_3ecbplus.15: On March 3, President Obama directed the Commerce and Interior departments to review it, stating that "we should be looking at ways to strengthen [ the Endangered Species Act ] —not weaken it. "
9_3ecbplus.16: President Obama also directed federal agencies to continue consulting with scientists on projects that might harm endangered species.
9_3ecbplus.17: Congress also has taken steps to address the problem.
9_3ecbplus.18: A provision in an omnibus spending bill signed by President Obama on March 11 allows Interior Secretary Ken Salazar and Commerce Secretary Gary Locke to rescind the rule changes within 60 days.
9_3ecbplus.19: Secretary Salazar has said publicly that he is concerned about the rule changes, but has not indicated that he will act by the May 9 deadline.
9_3ecbplus.20: On Friday, it was reported that the Interior Department sent a rule to the White House Office of Management and Budget that addresses the interagency review process but not other parts of the rules that the scientists want repealed, particularly the limits on what kinds of information can be used in determining how to protect the polar bear.
9_3ecbplus.21: The content of the rule was not released.
9_3ecbplus.22: The two letters also urge the administration to take a more comprehensive look at how science can better inform decision - making under the Endangered Species Act.
9_3ecbplus.23: According to the scientists, other recent changes create unrealistic deadlines for scientific consultations and limit the types of information federal scientists can consider when evaluating federal projects.
9_3ecbplus.24: "These changes chop down the role of science in governmental decision - making, leaving less than a stump behind.
9_3ecbplus.25: The loss of science translates into real loss of biodiversity, " said Francesca Grifo, a biodiversity expert and director of the Union of Concerned Scientists' Scientific Integrity Program.
9_3ecbplus.26: "The new rules weaken the scientific foundation of the Endangered Species Act and make it easier to base decisions on politics instead of science.
9_3ecbplus.27: In giving the departments the authority to roll back these rules, Congress has given the American People a gift, and the department secretaries need to open it. "

18_6ecbplus.0: Jury finds suspect in Troy office shooting guilty
18_6ecbplus.1: on April 30, 2008 at 4: 31 AM, updated April 30, 2008 at 8: 33 AM
18_6ecbplus.2: A jury on Tuesday convicted a man charged in an April 2007 shooting at a Troy accounting firm that left a receptionist dead and two managing partners wounded.
18_6ecbplus.3: Anthony LaCalamita III was found guilty of first - degree murder and assault with intent to murder in the shotgun slaying of 63 - year - old Madeline Kafoury and assault with intent to kill in the shootings of Paul Riva and Alan Steinberg at the accounting firm.
18_6ecbplus.4: Defense attorney Jerome Fenton argued LaCalamita's extensive history of mental illness was to blame.
18_6ecbplus.5: Assistant Oakland County Prosecutor Rob Novy said the 39 - year - old Troy man shot his former co - workers because he was furious over his firing four days earlier.

38_9ecbplus.0: Magnitude 4. 6 Earthquake Shakes Up North Bay
38_9ecbplus.2: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 4. 6 was recorded in the North Bay Thursday morning, according to the U. S. Geological Survey.

43_6ecbplus.0: AMD's Acquisition of SeaMicro Puts Intel on the Defensive
43_6ecbplus.2: Intel suffered a setback in the server market this week with the news that its former partner, SeaMicro, is being acquired by AMD.
43_6ecbplus.3: But the world's top chip maker said it was internally developing technology to remain competitive in the dense server market.
43_6ecbplus.4: Intel is developing integrated fabrics to boost I / O and high - performance networking and storage in servers, said Jason Waxman, general manager of Intel's data center business unit, in an interview.
43_6ecbplus.5: The technologies are being developed as the company tries to boost its presence in the market for dense servers used in cloud computing deployments in data centers.
43_6ecbplus.6: AMD is paying US$334 million for SeaMicro, which until now was in a tight partnership with Intel to develop dense servers.
43_6ecbplus.7: AMD plans to sell SeaMicro - branded servers and license to customers its fabric technology, which virtualizes I / O and ties together storage and networking.
43_6ecbplus.8: The deal is expected to close in March.
43_6ecbplus.9: SeaMicro provides AMD an instant presence in the nascent but fast - growing dense server market, and Intel will now be playing catch - up, analysts said.
43_6ecbplus.10: SeaMicro currently sells servers only with Intel processors, and it is likely that AMD will swap those with its own chips.
43_6ecbplus.11: Intel said it will continue to provide processors for SeaMicro servers, depending on the requirements.
43_6ecbplus.12: AMD's purchase of SeaMicro was an unexpected but smart move, said Nathan Brookwood, principal analyst at Insight 64.
43_6ecbplus.13: The dense server market is growing as companies look to curb electricity costs by deploying low - power servers to respond to Web and database queries.
43_6ecbplus.14: But AMD's prize in the acquisition is SeaMicro's specialized fabric, Brookwood said.
43_6ecbplus.15: SeaMicro's dense servers have many credit - card - sized motherboards that are connected by the fabric, which reduces the need for extra storage and network controllers.
43_6ecbplus.16: It could take Intel years to develop technology that is competitive with SeaMicro's fabric, Brookwood said.
43_6ecbplus.17: And Intel will need to prove its technology is reliable before it is widely adopted.
43_6ecbplus.18: "Intel has all the pieces and all the technology and the smart people to put this together.
43_6ecbplus.19: But it takes time, " Brookwood said.
43_6ecbplus.20: The SeaMicro deal gives AMD a technological head start, but it will also intensify Intel's focus on developing related technology, said Dean McCarron, principal analyst at Mercury Research.
43_6ecbplus.21: Intel's Waxman didn't specify how Intel would build the fabric and I / O technology, but said the company would utilize assets from recently acquired networking companies.
43_6ecbplus.22: In July it acquired Fulcrum Microsystems, which makes Ethernet switches, and last month it purchased InfiniBand assets from Qlogic, which provides high - performance fabric technology for servers.
43_6ecbplus.23: Intel also will remain competitive through new processors, memory and system management technologies.
43_6ecbplus.24: But by the time Intel's fabric technology matures, analysts said that AMD could be far ahead in the integration of SeaMicro's technology inside chips.
43_6ecbplus.25: AMD in the future will allow implementation of third - party intellectual property inside chips, and by 2013 or 2014, SeaMicro's IP could be inside Opteron server chips.
43_6ecbplus.26: Currently SeaMicro's ASIC ( application - specific integrated circuit ) controlling the fabric is placed on the motherboard alongside the processor and memory.
43_6ecbplus.27: When integrated inside a chip, it could be similar to Calxeda's EnergyCore chip, which will be used by Hewlett - Packard in its upcoming ARM server.
43_6ecbplus.28: The Calxeda chip includes cache, an 80 - Gigabit fabric switch and a management engine for power optimization.
43_6ecbplus.29: AMD will be able to license the fabric technology to work on ARM processors, which could also put pressure on Intel, analysts said.
43_6ecbplus.30: ARM processors are mainly found in smartphones and tablets, but there is growing interest in building power - efficient ARM servers.
43_6ecbplus.31: AMD will be able to differentiate its offerings from Intel's by offering SeaMicro technology with either ARM or x86 processors as early as 2013, said Matt Eastwood, group vice president for enterprise platform research at IDC.
43_6ecbplus.32: AMD currently offers only x86 chips, but the company's chief technology officer, Mark Papermaster, has not ruled out implementing ARM IP on its future chips.
43_6ecbplus.33: But Intel's Waxman said the AMD - SeaMicro deal does not change Intel's dense server strategy, and the chip maker will continue to work with customers like Dell and Tyan.
43_6ecbplus.34: "A part of our strategy is to provide a full portfolio of ingredients, " Waxman said.
43_6ecbplus.35: "We've got the right assets in our arsenal. "

33_4ecbplus.0: Gangbangers who allegedly killed mom of 12 in crossfire begin trial
33_4ecbplus.1: Zurana Horton was killed when the accused thugs Andrew Lopez, 20 and Jonathan Carrasquillo, 24, were spraying bullets from a rooftop in Brownsville, Brooklyn and one richocheted off a wall.
33_4ecbplus.3: Two accused gangbangers went on trial Wednesday for tragically killing a mother of 12 as they were spraying bullets from a Brooklyn rooftop.
33_4ecbplus.4: "Zurana Horton became a victim of the senseless gang violence that plagues Brooklyn, " prosecutor Seth Goldman said at the start of the murder trial of half - brothers Andrew Lopez, 20, and Jonathan Carrasquillo, 24.
33_4ecbplus.5: The 34 - year - old mother was struck in the chest from a bullet that ricocheted off a fence in her Brownsville neighborhood in Oct. 2011, authorities said.
33_4ecbplus.6: Lopez was allegedly targeting members of the Young Goon gang, who had a seven - year beef with the 8 Block crew he belonged to.

37_4ecbplus.0: Dozens injured, child dead as 6. 1 - magnitude earthquake hits Indonesia's Aceh
37_4ecbplus.2: A 6. 1 - magnitude earthquake which hit the Indonesian province of Aceh on Tuesday killed a child, injured dozens and destroyed buildings, sparking panic in a region devastated by the quake - triggered tsunami of 2004.
37_4ecbplus.3: The quake struck inland at 0737 GMT at a depth of just 10 kilometres ( 6. 2 miles ) in the mountainous Bener Meriah district in the heart of Aceh, the US Geological Survey said.
37_4ecbplus.4: Houses collapsed in the district, some 320 kilometres ( 200 miles ) from the provincial capital Banda Aceh.
37_4ecbplus.5: "A child died when a wall collapsed, " Ema Suryani, a doctor at a health clinic in Lampahan city, told AFP.
37_4ecbplus.6: "We have received around 50 people with injuries suffered when the walls of their houses collapsed, " added the doctor.
37_4ecbplus.7: "There are around 30 people seriously injured, some with head injuries.
37_4ecbplus.8: The rest have only light injuries like minor cuts and grazes. "
37_4ecbplus.9: Injured people had been transported from several affected villages in two trucks, she said.
37_4ecbplus.10: People ran outside in panic in Banda Aceh as the quake shook houses, and in Medan city to the south of Aceh province on Sumatra island.
37_4ecbplus.11: "The quake was felt strongly for around 15 seconds, from Bener Meriah to Banda Aceh.
37_4ecbplus.12: People panicked and rushed out of their homes, " national disaster agency spokesman Sutopo Purwo Nugroho said.
37_4ecbplus.13: Aceh, on the northern tip of Sumatra, is regularly hit by quakes.
37_4ecbplus.14: In 2004 a massive tremor sparked a tsunami that killed 170, 000 people in the province and tens of thousands more in countries around the Indian Ocean.
37_4ecbplus.15: In April last year an 8. 6 - magnitude quake struck 431 kilometres off Banda Aceh, prompting an Indian Ocean - wide tsunami alert.
37_4ecbplus.16: Five people died and seven were injured in Aceh in the quake and following aftershocks.
37_4ecbplus.17: In September 2009, a major earthquake near Padang city on Sumatra killed more than 1, 000 people.
37_4ecbplus.18: Indonesia sits on the Pacific "Ring of Fire" where tectonic plates collide, causing frequent seismic and volcanic activity.

28_7ecbplus.0: Fred LaRue, Watergate figure, dies at 75
28_7ecbplus.1: Nixon administration aide was 'bagman' in cover - up
28_7ecbplus.3: Fred LaRue, a high - ranking Nixon administration official who served a prison term for his role in Watergate and was among those rumored to be Deep Throat, has died.
28_7ecbplus.5: His body was discovered Tuesday by a maid who entered his hotel room in Biloxi, Coroner Gary Hargrove said.
28_7ecbplus.6: The coroner said he believes LaRue died Saturday of natural causes.
28_7ecbplus.7: LaRue was known as the "bagman" who delivered payoffs to keep participants in the Watergate break - in quiet, and served 4� months in federal prison for conspiracy to obstruct justice.
28_7ecbplus.8: LaRue served as special assistant to John Mitchell, the former attorney general who later headed President Nixon's Committee to Re - elect the President.
28_7ecbplus.9: LaRue was present at a 1972 meeting with Mitchell and Nixon aide Jeb Stuart Magruder at Nixon's vacation home in Key Biscayne, Fla. , where the plan to break in Democratic headquarters at the Watergate complex in Washington allegedly was hatched.
28_7ecbplus.10: LaRue said he advised against the burglary.
28_7ecbplus.12: LaRue discounted rumors that he was Deep Throat, saying the mysterious source for Washington Post reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein on the Watergate story was probably a combination of several people.
28_7ecbplus.13: Woodward says Deep Throat was an individual and not a composite, and promised to reveal his identity only after the source is dead.
28_7ecbplus.14: A request for comment from Woodward left with the newspaper Wednesday was not immediately returned.
28_7ecbplus.15: Among the other people who have been cited as possible Deep Throats are Earl J. Silbert, an original Watergate prosecutor; Alexander Haig, who was Nixon's chief of staff and Ronald Reagan's secretary of state; L. Patrick Gray, the acting FBI director who lived four blocks from Woodward; and deputy White House counsel Fred Fielding.
28_7ecbplus.17: After his political career ended in scandal, LaRue returned to his home state of Mississippi to work in his family's oil company and with its real estate holdings.
28_7ecbplus.18: In an interview last summer with The Sun Herald newspaper, LaRue said Magruder lied when he claimed Nixon knew about the break - in.
28_7ecbplus.19: Magruder claimed Nixon approved the plan in a telephone conversation with Mitchell.
28_7ecbplus.21: LaRue believed no such conversation occurred, saying he screened all the telephone calls on the getaway to Key Biscayne.
28_7ecbplus.23: I don't recall any phone call.
28_7ecbplus.24: I don't think there was one, " he said.
28_7ecbplus.25: If the president had approved the plan, LaRue believes that Mitchell would have told him.
28_7ecbplus.26: "There's absolutely no way, because of my unique relationship with John and Martha Mitchell, that he would not have told me that when I was in Key Biscayne, " LaRue said.
28_7ecbplus.28: I had dinner with the Mitchells four or five times a week.
28_7ecbplus.29: It was not just a political relationship.
28_7ecbplus.30: It was a very personal relationship. "

9_13ecbplus.0: Obama overturns Bush midnight rules on science, health care
9_13ecbplus.2: Controversial rulings enacted in the 11th hour by the Bush administration are being examined for policy and legal implications by the Obama administration.
9_13ecbplus.3: Several regulations affecting health care and the environment have been overturned.
9_13ecbplus.4: In his final months in office, former president George W. Bush enacted several highly controversial policies that affect health care and wildlife.
9_13ecbplus.5: In just a little over a month in office, President Barack Obama has sidelined or overturned several of them, and has also reached back over the years to reverse policies enacted during Bush ’ s first term.
9_13ecbplus.6: A Bush administration draft plan to allow oil and gas drilling off the Atlantic and Pacific coasts was sidelined by the Obama administration on Feb. 10.
9_13ecbplus.7: "To establish an orderly process that allows us to make wise decisions based on sound information, we need to set aside" the plan, said new Interior Secretary Ken Salazar who extended the public comment period on offshore drilling by six months.
9_13ecbplus.8: Obama has maintained that expanded offshore drilling should be part of a larger energy blueprint developed out in the open with Congress, not within the departments of Commerce and Interior Department alone.
9_13ecbplus.9: On Feb. 27, the Obama administration announced its intention to reverse the so - called “ medical conscience ” rule, following a 30 - day comment period.
9_13ecbplus.10: The rule gave health care workers the right to refuse to participate in services they consider immoral.
9_13ecbplus.11: The rule was vaguely worded and extended the right to refuse service to everyone from receptionists and janitors to hospital executives and insurance company CEOs.
9_13ecbplus.12: Opponents considered the rule, which took effect the day before Obama ’ s inauguration, a thinly veiled maneuver to limit access to legal abortions, contraceptives, and living will directives.
9_13ecbplus.13: On March 3, Obama overturned another 11th hour Bush regulation that weakened the Endangered Species Act and pitted federal agencies against each other.
9_13ecbplus.14: The regulation allowed federal agencies to sidestep scientific evidence gathered by U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service and National Marine Fisheries Service experts when launching construction projects that impact endangered wildlife.
9_13ecbplus.15: When overturning the regulation, Obama said he was restoring "the scientific process to its rightful place at the heart of the Endangered Species Act, a process undermined by past administrations. "
9_13ecbplus.16: The Obama administration will also move quickly to reverse some older Bush rulings.
9_13ecbplus.17: On January 30, Obama signed an executive order rescinding a 2001 Bush policy change that barred U. S. financial aid to international organizations that provide or promote abortions.
9_13ecbplus.18: First implemented by President Reagan and called the “ Mexico City ” rule, the policy is reversed whenever there is a change in ideology in the White House.
9_13ecbplus.19: Obama said the policy toward international family planning "has been used as a political wedge issue. "
9_13ecbplus.20: He said his administration would “ initiate a fresh conversation on family planning, working to find areas of common ground to best meet the needs of women and families at home and around the world. "
9_13ecbplus.21: The Obama administration plans to head off many of Bush ’ s midnight hour rules still in the pipeline before they take effect.
9_13ecbplus.22: On inauguration day, federal agency heads were sent a memo stating that they should freeze all Bush regulations in the pipeline.
9_13ecbplus.23: Office of Management and Budget Director Peter Orszag followed up with a Jan. 21 memo giving agency heads these options for dealing with Bush - era “ rules which raise substantial questions of law or policy: ” extending the effective date of a rule, reopening the notice and comment period, issuing interim final rules, and deciding not to defend court challenges to Bush administration rules.
9_13ecbplus.24: For a partial list of Bush ’ s midnight regulations and their current status, visit ProPublica.

41_3ecbplus.1: Sudan 'bombs refugees' in South Sudan's Unity state
41_3ecbplus.2: South Sudanese officials have condemned Sudan after an aerial bombardment of a refugee camp in their territory.
41_3ecbplus.3: The BBC's James Copnall was at the Yida camp in oil - rich Unity State, which borders Sudan, when it was bombed.
41_3ecbplus.4: Local official Miabek Lang said at least 12 people had been killed and 20 wounded.
41_3ecbplus.5: The Sudanese military, which has been fighting rebels in areas near South Sudan, has denied the claims.
41_3ecbplus.6: Our reporter says he arrived at the camp at about 12: 00 GMT on Thursday as a second round of bombs hit.
41_3ecbplus.7: He says that just as a UN helicopter, carrying food aid, settled on to a makeshift landing zone at the camp, there was a deep and terrifying thud of a nearby explosion.
41_3ecbplus.8: A large plane was spotted heading to the north, our reporter says.
41_3ecbplus.10: Several residents of the refugee camp told him it was an Antonov plane, often used by the Sudanese government as a makeshift bomber.
41_3ecbplus.11: The refugees said the plane had circled before launching two bombing raids.
41_3ecbplus.12: Five bombs were dropped, of which four exploded, they told our correspondent.
41_3ecbplus.13: Our reporter says he did not see any casualties, but Mr Lang, the commissioner of Pariang county in Unity state, said that 12 people had been killed and the death toll could rise.
41_3ecbplus.14: Incidents like this, and both sides' belief that the other is sponsoring rebels on their territory, are contributing to a rapidly deteriorating relationship between Sudan and South Sudan, he says.
41_3ecbplus.15: Thousands of people who have fled fighting in Sudan's South Kordofan region have crossed the border to take refuge at the Yida camp.
41_3ecbplus.16: Sudan's army has often been accused of bombing South Kordofan, where it is facing a rebellion from pro - southern groups.
41_3ecbplus.17: Our reporter says there is talk that rebels use the camp to rest before returning to South Kordofan to fight.
41_3ecbplus.18: The refugees are, however, furious with Sudan's President Omar al - Bashir over the bombings, he says.
41_3ecbplus.19: The governor of Unity State, Taban Deng, said Mr Bashir should be held responsible.
41_3ecbplus.21: He has a lot to answer, " Mr Deng said.
41_3ecbplus.22: However, Sudan Armed Forces spokesman Sawarmi Khaled Saad vehemently denied any links to the raid.
41_3ecbplus.24: We didn't bomb any camps or any areas inside the borders of South Sudan, " he told the AFP news agency.
41_3ecbplus.25: "What is going on in South Sudan belongs to the southerners.
41_3ecbplus.26: We don't have any links to this. "
41_3ecbplus.27: The South Sudan Liberation Army rebel group is active in Unity State - it denies claims that it is working for Khartoum in order to destabilise its neighbour.
41_3ecbplus.28: South Sudan gained independence in July under a peace deal which followed decades of north - south conflict.

18_5ecbplus.0: Gunman kills 1, wounds 2 at accounting office
18_5ecbplus.1: Suspect had been fired last week by Troy, Mich. , company
18_5ecbplus.2: An accounting firm employee who was fired last week shot and killed a woman and wounded two men Monday at the suburban Detroit building where he worked, then led officers on a high - speed chase, police said.
18_5ecbplus.3: Hours after the shooting, a motorist 50 miles north of Detroit spotted a vehicle described on radio reports and notified authorities, touching off a 30 - mile pursuit that passed through a construction zone and reached speeds of 120 mph, officials said.
18_5ecbplus.4: Anthony LaCalamita III, 38, said nothing after officers surrounded him, Genesee County Sheriff Robert J. Pickell said.
18_5ecbplus.5: Officers found a 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three live shells in the vehicle, but LaCalamita as “ subdued.
18_5ecbplus.6: Very, very, very subdued, ” the sheriff said.
18_5ecbplus.7: LaCalamita ’ s calmness at the conclusion belied a frantic mid - morning at the offices of Gordon Advisors, a 40 - to 50 - employee company where workers had been busy preparing tax returns.
18_5ecbplus.9: “ We heard pop, pop, pop, ” smelled gunpowder and heard co - workers yelling, said Jean Larson, 48, a staff accountant for G&C, a subsidiary of Gordon Advisors.
18_5ecbplus.10: “ I heard one employee screaming, ‘ He ’ s got a gun.
18_5ecbplus.13: No one knew what to do.
18_5ecbplus.14: No one knew where to go. ”
18_5ecbplus.15: After briefly assembling in the employee lunchroom, some employees opted to hole up inside individual offices.
18_5ecbplus.16: Larson joined two female co - workers, barricading the locked door with chairs, turning off the lights and silencing their cell phones.
18_5ecbplus.17: Beneath a desk, the three curled up and kept quiet.
18_5ecbplus.18: “ I was just so scared, ” Larson said.
18_5ecbplus.19: “ I just kept thinking, ‘ This can ’ t be happening. ” ’
18_5ecbplus.20: Police said the person killed was a 63 - year - old woman from Warren but would not name her.
18_5ecbplus.21: A message posted Monday afternoon on the accounting firm ’ s Web site said the office would be closed Tuesday in memory of Madeline Kafoury.
18_5ecbplus.23: Larson said Kafoury was well - known and well - liked.
18_5ecbplus.24: She said Kafoury retired last year following the conclusion of tax season, but returned part - time this year after her successor quit.
18_5ecbplus.25: Troy Police Lt. Gerry Scherlinck identified the other victims as a 47 - year - old man and a 48 - year - old man.
18_5ecbplus.26: Wolfe said the families of the wounded men requested privacy, and the hospital would not release any details about their conditions.
18_5ecbplus.27: “ I ’ m not positive all three of the people were targeted but there appeared to be some purpose, ” Troy Police Chief Charles Craft said.
18_5ecbplus.28: LaCalamita was being held on charges of fleeing and eluding police and was expected to be charged Tuesday in the shooting.
18_5ecbplus.29: LaCalamita was fired last week, Craft said, but still was listed on the Web site of Gordon Advisors.
18_5ecbplus.30: Calls made to Gordon were not answered, and a recording said the offices were closed.

38_10ecbplus.1: At a Richter magnitude of 4. 6, this one should have awakened sleepers
38_10ecbplus.3: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 4. 6 was recorded in the North Bay this morning, according to the U. S. Geological Survey.
38_10ecbplus.4: The quake occurred at 2: 09 a. m. about 14 miles north - northeast of Healdsburg and had a depth of 1. 2 miles.

38_10ecbplus.7: Did any Patch readers feel the earthquake, or perhaps wake up shortly after 2 a. m. because of it?

37_5ecbplus.0: Dozens injured as 6. 1 - magnitude quake hits Indonesia's Aceh
37_5ecbplus.2: A strong 6. 1 - magnitude earthquake struck Indonesia's northwestern province of Aceh today, causing buildings to collapse and injuring at least 50 people.
37_5ecbplus.3: The quake hit inland at 0737 GMT at a depth of just 10 kilometres, 55 kilometres south of Bireun and 72 kilometres southeast of Reuleuet, the US Geological Survey said.
37_5ecbplus.4: "We have received around 50 people with injuries suffered when the walls of their houses collapsed, " Ema Suryani, a doctor at a health clinic in Lampahan city, Bener Meriah district, told AFP.
37_5ecbplus.5: "The injuries vary from open wounds to broken bones. "
37_5ecbplus.6: Injured people had been transported from several affected villages in two trucks, she said.
37_5ecbplus.7: People also ran out of buildings in panic in the provincial capital Banda Aceh as the quake shook houses for around one minute, an AFP journalist at the scene said.
37_5ecbplus.8: A massive quake struck off Aceh in 2004, sparking a tsunami that killed 170, 000 people in the province on Sumatra and tens of thousands more in countries around the Indian Ocean.
37_5ecbplus.9: Indonesia sits on the Pacific "Ring of Fire" where continental plates collide, causing frequent seismic and volcanic activity.

9_1ecbplus.1: Obama Administration Restores Endangered Species Act Protections!
9_1ecbplus.2: Today, Interior Secretary Ken Salazar and Commerce Secretary Gary Locke announced the restoration of rules under the Endangered Species Act that help protect endangered species when government decisions or projects are implemented.
9_1ecbplus.3: The rules were weakened in the final days of the Bush administration.
9_1ecbplus.4: The Department of Interior sent out this press release announcing the decision today.
9_1ecbplus.5: Their decision requires federal agencies to once again consult with federal wildlife experts at the U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration before taking any action that may affect threatened or endangered species.
9_1ecbplus.6: The action will restore an important check - and - balance system that enables government projects to move forward and at the same time protect at - risk species.
9_1ecbplus.7: The restoration of these protections is amazing news for our country ’ s wildlife, fish and plants on the brink of extinction.
9_1ecbplus.8: Making this decision within the first 100 days of office is also an important symbol that America will once again respect science and environmental protections.
9_1ecbplus.9: The Endangered Species Coalition is incredibly grateful to President Obama, Secretary Locke and Secretary Salazar for their leadership on addressing the urgent environmental issues of species extinction and global warming.
9_1ecbplus.10: For more information, check out the ESC statement.
