9_9ecbplus.0: Biologists Call on Obama Administration to Overturn Bush Rules That Cut Science Out of Endangered Species Decisions
9_9ecbplus.1: Interior and Commerce Secretaries Must Act by May 9
9_9ecbplus.3: More than 1, 300 federal and independent scientists with biological expertise and three leading scientific societies today called on the Interior and Commerce departments to overturn rule changes made in January that weaken the scientific foundation of the Endangered Species Act.
9_9ecbplus.4: In a letter, the scientists urged the department secretaries to rescind changes to Endangered Species Act regulations that allow federal agencies to decide for themselves if their own projects - - such as roads, dams and mines - - would threaten imperiled species.
9_9ecbplus.5: Previously, federal agencies were required to consult with biologists at the U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service or National Marine Fisheries Service before undertaking or permitting projects.
9_9ecbplus.6: "Many federal agencies do not have the scientific expertise to determine the consequences of federal projects on endangered species and may have vested interests in the implementation of a project, " said Stuart Pimm, Doris Duke Professor of Conservation Ecology at Duke University, who helped organize the scientists' letter.
9_9ecbplus.7: "The new rules exclude expert scientists - - who for decades have provided impartial review and critical analysis - - from the process. "
9_9ecbplus.8: The Ornithological Council, Society for Conservation Biology and the Wildlife Society, which collectively represent more than 20, 000 scientists, also sent a letter today asking the Interior and Commerce secretaries to rescind the changes and make other improvements to the scientific base of the Endangered Species Act.
9_9ecbplus.9: "As the threats we face continue to evolve, federal scientists must be able to evaluate their consequences for imperiled species.
9_9ecbplus.10: Putting boundaries on the science that informs the Endangered Species Act fundamentally undermines the ability of science and scientists to protect our nation's biodiversity, " said Alan Thornhill, an ecologist and executive director of the Society for Conservation Biology.
9_9ecbplus.11: "Politics plays a huge role in such decisions, " said Michael Hutchins, executive director and CEO of The Wildlife Society.
9_9ecbplus.13: The rules generated concern when they were hastily pushed through at the end of the last administration with little discussion or debate.
9_9ecbplus.14: The Obama administration has addressed the rule change, but has not formally overturned it.
9_9ecbplus.15: On March 3, President Obama directed the Commerce and Interior departments to review it, stating that "we should be looking at ways to strengthen [ the Endangered Species Act ] - - not weaken it. "
9_9ecbplus.16: President Obama also directed federal agencies to continue consulting with scientists on projects that might harm endangered species.
9_9ecbplus.17: Congress also has taken steps to address the problem.
9_9ecbplus.18: A provision in an omnibus spending bill signed by President Obama on March 11 allows Interior Secretary Ken Salazar and Commerce Secretary Gary Locke to rescind the rule changes within 60 days.
9_9ecbplus.19: Secretary Salazar has said publicly that he is concerned about the rule changes, but has not indicated that he will act by the May 9 deadline.
9_9ecbplus.20: On Friday, it was reported that the Interior Department sent a rule to the White House Office of Management and Budget that addresses the interagency review process but not other parts of the rules that the scientists want repealed, particularly the limits on what kinds of information can be used in determining how to protect the polar bear.
9_9ecbplus.21: The content of the rule was not released.
9_9ecbplus.22: The two letters also urge the administration to take a more comprehensive look at how science can better inform decision - making under the Endangered Species Act.
9_9ecbplus.23: According to the scientists, other recent changes create unrealistic deadlines for scientific consultations and limit the types of information federal scientists can consider when evaluating federal projects.
9_9ecbplus.24: "These changes chop down the role of science in governmental decision - making, leaving less than a stump behind.
9_9ecbplus.25: The loss of science translates into real loss of biodiversity, " said Francesca Grifo, a biodiversity expert and director of the Union of Concerned Scientists' Scientific Integrity Program.
9_9ecbplus.26: "The new rules weaken the scientific foundation of the Endangered Species Act and make it easier to base decisions on politics instead of science.
9_9ecbplus.27: In giving the departments the authority to roll back these rules, Congress has given the American People a gift, and the department secretaries need to open it. "

24_7ecbplus.0: France hit by another jewellery heist
24_7ecbplus.2: Four men rammed their car into an up - market jewellery store in central Paris today, smashing the shop window and making off with a €2 million ( R26 million ) booty, a police source said.
24_7ecbplus.3: The heist near the upscale Place Vendome is the latest to hit France after a spate of high - profile robberies in the southern resort of Cannes.
24_7ecbplus.4: The police source, who wished to remain anonymous, said the men drove a large 4×4 car into the store in the early hours of the morning, and grabbed jewellery and luxury watches worth an estimated €2 million.
24_7ecbplus.5: They then set fire to the vehicle and escaped in another car.
24_7ecbplus.6: Forensic policemen are currently going through the site of the robbery at the Casty store on Rue de Castiglione in the central first district of Paris, which is home to numerous jewellery shops.
24_7ecbplus.7: At the end of July, an armed man carried out a brazen robbery in broad daylight at a diamond exhibition at the Carlton hotel in Cannes, making off with jewellery worth €103 million in one of the world ’ s biggest heists.
24_7ecbplus.8: Paris has also been the scene of high - profile robberies.
24_7ecbplus.9: In December 2008, three men emptied almost all of the stock of gems from the Harry Winston jewellery store.
24_7ecbplus.10: In 2009, police said they had recovered 80% of the haul.

36_5ecbplus.0: Prophet to pedophile: Polygamist Warren Jeffs sentenced to life in prison
36_5ecbplus.1: Warren Jeffs, leader of the polygamist FLDS religious sect, was sentenced to life in prison in Texas, convicted of sexually assaulting two girls, aged 15 and 12, that he claimed as his 'brides. '
36_5ecbplus.3: Polygamist sect leader Warren Jeffs was sentenced to life in a Texas prison on Tuesday following his conviction on charges that he sexually assaulted two young girls he claimed as "brides. "
36_5ecbplus.4: The sentencing at state district court in San Angelo brings to a conclusion an often bizarre trial that pitted a self - proclaimed religious prophet against state prosecutors seeking to expose Mr. Jeffs as a pedophile.
36_5ecbplus.5: After the sentence was announced, Prosecutor Eric Nichols said Jeffs had "corrupted and perverted" his position of authority and the religious convictions of his own community to victimize women and children "to satisfy his own appetites and desires. "
36_5ecbplus.6: Prosecutors charged that the 55 - year - old sect leader sexually assaulted two girls, ages 12 and 15, by arranging illegal marriages under the guise of his religious beliefs.
36_5ecbplus.7: They presented a DNA report that showed that Jeffs had fathered a child with the 15 year old.
36_5ecbplus.8: Prosecutors also played an audio recording of Jeffs allegedly engaging in sexual intercourse with the 12 - year - old.
36_5ecbplus.9: The recording was seized when Jeffs was arrested in 2006.
36_5ecbplus.10: Jeffs is the leader of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter - day Saints ( FLDS ).
36_5ecbplus.11: The sect is unaffiliated with the mainstream Church of Jesus Christ of Latter - day Saints, also known as the Mormon church.
36_5ecbplus.12: An estimated 10, 000 FLDS followers live in communities in Utah, Arizona, and Texas.
36_5ecbplus.13: They believe polygamy is a means to gain divine acceptance.
36_5ecbplus.14: Jeffs is believed to have 78 wives, 24 of them under age 17, according to prosecutors.
36_5ecbplus.15: Rather than focus on Jeffs's multiple marriages, prosecutors with the Texas Attorney General's Office presented a case based on alleged violations of the laws of consent in Texas.
36_5ecbplus.16: Twelve - and 15 - year - old girls are not old enough to consent to engage in sexual activities.
36_5ecbplus.17: Under Texas law, any sexual activity between an adult and an under - 17 - year - old is a sexual assault even if the minor is a willing participant.
36_5ecbplus.18: The same activity with an under - 14 - year - old is aggravated sexual assault punishable by up to life in prison.
36_5ecbplus.19: During the penalty phase of the case, prosecutors played an audio tape of Jeffs allegedly preparing five other young girls to have sex with him.
36_5ecbplus.20: He encouraged his "child brides" to set aside all their inhibitions.
36_5ecbplus.21: Prosecutors also showed jurors a page from one of Jeffs's personal journals.
36_5ecbplus.22: The 2005 entry says: "If the world knew what I was doing, they would hang me from the highest tree. "
36_5ecbplus.23: Jeffs became leader of the FLDS upon the death of his father in 2002.
36_5ecbplus.24: Jeffs claimed the prosecution was a form of persecution targeting his religious beliefs.
36_5ecbplus.25: Prior to the trial he fired seven lawyers, and ultimately tried to represent himself.
36_5ecbplus.26: Trial observers said he often paused for long periods of silence before resuming.
36_5ecbplus.27: At one point, rather than present a closing statement, he stood motionless and silent before the jury.
36_5ecbplus.28: Jeffs boycotted most of the penalty phase of his trial.
36_5ecbplus.29: He was represented by stand - by counsel, appointed by Judge Barbara Walther.
36_5ecbplus.30: The case against Jeffs stemmed from documents recovered in an April 2008 raid on the FDLS compound near Eldorado, Texas.
36_5ecbplus.31: Prosecutors also introduced evidence seized from a vehicle when Jeffs was arrested as a fugitive in 2006.
36_5ecbplus.32: At one point he was listed on the FBI's Top Ten Wanted list.
36_5ecbplus.33: After his arrest, Jeffs stood trial and was convicted in Utah for his role in allegedly arranging marriages among his followers.
36_5ecbplus.34: He was found guilty, but the conviction was overturned on appeal.
36_5ecbplus.35: Jeffs was sentenced to life in prison for his assault on the 12 - year - old.
36_5ecbplus.36: He received a 20 - year sentence for the assault on the 15 - year - old.
36_5ecbplus.37: The two sentences are to be served consecutively.
36_5ecbplus.38: In addition to Jeffs, seven other elder members of the FLDS sect have been convicted in Texas trials or pleaded guilty.
36_5ecbplus.39: They have received sentences ranging from six to 75 years.
36_5ecbplus.40: Four more FLDS members are awaiting trial.

8_2ecbplus.0: Deadly fire - bomb hits bank during Greek riots
8_2ecbplus.2: A fire - bomb attack on a bank in Greece killed at least three people Wednesday as police fought pitched battles with striking protestors furious at brutal budget cuts designed to avert national bankruptcy.
8_2ecbplus.3: Hooded youths hurled petrol bombs at stores and businesses in the center of the capital Athens and demonstrators tried to storm parliament during the general strike, as the rioting spread to the northern city of Thessaloniki.
8_2ecbplus.4: Police said two women and one man died at a branch of the Marfin bank which caught fire after rioters broke a window and threw Molotov cocktails inside.
8_2ecbplus.5: Around 20 more people had to be ushered to safety.
8_2ecbplus.6: "Nobody has the right to violence and particularly violence that leads to murder, " Prime Minister George Papandreou told parliament as he condemned "a raw murderous act".
8_2ecbplus.7: At least two other buildings, one used by tax officials, caught fire in other fire - bomb attacks on the margins of the protests.
8_2ecbplus.8: Athens underground stations were shuttered and the international airport deserted as tens of thousands of union members rallied on the eve of a vote in parliament on the planned cuts and tax hikes.
8_2ecbplus.9: The general strike was the first major test of the Socialist government's resolve to push through unprecedented measures since agreeing a? 110 - billion ( $143 - billion ) EU and IMF debt bailout at the weekend.
8_2ecbplus.10: Papandreou's insistence that the measures are vital for the nation's survival failed to dissuade unions from paralyzing public services.
8_2ecbplus.11: After rallying in two separate demonstrations in central Athens, unionists marched on parliament where a vote on the measures will be held Thursday.
8_2ecbplus.12: "They're taking everything from me, I don't know how I'm going to get by, " said 61 - year - old Anargyros Bizianis, a municipal worker in the Athens suburb of Piraeus who earns? 900 a month.
8_2ecbplus.13: As the protestors tried to break through a police line in front of parliament, they first hurled stones and bottles of water, prompting officers to respond with tear gas.
8_2ecbplus.14: Full - scale clashes then erupted, with riot police trying to disperse the crowds with baton - charges.
8_2ecbplus.15: During the unrest, one protestor threw a petrol bomb.
8_2ecbplus.16: Youths also went on the rampage in other parts of the capital, with several dozen youths hurling petrol bombs at stores, smashing shop windows and bus shelters with iron bars.
8_2ecbplus.17: Athens police chiefs mobilized all their forces, including those not on active duty, by declaring a general state of alert.
8_2ecbplus.18: The protestors in Thessaloniki targeted stores and banks in the city center before they were dispersed by the anti - riot police.
8_2ecbplus.19: A group of about 200 communists had stormed the Athens Acropolis on Tuesday, unfurling banners reading "Peoples of Europe, Rise Up. "
8_2ecbplus.20: "The Greek people have been called to make sacrifices while the rich pay nothing, " said Giannis Panagopoulos, head of the GSEE private sector union.
8_2ecbplus.21: A government official downplayed the unrest saying that "for years there's been strikes and protests in this country without much consequence. "
8_2ecbplus.22: But markets reacted with alarm as Greek stocks closed down 3. 9 percent.
8_2ecbplus.23: Pushed to the brink of default, the government agreed at the weekend to slash spending and jack up taxes in return for 110 billion euros in loans over three years from eurozone countries and the International Monetary Fund.
8_2ecbplus.24: Among the major measures, the government is to cut 13th and 14th month bonus pay for civil servants and retirees; require three years more for pension contributions; and raise the retirement age for women to 65.
8_2ecbplus.25: After months of hesitation, eurozone countries and the IMF agreed to lend Greece billions at below market rates after concerns the Athens crisis could trigger a knock - on effect elsewhere.
8_2ecbplus.26: Fighting accusations of holding up the bailout, German Chancellor Angela Merkel said the crisis underlined the need for an overhaul of EU fiscal rules.
8_2ecbplus.27: "The future of Europe and the future of Germany within Europe is at stake, " she told a debate on Berlin's decision to lend? 22. 4 billion to Greece.

27_7ecbplus.0: Microsoft to release patch for Internet Explorer
27_7ecbplus.1: 'The Fix' will remedy a vulnerability that allows an attacker to gain remote control of a Windows machine. .
27_7ecbplus.3: Microsoft will push out an out - of - cycle Windows patch to temporarily fix the critical Internet Explorer flaw revealed earlier this week.
27_7ecbplus.4: "While we have only seen a few attempts to exploit the issue, impacting an extremely limited number of people, we are taking this proactive step to help ensure Internet Explorer customers are protected and able to safely browse online, " Microsoft Trustworthy Computing director Yunsun Wee said in a blog posting on Sept. 18.
27_7ecbplus.5: "The Fix it is an easy - to - use, one - click, full - strength solution any Internet Explorer user can install, " Wee wrote.
27_7ecbplus.6: "It will not affect your ability to browse the Web, and it will provide full protection against this issue until an update is available.
27_7ecbplus.7: It won ’ t require a reboot of your computer.
27_7ecbplus.8: "This Fix it will be available for everyone to download and install within the next few days, " she added.
27_7ecbplus.9: Microsoft usually pushes out software updates and security patches on the second Tuesday of every month.
27_7ecbplus.10: Out - of - cycle patches are reserved for the most serious flaws.
27_7ecbplus.11: It's not clear what exactly Microsoft has in mind, if, as Wee indicates, the "fix it" is not a real update.
27_7ecbplus.12: Microsoft initially suggested that all Internet Explorer users install and configure a utility called the Enhanced Mitigation Experience Toolkit ( EMET ) to prevent exploitation of the flaw, but admitted EMET might interfere with other applications.
27_7ecbplus.13: Most security experts, and the German government, have recommended a simpler solution: Stop using Internet Explorer entirely until the flaw is fully fixed.
27_7ecbplus.14: The Internet Explorer vulnerability allows an attacker to gain remote control of a Windows machine at the same level of privilege as the current user.
27_7ecbplus.15: That's not so bad if a given machine's current user has limited privileges, but very serious if the current user has administrator rights and can install, modify or delete software.
27_7ecbplus.16: The flaw affects all currently distributed and supported versions of Internet Explorer and Windows: Internet Explorer versions 6, 7, 8, and 9 and Windows XP, Vista and 7, as well as Windows Server 2003, and 2008.
27_7ecbplus.17: Windows 8, due to be released to the general public Oct. 26, and its accompanying Web browser, Internet Explorer 10, are not affected.

22_7ecbplus.2: A Philadelphia judge today found a former Kraft Foods company employee guilty of murder in a workplace rampage exactly two years ago in Northeast Philadelphia that left two women dead and a third employee wounded.

22_7ecbplus.5: Then, on September 10, 2010, according to a surviving victim, Hiller went berserk again, cursing and making accusations and threats.
22_7ecbplus.6: She was suspended on the spot and escorted from the building.
22_7ecbplus.7: But, the witness says, she returned minutes later with a gun, opening fire on several employees in a break room, killing Latonya Brown and Tanya Wilson, and wounding Bryant Dalton.
22_7ecbplus.8: Dalton says the bullet went through his neck and lodged in his shoulder, and is still there.
22_7ecbplus.9: In the one - day, non - jury trial, Common Pleas Court judge Benjamin Lerner found Hiller guilty of two counts of first - degree murder and one count of attempted murder.
22_7ecbplus.10: The automatic sentence in life in prison, although formal sentencing will take place at a later date.

27_11ecbplus.0: Microsoft releases security patch for Internet Explorer
27_11ecbplus.2: Microsoft released an emergency software fix for Internet Explorer on Tuesday after hackers exploited a security flaw in the popular Web browser to attack an unknown number of users.
27_11ecbplus.3: The software maker said on its website it released the software, known as a "Fix It, " as an emergency measure to protect customers after learning about "extremely limited, targeted attacks" that made use of the newly discovered bug.
27_11ecbplus.4: Microsoft said the attacks took advantage of an undiscovered flaw, or "zero day" vulnerability in industry parlance.
27_11ecbplus.5: State - sponsored hacking groups are often willing to pay hundreds of thousands of dollars for zero - day vulnerabilities in widely used software such as Internet Explorer, according to security experts who track that market.
27_11ecbplus.6: They typically use them on small numbers of carefully selected, high - value targets, to keep such flaws secret.
27_11ecbplus.7: Once Microsoft issues a warning about a zero - day bug, other groups of hackers involved in massive cyber - crime operations, such as identity theft, rush to reverse - engineer the Fix Its so they can build computer viruses that also exploit the same vulnerabilities.
27_11ecbplus.8: Security experts said Internet Explorer users should either immediately install the Fix It or stop using the browser until Microsoft can put out an update, which will be automatically installed through its Windows Update program.
27_11ecbplus.9: "With the Fix It out, I'm sure any attacker who is a bit sophisticated can figure out what the flaw is and implement a similar exploit in their own attack toolkit, " said Wolfgang Kandek, chief technology officer with the cybersecurity firm Qualys Inc.
27_11ecbplus.10: "Fix Its" are pieces of software for remediating security flaws that must be downloaded and installed on PCs.
27_11ecbplus.11: They are designed to protect customers while Microsoft prepares official updates, automatically delivered via the Internet to be installed on computers.
27_11ecbplus.12: Kandek said he expects Microsoft to push out an update to address the issue within two to three weeks.
27_11ecbplus.13: The Fix It can be installed by clicking on a link this page on Microsoft's support site

32_1ecbplus.0: John Jenkin: Goth son held as mum and sister killed
32_1ecbplus.2: John Jenkin, 23, was arrested near the terraced house where Alice McMeekin, 58, and Katie Jenkin, 20, and a dead dog, thought to be the family's pet collie, were discovered
32_1ecbplus.3: A goth was being questioned on suspicion of murder yesterday after his mother and sister were found dead at home.
32_1ecbplus.4: John Jenkin, 23, was arrested near the terraced house where Alice McMeekin, 58, and Katie Jenkin, 20, and a dead dog, thought to be the family's pet collie, were discovered.
32_1ecbplus.5: Police were called by neighbours at breakfast time on Saturday after they heard piercing screams coming from the house.
32_1ecbplus.6: One said: "I heard screaming, really high - pitched screams in the early hours.
32_1ecbplus.7: Then later I heard more screaming.
32_1ecbplus.8: It sounded like someone telling a dog to shut up. "
32_1ecbplus.9: Alice lived in the pebble - dashed terrace in Millom, Cumbria, with �unemployed John.
32_1ecbplus.10: The neighbour described him as a goth and he is said to have recently been in hospital.
32_1ecbplus.11: Katie was visiting her mum from Cardiff, where she was at university.
32_1ecbplus.12: A close friend of the dead mum said: "I can't believe it.
32_1ecbplus.13: They all looked after each other after Alice separated from her husband in the 1990s.
32_1ecbplus.14: We were so close that Katie thought of my mum as a second mum.
32_1ecbplus.15: "John was a good kid, never one of those to get into trouble.
32_1ecbplus.16: He idolised his mum and his sister.
32_1ecbplus.17: His little sister was his world, and his mum was too. "
32_1ecbplus.18: Alice was brought up in Millom, where her father ran a greengrocer's and a fish shop.
32_1ecbplus.19: She returned to her home town 12 weeks ago after a four year spell living in Cardiff.
32_1ecbplus.20: Friends noticed she had lost weight and looked frail.
32_1ecbplus.21: It is thought she may have been suffering from cancer.
32_1ecbplus.22: Another neighbour added: "She went down to Wales to give her kids a better life.
32_1ecbplus.23: Katie got into Cardiff University, I think, and John was at college doing something in special effects.
32_1ecbplus.24: "When Alice came home, John came with her.
32_1ecbplus.25: As far as I know he didn't have a girlfriend.
32_1ecbplus.26: Katie still lived in Wales and had been going out with her boyfriend for two years.
32_1ecbplus.27: "She came up for the weekend on Friday.
32_1ecbplus.28: Alice met her at the station. "
32_1ecbplus.29: Security worker Alice had recently been upset by the death of one of her four cats and had taken in a collie dog called Fenn.
32_1ecbplus.30: The friend said she was "bubbly" when she saw her on Friday.
32_1ecbplus.31: She added: "We were chatting for about half an hour.
32_1ecbplus.32: She told me Katie was coming and she was so looking forward to it. "
32_1ecbplus.33: Cumbria Police have not disclosed how Alice and Katie died.
32_1ecbplus.34: A police spokesman said: "We do not suspect anyone else to be involved. "
32_1ecbplus.35: Detective Chief Inspector Paul Duhig said: "Events such as these are rare in Cumbria.
32_1ecbplus.36: We are doing all we can to bring the offender to justice. "

39_6ecbplus.0: Doctor Who Revealed: Peter Capaldi Cast as the 12th Time Lord!
39_6ecbplus.3: Doctor Who has finally selected its 12th doctor: Peter Capaldi is officially set to replace exiting star Matt Smith as the TARDIS leader, producer Steven Moffat announced on the live BBC special Doctor Who Live: The Next Doctor Sunday.
39_6ecbplus.4: Well known for his work as Malcolm Tucker on The Thick Of It, Capaldi, 55, isn't a stranger to the longrunning BBC hit's fans: He appeared opposite David Tennant in The Fires of Pompeii in 2008 as Caecilius and had a major role on Torchwood: Children of Earth, the Doctor Who spinoff series.
39_6ecbplus.5: "Being asked to play the Doctor is an amazing privilege, " Capaldi said.
39_6ecbplus.6: "Like the Doctor himself I find myself in a state of utter terror and delight.
39_6ecbplus.7: It's so wonderful not to keep this secret any longer, but it's been so fantastic. "
39_6ecbplus.8: "I just want to wish my successor all the best and say good luck and good on you for getting it, " Smith said in a videotaped message.
39_6ecbplus.9: "I know he's a huge fan of the show and a really nice guy.
39_6ecbplus.10: The casting of it made me really excited it.
39_6ecbplus.11: I think it's a really canny choice.
39_6ecbplus.13: It's going to be a thrill. "
39_6ecbplus.14: Oddly enough, Capaldi was recently seen in Brad Pitt's World War Z as a World Health Organization doctor, or W. H. O. doctor, for short.
39_6ecbplus.15: The big reveal was arguably Britain's second most highly - anticipated announcement in recent history, following Prince George's arrival, with BBC even promoting the announcement that an announcement would be made.
39_6ecbplus.16: "The decision is made & the time has come to reveal who's taking over the TARDIS, " BBCOne promoted on Twitter.
39_6ecbplus.17: "For the last of the Time Lords, the clock is striking twelve. "
39_6ecbplus.18: Smith had played the iconic role since 2010 and shocked fans when he announced his his departure from the series in June.
39_6ecbplus.19: "Doctor Who has been the most brilliant experience for me as an actor and a bloke, and that largely is down to the cast, crew and fans of the show.
39_6ecbplus.20: I'm incredibly grateful to all the cast and crew who work tirelessly every day, to realise all the elements of the show and deliver Doctor Who to the audience, " he wrote on BBC's Doctor Who website.
39_6ecbplus.21: "Many of them have become good friends and I'm incredibly proud of what we have achieved over the last four years. "
39_6ecbplus.22: The series' 50th anniversary special, which all air in November, is set to be Smith's last official outing as the Doctor, but it's been revealed that he will also make an appearance in the Christmas special.

22_9ecbplus.0: Murder trial ordered for woman accused in Kraft plant shootings
22_9ecbplus.2: Yvonne Hiller was certain she was being targeted for surreptitious "chemical abuse, " but no one believed her story.
22_9ecbplus.3: She accused her coworkers of spraying her with deer urine, prompting her to complain to a federal safety agency.
22_9ecbplus.4: She thought her Lawncrest neighbors were running a meth lab, and she called police to her apartment numerous times "for the smell. "
22_9ecbplus.5: She believed that chemicals were ruining her health, and had visited several doctors and counselors since 2007.
22_9ecbplus.6: Despite all that, she couldn't find the source of the toxins she thought were plaguing her.
22_9ecbplus.7: Hiller told homicide detectives that her mounting frustration finally culminated in September, when she went on a shooting rampage through the Kraft Foods plant in Northeast Philadelphia, where she had worked for 15 years.
22_9ecbplus.8: In her statement, Hiller admitted killing two coworkers and seriously wounding a third.
22_9ecbplus.9: Homicide Detective Dominic Mangoni, testifying Tuesday at Hiller's preliminary hearing, said he asked how she felt just hours after the shootings.
22_9ecbplus.10: "I don't feel anything, " she said, according to the statement.
22_9ecbplus.11: "I just wish people would accept me for what I was. "
22_9ecbplus.12: After the hearing, Hiller, 43, was ordered held on multiple counts of murder, attempted murder, and other crimes.
22_9ecbplus.13: An arraignment was scheduled for this month.
22_9ecbplus.14: The defense did not call any witnesses.
22_9ecbplus.15: Hiller entered the courtroom wearing a black garment and black head scarf.
22_9ecbplus.16: She waved and winked at a clutch of family members in the gallery.
22_9ecbplus.17: The other side of the room was packed with family members of the victims - LaTonya Brown, 36, and Tanya Wilson, 47, both of whom died in the third - floor break room where they were shot.
22_9ecbplus.18: The third victim, Bryant Dalton, 39, spent two weeks in the hospital and is recovering from gunshots to the neck and shoulder, prosecutors said.
22_9ecbplus.19: After the hearing, Dorothy Brown said she was "heartbroken" over the death of her granddaughter, who had four children.
22_9ecbplus.20: "She left them children, " she said, breaking into tears.
22_9ecbplus.22: Stephen Devine, a civil attorney for the Brown family, said relatives would hold a vigil Thursday at their home at 11th and Poplar Streets to mark the three - month anniversary of the shooting.
22_9ecbplus.23: Wilson's family and Dalton also are represented by civil attorneys, but Devine said it was too soon to say if they would file a lawsuit.
22_9ecbplus.24: At the preliminary hearing, the families "heard for the first time some answers to questions they had since the tragic events occurred, " Devine said.
22_9ecbplus.25: Hiller worked with the three victims in the mixing department at the plant at Roosevelt Boulevard and Byberry Road.
22_9ecbplus.26: Kraft makes Ritz crackers, Lorna Doone cookies, and other baked goods there.
22_9ecbplus.27: On the night of the shooting, Hiller again confronted her coworkers about her belief that they were spraying her with deer scent.
22_9ecbplus.28: "They told me they didn't know what I was talking about, " Hiller said in her statement.
22_9ecbplus.29: "I told them, 'You think this is a prank, but you don't know what this was doing to my body. ' "
22_9ecbplus.30: After the confrontation, Hiller was suspended from her job for the second time in two months.
22_9ecbplus.31: The other suspension came after she left a voice mail on her supervisor's phone, complaining about being sprayed.
22_9ecbplus.32: Hiller was escorted from the property.
22_9ecbplus.33: She told detectives that she "planned on going right home. "
22_9ecbplus.34: "But then I started to think about the 15 years I spent there and how it was taken away from me, " she said in her statement.
22_9ecbplus.35: She returned with a. 357 Magnum that she legally owned and kept under the seat of her car.
22_9ecbplus.36: She pointed the gun at two unarmed security guards and ordered them to let her back in the building.
22_9ecbplus.37: She said she sought out the three coworkers from her shift and opened fire.
22_9ecbplus.38: Hiller admitted firing at several other employees, but denied shooting at the first officers who responded to the scene.
22_9ecbplus.39: But Officer Michael Murphy, from the Seventh District, testified that Hiller fired at him and two other officers from down a hallway.
22_9ecbplus.40: The bullet, he said, went over his left shoulder and hit the wall behind him.
22_9ecbplus.41: After shutting herself in a quality control room on the second floor, Hiller made a number of phone calls to relatives and police.
22_9ecbplus.42: A 911 supervisor persuaded her to surrender to SWAT officers on the scene.

7_4ecbplus.0: Wladimir Klitschko stopped Tony Thompson in the sixth round to keep a comfortable hold on his WBA, IBF and WBO heavyweight title belts on Saturday.
7_4ecbplus.1: Klitschko put Thompson on the canvas with a big right hand near the end of the fifth round at Stade de Suisse, and the 40 - year - old American southpaw never recovered.
7_4ecbplus.2: The Ukrainian champion dropped Thompson again in the sixth, and referee Sam Williams gave the challenger a standing count before stopping the fight at 2: 56.

5_6ecbplus.0: NCAA: Improper gifts, assistance given to athletes
5_6ecbplus.2: The NCAA notified Ohio State on Monday of nine alleged rules violations, including cash gifts, improper academic assistance and failure of the school and coaches to monitor the men's basketball program.
5_6ecbplus.3: Seven of the violations involved men's basketball, including a school booster allegedly giving cash and academic help to a former player.
5_6ecbplus.4: The others involved a booster allegedly giving $500 to a football player, and an orthodontist providing free and discounted services to five women's basketball players.
5_6ecbplus.5: Ohio State previously said it was looking into many of the alleged violations, including a cash gift to a recruit from former basketball coach Jim O'Brien, who was fired after acknowledging the payment.
5_6ecbplus.6: "The allegations set forth in this report are consistent with what we expected, " Ohio State president Karen Holbrook said at a news conference.
5_6ecbplus.7: The school must respond to the allegations by July 26, and an infractions committee will hold a hearing before determining whether sanctions are warranted, NCAA spokesman Erik Christianson said.
5_6ecbplus.8: Ohio State's athletic department has faced a series of NCAA investigations of its high - profile sports since the football team won the national championship in 2002.
5_6ecbplus.9: In December, the school imposed a one - year postseason tournament ban on its men's basketball team after O'Brien acknowledged he gave about $6, 000 to recruit Alex Radojevic in 1999.
5_6ecbplus.10: O'Brien, fired on June 8, is seeking up to $6 million in a breach - of - contract suit against Ohio State.
5_6ecbplus.11: The NCAA report says O'Brien allegedly gave Radojevic the money through then - assistant coach Paul Biancardi.
5_6ecbplus.12: O'Brien and Biancardi are accused of acting "contrary to principles of ethical conduct" by failing to report their involvement in NCAA rules violations, the report said.
5_6ecbplus.13: "We deny that we engaged in any improper conduct under NCAA bylaws and legislation, " said Biancardi's attorney, James Zeszutek.
5_6ecbplus.14: Biancardi has cooperated fully with NCAA investigators and is barred by the NCAA from publicly discussing the allegations, Zeszutek said.
5_6ecbplus.15: A message seeking comment was left with O'Brien's attorney.
5_6ecbplus.16: Former star running back Maurice Clarett and other former football players have alleged that athletes received money from boosters, got academic credit for work they didn't do and received no - show jobs at high salaries.
5_6ecbplus.17: The only mention of the football program in the NCAA report is an allegation that $500 was given to a football player, whose name was withheld.
5_6ecbplus.18: Last season, quarterback Troy Smith was suspended from the Alamo Bowl for accepting money from a booster.
5_6ecbplus.19: Athletic director Gene Smith, who replaced Andy Geiger a month ago, said the allegations in the NCAA report were less serious than speculation indicated.
5_6ecbplus.20: "What you see before you is what they found in football, " he said, adding he would be surprised if sanctions are imposed against the football team.
5_6ecbplus.21: Clarett was suspended for the 2003 season for lying to investigators during an NCAA probe of allegations that he received improper benefits from a family friend.

5_3ecbplus.0: PHILADELPHIA 76ERS Fired Jim O'Brien, coach. Named Maurice Cheeks coach.

37_8ecbplus.0: Powerful 6. 1 magnitude earthquake injures dozens in Indonesia's Aceh province
37_8ecbplus.2: A powerful 6. 1 magnitude earthquake hit Indonesia's northwestern Aceh province, on the island of Sumatra.
37_8ecbplus.4: The epicenter of the quake was roughly 55 kilometers from the town of Bireuen, a regency of the larger Aceh province, and took place at 7: 37 AM local time according to data from the US Geological Survey.
37_8ecbplus.5: Although it's unknown how many were injured, Sky News estimates"at least 50 people, " and numerous buildings have collapsed as an effect of the powerful tremblor.
37_8ecbplus.6: The quake appears to have shaken the provincial capital of Banda Aceh, which is located at the northern tip of the Sumatran land mass.
37_8ecbplus.7: "I see many houses were damaged and their roofs fell onto some people, " said central Aceh district resident Bensu Elianita to the Associated Press.
37_8ecbplus.8: "Many people were injured but it is difficult to evacuate them due to traffic jams. "
37_8ecbplus.9: "We have received around 50 people with injuries suffered when the walls of their houses collapsed, " said doctor Ema Suryani to AFP, speaking from Lampahan city in Aceh's Bener Meriah district.
37_8ecbplus.10: Aceh was hit extremely hard by the massive "Boxing Day" earthquake and tsunami in 2004, killing 170, 000 people in Sumatra alone - with 35, 000 bodies never recovered.
37_8ecbplus.11: The rebuilding process continues to this day from the enormous natural disaster.

31_6ecbplus.0: CREIGHTON DEFEATS DRAKE 65 - 53 IN MVC TOURNAMENT
31_6ecbplus.2: Doug McDermott scored 23 points to become Creighton's all - time scoring leader and the top - seeded Bluejays defeated Drake 65 - 53 on Friday in the quarterfinals of the Missouri Valley Conference tournament.
31_6ecbplus.3: In Saturday's semifinals, Creighton ( 25 - 7 ) will play No. 5 seed Indiana State, which defeated Evansville 51 - 50 on Friday.
31_6ecbplus.4: Will Artino scored 14 points off the bench and Gregory Echenique had 11 points, 11 rebounds and six blocked shots for Creighton, which enjoyed a 44 - 26 rebounding edge.
31_6ecbplus.5: Grant Gibbs had eight of the Bluejays' 11 assists.
31_6ecbplus.6: McDermott, a junior, now has 2, 129 points — 13 more than Rodney Buford, who played for the Bluejays from 1995 - 99.
31_6ecbplus.7: Richard Carter scored 14 points and Seth VanDeest scored 13 for the ninth - seeded Bulldogs ( 15 - 17 ).
31_6ecbplus.8: Jordan Clarke had 10 rebounds for Drake, which reached the quarterfinal by beating Bradley on Thursday night.

5_2ecbplus.0: Mo Cheeks will take over as new coach
5_2ecbplus.2: Maurice Cheeks is running the show again for the Philadelphia 76ers.
5_2ecbplus.3: In a surprising move nearly three weeks following the end of their season, the Sixers fired Jim O'Brien on Monday after one season as coach and replaced him with Cheeks, one of the most popular players in franchise history.
5_2ecbplus.5: Mo bleeds 76ers. He bleeds Philadelphia, " team president Billy King said.
5_2ecbplus.6: Cheeks will be introduced as Philadelphia's 21st head coach at a Tuesday news conference.
5_2ecbplus.7: Philadelphia is certainly banking on the former point guard to have a happier homecoming than O'Brien, a Philadelphia native who played for Saint Joseph's.
5_2ecbplus.8: O'Brien's stubbornness and seemingly unwavering belief in a system that didn't fit his players cost him his job despite a 43 - 39 record and a return to the playoffs.
5_2ecbplus.9: "I just felt the direction we were going and the overall play wasn't where we wanted to go, " King said.
5_2ecbplus.10: O'Brien just finished the first year of a three - year deal that included an option and paid him about $4 million a year.
5_2ecbplus.11: O'Brien, though, was not very popular with his players - - most notably former All - Star Chris Webber - - who often complained about their roles.
5_2ecbplus.12: King said after the Sixers were eliminated in the first round of the playoffs by Detroit that he planned to bring O'Brien back.
5_2ecbplus.13: After meeting with his players and other members of management, King had a change of heart and decided over the weekend he had to make a change.
5_2ecbplus.14: Certainly, King knows a thing or two about making changes - - Cheeks will be the fifth Sixers coach in four years under his watch.
5_2ecbplus.15: Larry Brown left for Detroit following the 2002 - 03 season, and assistant Randy Ayers was promoted and fired 52 games into the 2003 - 04 season before he was replaced by Chris Ford.
5_2ecbplus.16: "I knew this thing was coming, and it wasn't an easy thing for anybody, " Brown said from Miami before coaching the Pistons in the Eastern Conference finals.
5_2ecbplus.17: "Knowing Billy, it's not easy to let a coach go.
5_2ecbplus.18: His relationship with Randy was pretty strong.
5_2ecbplus.19: I think it was hard for him to let Chris go.
5_2ecbplus.20: He was excited about having Jimmy, but I don't think it ever gets easy. "
5_2ecbplus.21: Cheeks was one of the most popular 76ers from 1978 - 89 and played on Philadelphia's last championship team in 1983.
5_2ecbplus.22: He also spent seven seasons as an assistant coach for the 76ers, was part of the staff under Brown when they went to the NBA Finals in 2001 and developed a strong bond with Allen Iverson.
5_2ecbplus.23: Cheeks was fired March 2 after nearly four seasons as coach of the Trail Blazers.
5_2ecbplus.24: He had a 162 - 139 record in Portland, the fourth - highest win total in Blazers history.
5_2ecbplus.25: Cheeks guided the team to the playoffs his first two seasons, but the players hardly made Cheeks' tenure easy - - on or off the court.
5_2ecbplus.26: The team was nicknamed the "Jail Blazers" after several brushes with the law, many of them involving marijuana possession.
5_2ecbplus.27: "If players have problems with Mo Cheeks. .. then there's got to be something wrong with those players, " King said.
5_2ecbplus.28: But Cheeks' return to the city where he was a four - time All - Star shouldn't come as a surprise.
5_2ecbplus.29: The Trail Blazers turned down Philadelphia's request to speak to Cheeks as a possible replacement for Brown, but the former point guard always remained popular with Philly fans and was at the top of the Sixers' short list to take over for Ford.
5_2ecbplus.31: "We do not want to change coaches [ again ], " Sixers chairman Ed Snider said.
5_2ecbplus.33: The Sixers will pay Ayers, O'Brien and Cheeks next season.
5_2ecbplus.34: "I don't think it's something we're very proud of, but I don't think it reflects poorly, " Snider said.
5_2ecbplus.35: O'Brien is the son - in - law of Hall of Fame coach Jack Ramsay.
5_2ecbplus.36: He led the Sixers to a 10 - win improvement from a year ago and they returned to the playoffs, largely on the back of a healthy, happy Iverson.
5_2ecbplus.37: While O'Brien avoided public spats with Iverson, he did not have the full support of the rest of the team.
5_2ecbplus.38: Some of the younger players, like Samuel Dalembert and Willie Green, felt they did not develop like they should have under O'Brien and were unsure about their roles.
5_2ecbplus.39: "In looking at the development of some of them, yeah, I wasn't pleased, " King said.
5_2ecbplus.40: The Sixers also failed to really understand O'Brien's defense, a sticking point even in the postseason.
5_2ecbplus.41: "Some of the criteria on our defense wasn't there, " King said.
5_2ecbplus.42: Cheeks, who once famously came to the rescue of a 13 - year - old girl who forgot the words to the national anthem before a playoff game, now hopes to bail out his former team and bring them another championship.
5_2ecbplus.43: "Mo has played this game here in Philadelphia, won a championship here in Philadelphia, understands players, understands defenses, understands the way I think we want to play, " King said.

34_3ecbplus.0: Regina Benjamin U. S. surgeon general nomination: Stories and resources
34_3ecbplus.1: on July 13, 2009 at 10: 50 AM, updated July 29, 2009 at 12: 16 PM
34_3ecbplus.2: President Barack Obama announces his nomination of Dr. Regina Benjamin, a physician who operates a clinic in Bayou La Batre, Ala. , as the U. S. Surgeon General during an announcement in the White House Rose Garden Monday, July 13, 2009.

20_8ecbplus.0: Powerful Quake in Iran Kills 10; 80 Hurt and 7 Villages Damaged
20_8ecbplus.2: A powerful earthquake hit southern Iran on Sunday, causing major destruction in seven villages and killing 10 people and injuring 80.
20_8ecbplus.3: The tremor shook Oman and the United Arab Emirates as well, forcing many office workers to evacuate their buildings.
20_8ecbplus.4: The official IRNA news agency and the United States Geological Survey said it had a magnitude of 5. 9.
20_8ecbplus.5: Iran's seismologic center said the epicenter of the earthquake was in the waters of the Persian Gulf, 35 miles southwest of the port of Bandar Abbas.
20_8ecbplus.6: Iran is on seismic fault lines.
20_8ecbplus.7: A major earthquake killed more than 31, 000 in city of Bam in central Iran in 2003, and 600 were killed in the city of Zarand in February in an earthquake with a magnitude of 6. 4.
20_8ecbplus.8: The tourist Island of Qeshm on the Persian Gulf and seven of its villages were most strongly affected by the quake.
20_8ecbplus.9: It hit at 1: 53 p. m. local time and was followed by at least four strong aftershocks, IRNA reported.
20_8ecbplus.10: The news agency also reported that one of the major hospitals on the island, in the village of Jeyhian, was destroyed and the village's power lines were cut.
20_8ecbplus.11: The island's airport was also damaged.
20_8ecbplus.12: Abdolreza Sheikholeslami, the governor of Hormozgan Province, the center of the damaged area, said 40 percent to 70 percent of the buildings in seven villages were destroyed, IRNA reported.
20_8ecbplus.13: Two helicopters began moving the injured to the hospital in Bandar Abbas, and aid workers began distributing food, blankets and tents in the region, the governor said.
20_8ecbplus.14: Qeshm is Iran's largest island in the Persian Gulf, with a population of 120, 000.
20_8ecbplus.15: The quake jolted several cities in the United Arab Emirates, across the Persian Gulf from Iran.
20_8ecbplus.16: Office workers in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, evacuated several buildings in the city, pouring onto the streets and snarling traffic.
20_8ecbplus.17: There were no reported injuries in Dubai.
20_8ecbplus.18: Mehdi Zareh, director of the seismological center in Tehran, dismissed concerns that the earthquake would cause tsunamis, IRNA reported.
20_8ecbplus.19: ''The Persian Gulf is not deep enough so that we can expect tsunamis, '' he was quoted as saying.
20_8ecbplus.20: Map of Iran highlighting epicenter of earthquake: A tremor shook southern Iran yesterday, causing major damage.

13_12ecbplus.1: Farewell to another piece of Mat Maid
13_12ecbplus.2: fast - moving fire destroyed the historic Matanuska Maid warehouse early this morning.
13_12ecbplus.5: Firefighters arriving on scene could see the building was likely a total loss, so they focused on a bigger problem: making sure the blaze didn't reach the nearby, petroleum - loaded Crowley Maritime tank farm.
13_12ecbplus.6: The first 9 - 1 - 1 call came at 3: 33 a. m. from someone at Valley Hotel, Palmer public safety director Jon Owen said this morning.
13_12ecbplus.7: A total of 31 separate pieces of firefighting apparatus responded to the blaze, including three ladder trucks.
13_12ecbplus.8: Engines came from Palmer Fire Department and Mat - Su Central Fire Department, where responders mustered to an "all - call" from emergency dispatchers.
13_12ecbplus.9: Palmer Fire Chief John McNutt was the first person to get to the fire.
13_12ecbplus.10: McNutt drove around the 9 - acre Mat Maid complex and spotted flames shooting out from below the eaves.
13_12ecbplus.11: Within minutes, the roof was engulfed, Owen said.
13_12ecbplus.12: Crews operating under a "surround and drown" strategy suppressed the fire.
13_12ecbplus.13: But their goal wasn't saving the old warehouse building, built in the 1930s, Owen said.
13_12ecbplus.14: Their focus instead was preventing "the conflagration" sure to follow if the fire reached the adjacent Crowley Maritime Corp. fuel sales office next door, where all the petroleum products on site would pose a tremendous problem should they ignite, he said.
13_12ecbplus.15: The Palmer tank farm holds 100, 000 gallons of petroleum products and serves as a distribution center for Anchorage, Palmer, Wasilla, and all the Matanuska Valley, according to Crowley's Web site.
13_12ecbplus.16: The fire was knocked down by 6: 40 a. m.
13_12ecbplus.17: The warehouse used to be used for produce sold out of one end.
13_12ecbplus.18: Rindi remembers walking through it with owner Bill Ingaldson a few years back; during the visit, she picked up an old potato sack decorated with the Matanuska Maid in her skating costume.
13_12ecbplus.19: Palmerites may remember that former city manager Bill Allen hoped to put a convention center on the property.
13_12ecbplus.20: This is the second destructive fire at the Mat Maid complex.
13_12ecbplus.21: A wind - whipped arson fire set by three teenagers destroyed the hardware store in February, 2003.
13_12ecbplus.22: Investigators were at the scene by 10 a. m. or so trying to determine the cause of the fire; finding the ignition source is key when there's no obvious heat source like a boiler, Owen said.
13_12ecbplus.23: Anything suspicious will be followed up.
13_12ecbplus.24: The investigation is being conducted by John Bond, an inspector with the Alaska State Fire Marshal's Office, and Palmer police Sgt. Shayne La Croix.
13_12ecbplus.25: Anyone with information about this morning's fire is asked to call Sgt. La Croix at 745 - 4811.

9_2ecbplus.0: updated 8: 41 p. m. EST, Tue March 3, 2009
9_2ecbplus.1: Obama overturns Bush endangered species rule
9_2ecbplus.2: President Obama on Tuesday overturned a last - minute Bush administration regulation that many environmentalists claim weakened the Endangered Species Act.
9_2ecbplus.3: The regulation, issued a few weeks before George W. Bush left office, made it easier for federal agencies to skip consultations with government scientists before launching projects that could affect endangered wildlife.
9_2ecbplus.4: By overturning the regulation, Obama said during an enthusiastic reception at the Interior Department, he had restored "the scientific process to its rightful place at the heart of the Endangered Species Act, a process undermined by past administrations. "
9_2ecbplus.5: Under the Bush administration rule, there was no need for a federal agency to consult with the U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service or the National Marine Fisheries Services if that agency determined that no harm would come to an endangered species as a result of its project.
9_2ecbplus.6: But the determination of what "no harm" meant rested with agency bureaucrats instead of scientists.
9_2ecbplus.7: Obama issued a memorandum that effectively suspends the regulation while ordering a review to determine whether it promotes "the purposes of the [ Endangered Species Act ]. "
9_2ecbplus.8: "The work of scientists and experts in my administration, including right here in the Interior Department, will be respected, " Obama said.
9_2ecbplus.9: "For more than three decades, the Endangered Species Act has successfully protected our nation's most threatened wildlife, and we should be looking for ways to improve it, not weaken it. "
9_2ecbplus.10: Environmental groups were quick to praise Obama's action.
9_2ecbplus.11: "President Obama's announcement will allow [ the Endangered Species Act ] to do what it was intended: protect our nation's endangered plants and animals, " said Andrew Wetzler, director of the Natural Resources Defense Council's Endangered Species Program.
9_2ecbplus.12: "Reversing the Bush administration's midnight action will restore protections for our last wild places and species. "
9_2ecbplus.13: Obama also helped celebrate the 160th anniversary of the Interior Department on Tuesday.
9_2ecbplus.14: "Throughout our history, there's been a tension between those who've sought to conserve our natural resources for the benefit of future generations and those who have sought to profit from these resources, " he told department employees.
9_2ecbplus.15: "But I'm here to tell you this is a false choice.
9_2ecbplus.16: With smart, sustainable policies, we can grow our economy today and preserve the environment for ourselves, our children and our grandchildren. "

44_2ecbplus.0: HP to Expand Data Center Services with Acquisition of Global Consulting Company EYP Mission Critical Facilities
44_2ecbplus.2: HP today announced that it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire EYP Mission Critical Facilities Inc. ( EYP MCF ), a consulting company specializing in strategic technology planning, design and operations support for large - scale data centers.
44_2ecbplus.3: By acquiring EYP MCF, HP will be better able to help customers to transform their data centers, optimize energy efficiency and position them for future business growth.
44_2ecbplus.4: Financial terms of the transaction were not disclosed.
44_2ecbplus.5: Headquartered in New York, EYP MCF has approximately 350 employees with 13 offices in the United States and the U. K.
44_2ecbplus.6: The firm provides mission - critical services to enterprises around the world in business sectors including financial services, telecommunications, technology, broadcast, manufacturing and healthcare, as well as numerous federal, state and county government agencies.
44_2ecbplus.7: From data centers and command and control centers, to trading floors and supercomputing sites, EYP MCF has designed hundreds of technology - intensive, high - performance facilities where monitoring, operational and energy efficiencies are top - priority business requirements.
44_2ecbplus.8: EYP MCF ’ s capabilities – particularly its expertise in energy - efficient operations – complement HP ’ s extensive Data Center Services and cost - saving power and cooling solutions, such as Dynamic Smart Cooling.
44_2ecbplus.9: “ The data center is the foundation of IT for enterprises, an essential building block for driving business growth and adapting to changing business objectives, ” said John McCain, senior vice president and general manager, HP Services.
44_2ecbplus.10: “ Acquiring EYP Mission Critical Facilities boosts HP ’ s ability to help customers transform their data centers and build dynamic computing environments from the ground up. ”
44_2ecbplus.11: Peter Gross, chief executive officer of EYP MCF, said, “ Worldwide data center requirements are rapidly growing, with significant year - over - year increases in power consumption, which is fueling demand for energy - efficient power and cooling strategies.
44_2ecbplus.12: HP and EYP Mission Critical Facilities will drive innovation by integrating IT infrastructure into the planning and design of the data center, enabling the customer ’ s whole organization to be more energy efficient and adaptive. ”
44_2ecbplus.13: The transaction is subject to certain closing conditions and is expected to be completed within HP ’ s first fiscal quarter.
44_2ecbplus.15: HP will hold a media teleconference to discuss the announcement at 7: 15 - 7: 45 a. m. PT today.
44_2ecbplus.18: A replay of the call will be available later in the day.
44_2ecbplus.19: About EYP Mission Critical Facilities, Inc.
44_2ecbplus.20: EYP Mission Critical Facilities, Inc. ( www. eypmcf. com ) is a consulting firm whose unique approach to achieving clients ’ energy - efficient operational continuity is based upon the integration of strategic technology planning, innovative design and on - site support.
44_2ecbplus.21: Through developing proprietary products and processes, authoring technical white papers, and presenting at international conferences, EYP MCF is recognized as a worldwide thought leader in the mission - critical industry.
44_2ecbplus.23: HP focuses on simplifying technology experiences for all of its customers – from individual consumers to the largest businesses.
44_2ecbplus.24: With a portfolio that spans printing, personal computing, software, services and IT infrastructure, HP is among the world ’ s largest IT companies, with revenue totaling $100. 5 billion for the four fiscal quarters ended July 31, 2007.
44_2ecbplus.25: More information about HP ( NYSE: HPQ ) is available at http: / / www. hp. com.

37_13ecbplus.2: Strong earthquake hits Indonesia's Aceh province
37_13ecbplus.3: A strong earthquake struck off Indonesia's Aceh province on Tuesday, damaging houses and injuring at least five people.
37_13ecbplus.4: The U. S. Geological Survey said the magnitude 6. 1 quake struck at a depth of 10 kilometers ( 6 miles ) and its epicenter was located 55 kilometers ( 34 miles ) west of the town of Bireun on the western tip of Sumatra island.
37_13ecbplus.5: At least five people were reportedly injured and 10 houses were damaged in Takengon, the capital of Central Aceh district, said Sutopo Purwo Nugroho of the National Disaster Mitigation Agency.
37_13ecbplus.6: "I see many houses were damages and their roofs fell onto some people, " said Bensu Elianita, a 22 year - old resident in Bukit Sama village in Central Aceh district.
37_13ecbplus.7: "Many people were injured but it is difficult to evacuate them due to traffic jams. "
37_13ecbplus.8: She said many people in the village ran out from their houses in panic and screamed for help.
37_13ecbplus.9: At least two houses were totally flattened, she said, adding that the quake also caused blackout in the village.
37_13ecbplus.10: Indonesia is prone to seismic upheaval due to its location on the Pacific Ring of Fire, an arc of volcanoes and fault lines encircling the Pacific Ocean.
37_13ecbplus.11: In 2004, a huge earthquake off Aceh triggered a tsunami that killed 230, 000 people across Asia.

37_9ecbplus.0: Dozens injured as 6. 1 - magnitude quake hits Indonesia's Aceh
37_9ecbplus.2: A 6. 1 - magnitude earthquake which hit the Indonesian province of Aceh on Tuesday killed at least one person, injured dozens and destroyed buildings, sparking panic in a region devastated by the quake - triggered tsunami of 2004.
37_9ecbplus.3: The quake hit inland at a depth of just 10km, 55km south of Bireun and 72 km southeast of Reuleuet, the US Geological Survey said.
37_9ecbplus.4: Houses collapsed in the district, some 320km from the provincial capital Banda Aceh.
37_9ecbplus.5: "A child died when a wall collapsed, " said Ema Suryani, a doctor at a health clinic in Lampahan city, Bener Meriah district.

7_6ecbplus.0: Klitschko stops Thompson in regulation win
7_6ecbplus.2: Wladimir Klitschko retained his IBF, WBO, WBA & IBO heavyweight world titles with a second professional victory over Tony Thompson on Saturday.
7_6ecbplus.3: Klitschko, 36, stopped the 40 - year - old Thompson with two seconds remaining of the sixth round in Switzerland to retain his collection of titles.
7_6ecbplus.4: In 2008, last time the pair met, the bout went 11 rounds before the Ukrainian emerged triumphant.
7_6ecbplus.5: Klitschko dumped Thompson onto the canvas with a booming right end towards the end of the fifth round of the fight in Bern, and from then on it was simply a matter of time before referee Sam Williams stopped matters.
7_6ecbplus.6: The decisive moment came at the end of the next three - minute stretch, the same punch again bringing Thompson to his knees and - despite beating the count - he was clearly too unsteady to continue.
7_6ecbplus.7: Klitschko, who could face Tyson Fury in the near future after being called out by the British - Irish fighter, improves to a career record of 58 wins and three defeats.

31_2ecbplus.0: Ott ’ s Thoughts: Creighton Returns to MVC Semis With Win Over Drake
31_2ecbplus.5: Ply them with a cocktail or two.
31_2ecbplus.6: Heap a few heavy dashes of high expectations for the weekend, and shake it all up with one big sense of being on vacation.
31_2ecbplus.7: That concoction looks like a blue - out in the Scottrade Center.
31_2ecbplus.8: It sounds like an overwhelming tidal wave of blue - clad crazies crashing onto the hard court after every Doug McDermott make and terrible officiating call.
31_2ecbplus.9: Creighton fans overtook the turnstiles in St. Louis Friday afternoon.
31_2ecbplus.10: They came from all over the Midwest and beyond to see CU win the weekend, and the Bluejays obliged the first of three requisite wins for an Arch Madness championship.
31_2ecbplus.11: Drake put up a fight; the Bulldogs twice cut Creighton ’ s lead to 3 points midway through the second half.
31_2ecbplus.12: But a 15 - 2 run during 5 minutes late in the game sealed the deal for the Jays, who will meet Indiana State in the semifinals Saturday afternoon after the Sycamores outlasted Evansville 51 - 50 Friday.
31_2ecbplus.13: Creighton ’ s win over Drake was historic for a few reasons, chief among them McDermott setting the Creighton career scoring record.
31_2ecbplus.14: McDermott scored 10 of the team ’ s first 17 points, displaying a mix of three - point touch and the ability to finish around the rim.
31_2ecbplus.16: Those 10 points tied McDermott with Rodney Buford, Creighton ’ s all - time leading scorer.
31_2ecbplus.17: And as those of us in the crowd who paid attention to such things held off on a bathroom or beer trip to watch him score one more point to break the record, McDermott wouldn ’ t do so for another 8 minutes of game time.
31_2ecbplus.19: And a bit anticlimactic, frankly, when he toed the free throw line and set the record with a one - for - two trip to the charity stripe.
31_2ecbplus.20: Still, that McDermott broke Rodzilla ’ s record in just three seasons is wild to me.
31_2ecbplus.21: I ’ m lucky to say I ’ ve been able to watch McDermott, Buford, Bob Harstad, and Chad Gallagher — the school ’ s top four scorers in history — during my time on Earth cheering for the Jays.
31_2ecbplus.22: But had you told me after that NCAA Tournament game in 1999 that Buford ’ s record would be bested by a guy in only three seasons, I ’ d have called you nuts.
31_2ecbplus.23: Or, as the kids around the Valley type on Twitter right now, #nutz.
31_2ecbplus.24: As for the entirety of his afternoon, McDermott was usual Dependable Doug.
31_2ecbplus.25: With a building full of NBA scouts hanging on his moves ( and, later, on Illinois State ’ s Jackie Carmichael ’ s ridiculous individual performance ), McDermott scored 23 points and grabbed 7 rebounds in 35 minutes.
31_2ecbplus.26: He left the court to chants of “ ONE MORE YEAR! ONE MORE YEAR! ONE MORE YEAR! ”
31_2ecbplus.28: But for all of McDermott ’ s historic accomplishments and his game - high scoring output, the storyline from the CU side of things was the combined play of Gregory Echenique and Will Artino.
31_2ecbplus.29: Echenique hadn ’ t scored much in two games against Drake earlier this season: he put up just 2 points in a 30 - point CU win in Omaha, and then battled foul trouble all night in Des Moines as Drake upset CU.
31_2ecbplus.30: And he went scoreless in the first half Friday.
31_2ecbplus.31: But up stepped Artino, Echenique ’ s sub when the CU coaching staff goes in favor of size and a high / low game instead of Ethan Wragge ’ s shooting touch from deep.
31_2ecbplus.32: Friday afternoon, Artino gave the Bluejays 14 energized and efficient minutes.
31_2ecbplus.33: Entering February, he had played double - digit minutes in just six games.
31_2ecbplus.34: Since the calendar flipped from January, though, he ’ s had five such games.
31_2ecbplus.35: Friday was arguably his most important performance of the season, given the stakes.
31_2ecbplus.36: Artino checked in at the under - 16: 00 media timeout and immediately broke a 12 - 12 tie with a dunk.
31_2ecbplus.37: Fouled on the flush, he finished the traditional three - point play with a free throw.
31_2ecbplus.38: Two trips later, Artino missed a shot but secured the follow and scored again.
31_2ecbplus.39: He would grab two more rebounds before checking out with 9: 07 to play in the first half.
31_2ecbplus.40: While he was in, Creighton ’ s lead grew as great as 9 points.
31_2ecbplus.41: In 8 first - half minutes, the guy teammates and fans call Big Swag scored 7 points and ripped down 5 rebounds.
31_2ecbplus.42: He played the high - low possessions well.
31_2ecbplus.43: While Drake held Echenique scoreless in the first half, Artino was able to find success.
31_2ecbplus.44: He finished the day with a career - high 14 points and 6 rebounds ( 5 on the offensive glass ).
31_2ecbplus.45: In the second half, though, Echenique got, um, engaged with things.
31_2ecbplus.46: He scored all 11 of his points, grabbed 6 of his team - high 11 rebounds, and swatted 5 of his season - high 6 blocked shots ( the 6 blocks are second - most in an MVC Tournament game ).
31_2ecbplus.47: During the game ’ s deciding 15 - 2 run, Echenique scored two traditional three - point plays, grabbed 3 of his 11 rebounds, and blocked two shots.
31_2ecbplus.48: Hammered on a no - call and forced to play at a disadvantage based on inconsistent referring in the frontcourt, Echenique seemed fired up.
31_2ecbplus.49: He flexed a few times, too, so as to remind the Bulldogs who the alpha dog in the paint was on Friday afternoon.
31_2ecbplus.50: The tournament ’ s top seed sticks around for Semifinal Saturday.
31_2ecbplus.51: The 1998 Bradley Braves remains the only play - in winner to advance past the quarterfinals, when they beat a two - seeded Creighton team.
31_2ecbplus.52: Wichita State survived a close game against Missouri State Friday evening, and Illinois State broke away late from Northern Iowa to advance as the six - seed.
31_2ecbplus.53: The Valley will have four solid fan bases represented in the Scottrade Center Saturday afternoon, with white and blue and black and gold the predominant colors swirling around the lower bowl.
31_2ecbplus.54: The day sets up for some solid matchups:
31_2ecbplus.55: The last time the two teams played, Indiana State made Creighton look completely lost.
31_2ecbplus.56: A blacked out crowd in Terre Haute helped the Sycamores to a resounding win.
31_2ecbplus.57: Meanwhile, it took a Carmichael karate kick and other late - game miscues for Illinois State to practically hand over a win to Wichita State in Normal.

19_8ecbplus.0: 'It sounds like a war zone': Chaos in Brooklyn as 100 teenagers 'riot' on the streets following vigil of 16 - year - old who was shot dead by NYPD plainclothes cops
19_8ecbplus.1: Two plainclothes NYPD officers shot and killed a 16 - year - old Brooklyn resident after police say he pointed a gun at officers on Saturday
19_8ecbplus.2: When police approached to speak with the young man, cops say he turned on them and aimed a. 357 caliber revolver at them
19_8ecbplus.3: Peaceful protest for Kimani Gray turned chaotic tonight as 100 people rioted and threw bottles at officers
19_8ecbplus.4: PUBLISHED: 02: 31 GMT, 12 March 2013 | UPDATED: 22: 19 GMT, 12 March 2013
19_8ecbplus.5: An orderly protest over the death of an armed 16 - year - old turned into a riot in Brooklyn tonight after young people started lashing out at NYPD officers.
19_8ecbplus.6: Between 60 and 100 rioters gathered around Church and Snyder Ave. in East Flatbush and threw bottles and other debris at police, witnesses said, following a vigil for Kimani Gray, 16, who was shot dead by two plainclothes officers over the weekend.
19_8ecbplus.7: One person has been arrested, though no injuries have been reported.
19_8ecbplus.8: They were lashing out at the NYPD, who they believe are responsible for the teen ’ s death.
19_8ecbplus.9: An NYPD spokesperson confirmed to MailOnline that there was a ‘ large disorderly group throwing bottles at police. ’
19_8ecbplus.10: They said the protest began around 8: 30pm tonight but the crowd is being dispersed by police.
19_8ecbplus.11: New York City Councilman Jumaane D. Williams, who represents the area of Flatbush, has been tweeting live updates, and said: ‘ I ’ m in the middle of the riot action at Church and Snyder in my district.
19_8ecbplus.14: Mr Williams later described the scene of chaos in Flatbush, saying that garbage cans had been overturned and people smashed out windows.
19_8ecbplus.15: He added that one person had been attacked outside of a local Rite Aid.
19_8ecbplus.16: ‘ Tonight was a peaceful vigil that devolved into a riot, ’ he wrote.
19_8ecbplus.17: ‘ The youth in this community have no outlets for their anger, no community. ’
19_8ecbplus.18: Another Twitter user who is apparently at the site said that the riot 'sounds like a war zone. '
19_8ecbplus.19: A source told the New York Daily News that the protest began some 20 blocks from where Gray was fatally shot.
19_8ecbplus.20: The march went past the 67th Presinct station, where officers impeded the protest ’ s progress.
19_8ecbplus.21: That ’ s when the peaceful protest got out of hand.
19_8ecbplus.22: The unnamed NYPD officer told the Daily News that they saw teens jumping on cars and throwing bottles at officers.
19_8ecbplus.23: Gray, 16, was shot eleven times after police said he pulled out a. 357 revolver in East Flatbush, Brooklyn over the weekend.
19_8ecbplus.24: Police say they came across a group of young men on Saturday evening and saw Gray acting suspiciously, walking away from his friends when he saw the officers approach.
19_8ecbplus.25: Officers say the 16 - year old began to adjust his waistband and started to act suspiciously.
19_8ecbplus.26: Gray then turned around and pointed a. 357 caliber gun at them, according to police accounts.
19_8ecbplus.27: When the two plainclothes officers saw the weapon they responded by opening fire.
19_8ecbplus.28: The teen was rushed to Kings County Hospital but he later died.
19_8ecbplus.29: However, witnesses to the shooting say that the NYPD's account is wrong.
19_8ecbplus.30: Gray ’ s older sister, Mahnefah Gray, 19, told the New York Times that one of the witnesses of the shooting told her that her brother was only fixing his belt.
19_8ecbplus.31: She added that her brother had too much ‘ common sense ’ to point a loaded gun at an officer, and doubted that he was even carrying a gun at all.
19_8ecbplus.32: A woman who lives across the street from the scene of the shooting told the Times that Gray was calling out: ‘ Please don ’ t let me die! ’ and said the officers yelled back: ‘ Stay down, or we ’ ll shoot you again. ’
19_8ecbplus.33: Grey lived in nearby Crown Heights, but had grown up in East Flatbush and returned there to visit friends.
19_8ecbplus.34: His older brother, Jamar, was killed in a car accident two years ago.
19_8ecbplus.35: According to witnesses, when the two cops arrived on the scene in an unmarked car, Gray was part of a group of six teenagers standing by the side of the road.
19_8ecbplus.36: One of Gray's friends, Devonte Brown told the New York Post: 'As the cops opened fire, he was screaming, ‘ Stop!
19_8ecbplus.38: His friends have not explained exactly what caused the police officers to shoot.
19_8ecbplus.39: Police say Gray's gun was loaded with four bullets but have not yet determined whether the teenager fired his weapon.
19_8ecbplus.40: Gray had been in trouble with the law before, having been arrested three times since October and had previously been charged with grand larceny and inciting a riot.

9_11ecbplus.0: Scientific Consultations Under Endangered Species Act Restored
9_11ecbplus.2: The Obama administration today revoked an eleventh - hour Bush - era rule that undermined protections for plants and animals listed as threatened or endangered under the Endangered Species Act.
9_11ecbplus.3: Passed in January 2009, the Bush - era rule lifted the requirement that federal agencies consult wildlife experts with the U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service or the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration before taking actions that could harm listed species.
9_11ecbplus.4: The Bush move allowed federal agencies to decide for themselves if their own projects, such as roads, dams and mines, would hurt species.
9_11ecbplus.5: Secretary of Commerce Gary Locke and Secretary of the Interior Ken Salazar, who head the two agencies that administer the Endangered Species Act, said their decision to again require consultation before action is based on sound science.
9_11ecbplus.6: "By rolling back this 11th hour regulation, we are ensuring that threatened and endangered species continue to receive the full protection of the law, " Salazar said.
9_11ecbplus.7: "Because science must serve as the foundation for decisions we make, federal agencies proposing to take actions that might affect threatened and endangered species will once again have to consult with biologists at the two departments, " he said.
9_11ecbplus.8: "For decades, the Endangered Species Act has protected threatened species and their habitats, " said Locke.
9_11ecbplus.9: "Our decision affirms the administration's commitment to using sound science to promote conservation and protect the environment. "
9_11ecbplus.10: In March, President Barack Obama directed the secretaries to review the previous administration's Section 7 regulation of the Endangered Species Act, which governs interagency consultation.
9_11ecbplus.11: Congress, in the 2009 Omnibus Appropriations Act, specifically authorized the secretaries to revoke the regulation.
9_11ecbplus.12: Locke and Salazar said the two departments will conduct a joint review of the 1986 consultation regulations that are now once again in effect to determine if any improvements should be proposed.
9_11ecbplus.13: The Endangered Species Act was signed into law in 1973 to protect imperiled species from extinction, as well as conserve the ecosystems and habitats necessary for their survival.
9_11ecbplus.14: Today there are 1, 009 species in the United States listed as endangered under the Act - 409 animals and 600 plants.
9_11ecbplus.15: An additional 162 animals and 146 plants are listed as threatened.
9_11ecbplus.16: Environmentalists and scientists who had lobbied against making consultation discretionary were pleased with the decision.
9_11ecbplus.17: Betsy Loyless, National Audubon Society senior vice president for advocacy and policy, said, "The Obama administration has given a great gift to wildlife and to future generations.
9_11ecbplus.18: Once again, our nation will follow the letter of the law and the advice of its own best experts before jeopardizing the future of threatened and endangered species. "
9_11ecbplus.19: The decision comes as President Obama prepares to mark his first 100 days in office on Wednesday.
9_11ecbplus.20: Loyless said, "The President has capped his first hundred days with a serious step toward restoring our commitment to this nation's great natural heritage. "
9_11ecbplus.21: Last Friday, 1, 300 biologists and three scientific societies representing some 20, 000 scientists - The Ornithological Council, Society for Conservation Biology and the Wildlife Society - sent separate letters to the Interior and Commerce departments urging them to overturn the last - minute Bush rule change.
9_11ecbplus.22: "Many federal agencies do not have the scientific expertise to determine the consequences of federal projects on endangered species and may have vested interests in the implementation of a project, " said Stuart Pimm, Doris Duke Professor of Conservation Ecology at Duke University, who helped organize the scientists' letter.
9_11ecbplus.23: Pimm said the Bush rule excluded from the process expert scientists who for decades have provided impartial review and critical analysis of proposed projects.
9_11ecbplus.24: Alan Thornhill, an ecologist and executive director of the Society for Conservation Biology, said, "As the threats we face continue to evolve, federal scientists must be able to evaluate their consequences for imperiled species.
9_11ecbplus.25: Putting boundaries on the science that informs the Endangered Species Act fundamentally undermines the ability of science and scientists to protect our nation's biodiversity. "
9_11ecbplus.26: "Politics plays a huge role in such decisions, " said Michael Hutchins, executive director and chief executive of The Wildlife Society.
9_11ecbplus.28: Francesca Grifo, director of Union of Concerned Scientists' Scientific Integrity Program, said lifting the requirement for consultation was one of a number of ways the Bush administration weakened the Act, and more work remains to be done.
9_11ecbplus.29: "Several last - minute Bush administration regulatory changes have undermined the scientific foundation of the Endangered Species Act, and today the Obama administration has begun to repair the damage, " she said.
9_11ecbplus.30: "The message from tens of thousands of scientists around the country is clear - these unwarranted changes fundamentally undermine our ability to protect imperiled plants and animals. "
9_11ecbplus.31: "Today, the Obama administration restored critical checks and balances to protect our nation's biodiversity, " said Grifo.
9_11ecbplus.32: "But there is much more to be done.
9_11ecbplus.33: The Obama administration must thoroughly review how science is used to ensure that our nation's imperiled species have a chance to survive - and thrive. "

22_14ecbplus.1: Kraft Shooting: Yvonne Hiller Charged With Two Counts Of Murder
22_14ecbplus.2: A Kraft Foods plant worker who had been suspended for feuding with colleagues, then escorted from the building, returned minutes later with a handgun, found her foes in a break room and executed two of them with a single bullet each and critically wounded a third, police said Friday.
22_14ecbplus.3: Yvonne Hiller, 43, had gotten into an argument Thursday evening with her co - workers at the northeast Philadelphia plant, police said.
22_14ecbplus.4: After she was disciplined, she went to her vehicle, made several phone calls, and then grabbed a. 357 Magnum and used it to force her way past security guards at the front gate.
22_14ecbplus.5: About 100 people were at work at the plant, which makes Nabisco cookies and crackers.
22_14ecbplus.6: Hiller walked to the third - floor mixing area and found four people in the break room.
22_14ecbplus.7: She had no quarrels with one woman and told her to leave.
22_14ecbplus.8: She then opened fire on the others, Philadelphia Homicide Capt. James Clark said.
22_14ecbplus.9: "She believed they were spraying chemicals at her, saying things behind her back, " Clark said.
22_14ecbplus.10: After leaving the break room, Hiller went down a hallway and fired shots at the supervisor who had suspended her and at a mechanic who was using a walkie - talkie to alert police and co - workers to her whereabouts, police said.
22_14ecbplus.12: Hiller finally went to a second - floor office and called police to tell them what she had done, authorities said.
