22_14ecbplus.13: Seven other workers were hiding in a closet nearby.
22_14ecbplus.14: Cpl. Janice Leader, a 911 dispatcher, told reporters Friday that Hiller called 911, saying "I'm the one you're looking for" and reporting that she had been harassed at work.
22_14ecbplus.15: Keeping her on the line, Leader said she told Hiller to put the gun down and place her hands on her head so officers wouldn't take any aggressive action against her.

36_4ecbplus.0: Texas jury hears Warren Jeffs sex tapes despite FLDS leader's objections
36_4ecbplus.1: Published: Tuesday, Aug. 2 2011 7: 08 p. m. MDT
36_4ecbplus.2: Prosecutors Tuesday put on the most shocking evidence yet in the trial of Warren Jeffs, who is charged with sexually assaulting underage girls.
36_4ecbplus.3: Prosecutors played two audio recordings of Jeffs instructing his 14 - year - old "spiritual wife" and several other young women on how to please him sexually, and thus win favor with God.
36_4ecbplus.4: Jeffs seemed determined to halt the trial, and the judge repeatedly warned him to stop talking and sit down - even threatened to kick him out of his own trial.
36_4ecbplus.5: Once the jury had headphones and started listening to a recording, Jeffs repeatedly objected, interrupting the recording many times.
36_4ecbplus.6: On the tape, Jeffs' voice drones on for well over two hours, using Biblical language and sometimes speaking in the voice of God, counseling a number of his plural wives to perform what he calls the "ordinance of heavenly comfort. "
36_4ecbplus.7: He promises they will feel the all - consuming fire of heaven, and by giving comfort to their husband, they will be touching God.
36_4ecbplus.8: The recordings were part of the mountain of documents seized in a law enforcement raid in 2008.
36_4ecbplus.9: On the recording, there are many long minutes in which it's hard to make out exactly what's happening.
36_4ecbplus.10: But it seems to include sounds of fumbling with clothing, sobbing, flushing of toilets.
36_4ecbplus.11: At one point Jeffs tells the girls or women, "You have to know how to be excited sexually.
36_4ecbplus.12: You have to be able to assist each other. "
36_4ecbplus.13: It all ends with prayers and supposed revelations from God, and Jeffs himself singing a hymn.
36_4ecbplus.14: Jeffs, 55, is head of the Utah - based Fundamentalist LDS Church, which believes polygamy brings exaltation in heaven.
36_4ecbplus.15: He is accused of sexually assaulting two girls, ages 12 and 15, he took as brides in what his church calls "spiritual marriages. "
36_4ecbplus.16: A forensic analyst testified Monday that Jeffs was the father of the 15 - year - old's child.
36_4ecbplus.17: On Tuesday, prosecutors also played a tape of Jeffs talking to the girl when she was 14, after Texas Ranger Nick Hanna testified about documents and electronic files seized during a 2008 police raid at the church's remote compound in West Texas.
36_4ecbplus.18: Among the materials recovered during the raid was a record of Jeffs' marriage "for time and all eternity" with the 14 - year - old in January 2004.
36_4ecbplus.19: An excerpt from hundreds of pages of Jeffs' personal journals said the child was "pure and innocent and willing to obey" and that he summoned her parents and "informed them of their girl belonging to me. "
36_4ecbplus.20: Followers see Jeffs as a prophet who is God's spokesman on earth.
36_4ecbplus.21: Hanna read from Jeffs' journals, which said he took the 14 - year - old the night after their wedding with him and another of his new wives on a car ride for "training. "
36_4ecbplus.22: There, he instructed them on their responsibilities as his wives and had the session taped.
36_4ecbplus.23: The recording was transcribed and placed in church records later seized by police.
36_4ecbplus.24: Lead prosecutor Eric Nichols played the tape for jurors, who followed along using transcripts.
36_4ecbplus.25: "A good wife is trained for her husband and follows the spirit of peace, " Jeffs is heard saying.
36_4ecbplus.26: He also makes reference to "drawing close" or "being close, " which is how church members refer to sex.
36_4ecbplus.28: In describing the session in his journal later, Jeffs said he told his wives they were "honorable vessels, property of your husband's kingdom and the Kingdom of God on Earth. "
36_4ecbplus.29: Jeffs has represented himself since firing his high - powered attorneys last week.
36_4ecbplus.30: Later, Nichols played a 58 - minute clip of another so - called training session from December 2004, this one involving what he described as 12 "young" ladies, including the one from the first recording.
36_4ecbplus.31: Jeffs stood up and talked over it, rambling about how a holy trust was being broken.
36_4ecbplus.32: "I am but a mortal man seeking peace, " he said.
36_4ecbplus.33: "I am not a threat to anyone.
36_4ecbplus.34: My faith is my only weapon. "
36_4ecbplus.35: Prosecutors have promised to play still another recording - this one of Jeffs having sex with the 12 - year - old girl - before resting their case.
36_4ecbplus.36: Nichols told Walther they would do so at the end of a court session that stretched late into Tuesday night.
36_4ecbplus.37: Before the recordings, Hanna read excerpts of Jeffs' journal where he described the Lord ordering him to visit Eldorado, Texas, about 45 miles south of San Angelo, and the church purchasing 1, 700 acres of land outside the town for $1. 2 million in 2003.
36_4ecbplus.38: "This will only be a place of refuge if it is kept sacred and secret, " Jeffs wrote, adding that his followers should populate the area and let "a community grow here more in hiding before the neighbors find out. "
36_4ecbplus.39: He told the faithful they could build anything they wanted, thanks to Texas' lax zoning laws, and construction teams working around - the - clock erected more than a dozen buildings, including a sprawling, white - limestone temple.
36_4ecbplus.40: Texas authorities raided the compound in April 2008 after receiving a call to an abuse hotline that turned out to be a hoax.
36_4ecbplus.41: More than 400 FLDS children who were placed in protective custody were eventually returned to their families.
36_4ecbplus.42: But police saw underage girls who were clearly pregnant and found Jeffs' journals and the other documents in a vault at the end of a secret passageway in the temple.
36_4ecbplus.43: Another vault in an annex building provided still more records and files.
36_4ecbplus.44: Jeffs and 11 other FLDS men were charged with crimes including sexual assault and bigamy.
36_4ecbplus.45: So far, all seven who have been prosecuted have been convicted, receiving prison sentences of between six and 75 years.

4_11ecbplus.0: Legendary Aquatic Musical Star Esther Williams Dies At 91
4_11ecbplus.2: Championship swimmer - turned - legendary Hollywood actress Esther Williams has died.
4_11ecbplus.3: The star of such MGM movie hits as “ Take Me Out to the Ball Game, ” "Jupiter's Darling" and "Million Dollar Mermaid, " passed away in Beverly Hills, Calif. , on Thursday at the age of 91.
4_11ecbplus.4: The California native, who once held the record in the 100 meter freestyle, was promoted as "the girl you will dream about! " in the film that made her a household name, "Bathing Beauty, " which was released shortly after D - Day in 1944, making her one of the top pin - up girls of U. S. servicemen serving in World War II.
4_11ecbplus.5: Williams' publicist, Harlan Boll, confirmed her death to the Associated Press on Thursday.

34_12ecbplus.0: Former AMA trustee Dr. Benjamin nominated to be surgeon general
34_12ecbplus.2: President Obama's choices to be the nation's top physician and top scientist are both hands - on practitioners with extensive leadership experience.
34_12ecbplus.3: On July 13, Obama announced that he was nominating Regina M. Benjamin, MD, a family physician from southern Alabama, to be surgeon general.
34_12ecbplus.4: Dr. Benjamin, 52, became the first woman and first African - American president of the Medical Assn. of the State of Alabama in 2002.
34_12ecbplus.5: She also completed a term in June as chair of the AMA Council on Ethical and Judicial Affairs and served on the AMA Board of Trustees from 1995 to 1998, becoming the first physician under 40 to serve on the board in a non - resident role.
34_12ecbplus.6: On July 8, Obama nominated Francis S. Collins, MD, PhD, as director of the National Institutes of Health.
34_12ecbplus.7: Dr. Collins, 59, led the Human Genome Project - - an effort to sequence and map human genes, that concluded in 2003.
34_12ecbplus.8: He left his position as director of the NIH's National Human Genome Research Institute in 2008 after 15 years but maintains a lab at the NIH's Bethesda, Md. , campus.
34_12ecbplus.9: Both nominees must first be confirmed by the Senate.
34_12ecbplus.10: AMA President J. James Rohack, MD, said Dr. Benjamin has an impressive list of accomplishments, including receiving a MacArthur Fellowship in 2008, commonly known as the "genius grant. "
34_12ecbplus.11: But awards are not her main focus, he said.
34_12ecbplus.12: "Dr. Benjamin's most important qualification for surgeon general is her deep commitment to her patients. "
34_12ecbplus.13: Dr. Benjamin said in the White House Rose Garden announcement that the deaths of close relatives from preventable diseases drove her to focus on public health.
34_12ecbplus.14: "My father died with diabetes and hypertension.
34_12ecbplus.15: My older brother, and only sibling, died at age 44 of HIV - related illness.
34_12ecbplus.16: My mother died of lung cancer, because as a young girl, she wanted to smoke just like her twin brother could. "
34_12ecbplus.17: Dr. Collins' colleagues said he is a natural choice to head the primary federal agency for funding and conducting medical research because of his thoughtfulness, willingness to listen and experience as a spokesman for the genome mapping effort.
34_12ecbplus.18: "He's a forceful personality, " said Tom Murray, PhD, head of the Hastings Center, an independent bioethics research institute.
34_12ecbplus.19: "He wants to hear from people who don't agree with him. "
34_12ecbplus.21: If confirmed, Dr. Benjamin would be the nation's lead public health educator.
34_12ecbplus.22: Fellow physicians see the role as a good fit.
34_12ecbplus.23: Besides experience with family illnesses, Dr. Benjamin said she also was influenced by her medical school training under David Satcher, MD, PhD, who later became surgeon general, and others who focused on public health issues in underserved areas.
34_12ecbplus.24: Jorge Alsip, MD, the Alabama medical society's president, said Dr. Benjamin has seen how much patients in poor and rural areas appreciate her help.
34_12ecbplus.25: "That can't help but affect you and make you want to do something for these people, " said Dr. Alsip, an emergency physician who has known Dr. Benjamin for more than 15 years.
34_12ecbplus.26: Dr. Alsip also said Dr. Benjamin is tenacious.
34_12ecbplus.27: "If Regina's in a fight, don't ever bet against her. "
34_12ecbplus.28: She rebuilt her clinic in Bayou La Batre, Ala. , twice after hurricanes destroyed it and is rebuilding it a third time after a fire.
34_12ecbplus.29: Obama said his surgeon general pick has personally witnessed how the U. S. health system is broken.
34_12ecbplus.30: "She's seen an increasing number of patients who've had health insurance their entire lives suddenly lose it because they lost their jobs or because it's simply become too expensive. "
34_12ecbplus.31: Dr. Benjamin lamented the difficulty some doctors face in caring for patients, regardless of ability to pay.
34_12ecbplus.32: "It shouldn't be this expensive for Americans to get health care in this country, " she said.
34_12ecbplus.33: Obama said Dr. Benjamin has forgone a salary when her clinic faced financial hardship.
34_12ecbplus.34: Jeff Terry, MD, chair of the AMA's Alabama delegation and a urologist, said Dr. Benjamin has proven herself through work in organized medicine and elsewhere.
34_12ecbplus.35: The two co - founded the young physicians section of the state medical society nearly two decades ago.
34_12ecbplus.36: Since then, she has held leadership positions in physician organizations and other groups.
34_12ecbplus.37: Dr. Benjamin is also probably more politically liberal than many physicians on Alabama's Gulf Coast, Dr. Terry said.
34_12ecbplus.38: "Maybe President Obama saw a little of that in her. "
34_12ecbplus.40: Obama lauded Dr. Collins' experience in the July 8 announcement.
34_12ecbplus.41: "Dr. Collins is one of the top scientists in the world, and his groundbreaking work has changed the very ways we consider our health and examine disease. "
34_12ecbplus.42: Dr. Collins' laboratory discovered several important genes, including those responsible for cystic fibrosis and Huntington's disease.
34_12ecbplus.43: Acquaintances and colleagues predicted that Dr. Collins would do a good job representing NIH in front of lawmakers and others.
34_12ecbplus.44: He is a very approachable person who doesn't rely on jargon to communicate, said Sean B. Tipton, spokesman for the American Society of Reproductive Medicine.
34_12ecbplus.45: "He has an ability to interact with the public and with policymakers and the press that I think will serve him very well as an NIH director. "
34_12ecbplus.46: The Hastings Center's Murray said that if Dr. Collins ever made a mistake, it may be that he was a bit overly enthusiastic when describing the potential for breakthroughs when he was leading the Human Genome Project.
34_12ecbplus.47: Still, "I can't fault the scientist who really believes in their work for being enthusiastic as they talk to Congress, " Murray said.
34_12ecbplus.48: Dr. Collins has garnered attention by professing that his belief in God can coexist with his pursuit of science.
34_12ecbplus.49: He's written books on the topic, including the 2007 best - seller The Language of God: A Scientist Presents Evidence for Belief.
34_12ecbplus.50: He is also founder and president of the BioLogos Foundation, whose purpose is to find compatibility between the scientific and religious searches for truth.
34_12ecbplus.51: In an interview with the spiritual Web site Beliefnet in 2007, Dr. Collins said Christians who reject scientific evolutionary theory are also rejecting humans' ability to understand, a God - given skill.
34_12ecbplus.52: But there are limits to the questions science can answer, such as why we are here or what happens after death, he said.
34_12ecbplus.53: William Hurlbut, MD, a consulting professor of neuroscience at Stanford University and a former member of President George W. Bush's Council on Bioethics, said the idea that science and religion can't coexist is ridiculous.
34_12ecbplus.54: "A person with Francis' background is a very wise choice" for NIH chief, he said.

11_3ecbplus.0: Turkmen election to have 2 parties for 1st time
11_3ecbplus.2: For the first time in post - Soviet Turkmenistan's history, its parliamentary elections will have two parties, ITAR - TASS reported September 26, citing the country's Central Election and Referendum Commission ( TsKVPR ).
11_3ecbplus.3: Besides the ruling Democratic Party ( former Communist Party ), the Party of Industrialists and Entrepreneurs ( PPPT ) – founded in 2012 – will be seeking seats in the December 15 election.
11_3ecbplus.5: The campaign starts October 5, according to TsKVPR.
11_3ecbplus.6: Presently, parliament has one PPPT member, who won a vacated seat in Akhal Oblast in June.

19_9ecbplus.0: Brooklyn vigil for slain teen killed by NYPD snowballs into full blown riot
19_9ecbplus.1: A candle light vigil turned violent Monday night in East Flatbush, Brooklyn.
19_9ecbplus.2: Dozens gathered to remember 16 - year - old Kimani Gray.
19_9ecbplus.3: NYPD officers shot and killed the teen late Saturday night.
19_9ecbplus.4: What started as a march, soon turned into a riot.
19_9ecbplus.5: Video posted on Youtube from OccupyBloomberg ’ s Ustream showed angry people screaming at the NYPD.
19_9ecbplus.6: According to reports from the scene, people vandalized property, looted and threw bottles at police.
19_9ecbplus.7: The NYPD said one person was arrested for disorderly conduct.
19_9ecbplus.8: Overnight and into early Tuesday morning, police barricaded Snyder Avenue in front of the 67th precinct in East Flatbush.
19_9ecbplus.9: Police still wearing helmets, guarded the block.
19_9ecbplus.10: “ Tonight, we saw an explosion of anger from the youth in my community.
19_9ecbplus.11: We have talked about this anger for years, but still the resources have not come to address it, ” said Brooklyn Councilman Jumaane Williams in a press release following the riot.
19_9ecbplus.12: “ We have talked about the corrosive relationship between our community and the NYPD, but still the Mayor and the Commissioner have failed to address the root causes of this tension.
19_9ecbplus.13: Tonight, we saw that tension turn in a destructive manner.
19_9ecbplus.14: I cannot and will not condone the damage caused to property or to person. ”
19_9ecbplus.15: According to police, Kimani Gray had a. 38 caliber Rohm ’ s Industry revolver and he allegedly pointed it at the plain clothes officers Saturday night when they approached a group on East 52nd street in East Flatbush.
19_9ecbplus.16: The officers fired their weapons and the teenager was pronounced dead at Kings County Hospital.
19_9ecbplus.17: The gun was found at the scene, said the NYPD.

1_3ecbplus.0: Lindsay Lohan Checks Out Of Rehab. .. To Check Into Different Rehab Centre
1_3ecbplus.2: The actress has left the Betty Ford Centre and gone to Malibu's Cliffside resort.
1_3ecbplus.3: One place Lindsay is finding this particularly difficult though is at the Betty Ford Centre, where the actress has just finished 30 days' worth of treatment and has decided that the renowned facilities there won't be enough to keep her around for her court - ordered 90 - day stay in rehab, so she's gone elsewhere.
1_3ecbplus.4: According to a report from TMZ published this week ( June 13 ), the Mean Girls actress has had enough of the Palm Springs rehab centre and has decided to spend the rest of her court - ordered stay in a rehab centre in Malibu, named the Cliffside.
1_3ecbplus.5: Lindsay hasn't messed around in getting to the new facility either and she is reportedly already a patient of the Cliffside rehab centre, having checked out of the Betty Ford Centre on Thursday ( June 13 ) this week and committing herself to Cliffside almost immediately afterward.

45_7ecbplus.0: Man found GUILTY of shooting dead pregnant girlfriend execution - style because 'he didn't want another child to support'
45_7ecbplus.2: A jury in eastern Oklahoma has convicted a 27 - year - old man of shooting dead his pregnant girlfriend and her unborn baby after she refused to get an abortion.
45_7ecbplus.3: The jury deliberated almost seven hours Thursday before convicting Christopher Kenyon Simpson, of Spiro, in the death of 20 - year - old Ka'loni Flynn, of Fort Smith, Arkansas.
45_7ecbplus.4: The jurors recommended the maximum sentence of life in prison without parole.
45_7ecbplus.5: Simpson is scheduled to be sentenced November 8.

6_5ecbplus.0: 'Hunger Games' Director Gary Ross in Tough Negotiation for Sequel
6_5ecbplus.2: Despite the movie's box - office records, the director isn't locked up as Lionsgate could pull a "Twilight" - style switcheroo over money.
6_5ecbplus.3: Now that The Hunger Games is a hit with more than $363 million in the till, the question is whether writer - director Gary Ross will return for the next installment in the lucrative Lionsgate franchise.
6_5ecbplus.4: Unlike stars Jennifer Lawrence, Josh Hutcherson and Liam Hemsworth, Ross is not signed for a sequel.
6_5ecbplus.5: And negotiations for him to do the first movie were "a terrible experience, " says a source with knowledge of the discussions, because Ross is a seasoned filmmaker ( Pleasantville, Seabiscuit ) and Lionsgate isn't accustomed to paying seasoned - filmmaker fees.
6_5ecbplus.6: He ended up taking a relatively low $3 million to write ( with Billy Ray and novelist Suzanne Collins ) and direct.
6_5ecbplus.7: But he will collect a very remunerative 5 percent of backend.
6_5ecbplus.8: Sources say Ross, 55, would like a significant raise for a second Hunger Games, but Lionsgate didn't kick off negotiations with him until about three weeks before the first film's March 23 opening.
6_5ecbplus.9: By then, with tracking suggesting a huge opening weekend, Ross and his CAA reps were in no hurry to bargain.
6_5ecbplus.10: Lionsgate has a script from Simon Beaufoy ( Slumdog Millionaire ) that Ross has yet to revise.
6_5ecbplus.11: The studio is in a rush to start the next film in the fall, though Fox might upset Lionsgate's plan by exercising its option on Lawrence to start another X - Men movie first.
6_5ecbplus.12: ( Fox's option would trump Lionsgate's hold on Lawrence, say sources. )
6_5ecbplus.13: Adding urgency: Lionsgate already has booked a November 2013 release for Hunger Games: Catching Fire.
6_5ecbplus.14: With other big literary properties, directors have been seen as fungible.
6_5ecbplus.15: Warner Bros. entrusted the first two Harry Potter films to Chris Columbus before employing a host of other filmmakers, and Summit memorably did not invite Catherine Hardwicke back to direct the second Twilight, despite the success of the first installment.
6_5ecbplus.16: ( And Summit's Rob Friedman and Patrick Wachsberger now run Lionsgate's film division. )
6_5ecbplus.17: But Ross will argue that his film was much better received than any in the Twilight series, with an A CinemaScore and an 85 percent "fresh" rating on Rotten Tomatoes in addition to huge worldwide box office.
6_5ecbplus.18: He'll contend that the movie will play longer and stronger in theaters and that he could direct his pick of other movies should Lionsgate refuse to pony up.
6_5ecbplus.19: ( But to state the obvious, Hunger Games' bi - gender story line appeals to a wider audience than Twilight. )
6_5ecbplus.20: It's always striking when a giant hit leads to anger and hurt feelings in Hollywood, but that seems to be the case here.
6_5ecbplus.21: Nonetheless, sources involved with the franchise are betting that Ross will return.
6_5ecbplus.22: "Ultimately, it will be difficult, and yet everybody will do the sane thing, which is to work it out, " says one.
6_5ecbplus.23: "Everybody will end up unhappy in their own way.
6_5ecbplus.24: It's just the nature of the beast. "

20_4ecbplus.0: Iran Villagers Shelter In Tents After Killer Quake
20_4ecbplus.2: Iranian rescue workers handed out blankets, food and water Monday to survivors of a powerful earthquake on a Gulf island that killed 10 people and forced villagers to spend the night in tents.
20_4ecbplus.3: Power was restored to the afflicted villages on the Gulf island of Qeshm after a blackout caused by the quake, which struck on Sunday with a force of about 6. 0 on the Richter scale.
20_4ecbplus.4: "We have distributed the needed tents, blankets, fresh water and food to survivors, " the governor - general of Hormouzgan province, Abdolreza Sheikholeslami, told state television.
20_4ecbplus.5: He said 30 of the 80 wounded remained in hospital after the tremor, which destroyed or damaged an estimated 1, 500 mudbrick houses in about 15 villages on the island and was felt across the Gulf in the United Arab Emirates.
20_4ecbplus.6: "Most of the buildings in the villages are not safe to live in any more.
20_4ecbplus.7: However, by nightfall all those who need tents will be provided with one, " the head of the provincial natural disaster service, Massoud Dalman, told the television.
20_4ecbplus.8: Qeshm island governor Heydar Alishbandi told AFP that a total of 10 people had been killed and that the death toll was not expected to rise further.
20_4ecbplus.9: "Around 1, 000 people are housed temporarily in tents and another 2, 000 are waiting to be housed, " he said, adding that the weather was warm with temperatures of about 28 degrees Celsius ( 82 degrees Fahrenheit ).
20_4ecbplus.10: "We are not facing shortages and the relief operations are going smoothly. "
20_4ecbplus.11: Some panicked residents of the island, which is situated off the coast from the large port city of Bandar Abbas and is home to about 100, 000 people, slept outside after a second quake jolted the area several hours later.
20_4ecbplus.12: The rocky and barren island was hit almost two years after the southeastern city of Bam - - situated 300 kilometers ( 190 miles ) to the north - - was destroyed in a quake that killed tens of thousands of people.
20_4ecbplus.13: State news agency IRNA quoted the head of Qeshm's free - trade zone, Ali Rezapour, as saying the quake caused damage estimated at around 54 million dollars, with 50 schools and about 1, 500 houses rendered unsafe.
20_4ecbplus.14: Qeshm, located 1, 150 kilometers ( 700 miles ) southeast of Tehran, has a busy commercial and fishing port and is also a popular weekend sunshine getaway for Iranian tourists.
20_4ecbplus.15: Airport chief Ali Naghavi was quoted by IRNA as saying that operations had resumed after being halted on Sunday.
20_4ecbplus.16: The island's main town, also called Qeshm, was undamaged.
20_4ecbplus.17: The most affected villages were identified as Gabardin, Tonban, Karvan, Tourian and Khaldin - - all situated in the less densely populated west of the island.
20_4ecbplus.18: Iran sits astride several major faults in the earth's crust, and is prone to frequent earthquakes.
20_4ecbplus.19: In February, a quake measuring 6. 4 on the Richter scale hit the southern town of Zarand, killing 612 people and wounding around 1, 400.
20_4ecbplus.20: In December 2003, the southeastern city of Bam was razed by a 6. 7 degree quake that left more than 31, 000 people dead.
20_4ecbplus.21: Mehdi Zareh, the head of Iran's Seismic Research Center, said there was no tsunami risk from the latest quake.
20_4ecbplus.22: "Because the Persian Gulf is not very deep, a tsunami is not expected, " he told the student news agency ISNA.

25_10ecbplus.0: Saints place Pierre Thomas on injured reserve; sign Joique Bell off Eagles practice squad
25_10ecbplus.2: The injury woes continued Wednesday for the defending Super Bowl champion New Orleans Saints, who have placed veteran running back Pierre Thomas on season - ending reserve.
25_10ecbplus.3: Thomas' spot on the 53 - man roster was quickly filled with the signing of undrafted rookie running back Joique Bell ( 5 - 11, 220 ), who comes to the Black and Gold from the Philadelphia Eagles practice squad.
25_10ecbplus.4: Thomas is the fifth Saints running back to go on IR this season, the second in two days, the third in less than a month.
25_10ecbplus.5: On Tuesday, team officials placed undrafted rookie running back Chris Ivory on IR with a Lisfranc injury to his left foot.
25_10ecbplus.6: On Dec. 8, veteran running back Ladell Betts went on IR with a neck injury
25_10ecbplus.8: The Saints ( 11 - 5 ) face the NFC West - champion Seattle Seahawks ( 7 - 9 ) in a wildcard game at 3: 30 p. m. Saturday at Qwest Field.

16_8ecbplus.0: Sheriff ’ s Deputy Shot and Killed
16_8ecbplus.2: A 35 - year - old sheriff ’ s deputy working with an anti - gang unit was killed Friday when he knocked on the door of a home and someone shot him in the head, authorities said.
16_8ecbplus.3: Deputy Jerry Ortiz had gone to the home to speak to a woman there as part of a gang investigation when he was attacked, Undersheriff Larry Waldie told reporters Friday night.
16_8ecbplus.4: Ortiz probably died instantly, Waldie said.
16_8ecbplus.5: “ Someone came out either nearby or from the residence and put a bullet through his head, ” Waldie said.
16_8ecbplus.6: Los Angeles County Sheriff Lee Baca, who was out of state attending a convention, made plans to return to Southern California immediately.
16_8ecbplus.7: The deputy, who was wed about three weeks ago, is survived by his wife and two sons, ages 16 and 6, Waldie said.
16_8ecbplus.8: He was a 15 - year veteran of the department and had been a member of its anti - gang unit for the past five years.
16_8ecbplus.9: Authorities said they believe they know the identity of the shooter, although the person was not immediately taken into custody.
16_8ecbplus.10: Deputies cordoned off streets in the neighborhood and were searching for the suspect Friday night.
16_8ecbplus.11: A passer - by who found the wounded deputy shortly after 3 p. m. called the Lakewood sheriff ’ s station to report the shooting, said sheriff ’ s Sgt. Vanette Christiansen.
16_8ecbplus.12: “ Our Lakewood units responded out and in fact we found a deputy who works our gang enforcement team who had gunshot wounds, ” she said.
16_8ecbplus.13: Another deputy fell and suffered a minor injury responding to the crime scene.

8_5ecbplus.0: Three Killed In Athens Bank Fire Amid Strike
8_5ecbplus.2: Three people have died after rioters in Greece set fire to a bank in Athens during a nationwide strike against huge spending cuts aimed at rescuing the country's economy.
8_5ecbplus.3: Greek police clashed with protesters in the capital as tens of thousands of people joined a 24 - hour walkout.
8_5ecbplus.4: The three bank workers - two women and a man - were killed when their branch went up in flames after a protester threw a petrol bomb inside.
8_5ecbplus.5: Firefighters rescued another five people from the balcony.
8_5ecbplus.6: Greek prime minister George Papandreou condemned the killings, saying: "A demonstration is one thing and murder is quite another".
8_5ecbplus.7: He added: "We will, of course, stand alongside the families who lost loved ones.
8_5ecbplus.8: This is the least we can do.
8_5ecbplus.9: "To those who now mourn the loss of three children we say that the perpetrators will be identified and held accountable for what they've done. "
8_5ecbplus.10: The general strike was staged as a protest against a new round of draconian austerity measures.
8_5ecbplus.11: Police said as many as 20, 000 people took to the streets of Athens as rallies all around the country kicked off.
8_5ecbplus.12: Also in the capital, a large group of people attempted to break through a riot police cordon guarding the parliament building.
8_5ecbplus.13: The protesters launched rocks and petrol bombs at the officers, who responded with stun grenades and tear gas - filling Syntagma Square with chemical smoke.
8_5ecbplus.14: Violence was also reported in Thessaloniki, where a further 20, 000 people joined the city's demonstrations.
8_5ecbplus.15: Greece has been paralysed by the strike and was effectively cut - off from the outside world.
8_5ecbplus.16: Flights to and from the country were grounded, while trains and ferries suspended their routes.
8_5ecbplus.17: Hospitals and schools were also hit.
8_5ecbplus.18: The Greek government is attempting to slice 30bn euros ( �25. 7bn ) from its deficit over the next three years.
8_5ecbplus.19: The country has to save money as a condition of a 110bn - euro emergency rescue package from the European Union and the International Monetary Fund.
8_5ecbplus.21: Trade unions say their members are having to pay for an economic crisis that has been created by corrupt politicians
8_5ecbplus.22: The vice president of the civil servants' union, Elias Vrettakos, told Sky News: "The measures of the government overtake our historic gains and abolish our rights and return society back to the 1960s. "
8_5ecbplus.23: Other union leaders have called the cuts "savage attacks on workers' rights".
8_5ecbplus.24: Markets around the world remained sceptical about the bail - out, as concerns grew about the economic crisis in the eurozone and fears it will spead.

35_1ecbplus.0: Chargers' Jamal Williams arrested on DUI suspicion
35_1ecbplus.2: Chargers defensive tackle Jamal Williams was arrested on suspicion of drunken driving, the team's second such arrest in less than a month.
35_1ecbplus.3: Williams was pulled over for speeding early Sunday on a freeway outside downtown, the California Highway Patrol said.
35_1ecbplus.4: Williams gave a blood sample for a blood - alcohol test, but the results won't be known for a few weeks.
35_1ecbplus.5: Williams was booked into county jail and later released on bail.
35_1ecbplus.6: The City Attorney's office said the case hadn't been submitted as of Tuesday.
35_1ecbplus.7: "It's disappointing to hear about the issue involving Jamal Williams, " general manager A. J. Smith said in a statement released by the team.
35_1ecbplus.8: "We'll continue to monitor the situation and let the legal process run its course.
35_1ecbplus.9: "The Chargers have always been leaders and positive contributors to our community, " Smith added.
35_1ecbplus.10: "We take our stature in the community very seriously.
35_1ecbplus.11: Through the Chargers and the NFL, our players receive one of the most comprehensive education and support programs in sports to help them deal with issues that affect all segments of society. "
35_1ecbplus.12: Smith didn't return a call seeking further comment.
35_1ecbplus.13: Chargers receiver Vincent Jackson was arrested for investigation of DUI on Jan. 6, five days before San Diego's playoff loss at Pittsburgh.
35_1ecbplus.14: Jackson is due in court Feb. 17.
35_1ecbplus.15: He was on probation for a previous DUI arrest, the CHP said.
35_1ecbplus.16: Williams, an 11 - year veteran, shared the team's Most Valuable Player Award with quarterback Philip Rivers this season.
35_1ecbplus.17: The Chargers reached the playoffs with an 8 - 8 record.
35_1ecbplus.18: Coincidentally, the Chargers were the first NFL team to implement Safe Ride Solutions, a program in which pro athletes who've had too much to drink can call a toll - free number and request a ride from an off - duty police officer.
35_1ecbplus.19: For implementing the program, the Chargers were awarded the NFL's Winston - Shell Award for demonstrating commitment and dedication to developing unique and innovative ideas and solutions.
35_1ecbplus.20: Smith often speaks of signing "character" players, yet the Chargers have had their share of off - field problems in recent seasons.
35_1ecbplus.21: In 2006, there were seven run - ins with the law by Chargers players, including linebacker Steve Foley's shooting by an off - duty Coronado police officer who suspected him of drunken driving, and two other players who were arrested for investigation of DUI.
35_1ecbplus.22: Besides the arrests, linebacker Shawne Merriman was suspended four games for testing positive for steroids in 2006, and linebacker Stephen Cooper was suspended by the NFL for the first four games of the 2008 season after testing positive for a banned stimulant.

6_6ecbplus.0: Gary Ross 'Catching Fire' Negotiations Reportedly Continue
6_6ecbplus.2: Gary Ross has not departed "The Hunger Games. "
6_6ecbplus.3: According to THR, Ross will resume negotiating with Lionsgate about returning for the "Games" sequel "Catching Fire" at some point on Monday.
6_6ecbplus.4: It has been quite a three days for Ross.

6_6ecbplus.7: Ross was reportedly paid $3 million to write and direct "The Hunger Games. "
6_6ecbplus.8: He'll also earn five percent of the backend grosses, a significant number since "Games" has already accumulated $459 million around the globe.

18_4ecbplus.0: Breaking News - Three People Shot in Office Shooting in Suburban Detroit
18_4ecbplus.2: There is breaking news out of Troy, Michigan, a suburb of Detroit.
18_4ecbplus.3: "A gunman shot three people at a suburban Detroit office building Monday morning, and officers were searching for the shooter, police said.
18_4ecbplus.4: The victims' conditions weren't immediately known, said Troy police Lt. Gerry Scherlinck.
18_4ecbplus.5: A spokeswoman for Beaumont Hospital in Royal Oak said the three victims were taken to the hospital but could not provide more details.
18_4ecbplus.6: Witnesses told Detroit broadcast stations that the shooter was a former employee of an accounting firm inside the building. " ( Yahoo! News article )
18_4ecbplus.7: At this time, there is no information on the whereabouts of the shooter.
18_4ecbplus.8: However, there is additional information detailing the scene of the crime.
18_4ecbplus.9: "The 170, 000 - square - foot building houses a number of businesses, including law offices, a State Farm insurance office and C&G Accounting, where the shooting was believed to have occurred.
18_4ecbplus.10: Police at first told workers to stay in their offices but a short time later evacuated the building.
18_4ecbplus.11: Police in bulletproof vests and with guns could be seen going into the building, and people from inside could later be seen walking quickly out through a parking lot.
18_4ecbplus.12: The office building is about 15 miles north of Detroit. ( CNN News Article )
18_4ecbplus.13: While both Yahoo! News and CNN News aren't reporting additional information regarding the suspect and the situation, Fox News is.
18_4ecbplus.14: "Troy Police Lt. Gerry Scherlinck told FOX News that it's unknown if the shooter is still in the building or if he escaped but the car police believe he arrived at the building in no longer is in the parking lot.
18_4ecbplus.15: 'We're actively looking for him and the vehicle, ' he said shortly before noon EDT.
18_4ecbplus.16: 'There's an active search for this suspect. '
18_4ecbplus.17: The suspect's name is Anthony Calamita and he was described by police as a 5 foot, 8 inch 38 - year - old male weighing 180 pounds, with short black hair parted on the side, wearing a dark brown or blue sweater and navy pants.
18_4ecbplus.18: Witnesses told Local FOX affiliate WJBK in Detroit there were sounds of gunfire around 10: 30 a. m.
18_4ecbplus.19: Employees of the building told WJBK that the shooter was a former disgruntled employee who brought a rifle into the building.
18_4ecbplus.20: His picture was passed out to officers on the scene.
18_4ecbplus.21: The suspect's car was described as a silver 2007 Ford Fusion with the license plate BEY 0843. " ( Fox News article )
18_4ecbplus.22: Additional information will follow as more details of the incident become known.
18_4ecbplus.23: It is unclear as to the nature of the dispute.

19_3ecbplus.0: Enraged protesters battle cops in Brooklyn streets during third night of rioting after it's revealed that 16 - year - old Kimani Gray was shot in the back
19_3ecbplus.1: As fights between cops and angry teens erupted in East Flatbush, 46 were arrested Wednesday night.
19_3ecbplus.2: Police struggled to control a furious crowd that broke away from a planned peaceful vigil.
19_3ecbplus.5: Protesters enraged over the fatal shooting of a teenager by police poured into Brooklyn streets for a third straight night Wednesday, pitching bricks, bottles and garbage in furious clashes with cops.
19_3ecbplus.6: At least 46 demonstrators were arrested along Church Ave. in East Flatbush.
19_3ecbplus.7: Police struggled to control a hostile crowd that broke away from a planned peaceful vigil for Kimani ( Kiki ) Gray, 16, killed by police on Saturday night.
19_3ecbplus.8: Gray ’ s sister Mahnefeh was among those arrested.
19_3ecbplus.9: A police officer suffered a gash in the face when a tossed brick hit him, NYPD spokesman Paul Browne said, and a window was smashed in an inspector ’ s car.
19_3ecbplus.10: “ They didn ’ t have to kill him, ” Makaeo Williams, 18, said as police on motorcycles tracked alongside him.
19_3ecbplus.13: That ’ s why I ’ m out here. ”
19_3ecbplus.14: Many in the community contest police allegations that Gray pointed a gun at cops when he was shot during a confrontation with two plainclothes officers on E. 52nd St. Saturday night.
19_3ecbplus.15: Those suspicions on the street intensified Wednesday when an autopsy report revealed Gray was hit by seven bullets — three to the back.
19_3ecbplus.16: It was not clear in what order the shots struck the teen or whether he had his back to the police when they opened fire.
19_3ecbplus.17: A witness told the Daily News Tuesday that the youth did not have a gun in his hand.
19_3ecbplus.18: But a police spokesman said the witness told detectives she couldn ’ t see the incident clearly “ from the angle I was at. ”
19_3ecbplus.19: A woman who identified herself as Gray ’ s cousin told news outlets Wednesday that the teen was carrying a gun for a friend and was trying to alert cops that he had a weapon when he was shot.
19_3ecbplus.20: A loaded. 38 - caliber revolver was recovered at the scene.
19_3ecbplus.21: The trouble Wednesday night began soon after more than 200 people set off from the vigil site at Church Ave. and E. 55th St. around 8: 30 p. m.
19_3ecbplus.22: Dozens chanted “ NYPD, KKK, how many kids did you kill today ” as they marched west on Church Ave. toward the 67th Precinct stationhouse.
19_3ecbplus.23: But things quickly got out of hand as some protesters tried to climb on police motorcycles.
19_3ecbplus.24: Men and women were pepper - sprayed and thrown to the ground and handcuffed.
19_3ecbplus.25: “ I ’ m scared for everything, myself, my store, my workers, ” said Salm Sami, 45, who owns the Deli, Grill & Grocery at Church and New York Aves.
19_3ecbplus.26: “ This is three days of this. ”
19_3ecbplus.27: The protesters eventually backtracked to the vigil site where the parents of Ramarley Graham — an unarmed teenager fatally shot by police in the Bronx last year — were waiting.
19_3ecbplus.28: “ It never seems to end, ” said Frank Graham, Ramarley ’ s father.
19_3ecbplus.29: “ The community has a right to be angry. ”
19_3ecbplus.30: But City Councilman Jumaane Williams, a frequent NYPD critic, blasted outsiders who he said escalated tensions.
19_3ecbplus.31: “ Please stay the HELL out of our community will only agitate our kids, ” Williams fumed on Twitter.

30_2ecbplus.1: Undersea internet cables severed near Egyptian coast line
30_2ecbplus.2: Have you experienced any internet connection or mobile phone problems yesterday! ?
30_2ecbplus.3: It seems that another incident of an undersea telecommunications cable being severed on Tuesday has resulted in partially blocking internet and mobile services in Alexandria and some other governorates.
30_2ecbplus.4: In a statement to Al - Masry Al - Youm news paper, Mahmoud Al - Goweiny, a member of the National Telecommunications Regulatory Authority's board of directors said that the cable cut happened around the same time that a different cable, owned by Telecom Egypt, was also cut, affecting services in Egypt.
30_2ecbplus.5: He also iterated that this particular undersea cable has frequently malfunctioned since late 2007.
30_2ecbplus.6: This cable is most likely to be the SEA - ME - WE 4 that passes through Egypt coming from Europe and then reaches Asia.
30_2ecbplus.7: Despite the after effects of this cable cut seems to be limited, however these incidents have been occurring more than once in a relatively short period of time.
30_2ecbplus.8: Severing a main internet pipe - line could leave a country's communication and economy crippled for at least 72 to 120 hours causing a lot of problems!
30_2ecbplus.9: It should be time to re - think protecting these valuable communication life lines!
30_2ecbplus.10: Etisalat Egypt and LinkdotNet are one of Egypt's largest internet service providers, and among the most affected by the cable cut.
30_2ecbplus.11: No further details were reported by Authorities about the effects of the cable cuts.

30_3ecbplus.0: Cable cuts partially block internet, mobile services in some areas
30_3ecbplus.2: An undersea telecommunications cable cut on Tuesday partially blocked internet and mobile services in Alexandria and some other governorates.
30_3ecbplus.3: The cable cut happened around the same time that a different cable, owned by Telecom Egypt, was cut that also affected services, Egyptian authorities said.
30_3ecbplus.4: Mahmoud al - Goweiny, a member of the National Telecommunications Regulatory Authority's board of directors, told Al - Masry Al - Youm that this particular undersea cable has frequently malfunctioned since late 2007.
30_3ecbplus.5: Ahmed Osama, deputy executive director of Telecom Egypt, said the cable passes through Egypt from Europe and reaches Asia.
30_3ecbplus.6: Osama said the cut's effect in Egypt was limited, and there haven't been clear reports about a cause.
30_3ecbplus.7: "Some internet users suffered problems with internet and mobile services, Osama noted.
30_3ecbplus.8: Osama attributed these problems to the Telecom Egypt cable cut, which affected Etisalat Egypt and LINKdotNET, two of Egypt's largest internet services providers.
30_3ecbplus.9: No further details were reported about the effects of the cuts.

23_1ecbplus.0: Climber dead after Aoraki Mount Cook fall
23_1ecbplus.2: A 36 - year - old Australian climber is dead after falling about 150 metres at Aoraki Mount Cook.
23_1ecbplus.3: The man, from Hampton East, fell in the Tasman Glacier area.
23_1ecbplus.4: A Westpac Rescue Helicopter from Christchurch was called about 3pm to assist with search and rescue co - ordination at the Mt Cook base.

30_8ecbplus.0: SEACOM problems only resolved next week
30_8ecbplus.1: Initial estimates indicate that the total SEACOM repair time will be around twelve days
30_8ecbplus.3: SEACOM said today ( 10 October 2011 ) that the total repair time of the current problems they experience will be around twelve days depending on weather conditions.
30_8ecbplus.4: SEACOM started to experience problems on Saturday 8 October 2011, caused by a problem on a cable between Abu Talat ( Egypt ) and Marseilles ( France ).
30_8ecbplus.5: "Initial estimates indicate that the total repair time will be around twelve days depending on weather conditions.
30_8ecbplus.6: This entails gaining the necessary permits and the actual repair time.
30_8ecbplus.7: A repair vessel has been notified of the call - out and mobilization will occur immediately once permits are received, " SEACOM said in an official statement.
30_8ecbplus.8: "The outage initially affected all SEACOM traffic to Europe, however SEACOM was able to restore some services by Saturday afternoon. "
30_8ecbplus.9: "Further restoration has continued throughout the weekend in cooperation with customers and partners and SEACOM will continue to actively work on securing additional capacity for all necessary services over the next day or two. "

38_6ecbplus.2: The Napa Valley was shaken at 2: 09 a. m. Thursday by a magnitude 4. 6 earthquake located near Clearlake in Lake County, the U. S. Geological Survey reported.
38_6ecbplus.3: The temblor rattled homes in Napa, but would not have been expected to do any local damage.
38_6ecbplus.4: The USGS rates 4. 6 magnitude as a "light" quake.
38_6ecbplus.5: Two aftershocks, magnitude 2. 9 and 2. 2, occurred immediately following.

45_1ecbplus.1: LeFlore Jury: Simpson Guilty Of Killing Pregnant Girlfriend
45_1ecbplus.2: A Spiro man was found guilty of two counts of first - degree murder Thursday evening in the 2012 shooting death of a Fort Smith woman and the subsequent death of her 8 - to 12 - week - old fetus.
45_1ecbplus.3: A nine - woman, three - man LeFlore County jury deliberated almost seven hours before finding Christopher Kenyon Simpson, 27, guilty of two counts of first - degree murder.
45_1ecbplus.4: Jurors recommended the maximum sentence, life without the possibility of parole and a $10, 000 fine on both counts.
45_1ecbplus.5: Formal sentencing is set for 11 a. m. Nov. 8 before LeFlore County District Judge Jon Sullivan.
45_1ecbplus.6: Flynn's father Herbert Flynn of Fort Coffee said later, "I'm glad it's over.
45_1ecbplus.7: I'm glad we got the verdict we got.
45_1ecbplus.9: After the courtroom emptied, Crawford County Deputy Prosecuting Attorney Jacob Howell and District 27 Assistant District Attorney Anthony Evans credited the verdict in the complicated and mostly circumstantial case to smart, attentive jurors.
45_1ecbplus.10: In closing arguments on the sixth day of Simpson's trial, Howell projected onto a video screen a photo of 20 - year - old victim Ka'Loni Flynn's body sitting in the driver's seat of her car, bullet wounds to her forehead and temples.
45_1ecbplus.11: Some audience members gasped audibly in the crowded, otherwise quiet courtroom gallery.
45_1ecbplus.12: "We know that's how we got here, " Howell said, indicating the photo.
45_1ecbplus.13: "I hope we showed you this was investigated thoroughly, and that every possible suspect was investigated and excluded except one, " Howell said.
45_1ecbplus.14: The prosecution contends Simpson planned the murders, then shot Flynn execution - style twice in the head on Easter Sunday, April 8, 2012, killing her and her fetus because he did not want another child to support, and Flynn refused an abortion.
45_1ecbplus.15: A DNA expert testified earlier that Simpson fathered the fetus.
45_1ecbplus.16: Howell contended Simpson's planning began in early April 2012 when he asked Mackenzi Clayton, a relative, about tracking a pay - as - you - go phone.
45_1ecbplus.17: Throughout the investigation and court proceedings, Simpson repeatedly denied having bought such a phone despite a Walmart video showing him doing so, then on Wednesday he testified he bought it, but for Clayton, not for himself, Howell said.
45_1ecbplus.18: Howell reminded the jury that Flynn's roommate testified Flynn left their apartment around 10: 30 p. m. April 8, a time matching the 10: 30 p. m. call Simpson's cousin's wife testified she saw him engaged in at her garage.
45_1ecbplus.19: Howell reminded jurors that Verizon Wireless, Cricket Wireless and Federal Bureau of Investigation cellular analysis experts testified about how the calls between the phone Simpson purchased and Flynn's phone pinged in cell towers covering the U. S. 271 corridor where Simpson planned to spend the night with his cousins in Fort Smith and the rural McGinnis Lane area between Pocola and Spiro where Flynn's body was found.
45_1ecbplus.20: Between 10: 37 and 10: 58 p. m. April 8, the pay - as - you - go phone called Flynn's phone six times.
45_1ecbplus.21: Arkansas State Trooper Mary Minor testified she pulled Flynn over at 10: 46 p. m. for speeding on Interstate 540.
45_1ecbplus.22: Flynn was heading toward Oklahoma, Minor stated.
45_1ecbplus.23: Howell said at 11: 01 p. m. Flynn's phone called the pay - as - you - go phone, and two employees of the Sac - N - Pac near McGinnis Lane testified they heard two to three gunshots around 11 p. m.
45_1ecbplus.24: Howell contended Simpson's whereabouts were not accounted for between 10: 30 p. m. and 11: 21 p. m. , when he made a purchase at an E - Z Mart near his cousins' home.
45_1ecbplus.25: And Howell reminded jurors that Simpson's cousins testified they became concerned about Simpson's prolonged absence for the quick trip to the E - Z Mart and called him three times beginning at 11 p. m.
45_1ecbplus.26: Those calls rolled to voice mail.
45_1ecbplus.27: In his closing statement, defense attorney Warren Gotcher of McAlester argued that the two Sac - N - Pac clerks stayed outside on their smoke break for 10 minutes after hearing the gunshots and never saw a car exit McGinnis Lane.
45_1ecbplus.28: Gotcher argued the timeline evidence showed Simpson couldn't have been involved.
45_1ecbplus.29: He said area resident Erica Hawkins saw Flynn's car in the roadway at 11: 41 p. m. , and pulled around to shine her bright headlights on it.
45_1ecbplus.30: He reminded jurors that Hawkins testified the driver's window was rolled down and she saw a red light inside the car, but she didn't see anyone in the car.
45_1ecbplus.31: Gotcher suggested the light could have been from a phone charger found unattached on the seat next to Flynn.
45_1ecbplus.32: Gotcher said when deputy Terry Springwater arrived on the scene around 3 a. m. April 9, the car window was rolled only three - fourths the way down, the parking lights were on, the trunk was unlatched and there was a body in the car.
45_1ecbplus.33: Gotcher reminded jurors an Oklahoma State Bureau of Investigation expert testified that Flynn's body had not been moved after she was shot.
45_1ecbplus.34: "Sometime between 11: 41 p. m. and 3 a. m. , the window was rolled three - fourths the way down, parking lights turned on and trunk unlatched and maybe the phone charger disconnected, " Gotcher contended.
45_1ecbplus.35: He contended, too, that Clayton testified as the prosecution wished because he was afraid his parole would be revoked, and that Simpson's cousins, likewise, testified as they had because they'd been threatened with a firearms charge and having their child taken away.
45_1ecbplus.36: Evans contended Simpson attempted character assassination of Flynn and attempted to divert blame for her murder to others because "the defendant has the spotlight on him, and it's hot, and he needs to get it off him.
45_1ecbplus.40: Evans contended Simpson destroyed or manipulated evidence throughout the investigation.
45_1ecbplus.41: "I submit to you that beyond a reasonable doubt, the defendant is guilty of killing Ka'Loni Flynn, and when he shot her, he also killed his own child, " Evans said.

8_1ecbplus.0: Three killed as rioters bomb Greek bank
8_1ecbplus.2: A firebomb attack on a bank in Greece killed at least three people today as police fought pitched battles with striking protesters furious at brutal budget cuts designed to avoid national bankruptcy.
8_1ecbplus.3: Hooded youths hurled petrol bombs at stores and businesses in the centre of the capital, Athens, and demonstrators tried to storm parliament during the general strike, as the rioting spread to the northern city of Thessaloniki.
8_1ecbplus.4: Police said two women and one man died at a branch of the Marfin bank which caught fire after hooded youths broke a window and hurled petrol bombs inside.
8_1ecbplus.5: Around 20 more people had to be ushered to safety.
8_1ecbplus.6: At least two other buildings, one used by tax officials, caught fire in other firebomb attacks on the margins of the protests.
8_1ecbplus.7: Athens underground stations were shut and the international airport deserted as tens of thousands of union members rallied on the eve of a vote in parliament on the planned cuts and tax rises.
8_1ecbplus.8: The general strike was the first major test of the Socialist government's resolve to push through unprecedented measures since agreeing an? 110 billion ( Dh472. 72bn ) debt bailout from the EU and the International Monetary Fund at the weekend.
8_1ecbplus.9: Prime minister George Papandreou's insistence that the measures are vital for the nation's survival failed to dissuade unions from paralysing public transport and preventing ferries from leaving docks.
8_1ecbplus.10: After rallying in two separate demonstrations in central Athens, members of the main unions began converging on parliament, where the government was preparing for the measures to be voted on Thursday.
8_1ecbplus.11: "They're taking everything from me, I don't know how I'm going to get by, " said 61 - year - old Anargyros Bizianis, a municipal worker in the Athens suburb of Piraeus who earns? 900 ( Dh4, 275 ) a month.
8_1ecbplus.12: As the protesters tried to break through a police line in front of parliament, they first hurled stones and bottles of water, prompting the riot squad officers to fire back with tear gas.
8_1ecbplus.13: Full - scale clashes soon then erupted outside the building, with riot police trying to disperse the crowds with baton - charges.
8_1ecbplus.14: During the unrest, one protester threw a petrol bomb.
8_1ecbplus.15: Youths also went on the rampage in other parts of the capital, with several dozen youths hurling petrol bombs at stores and banks, and smashing shop windows and bus shelters with iron bars.
8_1ecbplus.16: Athens police chiefs mobilised all their forces, including those not on active duty, by declaring a general state of alert.
8_1ecbplus.17: The protesters in Thessaloniki targeted stores and banks in the city centre before they were dispersed by anti - riot police.
8_1ecbplus.18: A group of about 200 communists had stormed the Athens Acropolis yesterday, unfurling banners reading "Peoples of Europe, Rise Up. "
8_1ecbplus.19: The head of the million - member strong GSEE private sector union, Giannis Panagopoulos, said: "The Greek people have been called to make sacrifices while the rich pay nothing. "
8_1ecbplus.20: A government official downplayed the unrest saying that "for years there's been strikes and protests in this country without much consequence. "
8_1ecbplus.21: But markets reacted to the violence with alarm as Greek stocks plunged 5. 4 per cent.
8_1ecbplus.22: The government, pushed to the brink of default, agreed at the weekend to slash spending and jack up taxes in return for? 110bn in loans over three years from eurozone countries and the International Monetary Fund.
8_1ecbplus.23: Among the major measures, the government is to cut 13th and 14th month bonus pay for civil servants and retirees; require three years more for pension contributions; and raise the retirement age for women to 65, the same level as men.
8_1ecbplus.24: After months of hesitation, eurozone countries and the IMF agreed to lend Greece billions of euros at below market rates after concerns that the Athens government's debt crisis could trigger a knock - on effect elsewhere.
8_1ecbplus.25: The German Chancellor, Angela Merkel, fighting accusations of holding up the bailout, said today that the Greek crisis underlined the need for an overhaul of the EU's fiscal rules.
8_1ecbplus.26: "The future of Europe and the future of Germany within Europe is at stake, " she told a debate on Berlin's decision to lend? 22. 4bn to Greece.

9_4ecbplus.1: Interior, Commerce Departments Overturn Rule That Cut Science Out of Endangered Species Act
9_4ecbplus.3: Today, Interior Secretary Ken Salazar rescinded eleventh - hour Bush administration changes to Endangered Species Act regulations that allowed federal agencies to decide for themselves if their own projects—such as roads and dams—would threaten imperiled species.
9_4ecbplus.4: Federal agencies again will be required to consult with expert biologists at the U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service or National Marine Fisheries Service before undertaking or permitting new projects.
9_4ecbplus.5: The rule change was just one of several controversial Bush administration actions that undermined the scientific foundation of the Endangered Species Act, according to the Union of Concerned Scientists ( UCS ).
9_4ecbplus.6: In a related story, 1, 300 biologists and three scientific societies representing some 20, 000 scientists sent separate letters last Friday to the Interior and Commerce departments urging them to overturn the last - minute Bush rule changes.
9_4ecbplus.7: Below is a statement by Francesca Grifo, director of UCS's Scientific Integrity Program:
9_4ecbplus.8: "Several last - minute Bush administration regulatory changes have undermined the scientific foundation of the Endangered Species Act, and today the Obama administration has begun to repair the damage.
9_4ecbplus.9: The message from tens of thousands of scientists around the country is clear: These unwarranted changes fundamentally undermine our ability to protect imperiled plants and animals.
9_4ecbplus.10: "Today, the Obama administration restored critical checks and balances to protect our nation's biodiversity.
9_4ecbplus.11: Interior Secretary Salazar's decision is a long - awaited first step.
9_4ecbplus.12: But there is much more to be done.
9_4ecbplus.13: The Obama administration must thoroughly review how science is used to ensure that our nation's imperiled species have a chance to survive—and thrive. "

30_12ecbplus.1: South Africa: P2P Control Helps Overcome Undersea Cable Outage
30_12ecbplus.2: "The SEACOM undersea cable, which provides a data link between South Africa, Europe and India, experienced downtime beginning on Saturday 8 October 2011, caused by a problem on a cable between Abu Talat ( Egypt ) and Marseilles ( France ). .
30_12ecbplus.3: Meanwhile, local Internet Service Providers ( ISPs ) who use bandwidth on the SEACOM cable have been scrambling to implement contingency plans to keep their customers connected".
30_12ecbplus.4: According to an MWEB update - "Some more bandwidth was brought online last night [ 10 October 2011 ] bringing us up to 83% of our required capacity.
30_12ecbplus.5: We allowed P2P traffic to run from midnight to 7am, after which it had to give way for critical traffic again. "
30_12ecbplus.6: As MWEB also uses PeerApp's caching solution, it may help serve some P2P traffic without accessing the undersea cable.

34_7ecbplus.0: Robert Wood Johnson Foundation Trustee, Regina Benjamin, M. D. , M. B. A. , Nominated for Surgeon General of the United States
34_7ecbplus.1: Nominee praised for her expertise, credentials, judgment and passionate commitment to health care equity and social justice.
34_7ecbplus.3: The Robert Wood Johnson Foundation congratulates former trustee, Regina Benjamin, M. D. , M. B. A. , on being nominated for Surgeon General of the United States.
34_7ecbplus.4: Benjamin brings to the position tremendous expertise, leading academic credentials, impeccable judgment, and a passionate commitment to health care equity and social justice.
34_7ecbplus.5: While the Foundation is sorry to be losing Benjamin as a trustee, we are grateful that she is continuing to dedicate her knowledge and commitment to helping Americans lead healthier lives and get the care they need.

21_1ecbplus.0: Woman Killed In Queens Hit - And - Run, Driver Charged
21_1ecbplus.2: A woman has died after being hit by a car that fled the scene in Queens, and now, the driver is facing manslaughter charges.
21_1ecbplus.3: Witnesses say 59 - year - old Raj Chohan was leaving her car on 117th Street in South Richmond Hill Friday when she was hit by a silver Toyota Camry and sent flying into the air.
21_1ecbplus.5: Police caught up with the driver, who is from Schnectady, a few blocks away.
21_1ecbplus.6: He has been charged with vehicular manslaughter, negligent homicide and fleeing the scene of an accident.
