43_9ecbplus.1: AMD Completes SeaMicro Acquisition Headed to $9
43_9ecbplus.2: AMD has completed its acquisition of SeaMicro as part of its strategy to regain lost server market share from Intel and better position itself against future competition from ARM - based players such as Nvidia.
43_9ecbplus.3: We previously wrote on how AMD can benefit from this acquisition ( see AMD Picks up SeaMicro to Strengthen Server Market Offering ).
43_9ecbplus.4: Here we take a brief look at the price that AMD paid for SeaMicro, and what this implies about its growth expectations.
43_9ecbplus.5: AMD shelled out $334 million for the acquisition of SeaMicro.
43_9ecbplus.6: Since SeaMicro ’ s revenues or other financials were not disclosed, it becomes difficult to gauge whether the price paid was cheap or steep.
43_9ecbplus.7: However, based on certain assumptions, it is possible to understand the range of AMD ’ s growth expectations from SeaMicro.
43_9ecbplus.8: For the purpose of calculations, we assume that SeaMicro operates at EBITDA margin of close to 25% and apply similar corporate expenses ( as % of revenues ) including taxes, capital expenditures and others that we apply for AMD.
43_9ecbplus.9: If we assume SeaMicro ’ s revenues for 2012 will be somewhere around $50 million, it implies that AMD expects SeaMicro ’ s revenues to grow at an average annual rate of 43% to 44% over the course of our forecast period, which extends till 2018.
43_9ecbplus.10: These revenues include both SeaMicro ’ s revenues as well as incremental benefit in server - related revenues from the acquisition.
43_9ecbplus.11: On the other hand, if we assume SeaMicro ’ s revenues for 2012 to be of the order of $150 million, it implies that AMD ’ s growth expectation for SeaMicro and related incremental server revenues stands at somewhere around 16% to 17%.
43_9ecbplus.12: According to AMD ’ s own calculations, it has paid a handsome price for the acquisition.
43_9ecbplus.13: Our price estimate for AMD stands at $9. 21, implying a premium of little under 15% to the market price.

21_13ecbplus.0: Man charged with DWI, leaving scene after S. Rich Hill mother killed in crash: NYPD
21_13ecbplus.1: A 59 - year - old woman was killed in a hit - and - run crash while visiting a former neighbor to welcome his new daughter - in - law to the family Friday evening, and the man allegedly behind the wheel of the car that hit her was charged with driving drunk, police and the woman ’ s friend said.
21_13ecbplus.2: Raj K. Chohan was walking alongside parked cars on 117th Street and 97th Avenue at about 7 p. m. when she was struck by a gray 2013 Toyota Camry, which then sped off, according to cops.
21_13ecbplus.3: “ The husband and wife came to visit, ” said South Richmond Hill resident Suri Charanjit.
21_13ecbplus.4: “ He was with her when it happened. ”
21_13ecbplus.5: Charanjit said he and his family came out of their home on 117th Street and saw a crowd of people gathered and EMS performing CPR on Chohan.
21_13ecbplus.6: Emergency responders were called in and took Chohan to Jamaica Hospital, where she was later pronounced dead, the NYPD said.
21_13ecbplus.7: Residents along 117th Street said a police cruiser happened to be pulled over on the side of the road near where the crash occurred, and immediately chased the vehicle.
21_13ecbplus.8: Police said the officers caught up with 23 - year - old Vishwanand Subryan of Schenectady a few blocks away - at 115th Street and 101st Avenue - where he was taken into custody without incident.
21_13ecbplus.9: Subryan was charged with vehicular manslaughter, criminally negligent homicide, leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death and DWI, the NYPD said.
21_13ecbplus.10: Chohan, who is a mother to a married son and daughter, had been in her former neighborhood to visit Piara Singh, according to Charanjit who translated for Singh.
21_13ecbplus.11: She had moved about a mile and a half away five or six years ago, her friend said.
21_13ecbplus.12: As part of a Sikh tradition, she had been visiting to greet Singh ’ s daughter - in - law, who recently arrived from India, and present her with gifts, he explained.
21_13ecbplus.13: Chohan had called Singh ’ s house to let the family know she was outside and asked that someone open the door.
21_13ecbplus.14: “ When [ Singh ’ s ] son came out, he saw her on the floor, ” Charanjit said.
21_13ecbplus.15: Both Charanjit and Singh complained cars speeding along 117th Street.
21_13ecbplus.16: “ The cars come straight from 103rd Avenue.
21_13ecbplus.17: They have no stop sign, no bump, nothing but green until 95th Avenue, ” Charanjit said.
21_13ecbplus.18: “ This is just a side street.
21_13ecbplus.19: We want to have a stop sign. ”

23_10ecbplus.0: British climber dies in New Zealand fall
23_10ecbplus.1: Robert Buckley the second climber to die in the Aoraki - Mount Cook national park at the weekend
23_10ecbplus.3: A British climber has fallen to his death in New Zealand.
23_10ecbplus.4: Robert Buckley, 32, fell about 2, 000 feet while climbing to a small hut on Mount Sefton in the Aoraki - Mount Cook national park on Saturday, police said.
23_10ecbplus.5: Buckley, who had been living and working in Christchurch, was one of four men who were trying to climb to the Sefton Bivvy from Mount Cook Village, according to New Zealand media reports.
23_10ecbplus.6: They were within 80m of their destination when Buckley slipped.
23_10ecbplus.7: His companions raised the alarm, but then got stuck.
23_10ecbplus.8: A rescue helicopter found Buckley and the others but they could not be rescued until the next morning.
23_10ecbplus.9: Buckley's body was recovered later in the day.
23_10ecbplus.10: Police said in a statement it appeared the group was insufficiently equipped and experienced for the climb.
23_10ecbplus.11: The three other climbers were released after an examination by medical staff.
23_10ecbplus.12: The day before Buckley's death another climber, 36 - year - old Duncan Rait, died after slipping and falling about 200 feet from a ridge in the same national park.
23_10ecbplus.13: The New Zealand - born man, who lived in Australia, had been been dropped off by helicopter and was walking to a hut when he fell in the Tasman Glacier area.
23_10ecbplus.14: Police spokesman Dave Gaskin said the deaths were a reminder that climbers needed to use extreme caution.
23_10ecbplus.15: 'I cant speak for the first death, but in this case it looks like to be a lack of experience, " Gaskin told the Timaru Herald.
23_10ecbplus.16: A Foreign Office spokeswoman said: "We are aware of the death of a British man in New Zealand.
23_10ecbplus.17: We are providing consular assistance at this time.

41_11ecbplus.0: Plane bombs South Sudan refugee camp - witness
41_11ecbplus.2: A refugee camp was the target of an air strike in South Sudan's Unity state on Thursday, less than 50 km ( 30 miles ) from the tense border with Sudan, a Reuters witness said.
41_11ecbplus.3: There appeared to be no casualties.
41_11ecbplus.4: The Reuters correspondent heard a large explosion, then saw a crater about two metres ( 6. 6 feet ) wide, an unexploded bomb wedged in the side of a school building and a white aircraft flying north from the Yida refugee camp.
41_11ecbplus.5: Witnesses at the camp said there were three other explosions at 3 p. m. ( 1200 GMT ).

37_3ecbplus.0: Indonesia earthquake: 24 dead and over 200 injured as 6. 1 magnitude quake hits Aceh province
37_3ecbplus.2: Soldiers and police are leading rescue operations in Indonesia after a 6. 1 magnitude earthquake hit Aceh province leaving 24 dead and over 200 injured.
37_3ecbplus.3: The quake struck yesterday afternoon at a depth of just six miles and was centred on the far western tip of Sumatra island in Aceh province.
37_3ecbplus.4: Twelve people were killed and 70 others were injured by a landslide or collapsing buildings in Bener Meriah district, said Sutopo Purwo Nugroho of the National Disaster Mitigation Agency.
37_3ecbplus.5: In neighbouring Central Aceh district, 10 people were killed, 140 were injured and about 1, 500 houses and buildings were damaged, Nugroho said.
37_3ecbplus.6: The quake also triggered landslides and caused hundreds of people to be evacuated to 10 temporary shelters.
37_3ecbplus.7: Another two people are also reported to have been killed, although it has not been stated where.
37_3ecbplus.8: Nugroho told Agence - France Presse: "We have recorded 24 people dead and 249 people injured", adding that more than 300 buildings have been damaged in the quake.
37_3ecbplus.9: Rescuers and other assistance teams have arrived in Bener Meriah, while the air force have dispatched a helicopter and a CN - 235 aircraft to the region, Nugroho said.
37_3ecbplus.10: "We are now concentrating on searching for people who may be trapped under the rubble, " said Rusli M. Saleh, the deputy district chief of Bener Meriah.
37_3ecbplus.11: He said at least 25 of the injured in his district were hospitalised in intensive care.
37_3ecbplus.12: As the quake hit, villagers in the area ran out of their homes in panic and screamed for help.
37_3ecbplus.13: "I see many houses were damaged and their roofs fell onto some people, " Bensu Elianita, a 22 - year - old resident of Bukit Sama village in Central Aceh district, said shortly after the quake hit.
37_3ecbplus.14: "Many people were injured, but it is difficult to evacuate them due to traffic jams. "
37_3ecbplus.15: The quake also caused concern among officials attending a meeting of the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation forum in Medan, the capital of neighboring North Sumatra province.
37_3ecbplus.16: They were escorted from the second - floor meeting room by security officers.
37_3ecbplus.17: Indonesia is prone to seismic upheaval due to its location on the Pacific Ring of Fire, an arc of volcanoes and fault lines encircling the Pacific Ocean.
37_3ecbplus.18: In 2004, a magnitude - 9. 1 earthquake off Aceh triggered a tsunami that killed 230, 000 people in 14 countries.

27_4ecbplus.0: Microsoft Rushes Emergency Fix To Address Internet Explorer Attacks
27_4ecbplus.2: Microsoft has rushed out a temporary fix to address ongoing attacks targeting an Internet Explorer zero - day vulnerability.
27_4ecbplus.3: The software giant said the Fix - It temporary workaround should be effective in preventing a successful attack.
27_4ecbplus.4: The company said the vulnerability impacts all currently supported versions of the browser, but attacks have been limited to users of Internet Explorer 8 and Internet Explorer 9.
27_4ecbplus.5: "On completion of this investigation, Microsoft will take the appropriate action to protect our customers, which may include providing a solution through our monthly security update release process, or an out - of - cycle security update, depending on customer needs, " the company said in a security advisory issued Tuesday.
27_4ecbplus.6: "In addition, we are actively working with partners to monitor the threat landscape and take action against malicious sites that attempt to exploit this vulnerability. "
27_4ecbplus.7: The fact that Microsoft is rushing out a patch so quickly indicates the threat is serious, said Paul Henry, security and forensic analyst at Lumension.
27_4ecbplus.8: Cybercriminals can set up drive - by attack campaigns or lure victims to a website hosting malware that targets the coding error.
27_4ecbplus.9: "This seems to be perfectly positioned for drive - by malware using compromised websites, " Henry told CRN.
27_4ecbplus.10: "Since these are targeted attacks, someone is restricting use of it; they don't want information about this out in the wild because they want to be able to profit from it or use it in nation - state attacks. "
27_4ecbplus.11: The attack is very targeted and limited to Japan, according to Wolfgang Kandek, chief technology officer of Qualys.
27_4ecbplus.12: "It might not affect you at the moment.
27_4ecbplus.13: But with the publication of the shim, other attackers can now analyze the condition fixed and will be able to produce an equivalent exploit fairly quickly, " Kandek wrote in a blog post about the issue.
27_4ecbplus.14: "We suggest applying the Fix - It as soon as possible if you use IE to access the Internet. "
27_4ecbplus.15: The flaw stems from an error in the way the browser accesses an object in memory that has been deleted or has not been properly allocated.
27_4ecbplus.16: The coding error results in memory corruption, giving an attacker the ability to execute code in the context of the current user within Internet Explorer, Microsoft said.
27_4ecbplus.17: As part of its September 2013 Patch Tuesday updates, Microsoft repaired 47 vulnerabilities, including 10 critical flaws in Internet Explorer.

24_8ecbplus.0: Paris Store Hit by $2. 6 Million Jewelry Heist
24_8ecbplus.2: Four men rammed their car into an upmarket jewelry store in central Paris on Monday, smashing the shop window and stealing $2. 6 million ( two million Euros ) in jewelry, according to AFP.
24_8ecbplus.3: The heist near Place Vendome is the latest to hit France after a string of high - profile robberies in Cannes.
24_8ecbplus.4: A police source reported that the men drove a large four - by - four car into the store in the early hours of the morning, grabbing jewelry and luxury watches before setting fire to the vehicle and escaping in another car.

13_9ecbplus.2: Alaska lost part of its history on Tuesday, when a pre - dawn blaze demolished the old Matanuska Maid Dairy warehouse building in Palmer.
13_9ecbplus.3: The Matanuska Maid Dairy building was located on the nine acre site on which stand many structures dating back to Colony days.
13_9ecbplus.4: In the afternoon sun, only charred rubble remained
13_9ecbplus.5: “ And it ’ s, of course, as you can see, a total loss, ” Palmer Public Safety Director Jon Owen said at the site of the fire Tuesday.
13_9ecbplus.6: “ We have a light breeze, as you ’ ve noticed, has picked up.
13_9ecbplus.7: And the breeze has ignited a hot spot over there.
13_9ecbplus.8: We ’ re just making sure that the scene is safe.
13_9ecbplus.9: Our crews are going to be out here all day. ”
13_9ecbplus.10: Palmer firemen were hosing down hotspots on the rubble of the old Mat Maid building late Tuesday, after the early morning fire demolished the antique structure in Palmer ’ s historic district.
13_9ecbplus.11: Owen says the fire call came in at 3: 30 a. m.
13_9ecbplus.12: “ The Palmer fire chief and the Palmer police arrived within a minute or two, ” Owen said.
13_9ecbplus.13: “ The fire chief drove around the perimeter of this nine acre city block and saw fire coming out from under the eaves of this building. ”
13_9ecbplus.14: “ Within a moment or two, the entire roof was engulfed in flame. ”
13_9ecbplus.15: Owen says Palmer and Mat Su Central fire departments responded with ladder trucks, to allow firefighters to attack the blaze from above.
13_9ecbplus.16: He says the firemen also had to protect nearby buildings.
13_9ecbplus.17: “ It ’ s called surround and drown, when you are fighting from the air, ” Owen said.
13_9ecbplus.18: “ And the big thing was we had to protect Crowley Petroleum, from the fire from spreading to the gas and the petroleum products that are stored at Crowley Petroleum, right next store here, because of the danger of an entire conflagration. ”
13_9ecbplus.19: State Fire Marshall John Bond surveyed the scene Tuesday afternoon to help determine the cause of the fire.
13_9ecbplus.20: Not much was left of the building except some charred wooden beams and metal remnants which had plunged into the building ’ s basement.
13_9ecbplus.21: The heat of the blaze was so intense it melted the paint off nearby cars.
13_9ecbplus.22: The old building was in private ownership.
13_9ecbplus.23: Last year, Palmer voters approved a bond measure allowing the city to purchase the historic district containing the Mat Maid building and several other wooden structures.
13_9ecbplus.24: Those plans have not been finalized yet.
13_9ecbplus.25: Owen says it will be about a month before a final determination as to the cause of the fires is known.
13_9ecbplus.26: Director Owen says no injuries have been reported in the blaze.
13_9ecbplus.27: He said there was no power or gas on in the building, nor was lightening a possible cause.

7_11ecbplus.0: Wladimir Klitschko stops Tony Thompson in 6th round to retain world heavyweight belts
7_11ecbplus.2: Wladimir Klitschko stopped Tony Thompson in the sixth round to keep a comfortable hold on his WBA, IBF and WBO heavyweight titles Saturday night.
7_11ecbplus.3: The 36 - year - old champion Klitschko, 58 - 3 with 51 knockouts, floored Thompson with a big right hand near the end of the fifth round at Stade de Suisse, and the 40 - year - old American never recovered.
7_11ecbplus.4: The Ukrainian champion dropped Thompson again in the sixth, and referee Sam Williams gave the challenger a standing count before stopping the fight at 2: 56.
7_11ecbplus.5: "Thompson was not so easy to box.
7_11ecbplus.7: In 2008, Klitschko stopped Thompson in the 11th round.

40_4ecbplus.0: Apple launches new MacBook Pros with Ivy Bridge, from $1, 199
40_4ecbplus.1: Apple's new MacBook Pros come with Ivy Bridge processors and the Nvidia GeForce GT650M graphics card.
40_4ecbplus.3: Apple today launch its new MacBook Pro line.
40_4ecbplus.4: Announced at the company's Worldwide Developers Conference keynote, the new MacBook Pros will boast third - generation Ivy Bridge processors and the Nvidia GeForce GT650M graphics.
40_4ecbplus.5: The line also includes both USB 2. 0 and USB 3. 0 support
40_4ecbplus.6: Unlike Apple's next - generation MacBook Pro, its 13 - and 15 - inch MacBook Pros don't come with the Retina display.
40_4ecbplus.7: Instead, the 13 - inch version boasts 1, 280 x 800 resolution, and comes with the 2. 5GHz dual - core Intel Core i5 processor.
