40_4ecbplus.13: The 15 - inch MacBook Pro starts off at $1, 799.

41_6ecbplus.0: South Sudan Accuses Sudan of Bombing Civilian Camp Amid Fears of War
41_6ecbplus.2: Civilians fled as bombs fell on a camp for displaced people in South Sudan on Thursday, and President Salva Kiir accused the Sudanese government of planning to invade his newly independent nation.
41_6ecbplus.3: Less than six months after South Sudan broke away from Sudan, an act that was the culmination of a peace accord to end decades of civil war, tensions between the neighbors are crystallizing into fears of direct confrontation.
41_6ecbplus.4: Speaking in South Sudan's capital, Juba, Mr. Kiir denounced the Sudanese government for threatening what he called a "military invasion" of South Sudan, and he rejected accusations by the Sudanese government that his country was arming Sudanese rebels as "utterly baseless and malicious. "
41_6ecbplus.5: Mr. Kiir has also accused the Sudanese government of bombing the South Sudanese area of Guffa in recent days, killing at least seven people and potentially moving the insurgencies on both sides of the border closer to an international conflict.
41_6ecbplus.6: The United States issued a statement on Thursday condemning "in the strongest possible terms" what it called "negative developments" between the nations, particularly the airstrike by the Sudanese forces.
41_6ecbplus.7: "The provocative aerial bombardments near the border increase the potential of direct confrontation between Sudan and South Sudan, " the American statement said.
41_6ecbplus.8: Sudan has denied striking South Sudanese territory.
41_6ecbplus.9: Nevertheless, on Thursday afternoon an Antonov bomber dropped four bombs on the South Sudanese area of Yida, hitting a refugee camp of roughly 21, 000 people, some of them northern Sudanese who had crossed the border since the rebellion in Sudan began.
41_6ecbplus.10: According to an aid worker with knowledge of the event, two bombs fell on an airstrip, one hit a school and one landed on a market, but did not detonate.
41_6ecbplus.11: There were varying reports of casualties, but none could be confirmed.
41_6ecbplus.12: While the two nations continue to discuss how to split lucrative oil revenues and the fate of the contested region of Abyei, a spreading rebellion inside Sudan has prompted the Sudanese government to accuse the south of providing military support to the rebels.
41_6ecbplus.13: Last week, the Sudanese government lodged a formal complaint with the United Nations Security Council, arguing that South Sudan was trying to start a border war.
41_6ecbplus.14: "We don't have any intention to go to war again, but it is now up to the southern government to either strengthen its state without hostility, or to disturb us, " said a Sudanese government spokesman, Rabie A. Atti.
41_6ecbplus.15: "If they come to war, they will lose a lot. "
41_6ecbplus.16: Many residents in the Sudanese provinces of Southern Kordofan and Blue Nile fought alongside the south during its civil war with the north.
41_6ecbplus.17: But the 2005 peace treaty placed the two provinces in Sudan's territory, leaving South Sudan to hold a referendum to decide its own fate.
41_6ecbplus.18: In January, the South Sudanese voted almost unanimously to secede from the rest of the country.
41_6ecbplus.19: Their fellow combatants in Southern Kordofan and Blue Nile remained on the other side of the border, and an armed rebellion soon began.
41_6ecbplus.20: "We are ready to fight and continue until we reach Khartoum, " the Sudanese capital, said one of the rebel leaders, Abdel Aziz al - Hilu, in a September interview.
41_6ecbplus.21: "We are prepared for a protracted war, a long war, " he added, "in order to see this regime ousted. "
41_6ecbplus.22: In return, the Sudanese military has clamped down hard on the rebellion, filling the skies over Southern Kordofan and Blue Nile with Antonov bombers, some of which have flown over South Sudanese territory, too.
41_6ecbplus.23: A satellite imaging project organized by the Enough Project, an advocacy group, has published what it says is evidence of mass graves in the rebellious regions, and the United Nations has said the military activity could amount to war crimes.
41_6ecbplus.24: The United States, a close partner of South Sudan, had made strong overtures to the government in Sudan, saying that if it cooperated peacefully with South Sudan's transition to independence, economic sanctions on the country could be lifted.
41_6ecbplus.25: But last week, President Obama seemed to change his mind, calling for sanctions to be extended over what he called "hostile" actions on the part of the Sudanese government that posed an "unusual and extraordinary threat" to American foreign policy.
41_6ecbplus.26: "They promised us a lot of things; nothing actually implemented, " said Mr. Atti, the Sudanese government spokesman.
41_6ecbplus.28: South Sudan - or Sudan - can ill afford a new war.
41_6ecbplus.29: The economies of both nations are in a delicate state, with Sudan suffering from a loss of oil income since South Sudan's independence, and protests springing up in the streets of Khartoum early this year.
41_6ecbplus.30: As for South Sudan, it is one of the least developed countries in the world.
41_6ecbplus.31: Furthermore, it faces a number of internal rebellions itself, particularly in provinces near the border, and it has accused the Sudanese government of backing militias there.
41_6ecbplus.32: "The overall view is that they have to exist with the other side, " said Aly Verjee, a senior researcher at the Rift Valley Institute.
41_6ecbplus.33: "Even if you don't trust them so much, and if they are meddling in your own sovereign territory, there is a lot riding on that. "

2_8ecbplus.0: Comedian Ellen DeGeneres picked to host 2014 Oscars
2_8ecbplus.2: Comedian Ellen DeGeneres will make her second appearance as an Academy Awards host next year, organizers said on Friday, in a move widely seen as a less provocative choice for Hollywood's highest honors after a ribald performance by Seth MacFarlane.
2_8ecbplus.3: DeGeneres, the star of her own daytime talk show "Ellen, " first hosted the Oscars in 2007, becoming only the second woman to fill that exalted role alone, after Whoopi Goldberg.
2_8ecbplus.4: "I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time, " DeGeneres said in a statement.
2_8ecbplus.5: "You know what they say - the third time's the charm. "
2_8ecbplus.6: "I'd like to thank @TheAcademy, my wife Portia and, oh dear, there goes the orchestra, " the comedian added on Twitter.
2_8ecbplus.7: DeGeneres, 55, earned an Emmy nomination for her performance in 2007 in which she departed from traditional Oscar hosting decorum and ventured into the audience for spot gags, at one point handing director Martin Scorsese a script of her own.
2_8ecbplus.8: "Choosing DeGeneres, known for her kindler, gentler humor, signals that the Academy's next awards show will have a decidedly different tone than the 85th Academy Awards, " trade magazine The Hollywood Reporter wrote.
2_8ecbplus.9: DeGeneres also earned praise for her performance as the host of TV's Emmy awards in 2001, which was twice delayed because of the September 11 attacks, memorably lightening the somber mood by asking, "What would bug the Taliban more than seeing a gay woman in a suit surrounded by Jews? "
2_8ecbplus.10: The announcement of DeGeneres as host also comes on the heels of Hollywood marketing executive Cheryl Boone Isaacs being elected as the first African American president of the 6, 000 - member Academy, which has made an effort to diversify its ranks after coming under fire for being too male, old and white.
2_8ecbplus.11: Trade publication Variety saw the choice of DeGeneres as a continuation of the Academy's "Year of the Woman, " writing that the Oscars "will put women in the driver's seat. "

30_1ecbplus.1: The break in an undersea cable on that affected Seacom has been repaired
30_1ecbplus.3: Undersea cable operator Seacom announced today ( 4 November 2011 ) that repairs have been completed on a broken cable off the coast of Egypt that caused an outage on its network.
30_1ecbplus.4: Seacom said that its cable network was successfully repaired on 29 October 2011 and all circuits were restored to the core network as of 4 November 02: 00 GMT.
30_1ecbplus.5: All Seacom traffic to Europe was affected by the break which happened on 8 October 2011 on one of their Mediterranean backhaul service providers' cables between Abu Talat and Marseilles.
30_1ecbplus.6: Initial indications were that the break would take 12 days to fix.
30_1ecbplus.7: The cable operator announced that it had restored services to its business customers via alternate routes on 14 October 2011.
30_1ecbplus.8: This was followed by similar restoration to the rest of its clients on 20 October 2011.
30_1ecbplus.9: "Our partner network has informed us that the assigned cable ship worked in optimal weather conditions for the duration of their repairs.
30_1ecbplus.10: The cable was quickly lifted, the new cable spliced in, tested and re - laid thanks to close coordination between the ship crew and on - shore support, " Seacom said in an announcement on their website.

10_15ecbplus.0: Red Sox to break bank for Teixeira
10_15ecbplus.1: Here's a prediction: By the time this is over, win or lose, the Red Sox effectively will have made Mark Teixeira the largest contract offer in the history of your storied franchise.
10_15ecbplus.2: When the Sox want something enough, they make sure they get it.
10_15ecbplus.3: In the case of Teixeira, rest assured that the Sox want him, no matter what games are being played by club officials.
10_15ecbplus.4: Publicly and privately, the Sox are saying nothing about their interest in Teixeira and playing dumb every time his name comes up.
10_15ecbplus.5: It's as sure a sign as any that they are preparing to go to extraordinary lengths.
10_15ecbplus.6: what the Red Sox truly fear here is that the Yankees can outbid them on Teixeira, explaining why the Sox have failed to confirm any interest in the player at all.
10_15ecbplus.7: With the possible exception of the New York Mets, who just exercised their contract option on first baseman Carlos Delgado, the Yankees are the only team in baseball who could outbid the Red Sox for Teixeira's services.
10_15ecbplus.8: The Yankees could do it in a big way, too, giving Teixeira the kind of money that would put him in the clouds with Alex Rodriguez.

44_3ecbplus.0: HP gets into data center design; acquires EYP Mission Critical Facilities
44_3ecbplus.2: Hewlett - Packard Co. announced yesterday that it will acquire EYP Mission Critical Facilities Inc. , a data center consulting business, to bolster its own position in the data center facilities space.

42_10ecbplus.0: T - Mobile will carry the BlackBerry Q10, business registration begins April 29th
42_10ecbplus.2: More details on the BlackBerry Q10's release in the US are starting to surface.
42_10ecbplus.3: T - Mobile confirmed in an email that its business customers will have the opportunity to register for the device starting next week on April 29th, with availability and pricing details to follow "at a later date. "
42_10ecbplus.4: General consumers will likely have to wait a little longer, if T - Mobile follows the same launch strategy that it did with the Z10.
42_10ecbplus.5: Of course, registration doesn't actually equate to pre - orders or actually purchasing the phone yet - - all we've heard from official channels is that it'll be coming towards the end of May - - but it's still a solid confirmation that QWERTY fans will at least be able to get their BB10 on in the very near future.

3_3ecbplus.0: Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr: Texas Child Molester Escaped and Armed
3_3ecbplus.2: Texas inmate Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr. escaped when he was being transported to a prison in Beaumont from Huntsville.
3_3ecbplus.3: Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr. is a convicted sex offender serving a life sentence.
3_3ecbplus.4: Comeaux escaped with a 12 - gauge shotgun and 2 semiautomatic pistols.
3_3ecbplus.5: He initially was imprisoned on February 1979 on three 10 - year sentences for rape of a child, aggravated rape of a child, and burglary of a building with the intent to commit theft.
3_3ecbplus.6: His supervision was revoked and he returned to prison in May 1984 with a new charge of indecency with a child, given a new 20 year sentence.
3_3ecbplus.7: Between 1991 and 1998, Comeaux was in and out of prison on parole violations until he finally returned to prison in June 1999 to serve a life sentence for aggravated sexual assault.

45_2ecbplus.0: Okla. man guilty of killing pregnant girlfriend
45_2ecbplus.2: An Oklahoma man was found guilty Thursday on two first - degree murder charges for the deaths of an Arkansas woman and her fetus, according to Crawford County Deputy Prosecuting Attorney Jacob Howell.
45_2ecbplus.3: Christopher Kenyon Simpson of Fort Coffee is accused of fatally shooting Ka'Loni Marie Flynn of Fort Smith, Ark.
45_2ecbplus.4: Prosecutors allege Simpson shot Flynn after she told him she was pregnant.
45_2ecbplus.5: Flynn's body was found in a car near Spiro on April 9.

25_9ecbplus.0: Pierre Thomas Placed on Injured Reserve
25_9ecbplus.2: Pierre Thomas, the Saints' leading rusher in 2009, was put on injured reserve, the team announced Wednesday.
25_9ecbplus.3: Thomas has an ankle injury, and he is the second running back in two days to be placed on IR as New Orleans prepares for its wild - card round playoff game at Seattle.
25_9ecbplus.4: The Saints placed rookie Chris Ivory on injured reserve Tuesday - - another huge blow, because he was the club's leading rusher this season.
25_9ecbplus.5: That leaves Reggie Bush, Julius Jones and the newly - signed Joique Bell, who was added off the Eagles' practice squad when Thomas was placed on IR, to carry the load in the Saints' backfield.
25_9ecbplus.6: The Saints do not generally run the ball much anyway - - New Orleans finished 30th in the NFL in rushing attempts this season, with 380.
25_9ecbplus.7: They do, however, use their running backs frequently out of the backfield in the short passing game, and Thomas' absence will hurt there.
25_9ecbplus.8: Ivory, who had made strides with ball security, showed off his power this season, running through arm tackles and over lighter linebackers en route to 716 yards rushing.
25_9ecbplus.9: Thomas was hurt in the Saints' game vs. Atlanta game in September and missed 10 games, including last Sunday's loss to the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
25_9ecbplus.11: New Orleans has never used Reggie Bush as a feature - type back, but as more of a third - down, all - purpose running back.
25_9ecbplus.12: It is likely he will get 10 to 12 carries on Saturday.
25_9ecbplus.13: The Saints are not likely to expose him to more than that, not with the depth being in such critical shape.
25_9ecbplus.14: There was good news for New Orleans: Wide receiver Marques Colston was a full participant in practice on Wednesday.
25_9ecbplus.15: He did not play last Sunday after undergoing arthroscopic knee surgery last Tuesday.
25_9ecbplus.16: Safety Malcolm Jenkins ( knee ), tight end Jimmy Graham ( ankle ), defensive tackle Anthony Hargrove ( knee ) and linebacker Danny Clark ( hamstring ) did not participate in team drills Wednesday.
25_9ecbplus.17: It is not certain what their status is for Saturday.
25_9ecbplus.18: Tight end Jeremy Shockey ( groin ) and tight end David Thomas ( knee ) were limited in Wednesday's practice, which is encouraging because of Graham's ankle injury.

30_10ecbplus.0: Seacom restored for commercial ISPs on alternate routes
30_10ecbplus.1: Seacom's business customers, including commercial Internet Service Providers, have had their services restored via alternative routes, Seacom announced today
30_10ecbplus.3: Subsea cable operator Seacom announced on Twitter today ( 14 October 2011 ) that they have restored all their business customers on alternate routes following an outage expected to extend into next week.
30_10ecbplus.4: This includes commercial Internet service providers, according to Seacom's tweet, which said that all such ISPs using Seacom capacity are no longer affected by the outage.
30_10ecbplus.5: Seacom started to experience problems on Saturday, 8 October 2011, which it said was caused by a problem on a cable between Abu Talat in Egypt and Marseilles in France.
30_10ecbplus.6: In an official statement from Seacom said that their initial estimates were that it would take 12 days to repair the cable, depending on weather conditions.
30_10ecbplus.7: Mweb announced on 12 October 2011 that their services through Seacom were running at full capacity again.
30_10ecbplus.8: Cybersmart posted on its website that their Seacom service was restored at 10: 57 on 11 October 2011.
30_10ecbplus.9: Openweb CEO Keoma Wright said that 99% of their supplier traffic has been restored.
30_10ecbplus.10: "We however were not severely affected due to the SAT3 backup in place on all our offerings, " Wright added.
30_10ecbplus.11: At the time of writing the websites of Axxess and Afrihost still said that they were experiencing degraded ADSL service.
30_10ecbplus.12: Neither ISP provided feedback as to whether their Seacom capacity had been restored.

6_8ecbplus.0: Gary Ross Will Not Direct 'Hunger Games' Sequel
6_8ecbplus.1: Filmmaker says he cannot commit to production schedule for 'Catching Fire'
6_8ecbplus.2: Hunger Games director Gary Ross will not helm the adaptation of Catching Fire, the second book in Suzanne Collins' trilogy, the Los Angeles Times reports.
6_8ecbplus.3: According to the newspaper's sources, Ross was in negotiations to direct the sequel, but was not able to come to an agreement over scheduling and compensation.
6_8ecbplus.4: "Despite recent speculation in the media, and after difficult but sincere consideration, I have decided not to direct Catching Fire, " Ross said in a statement.
6_8ecbplus.5: "As a writer and a director, I simply don't have the time I need to write and prep the movie I would have wanted to make because of the fixed and tight production schedule. "
6_8ecbplus.6: The director denied reports that his talks with the studio, Lionsgate, hit a snag.
6_8ecbplus.7: "Contrary to what has been reported, negotiations with Lionsgate have not been problematic.
6_8ecbplus.8: They have also been very understanding of me through this difficult decision. "
6_8ecbplus.9: The second film in the Hunger Games trilogy is scheduled to hit theaters in November of 2013, allowing the studio and creators a limited window to prepare before production would need to begin.

19_7ecbplus.0: Anger in East Flatbush Persists Over Teenager ’ s Killing by the Police
19_7ecbplus.2: First came the shooting: an armed teenager killed by police officers on a darkened Brooklyn street.
19_7ecbplus.3: Then came the anger: a Monday evening vigil marred by an unruly young mob thrashing its way through local businesses; a second protest the next night; and another on Wednesday night, after which, the police said, someone hit an officer in the face with a brick, another brick was thrown through the window of a police van, and there were 46 arrests — mostly for disorderly conduct.
19_7ecbplus.5: By the time an autopsy of the 16 - year - old was released Wednesday, the tension in East Flatbush could be measured in the silently flashing lights of squad cars parked at tight intervals along Church Avenue.
19_7ecbplus.6: For some, the sight of extra police officers meant a potential reprieve in an area troubled by crime.
19_7ecbplus.7: For others, it was anything but reassuring.
19_7ecbplus.8: The police said that two plainclothes officers fatally shot the teenager, Kimani Gray, just before 11: 30 p. m. on Saturday after he brandished a revolver and pointed it at them.
19_7ecbplus.9: The police commissioner, Raymond W. Kelly, said Tuesday that the police had interviewed three witnesses, “ two of which say that the officers said, ‘ Don ’ t move. ’ ”
19_7ecbplus.10: “ Another witness said an officer says, ‘ Freeze, ’ ” he said.
19_7ecbplus.11: The officers then fired 11 shots, the police said.
19_7ecbplus.12: Seven bullets hit Mr. Gray, including three that entered his body from the rear, according to the New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner.
19_7ecbplus.13: The autopsy did not establish the order in which the bullets struck Mr. Gray, or determine the path of the bullets, which might make clearer if Mr. Gray had his back to the officers when he was shot, or if he had twisted away after being struck from the front.
19_7ecbplus.14: But the findings, inconclusive though they were, appeared likely to heighten the tensions of a community already distrustful of the police and increasingly incensed about the shooting of the teenager.
19_7ecbplus.15: On Wednesday night, about 200 people attended the vigil.
19_7ecbplus.16: The gathering became unruly when about half of them splintered off and marched to a nearby police precinct station house.
19_7ecbplus.17: After officers in riot gear set up a roadblock on Church Avenue, Mr. Gray ’ s sister Mahnefah tried to cross the street and was put into a police car.
19_7ecbplus.18: She was given a summons and released.
19_7ecbplus.19: Some of the protesters shouted, “ That ’ s the sister, ” then started throwing bottles when the police would not release her.
19_7ecbplus.21: Screams could be heard as skirmishes broke out on side streets.
19_7ecbplus.22: For local residents, many of whom voiced skepticism about the official account, the situation surrounding Mr. Gray ’ s death was grimly familiar.
19_7ecbplus.23: Less than a year before, and only blocks away, a narcotics detective shot and killed an unarmed 23 - year - old woman, Shantel Davis, as she tried to flee the police in a car that had been reported stolen at gunpoint, the police said at the time.
19_7ecbplus.24: Vigils followed that shooting as well.
19_7ecbplus.25: But soon the rhythms of daily life returned, marked by what young men and women said was a daily backbeat of police stops.
19_7ecbplus.26: “ You try to put it out of your mind, ” said Ms. Davis ’ s sister Crystal.
19_7ecbplus.27: In interviews around East Flatbush, many spoke of a Police Department that, in its aggressive pursuit of gangs and informal criminal crews, had sown distrust, especially among young men and women, who feel that their encounters with officers often have racial overtones.
19_7ecbplus.28: At a barbershop along Church Avenue, two men on Tuesday were discussing the recent shooting when an Asian delivery cyclist pulled onto the sidewalk across the street.
19_7ecbplus.29: “ See that guy? ” said Elverton Thomas, 39, a black man and telemarketer who was there for a haircut.
19_7ecbplus.30: “ He can ride on the sidewalk.
19_7ecbplus.32: His barber, Julian Clark, also black, concurred.
19_7ecbplus.33: Two years before, he said, an officer stopped him in front of the shop for sidewalk riding, and then arrested him after the officer said his identification had expired; he spent a day in custody sorting it out, he said.
19_7ecbplus.34: “ They have a hard time because there ’ s a lot of crime in the neighborhood, ” he said of the police.
19_7ecbplus.35: “ But when they play hardball, they end up going after innocent people, too. ”
19_7ecbplus.36: The seemingly constant presence of the police in the lives of many youths — both on the street and, increasingly, monitoring conversations on social media — has left many feeling suffocated, said Shanduke McPhatter, 35, an ex - gang member who works with young men in the neighborhood.
19_7ecbplus.37: “ I understand the state of mind that these youths have, ” he said.
19_7ecbplus.38: “ The problem is there is no relationship with the police. ”
19_7ecbplus.39: At the same time, he said, the situation on the streets has grown more complex for law enforcement: gangs are less organized, replaced instead by informal crews with few requirements and in which leadership is frequently up for grabs among increasingly young members.
19_7ecbplus.40: “ The police say, ‘ Look at these kids, they ’ re wild, ’ ” Mr. McPhatter said.
19_7ecbplus.41: “ And then they use that as an excuse to be wild themselves. ”
19_7ecbplus.42: The Rev. Terry Lee, who runs a local youth ministry and acts as a liaison to the police, said many of the neighborhood shootings involved “ kids killing kids ” and lamented that the community did not rise up more frequently in anger over those shootings.
19_7ecbplus.43: But he said he understood why.
19_7ecbplus.44: “ The community we ’ re living in can get dangerous at times, ” he said.
19_7ecbplus.46: Mr. Lee said the local 67th Precinct had grown more open to the community in recent years.
19_7ecbplus.47: “ The problem is, people still don ’ t want to go to the police, ” he said.
19_7ecbplus.48: The autopsy report on Mr. Gray did not specify which of the seven bullets caused the death of the teenager; that determination awaits further investigation.
19_7ecbplus.49: One bullet entered his left shoulder in the rear; two other bullets struck the back of his thighs, one in the left thigh and one in the right.
19_7ecbplus.50: Two bullets struck from the front, hitting his right thigh; one bullet entered his left side, striking his lower rib cage; and the last bullet hit his left lower forearm.
19_7ecbplus.51: John C. Cerar, the former commander for firearms training at the Police Department, said many factors could explain the wounds to the front and back of Mr. Gray ’ s body.
19_7ecbplus.52: “ Most of the time, it ’ s the person making a turn, or the position of the officers, ” he said, or some combination of the two.
19_7ecbplus.53: Once that person has a gun, he said, the threat to the officers is imminent.
19_7ecbplus.54: Mr. Gray ’ s revolver was loaded with four bullets, the police said.
19_7ecbplus.55: Mr. Kelly, the police commissioner, said Tuesday that there was “ nothing to indicate that this shooting was outside the guidelines. ”
19_7ecbplus.56: Mr. Cerar concurred, saying, “ Under the reported circumstances, it appears to be a good shooting. ”
19_7ecbplus.57: But raw feeling in the neighborhood fueled accounts at wide variance with that provided by the police.
19_7ecbplus.58: Some said Mr. Gray, while armed, did not point the gun; others said they had heard that there had been no gun at all, or that his hands had been in the air.
19_7ecbplus.59: A family friend, Kevin Blacks, 33, said he was not surprised that the autopsy had found that Mr. Gray had been shot so many times or hit from behind.
19_7ecbplus.60: He said he had spoken to Mr. Gray ’ s parents.
19_7ecbplus.61: “ The dad is shook, ” Mr. Blacks said, standing by a makeshift memorial for Mr. Gray.
19_7ecbplus.64: He ’ s still in a dream. ”
19_7ecbplus.65: Local elected officials and clergy members, seeking to lower the temperature in the neighborhood, mostly did not issue new statements Wednesday.
19_7ecbplus.66: “ Our focus right now is to get the funeral service together, ” said Gilford T. Monrose, a local pastor and community leader who is working with the family on the service; a date had yet to be set, he said.
19_7ecbplus.67: On Tuesday, police investigators could be seen inside a Rite Aid store where, the night before, a group of at least three dozen mostly young people briefly rampaged through the aisles, turning over displays and assaulting one customer who tried to intervene.
19_7ecbplus.68: The police released store surveillance video and later announced the arrest of a 19 - year - old, saying he was one of three who hit the customer and took his cellphone.
19_7ecbplus.69: “ Nothing justifies that, ” Mr. Kelly said.
19_7ecbplus.70: He said at a City Council hearing on Tuesday that the violence had been caused by a disorderly group that broke away from the vigil and did not constitute a riot, as some had termed it.
19_7ecbplus.71: “ That belittles it, ” City Councilman Jumaane D. Williams said later, referring to the community anger after the police shooting.
19_7ecbplus.72: “ So now we ’ re going to wait for something worse, for something that meets the true definition of a riot? ”

32_3ecbplus.0: PROVISIONAL TRIAL DATE SET FOR CUMBRIA DOUBLE MURDER ACCUSED
32_3ecbplus.2: A provisional trial date has been set in the case of a son accused of killing his mother, sister and pet dog.
32_3ecbplus.3: A preliminary hearing for John Jenkin, 23, charged with the murders of his mum Alice McMeekin, 58, and sister Katie Jenkin, 20, took place at Preston Crown Court this morning.
32_3ecbplus.4: Jenkin was due to appear via videolink from HMP Preston but did not do so as he was considered a risk to his own safety and that of other people, said crown prosecutor Susan Carter.
32_3ecbplus.5: The case was heard in his absence and a provisional trial date was set for October 28, with a duration of three days.
32_3ecbplus.6: The bodies of Ms McMeekin and Miss Jenkin were found in their house in Newton Street, Millom, at about 8. 40am on Saturday.
32_3ecbplus.7: The family's border collie, named Fenn, was found dead in the backyard of the house.
32_3ecbplus.8: Jenkin, who was arrested at Millom Pier at around 9. 35am, is also facing a charge of causing unnecessary suffering to an animal in relation to the dog's death.
32_3ecbplus.9: No application was made for bail and no plea was entered.
32_3ecbplus.10: A plea and case management hearing will be held on September 6.
32_3ecbplus.11: Judge Anthony Russell QC asked for psychiatric reports to be completed on Jenkin before the next hearing.

29_7ecbplus.0: Luck throws for 205 yards, 4th - quarter TD as Colts beat Chiefs 20 - 13 to clinch playoff spot
29_7ecbplus.2: Andrew Luck threw for 205 yards to break the single - season rookie record, and his touchdown pass to Reggie Wayne late in the fourth quarter Sunday gave the Indianapolis Colts a 20 - 13 win over the Kansas City Chiefs and a berth in the playoffs.
29_7ecbplus.3: Luck surpassed Cam Newton's year - old record of 4, 051 yards passing by a rookie in the second quarter, and then came through in the closing minutes.
29_7ecbplus.4: He marched Indy to the Chiefs 7, and then found Wayne in the back of the end zone on third - and - goal for the go - ahead score.
29_7ecbplus.5: It was the seventh time Luck has rallied his team to victory in the fourth quarter.
29_7ecbplus.6: Darius Butler returned an interception 32 yards for a TD in helping the Colts ( 10 - 5 ) join the 2008 Miami Dolphins as the only NFL teams to win at least 10 games after losing 14 or more the previous season.

27_8ecbplus.0: Microsoft rushes out security patch for Internet Explorer
27_8ecbplus.2: Normally, Microsoft releases security bulletins for software products on the second Tuesday of each month.
27_8ecbplus.3: That happened last week as scheduled, but today the company announced it has rushed out an additional patch designed to fix an exploit that has been found in Internet Explorer, and is being used in attacks on IE8 and IE9.
27_8ecbplus.4: In a post on its security response blog, Microsoft says the issue would allow a hacker to launch a remote code execution if a person surfs to a website using IE that contains malicious code.
27_8ecbplus.5: The blog adds, "There are only reports of a limited number of targeted attacks specifically directed at Internet Explorer 8 and 9, although the issue could potentially affect all supported versions. "
27_8ecbplus.6: The company has released a "Fix - it" patch, "CVE - 2013 - 3893 MSHTML Shim Workaround" to plug this security hole in all currently supported versions of IE.
27_8ecbplus.7: In addition, Microsoft recommends that users set their security settings on the web browser to "High" to block any ActiveX Controls and Active Scripting on websites.
27_8ecbplus.8: It also recommends users set up IE so that it informs them ahead of time before running any Active Scripting features.
27_8ecbplus.9: The company plans to release a full security patch that will be a more complete solution to this problem in the near future.

12_5ecbplus.0: MUST SEE: Navy pins down Somali pirates in heroic face - off
12_5ecbplus.2: Indian Naval Ship Sukanya, deployed on anti - piracy patrols in the Gulf of Aden under the operational control of the Western Naval Command, thwarted a multiple - boat attack by pirates on Thursday and rescued 26 Somali crewmembers.
12_5ecbplus.3: The ship was escorting a group of five merchant vessels through the internationally recognised transit corridor at 9: 25 hours on Thursday when officers onboard detected a group of five boats approaching the merchant vessels.
12_5ecbplus.4: The warship immediately changed its route and challenged the pirates ferrying the suspicious vessels
12_5ecbplus.5: The pirates tried to reverse the course of the boats and tried to flee.
12_5ecbplus.6: Two managed to give the Indian Navy a slip, but the other three boats were intercepted.
12_5ecbplus.7: During the operation, six AK 47 rifles, 12 magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition were found and confiscated.
12_5ecbplus.8: In addition, a host of other equipment such as grapnels were also confiscated.
12_5ecbplus.9: This is the fifth successful anti - piracy operation conducted by Sukanya, in the course of her ongoing patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden, which commenced in September.
12_5ecbplus.10: So far, the Indian Navy has confiscated 14 AK 47 Rifles, 31 magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition from pirates.

33_5ecbplus.0: Gang member guilty in slay of Brooklyn mom of 12
33_5ecbplus.1: Andrew Lopez, 20 was found guilty in murder of Zurana Horton.
33_5ecbplus.2: Horton was struck by a stray bullet as Lopez targeted rival gang members.
33_5ecbplus.3: He faces up to 75 years to life in prison.
33_5ecbplus.5: A gang member was convicted Tuesday for claiming the life of a mother of 12 when he sprayed 13 bullets from a Brooklyn rooftop in broad daylight.
33_5ecbplus.6: Andrew Lopez, 20, was found guilty of slaying Zurana Horton, 34, and wounding Unique Armstead, 32, and Cheanne McKnight, 11, in October 2011 as he targeted rival gang members.
33_5ecbplus.7: He faces up to 75 years to life in prison when he's sentenced May 7.
33_5ecbplus.8: The gruesome death on a busy Brownsville street was captured in a chilling surveillance tape played at trial.
33_5ecbplus.9: It took the panel just over two hours to convict Lopez, who confessed after the shooting.

14_4ecbplus.1: A large fire has destroyed much of a supermarket in Somerset.
14_4ecbplus.2: Crews were called to the Waitrose building on Wellington High Street just after 6am.

12_1ecbplus.1: Navy foils Somali pirate attack off Gulf of Aden
12_1ecbplus.2: The Indian Navy patrolling the Gulf of Aden on Thursday thwarted a multi - boat attack by sea brigands on merchant vessels, apprehending 26 Somali pirates and confiscating arms and ammunition, in the fifth successful anti - piracy operation since September.
12_1ecbplus.3: At 9. 25 a. m. on Thursday, navy personnel aboard warship INS Sukanya spotted a group of five suspicious boats speedily approaching the merchant vessels of her group.
12_1ecbplus.4: “ The warship immediately altered ( its direction ) towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them.
12_1ecbplus.5: On seeing the resolve evident in the warship ’ s action and probably mindful of the reputation for resolute action that the Indian Navy justly enjoys in such deployments, the pirate skiffs reversed course and tried to flee the area, ” Captain Manohar Nambiar, Chief Public Relations Officer, Defence, said.
12_1ecbplus.6: While two of them managed to escape, INS Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three boats and, in a well - practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action, nabbed 26 Somali pirates with six AK 47 rifles, 12 magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition.
12_1ecbplus.7: This is the fifth successful anti - piracy operation conducted by INS Sukanya in the course of her ongoing patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden that commenced in September, the Navy said.
12_1ecbplus.8: INS Sukanya, currently deployed on anti - piracy patrols in the Gulf of Aden under the operational control of the Western Naval Command, was escorting a group of five merchant vessels through the Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor when the incident happened.
12_1ecbplus.9: The timely operation by INS Sukanya resulted, once again, in foiling the pirates ’ attempt to attack merchant vessels transiting the busy sea lane through which over nearly $100 billion worth India ’ s external trade passes each year, Captain Nambiar said.
12_1ecbplus.10: In their five operations so far, the personnel on board the warship have confiscated 14 AK - 47 Rifles, 31 magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition, he said.
12_1ecbplus.11: Indian Navy is part of the international effort to ensure the safety and freedom of seaborne trade in this high - risk stronghold of modern - day piracy.

31_9ecbplus.2: Doug McDermott became the leading scorer in Creighton history and had five points during a pivotal 15 - 2 run as top - seeded Creighton defeated Drake, 65 - 53, on Friday afternoon in the first quarterfinal of the Missouri Valley Conference Tournament.
31_9ecbplus.3: Creighton improved to 25 - 7 on the season and advances to play Saturday in a 1: 35 pm semifinal against the winner of the Evansville - Indiana State semifinal.
31_9ecbplus.4: Drake, which defeated Bradley in the play - in round just 18 hours earlier, fell to 15 - 17.
31_9ecbplus.5: Creighton broke open a 12 - all game with some strong play by Will Artino to key a 7 - 0 run.
31_9ecbplus.6: The sophomore center from Iowa came off the bench and dunked to start a traditional three - point play.
31_9ecbplus.7: McDermott would follow with a jumper to tie the scoring record, and Artino answered with another bucket to make it 19 - 12 with 11: 43 left in the first half.
31_9ecbplus.8: McDermott's history - making point came at the foul line, when he sank a free throw with 4: 43 left in the first half.
31_9ecbplus.9: It gave him 2, 117 career points, passing Rodney Buford's career mark that had stood since 1999 and moving him into 10th in MVC history.
31_9ecbplus.10: The Jays led 33 - 26 at the half, paced by 13 points from McDermott.
31_9ecbplus.11: CU dominated the glass 22 - 13, the paint ( 16 - 10 ) and the second chance points ( 9 - 0 ) in the first 20 minutes, while also outscoring DU 12 - 3 off the bench.
31_9ecbplus.12: Creighton would take its first double - digit lead of the day at 45 - 35 on a pair of Artino free throws with 13: 41 to go.
31_9ecbplus.13: Drake countered with a 9 - 2 run and missed a tying trey by Richard Carter with about 10: 00 to play.
31_9ecbplus.14: The Jays answered, as Echenique threw down a powerful alley - oop during a three - point play and the lead returned to 54 - 46 a short time later on Austin Chatman's first score of the second half and a McDermott hoop in transition to move ahead by eight with 7: 54 to go.
31_9ecbplus.15: After a timeout, McDermott hit his third trifecta of the day, and Echenique's third three - point play of the day made it 60 - 46 with 6: 11 to go.
31_9ecbplus.16: Gibbs ended the run with two charity shots, and the Jays would keep Drake off the scoreboard for nearly seven minutes to pull away.
31_9ecbplus.17: McDermott led all players with 23 points while also grabbing seven rebounds.
31_9ecbplus.18: He made 3 - of - 4 three attempts from 3 - point range.
31_9ecbplus.19: Echenique generated a double - double with 11 points, 11 rebounds and six swats, with most of that production after half.
31_9ecbplus.20: Artino complemented Echenique inside by scoring a career - high 14 points and adding six rebounds.
31_9ecbplus.21: The Jays shot 46. 8 percent for the game ( 22 - 47 ) and owned the glass by a 44 - 26 margin.
31_9ecbplus.22: Drake was paced by 13 points from Seth VanDeest, while Richard Carter had 12 points and four assists.
31_9ecbplus.23: Drake shot 35. 0 percent overall and just 11 - of - 36 after intermission.
31_9ecbplus.24: The win improved Creighton to 41 - 20 all - time in MVC Tournament play, easily the most victories by any team in event history.
31_9ecbplus.25: The Jays are 19 - 12 all - time in the quarterfinal round, and 5 - 2 all - time vs. Drake in the event.

32_8ecbplus.1: John Jenkin, 23 and from Cumbria, has been charged with the murder of his mother and sister.
32_8ecbplus.2: Kathryn Jenkin, 20 and from Aberdare, and her mother Alice McMeekin, 58, were found on Saturday.
32_8ecbplus.3: Brother charged after Aberdare woman found dead
32_8ecbplus.4: The brother of a woman from Aberdare found dead in Cumbria on Saturday has been charged with her murder.
32_8ecbplus.5: 23 - year - old John Jenkin, of Millom, has been charged with the murder of his 58 - year - old mother, Alice McMeekin, and sister, Kathryn Jenkin, 20, who is from Aberdare.
32_8ecbplus.6: On Saturday 8 June 2013, at 8: 39am police were called to a property in Newton Street where Mrs McMeekin and Miss Jenkin were tragically found dead with head injuries.
32_8ecbplus.7: The family dog was also found dead.
32_8ecbplus.8: John Jenkin was arrested on suspicion of murder shortly afterwards.
32_8ecbplus.9: He will appear at Furness District Magistrates court this morning.
32_8ecbplus.10: John Jenkin is related to the victims, he is the son of Alice McMeekin and the brother of Kathryn Jenkin.

22_2ecbplus.0: Suspended Worker Kills 2 Women in Kraft Factory Shooting: Police
22_2ecbplus.1: The woman accused had just been escorted from the building 10 minutes earlier
22_2ecbplus.3: Minutes after a woman was suspended and escorted from her job at the Kraft Foods plant in Northeast Philadelphia, she returned with a. 357 Magnum and opened fire, killing two women and critically injuring a third co - worker before being taken into custody, police said.
22_2ecbplus.4: The shootings happened shortly after 8: 30 p. m. Thursday.
22_2ecbplus.5: About 10 minutes after the Yvonne Hiller was escorted out, she returned in a car and drove through a security barrier before re - entering the building on foot, Lt. Frank Vanore said.
22_2ecbplus.6: She walked inside, firing a shot at an employee who had followed her in and had yelled, "Hide, she's got a gun! '' Vanore said.
22_2ecbplus.8: Hiller, 43, then shot the three victims, according to police - - the women were shot on the third floor and the man she confronted on the stairs as she went down to the second floor where she barricaded herself into an office.
22_2ecbplus.9: Officers freed seven people who had locked themselves in an office next to the shooter, said Vanore.
22_2ecbplus.10: Investigators didn't say why Hiller, a 15 - year employee, was suspended.
22_2ecbplus.11: One witness told NBC Philadelphia that she has a history of run - ins with co - workers and management.
22_2ecbplus.12: Dough mixer Andy Ryan, who has worked at the plant for nearly 30 years, said he was on the third floor when the sound of the shots
22_2ecbplus.14: "I heard the gunfire, and I ran, '' he told The Associated Press, his apron still on.
22_2ecbplus.15: "As I was running down the steps they were yelling, 'Oh, my God, there's three people shot! '''
22_2ecbplus.16: "This is a sad day for the Kraft Foods family, '' the company said in a statement.
22_2ecbplus.17: "Our thoughts and prayers go out to their families.
22_2ecbplus.18: The loss of a loved one is a great sorrow. ''
22_2ecbplus.19: Kraft said the plant would be closed until further notice and the company would provide employees with counseling.

13_4ecbplus.2: There is an old saying that “ Once is chance; Twice is Coincidence; the Third Time is a Pattern.
13_4ecbplus.3: It was probably “ chance ” when the Wasilla Bible Church was burned, and arson was suspected.
13_4ecbplus.4: It was determined that an acelerant was placed around the perimeter of the church.
13_4ecbplus.5: No arrests were made in that fire.
13_4ecbplus.6: The interesting part of that blaze reported that it didn ’ t harm the larger areas of the church where worship services were held.
13_4ecbplus.7: Instead it was, according to Sarah Palin, the offices where church records were stored, that was destroyed.
13_4ecbplus.8: If there were church records that would reveal something Sarah Palin didn ’ t want uncovered, the destruction of those records by fire would solve that problem.
13_4ecbplus.9: When arson was suspected in the burning of the house of Dar Miller it was probably just coincidence.
13_4ecbplus.10: It was probably just coincidence that Sarah Palin is not supportive of people who are homosexual, and it appears Dar was lesbian, and lived with her “ partner. ”
13_4ecbplus.11: Of course it was not coincidence that Dar Miller was in her home when the fire broke out and was burned so badly she died the next day.
13_4ecbplus.12: It was not coincidence that her dogs died in the fire as they lived with her.
13_4ecbplus.13: It was unusual that the dogs died at the foot of her bed, instead of by the door, trying to get out of the house.
13_4ecbplus.14: It was probably just coincidence that Dar Miller had previously worked at the Mat - Su Regional Hospital as a neo - natal nurse, which is the same hospital where Trig was purportedly born.
13_4ecbplus.15: The curious thing is that there was never an arrest made in that fire either.
13_4ecbplus.16: The suggesting was that Dar Miller had probably been smoking in bed and caught herself and the bed on fire.
13_4ecbplus.18: Did they know that Dar didn ’ t smoke?
13_4ecbplus.19: ( according to ottoline commenting in this blog ).
13_4ecbplus.20: The fire that burned so hot that it “ charred beams and melted pictures on the wall ” doesn ’ t sound like a fire caused by a cigarette in bed.
13_4ecbplus.21: The troubling “ pattern ” emerges as there is report of yet another fire in the small community of Palmer Alaska.
13_4ecbplus.22: This time the fire occurred at the Matanuska Maid Creamery.
13_4ecbplus.24: that dairy was the subject of a thorough investigation by Andrew Halcro.
13_4ecbplus.25: Andrew ’ s suggestion was that Sarah Palin had fraudulently diverted large sums of money to friends and high school buddies.
13_4ecbplus.26: Within a week of the dissolution of the last entity to run the Matanuska Maid Creamery, its building burned to the ground.
13_4ecbplus.27: Arson is likely, given the fact that the building was without electrical or gas connections and the fire broke out at 3: 30 AM.
13_4ecbplus.28: All three fires appear to be the result of arson.
13_4ecbplus.29: All three fires occurred in or around the small town of Alaska where Sarah Palin lives.
13_4ecbplus.30: All three fires may have conferred some benefit on Sarah Palin.
13_4ecbplus.31: When the church fire destroyed church records, I suspected foul play, but knew that it was probably just chance.
13_4ecbplus.32: When Dar Miller ’ s home was burned and she was killed by the blaze, I suspected foul play, but knew that it could be merely coincidence.
13_4ecbplus.33: Now that the Dairy has burned, and foul play seems clear, there is an unmistakable pattern.
13_4ecbplus.34: Given the fact that none of these crimes has been “ solved, ” a pattern is emerging.
13_4ecbplus.35: I wonder how long it will be before the Anchorage Police Department will issue a press release stating that there is not one scintilla of evidence connecting any of the members of the Palin family with these cases of arson?

26_4ecbplus.2: One of the most famous mafia godfathers in the US, Vincent "the Chin" Gigante, who spent much of his life avoiding prison, has died in jail, aged 77.
26_4ecbplus.3: He was, according to the New York Times, the last great mafioso of the 20th century.
26_4ecbplus.4: For years, Gigante evaded prison by concocting an elaborate mental illness.
26_4ecbplus.5: He routinely wandered the streets of New York's Manhattan, shuffling along in slippers and a tattered bathrobe, muttering incoherently.
26_4ecbplus.6: This bizarre behaviour earned him the title "the Oddfather", but also helped to keep him out of jail, as a series of juries were convinced that Gigante was indeed insane.
26_4ecbplus.7: But in 1997, he was finally convicted of racketeering, and in April 2003 he admitted to a court that his behaviour had been a ruse to stay out of prison.
26_4ecbplus.9: He died in a medical prison in Springfield, Missouri, on Monday morning, said a spokesman for the facility.
26_4ecbplus.10: The cause of his death was unknown, although he had had heart disease, the spokesman said.
26_4ecbplus.11: His death was confirmed by the FBI, whose agents worked for decades to bring him to justice.
26_4ecbplus.12: He was born in the Bronx in 1928 to Italian immigrants, and given the nickname "Chin" - short for Vincenzo.
26_4ecbplus.13: The ex - boxer became part of the powerful Genovese mafia family, eventually winning the patronage of ambitious mobster Vito Genovese.
26_4ecbplus.14: Gigante carried out an attempted hit on the boss of the family, Frank Costello, in 1957.
26_4ecbplus.15: The frightened Costello refused to name his attacker in court, and left Genovese to take over the mob.
26_4ecbplus.17: When the FBI closed in on Gigante, he feigned mental illness to escape conviction for police - bribery in 1970.
26_4ecbplus.18: From then on, his act became more elaborate.
26_4ecbplus.19: Federal agents once found him standing naked in a shower, holding an umbrella.
26_4ecbplus.20: Relatives - even including his brother, a Roman Catholic priest - insisted he suffered from paranoid schizophrenia, dementia and Alzheimer's disease.
26_4ecbplus.21: At his trial in 1997, for conspiracy to murder other organised crime figures, racketeering, and extortion, he sat in a wheelchair, mumbling quietly, apparently unaware of what was going on.
26_4ecbplus.22: It took the testimony of six turncoat mobsters, and FBI tape recordings in which the so - called Oddfather was heard conversing in a perfectly normal way, to convince the jury of his guilt.
26_4ecbplus.23: He was jailed for 12 years, but it took until 2003 for the Chin to admit his sham.

23_7ecbplus.0: Second climber dies at Mt Cook
23_7ecbplus.2: Two men have died in separate climbing accidents at Mt Cook this weekend.
23_7ecbplus.3: The Aoraki Mt Cook Alpine Rescue Team worked today to recover the body of a climber after bad weather hindered efforts yesterday.
23_7ecbplus.4: The climber fell in fading light yesterday near the Mt Sefton Bivvy, and rescue teams were unable to reach him or his companions due to the weather.
23_7ecbplus.5: Police are still at the scene and say more details will be released later.
23_7ecbplus.6: The first of the deaths this weekend was that of a New Zealand climber who fell on Friday morning.
23_7ecbplus.7: The 36 - year - old, who had been living in Melbourne, slipped and fell approximately 200 metres down a steep ice gully as he was approaching the Tasman Saddle Hut, police said.
23_7ecbplus.8: His brother witnessed the fall and had to spend the night in a hut before rescuers could reach him.
23_7ecbplus.9: The victim was still alive when rescuers reached him, Helicopter Line pilot Jim Campbell told the Herald on Sunday.
23_7ecbplus.10: "He was very badly hurt and he'd lost his hat and gloves in the fall so he was very cold. "
23_7ecbplus.11: The rescue team had to carry the man by stretcher down a glacier, walking two hours to reach a rescue helicopter.
23_7ecbplus.12: A Westpac Rescue Helicopter from Christchurch was called to help with search and rescue co - ordination at the Mt Cook base.
23_7ecbplus.13: By the time it arrived, the man had been transported to Mt Cook Village by a local helicopter service and had been pronounced dead by paramedics.
23_7ecbplus.14: He had been planning a four - day ski tour of the area and was using the Tasman Saddle Hut as a base, police said.
23_7ecbplus.15: Mr Campbell said police told him the man was well - equipped but was not wearing crampons when he slipped.
23_7ecbplus.16: A massive rescue bid was made shortly after 11am on Friday, with members of the Aoraki Mt Cook Department of Conservation Alpine Rescue Team, Alpine Guides, The Helicopter Line, Twizel and Fairlie police and Westpac Rescue paramedics all called in to help.
23_7ecbplus.17: Constable Joseph Rush, of Twizel police, said the weather conditions were severe, with poor visibility, strong wind gusts and - 15C temperatures.
23_7ecbplus.18: The man's name will not be released until family have been notified.

16_7ecbplus.1: A 27 - year - old parolee is found 'cowering in a bathtub' near the house where Jerry Ortiz had been shot in the head a few hours earlier.
16_7ecbplus.3: Before he was fatally shot, Los Angeles County Sheriff's Deputy Jerry Ortiz was looking for a man considered to be a "career criminal" and was hoping to arrest him on suspicion of attempted murder, officials said Saturday.
16_7ecbplus.4: That man, Jose Luis Orozco, is now the main suspect in the Friday afternoon slaying of Ortiz in Hawaiian Gardens.
16_7ecbplus.5: Orozco was arrested around midnight Friday by a sheriff's SWAT team, three houses from the scene of the fatal shooting.
16_7ecbplus.6: He was found "cowering in a bathtub, " Sheriff Lee Baca said.
16_7ecbplus.7: Ortiz, a gang enforcement officer, was searching for Orozco because he was a suspect in a shooting that occurred in the neighborhood Monday, said Sheriff's Capt. Ray Peavy, a homicide investigator.
16_7ecbplus.8: Orozco, 27, a known gang member, was also suspected of violating parole after serving time for a weapons violation, Peavy said.
16_7ecbplus.9: Ortiz, 35, was on his own about 3 p. m. Friday when he went to a house in Hawaiian Gardens, a working - class city at the northeast border of Long Beach with long - standing gang problems.
16_7ecbplus.10: Peavy said the specific reason for Ortiz's visit was unknown but he provided a few details about the encounter: A woman answered the door and a man walked up behind her.
16_7ecbplus.11: Ortiz asked the man for some identification and was checking it when Orozco appeared from inside the house.
16_7ecbplus.12: He shot Ortiz once in the head and fled, Peavy said.
16_7ecbplus.13: Dozens of law enforcement officers worked the case through the afternoon and into the night, fanning out around the 12200 block of 223rd Street and questioning residents.
16_7ecbplus.14: Deputies believed they knew where Orozco was hiding and obtained a search warrant.
16_7ecbplus.15: A handgun was recovered during the arrest, Peavy said.
16_7ecbplus.16: Orozco, who was booked on suspicion of violating his parole, is being held without bail.
16_7ecbplus.17: Los Angeles County Dist. Atty. Steve Cooley said he expected Orozco to be charged with first - degree murder of a peace officer, which means he could receive the death penalty if he is convicted.
16_7ecbplus.18: Peavy could not say what Orozco was doing in the house, but said he had been living on the street and sleeping in different places.
16_7ecbplus.19: Baca, who had been in Kentucky for a meeting of the National Sheriffs' Assn. , returned to Los Angeles for a news conference held Saturday with Cooley and Los Angeles Mayor - elect Antonio Villaraigosa.
16_7ecbplus.20: Baca praised the work of his investigators, but the arrest seemed to do little to quell his anger.
16_7ecbplus.21: He called Orozco "the scum of the earth" and an "idiot, " pointing to a photo of the suspect and the "devil horns" tattooed on his bald head.
16_7ecbplus.22: Cooley unfurled a long trail of printer paper that Baca said contained Orozco's criminal record, including drug and weapon violations, resisting arrest, burglary and assault with a deadly weapon.
16_7ecbplus.23: The sheriff contrasted the suspect's life with that of Ortiz, a 15 - year department veteran.
16_7ecbplus.24: Ortiz "not only exemplified the best of what we have, but took it upon himself to work in the toughest job that we also have - - and that is trying to do something about this out - of - control gang problem in Los Angeles County, " Baca said.
16_7ecbplus.25: Baca urged everyone in Southern California to pay more attention to the gang problem.
16_7ecbplus.26: He called for broader prevention initiatives, lamented the lack of resources in his department and urged parents to get involved in the lives of their children.
16_7ecbplus.27: Cooley said the fact that Orozco hadn't been in contact with his parole officer since January was a "failure" of the system, but he did not elaborate.
16_7ecbplus.28: Undersheriff Larry Waldie said that Ortiz set out without a partner Friday because he had arrived early and was eager to get to work.
16_7ecbplus.29: Peavy said Ortiz usually partnered with one of two deputies, but both had the day off.
16_7ecbplus.30: Instead, Ortiz had planned to partner with his sergeant.
16_7ecbplus.31: But he apparently decided to visit the house first.
16_7ecbplus.32: Peavy noted that such solo work is not a violation of department policy.
16_7ecbplus.33: Ortiz, of Diamond Bar, was an Army veteran and the father of two boys, ages 6 and 16.
16_7ecbplus.34: He was married for the second time about two weeks ago.
16_7ecbplus.35: His family declined a request for an interview Saturday through a sheriff's spokesman.
16_7ecbplus.36: But colleagues described him as someone who lived for police work and was a "fanatic" about boxing.
16_7ecbplus.37: He fought on the sheriff's boxing team and trained recruits and deputies in hand - to - hand combat.
16_7ecbplus.38: Lt. Bob Rifkin of Operation Safe Streets, the department's gang unit, said Ortiz became interested in the gang problem while working as a patrol officer from 1996 to 2000.
16_7ecbplus.39: He joined the gang unit in 2001 after passing a background check and written exam that tested his knowledge of gang culture.
16_7ecbplus.40: Ortiz won numerous commendations for his work.
16_7ecbplus.41: Last year, he was awarded the city of Lakewood's Medal of Valor after he fatally shot a carjacker who drew a gun on him and his partner.
16_7ecbplus.42: "Jerry was 35 years old and had more motivation than a 21 - year - old just getting on the department, " Rifkin said.
16_7ecbplus.43: "He always wanted to go toward the action and that's what Jerry was respected for. "
16_7ecbplus.44: Baca noted that Ortiz's family has had "tremendous tragedies when it comes to those members who've been in law enforcement. "
16_7ecbplus.45: In January, Ortiz's brother - in - law, Manuel A. Gonzalez, was stabbed to death while working as a corrections officer at a state prison in Chino.
16_7ecbplus.46: The alleged killer, Jon Christopher Blaylock, was serving a life sentence for the attempted murder of a police officer.

18_9ecbplus.0: Shooting at Accounting Firm Leaves Woman Dead and 2 Hurt
18_9ecbplus.2: A man who was fired last week from his job at an accounting firm in suburban Detroit walked into his former office with a shotgun on Monday and shot three people, killing one, before fleeing and leading police officers on a high - speed chase, the authorities said.
18_9ecbplus.3: The suspect, identified as Anthony LaCalamita, entered the second - floor office of the accounting firm, Gordon Advisors, about 10 a. m. and opened fire, the police said.
18_9ecbplus.4: A 63 - year - old woman and two men, ages 47 and 48, were shot, the police said.
18_9ecbplus.5: The woman, identified by the police as Madeline Kafoury, died at the scene, the authorities said.
18_9ecbplus.6: The two other victims were being treated at Beaumont Hospital in Royal Oak.
18_9ecbplus.7: Ilene Wolff, a spokeswoman for the hospital, said that their families had requested privacy, and that the hospital was not releasing any information about their condition or the nature of their injuries.
18_9ecbplus.8: Though the police declined to release the names of the two men, The Detroit Free Press identified them as Paul Riva, 47, of Sterling Heights and Alan Steinberg, 48, of Bruce Township.
18_9ecbplus.9: Both are partners in the firm, the newspaper reported.
18_9ecbplus.10: Mr. LaCalamita, 38, who was still listed on the firm ’ s Web site as a member of its “ professional staff, ” had been dismissed last week, the police said.
18_9ecbplus.11: Though they would not say what his relationship was with any of the victims or what led to the shootings, “ it doesn ’ t appear it was random, ” the Troy police chief, Charles Craft, said.
18_9ecbplus.12: Officers and witnesses described a chaotic scene immediately after the shooting as workers barricaded themselves in their cubicles and offices.
18_9ecbplus.13: A few hours later, some employees gathered outside the building but would not speak to reporters.
18_9ecbplus.14: The three - story office building houses other tenants in addition to the accounting firm, and appeared to have no formal security system, Chief Craft said.
18_9ecbplus.15: He said witnesses told the police that Mr. LaCalamita had walked into the building and into the firm ’ s unlocked suite as though he were concealing something.
18_9ecbplus.16: Mr. LaCalamita fled in his car before officers arrived, but witnesses took note of the license plate number, the authorities said.
18_9ecbplus.17: About two hours after the shooting, officers received a tip from a motorist in Flint, about 50 miles north of here, on the whereabouts of the car.
18_9ecbplus.18: Police officers chased Mr. LaCalamita for about 30 miles at speeds of up to 120 miles an hour on Interstate 75 before apprehending him near Bay City.

6_3ecbplus.0: Gary Ross in negotiations to direct 'The Hunger Games' sequel 'Catching Fire'
6_3ecbplus.2: Despite currently being the director behind the #1 movie in the world, the future of Gary Ross's involvement with The Hunger Games franchise remains uncertain.
6_3ecbplus.3: The Hollywood Reporter says Ross is in negotiations with Lionsgate to return as director for the sequel, Catching Fire - - and the deal likely hinges on money.
6_3ecbplus.4: THR says Ross, a seasoned director, accepted a relatively low $3 million salary for directing ( and co - writing ) The Hunger Games, but is asking for a significant raise for Catching Fire.
6_3ecbplus.5: Despite THR's article, which paints negotiations as tense, Ross has spoken very confidently about his involvement in Catching Fire - - even mentioning casting ideas and filming plans - - and it seems likely he will officially be signed on as director.
6_3ecbplus.6: Meanwhile, the film's main stars, including Jennifer Lawrence, Josh Hutcherson, and Liam Hemsworth, are all signed on for the rest of the movies in the series.
6_3ecbplus.7: Several additional new characters will need to be cast before Catching Fire can begin filming later this year, however.

21_10ecbplus.0: New York woman killed in hit - and - run crash
21_10ecbplus.1: On behalf of Howard R. Sanders, Esq. posted in Pedestrian Accidents on Wednesday, September 18, 2013.
21_10ecbplus.2: According to investigators, a woman was killed by a hit - and - run driver in Queens on the night of Sept. 13.
21_10ecbplus.3: At approximately 7 p. m. , the woman was walking near the intersection of 117th Street and 97th Avenue in Richmond Hill.
21_10ecbplus.4: She was walking among some parked cars when she was hit by a grey Toyota Camry that had been traveling north on 117th Street.

21_10ecbplus.8: A personal injury attorney might review a hit - and - run accident case and suggest seeking punitive damages.
21_10ecbplus.9: In some instances, it is possible to collect damages that exceed compensation for lost wages, medical expenses and funeral costs.
21_10ecbplus.10: The intention is to punish reckless and negligent drivers and also to send a message to other drivers.
21_10ecbplus.11: If the family wishes to seek only compensation for accident - related expenses, the attorney may negotiate for a settlement outside of court.
21_10ecbplus.12: On the other hand, if the family decides to seek punitive damages, the attorney might request a jury trial in civil court.
21_10ecbplus.13: If the at - fault driver was charged or convicted in criminal court, it may help support the claim of recklessness.
21_10ecbplus.14: The attorney may use police reports, photos and evidence to build a convincing argument on behalf of the family.
21_10ecbplus.15: If the judge and jury are persuaded by the argument and evidence presented, they may find in favor of the plaintiffs and award punitive damages.

33_2ecbplus.0: Video of Brooklyn woman's fatal shooting is played at trial of two men charged in rooftop gunplay

9_5ecbplus.0: Obama Reverses Bush on Species Protection Measure
9_5ecbplus.2: In a move that will subject a number of government projects to enhanced environmental and scientific scrutiny, President Obama is restoring a requirement that U. S. agencies consult with independent federal experts to determine whether their actions might harm threatened and endangered species.
9_5ecbplus.3: The presidential memorandum issued yesterday, which marks yet another reversal of former president George W. Bush's environmental legacy, will revive a decades - old practice under the Endangered Species Act that calls for agencies to consult with either the Fish and Wildlife Service or the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration on whether their projects could affect imperiled species.
9_5ecbplus.4: On Dec. 16, the Bush administration allowed agencies to waive such reviews if they decided, on their own, that the actions would not harm vulnerable plants and animals.
9_5ecbplus.5: Obama, who visited the Interior Department to commemorate its 160th anniversary, said he had instructed Interior and Commerce Department officials to review the Bush rules.
9_5ecbplus.6: In the meantime, according to the memorandum, officials should "follow the prior longstanding consultation and concurrence practices" that call for independent reviews.
9_5ecbplus.7: "The work of scientists and experts in my administration, including here at the Interior Department, will be respected, " Obama said.
9_5ecbplus.8: "With smart, sustainable policies, we can grow our economy today and preserve the environment. "
9_5ecbplus.9: Environmentalists and scientists welcomed the move, but business officials said it could delay federally funded projects that could help revive the nation's economy: All of them agreed it would prompt a second look at several initiatives adopted by the Bush administration in its final months in office.
9_5ecbplus.10: Earthjustice lawyer Janette Brimmer, whose group had challenged the Bush rule in federal district court in California, said she expected that the new administration would reexamine two pending projects: a Bureau of Land Management plan for overseeing Oregon's forests, which was finalized on Dec. 30 and could affect protected species such as the northern spotted owl; and construction of the White Pine coal - fired power plant in Nevada.
9_5ecbplus.11: "I think the Obama administration now is going to take a step back on these projects.
9_5ecbplus.12: It needs to bring science back into the equation, " Brimmer said, adding that her group will not drop its lawsuit until it can assess how the new policy is working.
9_5ecbplus.13: Francesca Grifo of the Union of Concerned Scientists, an activist group, said the switch would help guard against the potential conflicts of interest and lack of expertise that could color decision - making by any agency hoping to press ahead with a particular project.
9_5ecbplus.14: "After years of scientific scandal, the Interior Department and its partner agencies need desperately to regain credibility by making decisions with honesty, clarity and transparency, " Grifo said.
9_5ecbplus.15: But William L. Kovacs, the U. S. Chamber of Commerce's vice president of environment, technology and regulatory affairs, said that reviving another layer of review "will result in even greater delays to projects - - including stimulus - backed, job - creating projects - - as agencies now grapple with the prospect of lengthy interagency consultations to determine, for instance, if a bridge project in Florida contributes to the melting of Arctic ice.
9_5ecbplus.16: This is such a departure from the spirit and the letter of the Endangered Species Act that we wonder if the law's drafters would even recognize it today. "
9_5ecbplus.17: The latest policy shift follows several other administration actions revamping environmental policies, including a reexamination of fuel economy standards and offshore oil drilling; a new review of whether to grant California and other states the right to regulate greenhouse - gas emissions from vehicles; and the endorsement of a new international treaty negotiation on global mercury emissions.
9_5ecbplus.18: House Natural Resources Committee Chairman Nick J. Rahall II ( D - W. Va. ), who had been seeking to overturn Bush's endangered species rule through legislation, called the announcement "one more indication that the new administration truly represents change for the better and is committed to the protection of our natural resources and our environment. "
9_5ecbplus.19: Officials said the move is unlikely to trigger broad use of the Endangered Species Act to regulate greenhouse - gas emissions.
9_5ecbplus.20: While the Bush rule specifically prohibited endangered species consultations on the basis of "global processes" such as climate change, an Interior official speaking on the condition of anonymity said that under the new policy, such a review would be triggered only if scientific evidence suggested "a causal connection" between emissions from a federal project and its effect on an imperiled species or an identifiable part of its habitat.

43_8ecbplus.0: AMD Acquires SeaMicro – Big Bet on Architectural Shift for Servers
43_8ecbplus.1: Summary: Rich Fichera looks at the risks and potential rewards of AMD's recent acquisition of innovative server startup SeaMicro.
43_8ecbplus.3: At its recent financial analyst day, AMD indicated that intended to differentiate itself by creating products that were advantaged in niche markets, with specific mention, among other segments, of servers, and to generally shake up the trench warfare that has had it on the losing side of its lifelong battle with Intel ( my interpretation, not AMD management ’ s words ).
43_8ecbplus.4: Today, at least for the server side of the business they made a move that can potentially offer them visibility and differentiation by acquiring innovative server startup SeaMicro.
43_8ecbplus.5: SeaMicro has attracted our attention since its appearance ( blog post 1, blog post 2 ), with its innovative architecture that dramatically reduces power and improves density by sharing components like I / O adapters, disks and even BIOS over a proprietary fabric.
43_8ecbplus.6: The irony here is that SeaMicro came to market with a tight alignment with Intel, who at one pint even introduced a special dual - core packaging of their Atom CPU to allow SeaMicro improve its density and power efficiency.
43_8ecbplus.7: Most recently SeaMicro and Intel announced a new model which featured Xeon CPUs to address the more mainstream segments that were not a for SeaMicro ’ s original Atom - based offering.
43_8ecbplus.8: So what does AMD hope to gain from this acquisition?
43_8ecbplus.9: The strategic goal is a differentiated server architecture into which they can insert AMD silicon and IP.
43_8ecbplus.10: The SeaMicro architecture shares many of the characteristics of the Calxeda / HP Redstone architecture, and can potentially allow AMD to produce reference architecture for its system partners to leverage that gives them significant density advantages over any conventional x86 server offering.
43_8ecbplus.11: Since this architecture is initially targeted at dense computing environments such as those found in Web 2. 0, cloud service providers and similar workloads, as well as potentially at conventional HPC, the prospects for AMD are interesting.
43_8ecbplus.12: Long - term success will hinge on several interlocking factors:
43_8ecbplus.13: 1. How much will AMD focus this offering on the ultra - dense space that SeaMicro started addressing versus trying to also take a bite out of the enterprise space?
43_8ecbplus.14: 2. How aggressively will they scale it?
43_8ecbplus.15: The SeaMicro fabric does not extend beyond the single enclosure boundary, but that appears to be an implementation decision, not a fundamental architectural issue.
43_8ecbplus.16: My personal belief is that fabric - based servers are the wave of the future, with SeaMicro Calxeda / HP serving as very significant guidelines for future development.
43_8ecbplus.17: Scaling the fabric first for management and then for actual data traffic for shared I / O and eventually for coherent memory operations if needed is a natural progression.
43_8ecbplus.18: 3. What other IP will AMD add?
43_8ecbplus.19: AMD has an interesting portfolio of GPU technology as well as CPU, and the incorporation of GPU technology could provide further differentiation in niche markets.
43_8ecbplus.20: AMD has a choice of ways to monetize this IP, from selling systems based on its own processors ( possibly as early as late this year ) to providing reference designs and / or licensing the architecture or selling components like the fabric ASICs.
43_8ecbplus.21: 4. Will they also support ARM processors?
43_8ecbplus.22: If AMD becomes the source of licensed IP for vendors wanting to chase HP in ultra - dense servers, they can also make money by licensing their technology and selling components for non - x86 architectures.
43_8ecbplus.24: At least one of Intel ’ s partners, HP, already has a fabric - based dense server design that can support x86.
43_8ecbplus.25: Will Intel develop a similar reference architecture in the hopes that their major systems partners will adopt it?
43_8ecbplus.26: All in all, many ways this could play out, but a bold move and one that may serve to trigger a rapid change in the types of servers available to users over the next 24 months.
