8_7ecbplus.0: 3 dead after protesters torch Greek bank
8_7ecbplus.2: Three people died in a burning bank as tens of thousands of protesters took to the streets of Athens during a general strike over the Greek government's planned spending cuts.
8_7ecbplus.3: Some protesters tried to storm parliament while others threw petrol bombs at police and torched buildings in protest against new austerity measures and a decision to raise taxes to meet the conditions of its international bailout.
8_7ecbplus.4: A petrol bomb hurled at an Athens branch of the Marfin Investment Bank killed two women and a man who were caught in the resulting inferno.
8_7ecbplus.5: It was always going to be hard to convince Greeks that ripping $43 billion out of their public services and hiking their taxes was a necessary consequence of the international bailout.
8_7ecbplus.6: As the Greek prime minister George Papandreou looked out from his parliamentary office, he saw exactly how angry they were.
8_7ecbplus.7: "We are all deeply shocked by the unjust death of three of our citizens - citizens that were victims of a raw, murderous act, " Mr Papandreou said.
8_7ecbplus.8: A professor of economics at the University of Athens, Yanis Varoufakis, did not go to work today because it was not safe.
8_7ecbplus.9: But he rode his bicycle into the city to survey the aftermath of the day's mass demonstration.
8_7ecbplus.10: "What I did witness was the battlefields after the troops had departed, " he said.
8_7ecbplus.11: "There were a few still burning or smoking cars, a couple of fire engines that had been torched, a building that belongs to the finance ministry - not far away from home - was completely burned down.
8_7ecbplus.12: "Otherwise, it was an empty city without people. "
8_7ecbplus.13: Professor Varoufakis blames angry youths for the violence and deaths.
8_7ecbplus.14: "It seems it was a large demonstration, which unfortunately was infiltrated by the usual band of 100 or 200 professional [ trouble - makers ], " he said.
8_7ecbplus.15: "They're the ones who created the circumstances for the death, the tragic death and loss of those three people. "
8_7ecbplus.16: But Professor Varoufakis says there is "a very deep sense of injustice" across Greece.
8_7ecbplus.17: "In the foreign media, even the local media, there is a portrayal of the Greek people living above their means, who are lazy, who are not working.
8_7ecbplus.18: The truth, as always, is quite different from appearances, " he said.
8_7ecbplus.19: "This is a country of incredibly hard - working people, people who have two and three jobs in order to make ends meet.
8_7ecbplus.20: "Greece is also a country with the highest degree of poverty outside of Latvia in the whole of Europe, not just the eurozone, and it is a country in which a great deal of money was made over the last 10 - 20 years, but it was highly concentrated in a very small percentage of the population.
8_7ecbplus.21: "The rest have been struggling through the good times, through times of economic growth, to survive.
8_7ecbplus.22: Not to have a good life but just to survive, and they are the ones who now have to foot the bill for the economic collapse. "
8_7ecbplus.23: As Athens burned, many in Berlin were still fuming about having to foot most of the bill for Greek profligacy.
8_7ecbplus.24: German Chancellor Angela Merkel addressed parliament, raising her voice above the catcalls and angry hecklers from the opposition parties.
8_7ecbplus.25: "This is about nothing less than the future of Europe and with it the future of Germany in Europe, " she said.
8_7ecbplus.26: Approval ratings for the chancellor have dropped six points since the aid package for Greece was announced.
8_7ecbplus.27: Ms Merkel might pay a higher political price on the weekend when crucial regional elections are held.

39_9ecbplus.0: Peter Capaldi as 'Doctor Who': A return to distinguished tradition?
39_9ecbplus.2: And as the world ( or one obsessed subset thereof ) watched, the name of the person to play the Twelfth Doctor - though not, of course, the name of the Doctor, which shall remain unspoken - was revealed.
39_9ecbplus.3: Peter Capaldi, the bookmakers' choice by a wide margin, will take over for the retiring Matt Smith, the Doctor since 2010.
39_9ecbplus.4: Smith's Doctor will regenerate into Capaldi's - same character, just a different body - this Christmas.
39_9ecbplus.5: The new star of "Doctor Who" is best known to Americans, which is not to say well known, as the F - bombing spin doctor in Armando Iannucci's political comedies "The Thick of It" ( BBC series ) and "In the Loop" ( film spinoff ) and, reaching back through the foggy mists of time, for Bill Forsyth's gentle comedy of Scotland, "Local Hero. "
39_9ecbplus.6: He is, at any rate, better known to us than were his immediate predecessors, Christopher Eccleston, David Tennant and Smith, when they assumed the role.
39_9ecbplus.7: He has twice appeared in the Whoniverse, as a first - century businessman in "The Fires of Pompeii" and a tragic figure at the center of the spun - off "Torchwood" miniseries, "Children of Earth. "
39_9ecbplus.8: He also appears in "World War Z" as a World Health Organization, or WHO, doctor.
39_9ecbplus.9: You felt a little chill then, didn't you?
39_9ecbplus.10: The announcement came Sunday, after months of public speculation and wish - listing, conspiratorial sifting of coincidence and readings of tea leaves, near the end of "Doctor Who Live: The Next Doctor, " a BBC special that aired here simultaneously on BBC America.
39_9ecbplus.11: It is not to be confused with the big 50th anniversary special set for November.
39_9ecbplus.12: With Fifth Doctor Peter Davison ( the cricket - sweater Doctor ) and elderly companion Bernard Cribbens as its main in - studio star power and a floating Tardis ( police - box shaped time machine, for the uninitiated ) introduced as a "special guest, " it was, global interest aside, a small - scale, essentially local, even provincial, event.
39_9ecbplus.13: Because whatever else the new Doctor would turn out to be - and, if recent history was any guide he would turn out to be tall, thin, white, clean - shaven, not bald and unconventionally attractive ( check, check, check, check, check and check ) - it was going to be somebody British.
39_9ecbplus.14: As does James Bond, "Doctor Who" posits a world in which the U. K. is still at the center of things.
39_9ecbplus.15: It's where the aliens arrive, and the Earth is repeatedly saved.
39_9ecbplus.16: Some had hoped for a black Doctor ( Idris Elba was often named ), or a female Doctor ( Olivia Colman, perhaps ), and as with other great and important offices, it does seem only right that it be open to anyone, regardless of gender or color.
39_9ecbplus.17: Indeed, if it seemed just possible this time, it's hard to believe the next Doctor won't break one of those lines, or both.
39_9ecbplus.18: That Capaldi is an award - winning actor of great reputation does not necessarily mean that it will be any easier for him to take control of the Tardis.
39_9ecbplus.19: Every new Doctor represents a testing of the brand and a testing of the faithful; there are viewers still mourning the loss of David Tennant ( No. 10 ), and undoubtedly some who feel nothing's been as good since Tom Baker ( No. 4 ) quit, back in 1981.
39_9ecbplus.20: It is also, and not incidentally, a test of the show runner, Steven Moffat, who came in with Smith, following series - rebooter Russell T Davies.
39_9ecbplus.21: Show runners are a thing we know about now; we know whom to blame, and Moffat draws a fair share.
39_9ecbplus.22: Still, first reactions seem on the whole approving, though some younger online commenters bemoaned Capaldi's age - 55, the age of William Hartnell when he created the role, back in 1963.
39_9ecbplus.23: Fangirls who crushed on the younger Eccleston, Tennant and / or Smith wondered how they would adapt to a Doctor old enough to be their dad.
39_9ecbplus.24: There is, of course, plenty of precedent for gray - haired swashbucklers ( your Gandalf, actually called Gray, your Obi - wan Kenobi, your very vibrant Third Doctor, John Pertwee ).
39_9ecbplus.25: And Moffat can always create companions for raw youth appeal, as was the original custom.
39_9ecbplus.26: ( Hartnell's Doctor traveled with a granddaughter. )
39_9ecbplus.27: Certainly, Capaldi represents a change from Matt Smith - thought by some to be too young for the part when he took over, ironically - but he also offers a range of new tonal possibilities, some of which are also old possibilities.
39_9ecbplus.28: Moffat may be more of a "Who" classicist than Davies, who brought sex, romance and a will - they - won't - they element to the series.
39_9ecbplus.29: It may be time for the return of a more fatherly Doctor.
39_9ecbplus.30: If you look back across the whole life of the series, Capaldi seems very much in the tradition - a likely, almost obvious choice.
39_9ecbplus.31: He has the authority, the madness, the sweetness.
39_9ecbplus.32: At the same time, we don't know how Moffat plans to write him.
39_9ecbplus.33: The doctor is as constant as the stars and as changeable as the wind; he is a warrior clown, comical and stern, a thousand - year - old child, a tenderhearted soul who loves humanity and yet is renowned across the universe as the scourge of worlds.
39_9ecbplus.34: ( Typically, these are worlds that deserve a scourge. )
39_9ecbplus.35: There is a lot of room to play in there.
39_9ecbplus.36: Fans - especially British fans, whose allegiance spans decades and generations, speak of "my Doctor" as if every citizen needs to have a favorite - do have strong ideas about what the Doctor should be.
39_9ecbplus.37: But variety is in his nature, and in choosing to take this ride, we agree to accept the authenticity of the latest anointed choice - a choice no more in our hands, after all, than it is in the Doctor's.
39_9ecbplus.38: He is always surprised by who he next finds himself to be.
39_9ecbplus.39: For most viewers the Doctor shapes himself to the actor, even as the actor shapes the part.
39_9ecbplus.40: You want to honor the tradition, naturally, and you can't afford to alienate your audience.
39_9ecbplus.41: Still, fear of change is a poor basis for creative decision - the point, Moffat told Hero Complex recently, was to bring the world around: 'You want people to go, 'No, that would never work! '. ..
39_9ecbplus.42: And they always get wrenched out of their comfort zone, and then they find the Doctor again.
39_9ecbplus.43: And there's such a range of what the Doctor can be. "

35_4ecbplus.0: Charger Jamal Williams arrested on suspicion of DUI
35_4ecbplus.2: For the second time in less than a month, a member of the San Diego Chargers has been arrested on suspicion of drunk driving.
35_4ecbplus.3: According to the California Highway Patrol, defensive tackle Jamal Williams was arrested on suspicion of drunken driving last weekend on a freeway outside downtown.
35_4ecbplus.4: Williams, who was booked into county jail and later released on bail, did give a blood sample for a blood - alcohol test.
35_4ecbplus.5: However the results have not yet been divulged.
35_4ecbplus.6: Just last month, wide receiver Vincent Jackson, who was on probation for a previous DUI arrest, was pulled over for investigation of DUI.
35_4ecbplus.7: That arrest was just five days prior to the team's second - round playoff loss at Pittsburgh.
35_4ecbplus.8: In a statement released by the team, General Manager A. J. Smith noted, "It's disappointing to hear about the issue involving Jamal Williams.
35_4ecbplus.9: We'll continue to monitor the situation and let the legal process run its course.
35_4ecbplus.10: The Chargers have always been leaders and positive contributors to our community.
35_4ecbplus.11: We take our stature in the community very seriously. "
35_4ecbplus.12: While everyone is human, this appears to be yet another case of a professional athlete not using the matter that is provided to all of us between our ears.
35_4ecbplus.13: With more and more professional athletes making news these days, and oftentimes not for the right reasons, it is no wonder many people have trouble relating with the pros.
35_4ecbplus.14: Salaries that the common man generally doesn't see and an attitude of not caring in many cases is just part of the problem.
35_4ecbplus.15: While Williams and Jackson are presumed innocent, hopefully both of them learn a lesson.
35_4ecbplus.16: At the end of the day, their alleged actions not only impact them, but that family of four, the couple out on a date, or the guy returning home from his work shift.
35_4ecbplus.17: When you get behind the wheel of your car drunk, you could ruin more than just your life.

22_3ecbplus.0: CHARGED WITH MURDER: What most of the liberal media won't tell you about the "very spiritual' female Kraft employee who shot three co - workers
22_3ecbplus.1: The woman who allegedly shot three co - workers — killing two– at the Kraft Plant Thursday night has been charged with murder, attempted murder, aggravated assault, burglary, and other related charges, says Philadelphia District Attorney Seth Williams.
22_3ecbplus.2: The victims and alleged shooter in the last night ’ s Kraft plant shooting had a history of arguing that dates back several years — the suspect thought her co - workers were spraying chemicals on her and talking behind her back, according to police.
22_3ecbplus.3: Yvonne Hiller, 43, got into an altercation with the two women and a male co - worker Thursday night, was taken to the supervisor ’ s office, suspended and escorted out of the building. .
22_3ecbplus.4: Ten minutes after being taken off the job, Hiller drove her car to the security gate and forced her way in at gunpoint, police say, and headed back up to the third floor armed with her. 357 Magnum, which she has a permit to carry.
22_3ecbplus.5: She went to the employee lounge, saw four of her co - workers — three of with whom she ’ d just had the altercation.
22_3ecbplus.6: The fourth person told her to get out of the lounge.
22_3ecbplus.7: She shot the other three, police say.
22_3ecbplus.8: Bryant Dalton, 39, was shot in the neck and is hospitalized in critical condition.
22_3ecbplus.9: Latonya Brown, 36, was shot in the head and Tanya Wilson, 47, was shot in the side.
22_3ecbplus.11: Kenneth Dorsey says the woman accused of killing two co - workers and critically injuring a third at the Kraft plant in Northeast Philly is a good person.
22_3ecbplus.12: And so were the two women she ’ s accused of gunning down with a. 357 Magnum, just minutes after she ’ d been suspended and escorted from the building.
22_3ecbplus.13: “ We talked about her Muslim faith and I wished her happy Ramadan, ” Dorsey said.
22_3ecbplus.14: “ I never thought in my deepest heart that it would come down to this, ” Dorsey said.
22_3ecbplus.15: The reason Hiller was suspended had not been made public Friday afternoon and while some co - workers said she had a history of run - ins with other workers and management, Dorsey said like anyone, they sometimes had their differences, but always got along.

23_3ecbplus.0: English and Australian climbers fall to their deaths in New Zealand mountains
23_3ecbplus.1: One Australian and one English climber have fallen to their deaths in New Zealand.
23_3ecbplus.3: Police Inspector Dave Gaskin said the two incidents on consecutive days in the Aoraki - Mt. Cook National Park were not related and were not due to bad weather.
23_3ecbplus.4: He said they come as a reminder that climbers need to use extreme caution.
23_3ecbplus.5: On Friday, 36 - year - old Duncan Rait died after slipping and falling about 200ft from a ridge near the Tasman Glacier.
23_3ecbplus.6: The New Zealand - born Australian was planning to do some ski touring.
23_3ecbplus.7: He ’ d been dropped off by helicopter with a group and was walking to a hut when he fell, sliding down a steep slope and over a cliff.
23_3ecbplus.8: Gaskin said that other climbers attempted to rescue Raite by taking him down the glacier, but that he died on the way down.
23_3ecbplus.9: On Saturday, 32 - year - old Englishman Robert Buckley, originally from Essex, but living in Christchurch, fell about 2, 000ft while climbing to a small hut on Mount Sefton with three companions.
23_3ecbplus.10: Gaskin said Buckley was wearing crampons but was inexperienced.
23_3ecbplus.11: Police said that Mr Buckley's group appeared to be "insufficiently" equipped and inexperienced for the climb they chose.
23_3ecbplus.12: "They had hired some climbing equipment early that day and had managed to get within 80 meters of the bivvy, " police said.
23_3ecbplus.13: "At this stage. .. one of the party has slipped on the ice and has fallen some 700 metres to his death. "

42_5ecbplus.0: T - Mobile BlackBerry Q10 Pre - Order Begins April 29th for Business Customers
42_5ecbplus.2: T - Mobile today announced that the BlackBerry Q10 will be added to its growing 4G LTE smartphone portfolio.
42_5ecbplus.3: Beginning April 29th, business customers interested in registering for the BlackBerry Q10 can visit http: / / business. t - mobile. com / blackberry - q10.
42_5ecbplus.4: Additional details, including availability and pricing, will be shared at a later date.
42_5ecbplus.5: General consumers can expect the BlackBerry Q10 to become available later on in May.

5_5ecbplus.2: Mo ran the Sixers in the 1980s as their point guard.

23_11ecbplus.0: New Zealand: British Climber Killed In Fall
23_11ecbplus.2: A 32 - year - old British climber, described as "lacking experience", dies after falling from a mountain in New Zealand.
23_11ecbplus.3: A British man has been killed after falling around 2, 000ft while climbing in New Zealand.
23_11ecbplus.4: Robert Buckley, 32, was climbing to a small hut on Mount Sefton in the Aoraki - Mt Cook National Park on Saturday.
23_11ecbplus.5: He was wearing crampons but was inexperienced, local police inspector Dave Gaskin said.
23_11ecbplus.6: His body was recovered by a team of rescuers on Sunday afternoon after previous attempts proved unsuccessful.
23_11ecbplus.7: Three climbers who were with Mr Buckley were rescued after spending the night on the mountain.
23_11ecbplus.8: They were also released after being examined by medics.
23_11ecbplus.9: Mr Gaskin said: "There was a lot of snow and ice in very steep conditions.
23_11ecbplus.10: "It appears as if the party were insufficiently equipped and inexperienced for the climb they had undertaken. "
23_11ecbplus.11: Mr Buckley's death came a day after 36 - year - old Duncan Raite died when he slipped and fell around 200ft from a ridge in the same national park.
23_11ecbplus.12: The New Zealand - born man, who lived in Australia, had been dropped off by helicopter and was walking to a hut when he fell in the Tasman Glacier area.
23_11ecbplus.13: Mr Gaskin said the deaths were a reminder that climbers needed to use extreme caution.
23_11ecbplus.14: He said: "I can't speak for the first death, but in this case it looks like to be a lack of experience. "
23_11ecbplus.15: A Foreign Office spokeswoman said: "We are aware of the death of a British man in New Zealand.
23_11ecbplus.16: "We are providing consular assistance at this time. "

19_5ecbplus.0: 'There ’ s a lot of anger here': Riot breaks out in Brooklyn following candlelight vigil for 16 - year - old shot by cops
19_5ecbplus.1: Memorial for Kimani 'Kiki' Gray, who was fatally wounded by police Saturday after allegedly pointing a gun in their direction, turned ugly as nearly 100 angry mourners clashed with cops, tossing bottles and creating a melee.
19_5ecbplus.4: Anger over the death of a Brooklyn teenager shot and killed by police fueled a riot on the streets of East Flatbush Monday — projectiles were hurled at cops, car windows were smashed and a pharmacy customer had a bottle bashed over his head.
19_5ecbplus.5: The scenes of violence on blocks near the NYPD ’ s 67th Precinct stationhouse followed a protest march that grew out of a candlelight vigil for Kimani ( Kiki ) Gray, 16, killed by police bullets on Saturday.
19_5ecbplus.6: In the aftermath of the riot, as police were trying to secure the area and assess damage to stores along streets strewn with broken glass, City Councilman Jumaane Williams called for Police Commissioner Raymond Kelly and Mayor Bloomberg to visit the community.
19_5ecbplus.7: “ There ’ s a lot of anger here, ” said Williams, whose district includes the riot zone.
19_5ecbplus.8: “ This isn ’ t just from one particular shooting.
19_5ecbplus.9: A whole community has not been heard for far too long. ”
19_5ecbplus.10: Kelly visited the precinct stationhouse about 12: 30 a. m. Tuesday — more than four hours after the chaos began — but did not speak to reporters.
19_5ecbplus.11: The vigil for Kimani was held at E. 52nd St. and Tilden Ave. , the location of the shooting, which has caused tensions to simmer in the community, in part because the boy ’ s family contests police allegations that he was armed with a handgun.
19_5ecbplus.12: Starting at about 8 p. m. , nearly 100 people set off from the vigil site to march the more than 20 blocks to the precinct stationhouse, on Snyder Ave. near Nostrand Ave.
19_5ecbplus.13: But the procession, peaceful at first, turned into a wild confrontation between furious marchers and cops after a faction broke off from the group and began to smash car and store windows with rocks and jump on the tops of vehicles, police sources and witnesses said.
19_5ecbplus.14: “ I was sitting in my living room, ” said Mary John, 43, who witnessed destruction near E. 31st St. and Church Ave.
19_5ecbplus.15: “ People were standing up on vehicles.
19_5ecbplus.16: I saw them take garbage from the sidewalk and throw it onto the street.
19_5ecbplus.17: I saw someone take a TV and smash it into my neighbor ’ s car.
19_5ecbplus.18: They were throwing rocks at the cars.
19_5ecbplus.20: What ’ s going on here? ’ ” she continued.
19_5ecbplus.21: “ They were calling out, ‘ Rest in peace, Kiki. ’
19_5ecbplus.23: Abdoulaye Barry, 24, who works at African Movies, at Church Ave. and E. 31st St. , described how rioters tried to storm the business.
19_5ecbplus.24: He said he was outside, saw rioters causing mayhem in the streets, and rushed back to urge his co - workers to lock the store ’ s gates.
19_5ecbplus.25: Rioters rushed the entrance, fighting with workers as they struggled to lock the roll - down gates, he said.
19_5ecbplus.27: But they locked themselves into the store from the inside.
19_5ecbplus.28: Firefighters later had to cut the gates to liberate them.
19_5ecbplus.29: “ It was like the end of the world, ” Barry told the Daily News.
19_5ecbplus.30: “ That ’ s the first time something like that had happened here. ”
19_5ecbplus.31: At a Rite Aid drug store on Church Ave. near Albany Ave. , which had about 60 people inside at the time, at least one rioter physically assaulted a customer — cracking him over the head with a glass bottle.
19_5ecbplus.32: He was rushed to Kings County Hospital and listed in stable condition later, a police spokeswoman said.
19_5ecbplus.33: A manager of the store was also assaulted; he refused medical attention, the spokeswoman said.
19_5ecbplus.34: There were unconfirmed reports the store was looted; the police spokeswoman said only that the cash registers were not robbed.
19_5ecbplus.35: When cops finally managed to block the mob ’ s progress, about a block from the 67th Precinct stationhouse, rioters began pitching glass bottles at police officers as they moved in on the crowd, a police source said.
19_5ecbplus.36: One person threw a garbage can at a cop, the source added.
19_5ecbplus.37: “ They ’ re acting rowdy and calling us racist, ” said a police officer at the scene.
19_5ecbplus.38: As rioters fled into the night and protestors began making their way back toward E. 52nd St. , Williams joined the fray and tried to prevent more violence.
19_5ecbplus.39: “ The mayor and the [ police ] commissioner should be down here.
19_5ecbplus.41: Williams, a critic of NYPD policy, said before Kelly appeared on the scene.
19_5ecbplus.42: “ There ’ s a feeling that they don ’ t really care.
19_5ecbplus.43: They are leading and policing for one portion of this city.
19_5ecbplus.44: But they ’ re not paying attention to the other parts; they ’ re not listening to them. ”
19_5ecbplus.45: Public Advocate Bill de Blasio, a Democratic candidate for mayor this year, also came to the area Monday night.
19_5ecbplus.46: “ I understand if young people are frustrated, but we have to help them understand the way to deal with it should be a peaceful way, ” he said.
19_5ecbplus.47: “ They have every right to protest — that ’ s the American way. ”
19_5ecbplus.48: Williams said he was not surprised by the riot, only that it hadn ’ t happened before.
19_5ecbplus.49: Critics of the NYPD ’ s controversial stop - and - frisk policy argued it leads to distrust of the police by the black community because its members are stopped in such high numbers.
19_5ecbplus.50: “ When something happens, we should be able to trust the police and what they say, ” Williams said.
19_5ecbplus.51: “ Police officers shooting black men, black men shooting black men, it ’ s a problem that needs to be dealt with.
19_5ecbplus.52: If they want to ignore it, it ’ s just going to keep happening. ”
19_5ecbplus.53: Following the shooting death of Kimani on Saturday, police officials said he flashed a gun at a pair of plainclothes cops who approached a stoop where he and others were hanging out.
19_5ecbplus.54: Police said a loaded. 38 - caliber revolver was recovered at the scene — but family of the slain teen, who was hit multiple times by police bullets, vehemently deny that he was carrying a weapon.
19_5ecbplus.55: Before the riot Monday, a police source told The News that investigators believe Kimani was a member of the Bloods street gang.
19_5ecbplus.56: The source pointed to two YouTube videos, published last year, that featured violence between Bloods and Crips.
19_5ecbplus.57: The source said Kimani appears in both videos, which The News has refrained from publishing due to graphic content.
19_5ecbplus.58: In one video, Kimani is clad in a red Adidas hoodie and goes by the nickname “ Shapow, ” the source said.
19_5ecbplus.59: He can be seen taunting and hitting a 13 - year - old rival on Nostrand Ave. near Glenwood Rd. in Flatbush after the adversary flashed gang signs and said he runs with the Crips.
19_5ecbplus.60: Kimani also swiped a beaded necklace from the Crip and then stomped on it, the video shows, while his friends in the background identified themselves as Bloods.
19_5ecbplus.61: The second video captured an apparent Crips retaliation following the smackdown.
19_5ecbplus.62: A group of self - identified Crips stormed a McDonald ’ s on Utica Ave. and Ave. H in Flatbush after they spotted Kimani and other alleged Bloods inside, according to the video.
19_5ecbplus.63: After a minute of heckling and heated exchanges inside the McDonald ’ s, the Crips retreated outside.
19_5ecbplus.64: They mocked Kimani for refusing to come out into the parking lot.

5_9ecbplus.0: Agent says Sixers to sign Dalembert to six - year deal
5_9ecbplus.2: Samuel Dalembert agreed to a six year deal with the Philadelphia 76ers on Saturday, his agent Marc Cornstein, told ESPN. com.
5_9ecbplus.3: Cornstein refused to disclose the amount of the contract, but it's believed to be worth between $60 million to $70 million, based on previous negotiations.
5_9ecbplus.4: The signing came just one day before Dalembert was set to get on a plane and visit the Atlanta Hawks, who had the money under the cap to pay him a maximum five - year, $70 million offer.
5_9ecbplus.5: Of the three top big men on the market, Dalembert was the center with the most upside.
5_9ecbplus.6: He has great range and is athletic, with great shot blocking instincts.
5_9ecbplus.7: He's shown he can be a volume rebounder and his offensive game is emerging.
5_9ecbplus.8: He was very inconsistent at times this season, but in the playoffs against the Detroit Pistons, he played the part of a franchise center.
5_9ecbplus.9: The Sixers made a power move this offseason, firing head coach Jim O'Brien, who wasn't a Dalembert fan, and replacing him with Mo Cheeks, who is.
5_9ecbplus.10: Philly let it be known that O'Brien was fired, in part, because the Sixers are committed to Dalembert.
5_9ecbplus.11: This is the third deal for the Sixers this summer.
5_9ecbplus.12: They also reached six - year deals with Kyle Korver for $25 million and with Willie Green for about $20 million.

34_6ecbplus.0: President Nominates Regina Benjamin, MD to Serve as Surgeon General
34_6ecbplus.1: Rural Family Physician Featured in NLM's "Changing the Face of Medicine" Exhibition
34_6ecbplus.2: President Obama has nominated Alabama physician Dr. Regina Benjamin to be US Surgeon General.
34_6ecbplus.3: Dr. Benjamin is one of the outstanding American women physicians profiled in NLM's 2003 - 2005 exhibition, "Changing the Face of Medicine. "
34_6ecbplus.4: Her biography appears at: http: / / www. nlm. nih. gov / changingthefaceofmedicine / physicians / biography _ 31. html.
34_6ecbplus.5: With support from the American Library Association, "Changing the Face of Medicine" is traveling the nation through November 2010.
34_6ecbplus.6: You can view the itinerary at: http: / / www. nlm. nih. gov / hmd / about / exhibition / travelingexhibitions / ctfom. html.
34_6ecbplus.7: Dr. Benjamin, who has held leadership positions statewide and nationally, has long provided medical care on the Gulf Coast.
34_6ecbplus.8: In 1990, she founded Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic in the fishing village of Bayou La Batre, Alabama.
34_6ecbplus.9: Her clinic was battered by Hurricane Georges in 1998 and Hurricane Katrina in 2005, but Benjamin rebuilt it each time and continued to offer medical care to the village's 2, 500 residents.
34_6ecbplus.10: Many of her family practice patients are uninsured, according to the MacArthur Foundation, which last year awarded her one of its prestigious $500, 000 "genius" grants.
34_6ecbplus.11: Her patient population includes immigrants from Vietnam, Cambodia and Laos, who comprise a third of Bayou La Batre's population.
34_6ecbplus.12: Benjamin received a bachelor's degree in 1979 from Xavier University of Louisiana, attended Morehouse School of Medicine from 1980 to 1982 and received a doctor of medicine degree from the University of Alabama at Birmingham in 1984.
34_6ecbplus.13: She completed her residency in family practice at the Medical Center of Central Georgia in 1987 and has served as CEO of the Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic since its founding in 1990.
34_6ecbplus.14: She earned a master's degree in business administration in 1991 from Tulane University.
34_6ecbplus.15: Dr. Benjamin also served as the associate dean for rural health at the University of South Alabama's College of Medicine and as president of the State of Alabama Medical Association from 2002 to 2003.
34_6ecbplus.16: She is the first woman, first African American woman and first person under age 40 to sit on the board of trustees of the American Medical Association, serving from 1995 through 1998.
34_6ecbplus.17: The U. S. Surgeon General serves as America's chief health educator by providing Americans the best scientific information available on how to improve their health and reduce the risk of illness and injury.
34_6ecbplus.18: In carrying out all responsibilities, the Surgeon General reports to the Assistant Secretary for Health, who is the principal advisor to the Secretary of Health and Human Services on public health and scientific issues.
34_6ecbplus.19: The US Surgeon General also serves on the NLM Board of Regents as an ex officio member.

22_1ecbplus.0: Co - Worker Calls Alleged Shooter: "Very Spiritual"
22_1ecbplus.3: She's a hard worker, works very hard.
22_1ecbplus.5: Kenneth Dorsey says the woman accused of killing two co - workers and critically injuring a third at the Kraft plant in Northeast Philly is a good person.
22_1ecbplus.6: And so were the two women she's accused of gunning down with a. 357 Magnum, just minutes after she'd been suspended and escorted from the building.
22_1ecbplus.7: Dorsey's been at the plant for 37 years and worked on the third floor with the three victims and the alleged shooter, Yvonne Hiller.
22_1ecbplus.8: "They had argued, from what I was told, they argued, " Dorsey told NBC10's Rosemary Connors after the shootings Thursday night.
22_1ecbplus.9: "I had just started my job, you know and I heard like bang, bang, but you hear noises everyday at a bakery so you don't pay any mind. "
22_1ecbplus.10: Then a co - worker yelled, "Come on, you got to leave now!
22_1ecbplus.12: After the shootings, Hiller holed up in an office on the second floor where the SWAT team found her after co - workers who were hiding in the office next door tipped off building security.
22_1ecbplus.13: "I never thought in my deepest heart that it would come down to this, " Dorsey said.
22_1ecbplus.14: Some co - workers said she had a history of run - ins with other workers and management, Dorsey said like anyone, they sometimes had their differences, but always got along.
22_1ecbplus.15: "We talked about her Muslim faith and I wished her happy Ramadan, " Dorsey said.
22_1ecbplus.16: "I might be wrong, but my guess is she had some people that she had issues with and a personal agenda, a score she had to settle. "
22_1ecbplus.17: Dorsey said the shooting was going to be hard on everyone.
22_1ecbplus.19: "Tell your audience to keep the families in your prayers, however you pray - - whether you're Jewish, Christian, Muslim - - we're all in shock. ..
22_1ecbplus.20: and I lost two of my closest friends. ..
22_1ecbplus.21: I'm gonna go home and take a shower and read the Bible and pray.
22_1ecbplus.22: Hopefully, I can get through this.

24_9ecbplus.0: Crooks at $2. 6 million heist on Paris jewelry store
24_9ecbplus.1: A smash - and - grab on a high end Paris store saw four robbers make off with jewelry and watches valued at over $2. 6 million early Monday.
24_9ecbplus.2: At around 4: 30 a. m. local time ( 11. 30 p. m. ET ) the thieves rammed an SUV into the front of the Casty store, near the prestigious Place Vendome, a well - known square in the center of the French capital that is home to a number of jewelers and high - end stores.
24_9ecbplus.3: After scooping up jewelry and watches estimated to be worth 2 million euros ( $2. 6 million ) the thieves reversed their car out of the store and set fire to it before making off in another vehicle, Le Monde reported.
24_9ecbplus.4: The raid comes little over a month after a masked bandit made off with an $136M worth of diamonds and jewels from the Carlton Intercontinental Hotel in Cannes on the glamorous French Riviera, in possibly the world ’ s biggest heist.
24_9ecbplus.5: A lone robber entered through a French door at the side of the building on the famed La Croisette seafront, scooped up the loot and then jumped out of another window.
24_9ecbplus.6: Despite a huge police investigation, the audacious culprit remains at large.
24_9ecbplus.7: Thieves also targeted the annual Cannes film festival, stealing almost $2 million of jewelry from the safe in the hotel room of an American jeweler working for Chopard, one of Switzerland ’ s most famous diamond merchants.
24_9ecbplus.8: Days later a $2. 5 million necklace was lifted by a crook at a movie industry party at the even more exclusive resort of Cap d ’ Antibes, near the Italian border.

20_10ecbplus.1: Did the earth move for you?
20_10ecbplus.2: Because it didn't down here at Cell Block G. Dubai experienced a slight "tremor" today, after a more serious earthquake in Southern Iran, resulting in the evacuation of Emirates Towers and a few other scrapers:
20_10ecbplus.3: "Witnesses in high - rise buildings said they felt the ground shaking beneath them for about a minute.
20_10ecbplus.4: Many residents evacuated their buildings and waited on the streets. "
20_10ecbplus.5: Expect endless earthquake experts in the papers tomorrow, such as the prophetic Dr Azm Al Homoud:
20_10ecbplus.6: "We should stop saying the UAE is not in an earthquake prone area.
20_10ecbplus.7: I must say we are near major epicentres across the Arabian Gulf and fall within the collision area. "
20_10ecbplus.8: Inmates in the far southern gulags miss out on everything.
20_10ecbplus.9: Cut off by distance, traffic and general lethargy: the forgotten folk in the shadow of the Jebel.

36_8ecbplus.0: The Strange Legal Trip of Polygamist Warren Jeffs
36_8ecbplus.2: Five years ago, Warren Jeffs was charged with sex crimes resulting from the polygamous marriages he arranged for his followers in the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints ( FLDS ).
36_8ecbplus.3: Jeffs then began a circular journey through the jailhouses and courtrooms of the west.
36_8ecbplus.4: This week, the self - styled prophet awoke to the promise of a change of scenery - but not a change of fortune.
36_8ecbplus.5: An Arizona judge dismissed the original charges against Jeffs, the very charges that had catapulted him into national headlines.
36_8ecbplus.6: But the dismissal has only cleared the way for Texas authorities to get their hands on him to face even more serious charges.
36_8ecbplus.7: "Extradition proceedings against Warren Jeffs have commenced, " Lauri Saathoff, a spokesperson for Texas Attorney General Greg Abbott told TIME.
36_8ecbplus.8: Jeffs has already spent more time in an Arizona county jail cell than he would have spent in prison if found guilty of the original charges: arranging and performing marriages between two underage girls and their older male relatives, thus being an accomplice to sexual misconduct with minors.
36_8ecbplus.9: The prosecutor in the case said the two victims no longer wanted to pursue the charges, making a prosecution impractical.
36_8ecbplus.10: Jeffs' attorney, Mike Picarretta, hinted at "irregularities" and said the cases would have been dropped years ago had they involved someone less well - known than his client.
36_8ecbplus.11: But he doesn't face imminent release.
36_8ecbplus.12: Arizona had put its charges on hold while Jeffs was prosecuted in Utah on similar charges.
36_8ecbplus.13: In September 2007 a Utah jury found him guilty of two counts of being an accomplice to rape by performing a marriage involving an underage girl.
36_8ecbplus.14: He was given two five - years - to - life terms, moved to Utah state prison and then back to Arizona to await trial on the charges in that state.
36_8ecbplus.16: State officials are not revealing when Jeffs, 54, will be moved, but Mohave County Sheriff Tom Sheahan is under Arizona court orders to act speedily.
36_8ecbplus.17: The sheriff says he hopes Jeffs will be out of his jail by this week's end.
36_8ecbplus.18: "He's been a problem inmate since we had him, " Sheahan told the San Angelo ( Texas ) Standard - Times.
36_8ecbplus.19: "Mr. Jeffs was a handful from day one with his self - inflicted hunger strikes. "
36_8ecbplus.20: Jeffs served as president and prophet of the Fundamentalist Church of the Jesus Christ of the Latter Day Saints after his father, Rulon Jeffs, died in 2002.
36_8ecbplus.21: In June 2005, days after being indicted in Arizona on the charges of being an accomplice to sexual conduct with a minor, Jeffs fled the Colorado City, Arizona, area, home to a large FLDS community.
36_8ecbplus.22: A warrant was issued for his arrest and he was placed on the FBI's 10 Most Wanted list.
36_8ecbplus.23: Fourteen months later, he was arrested outside Las Vegas, Nevada, and began his journey from court to court and jail to jail.
36_8ecbplus.24: Jeffs' defenders claim he is a victim of religious persecution.
36_8ecbplus.25: He has spent much of his time in jail talking about his faith, fasting and praying.
36_8ecbplus.26: Tall, slender, with a wide - eyed gaze that seems to compel allegiance among his FLDS followers, Jeffs is a calm presence in court, but his life behind bars has been more tumultuous.
36_8ecbplus.27: Ill from fasting, his knees bleeding and sore from prolonged prayer sessions, he has been hospitalized and force - fed several times.
36_8ecbplus.28: He has also been inconsistently penitent.
36_8ecbplus.29: "I am one of the most wicked men on the face of the earth since the days of Father Adam, " Jeffs can be heard saying on a tape recorded by authorities at the Purgatory Jail in St. George, Utah.
36_8ecbplus.30: Still, Jeffs' attorneys are pledging to fight extradition and also have an appeal of the Utah case pending before the state supreme court.
36_8ecbplus.31: They also may seek a new trial based on recently uncovered evidence - now under investigation by the Utah Attorney General's Office - that some medical records in the trial may not have been original documents, but reconstructed ones.
36_8ecbplus.32: Jeffs' legal team says the Utah case must be resolved before their client is moved to Texas.
36_8ecbplus.33: The ordeal also has been difficult for his alleged victims, says Roger Hoole, an attorney for Elissa Wall and Susie Barlow, former FLDS members and child brides.
36_8ecbplus.35: They are hated and they have been scapegoated" in the FLDS community, Hoole told TIME.
36_8ecbplus.36: The FLDS communities in northern Arizona and southern Utah have strong, deep roots to the region going back to the mid - 19th century.
36_8ecbplus.37: Many families bear the same name - evidence of generations of intermarriage - and former FLDS members say communal wealth is used by the leadership to maintain power and punish.
36_8ecbplus.38: Witnesses have refused to testify in the cases against Jeffs.
36_8ecbplus.39: Texas prosecutors have sidestepped that problem by using genetic evidence and extensive church documents seized during an April, 2008 raid at the FLDS Yearning for Zion Ranch in West Texas.
36_8ecbplus.40: Jeffs was indicted in July, 2008, by a Schleicher County grand jury in Eldorado, Texas, home to the YFZ Ranch.
36_8ecbplus.41: The state authorities removed more than 400 children from the ranch, plus boxes of evidence, some of which purport to show Jeffs kissing child brides.
36_8ecbplus.42: He is facing charges of aggravated sexual assault, sexual assault and bigamy charges which could result in at least one life sentence.
36_8ecbplus.43: If extradited, he will join 12 other FLDS defendants charged with similar offenses.
36_8ecbplus.44: In a steady march beginning last October, five FLDS members have been convicted of felonies and received sentences ranging from seven to 75 years.
36_8ecbplus.45: A sixth trial is just getting under way in the small Eldorado courthouse and six more men await trail - seven if Jeffs finds himself in a West Texas jail.

2_1ecbplus.2: Ellen DeGeneres just tweeted she will be hosting the Oscars this year.
2_1ecbplus.3: It will be her second stint in the job, after hosting the 2007 ceremony and earning an Emmy nomination for it.
2_1ecbplus.4: “ It ’ s official: I ’ m hosting the #Oscars!
2_1ecbplus.5: I ’ d like to thank @TheAcademy, my wife Portia and, oh dear, there goes the orchestra “, the comedian and talk show host said on her Twitter feed just now.
2_1ecbplus.6: The announcement of DeGeneres as host comes just a couple of days after the election of Cheryl Boone Isaacs, only the third woman to head the Academy in its 86 - year history.
2_1ecbplus.7: When she first hosted in 2007 it was noted that DeGeneres also became the first openly gay or lesbian host.
2_1ecbplus.8: Of course DeGeneres, a double - digit Emmy winner, was also nominated for an Emmy for her Oscar - hosting stint in the now - defunct category of Outstanding Individual Performance in a Variety or Music Program.
2_1ecbplus.9: She also famously hosted the Emmys in November 2001 after the show was canceled twice in the wake of the 9 / 11 tragedy.
2_1ecbplus.10: She returned to host the Emmys in 2005, just three weeks after Hurricane Katrina.
2_1ecbplus.11: She also hosted the Grammys in 1996 and 1997.
2_1ecbplus.12: Here ’ s the Academy ’ s official release:
2_1ecbplus.13: Television icon Ellen DeGeneres will return to host the Oscars® for a second time, producers Craig Zadan and Neil Meron announced today.
2_1ecbplus.14: The Academy Awards® will be broadcast live on Oscar Sunday, March 2, 2014, on the ABC Television Network.
2_1ecbplus.15: “ We are thrilled to have Ellen DeGeneres host the Oscars, ” said Zadan and Meron.
2_1ecbplus.16: She is beloved everywhere and we expect that the audience at the Dolby Theatre, and in homes around the globe, will be as excited by this news as we are. ”
2_1ecbplus.17: “ I am so excited to be hosting the Oscars for the second time.
2_1ecbplus.18: You know what they say – the third time ’ s the charm, ” said DeGeneres.
2_1ecbplus.19: “ It is an honor to welcome back Ellen DeGeneres as the host of the biggest entertainment celebration of the year, ” said Paul Lee, president, ABC Entertainment Group.
2_1ecbplus.20: DeGeneres hosted the 79th Academy Awards in 2007, for which she received a Primetime Emmy® nomination for “ Outstanding Individual Performance in a Variety or Music Program. ”

30_9ecbplus.0: MWEB updates customers on SEACOM downtime
30_9ecbplus.1: SEACOM downtime has local ISPs scrambling to keep customers online; MWEB issues an update
30_9ecbplus.3: Summary: MWEB has managed to restore 83% of the required capacity on SEACOM.
30_9ecbplus.4: P2P protocols will remain shaped to prioritise critical traffic.
30_9ecbplus.5: The SEACOM undersea cable, which provides a data link between South Africa, Europe and India, experienced downtime beginning on Saturday 8 October 2011, caused by a problem on a cable between Abu Talat ( Egypt ) and Marseilles ( France ).
30_9ecbplus.6: This outage will likely only be fully resolved sometime during the week beginning 17 October 2011.
30_9ecbplus.7: Meanwhile, local Internet Service Providers ( ISPs ) who use bandwidth on the SEACOM cable have been scrambling to implement contingency plans to keep their customers connected.
30_9ecbplus.8: MWEB operations has issued an update regarding the SEACOM downtime to its customers.
30_9ecbplus.9: "Some more bandwidth was brought online last night [ 10 October 2011 ] bringing us up to 83% of our required capacity.
30_9ecbplus.10: We allowed P2P traffic to run from midnight to 7am, after which it had to give way for critical traffic again. "
30_9ecbplus.11: "We are working on having the remaining capacity restored during the course of the day, after which all traffic priorities will return to normal, " said MWEB Operations.
30_9ecbplus.12: SEACOM has previously issued a statement on the current problem with the cable:
30_9ecbplus.13: "Initial estimates indicate that the total repair time will be around twelve days depending on weather conditions.
30_9ecbplus.14: This entails gaining the necessary permits and the actual repair time.
30_9ecbplus.15: A repair vessel has been notified of the call - out and mobilization will occur immediately once permits are received, " SEACOM said in an official statement.
30_9ecbplus.16: "The outage initially affected all SEACOM traffic to Europe, however SEACOM was able to restore some services by Saturday afternoon [ 8 October 2011 ]. "
30_9ecbplus.17: "Further restoration has continued throughout the weekend in cooperation with customers and partners and SEACOM will continue to actively work on securing additional capacity for all necessary services over the next day or two. "

42_7ecbplus.0: T - Mobile Confirms it Will Carry BlackBerry Q10
42_7ecbplus.2: For those of you who have been waiting for BlackBerry's new Q10 handset, that wait is getting shorter.
42_7ecbplus.3: T - Mobile has announced that it will be carrying the keyboard touting Q10, with pre - registration starting on April 29th.
42_7ecbplus.4: Pricing and release dates are still TBD, but by signing up for alerts on T - Mobile's website you will be one of the first to know.
42_7ecbplus.5: If BlackBerry's release of the Z10 to business customers first is any sign, we may very well see the same approach when it comes to releasing the Q10, meaning that normal consumers may have to wait a little longer for their chance to purchase one of the devices.
42_7ecbplus.6: Although release details are still absent, this e - mail assures us that T - Mobile will in fact be carrying the Q10 in the future.
42_7ecbplus.7: The Q10 has been previously rumored to be released sometime in May, which seems reasonable given the timing of T - Mobile's announcement today, as well as BlackBerry's announcement of the device making its way to Canada on May 1st.
42_7ecbplus.9: T - Mobile today announced that the BlackBerry Q10 will be added to its growing 4G LTE smartphone portfolio.
42_7ecbplus.10: Beginning April 29th, business customers interested in registering for the BlackBerry Q10 can visit http: / / business. t - mobile. com / blackberry - q10.
42_7ecbplus.11: Additional details, including availability and pricing, will be shared at a later date.

43_7ecbplus.0: AMD to Acquire Microserver Startup SeaMicro for $334 Million
43_7ecbplus.2: Advanced Micro Devices on Wednesday announced a deal to acquire startup SeaMicro, a maker of microservers and data center fabric technology, for $334 million.
43_7ecbplus.3: SeaMicro chief executive Andrew Feldman will become general manager of a newly formed AMD business unit called Data Center Server Solutions.
43_7ecbplus.4: "SeaMicro's leading - edge fabric technology together with AMD Opteron processors point the way to a compelling roadmap for the cloud data center market, " said Lisa Su, senior vice president and general manager of AMD's Global Business Units, in a discussion with reporters at the chip maker's Sunnyvale, Calif. headquarters ahead of the announcement.
43_7ecbplus.5: The company will continue to honor SeaMicro's existing relationships with its own partners, Su said, and will sell SeaMicro - branded servers, which currently use server chips made by AMD archrival Intel.
43_7ecbplus.6: Feldman, who also spoke with media Wednesday, said SeaMicro's technology was "processor - agnostic, " so incorporating AMD's Opteron processors and even non - x86 instruction sets and architectures in future products would be easy to do.
43_7ecbplus.7: AMD representatives said they believed SeaMicro's unique supercompute fabric was a major innovation in data center technology, characterizing the platform as a "new server building block" which would increasingly make its way into the growing cloud infrastructure space.
43_7ecbplus.8: "When you're talking about the ability to tie together large amounts of processor cores, hundreds and even thousands, within a server system, there aren't a lot of choices out there [ in terms of competitors ], particularly if you want to bring Ethernet over it and disk traffic over it, there's just us, " said Feldman, describing his company's technology.
43_7ecbplus.9: "Nobody else can move both Ethernet and disk traffic, because they have very different requirements, " he added.
43_7ecbplus.10: Feldman said SeaMicro's suitors were numerous in the days leading up to the AMD acquisition and included more than just semiconductor companies.
43_7ecbplus.11: In recent months, Intel and other companies had spoken highly of the innovative startup.
43_7ecbplus.12: "We were fortunate that when we began speaking with AMD, they had far and away the most sophisticated view on fabrics, " he said.
43_7ecbplus.13: "They had already done extensive work on what a next - generation fabric could look like.
43_7ecbplus.14: They were kindred spirits and when you find that, you can move very quickly.
43_7ecbplus.15: And they really moved with dazzling speed. "
43_7ecbplus.16: AMD president and chief executive Rory Read also addressed the deal in a statement, saying that the SeaMicro acquisition would accelerate "AMD's transformation into an agile, disruptive innovator capable of staking a data center leadership position. "

37_2ecbplus.0: 6. 1 - magnitude quake strikes Indonesia's Aceh province
37_2ecbplus.2: A powerful 6. 1 - magnitude earthquake strikes the northern Indonesian province of Aceh, killing at least three people and injuring dozens more across the affected region.
37_2ecbplus.3: According to the US Geological Survey, the quake hit at a depth of 10 kilometers ( 6 miles ) in the Northern Province of Aceh.
37_2ecbplus.4: The epicenter was situated 55 kilometers ( 34 miles ) west of the town of Bireun on the western tip of Sumatra Island.
37_2ecbplus.5: Eyewitnesses and local residents say many homes and properties have collapsed or been damaged.
37_2ecbplus.6: "I see many houses were damaged and their roofs fell onto some people, " said Bensu Elianita, a 22 year - old resident in Bukit Sama village in Central Aceh district, adding, "Many people were injured but it is difficult to evacuate them due to traffic jams. "
37_2ecbplus.7: On April 20, a 6. 4 - magnitude earthquake jolted Indonesia's Maluku, but caused no casualties or material damage.
37_2ecbplus.8: On April 6, an earthquake measuring 7. 2 on the Richter scale struck eastern Indonesia's mountainous West Papua province.
37_2ecbplus.9: Indonesia is vulnerable to earthquakes since it is located on the Pacific Ring of Fire, a region known for its seismic and volcanic activity caused by friction between shifting tectonic plates.
37_2ecbplus.10: Last year, a 6. 4 - magnitude quake rocked the west coast of Sumatra Island, killing at least one person.
37_2ecbplus.11: An 8. 7 - magnitude earthquake also hit off the city of Banda Aceh in Sumatra Island in May 2012, triggering regional tsunami alerts.
37_2ecbplus.12: A strong quake off the shores of Indonesia triggered a tsunami that killed 230, 000 people in 13 countries around the Indian Ocean in 2004.

1_4ecbplus.0: Lindsay Lohan Checks Into Rehab, Checks Out Two Minutes Later
1_4ecbplus.2: The judge should know to never ever trust a gnome with a law degree, because they are shifty shits and will lie to you with a twinkle in their eyes.
1_4ecbplus.3: That ’ s exactly what LiLo ’ s lawyer Mark Heller did in court this morning.
1_4ecbplus.4: He told the judge that LiLo was “ ensconced in the bosom of ” rehab this morning when she was really buying crap at Fry ’ s in Fountain Valley, CA.
1_4ecbplus.5: The NYDN says that LiLo eventually made it to Morningside Recovery in Newport Beach, but two minutes after she walked through the door, she walked back through it and left.
1_4ecbplus.6: According to the NYDN, LiLo showed up to Morningside at around noon, spent a couple of minutes there, got spooked by the paparazzi ( uh huh ) and then jumped back into her SUV.

26_9ecbplus.0: Mafia 'Oddfather, ' Vincent 'Chin' Gigante, dies in U. S. prison at 77
26_9ecbplus.2: Vincent "The Chin" Gigante, the powerful mob boss who avoided jail for decades by wandering the Greenwich Village streets in a ratty bathrobe and slippers as part of an elaborate feigned mental illness, died Monday in prison, federal officials said.
26_9ecbplus.4: Gigante died at the U. S. Medical Center for federal prisoners in Springfield, Mo. , said prison spokesman Al Quintero.
26_9ecbplus.5: The cause of death was not immediately known, but Quintero said Gigante had a history of heart disease.
26_9ecbplus.6: Dubbed the "Oddfather" for his bizarre behavior, the former Genovese crime family head, an ex - boxer whose lengthy string of victories over prosecutors ended with a July 1997 racketeering conviction, finally admitted his insanity ruse at an April 2003 court hearing.
26_9ecbplus.7: After nearly a quarter - century of public craziness, Gigante calmly pleaded guilty to obstruction of justice for his deception.
26_9ecbplus.8: He then chatted amiably with his son, shook hands with defense lawyers and even laughed at one point.
26_9ecbplus.9: "God bless you, " he told the judge, offering a broad wave goodbye before leaving the Brooklyn courtroom.
26_9ecbplus.10: Gigante was jailed in the medical ward at the federal prison in Springfield - the same facility where rival mob boss John Gotti died.
26_9ecbplus.11: Denying he was a gangster, Gigante would wander the streets of his native Greenwich Village in nightclothes, muttering incoherently.
26_9ecbplus.12: Relatives, including a brother was who a Roman Catholic priest, insisted Gigante suffered from paranoid schizophrenia, dementia and Alzheimer's disease.
26_9ecbplus.13: Authorities charged it was a brazen act to avoid the law - although it wasn't until 1997 that a jury agreed, and it took another six years for Gigante to concede his subterfuge.
26_9ecbplus.14: At the height of his power, Gigante's empire stretched from the booths at Little Italy's San Gennaro Festival to the docks of Miami.
26_9ecbplus.15: "The looney tunes act served Gigante well - it kept him out of prison for 30 years - but in the end he was the victim of his own crazy act.
26_9ecbplus.16: He never had a chance to enjoy the fruits of his plunder, and he told some people that if given the chance, he wouldn't do it that way again, " said Jerry Capeci, a Mafia expert and author of six books on organized crime.
26_9ecbplus.17: For the man described by The New York Times Magazine as "the last great Mafioso of the century, " his admission was the final act in a 50 - year career spanning the era of the old - time, publicity - shy "Mustache Petes" and the modern - day Mafia of the swaggering Gotti.
26_9ecbplus.18: Gigante looked the part, a stocky figure with a pugilist's face and 1940s Brylcreem pompadour.
26_9ecbplus.19: Mob experts called him a traditional boss, trusted by others, who settled issues by whatever means - verbal or violent - were required.
26_9ecbplus.20: His fall from power was sealed in a Brooklyn courtroom where a parade of six turncoat mobsters, led by ex - Gotti underboss Salvatore "Sammy the Bull" Gravano, described "Chin's" power in the Genovese clan and the "Commission, " organized crime's ruling directorate.
26_9ecbplus.21: The trial was a spectacle, with Gigante in a wheelchair, mumbling silently, seemingly oblivious to the proceedings.
26_9ecbplus.22: His lawyers claimed they could not communicate in any "meaningful way" with a client who didn't know where he was, or why.
26_9ecbplus.23: At one point the trial turned into a "battle of the wheelchairs, " with testimony from Peter Chiodo, a 300 - plus - pound mobster who had survived a ganglaand execution only because his fat stopped a dozen bullets.
26_9ecbplus.24: None of that swayed jurors, who convicted Gigante of racketeering, extortion and plotting the murder - never carried out - of ex - mob associate Peter Savino.
26_9ecbplus.25: "Defendant has been consistently feigning insanity for many years and is still doing so in a shrewd attempt to avoid punishment for his crimes, " U. S. District Judge Jack B. Weinstein said in sentencing Gigante to 12 years in prison.
26_9ecbplus.26: "He is a shadow of his former self - an old man finally brought to bay in his declining years after decades of vicious criminal tyranny. "
26_9ecbplus.27: The verdict was a major blow to a Mafia already reeling from defections and convictions under the federal racketeering statute.
26_9ecbplus.28: Although Gigante allegedly ran the family from prison, the Genovese clan joined the city's four other mob families in disarray after he was jailed.
26_9ecbplus.29: Lawyer Michael Marinaccio, who led Gigante's defense team, said Monday that "putting aside the mental stuff, " Gigante had suffered from "a multitude of medical issues relating to the heart, " and had undergone open heart surgery twice, in 1988 and 1996.
26_9ecbplus.30: Recently when he complained of breathing difficulties, his family obtained a court order to have him treated at a hospital outside the prison until about two weeks ago, Marinaccio said in a telephone interview.
26_9ecbplus.31: "Vincent was very frail, and I have to say the prison medical care was substandard, no matter where he was, " Marinaccio said.
26_9ecbplus.32: "The family is very close, they made regular visits, and I feel especially bad for them, " he added.
26_9ecbplus.33: Born in the Bronx in 1928, one of five sons of Italian immigrant parents, Gigante was nicknamed "Chin" - short for "Vincenzo" - by his mother.
26_9ecbplus.34: He became a small - time boxer and drifted into the crime family founded in 1931 by legendary gangster Charles "Lucky" Luciano.
26_9ecbplus.35: In 1957, Gigante was the hitman in a botched attempt to assassinate then - boss Frank Costello.
26_9ecbplus.36: After refusing to name his attacker in court, the shaken Costello retired, making Gigante's patron, Vito Genovese, kingpin of the family that still bears his name.
26_9ecbplus.37: Over time, Gigante proved better at beating the law than Gotti, the so - called "Teflon Don" who won two acquittals before tapes and turncoats sent him to prison for life.
26_9ecbplus.38: Prior to 1997, Gigante had served only a five - year heroin rap in 1959.
26_9ecbplus.39: As boss, Gigante's watchword was secrecy.
26_9ecbplus.40: A sign at his headquarters warned, "Don't talk.
26_9ecbplus.42: He held Commission meetings in his mother's apartment house.
26_9ecbplus.43: Fellow mobsters, ordered never to say his name in public, referred to him by stroking their chins.
26_9ecbplus.44: He also turned his claim of mental illness - first used to escape trial in a 1970 police - bribery case - into a full - time strategy, behaving weirdly in public, checking into psychiatric treatment clinics whenever the FBI turned up the heat.
26_9ecbplus.45: There were comic - opera moments: Once, agents serving a subpoena found Gigante standing naked in the shower, holding an umbrella.
26_9ecbplus.46: Another time, upon spotting agents watching him, he fell to the sidewalk and prayed.
26_9ecbplus.48: In 1985 a federal crackdown on the Commission indicted 12 top hoodlums - but not Gigante, who some experts said was the actual leader.
26_9ecbplus.49: Yet even "Chin's" ruses were not always airtight; some mob cronies slipped up, and the FBI eventually obtained tapes of Gigante acting normally in private.
26_9ecbplus.50: Later, prison psychologists also said he appeared rational at times.
26_9ecbplus.51: Gigante had eight children by his wife and a mistress, both named Olympia.
26_9ecbplus.52: Relatives, led by Rev. Louis Gigante, his priest - brother and most ardent defender, filled three rows at the 1997 trial.
26_9ecbplus.53: Louis Gigante was in court when his brother finally admitted to faking his illness.

29_5ecbplus.0: Colts Beat Chiefs 20 - 13 To Clinch Playoff Berth
29_5ecbplus.2: The expectations placed upon Andrew Luck almost seemed unfair.
29_5ecbplus.3: Being the heir to Peyton Manning in Indianapolis is heady stuff for a rookie taking the reins of a franchise that won two games last season.
29_5ecbplus.4: Now, after guiding the Colts back to the playoffs – and breaking Cam Newton's single - season passing record for a first - year player – it's safe to say Luck exceeded just about all of them.
29_5ecbplus.5: Luck threw for 205 yards Sunday, and his 7 - yard touchdown pass to Reggie Wayne on third - and - goal late in the fourth quarter gave the Colts a 20 - 13 victory over the Kansas City Chiefs.
29_5ecbplus.6: That put them into the playoffs without worrying about anybody else.
29_5ecbplus.7: "Would we have done it without him? " Colts interim coach Bruce Arians asked.
29_5ecbplus.9: Luck broke Newton's record of 4, 051 yards passing in the second quarter.
29_5ecbplus.10: But it was extending his own rookie record for fourth - quarter comebacks to seven was more important.
29_5ecbplus.11: The Chiefs had rallied behind Jamaal Charles' 226 yards rushing to tie the game 13 - 13 heading into the fourth quarter.
29_5ecbplus.12: The Colts' defense stuffed quarterback Brady Quinn on fourth - and - inches to give Luck a chance.
29_5ecbplus.14: After a miserable stretch in which he connected on 1 of 13 passes, the fabulous freshman calmly led Indianapolis ( 10 - 5 ) downfield.
29_5ecbplus.15: He completed a key pass to T. Y. Hilton on third down and made two nice throws to Wayne before hitting the veteran in the back of the end zone.
29_5ecbplus.16: "We had so many opportunities all game, especially on third down, that we squandered, " Wayne said.
29_5ecbplus.18: That was the opportune time to do it. "
29_5ecbplus.19: Darius Butler returned an interception 32 yards for the Colts' other touchdown, helping them join the 2008 Miami Dolphins as the only teams to win at least 10 games after losing 14 or more the previous season.
29_5ecbplus.20: Most of those wins have come under Arians, who has filled in admirably while Chuck Pagano underwent treatment for leukemia.
29_5ecbplus.21: Pagano is expected to rejoin the Colts this week.
29_5ecbplus.23: That's all I can say, " Arians said.
29_5ecbplus.24: "Without getting emotional again, knowing that ( Pagano ) is going to be back Monday, the work week shouldn't be as stressful. "
29_5ecbplus.25: Charles' big day included an 86 - yard touchdown run on the first play of the second half.
29_5ecbplus.26: It was his second 200 - yard game of the season, and came one week after he managed 10 yards on nine carries against Oakland.
29_5ecbplus.27: "It was fun today, competing out there and doing it while we were trying to come back, " Charles said.
29_5ecbplus.28: "It was fun going out there and putting out a performance like that. "
29_5ecbplus.29: Charles joined the Titans' Chris Johnson and former Lions great Barry Sanders as the only players with three runs of 80 or more yards in a season.
29_5ecbplus.30: His third career 200 - yard game also set a franchise record, which he had shared with Larry Johnson.
29_5ecbplus.31: Peyton Hillis added 101 yards on the ground for the Chiefs ( 2 - 13 ), who had 352 yards rushing in a losing effort – the first time that's happened in NFL history.
29_5ecbplus.32: A big reason why was Quinn, who was just 10 of 22 for 162 yards with two interceptions.
29_5ecbplus.33: "This game was without a doubt, 100 percent on my shoulders, " he said.
29_5ecbplus.34: "You can't play the way I played today and win a football game. "
29_5ecbplus.35: His trouble began with the Chiefs' fifth offensive play, when he threw woefully behind Dexter McCluster – who wasn't even looking for the ball.
29_5ecbplus.36: Butler picked off the pass in stride, taking it untouched to the end zone for a 7 - 0 lead.
29_5ecbplus.37: Kansas City managed a field goal by Ryan Succop, but he missed his next try and the Colts went the other direction to set up the first of Adam Vinatieri's two field goals.
29_5ecbplus.38: Charles fumbled in the red zone later in the second quarter, and the Colts moved into Vinatieri's range for a 36 - yard field goal and a 13 - 3 halftime lead.
29_5ecbplus.39: Charles electrified a sparse crowd on the first play of the second half.
29_5ecbplus.40: He angled to the left and then found room down the sideline, cutting back toward the middle of the field and winning a foot - race with the Indianapolis defense for an 86 - yard touchdown run.
29_5ecbplus.41: The Chiefs were in position to take the lead later in the third quarter, but Quinn was picked off by Vontae Davis in the end zone.
29_5ecbplus.42: The defense forced a three - and - out and Kansas City was driving again before settling for Succop's tying 47 - yard field goal.
29_5ecbplus.43: The Chiefs got the ball back again late in the fourth quarter, but Quinn was stuffed on a quarterback sneak on fourth - and - inches from the Indianapolis 27.
29_5ecbplus.44: That turned the ball over to Luck, who completed an 11 - yard pass to T. Y. Hilton to convert a third down before he and Wayne won it.
29_5ecbplus.45: "At times it looked a little bleak, " Arians said.
29_5ecbplus.46: "Guys hung in there, made plays when they had to make them.
29_5ecbplus.47: Offensively we struggled, and then put together a drive, like we have all year. "
29_5ecbplus.48: Notes: Chiefs WR Terrance Copper ( left knee ) and DT Tyson Jackson ( left foot ) left with injuries. .. .
29_5ecbplus.49: Wayne had five catches to become the fifth player in NFL history with four 100 - catch seasons.
29_5ecbplus.50: He also became the 14th player to reach 13, 000 yards receiving.

9_6ecbplus.0: Obama Administration Flips Bush Endangered Species Ruling
9_6ecbplus.2: Federal agencies again will have to consult with government wildlife experts before taking actions that could have an impact on threatened or endangered species.
9_6ecbplus.3: The Obama administration said Tuesday it was overturning a rule change made in the final weeks of the Bush presidency.
9_6ecbplus.4: Officials at the Interior and Commerce departments said they have reimposed the consultation requirement that assured the government's top biologists involved in species protection will have a say in federal action that could harm plants, animals and fish that are at risk of extinction.
9_6ecbplus.5: Such consultation had been required for more than two decades until the Bush administration made it optional in rules issued last December, just weeks before the change in administrations.
9_6ecbplus.6: Environmentalists argued that the change severely reduced the protection afforded under the federal Endangered Species Act.
9_6ecbplus.7: "By rolling back this eleventh - hour regulation, we are ensuring that threatened and endangered species continue to receive the full protection of the law" and that top science will be the foundation of the decision making, said Interior Secretary Ken Salazar.
9_6ecbplus.8: Commerce Secretary Gary Locke added: "Our decision affirms the administration's commitment to using sound science to promote conservation and protect the environment. "
9_6ecbplus.9: Agencies in the two department's share responsibility for managing and enforcing the Endangered Species Act and employ the government's top scientists in species protection.
9_6ecbplus.10: In March, President Barack Obama issued an executive order putting the Bush rule change on hold.
9_6ecbplus.11: Congress followed by giving specific authorization for the Interior and Commerce departments to revoke the action, avoiding a long and complicated regulatory process.
9_6ecbplus.12: Environmentalists widely praised Tuesday's action, but some expressed dismay that Salazar didn't also rescind a rule that limits the protection to the polar bear, which last year was declared as "threatened" under the Endangered Species Act because of disappearing Arctic sea ice as a result of climate change.
9_6ecbplus.13: The Bush administration issued a rule that prohibits an agency from taking into account indirect adverse impacts on the polar bear from activities outside of the Arctic region: For example carbon dioxide emissions that are linked to global warming and, therefore, the loss of Arctic sea ice.
9_6ecbplus.14: Congress authorized that rule to be revoked as well, but the Interior Department said no decision had yet been made on the matter.
9_6ecbplus.15: "From our perspective the job is half done, " said Noah Greenwald of the Center for Biological Diversity, an advocacy group.
9_6ecbplus.16: "The polar bear's Arctic sea ice habitat is melting away.
9_6ecbplus.17: If the ( Bush ) special rule is not struck down the polar bear is likely to be the first large mammal to go extinct due to global warming in the United States. "
9_6ecbplus.18: The end of the long - standing requirement _ dating back to 1986 _ of interagency consultation with the Interior and Commerce agencies on endangered species protection produced a firestorm in both Congress and within the environmental and conservation communities.
9_6ecbplus.19: For years, agencies involved in thousands of federal activities _ from issuing clean air rules to approving highway or dam construction _ have had to consult not only their own experts but also biologists at the U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service or the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to ensure the activities did not harm plants, animals or fish that are protected by the Endangered Species Act.
9_6ecbplus.20: Developers and business groups argued that the consultation caused unneeded delays and increased the cost of projects.
9_6ecbplus.21: The Bush administration made the independent consultation optional, arguing that it was a minor shift in policy.
9_6ecbplus.22: One impetus for the rule change was concern by the Bush administration that the Endangered Species Act might be used as a back door to regulate greenhouse gases as a way to combat climate change.
9_6ecbplus.23: The Interior Department earlier had declared the polar bear a threatened species because of the loss of Arctic sea ice, a change attributed to global warming.
9_6ecbplus.24: Salazar and Lock said the two departments will jointly decide if any changes are needed to improve the interagency consultation procedures.
9_6ecbplus.25: The Fish and Wildlife Service, which is part of the Interior Department, has jurisdiction over plants and animals, while NOAA, part of the Commerce Department, deals with fish species that are at risk of extinction.

1_14ecbplus.0: Lindsay Lohan Checks Into Betty Ford Rehab – Where She 'Knows Everyone'
1_14ecbplus.3: Lindsay Lohan checked into the Betty Ford Clinic in Rancho Mirage, Calif. , on Thursday night, for what is to be a three - month stay, her rep confirms to PEOPLE.
1_14ecbplus.4: "And she showed up [ at Morningside Recovery ] in the morning and hated it.
1_14ecbplus.5: She is interested in going back to Betty Ford because she knows everyone there. "
1_14ecbplus.6: Lohan, who has been in rehab a total of five times before this, was previously in Betty Ford in 2010.
1_14ecbplus.7: Prior to this check - in to Betty Ford, which was first reported by TMZ. com, California prosecutors had said late Thursday that the troubled actress, 26, would be arrested if she continued to flout a court order to enter a rehab facility.

33_7ecbplus.0: Last moments of Brooklyn mother of 12 killed in crossfire caught on tape
33_7ecbplus.1: Zurana Horton, 34, was killed on Oct. 21, 2011 while walking near an intersection in Brownsville after 2 p. m.
33_7ecbplus.2: Andrew Lopez, 20, is the accused gunman who sprayed gunfire from a rooftop.
33_7ecbplus.4: A shocking video released for the first time Thursday captures the moment a Brooklyn mother of 12 was killed in a gang shootout as she picked her daughter up from school.
33_7ecbplus.5: The dramatic footage was shown at the trial of two local toughs charged with killing Zurana Horton, 34, on Oct. 21, 2011.
33_7ecbplus.6: At 2: 18 p. m. , Horton and two other moms are seen approaching a Brownsville intersection as a yellow school bus rolls up.
33_7ecbplus.7: A commotion breaks out as the three mothers and two children press up against a storefront for safety.
33_7ecbplus.8: Horton pushes a child out of the way, grips her chest, then collapses to the ground next to a pool of her own blood.
33_7ecbplus.10: I saw blood coming from her, " testified Unique Armstead, the mother in the video wearing a white jacket, seen enveloping herself around her son as they dive to the ground just feet from where Horton was killed.
33_7ecbplus.11: Armstead was shot in the left arm.
33_7ecbplus.12: Andrew Lopez, 20, is accused of firing indiscriminately at rival gang members from a nearby rooftop.
33_7ecbplus.13: His half - brother, Jonathan Carrasquillo, 24, who allegedly instructed Lopez to take care of their enemies, is also on trial for murder.
33_7ecbplus.14: Armstead, 32, testified that after she overheard someone say "he has a gun, " she took refuge inside a corner bodega with her son, who was celebrating his 11th birthday that day.
33_7ecbplus.15: They stepped out less than a minute later when it looked like the threat was over, she said, but then shots started to ring out.
33_7ecbplus.16: "I thought it was a brick but it was a bullet, " Armstead testified.
33_7ecbplus.17: "I told my son, 'I think I'm shot. ' "
33_7ecbplus.18: An 11 - year - old girl, Cheanne McKnight, was grazed in the cheek.
33_7ecbplus.19: Lopez is accused of spraying 13 shots on a Friday afternoon, just as schools were being let out.
33_7ecbplus.20: Horton's senseless death shook the city and highlighted the scourge of gun violence that plagues its hardscrabble neighborhoods.
33_7ecbplus.21: The two juries hearing the case - one for each defendant - showed little emotion as the disturbing tape was played in court.
33_7ecbplus.22: Horton's mother, Denise Peace, said she is now caring for five of her daughter's orphaned kids while their father is looking after seven others.
33_7ecbplus.23: Of the alleged gunman, she said, "He's a menace to society. "
33_7ecbplus.24: The trial will resume Monday with testimony from a man who purportedly told prosecutors he has been threatened with death by Lopez's brother.
33_7ecbplus.25: After the witness, who covered his face with a hoodie, was heard in an empty courtroom, the judge ruled he can testify in open court.
33_7ecbplus.26: But Justice Vincent DelGiudice made clear the witness is reluctant to take the stand.

1_12ecbplus.0: Lindsay Lohan is MIA after pretending to check into unlicensed Calif. rehab center
1_12ecbplus.2: “ The “ Mean Girls ” star fooled an L. A Superior Court judge, a Santa Monica prosecutor and apparently her own lawyer, by pretending to check into a rehabilitation facility, but chickening out when she got there.
1_12ecbplus.3: Prosecutor Terry White told The Post a couple hours after a court hearing — where Lohan ’ s lawyer Mark Heller said she was “ ensconced in the bosom ” of Morningside Recovery in Newport Beach — “ I hear she ’ s on her way to LAX and getting on a flight back to New York. ”
1_12ecbplus.4: Unfortunately, Morningside is unlicensed and photogs snapped her shopping for gadgets at the very moment of her alleged check in.
1_12ecbplus.5: Lohan reportedly pulled up to Morningside in an SUV but the vehicle left without the actress ever getting out.
1_12ecbplus.6: “ The facility that Lindsay is now in, that ’ s not a licensed residential drug treatment center, ” California Department of Alcohol and Drug Program deputy director Millicent Tidwell told The Post.

18_11ecbplus.2: A man suspected of shooting three people, killing one, at a suburban Detroit accounting firm from which he was fired last week was arrested after a high - speed chase a few hours after the attack this morning, authorities said.
18_11ecbplus.3: Police said they had located Anthony LaCalamita, 38, on the Interstate 75 highway, north of the office building where the shootings took place.
18_11ecbplus.4: Sheriff's deputies and state police chased him for 48km, including through a construction zone, at speeds up to 193km / h before he finally pulled over after about 15 minutes, Genesee County Sheriff Robert J Pickell said.
18_11ecbplus.5: "He probably realised if he didn't, he was going to be shot, " Undersheriff James Gage said.
18_11ecbplus.6: LaCalamita said nothing after officers surrounded him, Pickell said, describing the suspect as "subdued.
18_11ecbplus.8: Officers found a 12 - gauge pump - action shotgun and three live shells in the vehicle, Pickell said.
18_11ecbplus.9: Witnesses said the shooter used a shotgun or a rifle, Troy police Lieutenant Gerry Scherlinck said.
