18_11ecbplus.10: Some witnesses told police that when the shooter walked into the office on the building's second floor at about 10am today, he looked as if he was trying to hide something, Troy Police Chief Charles Craft said.
18_11ecbplus.11: Police could not say how many shots were fired.
18_11ecbplus.12: "I'm not positive all three of the people were targeted, but there appeared to be some purpose, " Craft said.
18_11ecbplus.13: The families of the two wounded men requested "total privacy", and the hospital would not release any details about their conditions, Beaumont Hospital spokeswoman Ilene Wolfe said.
18_11ecbplus.14: She said the third victim died on the way to the hospital.
18_11ecbplus.15: LaCalamita was listed among the professional staff on the website of Gordon Advisers, a public accounting and business consulting firm in the building.
18_11ecbplus.16: Calls to Gordon Advisers were not answered this afternoon, and a recording said the offices were closed.
18_11ecbplus.17: The 15, 800 - square - metre building houses a number of businesses, including law offices and the accounting firm.
18_11ecbplus.18: Police at first told workers to stay in their offices but a short time later evacuated the building, about 24km north of Detroit.
18_11ecbplus.19: Bill Adgate, who works at LPL Financial inside the building, said he had hunkered down inside the office for a couple of hours with furniture pushed up against the door.
18_11ecbplus.20: He said police told the group to stay put until officers allowed them to leave.
18_11ecbplus.22: I want to get out, " Adgate said by telephone.

34_11ecbplus.0: Regina Benjamin U. S. Surgeon General nominee
34_11ecbplus.2: President Barack Obama held a press conference, July 13, 2009 to announce his nominee for U. S. Surgeon General, Regina Benjamin.
34_11ecbplus.3: Here is the transcript of the announcement.
34_11ecbplus.4: President Barack Obama: Before I introduce America's next surgeon general, I'd like to say a few words about our ongoing efforts to reform the health care system that she will help oversee.
34_11ecbplus.5: We are now closer to the goal of health care reform than we have ever been.
34_11ecbplus.6: Over the last several weeks, key committees in the House and the Senate have made important and unprecedented progress on a plan that will lower costs, provide better care for patients and curb the worst practices of the insurance companies.
34_11ecbplus.7: It's a plan that will not add to our deficit over the next decade.
34_11ecbplus.8: Let me repeat that: It is a plan that will not add to our deficit over the next decade and eventually will help lower our deficit by slowing the skyrocketing costs of Medicare and Medicaid.
34_11ecbplus.9: Now, even though we are close, I've got no illusions that it's going to be easy to get over the finish line.
34_11ecbplus.10: There are going to be more debates and more disagreements before all is said and done.
34_11ecbplus.11: But health care reform must be done.
34_11ecbplus.12: I know there are those who believe we should wait to solve this problem or take a more incremental approach or simply do nothing.
34_11ecbplus.13: But this is the kind of criticism we heard when the country tried to pass Medicare, a program that is now providing quality care to generations of American seniors.
34_11ecbplus.14: It's the kind of criticism we heard when we tried to pass the Children's Health Insurance Program, which has provided quality care and coverage to millions of kids.
34_11ecbplus.15: It's the same Washington thinking that has ignored big challenges and put off tough decisions for decades.
34_11ecbplus.16: And it is precisely that kind of small thinking that has led us into the current predicament.
34_11ecbplus.17: So, make no mistake: The status quo on health care is no longer an option for the United States of America.
34_11ecbplus.18: If we step back from this challenge right now, we will leave our children a legacy of debt, a future of crushing costs that bankrupt our families, our businesses and, because we will have done nothing to bring down the costs of Medicare and Medicaid, will crush our government.
34_11ecbplus.19: Premiums will continue to skyrocket, placing what amounts to another tax on American families struggling to pay bills.
34_11ecbplus.20: The insurance companies and special interests that have killed reform in the past will only continue to benefit even more, and they'll continue to deny coverage to Americans with pre - existing medical conditions.
34_11ecbplus.21: People will continue to lose health insurance just because they lose their job or they change jobs.
34_11ecbplus.22: This is a future that we cannot afford.
34_11ecbplus.23: This country can't afford to have health care premiums rise three times faster than people's wages as they did over the last decade.
34_11ecbplus.24: We can't afford 14, 000 Americans losing their health care every single day.
34_11ecbplus.25: We can't afford a future where our government will eventually spend more on Medicare and Medicaid than what we spend on everything else.
34_11ecbplus.26: During the campaign I promised health care reform that would control costs, expand coverage and ensure choice, and I promised that Americans making $250, 000 a year or less would not pay more in taxes.
34_11ecbplus.27: These are promises that we're keeping as reform moves forward.
34_11ecbplus.28: This is no longer a problem we can wait to fix.
34_11ecbplus.29: This is about who we are as a country.
34_11ecbplus.30: Health care reform is about every family's health, but it's also about the health of the economy.
34_11ecbplus.31: So, I just want to put everybody on notice, because there was a lot of chatter during the week that I was gone: We are going to get this done.
34_11ecbplus.33: And for those naysayers and cynics who think that this is not going to happen, don't bet against us.
34_11ecbplus.34: We are going to make this thing happen because the American people desperately need it.
34_11ecbplus.35: And even those who are satisfied with their health care right now, they understand that if premiums keep on doubling and if employers keep on shedding health insurance because it's unsustainable, and if you look at the trajectory of where Medicare and Medicaid are going, then inaction will create the biggest crisis of all.
34_11ecbplus.36: And so I understand people are a little nervous and a little scared about making change.
34_11ecbplus.37: You know, the muscles in this town to bring about big changes are a little atrophied, but we're whipping folks back into shape.
34_11ecbplus.38: We are going to get this done.
34_11ecbplus.39: And if there's anyone who understands the urgency of meeting this challenge in a personal and powerful way, it is the woman who will become our nation's next surgeon general, Dr. Regina Benjamin.
34_11ecbplus.40: The list of qualifications that make Dr. Benjamin an outstanding candidate to be America's leading spokesperson on issues of public health are long indeed.
34_11ecbplus.41: She was in the second class at Morehouse School of Medicine and went on to earn an M. D. from the University of Alabama at Birmingham and an MBA from Tulane.
34_11ecbplus.42: She served as associate dean for rural health at the University of South Alabama College of Medicine, and in 1995, she became the first physician under 40 and the first African - American woman to be named to the American Medical Association's board of trustees.
34_11ecbplus.43: In 2002, she became president of Alabama's state medical association, and she has received numerous awards and recognitions, including the MacArthur genius award.
34_11ecbplus.45: But of all these achievements and experience, none has been more pertinent to today's challenges or closer to Regina's heart than the rural health clinic that she has built and rebuilt in Bayou La Batre.

5_4ecbplus.0: Philadelphia 76ers Fire Coach Jim O'Brien, Hire Maurice Cheeks
5_4ecbplus.2: Philadelphia 76ers President and General Manager Billy King announced today that Jim O'Brien has been relieved of his duties as head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers.
5_4ecbplus.3: No decision has been reached on O'Brien's staff at this time.
5_4ecbplus.4: O'Brien was hired as the 20th coach of the 76ers on April 21, 2004 and posted a record of 43 - 39 in 2004 - 05.
5_4ecbplus.5: Overall, in five seasons as an NBA head coach, O'Brien recorded a mark of 182 - 158 (. 535 ), including a record of 139 - 119 (. 539 ) with the Boston Celtics from 2000 - 04.
5_4ecbplus.6: O'Brien has served on the coaching staffs at seven different universities, including head coaching positions at Wheeling Jesuit College ( 1982 - 87 ) and University of Dayton ( 1989 - 94 ).
5_4ecbplus.7: He owns a 135 - 156 (. 464 ) record at the collegiate level in 10 seasons as a head coach.
5_4ecbplus.8: Also today, Philadelphia 76ers President and General Manager Billy King announced that Maurice Cheeks has been hired as the 21st head coach of the Philadelphia 76ers.
5_4ecbplus.9: Cheeks arrives in Philadelphia after three - plus seasons as head coach of the Portland Trail Blazers.
5_4ecbplus.10: He recorded a mark of 162 - 139 (. 538 ) in Portland, the fourth - highest win total in Blazers history.
5_4ecbplus.11: During his time in Portland, the Blazers reached the NBA Playoffs twice, and his 2002 - 03 squad tied for second in the Pacific Division with a 50 - 32 record.
5_4ecbplus.12: He joined the Blazers on June 27, 2001, after serving seven seasons as an assistant coach for the 76ers.
5_4ecbplus.13: Cheeks worked under head coaches John Lucas ( 1994 - 96 ), Johnny Davis ( 1996 - 97 ), and Larry Brown ( 1997 - 2001 ).
5_4ecbplus.14: In 2000 - 01 under Brown, Cheeks helped guide the 76ers to a record of 56 - 26 (. 683 ) and a spot in the NBA Finals.
5_4ecbplus.15: Cheeks, 48, logged an impressive 15 - year NBA career, spending 11 seasons in Philadelphia.
5_4ecbplus.16: The four - time All - Star ( 1983, '86, '87, '88 ) helped guide the 76ers to 10 playoff appearances, including a World Championship in 1983.
5_4ecbplus.17: In 133 career playoff games, he averaged 14. 4 points, 6. 9 assists, and 3. 4 rebounds while shooting 51. 2 percent from the field.
5_4ecbplus.18: Cheeks is also a five - time NBA All - Defensive Team honoree.
5_4ecbplus.19: The native of Chicago, Ill. , he averaged 11. 1 points, 6. 7 assists and 2. 1 steals in 1, 101 career games while shooting 52. 3 percent from the field and 79. 3 percent from the charity stripe.
5_4ecbplus.20: He retired in 1993 as the league's all - time leader in steals, and was fifth on the career assists list at that time.
5_4ecbplus.21: Currently, he ranks fourth in steals and eighth in assists all - time.
5_4ecbplus.22: Cheeks had his No. 10 76ers jersey retired on Feb. 6, 1995.
5_4ecbplus.23: The 1978 product of West Texas State was a four - year starter and three - time team MVP in college.
5_4ecbplus.24: He finished his collegiate career third on the Buffalos' all - time scoring list, averaging 16. 8 points per game.
5_4ecbplus.25: Cheeks was selected in the second round of the 1978 NBA Draft ( 36th overall pick ) by the 76ers.

7_7ecbplus.1: Wladimir Klitschko stops Tony Thompson in 6 with efficient execution
7_7ecbplus.2: Heavyweight champion Wladimir Klitschko once again displayed his dominance by scoring a sixth round stoppage against American contender Tony Thompson.
7_7ecbplus.3: Klitschko utilized good ring smarts and superior punching power to systematically break Thompson down.
7_7ecbplus.4: The first round started cautiously with both fighters becoming reacquainted with each other in a tentative feeling out process.
7_7ecbplus.5: Tony was exhibiting his trademark awkward movement and Wladimir was measuring him with the left rangefinder.
7_7ecbplus.6: It was a relatively even round without much action, but Klitschko landed the two best shots of the round even if Tony threw a little more.
7_7ecbplus.7: Thompson tried jumping on Wladimir to start the second but the champion was prepared.
7_7ecbplus.8: Klitschko followed this with a nice right hand followed by a short crisp combination.
7_7ecbplus.9: Later in the round another Klitschko right snuck in, and then a series of big rights backed the challenger into the ropes.
7_7ecbplus.10: Thompson was wrestled down to the canvas a couple of times in this stanza, and Wlad ’ s superior strength was evident.
7_7ecbplus.11: Klitschko was patient and measured, and his approach was paying off in round two.
7_7ecbplus.12: In between rounds Hall of Fame trainer Emanuel Steward told Klitschko he was mentally wearing Thompson down with pressure, and this certainly appeared to be the case.
7_7ecbplus.13: In round three Klitschko was again using his left hand to block jabs and establish range.
7_7ecbplus.14: Klitschko was looking almost exclusively for right hands, and was not using the authoritative jab we are accustomed to seeing because of Thompson ’ s awkwardness.
7_7ecbplus.15: Thompson was throwing jabs that were mostly being blocked or missing the mark.
7_7ecbplus.16: While it was obvious Thompson was having success in neutralizing Wlad's jab, he was also being peppered with Klitschko right hands that were inflicting far more damage than anything Thompson was throwing.
7_7ecbplus.17: Wladimir finally landed a solid jab almost halfway through the round, but his right hand was still the story of the fight.
7_7ecbplus.18: Thompson landed a decent left later in the round, but Klitschko was too elusive for him for the most part.
7_7ecbplus.19: It was another clear round for the champion.
7_7ecbplus.20: The fourth round was more of the same.
7_7ecbplus.21: The action was highlighted by a thudding right and a well timed combination from the champion.
7_7ecbplus.22: Before the start of the fifth, Steward urged Wladimir to throw more jabs and to spend less time waiting in between attacks.
7_7ecbplus.23: As has been the case many times in the past, Klitschko responded to Steward ’ s instructions and executed with workmanlike precision.
7_7ecbplus.24: He started landing the jab more, and this enabled him to score with a booming right hand that sent Thompson crashing to the canvas.
7_7ecbplus.25: Tony rose to his feet and the action resumed with about 20 seconds left.
7_7ecbplus.26: The challenger held on to survive, but this was perhaps the beginning of the end.
7_7ecbplus.27: Thompson came out to start the sixth and seemed to have regained his equilibrium.
7_7ecbplus.28: He was bouncing around, reacting to Klitschko ’ s feints, and mostly retreating in a defensive posture.
7_7ecbplus.29: As the round progressed he was trying to fling the jab out, but Klitschko was slowly measuring him up, cool as an assassin.
7_7ecbplus.30: Klitschko began throwing the infrequent jab and landing more big rights.
7_7ecbplus.31: Thompson was trying his best to survive, but then a vicious two - handed assault sent Thompson down for the second time.
7_7ecbplus.32: To his credit, he managed to rise to his feet, but the referee then waved it off.
7_7ecbplus.33: This was Klitschko ’ s second victory over Thompson, and with it he improves to 58 - 3 with 51 wins coming by way of knockout.
7_7ecbplus.34: Slowly but surely, Wladimir Klitschko is beginning to establish a strong legacy for himself.
7_7ecbplus.35: He may not always have the most crowd pleasing style, but he is intelligent, powerful, consistent, and extremely efficient at executing his game plan.
7_7ecbplus.36: The EPIX broadcast of the match made note of the following all - time heavyweight records in title fights:
7_7ecbplus.43: Now of course this includes Klitschko ’ s title reign as WBO champion as well as his current reign which began when he captured the IBF strap from Chris Byrd.
7_7ecbplus.44: Many critics will note that the WBO was not universally recognized in high regard at the time Klitschko held that title.
7_7ecbplus.45: Even still, however, Klitschko has won 16 fights in a row since losing to Lamon Brewster in April 2004, and he was won 13 title fights in a row since his April 2006 victory over Byrd.
7_7ecbplus.46: Beyond that, he has rarely lost a round during that impressive stretch.
7_7ecbplus.47: Given the current state of the heavyweight landscape, it is not inconceivable that Klitschko may well top that list before all is said and done.

44_12ecbplus.1: Hewlett - Packard Engineers Deal for EYP
44_12ecbplus.2: Hewlett - Packard agreed to buy EYP Mission Critical Facilities, a data center engineering firm, for an undisclosed sum in a deal that will provide an exit for TA Associates.
44_12ecbplus.3: The Boston private equity firm invested $57. 5 million in EYP Mission Critical in 2001.
44_12ecbplus.4: The target ’ s officials said at the time its post - money valuation was about $120 million.

22_11ecbplus.1: Female Employee Yvonne Hiller Kills Two In Kraft Shooting
22_11ecbplus.2: In a sad and surprising reversal of gender roles, a disgruntled woman opened fire at a Kraft factory in Philadelphia last night, killing two workers and wounding two others.
22_11ecbplus.3: The shooting happened moments after the employee, Yvonne Hiller, was suspended from her job at Kraft, where she ’ d worked for 15 years, the Daily News reports.
22_11ecbplus.4: After being escorted from the snack plant, she re - entered 10 minutes later with a handgun.
22_11ecbplus.5: About 100 people were in the building when she began shooting.
22_11ecbplus.6: Hiller was taken into custody after a standoff with the SWAT team.
22_11ecbplus.7: A Kraft representative confirmed Hiller is now in police custody and that one of the wounded employees is in the hospital.
22_11ecbplus.8: “ This is a sad time for the Kraft Foods family, ” a statement reads.
22_11ecbplus.9: “ We are working closely with the authorities as they investigate this situation, and our facility is closed until further notice. ”
22_11ecbplus.10: Unfortunately, the most surprising aspect of this incident is the shooter ’ s gender.
22_11ecbplus.11: Women shooters are rare but may be on the rise.
22_11ecbplus.12: In February, a woman opened fire at the University of Alabama, killing three and injuring several others.
22_11ecbplus.13: Reportedly, she was a professor whose tenure had been denied.
22_11ecbplus.14: Two years ago, a female college student committed a shooting at a Louisiana college.

36_2ecbplus.0: Polygamist leader Warren Jeffs sentenced to life in prison
36_2ecbplus.2: Polygamist leader Warren Jeffs was sentenced Tuesday to life in prison plus 20 years for sexually assaulting two girls he claimed were his "spiritual wives. "
36_2ecbplus.3: Jeffs, 55, will have to spend at least 45 years in prison before being eligible for release, according to Jerry Strickland, spokesman for the Texas Attorney General's office.
36_2ecbplus.4: The jury sentenced Jeffs to life in prison for aggravated sexual assault of a 12 - year - old girl and 20 years in prison for the sexual assault of a 15 - year - old girl.
36_2ecbplus.5: He must serve at least 35 years of the life sentence and half of the other sentence, Strickland said.
36_2ecbplus.6: The judge in the case ordered that the sentences be served consecutively.
36_2ecbplus.7: "Justice has been served, " Jeffs' nephew, Brent Jeffs, told InSession soon after the sentence.
36_2ecbplus.8: He testified during the penalty phase of his uncle's trial that Jeffs raped him when he was 5 years old.
36_2ecbplus.9: "I finally had this day and it was an awesome day in court to be here, involved in all of this, " said Brent Jeffs, now 28.
36_2ecbplus.10: Jeffs perverted his position as the head of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter - day Saints to "satisfy his own personal appetites and desires, " prosecutor Eric Nichols said.
36_2ecbplus.11: Those appetites included forcing sex on the two girls, 12 and 15, who he had taken as wives, prosecutors said.
36_2ecbplus.12: Audiotapes seized from his car and the church's Yearning For Zion Ranch compound in Eldorado, Texas, and played for jurors during his trial, depicted Jeffs offering "celestial marriage" instructions to the young wives, according to prosecutors.
36_2ecbplus.13: "You have to know how to be sexually excited and to help each other. .. and you have to be ready for the time I need your comfort, " a man's voice says.
36_2ecbplus.15: This is how you abide the law.
36_2ecbplus.16: At one point, the man says, "Take your clothes off.
36_2ecbplus.17: Do it right now, " followed by the sounds of crying.
36_2ecbplus.18: "Just don't think about the pain; you're going to heaven, " the man says.
36_2ecbplus.19: "Rarely if ever in the criminal justice system in Texas have we ever encouraged a person such as Warren Jeffs, whose criminal conduct spans decades, multiple jurisdictions and hundreds of victims, " Nichols said.
36_2ecbplus.20: A former member of the church, Rebecca Musser, said the verdict will not bring back lost innocence.
36_2ecbplus.21: But she said it can help others escape from abuse they may have suffered.
36_2ecbplus.22: "Whether the currency is God or greed, the trafficking of women and children for sex is a form of slavery, " she said.
36_2ecbplus.23: Jeffs is the eighth person from the ranch to be convicted on sexual assault, bigamy and other charges, according to the Texas Attorney General's office.
36_2ecbplus.25: Attorney General Greg Abbott said he believes authorities have rooted out the molesters from the ranch, but will continue to monitor the church's activities there.
36_2ecbplus.26: "We have an ongoing open investigation that will evaluate all evidence about any kind of wrongdoing out there at the compound whatsoever, " Abbott said.
36_2ecbplus.27: Jurors came back with the sentence after 30 minutes of deliberations Tuesday.
36_2ecbplus.28: They began their work Tuesday morning following brief closing statements by prosecutor Nichols.
36_2ecbplus.29: Jeffs, who has argued that he and his faith were being persecuted, instructed his attorneys to deliver no closing statement.
36_2ecbplus.30: "This is not the prosecution to persecute a people, this is a prosecution to protect a people, " Nichols told jurors.
36_2ecbplus.31: Jeffs did not attend the closing statement.
36_2ecbplus.32: In addition to tape recordings that the state said depicted sex acts with minors, prosecutors also presented evidence that Jeffs knew he was wanted by federal authorities and that his behavior would be shunned by outsiders.
36_2ecbplus.33: FBI Special Agent John Broadway testified that Jeffs ordered the destruction of various discs and transcripts three days after an arrest warrant was issued for him on June 10, 2005.
36_2ecbplus.34: The polygamist sect leader established "houses of hiding, " allegedly with young girls for him to marry, Broadway said.
36_2ecbplus.35: The FBI agent also read from a priesthood record, in which Jeffs allegedly wrote: "Things are happening so quickly.
36_2ecbplus.36: There is an even younger girl that the Lord wants me to take.
36_2ecbplus.38: For some reason the Lord is sending me these girls that can be worked with. "
36_2ecbplus.39: Jeffs also wrote: "If the world knew what I was doing, they would hang me from the highest tree, " according to evidence presented in court.
36_2ecbplus.40: Referring to that comment, prosecutor Nichols said during his closing statement that "Yes, this is Texas.
36_2ecbplus.41: But no, we don't hang convicts anymore from the highest tree, and we don't have the ability to call down the wrath of the Almighty. ..
36_2ecbplus.42: We as a people choose to isolate our worst offenders, to keep them away from their past and future victims. "
36_2ecbplus.43: Jeffs' breakaway sect is believed to have about 10, 000 followers.
36_2ecbplus.44: Their practice of polygamy, which the mainstream Mormon Church renounced more than a century ago, is part of the sect's doctrine.

37_14ecbplus.2: A strong earthquake struck Indonesia's Aceh province on Tuesday, killing at least one person and leaving two others missing.
37_14ecbplus.3: Many houses were damaged and dozens of villagers were injured.
37_14ecbplus.4: The magnitude - 6. 1 quake struck at a depth of just 10 kilometers ( six miles ) and its epicenter was located 55 kilometers ( 34 miles ) west of the town of Bireun on the western tip of Sumatra island, the US Geological Survey said.
37_14ecbplus.5: The worst - hit area was the district of Bener Meriah, where the quake caused a landslide that killed a man and left his wife and a young boy missing, said Fauzi, an official of the local disaster agency.
37_14ecbplus.6: "Dozens of people were injured and are being treated at three hospitals, " said Fauzi, who like many Indonesians uses a single name.
37_14ecbplus.7: He said at least 22 houses were badly damaged in the district.
37_14ecbplus.8: At least five people were reportedly injured and 10 houses were damaged in Takengon, the capital of Central Aceh district, said Sutopo Purwo Nugroho of the National Disaster Mitigation Agency.
37_14ecbplus.9: "I see many houses were damaged and their roofs fell onto some people, " said Bensu Elianita, a 22 - year - old resident in Bukit Sama village in Central Aceh district.
37_14ecbplus.10: "Many people were injured, but it is difficult to evacuate them due to traffic jams. "
37_14ecbplus.11: She said people in the village ran out from their houses in panic and screamed for help.
37_14ecbplus.12: At least two homes were totally flattened, she said, adding that the quake also caused a blackout in the village.
37_14ecbplus.13: The quake also caused panic among officials attending a meeting of the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation in Medan, the capital of neighboring North Sumatra province.
37_14ecbplus.14: The officials were escorted from the second - floor meeting room by security officers.
37_14ecbplus.15: Indonesia is prone to seismic upheaval due to its location on the Pacific Ring of Fire, an arc of volcanoes and fault lines encircling the Pacific Ocean.
37_14ecbplus.16: In 2004, a huge earthquake off Aceh triggered a tsunami that killed 230, 000 people across Asia.

6_9ecbplus.0: Gary Ross Won't Direct 'Hunger Games' Sequel
6_9ecbplus.2: Moviemaker Gary Ross has reportedly pulled out of negotiations to direct a sequel to "The Hunger Games. "
6_9ecbplus.3: Ross, who has wowed film fans and critics alike with his adaptation of the first book in author Suzanne Collins' trilogy, has officially decided not to return, according to The Playlist.
6_9ecbplus.4: Speculation about his successor for Catching Fire has begun with "The Hunger Games'" second - unit director Steven Soderbergh the early front - runner to take over the role.

35_5ecbplus.0: Chargers ’ Jamal Williams Arrested For DUI
35_5ecbplus.2: Chargers defensive tackle Jamal Williams was arrested early Sunday for suspicions of driving under the influence.
35_5ecbplus.3: Williams was pulled over by the California Highway Patrol for speeding in a San Diego freeway.
35_5ecbplus.4: He was given a blood alcohol test but the results have not been revealed.
35_5ecbplus.5: He was taken to the County jail where he was booked and released on bail.
35_5ecbplus.6: According to authorities, he was driving his Bentley at about 1: 00 am Sunday on highway 94 when the cops stopped him.
35_5ecbplus.7: This is the second DUI related arrest for the team.
35_5ecbplus.8: Earlier this year, star receiver Vincent Jackson was arrested for drunk driving a few days before their play - off game.

20_7ecbplus.0: Posted: Nov 27, 2005 8: 20 AM ET Last Updated: Nov 27, 2005 8: 10 PM ET
20_7ecbplus.1: An earthquake with a magnitude of at least 5. 9 hit southern Iran on Sunday, killing at least 10 people and injuring many others.
20_7ecbplus.2: The quake was centred near Qeshm Island, home to 200, 000 people, the U. S. Geological Survey said.
20_7ecbplus.3: Buildings were toppled in the island's capital, Qeshm City, as well as in the the villages of Tonban, Gavarzin and Khaledi.
20_7ecbplus.4: The main hospital on Qeshm was having trouble keeping up with the number of injured, Iran's official news agency IRNA said.
20_7ecbplus.5: It's "full of wounded, " the agency reported.
20_7ecbplus.6: The quake also shook the major port city of Bandar Abbas and was felt in nearby countries.
20_7ecbplus.7: In Oman and the United Arab Emirates, buildings were evacuated and people fled into the streets.
20_7ecbplus.8: An office worker in Dubai said the tremor lasted 30 seconds and was strong enough to shake buildings along the skyscraper - lined central business district.
20_7ecbplus.9: On Saturday, more than a dozen people were killed by a quake in eastern China.
20_7ecbplus.10: It destroyed thousands of buildings and left nearly half a million homeless.

35_9ecbplus.0: Hey, Jamal Williams: Hire a Driver!
35_9ecbplus.2: The City Attorney's Office is considering whether to file misdemeanor drunk - driving charges against Chargers defensive lineman Jamal Williams.
35_9ecbplus.3: Williams, 32, was pulled over for speeding in his Bentley on State Route 94 around 1: 30 a. m. on February 1, but was arrested on suspicion of drunk driving.
35_9ecbplus.4: He had refused a Breathalyzer test and was given a blood - alcohol test instead.
35_9ecbplus.5: The results from the test were released Wednesday and showed a level of 0. 07 percent - - just under the California legal limit of 0. 08 percent.
35_9ecbplus.6: CHP Officer Brian Pennings said that the blood had been drawn well after Williams' arrest, meaning he could have been intoxicated when officers had pulled him over.
35_9ecbplus.7: City Attorney spokeswoman Gina Coburn said the case remains under review and is being investigated further.

5_8ecbplus.0: Jim O'Brien was terminated from his position as head men's basketball coach at Ohio State University following the disclosure that he loaned a recruit's mother money.
5_8ecbplus.1: O'Brien sued, claiming he was terminated without cause, and both parties filed motions for summary judgment.
5_8ecbplus.2: The court of claims denied the motions because there was a factual dispute concerning what constituted a material breach under the employment contract.

41_2ecbplus.0: UNHCR condemns air attack on refugee camp in South Sudan
41_2ecbplus.2: The UN refugee agency on Friday strongly condemned the aerial bombing of a temporary refugee camp in South Sudan sheltering more than 20, 000 civilians fleeing from conflict in neighbouring Sudan's Nuba Mountains.
41_2ecbplus.3: "Two of the bombs fell within the Yida camp, including one close to the school, " said UNHCR spokesman Adrian Edwards.
41_2ecbplus.4: "Fortunately there were no casualties in the camp and we are verifying the situation of surrounding communities, " he told journalists in Geneva.
41_2ecbplus.5: UNHCR had been readying new refugee sites away from the border in Unity state when the incident occurred on Thursday.
41_2ecbplus.6: "We had hoped to begin the relocation of refugees but our efforts have so far been hampered by heavy rains which have made the road to the camp impassable, " Edwards explained.
41_2ecbplus.7: The refugee agency is concerned by the escalating tensions in the border areas between Sudan and South Sudan, where hundreds of thousands of civilians have been uprooted since June as a result of fighting.
41_2ecbplus.8: There are also reports this week of bombing in New Guffa village of South Sudan's Upper Nile state resulting in civilian casualties.
41_2ecbplus.9: As many as 55, 000 civilians originating from the Damazine and Kurmuk areas are said to be moving southwards in Sudan's Blue Nile state.
41_2ecbplus.10: Some of these people are heading to Chali within Blue Nile state.
41_2ecbplus.11: Others are crossing into New Guffa village, nine kilometres from the border, or Bunj, the capital of Maban county in South Sudan's Upper Nile state.
41_2ecbplus.12: Others may be moving into neighbouring Ethiopia, where more than 30, 000 Sudanese have found refuge and are being helped by UNHCR and its partners.
41_2ecbplus.13: New arrivals in Maban county describe empty villages south of Kurmuk town on the other side of the border.
41_2ecbplus.14: The new arrivals are being registered in Bunj, where UNHCR has a way station as well as a warehouse that holds enough supplies for 15, 000 refugees.
41_2ecbplus.15: UN assessment teams are planning to travel to Maban over the weekend to assess the humanitarian conditions for new arrivals.
41_2ecbplus.16: Meanwhile, local authorities have been identifying temporary reception sites as more arrivals are anticipated amid heightened tensions.

29_1ecbplus.0: Colts beat Chiefs 20 - 13 to clinch playoff berth
29_1ecbplus.2: The expectations placed upon Andrew Luck almost seemed unfair.
29_1ecbplus.3: Being the heir to Peyton Manning in Indianapolis is heady stuff for a rookie taking the reins of a franchise that won two games last season.
29_1ecbplus.4: Now, after guiding the Colts back to the playoffs - and breaking Cam Newton's single - season passing record for a first - year player - it's safe to say Luck exceeded just about all of them.
29_1ecbplus.5: Luck threw for 205 yards Sunday, and his 7 - yard touchdown pass to Reggie Wayne on third - and - goal late in the fourth quarter gave the Colts a 20 - 13 victory over the Kansas City Chiefs.
29_1ecbplus.6: That put them into the playoffs without worrying about anybody else.
29_1ecbplus.7: ''Would we have done it without him? '' Colts interim coach Bruce Arians asked.
29_1ecbplus.9: Luck broke Newton's record of 4, 051 yards passing in the second quarter.
29_1ecbplus.10: But it was extending his own rookie record for fourth - quarter comebacks to seven was more important.
29_1ecbplus.11: The Chiefs had rallied behind Jamaal Charles' 226 yards rushing to tie the game 13 - 13 heading into the fourth quarter.
29_1ecbplus.12: The Colts' defense stuffed quarterback Brady Quinn on fourth - and - inches to give Luck a chance.
29_1ecbplus.14: After a miserable stretch in which he connected on 1 of 13 passes, the fabulous freshman calmly led Indianapolis ( 10 - 5 ) downfield.
29_1ecbplus.15: He completed a key pass to T. Y. Hilton on third down and made two nice throws to Wayne before hitting the veteran in the back of the end zone.
29_1ecbplus.16: ''We had so many opportunities all game, especially on third down, that we squandered, '' Wayne said.
29_1ecbplus.18: That was the opportune time to do it. ''
29_1ecbplus.19: Darius Butler returned an interception 32 yards for the Colts' other touchdown, helping them join the 2008 Miami Dolphins as the only teams to win at least 10 games after losing 14 or more the previous season.
29_1ecbplus.20: Most of those wins have come under Arians, who has filled in admirably while Chuck Pagano underwent treatment for leukemia.
29_1ecbplus.21: Pagano is expected to rejoin the Colts this week.
29_1ecbplus.23: That's all I can say, '' Arians said.
29_1ecbplus.24: ''Without getting emotional again, knowing that ( Pagano ) is going to be back Monday, the work week shouldn't be as stressful. ''
29_1ecbplus.25: Charles' big day included an 86 - yard touchdown run on the first play of the second half.
29_1ecbplus.26: It was his second 200 - yard game of the season, and came one week after he managed 10 yards on nine carries against Oakland.
29_1ecbplus.27: ''It was fun today, competing out there and doing it while we were trying to come back, '' Charles said.
29_1ecbplus.28: ''It was fun going out there and putting out a performance like that. ''
29_1ecbplus.29: Charles joined the Titans' Chris Johnson and former Lions great Barry Sanders as the only players with three runs of 80 or more yards in a season.
29_1ecbplus.30: His third career 200 - yard game also set a franchise record, which he had shared with Larry Johnson.
29_1ecbplus.31: Peyton Hillis added 101 yards on the ground for the Chiefs ( 2 - 13 ), who had 352 yards rushing in a losing effort - the first time that's happened in NFL history.
29_1ecbplus.32: A big reason why was Quinn, who was just 10 of 22 for 162 yards with two interceptions.
29_1ecbplus.33: ''This game was without a doubt, 100 percent on my shoulders, '' he said.
29_1ecbplus.34: ''You can't play the way I played today and win a football game. ''
29_1ecbplus.35: His trouble began with the Chiefs' fifth offensive play, when he threw woefully behind Dexter McCluster - who wasn't even looking for the ball.
29_1ecbplus.36: Butler picked off the pass in stride, taking it untouched to the end zone for a 7 - 0 lead.
29_1ecbplus.37: Kansas City managed a field goal by Ryan Succop, but he missed his next try and the Colts went the other direction to set up the first of Adam Vinatieri's two field goals.
29_1ecbplus.38: Charles fumbled in the red zone later in the second quarter, and the Colts moved into Vinatieri's range for a 36 - yard field goal and a 13 - 3 halftime lead.
29_1ecbplus.39: Charles electrified a sparse crowd on the first play of the second half.
29_1ecbplus.40: He angled to the left and then found room down the sideline, cutting back toward the middle of the field and winning a foot - race with the Indianapolis defense for an 86 - yard touchdown run.
29_1ecbplus.41: The Chiefs were in position to take the lead later in the third quarter, but Quinn was picked off by Vontae Davis in the end zone.
29_1ecbplus.42: The defense forced a three - and - out and Kansas City was driving again before settling for Succop's tying 47 - yard field goal.
29_1ecbplus.43: The Chiefs got the ball back again late in the fourth quarter, but Quinn was stuffed on a quarterback sneak on fourth - and - inches from the Indianapolis 27.
29_1ecbplus.44: That turned the ball over to Luck, who completed an 11 - yard pass to T. Y. Hilton to convert a third down before he and Wayne won it.
29_1ecbplus.45: ''At times it looked a little bleak, '' Arians said.
29_1ecbplus.46: ''Guys hung in there, made plays when they had to make them.
29_1ecbplus.47: Offensively we struggled, and then put together a drive, like we have all year. ''
29_1ecbplus.48: Notes: Chiefs WR Terrance Copper ( left knee ) and DT Tyson Jackson ( left foot ) left with injuries. .. .
29_1ecbplus.49: Wayne had five catches to become the fifth player in NFL history with four 100 - catch seasons.
29_1ecbplus.50: He also became the 14th player to reach 13, 000 yards receiving.

43_10ecbplus.0: AMD buys SeaMicro, starts selling Intel - based servers
43_10ecbplus.2: In an unprecedented move that suggests that there might be life in the old dog yet, AMD has acquired SeaMicro, a company that builds high - density, low - power servers using Intel CPUs.
43_10ecbplus.3: The deal cost AMD $334 million ( $281M in cash ), a fairly sizable chunk of change when you consider that its yearly profits are usually around the $400 million mark.
43_10ecbplus.4: If you haven ’ t heard of SeaMicro before, they ’ re essentially a Silicon Valley startup built around a technology called Freedom Fabric, an ASIC ( Application - Specific Integrated Circuit ) that allows a computer to be scaled down to a motherboard the size of a deck of playing cards.
43_10ecbplus.5: These tiny computers ( each one containing an Atom or Xeon CPU, some DRAM, and the Freedom Fabric ASIC ) are then stacked together to form very - high - density servers ( pictured above ).
43_10ecbplus.6: These server bricks are just 10U in size, contain up to 768 CPUs, and include four gigabit Ethernet switches and a load balancer.
43_10ecbplus.7: To achieve the same kind of processing power with conventional rackmount servers you would need two full racks ( 84U! ) of dual - socket quad - core servers and network gear.
43_10ecbplus.8: The SeaMicro server bricks use a quarter of the power, too, because the custom CPU - DRAM - ASICs contain absolutely no hardware cruft that leeches power.
43_10ecbplus.9: In short, with energy prices increasing, data center real estate as costly as ever, and the web showing no signs of slowing down, SeaMicro servers are really rather desirable.
43_10ecbplus.10: More than miniaturization, though, Freedom Fabric is also compatible with multiple instruction sets and allows for complete hardware virtualization; both very desirable properties in this age of cloud computing.
43_10ecbplus.11: But why did AMD buy SeaMicro?
43_10ecbplus.12: As it stands, SeaMicro has a tight partnership with Intel, and every SeaMicro server uses Intel chips.
43_10ecbplus.13: According to AMD, SeaMicro will sell Intel - based servers “ for the foreseeable future, ” but an Opteron - based solution should arrive by the end of the year.
43_10ecbplus.14: In all likelihood, AMD probably sees SeaMicro as an excellent way of bolstering its presence in the incredibly lucrative ( and rapidly expanding ) server market.
43_10ecbplus.15: With SeaMicro, AMD can deal directly with companies looking for servers, cutting out the ( very profitable ) HP, Dell, or IBM middle man.
43_10ecbplus.16: The server space is one area that AMD still seems to be able compete with Intel and with Freedom Fabric AMD might once again become a compelling choice.

29_11ecbplus.0: Indianapolis Colts clinch playoff berth with win over Kansas City Chiefs
29_11ecbplus.2: Going into week 16, the Indianapolis Colts controlled their own destiny of making it to post - season play.
29_11ecbplus.3: The Colts could clinch a playoff berth with a win over the Kansas City Chiefs or a Pittsburgh Steelers loss.
29_11ecbplus.4: As they have done all season, the Colts refused to let their fate be decided by anyone other than themselves.
29_11ecbplus.5: The young team fought hard to defeat the Chiefs in another fourth quarter victory, 20 - 13.
29_11ecbplus.6: Although they started the game with a three - and - out, the Colts were able to light up the scoreboard first.
29_11ecbplus.7: Corner back Darius Butler intercepted Brady Quinn for a 32 yard defensive touchdown.
29_11ecbplus.8: This was Butler's second pick - six of the season, his first against the Jacksonville Jaguars.
29_11ecbplus.9: The Colts defense was able to keep the Chiefs out of the end zone in the first half.
29_11ecbplus.10: Throughout the game, the Chiefs defense and running game posed a serious threat to the Colts shot at the playoffs.
29_11ecbplus.11: The Chiefs rushed for over 350 yards giving their two leading running backs over 100 yards each.
29_11ecbplus.12: Jamaal Charles rushed for 226 yards while Peyton Hillis added 101.
29_11ecbplus.13: Kansas City emerged from the locker room with an extra burst of energy.
29_11ecbplus.14: Charles kicked off the second half with an 86 yard rushing touchdown.
29_11ecbplus.15: Despite their intimidating numbers on the ground, the Chiefs were not able to find any consistency in their passing game.
29_11ecbplus.16: Aside from Charles' second quarter score, Kansas City failed to find themselves in the end zone.
29_11ecbplus.17: A Ryan Succop field goal tied the game at 13 late in the third quarter.
29_11ecbplus.18: After failing to convert on a crucial fourth down, the Chiefs gave the Colts possession early in the fourth.
29_11ecbplus.19: As they have done a number of times in the fourth quarter, the Colts capitalized on this opportunity.
29_11ecbplus.20: Andrew Luck completed his first and only touchdown pass of the day to Reggie Wayne, putting the Colts up once again.
29_11ecbplus.21: In the end, the Colts held on to their 20 - 13 lead, winning the game and securing a spot in the playoffs.
29_11ecbplus.22: The Colts now will end the season with a double digit number in the win column, five times as many as last season.
29_11ecbplus.23: Indianapolis' head coach Chuck Pagano, is expected to rejoin his team just as they prepare for the post - season.
29_11ecbplus.24: Pagano has proven to be a source of motivation and inspiration to the Colts this season.
29_11ecbplus.25: The odds may be stacked against them, the Colts certainly have what it takes to make the unbelievable happen.
29_11ecbplus.26: They have overcome a number of obstacles this season, far surpassing any expectations placed upon them.
29_11ecbplus.27: The Colts will face their division rivals, the Houston Texans, at home in Indianapolis for their final game of the regular season.
29_11ecbplus.28: The Colts were defeated by the Texans in week 14.
29_11ecbplus.29: With a clinched playoff berth, the Colts can focus on how they will match up against a playoff - caliber team before Wildcard Weekend.

38_11ecbplus.0: California Earthquake Today 2013 Erupts Outside Sacramento
38_11ecbplus.2: A California earthquake today 2013 has erupted outside Santa Rosa.
38_11ecbplus.3: The strong and shallow quake began in the predawn morning hours today Thursday, March 14, 2013.
38_11ecbplus.4: No reports of injuries have yet to be indicated by local news.
38_11ecbplus.5: Officials tell news that a 4. 6 magnitude California earthquake began today shortly after 2: 09 am PST.
38_11ecbplus.6: The quake however had a nominal depth.
38_11ecbplus.7: USGS indicates to news that the quake began only one mile below ground level.
38_11ecbplus.8: As a result, the quake could be felt across the region.
38_11ecbplus.9: Mapping reveals that the quake began near Clearlake, south of Lakeport and west of Interstate 5.
38_11ecbplus.10: The quake was northwest of Sacramento and Woodland and Roseville, north of Santa Rosa and San Francisco, and south of Mendocino National Forest.
38_11ecbplus.11: USGS reports to news that the quake began two miles northeast of The Geysers, four miles west of Cobb, and six miles west of Anderson Springs.
38_11ecbplus.12: The quake also began twelve miles east of Clovedale and twenty - six mils north of Santa Rosa.
38_11ecbplus.13: Officials tell news that the quake also began seventy - three miles west of Sacramento.
38_11ecbplus.14: The same epicenter has been active over the years.
38_11ecbplus.15: In June 2012, a 3. 0 quake struck one mile north of The Geysers.
38_11ecbplus.16: The quake was six miles west of Cobb and seven miles from Anderson Springs.
38_11ecbplus.17: It was also east of Cloverdale and approximately twenty - six miles from Santa Rosa.
38_11ecbplus.18: The quake was centered seventy - five miles north of San Francisco.

33_9ecbplus.0: Jury finds Andrew Lopez guilty in murder of Zurana Horton
33_9ecbplus.2: A jury has handed down a guilty verdict for one of the two men accused of murdering a Brownsville mother of 12.
33_9ecbplus.3: Andrew Lopez was found guilty of second - degree murder and two counts of first - degree assault in the death of Zurana Horton.
33_9ecbplus.4: Jury deliberations are still underway for the second suspect, Jonathan Carrasquillo.
33_9ecbplus.5: Horton was shot and killed in October 2011 when gunfire erupted outside. ..

3_9ecbplus.1: Texas escapee now on U. S. Marshal's most wanted list
3_9ecbplus.2: Last week's escapee from the Texas prison system is still at large and is now on the U. S. Marshal Service's "Most Wanted" list of fugitives.
3_9ecbplus.3: Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr. is serving three life sentences.
3_9ecbplus.4: He escaped last week while being transported from a prison in Huntsville to one in Beaumont, Texas.
3_9ecbplus.5: Comeaux is accused of using a gun which was smuggled in to him for the escape.
3_9ecbplus.6: He was in prison after being convicted of aggravated sexual assault of a child and aggravated assault with a deadly weapon.
3_9ecbplus.7: According to Texas authorities, the weapons conviction stemmed from a 1999 incident where he stabbed his wife 17 times while she was visiting him in prison.

11_1ecbplus.0: Parliamentary elections in Turkmenistan to be held on two - party basis
11_1ecbplus.2: Parliamentary elections in Turkmenistan which are planned for December 15, 2013, will be held on a two - party basis, a message from the Central Commission for Elections and Referenda of Turkmenistan said.
11_1ecbplus.3: 'Representatives of the two political parties will compete for victory in the parliamentary elections.
11_1ecbplus.4: This will give a powerful impetus to the pre - election campaign and allow the electorate to nominate the most worthy representatives for the country's legislative body', the message said.
11_1ecbplus.5: The start of the campaign for this election will be announced on October 5, 2013, in Turkmenistan.
11_1ecbplus.6: Nomination of candidates for the national parliament will take place from October 16 to November 14.
11_1ecbplus.7: Registration will run from October 26 to November 20.
11_1ecbplus.8: At a meeting of the Central Election Commission it was decided to hold training seminars for representatives of political parties, public organisations and associations, electoral commissions and national observers.
11_1ecbplus.9: It is expected the elections will be monitored by national observers and invited international experts and witnesses from many foreign countries and major international organisations and in the first instance, the European Union, the CIS and the OSCE.
11_1ecbplus.10: The MPs term of office is five years.
11_1ecbplus.11: The main current staff was elected in December 2008.
11_1ecbplus.12: Last year a law 'On political parties' was adopted in Turkmenistan.
11_1ecbplus.13: On this basis, a party of Turkmenistan industrialists and entrepreneurs was established in August 2012 in Ashgabat with the participation of 300 delegates representing enterprise structures from all regions of the country.
11_1ecbplus.14: Up till then, the only political organisation, namely the Democratic Party, headed by President Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov was registered in the country.
11_1ecbplus.15: In August 2013 the Turkmen leader adopted a decision to remove the duties of the chairman of this political structure from himself.

11_4ecbplus.0: Electoral districts established in Turkmenistan due to parliamentary elections
11_4ecbplus.2: Regarding the election of deputies of the Turkmen Mejlis ( Parliament ), which is scheduled for December 15, 2013, a decision was taken on establishment of electoral districts, the resolution of the Central Election Commission of Turkmenistan released on Friday said.
11_4ecbplus.3: In accordance with Article 60 of the Turkmen Constitution for the orderly conduct of the elections in the country 125 electoral districts will be established, including those in Ashgabat city - 15, Akhal province - 15, Balkan province - 10, Dashoguz province - 27, Lebap province - 28, Mary province - 30.
11_4ecbplus.4: It is expected that the start of the campaign for this election will be announced on October 5, 2013, in Turkmenistan.
11_4ecbplus.5: Nomination of candidates for the national parliament will take place from October 16 to November 14.
11_4ecbplus.6: Registration will run from October 26 to November 20.
11_4ecbplus.7: It is expected the elections will be monitored by national observers and invited international experts and witnesses from many foreign countries and major international organisations and in the first instance, the European Union, the CIS and the OSCE.
11_4ecbplus.8: The MPs term of office is five years.
11_4ecbplus.9: The main current staff was elected in December 2008.
11_4ecbplus.10: According to the Turkmen constitution, the parliament passes laws, makes changes and additions to the Constitution of Turkmenistan; examines the state budget approval, addresses questions on holding referendums and announces presidential and parliamentary elections.
11_4ecbplus.11: It also considers issues the appointment and dismissal of the chief of the Supreme Court, attorney general, interior minister and minister of justice and ratifies and terminates international treaties, addresses issues on changes of state borders and the administrative - territorial division of Turkmenistan.

29_8ecbplus.0: Colts Clinch Playoff Berth with 20 - 13 Win Over Chiefs
29_8ecbplus.2: Despite rushing for 352 yards, the Kansas City Chiefs lost their home finale to the Indianapolis Colts at Arrowhead Stadium on Sunday afternoon.
29_8ecbplus.3: The Colts ( 10 - 5, 4 - 4 away ) owned the NFL ’ s worst record last year, and clinched a spot in the playoffs with Sunday ’ s win.
29_8ecbplus.4: With 4: 08 to play in the fourth quarter, rookie quarterback Andrew Luck found wide receiver Reggie Wayne for a seven - yard touchdown pass, capping the 73 - yard game winning drive.
29_8ecbplus.5: Luck also set a new record for most single - season passing yards by a rookie in the process.
29_8ecbplus.6: Carolina Panthers QB Cam Newton held the previous record at 4, 051 yards.
29_8ecbplus.7: The Chiefs ( 2 - 13, 1 - 7 home ) almost got to play the role of the Grinch in Chiefs red.
29_8ecbplus.8: However, a Chiefs win would ’ ve likely cost them the first overall pick in the 2013 NFL Draft.
29_8ecbplus.9: The Chiefs are currently in line for the first overall pick, owning the tiebreaker over the Jacksonville Jaguars ( 2 - 13 ).
29_8ecbplus.10: After holding Indianapolis to three and out to start the game, Chiefs QB Brady Quinn threw a pick six to cornerback Darius Butler, who returned the interception 32 yards for a TD.
29_8ecbplus.11: The Chiefs went on a 68 - yard drive midway through the second quarter, but the drive was halted when running back Jamaal Charles lost a fumble on the Colts 16 - yard line.
29_8ecbplus.12: Indy led 13 - 3 at the half, but Kansas City opened up the second half in a big way.
29_8ecbplus.13: On the first play from scrimmage, Charles broke off an 86 - yd TD run to trim the deficit to 13 - 10.
29_8ecbplus.14: The Chiefs went on a 67 - yd drive on their next possession, but CB Vontae Davis intercepted Quinn ’ s pass in the end zone.
29_8ecbplus.15: Kicker Ryan Succop tied the game at 13 - 13 with a 47 - yd field goal with 10: 03 to play in the third quarter, and it stayed that way until the Colts ’ game winning drive in the fourth.
29_8ecbplus.16: Charles ’ 226 yards rushing was good for the third most in a single game in franchise history.
29_8ecbplus.17: He also holds spots one and two on the all - time list.
29_8ecbplus.18: RB Peyton Hillis rushed for 101 yards.
29_8ecbplus.19: The Chiefs racked up a total of 507 yards on offense.
29_8ecbplus.20: The Chiefs will play their season finale against the Denver Broncos next Sunday afternoon at Sports Authority Field at Mile High.

22_6ecbplus.0: Accused Philadelphia Kraft Foods Killer Held For Trial
22_6ecbplus.2: The woman who allegedly shot and killed two co - workers in September at the Kraft Foods plant in Northeast Philadelphia will face trial on multiple counts of murder and attempted murder.
22_6ecbplus.3: At a hearing on Tuesday, assistant district attorney Gail Fairman described 43 - year - old Yvonne Hiller as a “ methodical killer ” who waved a gun within a foot of a security guard ’ s face to regain access to the plant less than ten minutes after she had been escorted out.
22_6ecbplus.4: “ She returned like a grim reaper, ” says ADA Fairman, “ and she only shot the ones that she held responsible for her suspension. ”
22_6ecbplus.5: Fairman says that when Hiller found a group of co - workers in a break room, she allowed one person to leave unharmed.
22_6ecbplus.6: “ At one point, there was a co - worker holding onto Latoya Brown, ” says Fairman, “ and the defendant ordered that worker away, and then she shot Brown. ”
22_6ecbplus.7: Hiller had repeated run - ins with co - workers, whom she accused of spraying her with a deer scent, among other things ( see related story ).
22_6ecbplus.8: Two women were pronounced dead at the scene, and a male co - worker was wounded.
22_6ecbplus.9: A detective testified during the preliminary hearing about Hiller ’ s statement to police, claiming people had been spraying her for years.
22_6ecbplus.10: The defense would not comment on strategy plans for the trial.

29_12ecbplus.0: Chiefs lose 20 - 13 to Colts despite Charles ’ 226 yards rushing
29_12ecbplus.2: On a day when the Kansas City Chiefs rushed for the 3rd - most yards in franchise history and the defense played well for 55 minutes of the game, the Chiefs lost to the Indianapolis Colts, 20 - 13, and kept their grip on the #1 pick in the 2013 NFL Draft.
29_12ecbplus.3: By beating the Chiefs, Indianapolis ’ record rose to 9 - 5 and they locked up a playoff spot just one season after posting the worst record in the NFL in 2011 – a Chiefs - like 2 - 14 mark.
29_12ecbplus.4: Meanwhile, the Chiefs lost their 13th game of the season and could tie the franchise mark of 14 losses next week in Denver against Peyton Manning and the Broncos.
29_12ecbplus.5: The 2008 Chiefs ended the season with a 2 - 14 record.
29_12ecbplus.6: On the only positive note for the game, the Chiefs had two players rush for over 100 yards apiece –something that hasn ’ t happened to the franchise since 1991.
29_12ecbplus.7: Jamaal Charles ( 226 yards ) and Peyton Hillis ( 101 yards ) led a powerful attack that, for any team other than the 2012 Chiefs, would have nearly guaranteed a victory.
29_12ecbplus.8: KC ended the game with 352 net yards rushing.
29_12ecbplus.9: The 1961 Dallas Texans rushed for 398 yards against Houston ( 10 / 1 / 61 ) and the ’ 66 squad gained 380 yards rushing against Denver ( 10 / 23 / 66 ).
29_12ecbplus.10: But this year ’ s team was undone again by three turnovers, a missed field goal, and untimely penalties that wiped out scoring drives.
29_12ecbplus.11: Brady Quinn threw two interceptions, both of which had a devastating effect on the Chiefs.
29_12ecbplus.12: The first occurred on Kansas City ’ s opening drive when Quinn threw behind receiver Dexter McCluster and Colts cornerback, Darius Butler, picked it off and returned it 32 yards for a touchdown, putting Indy up 7 - 0.
29_12ecbplus.13: Quinn ’ s second interception of the game came at a crucial point in the 4th quarter with the team trailing 13 - 10 and with the ball at the Indy 14 - yard line.
29_12ecbplus.14: Quinn underthrew a pass in the end zone to receiver Jon Baldwin and was picked off by Vontae Davis for an Indianapolis touchback.
29_12ecbplus.15: Yet another potential scoring opportunity blown for the Chiefs.
29_12ecbplus.16: Quinn threw a third interception – and his second to Davis in consecutive series – but it was overturned when Davis was called for pass interference.
29_12ecbplus.17: Any honest Chiefs fan would say that it was the most “ phantom ” interference penalty ever as Davis never appeared to touch KC receiver Jamar Newsome.
29_12ecbplus.18: Kicker Ryan Succop showed his Jekyll / Hyde nature in the first quarter by nailing a 47 - yard field goal that looked good the moment he kicked it, but then missing a 43 - yarder that would have made the score 7 - 6.
29_12ecbplus.19: Towards the end of the first half, Charles made his only mistake of the day by fumbling at the Indianapolis 16 - yard line, snuffing out another scoring opportunity with the Chiefs behind 10 - 3.
29_12ecbplus.20: The Colts turned the fumble into another field goal and went into halftime leading KC, 13 - 3.
29_12ecbplus.21: As the second half opened, the Chiefs looked like they were going to go into self - destruct mode again when return man, Devon Wylie, inexplicably tried to return the second - half kickoff from deep in his own end zone and was swarmed under at the 14 - yard line by Indy.
29_12ecbplus.22: The few Chiefs fans remaining in the stands undoubtedly thought about going home early and getting a head start on dinner.
29_12ecbplus.23: ( Personal note: Somebody on the special teams ’ coaching staff needs to put leg chains on Wylie, who apparently thinks he is former All - Pro return man, Dante Hall.
29_12ecbplus.24: Wylie brings out EVERY kick and more often than not, doesn ’ t get the ball back to the 20 - yard line. )
29_12ecbplus.25: But, showing why he is the best player on the team, Charles took a handoff around the left end and with some terrific downfield blocking by Baldwin, romped 86 yards for the Chiefs first touchdown in nine quarters of football – ironically since Charles ’ 80 - yard TD run on the opening play of the Cleveland game two weeks ago.
29_12ecbplus.26: Colts – 13, Chiefs – 10 and a new ballgame.
29_12ecbplus.27: Both defenses tightened up in the second half, but the key play of the game came with 10 minutes left in the fourth quarter and the score tied 13 - 13.
29_12ecbplus.28: The Chiefs faced a 4th - and - inches at the Indy 27 - yd line, but despite having Hillis and Charles in the backfield, coaches Romeo Crennel and offensive coordinator Brian Daboll decided to have Quinn try a quarterback sneak.
29_12ecbplus.29: Quinn was stopped short and the Colts took the ball over on downs.
29_12ecbplus.30: It was here that Chiefs fans could see what might have been had they had this awful season LAST YEAR when Colts QB Andrew Luck was the top prize of the draft.
29_12ecbplus.31: Luck had struggled all day long under pressure from the Chiefs defense and the rookie looked very ordinary.
29_12ecbplus.32: However, when it counted, he looked like Joe Montana.
29_12ecbplus.33: Luck calmly led the Colts on a 13 - play drive that culminated in a laser - like TD throw to Reggie Wayne that put the Colts up 20 - 13.
29_12ecbplus.34: I say that Chiefs fans could only dream of having Luck because if there was ever an indictment of the Chiefs QB situation, it came on the next series of downs.
29_12ecbplus.35: With four minutes left in the game, Wylie AGAIN brought the kick - off out of the end zone and was tackled at the 10 - yard line.
29_12ecbplus.37: With 90 yards to go and two time outs ( plus the two - minute warning ) in their pocket the Chiefs put a big red ribbon on this turd of a season for fans by running the following “ game - winning ” plays:
29_12ecbplus.38: 1st - and - 10 – Quinn pass incomplete short right to Steve Maneri
29_12ecbplus.39: 2nd - and - 10 – Jamaal Charles up middle for 2 yards
29_12ecbplus.40: 3rd - and - 8 – ( Shotgun formation ) Peyton Hillis around right end for - 2 yards
29_12ecbplus.42: So on a day when at least nine NFL quarterbacks threw for 300 yards or more ( and three threw for 400+ ), the Chiefs wouldn ’ t let their #1 quarterback attempt to win a game with his arm.
29_12ecbplus.43: One could only assume it ’ s because the odds of Jamaal Charles ripping off another 90 - yard run was more likely than any of the stiffs playing QB for the Chiefs leading a game - winning drive.
29_12ecbplus.44: Then, like the Grinch that really wanted to screw the fans' holidays, the defense couldn ’ t stop the Colts offense as Indy easily picked up a first down and ran out the clock.
29_12ecbplus.45: Luckily for KC fans, the final indignities of the season will end next week when the free agent QB that infamously spurned the Chiefs, Peyton Manning, leads his 12 - 3 Broncos against KC in what may be Romeo Crennel and Scott Pioli ’ s last games with the Chiefs.
29_12ecbplus.46: Manning and the Broncos have a legitimate shot at getting the #1 seed in the AFC for the playoffs, so they won't be resting anyone for the last game.
29_12ecbplus.47: Well, at least not until Denver is up by four touchdowns, which may be halftime.

24_5ecbplus.0: Ram - raiders hit Paris jewellery store for €2m
24_5ecbplus.3: Ram - raiders ploughed their vehicle into an upmarket jewellery boutique near Place Vendôme in central Paris on Monday in a dramatic dawn robbery, making off with €2 million worth of loot.
24_5ecbplus.4: Four men rammed their car into an upmarket jewellery store in central Paris on Monday, smashing the shop window and making off with a €2 million ( $2. 6 - million ) booty, a police source said.
24_5ecbplus.5: The heist near the upscale Place Vendôme is the latest to hit France after a spate of high - profile robberies in the southern resort of Cannes.
24_5ecbplus.6: The police source, who wished to remain anonymous, said the men drove a large four - by - four car into the store in the early hours of the morning and grabbed jewellery and luxury watches worth an estimated €2 million.
24_5ecbplus.7: They then set fire to the vehicle and escaped in another car.
24_5ecbplus.8: Forensic policemen are currently going through the site of the robbery at the Casty store on Rue de Castiglione in the central first arrondissement of Paris, which is home to numerous jewellery shops.
24_5ecbplus.9: Paris also witnessed another dramatic robbery on Sunday night when thieves armed with Kalashnikovs stormed a subsidiary of the France's rail operator SNCF in the capital's 15th arrondissement.
24_5ecbplus.10: According to reports, the robbers escaped with around €60, 000 from the company which is in charge of managing restaurant cars on the TGV trains.
24_5ecbplus.11: At the end of July, an armed man carried out a brazen robbery in broad daylight at a diamond exhibition at the Carlton hotel in Cannes, making off with jewellery worth €103 million in one of the world's biggest ever heists.
24_5ecbplus.12: Paris has also been the scene of high - profile robberies.
24_5ecbplus.13: In December 2008, three men emptied almost all of the stock of gems from the Harry Winston jewellery store.
24_5ecbplus.14: In 2009, police said they had recovered 80 percent of the haul.

39_2ecbplus.0: Peter Capaldi was the only name considered to take over Doctor Who role from Matt Smith, says show boss Steven Moffat
39_2ecbplus.2: Showrunner, 51, adds that Malcolm Tucker will not cast a shadow over new Time Lord: "You know when the Doctor is in the room"
39_2ecbplus.3: Doctor Who boss Steven Moffat has revealed that Peter Capaldi was the only name considered to take over from Matt Smith.
39_2ecbplus.4: Speaking after last night's announcement of The Thick of It star as the Twelfth Doctor, Moffat also said that the 55 - year - old's lifelong love of Doctor Who had been an aspect when it came to casting him.
39_2ecbplus.5: Asked whether the list of Time Lord contenders was a short one, Moffat said: "Yes.
39_2ecbplus.7: It was a very short list. "
39_2ecbplus.8: He added: " [ Capaldi came into consideration ] a fair amount of time ago.
39_2ecbplus.9: I happened to know he's a big fan.
39_2ecbplus.10: "There's something very seductive about an utterly brilliant, arresting looking leading man actor - one of the most talented actors in Britain - who you happen to know is a big fan of the show.
39_2ecbplus.11: "You start to think 'maybe we should so something about that'. "
39_2ecbplus.12: The 51 - year - old showrunner also insisted that Capaldi's most heralded and readily identifiable previous role - as sweary spin doctor Malcolm Tucker - would not overshadow his new position in charge of the TARDIS.
39_2ecbplus.13: "You know when the Doctor is in the room, " said Moffat.
39_2ecbplus.14: "I've seen the Doctor not be in the room when you say those lines out loud.
39_2ecbplus.15: "And just to check we weren't mad we showed it to [ BBC head of drama ] Ben [ Stephenson ].
39_2ecbplus.16: And we all just thought 'Yes, obviously that's it.
39_2ecbplus.18: Producer Moffat, who is also a co - creator of Sherlock, is sure that fans will agree that Capaldi is the perfect choice.
39_2ecbplus.19: "When you watched him walk out in the room tonight, didn't you just think 'well, there he is'? " he said.
39_2ecbplus.21: Malcolm Tucker is knocked out of the way.
39_2ecbplus.22: He's just suddenly this magnificent new man. "
39_2ecbplus.23: Last night's unveiling of Capaldi was watched by 6. 1m people ( a 29. 8% share of the TV - watching audience ), peaking at 6. 9m.

26_2ecbplus.1: Vincent 'The Chin' Gigante, last of Mafia giants, dies
26_2ecbplus.2: Mob boss Vincent "The Chin" Gigante, the powerful Mafioso who avoided jail for decades by wandering the streets in a ratty bathrobe and slippers, feigning mental illness, died Monday in prison.
26_2ecbplus.4: The head of the Genovese crime family, who had suffered from heart disease, died at the federal prison in Springfield, Mo. , said prison spokesman Al Quintero.
26_2ecbplus.5: It was the same place where rival mob boss John Gotti died of cancer in 2002 at age 61.
26_2ecbplus.6: Gigante's death also was confirmed by Christine Monaco, a spokeswoman for the FBI, the organization that worked for years to put him behind bars.
26_2ecbplus.7: Dubbed the "Oddfather" for his bizarre behavior, Gigante had scored a lengthy string of victories over prosecutors, but it ended with a July 1997 racketeering conviction.
26_2ecbplus.8: He was sentenced to 12 years in prison.
26_2ecbplus.9: After a quarter - century of public craziness, he finally admitted his insanity ruse at an April 2003 federal hearing in which he calmly pleaded guilty to obstruction of justice.
26_2ecbplus.10: That brought him another three - year sentence.
26_2ecbplus.11: At that hearing, he chatted amiably with his son, shook hands with defense lawyers and said "God bless you" to U. S. District Judge I. Leo Glasser.
26_2ecbplus.12: For the man described by The New York Times Magazine as "the last great Mafioso of the century, " his admission was the final act in a 50 - year career linking the era of old - time gangsters and the modern - day Mafia of Gotti.
26_2ecbplus.13: At the height of his power, Gigante's empire stretched from Little Italy to the docks of Miami.
26_2ecbplus.14: Mob experts called him a traditional boss who settled issues by whatever means - verbal or violent - were required.
26_2ecbplus.15: Denying he was a gangster, Gigante would wander the streets of the Greenwich Village neighborhood in nightclothes, muttering incoherently.
26_2ecbplus.16: Relatives, including a brother was who a Roman Catholic priest, insisted Gigante suffered from paranoid schizophrenia, dementia and Alzheimer's disease.
26_2ecbplus.17: Authorities charged it was a brazen act to avoid the law - although it wasn't until 1997 that a jury agreed.
26_2ecbplus.18: The trial was a spectacle, with Gigante in a wheelchair, mumbling silently, seemingly oblivious to the proceedings.
26_2ecbplus.19: His lawyers claimed they could not communicate with him in any "meaningful way. "
26_2ecbplus.20: None of that swayed jurors, who convicted Gigante of racketeering, extortion and plotting the murder - never carried out - of ex - mob associate Peter Savino.
26_2ecbplus.21: Born in the Bronx in 1928, one of five sons of Italian immigrant parents, Gigante became a small - time boxer and drifted into the crime family founded in 1931 by legendary gangster Charles "Lucky" Luciano.
26_2ecbplus.22: In 1957, Gigante was the hitman in a botched attempt to assassinate then - boss Frank Costello.
26_2ecbplus.23: After refusing to name his attacker in court, the shaken Costello retired, making Gigante's patron, Vito Genovese, kingpin of the family that still bears his name.
26_2ecbplus.24: Over time, Gigante, a stocky figure with a pugilist's face and 1940s pompadour, proved better at beating the law than Gotti, the so - called "Teflon Don" who won two acquittals before tapes and turncoats sent him to prison for life.
26_2ecbplus.25: Before 1997, Gigante had served only a five - year heroin rap in 1959.

24_11ecbplus.1: Paris: Jewellery Stolen In Casty Shop Raid
24_11ecbplus.2: Jewellery and watches worth £1. 7m have been stolen during a heist in an upmarket central Paris shop.
24_11ecbplus.3: Four men drove a 4x4 through the front window of the store on Rue de Castiglione, before making off with the jewellery and watches.
24_11ecbplus.4: They then set fire to the vehicle before fleeing in another car.
24_11ecbplus.5: Forensic policemen are examining the Casty store in the central first district of the capital, home to numerous jewellery shops.
24_11ecbplus.6: The heist near Place Vendome is the latest to hit France after a spate of high - profile robberies in the southern resort of Cannes.
24_11ecbplus.7: At the end of July, an armed man carried out a robbery at a diamond exhibition at the Carlton Hotel in Cannes, making off with jewellery worth £88m in one of the world's biggest ever heists.
24_11ecbplus.8: And last month thieves made off with £35, 000 of jewellery after cracking two safes at the luxury Grand Hotel du Cap in Saint - Jean - Cap - Ferrat, near Nice.
24_11ecbplus.9: In May, thieves stole £910, 000 worth of jewellery from an employee of Swiss firm Chopard that was due to be loaned to film stars during the Cannes Film Festival and a second theft saw a diamond necklace worth £1. 2m stolen.
24_11ecbplus.10: Paris has also been the scene of high - profile robberies.
24_11ecbplus.11: In December 2008, three men emptied almost the entire stock of gems from the Harry Winston jewellery store.
24_11ecbplus.12: Police said they had recovered 80% of the haul in 2009.

11_2ecbplus.0: 27 / 09 / 2013 - Turkmenistan to hold first - ever parliamentary elections on a two - party basis
11_2ecbplus.2: Parliamentary elections in Turkmenistan that are scheduled for December 15 of this year will be held on a two - party basis, for the first time in the country ’ s history, according to the Central Elections Commission of Turkmenistan.

38_8ecbplus.2: A magnitude 4. 6 earthquake struck Northern California on Thursday morning,
38_8ecbplus.3: The temblor struck about 26 miles north of Santa Rosa in the Geysers area.
38_8ecbplus.4: There were no reports of damage or injuries, but there were some apparent aftershocks.
38_8ecbplus.5: It was felt over a wide area of the region, including in Santa Rosa, Marin County and Vallejo, according to the U. S. Geological Survey.
38_8ecbplus.6: The "Do You Feel It? " survey by the USGS showed people as far south a San Francisco felt shaking.

14_2ecbplus.1: Waitrose Wellington fire: Man denies arson
14_2ecbplus.2: A man has denied arson following a fire at a Somerset supermarket early on Sunday.
14_2ecbplus.3: Robert Pitman, 24, is accused of setting fire to the Waitrose store in Wellington shortly after 06: 00 BST.
14_2ecbplus.4: Half of the entrance roof at the shop collapsed during the blaze.
14_2ecbplus.5: Mr Pitman, of High Street, Wellington, entered a not guilty plea at Taunton Deane Magistrates and was remanded in custody to appear before Taunton Crown Court on 19 August.

34_8ecbplus.1: Surgeon General Nominee Dr. Regina Benjamin
34_8ecbplus.2: I was immediately impressed with Dr. Regina Benjamin's background when President Obama nominated her for U. S. Surgeon General.
34_8ecbplus.3: She's led an impressive career, one that includes deciding to practice in a low - income community in the Gulf Coast of Alabama.
34_8ecbplus.4: The Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic has been a staple for residents since 1987 and often doesn't charge patients who can't afford to pay.
34_8ecbplus.5: The clinic also focuses heavily on preventative illness since this hits close to home for Dr. Benjamin.
34_8ecbplus.6: She lost her father to diabetics and high - blood pressure, her mother to lung cancer and her brother from a HIV - related illness.
34_8ecbplus.7: Personally and professionally, Dr. Benjamin has longed fought for the well - being of others.
34_8ecbplus.8: After researching her background, I had a gut feeling she was a member of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc. , a non - profit community service based organization.
34_8ecbplus.9: And it was confirmed several days later when the sorority's national president announced Dr. Benjamin became a member while completing her undergraduate degree at Xavier University in New Orleans, La.
34_8ecbplus.10: While I wasn't the only one impressed with Dr. Benjamin's background, there were also some who questioned her ability to perform the duties of Surgeon General.
34_8ecbplus.11: An article with the subtitle: "Do you have to be thin to be fit for the role of nation's Top Doc? ", was published shortly after Dr. Benjamin's nomination.
34_8ecbplus.12: Dr. Arthur Caplan penned the article and defended Dr. Benjamin due to her tireless effort of serving those less fortunate.
34_8ecbplus.13: I applaud him for taking a stand on Dr. Benjamin's behalf.
34_8ecbplus.14: I don't condone a unhealthy lifestyle, but I'm sure Dr. Benjamin is probably like many of us.
34_8ecbplus.15: With hectic work schedules and families, it can be difficult to find time to lead a healthy lifestyle.
34_8ecbplus.16: I struggle with juggling my to - do - list daily and sometimes exercise and healthy eating doesn't make the cut.
34_8ecbplus.17: It's no secret that women are confronted with these issues more than men.
34_8ecbplus.18: I'm calling on women to speak up for Dr. Benjamin.
34_8ecbplus.19: You don't have to agree with the policies of President Obama or even with the nomination of Dr. Benjamin, but we can't continue to allow society to dictate our outer appearance.
34_8ecbplus.20: Women, start making your Moves today!

30_11ecbplus.0: SEACOM cable problems may only be resolved next week
30_11ecbplus.1: Initial estimates indicate that the total SEACOM repair time will be around twelve days
30_11ecbplus.3: As many SA gamers may have noticed, SEACOM is experiencing downtime again.
30_11ecbplus.4: The cable system went down on Saturday 8 October 2011, and initial feedback suggests that the downtime may last for a few days.
30_11ecbplus.5: SEACOM said that their Mediterranean backhaul service provider is experiencing a service affecting outage between Abu Talat and Marseilles.
30_11ecbplus.6: This is affecting all SEACOM traffic to Europe.
30_11ecbplus.7: TENET CTO Andrew Alston said that they have had confirmation that SEACOM is offline and is unlikely to come back online for a few days.
30_11ecbplus.8: The SEACOM downtime seems to be related to a failure on the Telecom Egypt North ( TE North ) submarine telecommunications cable linking France and Egypt.
30_11ecbplus.9: SEACOM has stated that the total repair time of the current problems they experience will be around twelve days depending on weather conditions.
30_11ecbplus.10: "Initial estimates indicate that the total repair time will be around twelve days depending on weather conditions.
30_11ecbplus.11: This entails gaining the necessary permits and the actual repair time.
30_11ecbplus.12: A repair vessel has been notified of the call - out and mobilization will occur immediately once permits are received, " SEACOM said in an official statement.
30_11ecbplus.13: "The outage initially affected all SEACOM traffic to Europe, however SEACOM was able to restore some services by Saturday afternoon. "
30_11ecbplus.14: "Further restoration has continued throughout the weekend in cooperation with customers and partners and SEACOM will continue to actively work on securing additional capacity for all necessary services over the next day or two. "

41_5ecbplus.0: South Sudan accuses Sudan of air strike on refugee camp
41_5ecbplus.2: A refugee camp in South Sudan's Unity state was bombed Thursday, South Sudan officials and witnesses said, threatening to raise tensions with Sudan in the violence - plagued border region.
41_5ecbplus.3: Taban Deng, the governor of Unity state, accused Sudan of carrying out the attack.
41_5ecbplus.4: "These people ( Khartoum ) should be taken to book.
41_5ecbplus.5: They should adhere to international laws and regulations, " he told reporters in Bentiu.
41_5ecbplus.6: Sudan's armed forces denied they carried out the strike.
41_5ecbplus.7: In a statement before the bombing, South Sudan's president Salva Kiir talked of Sudan's "pending invasion" of its neighbor.
41_5ecbplus.8: Violence along the poorly defined border since South Sudan's independence in July has strained ties between the two former civil war foes.
41_5ecbplus.9: They have accused one another of backing rebel groups on their sides of the border.
