41_5ecbplus.10: A Reuters correspondent heard a large explosion in the Yida refugee camp, then saw a crater about two meters ( 6. 6 feet ) wide, an unexploded bomb wedged in the side of a school building and a white aircraft flying north.
41_5ecbplus.11: Witnesses said there were three further explosions at 3 p. m. ( 1200 GMT ).
41_5ecbplus.12: Yida is a camp of about 20, 000 refugees from the Nuba mountains region of South Kordofan, a state north of the border where rebels have been fighting Sudan's army since June.
41_5ecbplus.13: Khartoum reported fresh clashes in the state Thursday.
41_5ecbplus.14: There were no immediate reports of any casualties at the camp, less than 25 km ( 15 miles ) from the border with Sudan.
41_5ecbplus.15: A spokesman for the Enough Project, an activist group that works to end genocide, said the group confirmed there were no dead or wounded.
41_5ecbplus.16: "The refugees need to be safe and need to be protected.
41_5ecbplus.18: They should not be pursued inside the territory of South Sudan, " Deng, the governor, said.
41_5ecbplus.19: Al - Sawarmi Khalid, spokesman for Sudan's armed forces, said Sudan had not bombed anywhere in South Sudan's territory.
41_5ecbplus.20: "South Sudan is a state in the United Nations.
41_5ecbplus.21: We respect international law, and it's impossible that we would do that, " he said.
41_5ecbplus.22: Khalid said Sudanese forces fought rebels in South Kordofan about five kilometers south of the town of Taludi Thursday, killing dozens and destroying a tank and other military vehicles.
41_5ecbplus.23: Fighting has also broken out in Sudan's Blue Nile state this year.
41_5ecbplus.24: The two states are home to tens of thousands of fighters who sided with the south during the war but were left in Sudan when South Sudan seceded, analysts say.
41_5ecbplus.25: South Sudan split off into a separate country in July after voting overwhelmingly for secession in a January referendum, the culmination of a 2005 peace deal that ended decades of war between north and south.
41_5ecbplus.27: Fire crackled in the dry grass around the crater about 100 meters away from an aid agency compound in Yida camp.
41_5ecbplus.28: "They ( Khartoum ) don't want any life in the Nuba mountains, and now they are expanding the war to the South Sudan republic, " said Yousif Ismail, a refugee from the Nuba mountains, as he stood by the hole.
41_5ecbplus.29: Last week, Khartoum submitted its second complaint to the U. N. Security Council, accusing South Sudan of supplying anti - aircraft and anti - tank missiles, ammunition, landmines and mortars to insurgents in South Kordofan and Blue Nile states.
41_5ecbplus.30: Kiir denied those claims in a statement Thursday, calling them "smoke screens to mask Khartoum's own activities in support of the armed dissident groups that are fighting its proxy war against the Republic of South Sudan. "
41_5ecbplus.31: The accusations were being used to justify Sudan's "pending invasion of the South, " Kiir said.
41_5ecbplus.32: The two countries have yet to agree on how much the new nation will pay to use Sudan's oil pipelines and other facilities, which South Sudan depends on to export crude.
41_5ecbplus.33: They also dispute control of the Abyei region.
41_5ecbplus.34: Some 2 million people died in the north - south civil war, waged for all but a few years since 1955 over religion, ideology, ethnicity and oil.

27_5ecbplus.0: Microsoft issues patch to fix IE bug
27_5ecbplus.2: Microsoft has reportedly issued a patch to fix a previously unknown vulnerability in its Internet Explorer ( IE ) web browser.
27_5ecbplus.3: The software manufacturer said that the bug, related to the browser's memory, could affect all versions of IE6 to 10 as hackers could set up websites to exploit the vulnerability and run malicious code on users' computers.
27_5ecbplus.4: According to the BBC, Microsoft's Dustin Childs advised users to set internet and local security zone settings to 'high' to block ActiveX controls and active scripting apart from adding sites they trust to the IE trusted sites zone.
27_5ecbplus.5: Microsoft's Fix It patch applies only to 32 - bit versions of IE and is not being rolled out automatically and it is not intended to be a replacement for scheduled security updates.
27_5ecbplus.6: Director at security company Trusteer, Dana Tamir said that the patch is a temporary workaround, like applying a Band - Aid to a wound.
27_5ecbplus.7: Users have complained that they were repeatedly receiving update installation messages even after they had already done so, the report added.

12_7ecbplus.0: Somali pirate attack foiled in Gulf of Aden
12_7ecbplus.2: An Indian warship on Thursday intercepted three boats with 26 Somali pirates in the Gulf of Aden and foiled an attack on merchant vessels.
12_7ecbplus.3: INS Sukanya detected five suspicious boats, speedily approaching the merchant vessels that the warship was escorting through the Internationally Recognized Transit Corridor.
12_7ecbplus.4: "The warship immediately altered towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them.
12_7ecbplus.5: While two of them managed to escape, INS Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three and carried out boarding - and - search action, " said Captain Manohar Nambiar, chief PRO ( Defence ).
12_7ecbplus.6: The Navy confiscated 14 AK - 47 rifles, 31 magazines and 923 rounds from the boat along with grapnels, ladders and rope - handling gloves, Nambiar said.
12_7ecbplus.7: This is the fifth successful anti - piracy operation conducted by INS Sukanya, during its patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden.

10_13ecbplus.0: Report: Red Sox offer Teixeira $200 million
10_13ecbplus.2: Dan Patrick reported on his show on AM 570 that the Boston Red Sox have made first baseman Mark Teixeira an eight - year, $200 million offer.
10_13ecbplus.3: If so, that blows the reported eight - year, $160 million offers by the Angels and the Washington Nationals out of the water.
10_13ecbplus.4: Patrick said Monday morning: "If it's true they're offering $200 million to a career. 290 hitter, it'll be interesting to see what the Angels do. "
10_13ecbplus.5: He then speculated the Angels might turn their interest to Manny Ramirez.
10_13ecbplus.6: The Boston Herald's Michael Silverman wrote in his Monday column the Red Sox offer was expected to be in the range of $145 million to $175 million, possibly more.
10_13ecbplus.7: He also noted that it is rare for Boston to extend contracts to players that go to their 36th birthdays, with the exceptions of Jason Varitek's just - expired deal and Mike Lowell's contract.

32_2ecbplus.0: Son suspected of killing mother and sister 'had begged to stay locked up in mental hospital'
32_2ecbplus.1: John Jenkin, 23, released from secure mental hospital against his wishes
32_2ecbplus.2: His sister Katie Jenkin, 20, and mother Alice McMeekin, 58, were found dead in a home in Millom, Cumbria
32_2ecbplus.3: Relative said he had history of mental health problems
32_2ecbplus.4: Police not searching for any other suspects in connection with double murders
32_2ecbplus.5: PUBLISHED: 16: 05 GMT, 9 June 2013 | UPDATED: 06: 55 GMT, 10 June 2013
32_2ecbplus.6: A man said to have been released from a secure mental hospital against his wishes was yesterday being questioned over the murders of his mother and sister.
32_2ecbplus.7: John Jenkin, 23, had been sectioned after an apparent suicide attempt in the week before the double murder.
32_2ecbplus.8: According to a relative, he had a history of mental health problems and had pleaded in vain to be kept locked up because he feared harming himself or someone else.
32_2ecbplus.9: Police were called to the family's terraced house in Millom, Cumbria, at 8. 40am on Saturday and found the bodies of Alice McMeekin, 58, and her university student daughter Katie Jenkin, 20.
32_2ecbplus.10: The family's new pet collie, Fenn, was also killed.
32_2ecbplus.11: Jenkin, who was described as a Goth, was arrested nearby on suspicion of murder.
32_2ecbplus.12: He was said to have doted on his mother and younger sister, but the heavy metal fan was also obsessed with the occult.
32_2ecbplus.13: Cumbria police have not revealed how the women died, although no gun was used in the murders.
32_2ecbplus.14: Friends and neighbours were shocked by the murders of the animal - loving divorced mother - of - two and her daughter, who was studying in South Wales and was on a weekend visit home.
32_2ecbplus.15: Yesterday a neighbour recalled seeing the suspect in the street at 3am on Saturday and also hearing screams coming from the pebble - dashed house.
32_2ecbplus.16: 'I was coming back home at 3am with my girlfriend and I was walking up the back street and he was walking around and I looked at his face and it was like looking into space, there was nothing there, ' he said.
32_2ecbplus.17: 'Then I went home and I heard a lot of screams.
32_2ecbplus.18: It sounded like the screams of a dog.
32_2ecbplus.19: I went into my backyard and I heard these piercing screams I will never forget. '
32_2ecbplus.20: He did not contact the police, but more noise was heard at around 8am.
32_2ecbplus.21: 'It sounded like someone telling a dog to shut up, ' said the neighbour.
32_2ecbplus.22: Police were called and found the bodies.
32_2ecbplus.23: Jenkin, who is unemployed, spent much of his time on his computer and listening to music.
32_2ecbplus.24: According to a relative, he had suffered mental health problems for some time.
32_2ecbplus.25: 'He's had a very dark past, but I don't want people to think he is some kind of monster, I just feel sorry for him, ' she said.
32_2ecbplus.26: The relative said he was sectioned under the Mental Health Act for attempting to slit his wrists and then allowed home again in the days before the tragedy.
32_2ecbplus.27: She said he had told health workers that he feared he would harm himself or someone else if he did not stay in a secure psychiatric unit.
32_2ecbplus.28: 'John begged people for help, but he didn't get it, ' she said.
32_2ecbplus.29: Friends said John Jenkin was close to his family.
32_2ecbplus.30: One friend, who asked not to be named, said: 'He idolised his mum and his sister.
32_2ecbplus.31: His little sister was his world, and his mum was too.
32_2ecbplus.32: They all looked after each other.
32_2ecbplus.33: He was a good kid, never one of those to go out and get into trouble. '
32_2ecbplus.34: Mrs McMeekin was brought up in Millom and was the daughter of a greengrocer.
32_2ecbplus.35: She moved to Merthyr Tydfil, South Wales, four years ago 'to give her kids a better life', but returned to her home town with John 12 weeks ago.
32_2ecbplus.36: She worked for the prison service and 'would do anything for anybody', according to the friend.
32_2ecbplus.37: Katie, who was in a steady relationship with a boyfriend, stayed in Wales to continue her media studies course.
32_2ecbplus.38: 'She was a happy, beautiful girl with the world in front of her, ' said the friend.
32_2ecbplus.39: She recalled chatting on Friday to Mrs McMeekin, who was looking forward to her daughter's visit.

30_13ecbplus.1: Seacom announced that it has fully restored all its customers on alternative routes
30_13ecbplus.3: Subsea cable operator, Seacom, announced on Twitter today ( 20 October 2011 ) that they have restored services to all customers using alternate routes, following an outage that was initially expected to take 12 days to repair.
30_13ecbplus.4: In a statement published on its official website, Seacom said that a repair vessel is now in transit.
30_13ecbplus.5: "The vessel has received the master permit for this repair; operational permits are being finalized and should be received prior to arrival on the repair ground, " Seacom said.
30_13ecbplus.6: The repair is now expected to be completed in late October, but Seacom warned that "the usual exogenous factors associated with sub - sea repairs, including weather and currents, may further impact the repair. "
30_13ecbplus.7: Seacom started to experience problems on Saturday, 8 October 2011, which it said was caused by a problem on a cable between Abu Talat in Egypt and Marseilles in France.
30_13ecbplus.8: Last week Friday ( 14 October 2011 ), Seacom announced that it had restored services to its business customers, which included Internet service providers, via alternate routes.

8_3ecbplus.0: Three die in bank during Greek riots
8_3ecbplus.2: Riots over harsh new austerity measures left three bank workers dead and engulfed the streets of Athens on Wednesday, as angry protesters tried to storm parliament, hurled Molotov cocktails at police and torched buildings.
8_3ecbplus.3: Police responded with barrages of tear gas.
8_3ecbplus.4: Tens of thousands of people took to the streets in a nationwide strike to protest new taxes and government spending cuts demanded by the International Monetary Fund and other European nations before heavily indebted Greece gets a euro110 billion ( $141 billion ) loan package to keep it from defaulting.
8_3ecbplus.5: The three bank workers a man and two women died after demonstrators set their bank on fire along the main demonstration route in central Athens.
8_3ecbplus.6: As their colleagues sobbed in the street, five other bank workers were rescued from the balcony of the burning building.
8_3ecbplus.7: "A demonstration is one thing and murder is quite another! " Prime Minister George Papandreou thundered in Parliament during a session to discuss the spending cuts he announced Sunday measures even the IMF has called draconian.
8_3ecbplus.8: Lawmakers held a minute of silence for the dead the first deaths during a protest in Greece since 1991.
8_3ecbplus.9: "We are all concerned by Greece's economic and budgetary situation but at this time our thoughts are with the human victims in Athens, " European Union President Herman Van Rompuy said in Brussels.
8_3ecbplus.10: A senior fire department official said demonstrators prevented firefighters from reaching the burning building, costing them vital time.
8_3ecbplus.11: "Several crucial minutes were lost, " the official said, visibly upset.
8_3ecbplus.12: "If we had intervened earlier, the loss of life could have been prevented. "
8_3ecbplus.13: He asked not to be identified pending an official announcement.
8_3ecbplus.14: In Berlin, German Chancellor Angela Merkel called the Greek bailout critical for all of Europe.
8_3ecbplus.15: "Nothing less than the future of Europe, and with that the future of Germany in Europe, is at stake, " Merkel told lawmakers in Berlin, urging them to quickly pass the country's share of the bailout euro22 billion ( $28 billion ) over three years by Friday.
8_3ecbplus.16: "We are at a fork in the road. "
8_3ecbplus.17: Greece faces a May 19 due date on debt it says it can't repay without the help.
8_3ecbplus.18: In Brussels, European Union officials desperately tried to calm market fears that Greece's debt crisis was spreading to the rest of Europe, insisting it was a "unique case" combining profligacy and tampered accounts.
8_3ecbplus.19: Van Rompuy insisted the growing debt problems in Spain and Portugal had "absolutely nothing to do with the situation in Greece. "
8_3ecbplus.20: "Greece is a unique and particular case in the EU" because of its "precarious debt dynamics" and because it "has cheated with its statistics for years and years, " EU Commissioner Olli Rehn said.
8_3ecbplus.21: But Moody's Investor Services, a major ratings agency, put Portugal's bond rating on review for possible downgrade Wednesday.
8_3ecbplus.22: Spanish and Portuguese bonds and stocks slumped further on the news, reflecting fears that they may also have trouble repaying their debt and that the eurozone would have to extend even larger bailouts to them.
8_3ecbplus.23: On the streets of Athens, demonstrators chanted "Thieves, thieves! " as they attempted to break through a riot police cordon guarding Parliament and chased ceremonial guards away from the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in front of the building.
8_3ecbplus.24: Tear gas drifted across the city center as rioters hurled paving stones and fire bombs at police.
8_3ecbplus.25: Firefighters extinguished blazes at least two buildings the bank and a branch of the Finance Ministry while protesters set up burning barricades and torched cars and a fire truck.
8_3ecbplus.26: Police said 12 people were injured in the riots.
8_3ecbplus.27: The marches came amid a 24 - hour nationwide general strike that grounded all flights to and from Greece, shut down ports, schools and government services, and left hospitals working with emergency medical staff.
8_3ecbplus.28: The Acropolis and all other ancient sites were closed and journalists also walked off the job, suspending television and radio news broadcasts.
8_3ecbplus.29: But media later broke the strike to report on the deaths and the protests.
8_3ecbplus.30: Violence also broke out in the northern city of Thessaloniki, where another 20, 000 people marched through the city center and some youths smashed store windows.
8_3ecbplus.31: Union reaction over austerity measures until now had been relatively muted by Greece's volatile standards, despite several previous strikes.
8_3ecbplus.32: But anger mounted after Papandreou announced cuts in salaries and pensions for civil servants and another round of consumer tax increases.
8_3ecbplus.33: Papandreou said he has no choice but to implement the measures if Greece was to avoid bankruptcy.
8_3ecbplus.34: "There was only one other solution for the country to default, taking the citizenry with it.
8_3ecbplus.35: And that would not have affected the rich, it would have affected workers and pensioners, " he told Parliament on Wednesday.
8_3ecbplus.36: "That was a real possibility, however nightmarish. "
8_3ecbplus.37: Under the bailout package, Greece will receive loans over three years from the IMF and the other 15 countries who share the euro currency.
8_3ecbplus.38: The rescue aims to prevent Athens' debt troubles from becoming a wider crisis for the euro.
8_3ecbplus.39: But the rioting underlined skepticism that the Greek government could keep up its end of the bargain, helping drive the euro below $1. 29 for the first time in over a year.
8_3ecbplus.40: Even with the bailout, many economists think Greece will eventually default on or restructure its debts because its prospects for economic growth are so poor over the next several years, hurting government revenue.
8_3ecbplus.41: Some fear the austerity measures insisted upon by the EU and IMF could make prospects for growth even worse.
8_3ecbplus.42: Unions say low - income Greeks will suffer disproportionately from the latest austerity measures, which aim to save euro30 billion ( $40 billion ) the country's current budget deficit through 2012.
8_3ecbplus.43: "These people are losing their rights, they are losing their future, " said Yiannis Panagopoulos, head of GSEE, one of the two largest unions.
8_3ecbplus.44: "The country cannot surrender without a fight. "
8_3ecbplus.45: IMF chief Dominique Strauss - Kahn warned that the crisis could spread to other countries despite the rescue package's efforts to contain it.
8_3ecbplus.46: "Everyone must remain extremely vigilant" to this risk, Strauss - Kahn said in an interview in French newspaper Le Parisien Wednesday.
8_3ecbplus.47: "I completely understand the Greek population's anger, its incomprehension at the size of the economic catastrophe, " Strauss - Kahn said.
8_3ecbplus.48: But, he said, Greeks must also understand that without these measures "the situation would be infinitely more serious. "
8_3ecbplus.49: The draft bill of the new austerity measures is to be voted on Thursday.
8_3ecbplus.50: Papandreou's Socialists hold a comfortable majority of 160 in the 300 - seat Parliament and the bill is expected to pass easily.

2_11ecbplus.1: 5 Thoughts on Why the Academy Picked Ellen DeGeneres As Oscar Host
2_11ecbplus.3: The Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences announced this morning that Ellen DeGeneres would return to the Academy Awards as emcee, marking her second hosting stint.
2_11ecbplus.4: Over the past few years, AMPAS has gone to great lengths to pick a host who'd make some noise: Whether it was the pairing of James Franco and Anne Hathaway in 2011, the aborted choice of Eddie Murphy as host for the 2012 Oscars, or Seth MacFarlane's pick last year, the Academy has seemed hell - bent on finding a host who might draw curious viewers — particularly, the elusive young male demographic — to the telecast.

26_6ecbplus.2: Vincent Gigante, who died yesterday in federal prison at 77, was the Genovese crime family boss who for three decades feigned lunacy to evade prosecution for crimes ranging from loan sharking to murder to bribing the entire police force of Old Tappan, N. J.
26_6ecbplus.3: He was known as "Chin, " and his moniker was often invoked by denizens of the Mafia underworld with a hand - to - chin gesture rather than a word, the better to foil police bugs.
26_6ecbplus.4: To the writers of headlines he was sometimes "Daffy Don" or "the Oddfather" for his habit of walking the streets of the West Village clad in a bathrobe, striped pyjamas, and slippers, while muttering incoherently.
26_6ecbplus.5: Federal prosecutors claimed it was an act, but it was not until 2003, after more than three decades of faking mental illness, that Gigante admitted in court that he did it to avoid prosecution.
26_6ecbplus.6: His admission came as part of a plea deal on behalf of his son, Andrew, also convicted of mob - related activities.
26_6ecbplus.7: For two decades, Gigante was head of the Genovese crime family, which emerged as the largest of the five New York Mafia clans after decades of concerted federal prosecutions decimated its rivals.
26_6ecbplus.8: It was estimated that there were some 300 members of the family under his control.
26_6ecbplus.9: The Genovese rackets included guaranteeing labor peace to firms in construction, garbage removal, and trucking; extorting payoffs from companies doing business at the Ports of Newark and Elizabeth; various rackets at the Fulton Fish Market and the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center; contracts for window - installation in city housing, and the old standbys of bookmaking, loan - sharking, and narcotics.
26_6ecbplus.10: It was narcotics that first sent Gigante to prison, in 1959, when he received a five - year sentence after being caught conspiring to smuggle heroin from abroad.
26_6ecbplus.11: Also sentenced in the case was the man who gave his name to the crime family, Vito Genovese.
26_6ecbplus.12: Genovese ran his organization from behind bars while serving a 15 - year sentence.
26_6ecbplus.13: It was a similar ruse - maintaining control of the family while incarcerated by transmitting orders through his son, Andrew - that was Gigante's downfall.
26_6ecbplus.14: Gigante was born in the Bronx to parents who were immigrants from Naples, Italy.
26_6ecbplus.15: His father was a jewelry engraver, and his mother was a seamstress.
26_6ecbplus.16: Born Vincenzo, he was called "Chin" for short, and his prominent chin probably helped the name stick.
26_6ecbplus.17: He put it to good use as a teenage boxer, winning 21 of 25 club fights.
26_6ecbplus.18: Gigante was arrested several times from when he was 17 to 25, for possession of an unlicensed handgun, gambling, bookmaking, grand larceny, and arson.
26_6ecbplus.19: Two of his brothers, Mario and Ralph, were also identified as Mafia soldiers, while another, Louis, was a prominent Catholic priest as well as a Democratic politician in the Bronx.
26_6ecbplus.20: In 1957 Gigante was charged with attempted murder in the shooting of Frank Costello, then the head of what would be called the Genovese family.
26_6ecbplus.21: He was acquitted despite the testimony of a doorman who claimed to have witnessed the crime; Costello himself claimed not to have seen his assailant, despite being shot at close range from the front.
26_6ecbplus.22: The shot had only "creased his head, " according to reports at the time.
26_6ecbplus.23: The prosecutor in the Costello case claimed that Gigante was "a young punk on the way up in the underworld who was chosen to kill Costello to win his spurs. "
26_6ecbplus.24: If so, it seemed to have worked, despite his having missed.
26_6ecbplus.25: Costello retired soon after, and Genovese assumed control of the family, which had a history going back to Lucky Luciano.
26_6ecbplus.26: After serving five years on the 1959 heroin conviction, Gigante resumed his life of crime.
26_6ecbplus.27: He first sought psychiatric help in 1966, while under investigation for bribing New York City police.
26_6ecbplus.28: In 1970, he was indicted for bribing the entire five - man police force of Old Tappan, N. J. , a small town in Bergen County where he had moved.
26_6ecbplus.29: After he produced evidence that he was under psychiatric care at St. Vincent's hospital in Westchester, the court ruled that he was mentally incompetent to testify in the case.
26_6ecbplus.30: It was a pattern Gigante would repeat in the coming decades, including committing himself several times when prosecutions threatened.
26_6ecbplus.31: Gigante's immediate family supported him, especially Louis, the glad - handing, cigar - smoking priest and builder of low - income housing, who told reporters his brother had paranoid schizophrenia, dementia, and Alzheimer's disease.
26_6ecbplus.32: Federal marshals serving him with a subpoena at his mother's Sullivan Street apartment house once found him standing under the shower, fully clothed, holding an umbrella.
26_6ecbplus.34: He is the boss of the toilet! "
26_6ecbplus.35: his mother told New York Post columnist Cindy Adams.
26_6ecbplus.36: Gigante, meantime, was consolidating his power within the Genovese family.
26_6ecbplus.37: In the late 1970s, he ran a crew in Lower Manhattan, operating waterfront rackets, as well as loan - sharking and gambling in New Jersey.
26_6ecbplus.38: He emerged as head of the Genovese family by the early 1980s.
26_6ecbplus.39: Federal prosecutors kept him under observation for decades, and Gigante kept up the crazy act with amazing consistency.
26_6ecbplus.40: He spent much of each day walking around the Village in his bed clothes and playing cards at his Triangle Civic Improvement Association on Mulberry Street.
26_6ecbplus.41: A sign hung on the wall warning business associates against loose talk: "This place is bugged. "
26_6ecbplus.42: By the late 1980s, he rarely went to Old Tappan, preferring to spend his nights on the Upper East Side with his mistress, with whom he had three children.
26_6ecbplus.43: Oddly, both his wife and his mistress were named Olympia.
26_6ecbplus.44: Gigante's mental illness act allowed him to escape trial despite being indicted numerous times on charges ranging from bid rigging and extortion to conspiracy to commit eight murders.
26_6ecbplus.45: His luck held until 1997, when a New York jury found him guilty of a range of charges and sentenced him to 12 years in the federal penitentiary.
26_6ecbplus.46: It may have been a bad omen that the judge in the case, Jack B. Weinstein, insisted that Gigante wear a suit rather than a bathrobe to his trial.
26_6ecbplus.47: At the Palma Boys Social Club in East Harlem in 1985, the FBI taped the following exchange between two Genovese family members, Anthony "Fat Tony" Salerno and Giuseppe Sabato:
26_6ecbplus.48: Salerno: He's got to worry if he gets pinched, all them years he spent in that [ expletive deleted ] asylum.
26_6ecbplus.52: Born March 29, 1928, in the Bronx; died December 19 at the U. S. Medical Center for federal prisoners in Springfield, Mo. ; the cause of death was not announced, but he had recently suffered heart problems.

24_4ecbplus.1: France jewels thefts: Robbers ram 4x4 into Paris shop
24_4ecbplus.2: French police are investigating a daring jewellery robbery in Paris - the latest in a series of high - profile thefts in France this summer.
24_4ecbplus.3: In the early hours of Monday, thieves rammed a 4x4 vehicle through the windows of an upmarket jewellery store near the prestigious Place Vendome.
24_4ecbplus.4: They made off with 2m euros ( £1. 7m; $2. 6m ) in gems and watches.
24_4ecbplus.5: In July, a masked jewel thief stole £88m worth of precious stones from the Carlton Hotel in Cannes.
24_4ecbplus.6: After Monday's robbery, the thieves set fire to the 4x4 vehicle in an adjacent side street and made off in a second car.
24_4ecbplus.7: Many of the most famous names in jewellery have their flagship stores in the Place Vendome, and this is a further embarrassment to the French authorities who have seen a spate of robberies in recent weeks, says the BBC's Christian Fraser in Paris.
24_4ecbplus.8: Inevitably, the finger will again be pointed at the Pink Panther gang, a loosely aligned network of criminals who are believed to have carried out 300 similar robberies across the world since 1999, our correspondent says.
24_4ecbplus.9: The international police agency Interpol has recently begun co - ordinating its efforts to track down the gangs' members, many of them from the former Yugoslavia.
24_4ecbplus.10: In 2007, the gang drove two cars through the window of a jewellery store in Dubai, and in less than a minute had escaped with 11m euros of jewellery.

37_1ecbplus.0: Five dead, dozens injured in Indonesia quake
37_1ecbplus.2: A powerful earthquake in Indonesia's Aceh province flattened buildings and sparked landslides Tuesday, killing at least five people and injuring dozens in a region devastated by the quake - triggered tsunami of 2004.
37_1ecbplus.3: The 6. 1 - magnitude quake struck inland at a depth of just 10 kilometers in the mountainous Bener Meriah district in the heart of Aceh, the US Geological Survey said.
37_1ecbplus.4: It destroyed houses in the district, some 320 kilometers from the provincial capital Banda Aceh, and triggered several landslides.
37_1ecbplus.5: Police and troops were deployed to lead rescue efforts, as pictures showed the walls of houses reduced to rubble and roads badly damaged and blocked by landslips.
37_1ecbplus.6: Five people had so far been confirmed dead in the quake, Fauzi, an official from the local disaster agency, told AFP late Tuesday.
37_1ecbplus.7: In Suka Makmur village a landslide engulfed a coffee plantation, killing one man, said the official who uses one name.
37_1ecbplus.8: "A man was working at a coffee plantation with his wife when a landslide caused by the quake struck, " he said.
37_1ecbplus.9: "His body was found under a pile of earth soon afterwards, " he said, adding that his wife and another woman were missing at the site.
37_1ecbplus.10: Four other people died in hospitals in the district from injuries sustained in the quake, he said.
37_1ecbplus.11: One of the fatalities was a child who died when a wall collapsed, Ema Suryani, a doctor at a health clinic in Lampahan city in the district, told AFP.
37_1ecbplus.12: "We have received around 50 people with injuries sustained when the walls of their houses collapsed, " added the doctor.
37_1ecbplus.13: "There are around 30 people seriously injured, some with head injuries.
37_1ecbplus.14: The rest have only light injuries like minor cuts and grazes. "
37_1ecbplus.15: Injured people had been transported from several affected villages in two trucks, she said.
37_1ecbplus.16: Around 40 houses were damaged by the quake, including some which were flattened, said disaster agency official Fauzi.
37_1ecbplus.17: Most of the damaged houses were in the Wih Pesam area of the district, he added.
37_1ecbplus.18: People ran outside in panic in Banda Aceh as the quake shook houses, and in Medan city to the south of the province on Sumatra island.
37_1ecbplus.19: "The quake was felt strongly for around 15 seconds, from Bener Meriah to Banda Aceh.
37_1ecbplus.20: People panicked and rushed out of their homes, " national disaster agency spokesman Sutopo Purwo Nugroho said.
37_1ecbplus.21: Aceh, on the northern tip of Sumatra, is regularly hit by quakes.
37_1ecbplus.22: In 2004 a massive tremor sparked a tsunami that killed 170, 000 people in the province and tens of thousands more in countries around the Indian Ocean.
37_1ecbplus.23: In April last year an 8. 6 - magnitude quake struck 431 kilometres off Banda Aceh, prompting an Indian Ocean - wide tsunami alert.
37_1ecbplus.24: Five people died and seven were injured in Aceh in the quake and following aftershocks.
37_1ecbplus.25: In September 2009 a major earthquake near Padang city on Sumatra killed more than 1, 000 people.
37_1ecbplus.26: Indonesia sits on the Pacific "Ring of Fire" where tectonic plates collide, causing frequent seismic and volcanic activity.

34_4ecbplus.0: The Doctor Is ( Finally ) In: Obama To Nominate Regina Benjamin as Surgeon General
34_4ecbplus.2: President Obama will name Dr. Regina Benjamin as U. S. Surgeon General in a Rose Garden announcement late this morning.
34_4ecbplus.3: Benjamin, an Alabama family physician, runs a rural health clinic in Bayou La Batre.
34_4ecbplus.4: She was the first African - American woman to head a state medical society and received a MacArthur Foundation "genius grant" last year.
34_4ecbplus.5: She became known nationally for her determination to rebuild her clinic, destroyed in Hurricane Katrina in 2005.
34_4ecbplus.6: In her profile on the National Institutes of Health web site, Benjamin writes about her calling to become a doctor while in medical school at the University of Alabama at Birmingham.
34_4ecbplus.7: "I believe it was divine intervention - it was in medical school when I realized there was nothing else I'd rather do with my life than to be a doctor.
34_4ecbplus.8: I had never seen a black doctor before I went to college, so I did not have an idea that I wanted to be one.
34_4ecbplus.9: I never thought I that I couldn't, but I never really thought about it at all. "
34_4ecbplus.10: According to a 1997 article in Ebony, Benjamin said she applied to Yale University School of Law before she attended college.
34_4ecbplus.11: "They sent me a reply politely telling me that I needed my undergraduate degree first. "
34_4ecbplus.12: To pay for college, she turned to the National Health Service Corps, which gave her a tuition reimbursement in exchange for committing to work in areas where there was a shortage of doctors.
34_4ecbplus.13: That agreement took her to Bayou La Batre where she was the only doctor for 2, 500 people, most of whom lived below the poverty line and spoke no English.
34_4ecbplus.14: Benjamin was named the Person of the Week on ABC News' World News Tonight in 1995 and conveyed the challenges of servicing poor patients.
34_4ecbplus.17: They make a living the best they can on shrimp boats.
34_4ecbplus.18: They, unfortunately, are too poor to pay their medical bills at times, " she told ABC News' Peter Jennings.
34_4ecbplus.20: Sometimes I can do everything that the textbooks taught me and school taught me and then patients can't buy their medicine.
34_4ecbplus.22: In January, it was reported that President Obama had asked CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta to be Surgeon General, and that Gupta had mulled the offer for a while, but eventually turned it down.
34_4ecbplus.23: Benjamin will appear in the Rose Garden today as the president makes the nomination formal.

16_11ecbplus.1: RIP LA County Sheriff Deputy Jerry Ortiz
16_11ecbplus.2: Another peace officer has been gunned down in cold blood.
16_11ecbplus.3: His name is Los Angeles county Sheriff deputy Jerry Ortiz.
16_11ecbplus.4: Officer Ortiz was knocking on doors down in the city of Hawaiian Gardens looking for gang members and he was shot point blank range in the head by gang member Jose Luis Orozco.
16_11ecbplus.5: They caught him a few doors down from where the shooting took place.
16_11ecbplus.6: At least he didn't get a chance to flee to Mexico.
16_11ecbplus.7: I guess we can be thankful for that.
16_11ecbplus.8: This is just another example of how hard the job that police officers have.
16_11ecbplus.9: They truely love what they're doing because they certainly aren't in it for the money.
16_11ecbplus.10: These guys are constantly getting shot at.
16_11ecbplus.11: My hat is off to all the police officers around the country.

13_8ecbplus.0: Fire destroys historic Mat Maid dairy building in Palmer
13_8ecbplus.2: Warehouse was one of the last original buildings remaining from the Matanuska Colony
13_8ecbplus.3: The Matanuska Maid Block Building, one of the oldest buildings in Palmer, burned to the ground in a spectacular fire Tuesday morning.
13_8ecbplus.4: The wooden structure at 325 E. Dahlia Ave. was known as the "Old Mat Maid Warehouse. "
13_8ecbplus.5: It was built in 1935, the same year that the first farm families arrived as part of the federal government's Matanuska Colony project.
13_8ecbplus.6: A 911 caller reported the fire at 3: 33 a. m.
13_8ecbplus.7: Palmer Fire and Rescue Chief John McNutt arrived and saw fire under the eaves of the building.
13_8ecbplus.8: "Within one minute or two, the whole roof was ablaze, " said Palmer Public Safety Director Jon Owen.
13_8ecbplus.9: After a quick survey of the scene, Owen said, McNutt's main concern was keeping the fire from spreading to the heating oil stored next door at the Crowley fuel distribution center.
13_8ecbplus.10: The Mat - Su Central Fire Department joined Palmer firefighters with men and equipment.
13_8ecbplus.11: Photos show the entire two - story building seeming to go up in flames at once, with a ball of fire boiling into the air 20 feet above the roof.
13_8ecbplus.12: Owen said a total of 31 fire trucks, emergency vehicles and other equipment were eventually on scene.
13_8ecbplus.13: Three "aerials, " ladders with hoses, fought the fire from above, two of which were positioned between the fire and Crowley.
13_8ecbplus.14: At its height, 5, 000 gallons of water were being poured onto the blaze every minute.
13_8ecbplus.15: "It was a testament to the Palmer water system, " Owen said.
13_8ecbplus.16: "We could have had a ( larger ) conflagration. "
13_8ecbplus.17: A Crowley employee was at the office within minutes, said terminal manager Jasper Hall, ready to move the fuel delivery trucks out of harm's way.
13_8ecbplus.18: The terminal mainly holds heating oil, he said.
13_8ecbplus.19: By 6: 40 a. m. the fire was under control, Owen said.
13_8ecbplus.20: By noon, small clouds of smoke still rose from the pile of ash and a few charred upright timbers teetered over the ruin.
13_8ecbplus.21: The building, which the city of Palmer had valued at about $380, 600, was a total loss.
13_8ecbplus.22: Anchorage lawyer William Ingaldson, the building's owner, was there to inspect the damage.
13_8ecbplus.23: He said he had owned the property for six or seven years.
13_8ecbplus.24: He estimated the size of the structure at 12, 000 square feet.
13_8ecbplus.25: "None of it was insured, " he said.
13_8ecbplus.27: There were no reports of injuries.
13_8ecbplus.28: The building was vacant and not in use at the time of the fire.
13_8ecbplus.29: The structure made the Alaska Association for Historic Preservation's list of 10 most endangered properties in the state for the past four years.
13_8ecbplus.30: It was also known as the Colony Project Warehouse because it was built as part of the federal Matanuska Colony Project during the New Deal era.
13_8ecbplus.31: Families were brought to Palmer and given land.
13_8ecbplus.32: They formed the Matanuska Valley Farmers Cooperating Association.
13_8ecbplus.33: The warehouse stored feed and other supplies for the farmers.
13_8ecbplus.34: The Matanuska Colony had a mixed record.
13_8ecbplus.35: Within five years, half of the settlers gave up and left.
13_8ecbplus.37: At a time when shipment of food from the states could take a month, Valley producers supplied fresh milk to customers along the rail belt.
13_8ecbplus.38: The co - op became the Matanuska Maid corporation.
13_8ecbplus.39: In the 1950s, dairy operators fought a losing battle against the importation of reconstituted milk, which allowed powdered milk to be mixed with fresh milk and sold at a lower price.
13_8ecbplus.40: As transportation improved, it became cheaper to ship milk from the Lower 48.
13_8ecbplus.41: The state's Point MacKenzie project, designed to rescue Alaska's dairy industry, turned out to be a colossal failure.
13_8ecbplus.42: Mat Maid filed for bankruptcy in November 1983.
13_8ecbplus.43: The state took over and ran the business until economic pressures forced it to close in December 2007.
13_8ecbplus.44: Even before then, Mat Maid assets were being put on the auction block or abandoned.
13_8ecbplus.45: The trading post, also built in 1935, is beautifully restored and still open for business as Dahlia Street Market, on the other side of the street.
13_8ecbplus.46: But the Matanuska Maid creamery building, which stood between the street and the warehouse in the old days, was burned down by teenagers in 2003.
13_8ecbplus.47: Grass and cottonwoods now cover the site.
13_8ecbplus.48: The long warehouse boasted a full - length porch and distinctive chevron pattern at the gable ends of the roof.
13_8ecbplus.49: It had its own railroad siding.
13_8ecbplus.50: Three cupolas drew light into the building.
13_8ecbplus.51: A recessed entry let workers unload wagons or trucks out of the wind.
13_8ecbplus.52: A historical marker reads, "These buildings were the heart and economic center of Palmer and the colony. "
13_8ecbplus.53: The old warehouse was weathered and battered on the outside, Ingaldson said.
13_8ecbplus.54: "But inside, there was all this beautiful timber.
13_8ecbplus.58: The building still stored relics from its glory days, he said, canvas potato bags and containers for cheese products.
13_8ecbplus.59: Ingaldson said he had explored different options for developing the building, which was not being used at the time of the fire.
13_8ecbplus.60: Ideas included turning it into apartments, shops and offices for nonprofit groups or as part of a convention area.
13_8ecbplus.61: "There were lots of really good plans we had, " he said.
13_8ecbplus.62: "It was a historic building with lots of possibilities.
13_8ecbplus.65: The State Fire Marshall's office is helping investigate the fire.
13_8ecbplus.66: Palmer police ask anyone with information about how the fire started to call Sgt. Shayne La Croix at 745 - 4811.

21_4ecbplus.0: Cops: Queens Woman Killed In Hit - And - Run
21_4ecbplus.1: Driver Charged With DWI, Vehicular Manslaughter
21_4ecbplus.3: A 59 - year - old mother of two died when a drunken driver struck her with his car and then drove off, police said.
21_4ecbplus.4: Raj Chohan, 59, of Queens, had just parked her car around 7 p. m. Friday at 97th Avenue and 117th Street in Richmond Hill when she was hit by a 2013 Toyota Camry, which then fled, police told 1010 WINS ’ Glenn Schuck.
21_4ecbplus.5: A police officer that was parked nearby and witnessed the incident chased after the car and arrested Vishwanand Subryan, 23, of Schenectady, several blocks away.
21_4ecbplus.6: Subryan is charged with DWI, vehicular manslaughter and leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death.
21_4ecbplus.7: Chohan was pronounced dead at Jamaica Hospital.
21_4ecbplus.8: Several neighbors ran outside to try to help the woman.
21_4ecbplus.9: “ Oh man, she was bad, ” one man told Schuck.
21_4ecbplus.10: “ There was nothing we could do.
21_4ecbplus.11: Everybody was just standing there all confused, like they can ’ t believe that this happened over here.
21_4ecbplus.13: “ My wife was getting ready to go out with the kid, and she screamed that somebody hit another car and ran away, ” another neighbor said.
21_4ecbplus.14: “ When I went to check, I saw the lady lying on the floor, but she wasn ’ t breathing or anything. ”

41_10ecbplus.0: South Sudan warns of war after Sudan bombs refugee camp
41_10ecbplus.1: Military aircraft from Sudan crossed the new international border with South Sudan and dropped bombs Thursday in and around a camp filled with refugees, officials said.
41_10ecbplus.2: A government official initially reported deaths, but an American activist who spoke to aid workers at the camp later said there were no casualties.
41_10ecbplus.3: The violence in and near the Yida refugee camp, located 10 miles south of the border, came one day after bombings were reported in another region of South Sudan, an attack that provoked strong condemnation from the U. S. State Department.
41_10ecbplus.4: The president of South Sudan, which became the world's newest country only four months ago, said he fears the Khartoum - based government intends to invade the south soon.
41_10ecbplus.5: "Whatever allegations Khartoum labels against the Republic of South Sudan are baseless, but intended to justify his pending invasion of the south, " President Salva Kiir said.
41_10ecbplus.6: He later added: "We are committed to peaceful resolutions to any conflict but we will never allow our sovereignty to be violated by anybody. "
41_10ecbplus.7: There was no immediate comment from the Sudanese government in Khartoum on Thursday.
41_10ecbplus.8: The violence is especially troubling given the history between the two sides: The black African tribes of South Sudan and the mainly Arab north battled two civil wars over more than five decades, and some 2 million died in the latest war, from 1983 - 2005.
41_10ecbplus.9: A peace deal ended the war and South Sudan became its own country in July after a successful independence referendum.
41_10ecbplus.10: But there have been lingering disputes over border demarcation and oil - sharing revenues.
41_10ecbplus.11: Ryan Boyette, a former aid worker who lives in Sudan who is now leading a team of 15 citizen journalists, said he talked to five aid workers in the Yida camp, all of whom said that four bombs were dropped but that they caused no casualties.

40_7ecbplus.0: Apple unveils new MacBook Pro with Ivy Bridge at WWDC
40_7ecbplus.2: Apple is certainly making WWDC a hardware conference this year - it just unveiled a refresh of the existing MacBook Pro running Intel's newer Ivy Bridge processors on the San Francisco gathering's opening day.
40_7ecbplus.3: The 13 - and 15 - inch portables run up to 2. 7GHz quad Core i7s ( turbo up to 3. 7GHz ), carry up to 8GB of RAM and have GeForce GT 650M - based graphics 60 percent faster than the previous generation.
40_7ecbplus.4: Like the new MacBook Air, they tout USB 3. 0 ports.
40_7ecbplus.5: If you're more comfortable with Apple's conventional MacBook Pro design than the new variety, Apple will ask $1, 099 for the base 13 - inch version and $1, 799 for a 15 - inch version, with an upgraded 15 - inch model going for $2, 199.
40_7ecbplus.6: All of them are shipping today - we're not seeing any mention of an updated 17 - inch version, so it may have been cast aside.

43_3ecbplus.0: AMD Enters Server Business With Bold Acquisition
43_3ecbplus.2: Chip designer and chief Intel rival AMD has signed an agreement to acquire SeaMicro, a Silicon Valley startup that seeks to save power and space by building servers from hundreds of low - power processors.
43_3ecbplus.3: With the purchase, AMD will not only turn itself into a server maker, it will turn itself into a server maker that uses chips from Intel.
43_3ecbplus.4: Today, SeaMicro ’ s servers are built with processors from AMD ’ s rival, including Intel ’ s Atom mobile processors as well as Intel Xeon chips.
43_3ecbplus.5: AMD says it will continue to sell and support SeaMicro servers equipped with Intel chips “ for the foreseeable future. ”
43_3ecbplus.6: But it also hopes to license SeaMicro ’ s server “ fabric ” technology to other server sellers, including big names Dell and HP, and it plans to introduce AMD Opteron chips into SeaMicro machines sometime in the second half of the year.
43_3ecbplus.7: SeaMicro ’ s fabric is a way of efficiently connecting various pieces of server hardware, and the company says it can be used with virtually any processor.
43_3ecbplus.8: Less than a month ago, Intel and SeaMicro held a joint press event where they predicted a bright future together, so it would appear that the AMD acquisition came about rather quickly.
43_3ecbplus.9: But AMD ’ s Lisa Su — the company ’ s senior vice president and general manager for its global business units — says the chip designer has been eyeing technologies along the lines of SeaMicro ’ s for some time.
43_3ecbplus.10: “ We ’ ve been looking at the key technology innovations that are going to really disrupt the server market.
43_3ecbplus.11: We ’ ve been looking at fabric technologies — externally with a number of companies as well as internally, looking to develop ourselves — and we felt that SeaMicro was really the best option.
43_3ecbplus.12: It was proven, and it was in systems, ” Su said on Wednesday morning during a briefing with reporters.
43_3ecbplus.13: “ The complement of our processing capability and SeaMicro ’ s fabric technology gives us what we think is a very, very strong [ intellectual property ] portfolio. ”
43_3ecbplus.14: AMD will pay $334 million for SeaMicro, including $281 million in cash.
43_3ecbplus.15: The deal is expected to close in “ a number of weeks. ”
43_3ecbplus.16: Based in Sunnyvale, California, SeaMicro is at the forefront of a movement to build servers from ultra - low - powered processors — aka “ wimpy cores. ”
43_3ecbplus.17: The idea is to reduce power by splitting applications into small pieces that can be spread across a larger number of chips, not unlike the one running your cell phone.
43_3ecbplus.18: Texas startup Calxeda offers “ wimpy core ” servers equipped with chips using the ARM instruction set — an alternative to the x86 instruction set used by Intel and AMD — while HP is exploring the idea with a research effort it calls Project Moonshot.
43_3ecbplus.19: But last month, during that press event co - hosted by Intel, SeaMicro announced that it would also offer servers equipped with Intel Xeon chips, which were specifically designed for servers.
43_3ecbplus.20: Xeon consume more power, but they also offer more speed.
43_3ecbplus.21: SeaMicro says that certain software workloads are suited to the wimpy cores, while others are suited to “ brawny cores, ” and this same message is delivered by the likes of Dave Andersen, the Carnegie Melon professor who coined the wimpy core name.
43_3ecbplus.22: Whatever processor it uses, SeaMicro says, it can save power and space when you compare its machines to traditional servers.
43_3ecbplus.23: The company has built specialized ASIC chip loaded with software that allows the company to build ultra - small motherboards that include little more than processors, memory, and the ASIC itself — and then connect hundreds of these boards.
43_3ecbplus.24: According to the company, this technology is “ chip agnostic, ” meaning it can relatively easily be used with new chip architectures.
43_3ecbplus.25: AMD and SeaMicro say that they will “ explore ” the use of SeaMicro ’ s fabrics with all sorts of processors, both wimpy and brawny.
43_3ecbplus.27: In recent weeks, AMD has hinted that it will eventually license ARM technology.
43_3ecbplus.28: Asked if the company will continue to offer ultra - low - power chips along the lines of the Intel Atom, SeaMicro CEO and co - founder Andrew Feldman said “ absolutely. ”
43_3ecbplus.29: But he declined to point to specific processor architectures.
43_3ecbplus.30: “ This [ SeaMicro fabric ] technology can work with larger cores and small cores.
43_3ecbplus.31: It can work with x86 and non - x86.
43_3ecbplus.32: It can also move Ethernet traffic and storage traffic, ” Feldman said.
43_3ecbplus.33: AMD chief technology officer Mark Papermaster then piped up to point out that AMD is intent on using whatever chip technologies are needed to get a particular job done.
43_3ecbplus.34: “ If you look at our roadmap, we have a very agile [ system - on - a - chip ], ” he said.
43_3ecbplus.35: “ It allows us to be more pushy in bringing in our IP. ”
43_3ecbplus.36: SeaMicro currently employs 80 people, and about half of them are engineers.
43_3ecbplus.37: One of those engineers is founder and chief technology officer Gary Lauterbach, who was previously an AMD fellow and one of five architects who build the core of AMD ’ s Opteron processor.
43_3ecbplus.38: Lauterbach was also a lead chip designer at Sun Microsystems, and the idea for SeaMicro first came to him when he and another Sun executive got a look at the low - power servers that powered Google ’ s search engine in the early part of the last decade.
43_3ecbplus.39: Andrew Feldman will become the general manager of AMD ’ s new “ data center solutions ” business.
43_3ecbplus.40: According to Su, this business unit will continue to support the current “ roadmap ” for SeaMicro ’ s servers.
43_3ecbplus.41: This means that the company will sell and service SeaMicro ’ s Intel Atom and Intel Xeon systems — though Su indicated that the company will eventually drop Intel ’ s chips.
43_3ecbplus.42: She said that AMD Opteron chips will be added to SeaMicro system “ towards the end of this year. ”
43_3ecbplus.43: Intel ’ s Jason Waxman — who heads the company ’ s general manager of Intel ’ s High Density Computing group — tells Wired that AMD ’ s acquisition of SeaMicro “ doesn ’ t change a whole lot ” for Intel.
43_3ecbplus.44: He says that AMD will decide whether to keep selling SeaMicro servers with Intel chips, and that Intel will continue to reduce the power consumption of both its Xeon and Atom chips for use inside servers.
43_3ecbplus.45: “ Being able to launch the SeaMicro product with Intel Xeon silicon was a good testimonial for us.
43_3ecbplus.46: They thought we were the best partner at the time, ” Waxman said.
43_3ecbplus.47: “ They chose our silicon for a reason. ”
43_3ecbplus.48: Whatever the fate of Intel chips in SeaMicro servers, AMD says the acquisition is about more than just selling machines.
43_3ecbplus.49: The idea is also to “ broaden ” AMD ’ s relationships with server sellers such as Dell and HP.
43_3ecbplus.50: Presumably, this means that AMD will license SeaMicro ’ s fabric technology to third - parties.
43_3ecbplus.51: “ We have new technology that we can add to our existing Opteron roadmap to form something that can really differentiate us in the marketplace, ” Su said.
43_3ecbplus.52: Andrew Feldman added that SeaMicro has already had discussions along these lines with the likes of Dell and HP.
43_3ecbplus.54: That said, the acquisition means that — on some level — AMD will be competing with its own customers.
43_3ecbplus.55: It will be both chip designer and server maker.
43_3ecbplus.57: “ We are not competing with our customers.
43_3ecbplus.58: We have to balance the fact that will continue to support [ SeaMicro's ] products.
43_3ecbplus.59: But the goal is to proliferate the technology with OEMs, ” Su said, referring to original equipment manufacturers such as Dell and HP.
43_3ecbplus.60: “ What we saw was a chance to take our technology to multiple markets, with multiple partners, in multiple geographies — in ways we couldn ’ t do on our own, ” said SeaMicro CEO and new AMD general manager Andrew Feldman.
43_3ecbplus.61: “ The opportunity to collaborate with the OEMs was larger than the opportunity to compete with them. ”

41_9ecbplus.0: Samaritan's Purse Refugee Camp Bombed, Allegedly By Sudanese Government
41_9ecbplus.2: The government of Sudan bombed the Samaritan's Purse refugee camp in Yida, South Sudan, on Thursday, Nov. 10, alleges the nondenominational evangelical Christian organization.
41_9ecbplus.3: The camp, located in the oil - rich northern region of Yida, consists of over 24, 000 refugees who have fled the heavy fighting of Sudan's South Kordofan region.
41_9ecbplus.4: The camp at Yida is an area of thick bush just about ten miles south of the generally recognized border between South Sudan and Sudan.
41_9ecbplus.5: The bombing was a result of the heightening tensions between Sudan and South Sudan.
41_9ecbplus.6: South Sudan gained its independence from Sudan 6 months ago, ending one of Africa's longest civil wars.
41_9ecbplus.7: Sudan accuses South Sudan of arming Sudanese rebels in the border states of Southern Kordofan and the Blue Nile, according to The New York Times.
41_9ecbplus.8: Samaritan's Purse provides aid, both spiritually and physically, to those in need.
41_9ecbplus.9: The organization uses DC - 3 planes to deliver food to the refugees of Yida.
41_9ecbplus.10: The planes deliver six to seven loads a day, three days a week.
41_9ecbplus.11: The organization has dropped 420 tons of food staples to the refugees, and is in connection with the U. N. 's World Food Program.
41_9ecbplus.12: According to a Samaritan's Purse press release, Sudan Armed Forces planes dropped four bombs at 3: 20 p. m. in the region Thursday.
41_9ecbplus.13: Ken Isaacs, Vice President of programs and government relations at Samaritan's Purse, told The Christian Post that the bombing as a "terrifying event for all of the staff and the people in our community. "
41_9ecbplus.14: One bomb hit a 200 - student schoolhouse but did not explode, another bomb hit the community marketplace and two others hit the outskirts of the camp.
41_9ecbplus.15: The bombs did not do any damage and, according to Isaacs, one bomb landed just 5 feet away from a boy, but did not explode.
41_9ecbplus.16: " [ The ] MineTech International ( MTI ) explosive ordinance disposal ( EOD ) team removed the bomb from the Yida Village School and moved it to an isolated location for disposal at a later date, " according to the United Nations Mine Action Coordination Center of South Sudan.
41_9ecbplus.17: "I urge the United States and the international community to enforce a no - fly zone in the area to protect not only the innocent civilians there but also those who are trying to help them, " Samaritan's Purse president Franklin Graham said in a press release.
41_9ecbplus.18: "My prayer is that the world will not just sit by and watch and hope for the best like they did during Rwanda, where close to a million people were massacred.
41_9ecbplus.19: We need to make it clear to the government of Sudan that attacks on innocent people will not be tolerated, " the evangelist said.
41_9ecbplus.20: The White House has also condemned the bombing.
41_9ecbplus.21: In a press statement released Nov. 10, the White House urged the government to stop the bombings immediately.
41_9ecbplus.22: "We urge the Government of South Sudan to exercise restraint in responding to this provocation to prevent further escalation of hostilities, " read the press release.
41_9ecbplus.23: The refugee camp had just received food rations when the bombing took place.
41_9ecbplus.24: Graham said these bombings are a tactic reminiscent of Sudan's civil war, used to injure and kill as many as possible.
41_9ecbplus.25: The food is delivered, the attackers wait for people to gather to collect the food, and then they bomb the masses.
41_9ecbplus.26: According to The New York Times, a satellite - imaging program reveals a build - up of Sudanese troops near the South Sudan border in the Blue Nile region.
41_9ecbplus.27: Images also reportedly reveal upgraded air bases recently captured by government forces.
41_9ecbplus.28: Sudan's government denies a connection to the bombing.
41_9ecbplus.29: Sudanese government spokesperson Rabie A. Atti defended the government Sunday, saying, "We are only securing our border. "
41_9ecbplus.30: Susan Rice, U. S. Ambassador for the United Nations, said the Sudan government "blatantly lied" about the bombing, adding that such a lie proves very disturbing to the United States and many members of the U. N. Security Council.
41_9ecbplus.31: As Isaacs of Samaritan's Purse contends, Sudan's government denied any bombing in "South Sudan. "
41_9ecbplus.32: "What do they consider to be South Sudan? " Isaacs questioned, noting that there are elements of a border dispute, with Yida being only 10 miles from the border.
41_9ecbplus.33: Describing Yida as a "very insecure" area, Isaacs expressed worry for the future of Yida's refugees.
41_9ecbplus.34: "The conflict and the insecurity are going to grow.
41_9ecbplus.35: It is going to get worse before it gets better, " he said.
41_9ecbplus.36: "There is a need to relocate the people.
41_9ecbplus.37: The areas that have been offered for relocation are not agreeable, " he added.
41_9ecbplus.38: According to Isaacs, food supplies are rapidly dwindling.
41_9ecbplus.39: The refugees received a three - day ration on Oct. 29, a one - day ration on Nov. 7th and a one - day ration on Nov. 11.
41_9ecbplus.40: "We are looking to World Food Programme and the UNHCR to fully respond to the needs [ of the people ].
41_9ecbplus.41: We appreciate what they're doing but we remain deeply concerned for the people, " Isaacs said.

35_6ecbplus.0: City Attorney Weighs Filing DUI Charges Against Chargers' Jamal Williams
35_6ecbplus.3: The City Attorney's Office was considering today whether to file misdemeanor drunken - driving charges against Chargers defensive lineman Jamal Williams.
35_6ecbplus.4: Williams, 32, was arrested around 1: 30 a. m. Feb. 1 on state Route 94 on suspicion of drunken driving.
35_6ecbplus.5: Results from a blood - alcohol test administered when Williams was arrested were released Wednesday, showing a level of 0. 07 percent - - just under the state legal limit of 0. 08 percent, California Highway Patrol Officer Brian Pennings told The San Diego Union - Tribune.
35_6ecbplus.6: He said the blood was drawn well after Williams' arrest, meaning he could have been intoxicated when when officers pulled him over for speeding in his 2008 Bentley.
35_6ecbplus.7: City Attorney spokeswoman Gina Coburn told the Union - Tribune the case remains under review and is being investigated further.

8_8ecbplus.0: Greek anti - austerity march erupts in violence, 3 dead
8_8ecbplus.2: Three people, one of them a pregnant woman, were killed when Greeks protesting against government austerity measures threw petrol bombs at a bank in Athens on Wednesday.
8_8ecbplus.3: Tens of thousands of striking workers and civil servants took to the streets and masked youths clashed with police in riot gear, who responded with steady rounds of tear gas and flash bombs which clouded the city centre.
8_8ecbplus.4: It was the worst violence to hit Greece since riots in 2008.
8_8ecbplus.5: The violence was a blow to Prime Minister George Papandreou's plans to push through tough budget cuts demanded by the European Union and International Monetary Fund in exchange for a 110 billion euro ( 93. 6 billion pound ) aid package unveiled on Sunday.
8_8ecbplus.6: Police said two women and one man, between 30 and 40 years old, working for a Marfin bank branch choked on smoke after protesters broke the windows of a commercial building on central Stadiou Avenue and tossed in Molotov cocktails.
8_8ecbplus.7: Marfin bank officials told Reuters one of the female victims was pregnant.
8_8ecbplus.8: Firemen had to restrain a distraught elderly woman outside the bank, who wept and cried "my child, my child. "
8_8ecbplus.9: Papandreou expressed shock at the deaths and vowed to bring those responsible to justice.
8_8ecbplus.10: "We are deeply shocked by the unjust death of these three people, our fellow citizens, who were victims of a murderous act, " he told parliament.
8_8ecbplus.11: He also defended his austerity plans, which foresee 30 billion euros in savings mainly from cuts in wages and pensions, and said the government would not abandon its drive to save the country from ruin.
8_8ecbplus.12: "We took these decisions to save the country, " he said.
8_8ecbplus.15: Protesters tried to storm parliament but were pushed back by riot police shortly before it started to debate the austerity bill.
8_8ecbplus.16: Opposition conservatives are refusing to support it, but the government, which enjoys a comfortable majority, hopes to pass it by the end of the week.
8_8ecbplus.17: Police put the march, to mark a 24 - hour nationwide strike, at roughly 30, 000 people.
8_8ecbplus.18: But witnesses said there were more than 50, 000 - - easily the biggest protest since Papandreou took office last October and launched efforts to reform an economy that is uncompetitive and plagued by corruption.
8_8ecbplus.19: Hundreds of black - hooded anarchists roamed the streets, smashing store windows and hacking chunks of marble off buildings to throw at police.
8_8ecbplus.20: Although they were behind the worst of the violence, other protesters joined them in pelting police with bottles, shouting "Thieves! "
8_8ecbplus.21: Presidential guards, who usually stand immobile in front of the assembly building, left their posts as the clashes worsened.
8_8ecbplus.22: "Our country is on the edge of the abyss, " Greek President Karolos Papoulias said in a statement.
8_8ecbplus.23: "We are all responsible so that it does not take the step into the void. "
8_8ecbplus.24: The marchers had dispersed by late afternoon, leaving streets littered with burnt out garbage containers.
8_8ecbplus.25: Dozens of shop windows were smashed, including a bookstore near the burnt bank.
8_8ecbplus.26: Two other buildings besides the bank were set on fire.
8_8ecbplus.27: Police said 18 people had been injured in the violence and 12 arrested for carrying weapons and resisting authorities.
8_8ecbplus.29: The EU and IMF aid was intended to calm markets and give the government time to overhaul the economy and bring down a deficit that totalled 13. 6 percent of national economic output last year.
8_8ecbplus.30: But the euro currency and Greek assets have been pummelled by concern that social unrest could thwart government plans to push through the measures, and on fears that Greece's woes could spread to other euro zone countries such as Portugal and Spain.
8_8ecbplus.31: In past months anti - austerity protests had been fairly peaceful, but Wednesday's violence was similar to that seen in the December 2008 riots, which broke out when police killed a teenager and dragged on for weeks.
8_8ecbplus.32: Wednesday's strike grounded flights, shut shops and brought public transport to a standstill and the main public sector union ADEDY said it was planning more walkout for next week.
8_8ecbplus.33: "The big participation in the strike today and the crowds that flooded the streets of Athens. .. sent a message to the government: We will not let the EU and the IMF measures pass, " said Ilias Vrettakos, deputy head of the union.
8_8ecbplus.34: Apostolos Kolokythopoulos, a 70 - year old pensioner who lives on less than 1, 000 euros a month, said the walkouts were needed to force the government to change course.
8_8ecbplus.36: If people don't react, don't protest, how will things change? " he said.
8_8ecbplus.37: Centre - left daily Eleftherotypia warned young Greeks would rise up if nothing was done to give them hope of a future.
8_8ecbplus.38: "If nothing is done, the explosion of the angry and the disappointed will sweep everything away, " the paper said.
8_8ecbplus.39: "Have we forgotten December 2008 and become complacent? "

1_16ecbplus.0: Lindsay Lohan Checks Into Rehab in Newport Beach; Investigation of Facility Pending
1_16ecbplus.2: Lindsay Lohan has checked into rehab in Newport Beach, Calif. , and will remain there for the time being, pending an investigation of the facility she chose.
1_16ecbplus.3: This despite the fact that, at the 11th hour, Lohan bailed on rehab in a New York facility that was approved by prosecutors and a judge and flew to L. A.

13_11ecbplus.2: Remains of the Mat Maid warehouse smolder Tuesday morning in Palmer.
13_11ecbplus.3: The fire was reported at 3: 33 a. m. and is under investigation by the Palmer Police and the State Fire Marshal.

39_5ecbplus.0: Peter Capaldi Takes Over Doctor Who Tardis: John Barrowman, Stephen Fry & McFly's Tom Fletcher Lead Celeb Congrats
39_5ecbplus.1: Celeb fans took to Twitter as Matt Smith's replacement was unveiled
39_5ecbplus.2: The new Doctor Who has finally been unveiled.
39_5ecbplus.3: Yesterday evening the new tenant of the Tardis was unveiled as Peter Capaldi stepped into Matt Smith's soon to be vacant Doctor Who shoes as the twelfth incarnation of the Time Lord.
39_5ecbplus.4: Celebrity Who fans were soon taking to Twitter in their droves to voice their excitement at the Doctor's appointment.
39_5ecbplus.5: The Thick Of It star, Capaldi described himself as a "life - long Doctor Who fan" when revealed by Zoe Ball as Smith's successor on a live BBC show on Sunday evening.
39_5ecbplus.6: He said in his first interview: "It's so wonderful not to keep the secret any longer! "
39_5ecbplus.7: "For a while I couldn't tell my daughter, who'd be looking on the internet at people saying 'So - and - so should be Doctor Who, so - and - so should be Doctor Who. ..
39_5ecbplus.8: she was getting rather upset that they never mentioned me! "
39_5ecbplus.9: The 55 - year - old is a hugely popular choice, judging by some celebrity twitter chatter last night.
39_5ecbplus.10: Huge Who fan Stephen Fry tweeted: "Well, at least they've chosen a wonderful actor. .. #DrWho" whilst former Companion Karen Gillan was more than happy with Peter, who she starred with in 2008 Doctor Who episode The Fires of Pompeii:
39_5ecbplus.13: Swear I've seen him in Pompeii. .. "
39_5ecbplus.14: Sherlock star and Doctor Who writer Mark Gatiss added to the gushing messages:
39_5ecbplus.16: Cometh the hour, cometh the man!
39_5ecbplus.17: Peter Capaldi is the PERFECT choice.
39_5ecbplus.19: Self confessed sci - fi geek Tom Fletcher from McFly was the envy of his Twitter followers as he heard the news live from the studio, sitting amongst fellow Doctor Who fans as he tweeted:
39_5ecbplus.20: "That was tense, was sweating waiting for the big reveal!
39_5ecbplus.24: Former Doctor Colin Baker tweeted: "Delighted to hear Peter Capaldi is the new Doctor, very good choice.
39_5ecbplus.26: Nice to have a more mature Doctor too.
39_5ecbplus.28: Captain Jack Harkness, John Barrowman added his congrats: "Peter Capaldi good choice and good actor.
39_5ecbplus.32: Finally Homeland star David Harewood, one of the buzzed about names to take over the role, managed a cheeky joke amid all the excitement: "Well. .. .. if it is me. .. .. the bleedin taxi's late. #who"

28_8ecbplus.0: Watergate figure Fred LaRue found dead in hotel
28_8ecbplus.2: Fred LaRue, a high - ranking Nixon administration official who served a prison term for his role in Watergate and was among those rumored to be Deep Throat, has died.
28_8ecbplus.4: His body was discovered Tuesday by a maid who entered his hotel room in Biloxi, Coroner Gary Hargrove said.
28_8ecbplus.5: The coroner said he thinks LaRue died Saturday of natural causes.
28_8ecbplus.6: LaRue was known as the "bagman" who delivered payoffs to keep participants in the Watergate break - in quiet and served 412 months in federal prison for conspiracy to obstruct justice.
28_8ecbplus.7: LaRue served as special assistant to John Mitchell, the former attorney general who later headed President Nixon's Committee to Re - elect the President.
28_8ecbplus.8: LaRue discounted rumors that he was Deep Throat, saying the source for Washington Post reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein on the Watergate story was probably a combination of people.

3_11ecbplus.2: The Texas Department of Criminal Justice has made sweeping leadership changes at a Huntsville prison where an inmate managed to get a gun that he later used to escape, the agency announced Tuesday.
3_11ecbplus.3: The Nov. 30 escape by Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr. , a convicted rapist recaptured last month after eight days on the run in Baytown and Houston, has led to unprecedented fallout at the prison unit where he was housed, with the largest number of TDCJ employees ever facing termination or disciplinary action because of a single incident, said TDCJ Inspector General John Moriarty.
3_11ecbplus.4: Comeaux, 49, escaped from a prison van in Baytown after he pulled a gun on two TDCJ officers driving him to another prison in Beaumont.
3_11ecbplus.5: He was at large until Dec. 7, when he was found shoeless, wet and hungry at a north Houston business, where he asked to use the phone.
3_11ecbplus.6: So far, 11 Estelle unit employees have been recommended for termination or faced consequences related to Comeaux's escape.
3_11ecbplus.7: Four of those elected to retire instead of facing disciplinary action, including the two officers who drove Comeaux in the van on the day he escaped.
3_11ecbplus.8: Whitmire questioned why several prisons, including the Estelle unit, stopped searching visitors two months before Comeaux's escape and moved to random pat - downs.
3_11ecbplus.9: Since Comeaux's jailbreak, all visitors and employees at the Estelle prison unit are again subject to mandatory pat - downs, Lyons said.

11_5ecbplus.0: UN consults Turkmenistan on electoral processes
11_5ecbplus.2: On October 1 - 2 Ashgabat hosts a seminar organised with the assistance of the United Nations Development Programme on 'Enhancing the electoral system and processes in Turkmenistan', a statement of the event organisers said on Wednesday.
11_5ecbplus.3: The project is a part of a joint project with the Central Commission for Elections and Referenda ( CEC ) in Turkmenistan.
11_5ecbplus.4: 'The objectives of this meeting are to provide expert support to professionals and members of the electoral commission on issues of administration and technical procedures of the electoral process, as well as advice in preparing a plan to monitor the elections', the information said.
11_5ecbplus.5: After the seminar, UN consultants will submit the country's CEC guidelines for the use of the international standard of election observation in accordance with national legislation.
11_5ecbplus.6: Turkeminstan's CEC plans to hold elections on December 15 2013.
11_5ecbplus.7: It is expected that the elections will be observed by local observers and invited international experts and observers from many foreign countries and major international organisations and in the first instance, the European Union, CIS and OSCE.
11_5ecbplus.8: The term of office of Turkmen MPs is five years.
11_5ecbplus.9: The current senior composition was elected in December 2008.

33_8ecbplus.0: Prosecutors release new video in shooting trial of Brownsville mother of 12, Zurana Horton
33_8ecbplus.2: Prosecutors have released new video in the trial of two men accused of killing a Brownsville mother of 12 in Oct. 2011.
33_8ecbplus.3: The video shows Zurana Horton falling to the ground surrounded by kids in the moments after gunfire erupted outside her children's school.
33_8ecbplus.4: Witnesses say Horton died trying to shield several students.
33_8ecbplus.5: Authorities have charged Andrew Lopez and Jonathan Carrasquillo with her murder.

16_4ecbplus.0: A Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department deputy — a recently married father of two sons — died after a shooting Friday afternoon in Hawaiian Gardens, according to the sheriff's department.
16_4ecbplus.1: Gunfire was reported at about 3 p. m. in the Hawaiian Gardens area during an operation involving a uniformed gang enforcement deputy identified as Los Angeles County Sheriff's Deputy Jerry Ortiz, according to sheriff's officials.
16_4ecbplus.2: The location is about 10 blocks east of the 605 Freeway.
16_4ecbplus.3: Authorities said a witness called 911 to report the shooting, which occurred after Ortiz knocked on the residence's door, according to the sheriff's department.
16_4ecbplus.4: Ortiz was shot in the head, said Larry Waldie of the sheriff's department.
16_4ecbplus.5: He was transported in a helicopter to UCLA - Medical Center.
16_4ecbplus.6: As of 11 p. m. authorities were still searching for Jose Luis Orozco, 27, who is considered armed and dangerous.
16_4ecbplus.7: He is 5 - feet - 8 inches tall, weighing 130 pounds, has a shaved head and is heavily tattooed.
16_4ecbplus.8: He was wearing knee - length shorts with white tennis shoes, according to the sheriff's department.
16_4ecbplus.9: Ortiz, 35, was a 15 - year member of the sheriff's department.
16_4ecbplus.10: He had been working with the gang enforcement team for the last five years.
16_4ecbplus.11: Sheriff's department officials initially reported that a second deputy was shot, but authorities later said the responding deputy's injuries were not caused by gunfire.
16_4ecbplus.12: Sheriff's officials said the second deputy was injured when he fell.
16_4ecbplus.13: That deputy was hospitalized at Tri - Cities Hospital.
16_4ecbplus.14: A SWAT unit was dispatched to the area near Carson Street and Norwalk Boulevard.
16_4ecbplus.15: Deputies and at least one canine unit also were at the scene.
16_4ecbplus.16: Authorities said they believe they know the identity of the shooter but no suspects have been taken into custody.
16_4ecbplus.18: A suspect has been arrested in connection with the killing of a Los Angeles County sheriff's deputy conducting a follow - up investigation in a gang case, authorities said today.
16_4ecbplus.19: Jose Luis Orozco was arrested just before midnight yesterday, near where the shooting ocurred in Hawaiian Gardens, Los Angeles County sheriff's Sgt. Don Manumaleuna said.
16_4ecbplus.20: No shots were fired when Orozco was taken into custody, he added.

12_6ecbplus.0: Indian Naval Ship Interdicts Three Pirate Vessels In A Single Operation
12_6ecbplus.2: Indian Naval Ship Sukanya, presently deployed on anti - piracy patrols in the Gulf of Aden under the operational control of the Western Naval Command, found herself once again in the thick of things, thwarting a multiple - boat piracy attack on 10 Nov 11.
12_6ecbplus.3: The ship was escorting a group of five merchant vessels through the IRTC ( Internationally Recognised Transit Corridor ) when, at about 9: 25 in the morning of 10th Nov, she detected a group of five suspicious boats, speedily approaching the merchant vessels of her group.
12_6ecbplus.4: The warship immediately altered towards the suspicious vessels and challenged them.
12_6ecbplus.5: On seeing the resolve evident in the warship ’ s action and probably mindful of the reputation for resolute action that the Indian Navy justly enjoys in such deployments, the pirate skiffs reversed course and tried to flee the area.
12_6ecbplus.6: While two of them managed to get away, the Sukanya successfully intercepted the remaining three and carried out well practiced and professionally executed boarding - and - search action.
12_6ecbplus.7: The three boats had a total of 26 Somali crew onboard.
12_6ecbplus.8: During the operation, six AK 47 rifles, 12 Magazines and about 300 rounds of ammunition were found and confiscated.
12_6ecbplus.9: In addition, the boarding party also found a host of other equipment such as grapnels, ladders and rope - handling gloves all of which confirmed their piratical intent.
12_6ecbplus.10: The timely operation by Sukanya resulted, once again, in foiling the pirates ’ intention of attacking merchant vessels transiting this busy sea lane through which over a hundred Billion Dollars of India ’ s external trade passes each year.
12_6ecbplus.11: This is the fifth successful anti - piracy operation conducted by Sukanya, in the course of her ongoing patrol mission in the Gulf of Aden, which commenced in September.
