12_6ecbplus.12: The ship has, thus far, confiscated a total of 14 AK 47 Rifles, 31 Magazines and 923 rounds of ammunition, thereby ensuring that the Indian Navy retains its standing as a force not to be trifled with, and remains at the forefront of anti - piracy operations, as a critical component of the international effort to curb piracy and ensure the safety and freedom of seaborne trade, even in this highly risk - prone area.

21_5ecbplus.0: Woman Killed in Queens Hit - And - Run, Police Arrest Allegedly Drunk Driver
21_5ecbplus.2: An allegedly intoxicated driver who tried to flee after striking and fatally injuring a woman in Queens has been charged in her murder, according to police.
21_5ecbplus.3: Police responded to the Richmond Hill crash on the corner of 117th Street and 97th Avenue at 7: 01 p. m. on Friday to find the unconscious Raj K. Chohan, 59, of College Point, lying in the roadway, the NYPD said.
21_5ecbplus.4: EMS crews rushed Chohan to Jamaica Hospital for treatment, where she was later pronounced dead.
21_5ecbplus.5: An initial investigation of the scene revealed that Chohan had been walking alongside the parked cars on 117th Street when she was struck by a vehicle heading northbound, police said.
21_5ecbplus.6: The driver took off after the accident, but witnesses identified the vehicle as a grey 2013 Toyota Camry and Vishwanand Subryan, 23, of Schenectady, was identified and arrested not far from the scene, police said.
21_5ecbplus.7: Subryan was charged with criminally negligent homicide, vehicular manslaughter, leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death, and driving while intoxicated.
21_5ecbplus.8: An investigation into the crime is still ongoing, police said.

30_6ecbplus.1: SEACOM experienced downtime this morning; SEACOM explained that the downtime was most likely caused by a problem on SEA - ME - WE 4
30_6ecbplus.3: Numerous broadband users complained about international connectivity problems this morning, caused by problems on the SEACOM cable.
30_6ecbplus.4: SEACOM confirmed the problems on their Twitter account.
30_6ecbplus.5: "We can confirm that SEACOM is currently experiencing problems on their network.
30_6ecbplus.6: We will keep you updated on progress, " SEACOM tweeted at 09: 30 this morning ( Tuesday 16 August 2011 ).
30_6ecbplus.7: According to SEACOM's Suveer Ramdhani initial feedback points to a problem on the SEA - ME - WE 4 which caused downtime of around an hour on Tuesday.
30_6ecbplus.8: The downtime started at around 08: 30 on Tuesday, and was resolved at approximately 09: 40.
30_6ecbplus.9: "SEACOM's partner network experienced a terrestrial fibre cut between Alexandria and the Suez this morning 16th August from 06: 31GMT.
30_6ecbplus.10: All links are back up as of 07: 35GMT.
30_6ecbplus.11: Total downtime was 1hr 4 mins, " SEACOM said in an official statement.
30_6ecbplus.12: MWEB CEO Rudi Jansen said that their business clients experienced no service interruptions because of the SEACOM downtime, and that their residential clients may have experienced some slow international connectivity.
30_6ecbplus.13: MWEB has automatic failover on SAT - 3 in the event of SEACOM outages to minimize the impact on their subscribers.

3_6ecbplus.0: 'Armed and Dangerous' Texas Inmate on The Loose

6_10ecbplus.0: Gary Ross in negotiations to direct ‘ Hunger Games ’ sequel ‘ Catching Fire ’
6_10ecbplus.1: Now that ‘ The Hunger Games ’ is a monster hit Lionsgate are getting ready for the sequel ‘ Catching Fire ’.
6_10ecbplus.2: The three leads Jennifer Lawrence, Josh Hutcherson, and Liam Hemsworth are already signed on to appear in the sequel and, no doubt, the third film ‘ Mockingjay ’ as well.
6_10ecbplus.3: The biggest player who doesn ’ t have a deal in place is director Gary Ross and The Hollywood Reporter and Collider are reporting that he is in negotiations with Lionsgate to return.
6_10ecbplus.4: Hit the jump for more details and how ‘ Catching Fire ’ could face a huge delay.
6_10ecbplus.5: Allegedly, Ross was paid $3 million to direct ‘ The Hunger Games ’ plus five per cent on the back end.
6_10ecbplus.6: With no deal in place for Ross to direct future films in the series, he is in a good position to ask for more money.
6_10ecbplus.7: There is no doubt that Ross was instrumental in making ‘ The Hunger Games ’ a huge success.
6_10ecbplus.8: It was his direction that many critics applauded and brought the film down to earth, as opposed to the bloated spectacle it could have become in the wrong hands.
6_10ecbplus.9: Lionsgate can ’ t hide that they don ’ t have the money, but they have to spend it wisely to ensure the quality of the franchise continues and Ross could get a good deal out of it.
6_10ecbplus.10: Of course, if Ross wants too much money Lionsgate could easily give him the flick and hire a new director similar to the ‘ Harry Potter ’ and ‘ Twilight ’ films.
6_10ecbplus.11: Considering Lionsgate recently absorbed Summit and their executives ( masters of the ‘ Twilight ’ films ) into team Lionsgate; a change in director could be likely.
6_10ecbplus.12: Another tough challenge facing Lionsgate with the production of ‘ Catching Fire ’ is the possibility of delays due to the schedule of Lawrence.
6_10ecbplus.13: ‘ Catching Fire ’ has a release date of 22 November 2013 with production starting later in the year.
6_10ecbplus.14: Lawrence is set to star in the sequel to ‘ X - Men: First Class ’ that could go into production soon if Fox decide to exercise Lawrence ’ s option to do the sequel.
6_10ecbplus.15: The ‘ X - Men: First Class ’ sequel already has a director with Matthew Vaughn returning and Fox might rush it into production to capitalise on Lawrence ’ s star power.

36_1ecbplus.0: Warren Jeffs Found Guilty on Sexual Assault Charges
36_1ecbplus.2: A San Antonio jury has found polygamist leader Warren Jeffs guilty on both sexual assault charges on Thursday.
36_1ecbplus.3: The 55 - year older leader of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints was charged with sexual assault of a child after taking a 12 - year old girl and a 15 - year girl as "spiritual wives. "

26_11ecbplus.0: Mob boss 'Oddfather' dies in prison at 77
26_11ecbplus.1: Published: Tuesday, Dec. 20 2005 12: 00 a. m. MST
26_11ecbplus.2: Mob boss Vincent "The Chin" Gigante, the powerful Mafioso who avoided jail for decades by wandering the streets in a ratty bathrobe and slippers, feigning mental illness, died Monday in prison.
26_11ecbplus.4: The head of the Genovese crime family, who had suffered from heart disease, died at the federal prison in Springfield, Mo. , said prison spokesman Al Quintero.
26_11ecbplus.5: It was the same place where rival mob boss John Gotti died of cancer in 2002 at age 61.
26_11ecbplus.6: Gigante's death also was confirmed by Christine Monaco, a spokeswoman for the FBI, the organization that worked for years to put him behind bars.
26_11ecbplus.7: Dubbed the "Oddfather" for his bizarre behavior, Gigante had scored a lengthy string of victories over prosecutors, but it ended with a July 1997 racketeering conviction.
26_11ecbplus.8: He was sentenced to 12 years in prison.

28_12ecbplus.0: Fred LaRue, 75; delivered 'hush' money in Watergate
28_12ecbplus.2: Fred LaRue, a close aide to former Attorney General John Mitchell and the first person to plead guilty in the Watergate scandal, died of natural causes.
28_12ecbplus.4: His body was discovered yesterday by a maid who entered his hotel room in Biloxi.
28_12ecbplus.5: Coroner Gary Hargrove said he believes that Mr. LaRue died Saturday.
28_12ecbplus.6: Mr. LaRue was known as the "bagman" who delivered payoffs to keep participants in the Watergate break - in quiet.
28_12ecbplus.7: He served four months in federal prison for conspiracy to obstruct justice.
28_12ecbplus.8: Mr. LaRue served as special assistant to Mitchell, who later headed President Nixon's reelection committee.
28_12ecbplus.9: Mr. LaRue was present at a 1972 meeting with Mitchell and Nixon aide Jeb Stuart Magruder at Nixon's vacation home in Key Biscayne, Fla. , where the plan to break into the Watergate complex in Washington was allegedly hatched.
28_12ecbplus.10: Mr. LaRue said he advised against the burglarization of the building, which housed Democratic Party headquarters.
28_12ecbplus.11: After his political career ended in scandal, Mr. LaRue returned to his home state of Mississippi to work in his family's oil company and with its real estate holdings.
28_12ecbplus.12: He also spent much time catching shrimp in the Gulf of Mexico.
28_12ecbplus.13: A few researchers of the scandal have suggested that Mr. LaRue could have been Deep Throat.
28_12ecbplus.14: He discounted those rumors, saying the mysterious source for Washington Post reporters Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein on the Watergate story was not one person, but probably a combination of several people.

24_6ecbplus.0: Paris: Jewellery Stolen In Casty Shop Raid
24_6ecbplus.2: Four men smash their car into a jewellery store before fleeing in a different vehicle in the latest high - profile heist in France.
24_6ecbplus.3: Jewellery and watches worth £1. 7m have been stolen during a heist in an upmarket central Paris shop.
24_6ecbplus.4: Four men drove a 4x4 through the front window of the store on Rue de Castiglione, before making off with the jewellery and watches.
24_6ecbplus.5: They then set fire to the vehicle before fleeing in another car.
24_6ecbplus.6: Forensic policemen are examining the Casty store in the central first district of the capital, home to numerous jewellery shops.
24_6ecbplus.7: The heist near Place Vendome is the latest to hit France after a spate of high - profile robberies in the southern resort of Cannes.
24_6ecbplus.8: At the end of July, an armed man carried out a robbery at a diamond exhibition at the Carlton Hotel in Cannes, making off with jewellery worth £88m in one of the world's biggest ever heists.
24_6ecbplus.9: And last month thieves made off with £35, 000 of jewellery after cracking two safes at the luxury Grand Hotel du Cap in Saint - Jean - Cap - Ferrat, near Nice.
24_6ecbplus.10: In May, thieves stole £910, 000 worth of jewellery from an employee of Swiss firm Chopard that was due to be loaned to film stars during the Cannes Film Festival and a second theft saw a diamond necklace worth £1. 2m stolen.
24_6ecbplus.11: Paris has also been the scene of high - profile robberies.
24_6ecbplus.12: In December 2008, three men emptied almost the entire stock of gems from the Harry Winston jewellery store.
24_6ecbplus.13: Police said they had recovered 80% of the haul in 2009.

45_10ecbplus.0: Jury convicts man in woman's death
45_10ecbplus.2: A jury in eastern Oklahoma has convicted a Spiro man of two counts of first - degree murder in the 2012 shooting death of his pregnant girlfriend.
45_10ecbplus.3: The jury deliberated almost seven hours Thursday before convicting 27 - year - old Christopher Kenyon Simpson in the death of 20 - year - old Ka'loni Flynn, of Fort Smith, Ark.
45_10ecbplus.4: The jury recommended the maximum sentence of life in prison without parole, the Southwest Times Record reported ( http: / / bit. ly / 16vDN3E ).
45_10ecbplus.5: He is to be sentenced Nov. 8.
45_10ecbplus.6: Prosecutors allege that Simpson shot Flynn twice in the head because he did not want another child to support.
45_10ecbplus.7: A DNA expert testified that Simpson fathered the fetus.
45_10ecbplus.9: I'm glad we got the verdict we got, " said Flynn's father, Herbert Flynn.
45_10ecbplus.11: During closing arguments, Crawford County Deputy Prosecuting Attorney Jacob Howell showed a photograph of Flynn's body in the driver's seat of car, with bullet wounds to her temple and forehead.
45_10ecbplus.13: "We know that's how we got here, " Howell said, indicating the photo.
45_10ecbplus.14: Prosecutors acknowledged that the case against Simpson was complicated and mostly circumstantial.

7_5ecbplus.0: Klitschko vs Thompson II Results: Wladimir Klitschko Cruises Again, Wins in Six
7_5ecbplus.2: Wladimir Klitschko won his 16th straight fight today, successfully defending the WBA, WBO, and IBF heavyweight titles against Tony Thompson, stopping the 40 - year - old American in the sixth round of a fight that was never really close.
7_5ecbplus.3: Klitschko ( 58 - 3, 51 KO ) bombed Thompson with a vicious right hand in the fifth round, putting him down late in the frame.
7_5ecbplus.4: That Thompson got up spoke a lot about his desire to try and win, but the fight essentially ended there.
7_5ecbplus.5: He survived the round, but by the end of the sixth frame, appeared mentally beaten and looking for a way out.
7_5ecbplus.6: He went down again in the corner late in the round, and this time referee Sam Williams stopped it at 2: 56.
7_5ecbplus.7: Klitschko had beaten Thompson back in 2008, mostly dominating that fight and knocking "The Tiger" out in the 11th rounds.
7_5ecbplus.8: This time, with Thompson four years older and having had no significant tests in the four years that had passed since their first bout, it wasn't even as competitive as it was the first time.
7_5ecbplus.9: Thompson ( 36 - 3, 24 KO ) just didn't have a shot in there, looked old, and though his awkward southpaw style gave Klitschko some moments of slight discomfort, it would be a stretch to say that he troubled Wladimir.
7_5ecbplus.10: At this point with the Klitschkos, as much as I admire their talent, skill, dedication to their craft, and the classy manner in which they carry themselves, I just feel like I've seen enough from them both.
7_5ecbplus.12: Is there really anyone out there you can look at and see as an actual threat to them? Is there anyone on the way up who has that skill set?
7_5ecbplus.13: I just don't see it, and I've grown tired of tuning in for passionless exhibitions of superiority.
7_5ecbplus.14: I don't think they've killed the division, I just think they've dominated it, and with no actual hope for that earth - shaking upset on the horizon, I think I'd personally prefer to just see them both take farewell fights and head on out.
7_5ecbplus.15: There's nothing more to see here.

37_12ecbplus.0: Earthquake Of Magnitude 6. 1 Strikes Indonesia's Aceh Province Killing One
37_12ecbplus.2: A magnitude - 6. 1 earthquake struck Indonesia's Aceh province on Tuesday at 07: 37 a. m. UTC ( 3: 37 a. m. EDT ), killing at least one and leaving two others missing, the Associated Press reported.
37_12ecbplus.3: The epicenter of the quake, which originated six miles beneath the surface, was located 34 miles west of the town of Bireun, near the western coast of Sumatra island, according to the U. S. Geological Survey.
37_12ecbplus.4: No tsunami warnings were issued following the quake, which injured dozens and damaged several houses in Takengon, the capital of Central Aceh district, AP reported.
37_12ecbplus.5: People ran out of their homes when the quake hit, AP reported, citing residents of Bukit Sama village in Central Aceh district, where the quake has led to a power outage.
37_12ecbplus.6: "I see many houses were damaged and their roofs fell onto some people, " a Bukit Sama village resident told AP.
37_12ecbplus.7: "Many people were injured but it is difficult to evacuate them due to traffic jams. "
37_12ecbplus.8: Indonesia is prone to seismic activity, due to its location on the Pacific Basin's "Ring of Fire, " a 25, 000 - mile - long stretch where earthquakes are common, although only a small percentage are strong enough to be felt.
37_12ecbplus.9: The 2004 tsunami that killed about 230, 000 people across Asia was triggered by a massive 9. 1 - magnitude quake off Aceh.

34_9ecbplus.0: Obama nominates rural Catholic doctor as Surgeon General
34_9ecbplus.1: Washington D. C. , Jul 13, 2009 / 02: 00 pm ( CNA )
34_9ecbplus.2: President Barack Obama has announced that he is nominating a rural Alabama Catholic doctor to be the U. S. Surgeon General.
34_9ecbplus.3: Reacting to the news, the rector of Mobile's Catholic cathedral, where she serves as lector, is encouraging her to defend the unborn in her new position.
34_9ecbplus.4: In a Monday statement President Obama said he intended to nominate Dr. Regina Benjamin as Surgeon General, the United States government's "chief health educator. "
34_9ecbplus.5: The president's announcement focused on health care reform as an urgent challenge.
34_9ecbplus.6: Dr. Benjamin, the first black woman to be admitted to the American Medical Association, founded the Bayou La Batre Rural Health Clinic in Alabama in 1990.
34_9ecbplus.7: There, she served the poor Alabama community on the Gulf Coast after 1998's Hurricane Georges and 2005's Hurricane Katrina.
34_9ecbplus.8: She had to rebuild the clinic after it burned down, receiving a $500, 000 MacArthur Foundation "genius grant" in 2008 for the effort.
34_9ecbplus.9: Dr. Benjamin is known as being a national leader in improving health disparities, motivated by the need in her community.
34_9ecbplus.10: Immigrants from Vietnam, Cambodia and Laos make up a third of the area's population of 2, 500.
34_9ecbplus.11: She received the Nelson Mandela Award for Health and Human Rights in 1998.
34_9ecbplus.12: Pope Benedict XVI awarded her the Pro Ecclessia et Pontifice medal in 2006.
34_9ecbplus.13: President Obama's announcement also noted that Dr. Benjamin received the 2000 National Caring Award which was inspired by Mother Teresa.
34_9ecbplus.14: The nominee graduated from Xavier University in New Orleans, a Catholic school descended from the educational work of St. Katharine Drexel.
34_9ecbplus.15: Dr. Benjamin received her medical degree from the University of Alabama, Birmingham.
34_9ecbplus.16: Dr. Benjamin has also served on the Board of Trustees for the Catholic Health Association, a position that she will resign from to take on her new job.
34_9ecbplus.17: In a Monday statement, CHA president and chief executive officer Sister Carol Keehan, DC, said that the organization "rejoices for our nation" in Dr. Benjamin's nomination.
34_9ecbplus.18: "In Dr. Benjamin, we have a brilliant physician who understands health care, nationally and internationally; but even more important, she knows the health care needs of the people of Bayou La Batre, Alabama, who she meets on a daily basis. "
34_9ecbplus.19: Sr. Keehan said the nominee will "enrich the nation" with her competence and integrity and she praised Dr. Benjamin's daily experience working in "a very vulnerable committee. "
34_9ecbplus.20: CNA spoke with Msgr. Michael L. Farmer, Vicar General of the Archdiocese of Mobile and rector at the Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception in Mobile.
34_9ecbplus.21: Msgr. Farmer said Dr. Benjamin is a "delightful lady" who has served as lector at the cathedral and has been "readily available" to speak with various Catholic organizations.
34_9ecbplus.22: She has also worked with Catholic Charities in Mobile and has spoken on the good the organization does.
34_9ecbplus.23: He reported that she grew up at the historically African - American parish Shrine of the Holy Cross in the Gulf Coast town of Daphne, Alabama.
34_9ecbplus.24: The monsignor also confirmed that then - Archbishop of Mobile Oscar Lipscomb recommended Dr. Regina Benjamin for the Pro Ecclesia et Pontifice award.
34_9ecbplus.25: The medal is bestowed to lay people and clergy who have given zealous and outstanding service to the Church.
34_9ecbplus.26: The honor was instituted by Pope Leo XIII in 1888.
34_9ecbplus.27: "He recommended her for her example in her Catholic faith as well as in her medical profession, " Msgr. Farmer said, noting the "amazing amount of work" she has done for the common good and for health care in south Mobile County.
34_9ecbplus.28: Expressing certainty that Dr. Benjamin had opportunities to go elsewhere, he said the doctor had made a "concrete decision" to remain in Alabama and address her patients' needs.
34_9ecbplus.29: "She's noted not only for clinic work, but for going on site to these people's homes.
34_9ecbplus.30: And they're not necessarily the nicest places to go to. "
34_9ecbplus.31: He said it was "remarkable" and "bridge - building" that Dr. Benjamin, an African - American woman, has done her work in the bayou, which he described as a majority white community with "a lot of poor people in it. "
34_9ecbplus.32: Given the appointments and policy decisions of the Obama Administration that favor the promotion of abortion, CNA asked Msgr. Farmer if he knew what Dr. Benjamin's position is on abortion.
34_9ecbplus.33: He explained that he did not "explicitly" know Dr. Benjamin's position on abortion and other life issues and had never discussed it with her.
34_9ecbplus.34: "I would hope that her position would be in line with the Church's position, " he told CNA.
34_9ecbplus.35: "As far as I know she has been in conformity with the Catholic Church. "
34_9ecbplus.36: "I would hope that that would continue, " he added, noting that it could be "difficult" to adhere to Catholic moral teaching in a position with the Obama Administration.
34_9ecbplus.37: In a Monday morning telephone interview with CNA, Sr. Keehan pointed out that Dr. Benjamin isn't "in a specialty that would do abortion" and that her work to provide health care to the poor and elderly demonstrates her "tremendous attention to the issue of life. "
34_9ecbplus.38: "And you've got her own archbishop who asked the Holy Father to give her the Pro Ecclesia medal.
34_9ecbplus.39: "You don't get that for just being a token Catholic, " she told CNA.
34_9ecbplus.40: In December 2008 a coalition of several dozen pro - abortion groups released a strategy document titled "Advancing Reproductive Rights and Health in a New Administration" calling on Obama to improve access to "abortion care. "
34_9ecbplus.41: The document named the surgeon general's office as a "position of interest. "

23_9ecbplus.0: Australian Ski Mountaineer Dies in Fall in New Zealand
23_9ecbplus.2: A 36 - year - old Australian man died on Friday after falling 150 meters from a ridge in Aoraki / Mt. Cook National Park on New Zealand ’ s South Island.
23_9ecbplus.3: Duncan Robert Rait, a New Zealand native living in Melbourne, Australia, was with a group of ski mountaineers who had just arrived by helicopter to a ridge top location near the Tasman Saddle Hut.

23_9ecbplus.5: Rait had planned to spend four days ski touring in the area with his brother.
23_9ecbplus.6: Although not a factor in the accident, rescue efforts were hampered by weather conditions.
23_9ecbplus.7: The rescue team were dropped at the hut and then descended to the location of the injured man as the helicopter became grounded due to poor weather.
23_9ecbplus.8: Rait was returned to Mt. Cook Village, where he was pronounced dead.
23_9ecbplus.9: The day following Rait ’ s death an inexperienced and reportedly ill - equipped mountain climber with rental gear, 31 - year - old Robert Buckley of the U. K. but living in Christchurch, New Zealand, slipped on ice and fell 700 meters to his own death elsewhere in the same National Park.

20_9ecbplus.2: Tremors from an earthquake registering 6. 1 on the Richter scale 60km south west of Bandar Abbas in Iran were felt in Dubai today, prompting the evacuation of high - rise buildings on the Sheikh Zayed Road and in the Dubai Media City.
20_9ecbplus.3: Some eye witnesses reported sensing a definite tremor for one minute, although others told AME Info they had not felt anything.
20_9ecbplus.4: UAE authorities are now said to be contacting the US Geological Survey for details of this seismic activity, which is already listed on the USGS website, www. earthquake. usgs. gov, under the section for recent activity ( see address below ).
20_9ecbplus.5: The website reported 65 responses from Dubai.
20_9ecbplus.6: The earth tremor hit a triangular area between Ras Al Khaimah, Al Ain and Dubai.
20_9ecbplus.7: This follows warnings from local UAE academics that earthquake faultlines in Iran could have serious implications for building stability in the UAE.
20_9ecbplus.9: Scientists such as Dr Azm Al - Homoud from the American University of Sharjah have been trying to educate engineers, governments and the construction industry about the risks.
20_9ecbplus.10: Today's incident is bound to prompt a more serious interest in their work.
20_9ecbplus.11: However, high - rise buildings in the UAE all conform to international construction standards and are designed to withstand the sort of minor tremors reported today, although buildings are always thoroughly checked after such events to ensure their integrity.
20_9ecbplus.12: The Dubai authorities are expected to move swiftly to reassure residents that there has been no damage to persons or property.
20_9ecbplus.13: The emirate is not believed to have had such a tremor in living memory, and clearly some people have been shaken.
20_9ecbplus.14: Such tremors are common in many major cities of the world, but Dubai residents have not felt them before and will be looking for answers to the question of likely future seismic activity in the emirate.
20_9ecbplus.15: But there appears no reason for alarm, as the earthquake was in Iran.

33_3ecbplus.0: Jury shown horrific moment innocent mother is shot dead shielding her child when she's caught up in gang attack as she picks up daughter from school
33_3ecbplus.1: Zurana Horton, 34, a mother of 12, was fatally shot in 2011 while picking up her daughter, 11, from school
33_3ecbplus.2: A second mother who testified was shot in her arm as well as an 11 - year - old girl
33_3ecbplus.3: Testimony by a second witness has been delayed after allegedly threatened with death by the brother of the accused gunman
33_3ecbplus.5: Jurors on Thursday watched video capturing the horrific moment a mother was gunned down in broad daylight while picking up her 11 - year - old daughter outside a New York City school.
33_3ecbplus.6: Behind her another mother was seen shot in her arm before staggering against a wall while trying to hide her own son from the alleged gang members' stray gunfire from a nearby rooftop.
33_3ecbplus.7: This frightening surveillance video was presented at the Brooklyn Supreme Court on Thursday during the trial of two men accused in killing Zurana Horton, 34, a mother of 12, in 2011 and wounding two others, including an 11 - year - old girl.
33_3ecbplus.8: Prosecutors say Andrew Lopez, 20, an alleged 8 Block gang member fired the shots meant for rival gang members from the Howard Projects while his brother Jonathan Carrasquillo, 24, gave the orders.
33_3ecbplus.9: 'When me and my son were on the floor, I noticed Mrs Horton fall down.
33_3ecbplus.10: I honestly thought she was shot in the head.
33_3ecbplus.11: There was blood, ' said Unique Armstead, who was shot along with an 11 - year - old girl nearby according to the New York post.
33_3ecbplus.12: Mrs Armstead says that just before the shots were fired she passed a group of young men arguing on the street about a gun.
33_3ecbplus.14: Feeling uneasy, she says 'I speed - walked to my son, and I held him.
33_3ecbplus.16: I was trying to get out of harm's way. '
33_3ecbplus.17: She took her son into a nearby store to wait it out.
33_3ecbplus.18: When the fight appeared to die down, she says she slipped back onto the street with her son by her side when a stray bullet shot straight into her arm.
33_3ecbplus.19: She next saw Horton fall down dead.
33_3ecbplus.20: Mrs Horton is seen sprawled out on the sidewalk beside a pool of blood on the surveillance video.
33_3ecbplus.21: Witnesses are seen cowering in fear around her.
33_3ecbplus.22: 'At the time, I thought it was a brick, but it was a bullet, ' Mrs Armstead said of her injury.
33_3ecbplus.23: Lopez, who was 18 at the time of the shooting, confessed to being the rooftop sniper according to initial reports by the New York Daily News.
33_3ecbplus.24: The gunman said the shooting near Public School 298 in Brownsville had stemmed from a turf war between two Brooklyn gangs.
33_3ecbplus.25: Lopez told police that 'he did not mean to shoot the ladies, ' the source said.
33_3ecbplus.26: A second witness had expected to testify in the shooting on Thursday as well but after threatened with death by the brother of the alleged gunman, their testimony has been delayed until Monday.
33_3ecbplus.27: 'The man is an emotional wreck, ' Brooklyn Supreme Court Judge Vincent Del Giudice said, according to the Post.
33_3ecbplus.28: Lopez has been linked to a Brooklyn gang known as '8 Block, ' who police say are engaged in a turf battle with the neighboring Young Guns gang.
33_3ecbplus.29: NYPD Commissioner Raymond Kelly said: 'We're certainly pleased with the fact that the investigation has identified Mr. Lopez and he's made statements and apparently made a full confession, ' the Daily News reported.
33_3ecbplus.30: Lopez told police he was aiming for rival gang members when a stray bullet hit the mother of 13 who was collecting her children from school.
33_3ecbplus.31: Horton was planning to marry her boyfriend on Valentine's Day in 2012.
33_3ecbplus.32: Also arrested were Lopez' half - brother, 17 - year - old Kristian, and Carrasquillo.
33_3ecbplus.33: All three live in a fifth - floor apartment inside 1800 Pitkin Ave. , the same building from where the gunman opened fire, police said.
33_3ecbplus.34: That apartment building is said to be where 8 Block got their name, the Post reported in 2011.
33_3ecbplus.35: Carrasquillo was charged with murder, and Kristian Lopez was arrested for possession of a baseball bat, police said.
33_3ecbplus.36: Andrew Lopez had a previous arrest for walking down Pitkin Ave. brandishing a loaded gun three years ago, sources told the Daily News.
33_3ecbplus.37: The shooting frenzy in which at least 12 shots were fired began just 13 minutes after school finished.
33_3ecbplus.38: Cheanne McKnight, 11, is recovering from a graze wound to her cheek, while a 31 - year - old Brooklyn mom was shot in the arm.
33_3ecbplus.39: Police recovered 12 9 - mm shell casings on the roof of the Pitkin Avenue apartment and the sidewalk.

22_13ecbplus.0: Krafts Food Shooter Yvonne Hiller Charged with Two Counts of Murder
22_13ecbplus.1: Hiller Feuded with Co - Workers Prior to Shooting; Risk Factors and Prevention of Workplace Violence
22_13ecbplus.3: Yvonne Hiller, a suspended Kraft Foods employee at the company's Philadelphia factory, returned Thursday evening, gunned down two women and leaving a man wounded with shots to the neck and shoulder.
22_13ecbplus.4: Another man was also injured but not seriously.
22_13ecbplus.5: A few minutes after being escorted from the facility by security, Hiller drove her car through a security barrier and entered where roughly 100 people were.
22_13ecbplus.6: According to the Philadelphia Inquirer, she was carrying a. 357 Magnum handgun.
22_13ecbplus.7: According to the Huffington Post, police say Hiller feuded with her victims prior to their shooting deaths.
22_13ecbplus.8: Hiller made her way to the third - floor mixing room where she worked, located her victims in the break room, and opened fire.
22_13ecbplus.9: She also fired through a wall at police officers but none were hit.
22_13ecbplus.10: The SWAT team apprehended Yvonne Hiller while she hid in a second - floor office and she has been charged with two counts of murder.
22_13ecbplus.11: Kraft has closed the Philadelphia factory until further notice.
22_13ecbplus.12: Kraft Food's Susan Davison said, "This is a tragic loss for all of us.
22_13ecbplus.13: To assist our employees, we will be providing counseling services at the facility.
22_13ecbplus.14: At this time, we are still trying to confirm the facts. "
22_13ecbplus.15: Davison added, "We again express our deepest condolences to the families who have been touched by this tragedy. "

1_8ecbplus.0: Lindsay Lohan rehires longtime lawyer Shawn Holley, heads to rehab

1_8ecbplus.3: The actress re - hired longtime attorney Shawn Holley to handle her case.

3_10ecbplus.0: Texas prisoner captured after week on the run
3_10ecbplus.2: A convicted sex offender who was the subject of a weeklong manhunt after pulling off a daring escape during a prison transfer was captured Monday after authorities received several phone tips, including one from a salesman who recognized the inmate outside his business.
3_10ecbplus.3: A hungry, wet and barefoot Arcade Joseph Comeaux Jr. was caught in northeast Houston, about 25 miles northwest of where he escaped, said Alfredo Perez, a spokesman for the U. S. Marshals Service.
3_10ecbplus.4: Comeaux, 49, was in a wheelchair Nov. 30 when he pulled a gun on two guards and fired it during a transfer from a prison unit in Huntsville to one in Beaumont.
3_10ecbplus.5: The guards, who were unharmed, were forced to drive to the Baytown area, where Comeaux took their weapons, handcuffed them together and ran away.
3_10ecbplus.6: Comeaux was serving a sentence of life in prison for a 1998 aggravated sexual assault conviction in Brazos County, northwest of Houston.
3_10ecbplus.7: He was given two extra life sentences after being convicted of stabbing his wife and another person in 1999 while she visited him in prison.

29_4ecbplus.0: Colts Clinch Playoff Spot with 20 - 13 Win Over Chiefs
29_4ecbplus.2: The Indianapolis Colts clinched a playoff spot and the five seed in the AFC playoffs with a 20 - 13 win over the Kansas City Chiefs on another Andrew Luck game - winning drive, his seventh of the season.
29_4ecbplus.3: A year ago, the Indianapolis Colts were an NFL - worst 2 - 14 and did not figure to be much better this season.
29_4ecbplus.4: But fifteen games later and the Colts stand at 10 - 5 and in the playoffs as the AFC's five seed.
29_4ecbplus.5: It is the representation of an incredible sesaon that will be extended beyond just next week.
29_4ecbplus.6: The Colts got the win today, but it wasn't pretty.
29_4ecbplus.7: In fact, according to Pro Football Reference, it was the first time in NFL history that a team rushed for over 350 yards and lost the game.
29_4ecbplus.8: The Colts were outplayed on both sides of the ball, but when it counted Andrew Luck and the Colts got it done.
29_4ecbplus.9: Check out some notes from the game:
29_4ecbplus.10: Andrew Luck was terrible for a stretch in the game that included 10 straight incompletions.
29_4ecbplus.11: But after that he got hot at just the right time and hit his last 6 passes of the day, capped off by a 7 - yard touchdown pass to Reggie Wayne in the back of the end zone for what proved to be the game winning score with four minutes left.
29_4ecbplus.12: He ended the day 17 / 35 for 205 yards and the touchdown along with 6 carries for 21 yards.
29_4ecbplus.13: For the second week in a row he did not turn the ball over, which is huge.
29_4ecbplus.14: And he also set the NFL rookie record for most passing yards in a season with 4, 051 yards - breaking Cam Newton's record set a year ago.
29_4ecbplus.15: Dwayne Allen also set a Colts rookie record for receptions by a tight end with 43.
29_4ecbplus.16: Allen has had a tremendous rookie year.
29_4ecbplus.17: He has a bright future ahead of him.
29_4ecbplus.18: Cassius Vaughn and Pat Angerer both were terrible today.
29_4ecbplus.19: There were others as well, but those two were the ones that really stuck out.
29_4ecbplus.20: Basically, however, the whole defense stunk today.
29_4ecbplus.21: The Colts gave up 507 total yards, 352 of them on the ground.
29_4ecbplus.22: It was the worst run defense I have seen the Colts play since that now infamous debacle in Jacksonville in 2006.
29_4ecbplus.24: That said, the Colts won the turnover battle 3 - 0 over the Chiefs.
29_4ecbplus.25: Darius Butler picked off a terrible Brady Quinn throw and took it back 32 yards for a score.
29_4ecbplus.26: It was Butler's 4th pick of the year and the 2nd one he returned for a touchdown.
29_4ecbplus.27: Pat Angerer also forced a big fumble with the Chiefs in the red zone and threatening that led to 3 points for the Colts before the half.
29_4ecbplus.28: And then the 3rd turnover was a pick by Vontae Davis.
29_4ecbplus.29: When you have a +3 turnover differential, you are going to win most games.
29_4ecbplus.30: It will be huge if the Colts could keep that up.
29_4ecbplus.31: The wide receivers really didn't help out Andrew Luck today.
29_4ecbplus.32: They dropped several passes ( Reggie Wayne included ) and failed to get open numerous other times.
29_4ecbplus.33: While it looked like a bad game from Luck, I place more of the blame on the receivers in this one.
29_4ecbplus.35: However, on the final drive, once Reggie Wayne started getting involved, the Colts started rolling.
29_4ecbplus.36: On the last drive he caught 3 passes for 37 yards and a touchdown.
29_4ecbplus.37: Prior to that he had caught 2 passes for 44.
29_4ecbplus.38: The key was that once the Colts got Reggie involved, good things happened.
29_4ecbplus.39: This game was Andrew Luck's 7th game - winning drive of the season, tying an NFL record - not just a rookie record.
29_4ecbplus.41: Incredibly, if Luck leads a game winning drive next week in a very winnable game for the Colts, he would have the NFL record all to himself - as a rookie.
29_4ecbplus.42: Added to that fact is that the Colts are 8 - 1 in games decided by one score or less - the only loss coming in week 3 on that last - minute 80 yard touchdown pass by the Jaguars after Luck had led another go - ahead scoring drive late in the 4th quarter.
29_4ecbplus.44: What a moment that will be tomorrow when Pagano walks into the locker room and is handed the head coaching reigns once again.
29_4ecbplus.45: And what a moment that will be next Sunday when he takes the field for the first time since week 3.
29_4ecbplus.46: Colts nation has supported him all the way, as has the NFL.
29_4ecbplus.47: Next Sunday, the division rival Houston Texans come to Lucas Oil Stadium having never won in Indy.
29_4ecbplus.48: This is a game that before the season I even thought the Colts would win - back when I thought they would get 7 wins all year.
29_4ecbplus.49: They can beat the Texans, and with Pagano coming back, that will be a special game.
29_4ecbplus.52: Now my piece of advice to the Colts - don't stop being Chuckstrong.

43_14ecbplus.0: AMD to acquire microserver vendor SeaMicro - - a user of Intel chips
43_14ecbplus.1: Advanced Micro Devices to acquire microserver vendor SeaMicro for $334 million.
43_14ecbplus.2: To date, SeaMicro has used chips from Intel.
43_14ecbplus.4: Advanced Micro Devices will acquire server vendor SeaMicro in an attempt to make a run at Intel in the microserver market.
43_14ecbplus.5: AMD said it has signed a definitive agreement to acquire SeaMicro, a company that supplies energy - efficient microservers, for approximately $334 million.
43_14ecbplus.6: To date, SeaMicro servers have been using Intel's Atom and Xeon processors.
43_14ecbplus.7: Future plans call for SeaMicro to build servers with AMD's Opteron chips.
43_14ecbplus.8: "AMD plans to offer the first AMD Opteron processor - based solutions that combine AMD and SeaMicro technology in the second half of 2012.
43_14ecbplus.9: The company remains firmly committed to its traditional server business, and will continue to focus and invest in this area, " AMD said in a statement.
43_14ecbplus.10: SeaMicro's innovations include its supercompute fabric, which connects thousands of processor cores, memory, storage, and input / output traffic.
43_14ecbplus.11: SeaMicro's fabric supports multiple processor instruction sets.
43_14ecbplus.12: "SeaMicro was founded to dramatically reduce the power consumed by servers, while increasing compute density and bandwidth, " said Andrew Feldman, SeaMicro CEO, who will become general manager of AMD's newly created Data Center Server Solutions business.

26_10ecbplus.0: Vincent 'The Chin' Gigante dies in prison
26_10ecbplus.2: Vincent "The Chin" Gigante, the New York mob boss whose crazy act earned him the nickname "The Oddfather, " died in prison Monday.
26_10ecbplus.4: The former driver for late Mafia boss Vito Genovese, Gigante rose to the head of the crime family that bears Genovese's name, Newsday reported.
26_10ecbplus.5: "He was the last of the old - school bosses, " said ex - NYPD organized crime detective Joe Coffey Monday.
26_10ecbplus.6: Bureau of Prisons spokesman Al Quintero said Gigante died early Monday of apparent heart disease at the U. S. medical center for federal prisoners in Springfield, Mo.
26_10ecbplus.7: It is the same prison where mobsters John Gotti, Anthony "Fat Tony" Salerno and Anthony "Tony Ducks" Corallo also died, the newspaper said.
26_10ecbplus.8: Gigante was serving a 12 - year sentence for a racketeering conspiracy conviction in Brooklyn in 1997 and was due to be released in June 2010.
26_10ecbplus.9: He became a legend for pretending he was mentally ill as a way of escaping prosecution.
26_10ecbplus.10: Gigante would wander around Greenwich Village in his bathrobe, mumbling to himself.
26_10ecbplus.11: In April 2003, Gigante plead guilty to charges he feigned mental illness in the 1990s, adding three years to his sentence.

31_8ecbplus.0: 2013 MVC Tournament results and bracket: Creighton, Wichita St. move on

1_13ecbplus.0: Lindsay Lohan checks into rehab to begin 90 - day stint, lawyer says
1_13ecbplus.2: Lindsay Lohan has checked into a rehab facility to begin a 90 - day court - ordered stint, handed down as part of a sentence for a 2012 car crash case.
1_13ecbplus.3: However, it remains unclear whether a judge will accept her placement at the center, whose location was not revealed publicly, the Associated Press reported, quoting her lawyer Mark Heller as saying on May 2 that prosecutors have not approved it yet.
1_13ecbplus.4: One of them told the judge he needed more time to investigate the place and the judge has given him a May 10 deadline, the news wire said.

20_2ecbplus.1: Aftershocks jolt Iran's Qeshm island, death toll rises to 10
20_2ecbplus.2: The sixth aftershock shook this southern Iranian island in the Persian Gulf on Monday as death toll from a strong earthquake a day before rose to 10.
20_2ecbplus.3: The new death toll came after the bodies of two more victims were found in the village of Ziranag which is one of the 12 worst - hit villages in the quake, Qeshm Governor Heydar Alishvandi said.
20_2ecbplus.4: He said search was going on for several people who were reported to be missing.
20_2ecbplus.5: As many as 80 people were also wounded.
20_2ecbplus.6: Alishvandi said some of the injured were transferred by helicopter to the provincial capital of Bandar Abbas on the coast, including several who were in critical condition.
20_2ecbplus.7: The governor stated that as many as 2, 000 people in rural regions needed accommodation, half of whom had been given temporary housing.
20_2ecbplus.8: He cited tents, blankets, canned food and drinking water as the most needed items.
20_2ecbplus.9: Alishvandi said the first truck of public aid donations, including tents, blankets, canned food and water tanks were sent to the affected regions Monday morning.
20_2ecbplus.10: Meanwhile, the head of the Interior Ministry's Natural Disasters Headquarters, Abbas Jazayeri, said that the situation on the Qeshm island was under control.
20_2ecbplus.11: He said relief workers had completed the shipment of urgent needs including foodstuff, tents and blankets to all affected villages.
20_2ecbplus.12: But residents at the village of Gavarzin complained that relief operations were slow.
20_2ecbplus.13: Speaking to IRNA, they said they had not received aid almost a day after the quake.
20_2ecbplus.14: "Houses in the village of Gavarzin have been destroyed 100 percent and we have now no refuge to take, " Jassem Chabok said, adding all their furniture had been buried under rubble.
20_2ecbplus.15: A series of aftershocks have hit the island since it was first rocked by a magnitude - 5. 9 earthquake early Sunday afternoon.
20_2ecbplus.16: The seismological bases of Tehran University registered a quake measuring 3. 8 on the Richter scale at 09: 10 hours ( 0440 GMT ) on Monday.
20_2ecbplus.17: The earthquake knocked down power in rural areas, sinking them into darkness.
20_2ecbplus.18: Local officials were struggling Monday to restore electricity.
20_2ecbplus.19: Flights from and into the International Qeshm Airport were resumed Monday morning.
20_2ecbplus.20: The airport received minor damage in the quake.
20_2ecbplus.21: The tremor also damaged hospitals on the island, including one which was reported to have stopped providing medical service.
20_2ecbplus.22: The worst hit villages sustained between 40 and 80 percent damage.
20_2ecbplus.23: A team of experts from the governorate of the Hormuzgan province arrived in the affected areas Monday to assess damage to infrastructure.
20_2ecbplus.24: The head of the team, Alireza Safa, estimated that between 50 and 70 percent of the industrial structure in the 12 worst - hit villages might have been destroyed.
20_2ecbplus.25: Qeshm, a 1, 500 - square - kilometer island off the coast southwest of Bandar Abbas and 1, 500 kilometers south of Tehran, has a population of more than 100, 000.
20_2ecbplus.26: Iranians are still haunted by harrowing images of the world's worst disaster in December 2003, in which more than 31, 000 people were killed in the ancient city of Bam.
20_2ecbplus.27: The country is prone to earthquakes and tremors of lower magnitude are usual occurrences.

22_8ecbplus.0: 2 Dead, 1 Wounded in Shooting at NE Phila. Kraft Plant
22_8ecbplus.2: Police say two people have been killed and another wounded in a shooting at the Kraft Foods plant in Northeast Philadelphia.
22_8ecbplus.3: The alleged shooter is in police custody.
22_8ecbplus.4: KYW ’ s Pat Loeb reports that the shooting took place just after 8: 30pm Thursday night inside the old Nabisco factory, along the 12000 block of Roosevelt Boulevard, at Woodhaven Road.
22_8ecbplus.5: Authorities say the incident began after the fifteen - year employee, 43 - year - old Yvonne Hiller, was suspended.
22_8ecbplus.6: Police commissioner Charles Ramsey says she was escorted out of the building and was outside for nine minutes before coming back:
22_8ecbplus.7: “ She drove her car through a barrier and entered the premises.
22_8ecbplus.9: Made her way to the third - floor mixing room, where she encountered at least three of the employees.
22_8ecbplus.10: Two, she shot and killed there in the room.
22_8ecbplus.12: The third victim, identified as Brian Dalton, was rushed to Aria Health ’ s Torresdale campus with a gunshot wound.
22_8ecbplus.13: He was later transferred to Jefferson and listed in stable condition.
22_8ecbplus.14: Officers responded to 911 calls from other employees inside the building, arriving with SWAT teams and other personnel who were trained in an “ active shooter ” situation, according to Commissioner Ramsey.
22_8ecbplus.15: He says most of the other 100 workers inside were able to get out safely.
22_8ecbplus.16: Seven employees were trapped near the shooter, but cops say they were able to free them, disarm the woman, and take her into custody.
22_8ecbplus.17: KYW ’ s Paul Kurtz reports that Commissioner Ramsey credits a special training program for preventing even more bloodshed last night.
22_8ecbplus.18: The commissioner says he ’ s put many officers through what ’ s called “ active shooter ” training for first - responding officers:
22_8ecbplus.19: “ We ’ ve learned from Columbine and other places that you can ’ t wait, you can ’ t just sit there and wait for SWAT.
22_8ecbplus.20: You ’ ve got to at least make entry and try to get as many people out as possible, isolate the shooter, and then hopefully SWAT arrives in enough time to take care of the situation.
22_8ecbplus.21: They did an excellent job, the 7th and 8th Districts in particular.
22_8ecbplus.22: Those officers did an outstanding job. ”
22_8ecbplus.23: And it turns out that at least seven of the officers who rushed to the Kraft factory had “ active shooter ” training.
22_8ecbplus.24: Ramsey says he plans to expand the program.
22_8ecbplus.25: Hiller is expected to be arraigned on two murder charges and one attempted murder charge later today.
22_8ecbplus.26: Kraft Foods issued a statement early this morning announcing that the Northeast facility is closed until further notice.
22_8ecbplus.27: The statement expresses condolences for the families of the dead and wounded employees, saying, “ This is a tragic loss for all of us. ”
22_8ecbplus.28: It states that Kraft is working closely with the authorities as they investigate and will be providing counseling services for employees at the facility.

23_6ecbplus.0: Australian, English climbers killed in New Zealand
23_6ecbplus.2: ONE Australian and one English climber have fallen to their deaths in New Zealand, police confirmed today.
23_6ecbplus.3: Police Inspector Dave Gaskin said the two incidents on consecutive days in the Aoraki - Mt. Cook National Park were not related and were not due to bad weather.
23_6ecbplus.4: He said they come as a reminder that climbers need to use extreme caution.
23_6ecbplus.5: On Friday, 36 - year - old Duncan Rait died after slipping and falling about 60m from a ridge near the Tasman Glacier.
23_6ecbplus.6: The New Zealand - born Australian was planning to do some ski touring.
23_6ecbplus.7: He'd been dropped off by helicopter with a group and was walking to a hut when he fell, sliding down a steep slope and over a cliff.
23_6ecbplus.8: Gaskin said that other climbers attempted to rescue Rait by taking him down the glacier, but that he died on the way down.
23_6ecbplus.9: On Saturday, 32 - year - old Englishman Robert Buckley fell about 600m while climbing to a small hut on Mount Sefton with three companions.
23_6ecbplus.10: Gaskin said Buckley was wearing crampons but was inexperienced.
